The staff was super friendly and the prices were reasonable.I wound up getting a iced vanilla latte which wasn't really that great. It wasn't very flavorful and the coffee aspect wasn't that great either.I don't think I'll be back as there are way better places in the hood but maybe my experience was just a one off.

I came here with a friend. Cappuccino was okay. My friend said he had the worst latte he had in his life here so I guess it was really pretty bad. Restroom is awkwardly on the 2nd floor of the gym.. and they ask you to sign a waiver before proceeding upstairs. Seems v impractical. They did have wifi though!Pretty basic cafe, basically a great option for cafe to be next to the gym but out of all the cafes available in SF, I wouldn't specially make a trip out for this cafe.

Really tasty coffee! I had their iced coffee and usually I add a little syrup to dull the bitterness, but did not need it for this one! (Not just because they didn't have any) Their coffee was sweet and delish! Cute spot to read or work!

I've been a loyal customer, so I usually love this place. But I recently found out that they will not honor the promise of a free drink with a full stamp card, unless all the stamps are on one card. I realize now that they wrote this disclaimer on the loyalty card, but this is unfair. The drinks are pricey (~$5), and when customers are loyal, a business should follow through and reward loyalty, whether those purchases are on one card or several...I don't understand the difference. Loyalty is loyalty. Less impressed with this place, now.

Really great coffees/tea lattes. I've actually recommended fifty fifty to many coffee lovers who have never heard of them. 5 stars on the drinks. About 0.5 stars on the baristas. My son accidentally spilled my coffee we were both super apologetic and cleaned up the entire floor as well as counter while the barista gave us a blank stare as if we peed in her Cheerios and did it intently. Thanked and apologized one more time before walking out and both ladies stayed completely MUTE. Total wet blankets!

This place used to be good but...don't know what happened. The past 3 times I've been there my order has been messed up. This time they accidentally made my drink with oat milk? Whatever, fine. But what's unacceptable is that the only thing that tipped me off was the baristas awkwardly whispering about my drink. I finally just walked back up and asked if it was my drink, and was told it was accidentally made with oat milk. Hm ok. Luckily I'm not allergic to it...? Kind of weird to not say anything. I would've asked them to make another but it took so long I just said it's alright and left.Honestly I get it, customer service is a pain, but I can't go here anymore. The baristas are mostly nice, but I'm really not going to eat at a place that's willing to serve me something (esp. a potential allergen) without correcting the mistake themselves.
Amazing place for a great tea! But, i think it's close to early everyday, they should stay open at least more 2 hours day!

Expensive coffee, dirty sticky tables (it wasn't that busy, they could have cleaned them if they felt like it), and unnecessary paper cups.It's a cute place. But honestly, paying $5.50 plus tip for a coffee in a nasty paper cup (when I didn't order it to go) and a dirty table is way too much. I regret tipping.
Got the matcha latte here. Having been to Japan, I still do enjoy the quality of the matcha here. The boba is tasty and sweet here as well!Would recommend this place :)

Friendly little coffee shop on Geary. Their coffee is good and they have a number of daily pastries and banana bread-type items. They offer free WiFi and lots of people work here at their 7-8 small tables. The bathroom is pretty cool. You could use it without touching anything -- automatic door, automatic flushing, automatic sink, automatic hand dryer, automatic door re-opener.

Best coffee in the area.Opens early, ideal for both a quick coffee stop or if you need to work. Please be prepared for crowds during the weekends.  Location: right next to bus 38 Ambiance: small and petite but it offers good seating along the window as well as small tables (for 2) with plugs next door.  F&B:  Ritual coffee made here is great. Very well brewed, the cappuccino are also very tasty with soy or almond and oats options.  Snacks: unable to taste anything as there's no vegan pastry.WiFi: providedOutlets: YesTime limits: none Big tables for meeting: noneBathroom: clean.
Love this neighborhood coffee shop! I recommend their Latte if you're in a coffee mood and their mango tea for a sweet taste. Also love all of their pastries. Especially the muffins!

Stopped in for a quick hot milk latte as I was feeling under the weather. I appreciated that the drink was not sweetened and I could add sweetener as I liked. Boba was flavorless so I wouldn't get the boba again. Texture and chewiness were there but no honey flavor or sweetness. Cute spot, I might drop in again for a latte. Up charge for oatmilk was $1 ouch. This is SF so I guess that's the norm

I was walking on Geary at a godforsaken hour because I had to take my car in for a software issue that affected a lot of that year's make and model. Can you imagine? I never connect autos with software, but considering how I perpetually need the IT help desk at work to help me with my laptop, I get nervous about driving and being affected by some viral bug that will lead to my fiery death. In that unsettling state of mind, I wound up at this tiny corner spot that serves various beverages with or without caffeine, tapioca drinks not before noon (thus the dearth of young Asians at that hour), and a lotta baked goods.Well, the display case looked fully stocked because it was just a little past 7AM on a Saturday morning. It went from empty to all the tables and counter seats completely taken in a half-hour span. Luckily I ordered a $5 Honey Coconut Tea Latte and parked myself at a table before it was taken. That was quite a mouthful of subtle flavors in that biodegradable cup (photo: bit.ly/2HHkhaY), and I enjoyed it while the hipsters gave me small-mouth as they sauntered by. They really need to work on their posture...and their attitude. But not the two industrious women behind the counter. They were aces.TEA LATTE - 4 stars...tasty concoction and not overly sweetAMBIANCE - 4 stars...clean, white walls with refurbished schoolhouse swivel chairs and tables SERVICE - 4.5 stars...they tow the line hereTOTAL - 4 stars...more like 90/10RELATED - Looking for dining options in the Richmond? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2HvkBu7

Cute little place on Geary. It's near my church so I've been here few times on a Sunday. I've always managed to park in front. I like how they have coffee and tea latte. Both good! I never get to try their boba since those are ready and 12pm. They have chairs but it's always full when I come so I never get to hang out here. I usually come here with my toddler so it's too small for a kid to be in.

Love their earl grey lavender. Atmosphere is simple and staff are extremely sweet and helpful. I know a lot of my coworkers love their coconut milk latte. Would definately recommend this place if you're just looking for a simple place to get tea or coffee and chill. May the odds be ever in your favor looking for parking though.

Rounding up from 2.5 for the coziness. I happened upon this place while trying to kill some time in the area. Per popular Yelp recommendation, I ordered the lavender earl gray latte - lavender is always risky to use with tea because it's so easy to make the aroma too strong but have little actual taste. Fifty / fifty managed to keep the aroma limited which I appreciate, but the latte still didn't really taste like much. Personally, I do prefer drinks to be less sweet so for me I don't think it was a sweetness issue. I think it was just the flavor of the earl gray and the steamed milk didn't go well together. Maybe I should have gone for the matcha instead )':

Stopped by here for a quick tea fix with a friend! We were hoping to study a little bit but it seems like all the tables were filled up and there were a few bar seats available, so I wouldn't recommend it if you're lookin to study somewhere with avid table space. Most people seemed like they were taking their drinks to go. The ambience was very simple, modern, and clean. I liked how there was a lot of light in the cafe! There's light music playing in the background- it's still very quiet! There's 2-3 baristas patrolling the espresso station & are very willing to help you out and a few pastries they have on display. I saw a few interesting drinks and settled on the honey coconut tea latte ($4.50) with almond milk (+$1.00) which I thought was kinda pricey for just almond milk! The drink was delicious, without being too sweet & just the right amount of coconut flavor without being too overpowering. I liked how the almond milk complimented the latte as well- I wonder what kind of tea they use! Overall a decent place to stop by for a quick drink that's close to USF campus! I'd come back again to try their espresso drinks and maybe swoop a seat to study if I could :D

Fifty fifty is a great neighborhood coffee shop. The place has a about 4 tables with seats and another long table by the window with about 5 stools. They offer free wifi for their customers if you chose to work on things there. They have a nice bathroom but you have to ask the barista for access to it. They offer a stamp card, for every 10 drinks you get 1 for free. If you order multiple drinks and use the stamp card the baristas are usually nice enough to take off the more expensive drink. They have pastries sometimes but it's not my favorite. Drinks on average are $4-5 here.Customer service is excellent here. There are usually 2-3 baristas working at a time and will get to you within a minute or two of you entering the shop. Very patient when you don't know what to order and can offer suggestions. They offer a variety of milk, whole milk, coconut, and almond milk. I believe it does cost extra for the coconut and almond milk.All their selections of teas and coffees are delicious although I tend to order their cappuccino. There have been one or two instances when my cappuccino had just a tad more milk but was delicious regardless. Teas/tea lattes: You can get their teas either iced or hot. Their matcha tea is usually pretty good although sometimes it can be a little bit on the milky side. Their Thai iced tea only comes iced so it's a bummer when you want it warm but usually pretty good. Their lavender earl gray is my personal favorite. You can add boba to any iced teas past noon. The boba is limited as once they're out they're out for the rest of the day.
Came in search of a coffee and gluten-free pastry. Succeeded with the coffee but failed on the pastry. I was told that they only carry gluten-free options on some weekends. Better to go elsewhere.

Solid coffee and tea place with friendly baristas, really good iced drinks and a clean bathroom (gotta get the code!) It's the perfect place to grab an espresso and pastry, and sit by at the bar by the window and watch the cars and buses go by.

Not sure what other reviews are talking about when they say they don't taste the matcha. They do a good job. I got the matcha latte with almond milk and unsweetened. I usually grab a latte but this time I wanted to try something different. They were out of almond milk. This place is on the pricier side... $1 for almond or oat milk is a lot

Sam is a treasure.I was heading over to the UCSF library (which is also great, by the way) and decided to stop in here. So glad I did. I was the only one in the store when I went by, and I was able to have a great chat with the owner while he made my coffee "Sam's way". The coffee was great, but what really sold me on this place was Sam, himself.If you like having the kind of interaction with a small business proprietor where you smile and shake their hand on your way out, you'll like this place.
Had the best Turkish coffee I've ever had. Had a hint of pistachio in it. Really cool joint, hope to come here again. Be wary though, parking is very limited around here.

Excellent Turkish coffee!  You can't find coffee like this anywhere else in the city.  Sam, the owner, is very personable, and is what really makes this place special, though.  He is passionate about making the perfect cup of coffee, with the right balance of cream and sugar, each time.   Beautiful selections of premium wines and liquors, as well. A must visit in the Sunset!

BEWARE!All these "amazing" reviews on here are definitely fraudulent. The saddest part is that apparently they were so mad about bad yelp reviews (due to their rude, pushy scammy service) they even made a sign they posted outside claiming "people love us on yelp" after very clearly paying for fake reviews. The owner would be better served (as would our neighborhood) if he focused less on scamming people for their money, and instead finding more good quality products people wanted.
The Turkish coffee is very I like the one I tried in Istanbul a couple of years ago and the pastries are delicious!
Great strong smooth coffee. Guy was a little rude in not giving a customer individual attention. The price was pretty high even for SF. His Turkish pastry was the bomb. He should list prices.

Kris here. Tried this place today. Tried the Turkish Coffee (No cream or sugar), the Turkish Mocha, and the Turkish Coffee with Cream and Sugar and the baklava. My favorite was the Turkish Mocha.The finish of the coffee is good, no acidity and made well, though we had to let our cool a bit to get the full effect. The baklava was also amazing. Usually this kind of dessert is too sweet and covered in syrups that ooze out. Not this time. These were made very well, were flaky and not too sweet. A good match to our coffees.What really made our experience though is Sam. He came off a bit edgy in the beginning, but as he talked to us we felt more and more that he really just loved his coffee and his store and just wanted to share it with us in his own way. He seemed to us to be completely genuine and was quite excited to show us the recipes his grandma made. This place isn't for people who take themselves too seriously, but if you're willing to be open to the recommendations and have a good laugh, walk on in. It's an experience to remember.
Best customer service ever the owner is the sweetest, kindest and most down to earth guy you'll meet. He gives suggestions and his way "if you don't like it-don't pay (:" definitely going back.
Heaven starts here, with this man! Amazing Brazilian mochaI have been coming here since 2007 and this place will always have a place in my heart. No other coffee shop can compare. SF original.
World's best. Better than the feeling of a nice walk. Also quality beer and wine selection. Better than Peets Coffee
The best cafe in San Francisco. "Have it Sam's way and if you don't like it you don't pay."Exquisite Cofee!
This is a great place and they make a wonderful coffee. Sam is a good guy. I have a great time every time I go here. I recommend it to everyone in inner sunset.

This was the worst cafe I've ever been to The prices are so high and the guy is the rudest person that you'd ever meet don't come here I wish I'd read the reviews before I wasted my time and money coming here

Definitely fraudulent yelp reviews on here. I've been to this place a couple times and both times there were absolutely no customers inside and the owner was sitting outside talking to a friend. Most uncomfortable experience waiting for my coffee. He was extremely pushy and kept talking up the coffee. Also, he charged me $7 for "double shot" coffee which was just a medium sized cup filled with normal drip coffee?? Overpriced store bought pastries that he microwaves for you... don't waste money here.
Best Turkish coffee ever, delicious knafeh, lively company (the cool owner Sam included).

Firstly, the coffee here is mother f*cking great. Sam makes a mean Turkish. Secondly Sam himself is the man. Super personable, and a genuine nice guy. If you're in the inner sunset and like coffee this place is a must go.
Best cup of coffee I've ever had. I don't even know how that's possible. The proprietor, Sam, takes his time crafting every perfect cup. Nice place to slow down and enjoy a little old world charm.
Sam does not sell coffee, he shares love. His passion, attention to detail, and service is unparalleled. People come from all over the world the coffee, and stay because of Sam.
Great coffee, snacks, and impressive wine and scotch/whiskey selection.  The dude running it is a character and we loved the outside seating.

We made a quick visit to Golden Bear Trading Company to get some coffee in a rush and I am extremely glad we did! The owner Sam made it a lovely experience and suggested some kunafa to go with our Turkish coffee. Even if you're not a fan of cheese, you simply MUST try it. You will not regret it! I highly recommend stopping by this lovely shop!

The ambience and coffee here are great, however they're lacking some basics like sugar-free (Stevia, Splenda, etc), Wi-fi, or a microwave to heat pastries. It's a good place to come if you're meeting friends but not great to get some work done.
One of my favorites. Typically drop by for a cappuccino and almond cake / kouign amman. Good place to work.

Have frequented Sightglass three times now, and have unfortunately been disappointed all three of those times :( While their space has a great industrial feel, their product and them not offering wi-fi (or having any outlets) makes it hard for me to come back.The first time I went (about two years ago), I got a latte and the coffee beans tasted burnt beyond belief. The second time I went (about a year ago now) was to their location at the ferry plaza for the farmer's market on Saturday's. My iced latte was okay this time, but nothing memorable.I went this past week with a friend since we were in the area and I was craving coffee, so decided to give this place another shot. Ordered an iced mocha, and turned out to be yet another let down. My drink literally tasted like chocolate milk- could not get any hints of coffee whatsoever. Took it to go, and didn't feel like returning for them to remake my drink since my friend and I were on a tight schedule.The only instance in which I'd see myself returning is if I'm in the area and in extremely dire need of coffee, but other than that, I highly doubt that I'll return.

I came into this wonderfully decorated shop on a 1pm on a Saturday. The barista was very pretentious, and lacking simple people skills. I asked a simple question about a drink and was met with a rude "I already gave a recommendation for that drink," instead of an explanation of what was in it. I proceeded to ask what a paste was and was met with a scoff on the baristas face. The coffee was roasted perfectly but the sizes offered and service were trash.

It's a very cute place. My only issue is that it is advertised here on Yelp as having free WiFi and being "good for working". I planned accordingly but when I arrived there was no WiFi and not even any outlets to plug your electronics.
Cute spot, I got the hot mocha with real chocolate. $5 or so but a bit small cup. Wanted to try as I checked out of my hotel in SF to leave the city.

My wife, sister-in-law and I came here on an outing to SF and the sister-in-law was raving about this place since it's not too far from her work. The place is pretty big and the staff are friendly. The interior is laid out where you can see them grind the beans and all the equipment to brew their coffee. We got some light baked items and some lattes. We decided to enjoy our items on the second floor as people were just hanging out on both floors. The 2nd floor has bigger tables where you can lounge about or work on group projects. 1st floor has more seating suited for two people as well as spots to get water on both floors. As the place is in SF, I definitely would recommend walking if you're close or getting a lyft or uber. The drinks are good and the ambience is great for people to just hang out and enjoy a cup of coffee. If we're back in the city, we'll definitely stop by again as we had a pleasant experience.

This place is super cute and has great coffee but i came to study for an AP exam i have tomorrow thinking there would be wifi because yelp said there would be but unfortunately there is no wifi and no outlet. great to hang out and get coffee though
No internet , no electrical outlets for charging ... and 100$ cups of coffee. No thanks !!!

Great atmosphere with great coffee and pastries. Loved the way it was decorated and how there was seating all over the place. They even had an upper level where you can sit and enjoy your coffee while admiring the coffeeshop.Great place to hangout or read. There is no wifi but I loved it since I was just swinging by.
I like the store layout a lot but there is no wifi in the store. Please correct the info on yelp.

First time here and I ordered the Ethiopia iced coffee. It was strong, which I like, & it definitely got me going for my afternoon pick me up. Their passion fruit sponge cake is good too. Very light flavor and moist. The place itself is super large with an upstairs area for chillin or doing work. Service itself was so so as in not the friendliest but not awful. Maybe it was the tail end of someone's shift. I'd go back to try their other drinks.

This is a nice space to get a good coffee and catch up with a friend. However, I was planning to drive into SF from the East Bay, needing a place to get some work done. I saw "Free Wifi" marked on their page, so I drove there and ordered a coffee. When I asked for the wifi information, they told me they don't actually have wifi or outlets. Hopefully someone can update this info on Yelp to be accurate.

Best espresso place for me. I work nearby and ready to have their coffee over and over again. Love the ambiance and friendly service! Sightglass Coffee drfinitely has the friendly neighborhood feel and vibe.

We enjoyed this place so much that we made sure to visit every morning during our stay. Wow, first of all, the location and decor is AMAZING! Great industrial vibe- a really cool design the blends a coffee house and wooden loft. The coffee was fantastic as were their espresso options. Just delicious.

I am a little bit outdated on the coffee scene in SF. Today I finally visited their retail space, after discovering their espresso beans in my office. At work, I usually make my own latte and thought that their espresso has a nice fruity taste to it. I would have thought that visiting the retail space and have a barista make my latte would make it taste 10x better than what I do myself, but nope, it was far from good. My latte tasted watery, foam was not done well, and overall just extremely disappointed. Blue Bottle still remains my #1 choice and I will save myself $5 by making my own Sightglass latte at work!
So many good things to try here! Fantasitic bold and smooth flat white. Staff was super friendly and helping me decide what I wanted. Great atmosphere to hang out in or work.

Goooood coffee, nice space. Only thing is that it's pretty hot inside and although there's a lot of space, there's no WiFi/barely any outlets to use. I also attended their first coffee tasting today and learned a lot about where they get their coffee beans and even got to Skype with the farmer in Colombia who harvests their beans. It was pretty cool. For $20, we got to learn a lot about the source of their beans and even got to try their pastries and the first tasting of the coffee! We also got a free bag of coffee beans as well and a cute pin that gave us a free cold brew next time we came.Overall so worth it if you love coffee/cafes like me.

TLDR: Go to Blue Bottle or Philz for better coffee, service, and pet-friendly staff. Most workers here treat their coffee better than their customers. Sightglass, never forget who's serving whom.I enjoy Sightglass coffee, but had an extremely disappointing experience yesterday when I used the Ritual app for the first time to pick up an order. I wasn't warned that your shop was not pet-friendly, so I walked my dog there and thought I could pop in to quickly grab my order. Upon seeing the no pets sign, I asked your barista if someone could grab my order upstairs since no pets are allowed inside. Instead of giving a direct answer, he told me to speak with your production team. A young woman in production said no dogs allowed, but she could grab my order. She asked for my name and what service I ordered through. When she found out it was for Ritual, she said I had to pick it up myself and told me to tie my dog outside. In SF, when anything left on the sidewalk is fair game, I wasn't about to risk losing my dog for coffee. So I asked her again if she could allow a one time courtesy since I wasn't notified about the no pet policy. She rudely said, "No we're busy working".1. When it comes to working, wouldn't you say that serving customers would be your team's highest priority? And if her task was too urgent/important, couldn't she have politely phrased her response? 2. I asked her to simply grab my order upstairs, but she treated me like I was a homeless person begging in some fancy establishment. No coffee, no matter how delicious, is worth risking my dog over or being treated so poorly. It's JUST COFFEE. I demand compensation and an apology for such a terrible experience. Your staff needs to be retrained, told to get over themselves and cool it with the snooty vibe. They are there to serve the people who help pay their salary. Don't forget who's serving whom.1 star because the coffee is good.

Upon first glance, the place looks good to work at - gentrification at its finest, with potentially amazing coffee, a huge space, and cool people watching.  After spending $17 for 2 12 ounce ice teas and a pastry, I was still excited about working here.  After finding a seat, I was getting ready to enjoy my time focused on the task at hand - except, they don't offer wi-fi.  Epic fail.  Further, no outlets to charge anything.  $@?@ this place!  True testament to the new wave.  They'll be gone when the tech industry collapses,

Incredibly shoddy behavior of the employees, repeatedly showing unwillingness to answer easy questions. Today I liked the white kettle they are using, and I asked who makes them. Answer: "I am too busy right now, I'll have to ask someone". I waited 5 minutes, then a really annoyed "I am really too busy". Really? There were maybe 5 customers in the store, and nobody in line.
WOWWWW. This is legit the best spot ever for coffee. Not only is it so cute inside, but my Almond milk latte was amazing! I am absolutely coming here every time I come into the city!

While visiting the Marina District, we were so thrilled to stumble upon this gem of a coffee shop. They have friendly employees, fast service, and amazing, high quality beans. Being from Sacramento, we love our Temple, Pachamama, Insight, etc. coffee roasters, and now we have a new SF roaster to add to our favorite Bay Area coffee companies. This shop has a very small interior. You can push a single stroller into it down the narrow entryway (yes, parents really need their coffee!), but space is very limited. We gladly took our coffee to go, because it was fun to sip our drinks and stroll down Union Street, exploring the different shops.If you decide to get your coffee "for here," there's a small counter bar you can sit at and watch any hand pours that they make. There is also a bench along the entryway and a few chairs out front. We came twice, it was that good. Our first trip was in the afternoon and our second visit was in the morning. In the morning, their pastry case was bursting with delightful looking treats, big and moist, and I'll have to come back to get one!We got some "chocolate milk" for our toddler, which was their house made chocolate sauce/base with some slightly-warmed and frothed milk, and it was a delightful treat!I got a cappuccino on both visits because it was perfection. The perfect ratio of milk to espresso, and their espresso is amazing!! They poured beautifully-designed hearts in the milk foam on top too. One wall has several shelves with items for sale, including their beans and locally-made chocolate.Don't miss out on this little "hole in the wall" coffee shop! It's gorgeously decorated and is sure to satisfy all true coffee lovers.

I'm so glad I work a block away from here because the coffee is fantastic. My favorite almond milk latte (iced or hot) in the city, it never needs anything added to it. Everyone here is super nice and I love the pineapple wallpaper. Cannot recommend this spot enough.

This is one of my neighborhood coffee shops, so I really want to like it more. The coffee is good but quite expensive. But the service / attitude is very bad, even by hipster coffee standards.On my most recent visit, I bought a Miir coffee mug from them (a $35 "value," ordered an Americano with a splash of heavy cream ($5) and gave a $2 tip.I was served my Americano in my new mug (only filled 2/3, but ok), but with no cream. When I asked for the heavy cream, the junior barista helpfully brought it out. At which point the senior barista threw a fit, declared that the heavy cream (a full half-gallon) was for the "children's hot-chocolate only" and refused under all circumstances to let me have a splash. Only half and half was offered, and there are dietary reasons that I wanted full-fat cream instead of half-milk.I suppose that I could have demanded a refund on my Americano (none was offered) but I decided to leave it at that. It didn't occur to me that one has to authenticate that coffee shops can actually deliver what they sell you.You can get equally good coffee at lower prices and much lower attitude at Rapha, on the corner of Filbert and Fillmore.
This is one of our favorite spot for cappuccino and pastries whenever we are around the area we will definitely be seeing these guys.
This was my favorite espresso in SF. I sat outside on a little patio chair and enjoyed my coffee in the rare sunshine.

This place is about the size of a college dorm room. It's impressive that they fit a full service coffee shop in there.The cashier was not helpful. I asked what they had available for the hand pour, and she said everything, but when I tried to order one of their coffees (Colombia Cauca el Totoro) she said it wasn't available. It'd be helpful if they just had a menu of what was available for hand pour daily like most specialty roasters. I settled on the Ethiopia Sidama. I don't usually interact with the baristas, but my son was infatuated watching them make my coffee and he and the barista had a hilarious (and very loud) discussion about making coffee. The barista was amazing, and it was adorable. The coffee itself is very good. Great citrus acidity up front, and a clean finish. I would definitely go back if I were in Cow Hollow again.
What is it with San Francisco coffee shops serving espresso in to go cups? I don't get the high rating on this spot at all. Glorified Starbucks
Pricey but very chic and taste amazing! Small seating area but enough seating to sit down
Tried a mocha coffee, and it's got caffeine in it so that was a plus but I didn't much care for the grind. It had an oily residue aftertaste that made me want to brush my teeth after drinking it.
Got the best matcha latte I've ever had here! It's slightly pricey but honestly worth it!
This is 5 stars for quality of coffee alone. There isnt anything else to this spot: essentially nowhere to sit and no wifi, but that is a QUALITY cup of drip coffee to go!!
Nice little cafe with good drip coffee, delicious scones, and room to sit down and relax

Damn, the guys at Wrecking Ball have it right! By far the creamiest and perfect strength of coffee. I stopped by 4 days ago and have been meaning to write in to give you a shoutout! Thanks. You beat all the coffee, roasters, everyone in Cow Hollow and I would have to say almost the entire city. Sightglass comes a second close!

It was ok but not what we thought. The girl that helped us was quiet, so it was one of those awkward moments of did she say something, I think so but idk .  A little overpriced for sure. I think most of the reviews are people saying how instagram worthy it is.

I love the idea of this place (a local coffee shop with thoughtful decor and rotating drinks), but the prices seem out of control even by sf standards.The speciality coffee drinks my friend and I had were tasty, but I can't... sip easy with those prices.

Terrible wait but fabulous coffee! We all enjoyed our drinks, but the single barista had everyone waiting at least 20 minutes from ordering to get the drinks served. Worth the wait if you have the time.
Good coffee! Not somewhere you can sit and chill at, unless you come in in a slow day and get one of the bar seats.

This cafe is instagram worthy! The wallpaper with the pineapples is so aesthetic. The coffee here is a bit pricey at ~$6 but it is so worth it. Parking was a bit hard to find since it is in the marina district. Would come again if I'm around the area!
Overpriced, just ok coffee in a very hip space. It would've been nice if they filled ur coffee cup up for the price for a cup. Overall, pretty ok

Amazing coffee. Definitely worth coming thru for Cold Brew (Regular and Nitro are equally good but with different vibes). Atmosphere is aesthetic if you're into the look of your coffee shops but at the end of the day they make a great cup, so would recommend!

First time here. Pricy but good coffee. Great service!!!! Had the columbia coffee and was able to taste the Nitro ( tasted like beer) but had none in it. Cold n YUM! Great space for getting some work done, studying or just some caffeine and baked goods. Love the decor and woodsy look. Ill def be back when i need a kick of caffeine.
Flywheel has become by go to coffee stop in the city. Bold and creamy lattes, tasty cortados and delicious pour overs. They do one thing right.... coffee. A definite stop by.

Okay, I've been here pretty regularly (more than myCheck ins suggest)  and so I can write a review based on consistency. It is a great, dark but open atmosphere and I always end up here because of the 'vibe'. On the other hand, I end up ordering hot chocolate because their coffees are so strong (I don't know if it's because it's drip coffee or it's dark roast) but even the mochas are a tad bit much for me. I love coffee so I've tried everything in their menu (don't worry, the options are limited) and personally it's just not my cup of coffee. ** I don't know if this is a legitimate complaint though, maybe it's me WiFi and outlets though is a legitimate complaint. They do at least have outlets in some of the seatings but still, I've found myself waiting for the spots to open up or leaving because I know my computer will die within the hour thus making $6 hot chocolate not worth it. WiFi is spotty, 75% of the time I come here I'm connecting to the complimentary hour xfinity WiFi or the whole foods one and between that, no outlet and refreshing my page like 50 times and then right before my computer dies , success! (My computer isn't innocent in this either but still ... ) As I write this, I realize that I should probably just stop coming here. I do for the convenience (I live very close by) and the outside space is nice. Today I brought two computers, so maybe I can actually be productive. Good spot for reading though. * this was written as I waited for the WiFi

Keanu, Megan, Gary !!!!!PURELY AND UTTERLY AMAZING! I CAME IN THE BUILDING WITH MY VIBE ON 1 MILLION AND THEY TOOK IT TO 2 TRILLION! They made my experience so amazing and were warm and welcoming! They made me feel like regulars and I'm not from here! They made sure I was comfortable and made sure i was happy with my order! They made me laugh and smile and made me feel warm! They had some great music playing and it was all just 1 great experience!!!! I will definitely be coming here every year when i visit! My new favorite SF coffee shop! Thank you so much to them! I am truly happy and utterly amazed at the staffing, the customer service, the good vibes, and the flywheel coffee!!!!!

This place is horrible.  The staff is obnoxiously rude.  Gal with nose ring and tattoos yelled F word at me for bringing in a Whole Foods salad from next door last week.  I almost called the police when the gal approached me.  Gal had a nose ring and tattoos and has worked there for some time.  When I looked up, she walked over from behind the counter, came to my seat and she said "are you ok?".  I replied "yes."   She then said, "you must be a fucking retard for bringing in that salad you fuck."  I just walked out.  I have been a victim of violence before and this scared the hell out of me. I will seek out management here next time I stop in the area.

Great location with latest and greatest in coffee Roastery  so down to atmosphere enjoy your cuppa Java just a really unique place and it's great to have a Roastery in San Francisco where you can watch the process of Roastery prices are kind a high but well it's San Francisco you know so check it out cool place really great coffee basic menu just a lot of fun
Something I ate here disagreed with my stomach. One of the ladies here was nice and helpful that's why they even got 2 stars.
This is a wonderful coffee roaster! Macchiato, cold brew, donuts... all are great! Plenty of space and tables and the staff is top notch. Come here. You won't regret it!

Came here for a study date and to be honest, we were not that impressed.For starters, when we were trying to order our drinks we were asking the barista for her opinion since we aren't big coffee drinkers and she was not very helpful. There were only 2 of them working but it was not busy enough to where they were slammed with orders, yet as we were trying to ask her questions to order, she kept going back and forth from the register and coffee maker and when asking about drinks, she was very blunt with no real explanation on the differences. Hence why we ended up buying a dang shot glass of coffee instead of a cup.In terms of the actual space, it's very limited. No outlets really around for one to charge their products, stools as seats for a majority of the tables, it's just not the ideal spot to get work done really.Giving two stars because they at least have outdoor seating, but even then, tables are super tiny, and the outdoor location is small itself too.Overall, this place could work for someone looking to take a quick drink of coffee and check ema

Came here this week to quickly work before closing time- great space with different seating but access to outlets. Oat milk latte was DELICIOUS and the two peeps behind the bar were fun and great! However, would appreciate some cocoa and cinnamon to add! Will def be back for late night caffeine hits and work space.

Fantastic cold brew, awesome vibe to the place, friendly staff, and awesome to watch them roast and teach you about coffee. This place is great any day, nice to sit, drink coffee, and enjoy a book or work.

great place for a quick coffee run- they offer a variety of croissants and baked goods. the location is right off of having street next to whole foods- a super convenient location if you are driving or taking the muni. staff was really sweet and welcoming. only room for improvement is the seating- i wish there were more tables to sit at to chat or study. otherwise great place, check it out!

Espresso here is STRONGGGGG.I *am* super sensitive to caffeine. Like super sensitive. But the two times I felt that caffeine really messed me up is when I... 1) downed my latte from Flywheel in one sitting (usually I don't ever finish an espresso drink) and I literally threw up at work and 2) when I finished a macchiato from Flywheel in one sitting and I was SWEATING in WholeFoods like I just ran a marathon and my hands were shaking while trying to find star anise in the spices section.The espresso drinks are Very Consistent and delicious. The espresso is flavorful and got a good amount of acidity/fruitiness and body. Their iced mocha is to die for (they use some kind of a darker chocolate so it's not TOO sweet and it doesn't taste fake). I used to drink their iced mochas all the time when I was a student!The space is nice, they have their pastries, ambiance is good for either reading a book, meeting a friend, or studying. Lastly if you want STRONG coffee!! Visit this place!

Great place to stop by before / after hanging out in Golden Gate Park or the Haight. I recommend the latte here bc of the strong coffee flavor that comes through. Bonus points for the good latte art too. I would def come back w/o hesitation

Nitro coffee is like my crack. It makes me vibrate in a way that no other caffeine product does. So on a Friday morning, when visiting my new nephew in San Fran, this was an excellent choice for a pick me up before heading to the awesome Golden Gate Park playground, just across the street.  The service was friendly, fast and kind.  There was a jovial and heartwarming conversation about a man's dog who had just had medical issues and was sweetly lying on the floor waiting for his owner. The server was genuinely interested in the man's story and the dog's recovery.The space is open and inviting. With enough spots to sit, but also the room to move around freely and get the items you've ordered without getting stuck in the flow of traffic.  I was able to get a vegan donut for my kiddo, who's allergic to dairy, and a pizza danish, which was weirdly amazing as a cross between a pastry and a slice of thin crust.I would saunter back to this spot in a heartbeat to get more morning "get up and go juice" anytime I'm in town!

Flywheel is conveniently close to my workplace, so a few of us decided to make a stop after work. We were in search of a place to sit and chat, and found a comfortable round table in the back. The area is quite spacious, and while there is wifi offered the speeds are incredibly slow. My friend found it faster to use the nearby Whole Foods wifi instead.I'm not a coffee drinker, so I opted for the hot chocolate. My friend got the coffee and felt like it was solid. The hot chocolate however was mediocre at best. I was quite underwhelmed by the flavor, and felt that the overall chocolate taste was lacking in strength. The hot chocolate was also lukewarm, and I expected better quality for the price.Overall, Flywheel seems like a reasonable place to meet up with friends, or take a little change of environment by studying / working at a coffee shop. In terms of the hot chocolate however, I would likely go somewhere else instead for my next cup.

I came in to meet a friend for coffee. Upon entering there was no greeting from the baristas, which I was fine with since they were making drinks. Being this was my first time here, I had no idea what to order, what their drink menu was or what the ordering process was like. I walked up to the counter and saw the iPad facing towards me and I thought maybe I'm suppose to just order it myself. I figured if I had to wait to order that the barista who was less than a foot away from me and the ipad would say "I'll be right with you" or something along the lines of that. Since he did not say anything, I made an assumption that maybe I was suppose to order through the iPad since I have been to places that have an iPad ordering station. Since the iPad was already facing me, I looked to see what they had besides what was written on the wooden menu on the back wall. When the barista finally came over to me and he gave me a dirty look before he pushed the iPad towards himself to ask for my order.  I asked if they could make a vanilla latte considering  the menu had latte is an option. The barista said, "we don't have syrups" in a rude response because he was obviously irritated that I look at the iPad and almost proceeded to click the buttons to order myself. All this unnecessary attitude could have been prevented if the baristas would have just greeted the customers so that they know you will be with them shortly instead of having them figure out what to do.
Great coffee & the staff is super friendly. Their coffee is VERY caffeinated & super smooth. Also they have dynamo doughnuts :)
Really delicious coffee, granola, and blueberry coffee cake! The owners are actual twins and I love the vibe. More of a to go place but very tasty.

This small cute coffee shop is perfect! It is my go-to coffee place in the area!! And they have the best matcha, always foamy and creamy. I love their small breakfasts too. I always grab an avocado toast to go!

We found this coffee shop completely by accident back in December. Now every time we make a trip to the city it is a must that we stop here.The twins (they really are twins) are always working the counter and have great presence/energy. The vibe is laid back and makes you feel at home instantly!My wife and I always get a latte/mocha and a selection from their various toast dishes. I have never been a huge fan of 'avocado toast' always thought it was a fad, honestly. The twins make an avocado toast that I can't seem to resist! It seems like a simple recipe, but they consistently deliver a dish that is a joy to consume. (I always consider going back for a second!)

Very cute small shop on Divisadero. The granola is also made by the owners of the cafe and it's great- low sugar and the kind I had included cardamom. I had a macadamia nut milk latte and they also had almond, oat, coconut, and a few other non dairy options. the drink was good but the espresso was not the best coffee, not the worst. I also had a chia seed pudding which was a perfect snack. My sister has a poppy seed cake slice she said wasn't anything to write home about. Our other friend had an orange olive cake slice which she really liked.
Just discovered this tiny place as I was walking down Divisadero. The pastry and the mocha were a bit too sweet for my taste but pretty good nonetheless

$6.50 for a turmeric matcha seems a bit steep but... I guess Lower Haight is coming up in the world. I had to put my headphones on because this place is teeny-tiny and the two gals working there were ranting back and forth about work drama. That's fine just not super professional. No biggie though. They have WiFi which is why I stopped in. The barstools are not very comfortable though - this is the kind of place that obviously wants their customers in and out.

This place to caters to all types of eaters. I've never seen so many toast options AND get to enjoy it in damn good gf sourdough. Their matcha is perfect. They even have a variety of other intriguing wellness lattes and unique coffee drinks. Without crossing over to the dark side of sugary gross lattes. The space is small yet comfortable. I'm always happy with every visit.

I really love this place! Delicious lattes with so many different milk replacement options. Soy, heavy cream, almond milk, etc. This beats sight glass for sure! Tasty toast and pastries as well. It's a local business owned by 2 lovely twin sisters that are super nice. Support!

It's not a far cry to say it's one of my favorite coffees in the city. Beans are great ( Temple ) & truth be told, I'm addicted to their butterscotch latte - 1/2 sweet, with almond milk, and every time - they deliver with a smile. All of them, which is a f'in rarity these days. The coffee isn't the only thing that's warm here :) I just moved closer to the neighborhood and couldn't be happier to start my mornings/kick start my afternoons with one of their bevs. Plus, it's a locally owned by amazing women, and I can't not support them. Take my money guys, I'll be back for another tomorrow ;)

Love this spot. Pretty small but with a large personality. Very kind staff, good coffee, and yummy avocado toast. Got the garlic variation which was a bit intense recently but the traditional is extremely tasty.

One of my favorite coffee shops in the city! Their coffee is just perfect! Not weak, not too strong (burnt), just right! I also love their little muffins! Perfect place, great location, nice service! Totally recommended!!! :)

I come here a couple of times a week before my morning walk, and it is a perfect way to start my day.  Very approachable team, superb coffee and espresso selection, although I always get the cold brew (sorry for taking so much of it!).  They have all the milks (oat, cream, almond, etc. etc.) if needed.  Also have pricey but DELICIOUS baked goods like donuts, bars, and natural pop-tarts etc.Not a ton of seating, have a good bar in the front and side to have a seat, but perfect community coffee shop for a cup to go.

I love this place. I try to come as much as I can because this really is my favorite coffee shop. As a former barista/coffee snob, this place has everything you look for. Great beans, great people, and that intimate feel that makes a local coffee shop part of the neighborhood. You can't miss with their cold brew!

Great vibes here all around. Plenty of dogs and good food and snacks. Women owned business. Great ambiance great coffee free WiFi. I ordered pluot toast, turmeric green tea latte with oak milk. I discovered both pluot jam and oak milk on my visit there. They were kind enough to explain it to me. I can't wait to go again

The lattes at Native Twins are absolute perfection. I used to get the espresso latte, but I stopped drinking coffee/espresso several months back and switched to the matcha latte (also have tried the turmeric and chai latte). Whatever the latte, it's always delicious and the perfect temperature (I find that a lot of coffee shops steam their latte milk way too hot, which is a big no no). The matcha latte, specifically, is smooth, earthy, and not overly sweetened. I've had a lot of matcha lattes from other coffee shops in various places and I always find myself judging them against Native Twins' because it's my gold standard that remains unparalleled.  I could be biased because, beyond the drinks, the owners/baristas are wonderful: their service is warm and quick. The eponymous twins run a lovely coffee shop that epitomizes what a great local business is and makes me proud to live in the Nopa area.

Okay so there are several coffee places to choose from on Divisadero in Lower Haight, but this one is definitely my favorite. First, the coffee shop is super cute, the walls covered with record albums. Second, the coffee is really good. It is a bit pricier than I might normally spend on coffee but its definitely of quality. The only downside to the place is that it's not very big so I wouldn't plan on hanging out there. They did have some outside seating on the sidewalk however.

Amazing coffee and food and amazing service! The girls who own the cafe are hard working and have great product. Their employees are positive and kind. The type of attitudes that keep people coming back. Love it here.

Native Twins carries Temple Coffee and has casual outdoor seating, which is scarce on Divisadero. My advice to Native Twins is to market Temple Coffee and the simple food choices as the best "breakfast to go" spot on Divis. It fills a niche. I like that it's a small, cozy spot - we need that in SF. I think it's cool that the owners serve; also rare here and I think that could be leveraged more to get more return customers.

This place is fantastic - for coffee, toast, and friendly baristas/owners! It is owned and operated by a lovely set of twin ladies. This hits home for me as my twin and I have always dreamed of opening up our own coffee shop :). I ordered the dirty turmeric chai and it was delicious! A perfectly balanced drink. They happily accommodated my request of 2% milk - it's rare these days to find that as places only carry skim and whole milk.We also order the Pesto Tomato Toast and holy moly it was superb. The pesto was so good! And they use the perfect bread for avo toast - nicely grilled. As a millennial, I approve! They also have gluten free bread to accommodate those with dietary restriction.This cute cafe had a constant flow of folks coming in and out and for good reason! I highly recommend coming her for your joe and toast :). Best of luck to these ladies!

Cute very friendly coffee shop on Divis. I got a cortado and it was very good. I've heard their food is also good. There is a small bench with a table on the sidewalk. Nice neighborhood spot. Very relaxed.

What a homey, wonderful gem Spikes is in the Castro. So cozy and welcoming, like walking into someone's home. They make excellent sugar-free vanilla latte's. Delicious! The staff are all friendly and professional...especially now that my friend Brad works there!  He used to work at the Starbucks near my office...what a nice surprise to see him again!  Unfortunately I live in Hercules so I don't have the opportunity to visit as often as I would like, otherwise I'd get my daily coffee fix at Spikes! Though my husband and I come to the Castro every Saturday, and I get my hair cut a couple of doors down, so I'll definitely be back soon!

Stopped by Spike's this morning. The mocha was made perfectly per my specifications. Grabbed some croissants for my sons and they loved them! Nice atmosphere. Will be back for sure. Highly recommend! How

I stopped by on a whim on a Friday afternoon and it was such a great experience! The staff was friendly and hilarious! They talk to you like old friends and have great senses of humor all around. I ordered a 16 ounce White Chocolate Mocha and it was delicious! Dare I say better than Starbucks  and it was only $4. There were a lot of dogs outside and there were pictures of them everywhere which makes the cafe feel really homey and comfortable
Really great coffee. Nice vibes. Right next to me work, and not super busy when I go in.

This place was amazing! We were visiting from out of state and needed a coffee fix. Popped in here because the one down the street called Duboce had an extremely rude staff. Anyway, Spike's was perfect. Great staff and AMAZING coffee!

Fantastic little cafe with a wide variety of coffees and eats. I came here in the afternoon with some friends while visiting SF and needed a quick caffeine fix-up and ordered a Cafe au Lait with soymilk as per advice from my coffee-loving Italian friend. Before ordering, I was allowed to same each different brew and decide which one I wanted in my drink. I had never tasted a soymilk based drink so smooth or clean-tasting in my life. Normally soy makes a pretty obvious substitution for milk, but this time I really enjoyed the slightly nutty flavor that it gave off. The pastries also looked excellent; my friends ordered an almond croissant and a lemon muffin which I nibbled off of. Both were decent. Overall a great first coffee experience in SF; would easily come back to try different blends of coffee.
Great coffee, eclectic flavor selection, high prices, delicious raspberry crumb bars, and decent service. As simple as that.
Good coffee. Self serve. A real nice place to stop at and take in the moment. The barista was nice and I will definitely stop here when I'm in town again. Great selection.

visited Spike's coffee on a Friday morning while on vacation in SF, automatically greeted by very kind, laughing faces. The two baristas answered my questions happily and my cup of Fancy House Blend and toasted vegan Pumpkin Bread were AMAZING. One of the baristas even asked if it was okay if my vegan bread went in the same toaster as the other pastries. veg considerate. Can't wait to visit next time i'm in the area. PS extra love to their whole section of cute dog photos and green encouragement.

This was my first time at Spike's and I LOVE IT HERE. The staff is super friendly, coffee is delicious (Tanzania Peaberry Roast) and a toasted sweet potato bread - Wow. Very laid back, not pretentious atmosphere - and dogs allowed! I highly recommend Spike's!

It's been eleven long years since my first review of Spike's, and I was a gushing li'l Yelper at the time dramatically comparing the service one receives there to the feeling of being kowtowed at a high-end Japanese department store. Itadakimasu! Overstate much, Ed U.? Well, Jamie W. and I were back at Spike's after a long absence just because I was looking to have some hot liquid in my body after a brisk walk over the Swish Alps. It's still the same tiny place on 19th Street, but we take up less room so it didn't seem as claustrophobic on this visit. The service was pleasant enough but didn't seem that outstanding. Maybe I've gotten more crotchety over the years. I can cop to that. Get off my lawn!However, I did like the montage of dog photos which we stared at from the round table next to the front window (photo: bit.ly/2EwLqwY). This time, we took advantage of their robust tea selection (photo: bit.ly/2F9zMW6) and decided on a steeping $2.50 cup of Rooibos (photo: bit.ly/2C2YfNT). Jamie, never a fan of hot liquids, went with the $3 Ginger Peach Iced Tea. They offer all sorts of gummy candies, but we were good and stuck with our teas. We decided to replace our collective sweet tooth with subtle eavesdropping skills as we listened to an awkward blind date at the next table where the more interested guy kept laughing like a hyena at anything the other one said. Ah, I remember those days...TEA - 4 stars...nice loose-leaf qualityAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...tiny space, crowds quicklySERVICE - 4 stars...good but remember that I am a curmudgeonTOTAL - 4 stars...good to be back, Spike
Wonderful service and employees and delicious drinks! The hippies ice tea is awesome and all of our drinks came super quickly. Great selection of pastries and food.
Either they forgot to use Soy Milk instead of Cows Milk or the Soy Milk they used had gone bad.

Love this little coffee shop. Friendly staff, cozy feel, lovely varieties of teas, coffees, and pastries. I'm so impressed every time I go in this place. My tip is: if you like Earl Grey, this is the best I've found in the city.

English breakfast tea had no taste of tea at all. Coffee beans all appeared roasted to burned. Staff was friendly but kind of clueless. Places that pay for Yelp ads are suspicious and this is a good example of just why. Keep walking....

These guys make my day sooooooo much better, even when it's already a good day! They're super friendly and make very good coffee drinks. Their non-dairy options are also impressively tasty. I love my community and these guys are a major major part of it. We wouldn't be the same without them.

Delicious hidden coffee shop in the Castro. Grab a cup and pick your brew. Simple as that! The two baristas who were working today were very kind and patient with us and our kiddos! Thank you! The gluten free sweet potato bread was delicious! Try it! Kids also loved the banana bread! They have a few spots to sit inside and a few tables outside. Stay a while or take it to go. (They also have espresso, but the black coffee was pretty delicious)! I think they rotate the blends, so ask for recommendations. They were helpful and gave honest feedback which I always appreciate! And they let me try a few before I settled on one! Can't beat that!
Loved the feel of this place. I usually do not like Mochas but theirs was delicious. The white mocha was way too sweet, recommend asking for less pumps.

This is one of the Castro's best hidden gems, reminiscent of when coffee shops were real community spaces. It is tiny and cozy and there is outdoor seating. No WiFi, as this isn't really a work space.

I love Spike's. A bit old-fashioned, yet definitely worth a trip. They've got a collection of beans displayed in front to choose from. Really enjoyed my "small" cup of skinny latte though it was as huge as a basin...very smooth taste.
Great service, bright, spacious, no wi-fi on weekends! Such a quality coffee beans, thanks St. Frank crew
Loved their coffee. Great espresso. I also go the game and cheese crossoints! They were nice and flaky. Perfect for breakfast

Just stunning! We got macchiatos to go and they were some of the best macchiatos ever. The whole vibe there is so modern, definitely a cool space to meet up with a friend or go to work on your laptop. The staff was extremely friendly even though they were very busy. Recommend!!

The fact that they have a "flight" of coffees is absolutely amazing. How fun and such a cool touch to have at a coffee shop. This coffee shop is inspired by Honduran coffees and has Spanish music playing throughout enough to be heard but not too loud. Really enjoyed that. seating is not super comfortable to sit and do work but still worth going. Enjoyed all (3/4) coffees - the iced coffee was not very good.. in fact I didn't even drink it and I typically am able to drink all types of coffee. They do have an almond macadamia (if im not mistaken) milk that they make in house that is light and yummy. Actually pretty awesome because its light and doesn't give that over powering almond milk taste to the coffee!! Def check this place out. Next to try is the honey lavender latte!!!

The coffee flight idea is really cool! In the flight I had the latte with their storemade almond macadamia milk and it was really good. I didn't care for the iced coffee on the flight. The rest was good. I came near closing time so I would love to come back to try their lavender latte.
Great coffee and atmosphere but no outlets for laptops. Would definitely recommend the honey lavender latte!

I had the perfect latte at Saint Frank. It was the perfect temperature -- not too hot like coffee so often is. The milk was frothed just the right amount. Of course the latte art was beautiful, too. At Saint Frank the baristas measure everything. They weigh the espresso grounds before pulling a shot. Then they weigh the shot. And so on and so forth. Their dedication to precision really shows. The shop is spacious, well lit, geometric.

Now that the Third Wave is fully formed and we can stand up and ride our board for a minute, novelty has exhausted itself, and crowds have died down, it's fun to revisit this fine establishment and find that in the absence of so much chaos and hype, they offer a superior product and provide what's actually a very pleasant space in which to remain for a while. This time I went straight for a high-grade pour-over--I've never really seen the point of passing this option up unless you use a place this caliber for your daily cuppa--and it came out lovely, rich and flavorful with brightness on top, all the things high-end coffee is supposed to do.What I liked even more was that it's now possible to find a seat and linger for a while. The wifi policy of wifi only on weekdays, announced in the network name, seems like the right balance. Cell phones for essential information but no serious work; on a weekend everyone must make do with paper or actual human interaction. This would irk me if not announced loud and proud, which it is, and handled this way they get everyone on the same page. I still can't quite bring myself to release five stars when single cup prices often top $6, but I'll allow that here especially in the current configuration you get what you pay for, even if you do pay for what you get.

Awesome awesome awesome place. The coffee is gorgeous! I'd recommend getting the flight.Was here on my last day in San Francisco and what a way to end my vacation. It's also pretty cheap so yes, go in and grab yourself some coffee!!!

This review is about the wifi and the service not the coffee - the coffee is good. Every time I've been here, which has been 5+ times over the past year the wifi has never worked. Side note: they only offer wifi on weekdays. Today, the baristas looked at me like I had a third head when I said the wifi wasn't working and then tried to blame it on my computer when literally everyone else in the shop was having the same issue. There was a half hearted attempt to fix the issue followed by an equally lackluster apology. I'd understand if this was a one time occurrence, but their wifi issues seem recurrent. I know no one likes to do it, but can you please just call Comcast?
Best coffee ever. Nice atmosphere and friendly staffs. I always bring there beans to korea for present. My dad even told me best coffee he ever tried in US.
Love their interior design! Minimalism and great flow to the space. Their coffees and pastries are yummy :) their mocha has a great balance of bitterness and sweetness.

Hip, clean, minimal space. A line out the door on Saturday afternoon. My iced cappuccino was delicious. Smooth but strong espresso and friendly, efficient service even with only one barista which might be the key to their consistent quality . I appreciate that they have a gluten free pastry too. The muffin looked delicious.

Love this place! Their honey lavender latte is to die for. They also have a super tasty Kaffe Tonic which i had never had before. The vibe is super cool and modern. A place you can come and work in the middle of the day or just snag a coffee to go. Really enjoy coming here.
Place is awesome, good coffee (though not a large menu), and the vibes are super chill... but wifi was slow, customer service was subpar, and they don't provide wifi on weekends. 3 stars for effort.

I'm not the biggest fan of coffee, but I went with my cousins because they're pretty into it. I'd say it's where I imagine hipsters going on a Saturday morning to get their daily boost of energy. COFFEE: The coffee itself was alright. Both of the ones we tried had a certain tang of bitterness to them that I wasn't really expecting with the "apple spiced" component. I didn't really get any of that flavor at all to be honest... If anything, I could tell that the flavor was rich and deep. The coffee beans that they use for sure have a different quality than your average Starbucks coffee. Despite this, I've had better cups of coffee for cheaper all around the Bay Area. SERVICE: It might not be the barista's fault, but some girl walked up after we had been waiting in line and asserted herself so she could get her cup first. I wish they had paid better attention to the order or had a more organized system of ordering, but it's alright.5/5 for that minimalist aesthetic and modern coffee shop vibe... 3/5 for the overall experience and taste.NOTE: This review is late, so the spiced apple latte was probably a part of their seasonal holiday menu.

Delicious honey lavender iced lattes and bright, modern interior. We enjoyed our drinks outside at the sidewalk tables and had a nice time people watching and getting sun. There were lots of people inside doing work or studying as well.

I brought my cousin here for the coffee flight while we were being cheesy SF tourists. It definitely seemed like a local coffee spot for coffee fanatics and it quickly got packed. They have really quality coffee and a few menu items. None of the sugary varieties at Starbucks which I appreciated. They also have a number of baked goods. We ordered the flight of course which comes with a preset 4 cups. It's actually quite a bit of coffee for one person. I ordered the vanilla latte. I'm not really a coffee person but it was good. We also got the cheddar biscuit and banana bread. I love banana bread and theirs was soo delicious. Plus it's a huge slice. Perfect to share!

Saint Frank has been on my coffee bucket list, but it took that extra push (and a recommended order) by a peer to come out and give it a try.Came in with my husband before a Tahoe trip, and we were blessed to be greeted by a short line (which grew rapidly soon after we ordered). While we waited, I took in the cute little coffee shop- seating downstairs with charging spots for those who like to get work done, and another seating area upstairs (I imagine sans technology support to allow for conversation). The space is bright and welcoming, as was the barista who took our order. Clear from those in line ahead of me, and per the recommendation, the almond macadamia milk latte was the way to go! We ordered two, watched them being made (very cool preparation space and view), paid and were our the door in just minutes! As for the lattes themselves- the almond macadamia nut milk definitely adds a creaminess to the latte. The beans, themselves, I imagine are quite strong as, even with the milk, I felt them to be slightly more acidic on my stomach. Regardless, the drinks were delicious! Will DEFINITELY be back (and will need to try the granola which is also said to be delicious)!

I love Saint Frank. Great atmosphere and staff. I love their Americanos and the pastries. I stop on my way to work at least 2-3 days a week. What would make Saint Frank even better is if they had a bike share station and a parklet out in front. That'd make it easier to get to and then make it more fun and easy to meet friends there. I love that about the Mill on Divisadero.

So glad my hotel was just a few doors down because the coffee here was outstanding as were the pastries on offer. The space is very spartan with the most interesting things all being behind the counter: the record player playing, the coffee machines whirring and dripping.Each morning we would stop in and grab a coffee and a pastry and wake up. The staff were friendly and made a great latte. My husband swore the mocha was perfection. The apple hand pie I had one morning was a great mixture of pastry and fruit without too much sugar. The croissant I enjoyed on another visit was light, fluffy and fresh.Will be back when we visit again!

I feel like I'm in a space movie when I go into these new coffee shops. I was looking a one of the touchable screens and thinking about Star Track, my brother Jefrey liked Star Track, he really liked lizards too, I wish he hadn't! They were so scary always eating bugs, that's why he never got married. Anyways  a nice young lady named Gayle (a pretty name!) asked me if I wanted to order anything and I was thinking for a while. She suggested a latte which turned out to be lovely! Thank you how do you do copy pastes? My niece showed me once it makes it so I don't have to spell things I can just copy them. I want to do it for the name of the coffee shop so I can write Thank you Sightglass Coffee! Oh well.

This location is just ok. I love Sightglass Coffee and have been a customer for years. This location is beautiful. The place is always busy. People that work here are not as friendly as people who work on other locations. They are sometimes rude. At all times, there's a lot of people working and they take forever to acknowledge a customer waiting to order. Terrible customer service, excellent coffee. Save some money and make Sightglass Coffee at home ! No need to pay for negative vibes ...

Space 5/5Coffee 4/5 Treats 5/5 (bummed there's no more Piccino ginger scone, or anything Piccino, but glad to have the Neighbor blackberry/pistachio croissant)Treat availability 1/5This place breaks my heart on a regular basis--it's my favorite coffee shop but I'm always looking for coffee AND a treat and it seems I just can't have both. If you don't come before 11 there are sparse pickings for food, and if you don't come before 12 you are very lucky if they aren't 100% sold out. Two of every three visits I arrive only to turn right back around because there's no food left. I don't understand! Please buy more!

This place is below average I'd say.  No music, no Wi Fi boring little place.  Coffee staff dressed up like James Bond movie.  Very San Francisco and very silly.   Space inside is good though with seating and window seats in the front.  If they added some music and books and personality, I'd throw in another star or two.  Pricing is about normal though this place is boring as Kansas.

The ambiance of this coffee shop is awesome, super open bright and clean and a great space to get work done. The coffee is pretty strong and on the pricier end. You don't get a lot of coffee for you money but what you do get is high quality. Definitely a spot to pop into if you're in the area!

The cafe is spacious, open and brings in a lot of light. It has a great ambiances for a morning latte and quick pastry. It is also a fantastic spot to plug in for some long hours of studying. This is my third visit to this location and it won't be my last.

Coffee: 2/5Snacks: 5/5 Atmosphere: 5/5If it's for their coffee alone, would not come here. I've had their pour overs, lattes, mochas (...) and I always go back for their treats and apple cider (which they don't make themselves). The beans they use here tend to be more acidic without a lot of the fragrance you get at other places. Their treats and store design though are on point.

Probably one of the best coffee shop chains left in SF. It's a super hipster place, and all aspects of the coffee and location are well thought out. I got a mocha, w/ their fancy chocolate, and it was AMAZING. Super smooth, deep chocolate flavor, perfect amount of milk, and no sugar needed. It also came w/ a super cute latte art. I will say their water spout is a little broken and I got water everwhere, but that might be more of a me thing and less of a Sightglass thing. Overall, my favorite coffee shop in the city 10/10 need to go to one if you're around.

Love the space, love their coffee, love their brand, and love their service. Sightglass is my favorite coffee shop in the city. The first time I visited, I was stoked that they used ice cream for Salt and Straw in their affogatos (this was before Salt and Straw had opened in SF). Their service is always great and fast, and the space is just so cool. They don't have WiFi but that's a great reason to disconnect and read a book or to catch up with a friend.

Sightglass is one of the best and most consistent coffee shops in SF. It is a pretty easy coffee experience, and is never too busy because they don't have WiFi here.What's good:-Coffee is excellent-Plenty of seating-Lots of sunlight in the store-Decor is always nice and clean-Clean bathrooms (who can say no to Aesop soap??)Anything you need to know about?:-No WiFi here. Hotspot yourself or bring a book?-Coffee is on the pricey end, $4.50 for a cappuccino
Place is clean and staff are friendly. Love the coffee bean from here... Wish they open store in Florida area.

Boo.  No stars because I couldn't try your coffee.  Why don't you have Splenda, sweet n low, or equal? I've been noticing so many coffee shops in SF don't have sugar substitutes.  I think that is wrong. And realizing why SF is becoming so lame.  Was considering buying some other drinks or food, but decided I don't want to give a business like this my money.

Wanted to love this place but... there's NO WiFi and NO outlets which for most people defeats the purpose of coming to a coffee shop. Ambience is cool and  the baristas are pretentious and rude if that's how you like your coffee served...might be your spot. If not, save yourself the time. The Mill is a great alternative right down the street. You're welcome

Very stylish shop with good location, I came in prepared to order a beverage and study for an hour or so, but was surprised that they don't have Wi-Fi. That probably explains why there weren't very many people in there, you can have a drink and enjoy a conversation if you have a friend with you but you can't get any work done without Internet. Besides that, when I walked in both of the iPads at the front of the bar were facing towards the customer side and the barista's were clustered together in the back of the bar talking with themselves, I stood there for a minute or so, nobody came over, and then thought to myself oh maybe this is a self-serve place where I just place my order on the iPad. So I pressed the button for a latte, and then one of the baristas came over and asked me what I was doing, I said oh I'm just placing my order, I thought it was self serve, and he flipped the iPad back around and said no it's not. Besides being embarrassed I felt unwelcome and the customer service was not great. I got my hot chocolate and it was bitter and watery. I drank it and promptly left. I probably won't be returning.

Disappointed that this place doesn't have wifi. I guess some people love it, but to my opinion we don't have a nice to-do-work places in this neighborhood. I was surprised that the stuff didn't offer me a refund for their half-cup sized overpriced coffee after I learned I couldn't do work from there and had to leave to search for another place. They didn't have any sign about that that I could see clearly before ordering.

Large café with tons of light and comfy seating. This would be a good spot to meet up with a friend. I tried to work from here too but there's no wifi. Also, they have great drinks (vanilla cold brew!). For those lactose intolerant folks, almond milk is an option (no upcharge!) Would definitely recommend.

I love the space. The communal tables aren't too crowded, the lighting was just right, and the bathroom was clean even if I visited towards the end of the day.I went here to read because I was having a hard time concentrating at home (where I was watching The Office instead). The vibe is welcoming enough; I like that there was a good mix of people working/reading and socializing. (I'm not sure why people would work there though--there was no wi-fi.) I did feel, however, that the music was too loud and not really coffee shop-py. Perhaps they could have lowered the volume? Or played something more mellow so that people didn't need to raise their voices? (I had headphones on me, so I made it work.)I am ...not the biggest fan of the coffee. The coffee is too sour for my taste, but I've noticed that sour-tasting coffee is trendy now, so others might like it better than I do. I would come back if a friend *really* wanted to drink Sightglass coffee--sure, I'll hang out there--but there are also other coffee shops nearby that serve less sour coffee.

Just stopped in here for a quick cup of coffee and the place was super cool. Wish I had spent more time here with my laptop and a good book because it is totally the shop you want to come to for all the coffee place cozy vibes. Good people watching spot from the window and friendly staff. Oh and their coffee was excellent too! Like most places nowadays they had your non-dairy milks, always appreciated and some food options too that I didn't dabble in but definitely would next time. Tried tasting as many different coffees from various places in San Francisco as I could during my first visit and this place definitely had one of my favorite cups!

Beautiful workspace with lots of large communal tables perfect for awkward side-by-side working and chatting with strangers. For whatever reason, this store seems to accumulate a lot of heat...probably a combination of location and lots of natural light. Pretty popular spot but I've never had trouble finding a seat.Coffee was good, but it was pretty expensive for a pretty small cup of cold brew ($4.50). Their cups did not seem regular size and I really needed every last drop of caffeine.Also, their bathroom is like the bathroom design of my dreams. I'm pretty sure they got custom wooden accents made (like there is a wooden cover built into the wall and also a wooden holder for toilet seat covers...because clearly that was necessary). I was also super digging the matte white wide subway tiles. And Aesop hand soap to top it off.
