It is on the pricier side, but it's definitely cause they use higher quality ingredients and you can tell! I came in around lunch time and ordered an iced honey latte made with soy as well as their avocado toast with a poached egg. This was probably the best avocado toasts I've ever had! I like how the avocado spread was still pretty chunky (which is how I like it) and it was seasoned perfectly with the coarse ground black pepper on top that added a nice little kick. The pickled red onions on top also added a good crunch and acidity that complimented the creaminess of the avocado very well. Do yourself a favor too and add the poached egg - it's an extra $2 but it's well worth it! The drink I had was also pretty good; I don't like my drinks too sweet and I was scared that the honey latte was going to be, but it had just the right amount of sweetness for me! I'll definitely be back here some time!

Nice place to sit and relax and enjoy the window views but, it's a big butt, they have no artificial sweeteners, the coffee is overpriced and kind of strong , not to mention the day I was there they had nothing to eat but one sad looking donut. Too  hoity toity  for me.

All guys who works here are the best. I feel like I know them forever. Always great coffee (try Whiskey Latte). There is also smth special in this place, this vibe. SF needs more coffee shops like Verve. Sending big love to baristas
Literally the most poorly run coffeeshop in SF. Spend your money anywhere else. You'd probably get a nicer barista at a gas station.

I've walked by this place many times and never walked in until today, and I'm really glad I did! I walked in on a whim and was immediately greeted by the friendly baristas behind the counter, the immediate service was really nice too!I ordered the Jasmine Oolong Tea For Here and it came out a few minutes after I ordered in a cute tea cup with a little pitcher of the rest of my hot tea. The set up was so cute and it only cost $5! Their big windows are perfect to enjoy the late afternoon sun. There is a little sugar station where you can add what you want to your tea and coffee, but when it comes to my hot tea I like it just the way it is! The little blue seating area that doesn't have any booths or set tables has a very cute community vibe to it and I enjoyed sitting there just enjoying the sun with others

I'm a huge fan of Verve Coffee in Santa Cruz. Unfortunately, this location isn't at all the style I liked at the original location. First, seating is limited, and you can't lean backwards on any of the cushions near the windows without stressing your back. Second, some of the pricing is misleading. Santa Cruz offers you different prices for different sizes but here, the menu at the counter only displays one price for certain items--the larger and more costly size. I'm sorry to say I won't be returning and will instead drive to Santa Cruz. (April 2019)

Their bowl of soul is my all time favorite!!! I recommend it with the English Breakfast tea. The shop itself is also very cozy and lovely - a great place for working / studying / meeting with friends.
You might not think of this place for tea, but you should !!! If you get it for in house, over the next hour you can get it steaped again. Definitely a popping place with great service, too.

Was ok drinking my coffee when suddenly a frigid strong cold draft starts blowing on me and does not stop. I asked an employee to turn it off or do something since its 8am and why any SF restaurant would need AC on?! He came back with a pathetic lazy response saying it has to do with temp outside and blah blah they didnt give a hoot about my discomfort and annoyance. Have to stop my work email morning routine to pack up and go somewhere with normal air temperatures, better staff and simple comforts. Waste of time and regret spending my money here. This places sucks!!!
Delicious espresso drinks, great service from lovely people, and the best over-the-top avocado toast ever, anyplace... We just happened by, but we'll be back!
Had the absolute hot chocolate here!!! Have yet to try the coffee ironically, but I'd really come here just to get their hot chocolate--wow.

Ahhhh the epitome of the hipster cafe with minimal space where you're forced to either uncomfortably stand with a sliver of table to work or cuddle with the stranger next to you as you share the only table in the entire space. My favorite! Other than that, love the vibe haha. But really there's not a lot of space and you really have to wait for a spot or just idk leave? I didn't try their coffee as I was all caffeinated for the day. I definitely will be back though! I love this area and it's right near Dolores Park. I would just recommend you come early to snag a spot or come superrrr late like when they're closing lol.OK UPDATE: I totally lovedddd spending my afternoon here. I applied to what seemed like all the jobs listed in the Bay Area and read Michelle Obama's new book! A+! The place starts to clear out around 5pm so if you're looking for a spot then without waiting, that'd be the time!
What a great place! Loved the coffee that they roast and serve. Very lively atmosphere with a lot of locals.
Probably my favorite coffee shop in the city. I'll literally call two Uber's in between my home and work in the morning for a quick stop here. My go-to is the cappuccino!

Today was my first time in, a Sunday at 7am. I ordered two large coffees and 4 pastries. I was told the pastries were ham and gruyere on brioche...they were corned beef and cabbage (which I like normally but not for breakfast) and were soggy in the middle and stale on the outside. The almond croissants I ordered were stale and the filling tasted like thick sugary honey paste, not marzipan. I thought to myself, "well at least I have coffee."  When I was finally handed my two "large" coffees (that are the size of a Starbucks Tall) and was told my bill was $32, I just paid and walked out.  Two stars, not one, because the woman that waited on me was really friendly...despite complaining to me that no one tips her (which I did).  So disappointing. And finally when I got to my car, the coffee is HORRIBLE. UGH.

Love this place! People who work there are very knowledgeable and care about coffee, without having the pretentiousness some other third wave coffee places have. Definitely recommend a shot of espresso, poached egg biscuit, jasmine pearl green tea (comes with 3 resteeps within an hour), and a plain croissant. Would definitely come back

Super friendly service, nice strong coffee and very convenient location. Verve is a comfortable place to come and grab a pick me up and work a little. So glad this place finally opened. Perfect addition to the neighborhood. The monkey bread and doughnuts are bomb!

Great place located at the corner of Market and Church. I love the big windows, wooden panels, plants, bright, and cozy feel of the space. They have free WiFi and tables  for you to read and do work.  The coffee and service is great, of course. There is also a bathroom for what happens after drinking coffee ;)I had a cappuccino with hemp milk (they don't have oat milk here), and my boyfriend had the one&one which is basically a machiatto with an extra shot of espresso. Will definitely be back.

I have walked by Verve Coffee many times. I decided to visit today and try something. It's a different cafe with its own concept. It's minimal, but there's some different coffee drinks. I saw Americano and espresso, and that didn't appeal to me. I saw something called "One and One" and thought I would try it. It was an espresso shot and a macchiato shot. The macchiato shot was creamy and a small shot of coffee. The espresso was very sour and you had to drink it fast. This cafe is modern and comfortable to hang out in. Compare it to Philz, which gets on my nerves. My drink was $4. I wonder if I will be caffeinated for the rest of the day.

Doesn't it sound like the name of a blaxploitation film circa 1972, an urban crime thriller that played on a double bill with "Cleopatra Jones"? Well, it's not, and they don't play the "Theme from Shaft" on the Muzak either. No, they serve milk teas and fruit teas, milk drinks and matcha, and cold brew coffee in a pretty small space on O'Farrell right on the edge of the 'Loin. Yet close enough to attract unsuspecting tourists making a wrong turn from Union Square. I tried to behave and ordered the $3.95 Lychee Green Tea since they apparently purée their lychees and we all know how painful it can be to purée your lychees. I thought it was reasonably good even at 30% sweetness, whatever that means (photo: bit.ly/2WMy3RH), but I heard the Black Sugar Milk Tea was the get here if calories are not a consideration. You're under arrest, Sugah!TEA - 3 stars...the fruit teas are a bit of a blank as refreshing as it tastedAMBIANCE - 3 stars...tiny spot, limited seating but cleanSERVICE - 3.5 stars...definitely friendlyTOTAL - 3 stars...Get me Black Sugar!RELATED - In need of some boba? Here's a collection of places I've visited and reviewed: bit.ly/2QQ7RAo

The boba is great here! It's the best I had in a while, and SoCal has a lot of good boba too. This is definitely the best boba I've ever had because I actually finished eating all of the boba. Definitely recommend!

I was in SF for the weekend, visiting from LA, and decided to stop by here since a friend recommended it. And I'm so glad I did! I got the pear green tea at 70% sweetness and it was perfect. It was a very refreshing drink to have after walking around Union Square. And I'm pretty picky about the texture of my boba, but the consistency of the boba here was literally perfect!! Benny was very personable and made sure we liked how our drinks tasted. I'll definitely be coming back the next time I'm in SF!

A new favorite here in SF! My sister and I got their Mango Matcha and Black Sugar Fresh Milk, both at 100% sweetness with boba. Despite being 100%, it was surprisingly not extremely sweet. It was just right. The Mango Matcha makes a perfect summer drink and the Black Sugar Fresh Milk is a great classic. I love the milky and caramel flavour. The boba was nice and chewy as well, just how I like it. Would definitely come back. They only offer one size which is a bummer. I hope they offer a larger size soon for boba addicts such as myself lol.

I'm not a boba fan (I usually opt out) but I can't resist Black Sugar boba. If I understood the barista correctly, black sugar is real, unrefined, and a healthier option. This place also does not use powders or artificial syrups!- House black milk tea: classic but for a reason, try light sweetness- Taro matcha latte: awesome blend of taro root and matcha green tea- Black sugar fresh milk: delicious, but note sweetness level cannot be changedEnjoy!!

Meh. As a taiwanese person, I can't say I'm too impressed. The black sugar is just okay. I wish it were more syrupy. My boyfriend got the matcha mango. Odd combo and very strong mango flavor, but also not awful. I don't like the texture of the boba. It's too hard and not QQ enough.

I'm really happy I stumbled upon this place!I ordered the Mango Matcha Latte - probably the best type of boba matcha latte I've ever tried. I ordered it at 70% sweetness and it was perfection. Small location, but sufficient enough to get in and out with your creamy goodness in a matter of 5 minutes or so. Only downside, no oat milk hahaI will most definitely be back.
So good. So many flavors and add-in options. I also like that they have dairy free milk. Great friendly service.
Tea was almost cofeeish in some areas. Boba is very nice flavor and texture. The sweet milk was the highlight, I would make myself sick on it if I could.

What can I say about this place? Black sugar cannot get enough of this place. I'd definitely say it's one of my favorite places here in SF. Every time I'm here, I am welcomed and the staff never fails to impress me. Boba is always soft and chewy, rather than being powdery and tasting old. Definitely recommend everything here and on the menu. Tried everything and nothing has disappointed me. The only place that has really great fresh milk tea besides my fav which is sharetea. Thank you black sugar for an amazing experience. I'll be back when I'm in SF.

Very overrated. Drinks are regular quality which can be found at any other boba shops. Cup size is very small compares to others local shop but prices range from 4:50 to 5$ so i consider this on the expensive end. Matcha with mango was ok if not bad, cant taste the matcha because of mango so in combination, a weird sour powdered drink. Boba is okay. Not worth the price and the hunt for parking

Lovely+ cute little spot! Definitely not enough space to bring a large group of people to stay, but the drinks are amazing!We got the mango matcha latte and the jasmine milk tea-- both were absolutely delicious. Mango and matcha is such an underrated combination, and if you haven't tried it and are curious how it tastes, come here to try it out for the first time. (; As for the jasmine milk tea, I'm pretty picky with milk tea and so if it just tastes like milk and sugar, that's a big no no for me. But you actually get a decent tea flavor here, so two thumbs up from me.Service is great. They're very accommodating and make sure that you love your drink. They emphasize high quality ingredients and it shows. Will definitely return for more when I'm in the area!

Over-rated.come here if you like:-your boba firm-cashiers with RBF -drinks around $5 if you add a topping, which most people do -matcha drinks Seeing as how I don't care for most of those things except the matcha, I probably wouldn't come back here unless I was in union square and the boba guys line was too long I had the black sesame matcha latte with boba. The ratio was pretty good. It was alright. For some reason I thought it'd be mind-blowing. Matcha quality was good. I'd be interested in trying the pear jasmine tea. I would come back but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way for it.

As a boba fanatic, I've enjoyed many a cup of boba all across San Francisco. This place is hands-down one of my FAV places to go, especially their signature black sugar iced milk with boba. The taste of the black sugar reminds me of Taiwan and the boba is cooked fresh, what's not to love about it. I like Black Sugar so much that when my company offered to buy me a gift card, I actually went to Black Sugar and got one myself :) Highly recommend visiting!

Black Sugar is by far my favorite boba shop in the city. It's small so there are only a few seats at the window but definitely come and order a drink and enjoy it outside in Union Square or walking around. It is San Francisco after all!The reason why Black Sugar is so amazing is a combination of quality and service. They use organic milk and house made sugar cane syrup though I always get mine with almond milk. The boba is PERFECT, and the drinks are not too sweet. My go to is the classic milk tea, 30% sweet with almond milk and I get it a few times a week. The service is great. Unlike other boba shops they encourage you to bring it back if you don't like it and they'll adjust. They take the time to answer questions and the owner Bennie cares that each and every customer is happy. There is only one location right now so sometimes I have to try other boba teas when I'm not in the area, but every time I am disappointed when comparing to Black Sugar.
The mango matcha latte is delicious. You can adjust the sweetness of the drink to your choice what is also nice.

I had to actually google the definition for this review, hold on, let me paste it really quick:hype:extravagant or intensive publicity or promotion.This boba shop is just not good. It has four and a half star so I was hoping for a really great tasting milk tea but alas I felt like I was drinking coffee. I really hope people who reviewed this place would actually go to Yi Fang or Ten Ren or Boba Guys. Those three behemoth of boba shops (not size rather their quality) have the best milk tea in the world.

Another "IG"able boba spot in Sf. While I was browsing the pictures and reviews on Yelp, someone mentioned having to ask for the fancy cups...so I went in and asked for my drinks to be served in the "fancy cup" lol because why not? I want IG pics too! - false information. You DO NOT need to ask for the fancy cup, they simply ran out of their signature cups, but the guy at the register did assure me they're getting more in so whoever wrote that, shame on you. **Clearing the cup situation. A few FYIs, parking in this area sucks but that's about all of dt Sf, right? There is a parking garage at the corner if you're willing to pay for that or walk a few blocks to get here. The space is extremely small. It can probably fit no more than 8 people comfortably so this is definitely the grab and go type of place. Drinks only come in one size which may be a downer for people who drink a lot of milk tea.I ordered three drinks to go for my 2-hour drive: Taro Matcha Latte, mango ML and the Black Sugar Fresh Milk all with boba. After 2 hours, I finally sipped on these and absolutely loved the Black Sugar milk tea (my fave). The mango matcha was also good with a nice balance of mango, milk and matcha. I wasn't a fan of the Taro. Maybe it was because I didn't drink it when it was freshly made, but the whole combo was not of my liking and the tapioca balls were a bit stale. Overall, the gentleman at the counter was very helpful and my drinks came out pretty quick! Would come back again for the Black Sugar Milk Tea AND the fancy cup when it's in stock again. Lol.

Another great milk tea place in SF. 1) Get the matcha mango latte. My favorite!2) Black milk tea is great too!3) Great location and not a long wait for drinks. Yay!I hope you give this pearl drink place a try. Cheers!

Found this boba spot after buying lunch at Halal Guys.  It's small, with only 4 seats at the bar by the window.  So just take your drink to go. I ordered black sesame milk tea with boba.  With less sugar.  I love black sesame so I really enjoyed it.  It was tasty. If you don't like black sesame it would definitely be an acquired taste for many. There weren't a lot of customer when I came here, didn't have to wait long.  Service was good and friendly.  There are metered parking and sometimes it could be difficult.  I got dropped off so I didn't have to park.  I would come back to try other drinks if I'm in the area.  Definitely give their milk teas a try.

I am here every day and the staff at this place is exceptional! Always nice and friendly, always meeting me with a smile, and all are genuinely nice people. I have seen them manage through the busiest days with grace and incredible efficiency. Impressive, way to go team!
Strategic location between Fort Mason greens and the Crissy Field walk, good coffee, good service, clean bathroom, thumbs up!

Smooth Americano with a beautiful view of the Marina and GG Bridge, thank you Equator coffee! I've stopped here twice while walking around Fort Mason and the coffee has been great both times, smooth without any bitterness. I'm a fan!

Location, Staff, Hygiene all great with a good strong cup of coffee.  For laptop nomads charge up your devices.  Location: right in Fort Mason Atmosphere: love the outdoor space and view. F&B: great coffee, cappuccino.   Non dairy options include oat milk or almond milk. VG options: carrot muffin (+wheat free) as well as banana bread.Price: drink + sweet = +/- $8Wifi: available even outsideSeating: window seats or outdoor tables Outlets: none Time limits: noneExtra perk: water for dogs

Awesome location, affordable coffee and other breakfast items. Have yet to try the breakfast tacos but the frittata was delish. Great way to start the morning. They also have happy hour with canned wine, interesting!
Very cozy, good coffee, great view. Would become go-to place if I lived in the Bay Area. Plus, they open early for esrly birds like me!

My absolute favorite spot in the city. Kind staff, beautiful views and interior, and absolutely delicious items on the menu. Highly recommend a matcha latte (best I've ever had!), vanilla latte, and the Early Bird Tacos (have to show up early for these!). A must-visit in the city!

Coffee was hot and ready to go. Cashew milk at no extra charge #yesplease. Shakerato took a bit to prepare. Not sure if they were understaffed for the morning hours? The staff members that were working were very nice though!
Excellent cappuccinos, friendly, efficient service, fair prices, and a view of the Golden Gate Bridge!  What more can you ask for!

I really wanted to give this place more stars, but I can't. The staff here are really nice, but everything lacks.My chai wasn't great and hardly took up my whole cup.  Also, the last time I came here my friend and I thought we would get baked goods and there were a ton of flies and insects sitting on the food. I ended up getting a glutenfree chocolate chip cookie that was on the bottom of the pile ( praying that nothing sat on it), and it had potential.. but had a dry after taste.Gf baked goods can be difficult to make since the non wheat flour you use will make or break your item. In this case, whatever was used, wasn't the best.

If you're a coffee aficionado in the bay area, you've probably come across equator coffee beans at many artisanal coffee shops or carts. It's stellar beans and they make a great coffee. This shop is right on the forefront of the Marina. It's got ample parking and outside seating. They offer some savory treats, while on the expensive side, they are good.
Cute coffee outpost with lots of patio seating.
Love Equator. Great coffee and their tacos on the weekends are really good. Wish they had a bike share station nearby so it was easier to get to.

One of the few Equator locations in San Francisco, located at Fort Mason Center. Great service, ample outdoor seating, small space for indoor seating. I had the house-made vanilla latte and veggie scone, both were delicious. On a nice day, get a coffee and sit outside reading a book with a view of Golden Gate bridge.
Update: The owner wrote me a nice message and promised to address the issue. She also refunded my payment. Could not ask for more. Thank you.

I'll start by saying that based on my brief interaction with the rude clientele (cutting in line then rudely justifying themselves); which I can't officially blame on the shop, other than as a general tone that they set and accept, this was my first and last visit to this establishment. Further, I found it odd that I ordered three chai teas "to go". The cashier acknowledged this but when they came up there were three cups sitting on the counter. No carrier, no tops...  just cups with liquid sitting there.  These were "to go"? I asked the girl if I could have them "to go please", and she looked at me, dumbfounded, and answered "they are". So I asked again, in case she didn't quite hear me and got the same reply. So I specifically asked for a cup carrier, which there was a stack of behind her, as well as cup tops. "Ok, here's a carrier" she replied and handed it to me. She then pointed out the stack of cup tops on the counter between us. I know this is a little gripe in the big scheme of things, but I was frankly shocked at the blatant poor service about something that's generally a no-brainer. I always leave a buck or two in tip jars, but was happy not to this time. I might as well add that it was, in fact, the worst chai tea I've ever had. Bland in flavor, with tea leaves in the drink. Not to mention very high prices for such a poor product. Hello and goodbye, Equator coffes and teas.

Had been waiting in line to buy coffee and really had to use bathroom. Politely asked for keycode and was denied unless I was a paying customer. Clearly was in line with my wife and asked them again since I was about to buy something. Workers were rude and failed to use common sense about an obviously understandable situation. Ended up leaving the line due to poor treatment. Bad service, bad staff as noted by other reviewers.

Love this location! It's in the marina area right before you hit the fort mason center at the gate. You'll see a big red sign that says equator coffee on the wall and red umbrellas and red seats. This place makes a killer Gibraltar! I definitely recommend, but then anything with creme tastes good. I also had their house made chai, which was like any other chai. I was told they were know for their shakeratos and also some of their light roast beans are roasted with honey which my husband and I have become a fan! The light roasting with honey definitely adds a great flavor to the bean. Best place to come on a nice day and people watch.

I've come here the last two days as my son is taking an art class at Fort Mason. They have a great selection of fresh gluten free goodies such as banana jumble bread and lemon buttermilk donuts. Thank you! The staff have been very friendly and helpful as well.

Great little coffee spot right by Fort Mason! They have outdoor seating which is lovely to enjoy a sunny afternoon. They have decaf espresso and also delicious donuts and pastries. Indoor seating is only counter space so it's limited. And you gotta love their cappuccino foam art :)

I have two coffee scoops at home. One is made of plastic and came free with my Hario V60 ceramic dripper. The other is metal and was purchased at Williams Sonoma when, as a graduate student, I was feeling flush with cash after my monthly stipend arrived. Most of the time, the luxury-model stainless steel scoop sits in the back of the cutlery drawer. It's smaller than the plastic one and takes three scoops to reach 25 grams of whole beans on my digital scale. The plastic scoop usually needs just one. Occam's Razor - the caffeinated kind, mind you - in action.But then I met Frank. When I brought my first bag of "las Nieblas" home, I rummaged around the cutlery drawer for the metal coffee scoop. I carefully cleaned my Zassenhaus manual grinder by running some uncooked rice grains through it and wiping it clean with an organic cotton cloth. I reread the pourover chapter in Grounded: The Fundamentals of Brewing a Delicious Cup of Coffee (2018). It was just before sunrise on a Saturday in early May. Quietly, so as not to wake my companion sleeping in the other room, I lit an oak fire in the fireplace. I put Disc 1 of "The Definitive Vince Guaraldi" on the stereo. I got my digital timer and scale ready. I measured and ground 25 grams of coffee and poured 400 grams of just boiled, charcoal filtered water into the dripper. A hand-thrown ceramic mug was pre-warmed and ready. Over the sink, I did a high pour into the mug so that a beautiful bunch of coffee bubbles formed on top. I walked to the hearth and took my first sip as the crackle of burning wood accompanied "Cast Your Fate to the Wind" on the stereo. A dense fog was rolling in off the Pacific, and the redwoods were dripping steadily as a golden-hued early morning light began to brighten the room. I stood in front of the fire sipping that cup of "las Nieblas" until it was completely empty. I almost never do that in one sitting. It was me, Vince, the fire, the redwoods, and the fog. In a million years, you will not get any more "Saint Frank" than that.What would Uvaldo Moreno have said if I had measured out his magical beans with a scoop made of mere plastic? Or sipped it from a dirty travel mug with the scent of past pourovers still in it? Señor Moreno would not have been pleased, nor his two sons, Milton and Alexi, whose coffee parcels are named "las Nieves" ("the snow") and "las Nubes" (the clouds") and also are roasted here at Saint Frank.How do I know all this? Because Saint Frank told me! It's all on the cards with pictures of the coffee parcels from which the beans have been harvested. I didn't just buy a bag of freshly roasted coffee beans that day. It's more like I adopted them, like in those old TV ads for Save the Children.Ever heard of an heirloom coffee varietal called Parainema? Me neither! That's because it's probably unique to only one section of Santa Barbara Mountain, Honduras. You can try that one, too. It's called "la Laguneta" ("the lagoon"). Benjamin Paz grows that one. Saint Frank buys it directly from Benjamin and ships it to San Francisco, where it's roasted here in SoMa. Plus a bunch of other single origin coffees, each with their own personalized backstory and "mud to mug" micro-narrative.  Even the espresso machine here - an Italian made custom VA 338 "Black Eagle" - has a backstory. It won a recent U.S. Barista Championship. That's right: the exact machine. Not the model! The actual machine that won it. It's like having your honey lavender latte made by Mary Lou Retton. That croissant you're eating? Jane made that. Jane who? Jane the Baker, obviously. Haven't you been paying attention to Saint Frank and his spiritually-tinged planetary mission "to inspire joy, connection, and meaning in coffee with simplicity and courtesy"?I don't know exactly what "fourth wave" coffee culture would look like. But Saint Frank ain't no third wave wanna-be. Maybe in Menlo Park, where Facebookers can slurp up "the Fog," "the Snow," and "the Clouds" in a single sitting while trolling your latest posts for harvestable data. Or on Polk Street, where Saint Frank's original cafe is still located. But this here is a roastery. Customers do not come first. The coffee does. If it feels a bit like an artisan's workshop, that's because it is. The fact that you can even sit down while you drink is a major perk. Purchase a 12oz. bag of beans to go ($19-21), and they'll throw in a complimentary cup of filtered drip - your choice.Except that you can't drink it in front of an open fireplace with redwood rain falling on the rooftop. Unless you actually happen to be Uvaldo Moreno or one of his sons. Then, you are welcome to join me for an early morning fireside pourover. I'll make it for free and serve you sourdough pancakes with fresh Seascape strawberries to boot. Together, we will light a votive candle on the breakfast table for Saint Francis. Uvaldo, my friend, even a multi-billionaire like Mark Zuckerberg can't offer you that.

the staff was really friendly and got to know me a little bit, had a really fun time just going here. The owner was present, so that was cool to see. The honey lavender mocha latte was exceptionally good so i'll add another 5 star review to the many others i'm sure they received. will definitely be back next time i'm in the city!!

Excellent mochaWell tastingWell texturedLoooove that crispy fresh coffee bean roasting smell in the airPerfect combination of chocolate and coffeeTook half a star off because of lack of sitting space but hoping the owners/managers can address that soon. A few more tables and chairs will definitely pull in more folks to this quaint Will be back for coffee. Blue bottle and Starbucks. You got great competition here!!

Delicious iced mocha! The ratio of the sugar to the milk, chocolate and coffee is perfect. It wasn't too sweet or too bitter like some other mochas. Pretty well-lit coffeeshop with very limited seating, so this place would definitely be better if you want to get your coffees to go. There's no public WiFi, but it would be a great space to read your book or just chill with  friends.

Mocha is perfectly caffeinated and not loaded with sugar. I love feeling a little less guilty when I drink something tasty! Pretty milk froth art and it was done it no-time. Could be a great stop on the way to work if you need a quick coffee fix.Unfortunately there's no public WiFi but they've got a great music selection and it smells like delicious toast inside... nice place to sit for a while!

Legit coffee spot that's just for the pure coffee drinkers with a break or work meeting - in the Civic Center area. No WiFi and only a few tables inside with a few more outside, plus a couple outlets inside. Don't come to work but DO COME to enjoy the BEST CAPPUCCINO you've ever had. So legit. Loved it.

This is the worst coffee I've tasted in SF. They make their own almond milk and it sucked. If you drink almond milk, don't come here. My friend got a normal cap and it also sucked. The shots they pulled were off, way off. The milk consistency was also off, you'd do better going to another specialty coffee shop.
Love this coffee and the clean cute location. Staff is friendly and coffee is delicious

Absolutely awesome coffee shop. Unfortunately they only have three tables for sitting as well as some chairs outside, so this isn't the place to camp out and work, but that being said I came around 9:30 and stayed for an hour on my laptop without being disturbed (most people were grabbing coffee to go). Had an iced latte, and the coffee was the right level of strength balanced with the milk. And the milk!! I came to this place because I read they offered homemade nut milk, and their homemade almond-macadamia milk blend was out of this world, both creamy and with a mild nutty flavour that I LOVE. Would come back for it alone.
Some of the best coffee I've ever had. The service is fine, but the staff is a little aloof. The pastry selection is good.

A really superb operation. Impecable style + coffee (of any kind) will always draw a crowd, but the raison d'etre of Saint Frank I would argue is what they produce. They are a proud roaster with purpose and intention. With that said, they also hold a reverence for coffee as a medium. It's not simply fuel, a jolt, something to sip on (in some/many cases a necessary input for proper functioning...); it's something to be enjoyed which places you in a setting of spontaneous inspiration, the cafe. The layouts of their shops are designed to encourage interaction, whether you're meeting a friend or someone new. The topics you cover or overhear might surprise you. And if by yourself, the plain and attractive white walls seem to draw out creativity when before it was more obscure.Did I mention the coffee is good to?
I enjoy the mornings when I pick up a Saint Frank's almond milk latte on the way to work

I don't come from San Francisco so I don't know if this is a normal occurrance. The coffee was good in presentation but in my honest opinion - the flavor was off the mark for me personally.I ordered an almond macadamia latte. I'm unsure if it's an extract used for the macadamia and if it is I believe it was done without peeling the macadamias prior to using it for the coffee. The latte had a bitter taste that wasn't very good at all.

I love coming here in the morning to get my delicious cappuccino. Everyone is always nice and the espresso pull always perfect. They also have pastries from The Jane and granola. Which hits the spot when your house is bereft of food.

Sometime I go to a place and wonder how can places like this survive in an expensive city like San Fran! It's small and cute, and tucked into a nice shop right off a non busy street! I guess they do beans and I realized after the fact I was drinking this coffee all week at work!The staff was super sweet, and they had indoor and outdoor seating. It was the perfect spot to meet up with a friend for a coffee. The latte I had was perfectly made and was delicious! Prices pretty right on with the rest of the city and I have no complaints at all! If I lived in San Fran, I would be a patron of this Saint!

I got the almond milk latte and WOW! The almond really comes through as a deep, nutty flavor. It's a pricey cup of coffee (which ones aren't nowadays) but I truly was blown away by the flavor of the milk.The environment of the cafe is nice too. A few tables near the front windows and a few tables out front. Worth a visit if you're in the area!

With a name like Frank how can you go wrong. We walked out of our way to try an iced coffee at this hip coffee house in this beautiful hot weather we were enjoying. The iced mocha was perfect but my daughter ordered an iced mocha with almond macadamia milk and it was terrible. The barista Joshua made a replacement and it was just as bad. I went back to complain and had them skip the almond milk and the barista replaced it with a regular iced mocha. Joshua and Kia were very nice about this negative episode and kindly made up for it. Great barista team.

As a native Portlander, I've had some pretty excellent coffee and let me tell you, Saint Frank coffee could hold it's own against the very best Portland has to offer. We ordered a latte (smooth, creamy, and delicious), and an iced coffee tasting flight, which included four brews: Kenya Kaiguri, Honduras Las Nubes, Honduras Los Hermanos (my least favorite), and Burundi Ninga Hill (my favorite). The word I would use to describe the staff is - chill. Not uppity or over the top at all, just nice folks who like good coffee. The interior is gorgeous, clean and simple in design. It was also cool to see the roasters and bag of coffee in the back. We enjoyed our coffee in Saint Frank's storefront seating area and I think next time we'll stick to sitting inside - the street is quite noisy. Overall, a great experience!
The one of Mission St. is my favorite coffee shop stop before work. A big fan of the open, simple design with good, honest coffee. Wish they were open for longer hours, though!
Good coffee as always, but it smells a bit funky inside. Luckily they have a couple of tables outside.

Great coffee, great teas, amazing pastries, just one thing... why no ice?!?!  It's ok, there's a hidden patio in the back that I didn't even know about for the first three years I went here. Very calm back there, one of the best 'secret' patios in SF.

There are coffee shops and more coffee shops to caffeinate your soul.This place does not serve the best coffee. It serves great coffee and has baked goods, a great mocha and great service. But that's not what earns it 5 stars.From the outside, you are likely to miss it. If not for Yelp, I would not have found it. And it took us some walking around to find the entrance.Imagine my surprise when we tried to find a place to sit and talk about singularity and how humans may be a simulation, when we discovered the back patio. It's wonderful. Open, tree-lined, between 3 buildings, a classic San Francisco experience. Tip: Ask for extra hot if you are getting a mocha or a latte. And while you are at it, try one of their delicious baked goods. Then spend hours in the backyard reading a book, working on your mechanical turk top lap or simply having the best conversation of your life in an expansive space.
If you want some of the best pastries in San Francisco I recommend this place. I'm a very picky person when it comes to pastry and ice cream. If you come here you'll love it

Food:. ***Ambiance: ***Service: ****I had high expectations based on the reviews but...  Croissant was good but nothing special.  I was expecting crunch outside and flaky inside.  Inside was good but tasted like the ones you can get from Costco croissant ($5.99 a dozen).  Tomato, basil, mozzarella in baguette had fresh ingredients with strong basil scent.  It was good but problem is that you can only bite into half of buns.  You can drop cheese and tomatoes if you take a burger style bite.  Baguette is good (just like the ones you get from Trader Joe's) but I was glad that I have strong teeth.  I still want to like the place and so I will try other breads as well next time I am in the area.

Great pastries, tasty coffee and awesome service! First off, the people working here were so friendly and easy to talk to. I was so glad they weren't pushy about hurrying my order with the line to the door. I ordered two vanilla lattes, two Easter macarons, a cranberry muffin, coffee cake and blueberry scones. Total came out to be just under $30 which isn't bad considering how much we ordered. The latte, macaron and muffin were delicious! I loved the flavor to the muffins with the slight hint of fruit! It was even tasty the day after. My boyfriend literally said "Mmmmm" when he ate the colorful macaron filled with chocolate ganache. Great service and tasty treats! I'd definitely come back again if in the area.

Dropped in here to do some work. I ordered a latte and the customer service was terrible. I went to the bathroom and didn't see my latte yet so I went to sit down to start my work, thinking that they would let me know when my latte was ready. It was the end of the day and there was nobody there. 10 minutes later, I went to check and saw my latte sitting on the counter. The people who worked there gave me NO indication that my latte was ready. There were no customers trying to order and they weren't even doing anything except standing at the counter. I don't plan on coming here again.

Lovely spot for pastries and baked goods. They have a cute and quiet little garden area in the back where you can enjoy your treats in a peaceful area, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Love their almond croissants paired with a cappuccino.

The pastries will make your brain truly explode. GO EAT ONE NOW. ANY OF THEM. GO!However, NOT a fan of the fact that they have no "ice", and therefore: no iced coffee drinks, whatsoever. EEEK. For those of us who only drink iced coffees: no bueno.Bonus: the backyard is a beautiful, garden patio with metal trellis-like tables and chairs. FEELS FANCY LIKE IM IN FRANCE(?)

Only grabbed the ham and cheese croissant to go, but it is SO GOOD that I am making myself write a review for it right now as I enjoy its flaky, savory, cheesy, and meaty goodness. One of the top croissants of my life. Would def return to have another and try their other goodies.

Made a valid service complaint and manager on duty was very rude. Rude enough I walked back to return my food and get a refund. He wouldn't step away to have a private conversation so I had to call it out in view of the full staff. I sent a follow up email complaint and now I'm receiving homophobic email spam. Keep it classy!PS - I'll miss the awesome chocolate cake but homophobes ain't getting my money. You just inspired me to wait in line at Tartine from now on.

Came here an hour before they were closing. They hardly had anything left. Maybe I didn't get what they are known for. The chocolate cake I had was hard and dry. It costs $6 and looks very pretty but just didn't taste too good. There was a lavender cheesy fruity pastry that we liked. Sweet and savory but nothing out of this world. Unique but it felt sort of thrown together. The patio in the back is super cute. If I get a chance and it's carb cheat day, I'll check it out again to see what else they have...hopefully it isn't towards the end of the day.

This is the best bakery in SF in my opinion! I've never had something I didn't love... it's all so good! Their eclair, their scones, their tarts, their turnovers, their bread pudding... and it's all at a very fair price! Also the people that work there are so friendly. There is also a nice back porch where you can sit and eat. I don't usually mention other places in reviews but I'll do it this once... this place is much better than Tartine Bakery!

I walked by this bakery on my way to the hair salon Saturday morning and figured I would stop for a quick breakfast since I was early for my appointment and the line inside implied it was a decent bakery. :PThe smell, once I got inside, was phenomenal and the selection of savory and sweet pastries was enough to make me salivate. I ended up getting just a savory croissant (ham and cheese, I believe) and a house coffee to go, but it was reaaalllly tough to harness my self control! I mean..what can't I use a whole loaf of bread for? Anyway, I'm not sure what they brew, but their drip coffee is quite good! The croissant was quite tasty as well, and perfectly flaky with a generous amount of ham and cheese. I will definitely be back for more of their baked goodies and especially if I need a fresh full loaf of bread for a special occasion.

Unless your allergic to nuts, you have no excuse to not get yourself an almond croissant here. The croissant buttery and flakey and the almond paste was smooth and flavorful. Trust me, you need this croissant in your life.My husband got the chocolate croissant and enjoyed that as well.I also got the butter chocolate chip cookie. The texture was perfect, the base of the cookie had a nice flavor, and the chocolate chips were gooey and perfect. Totally recommend this place.

Almond croissant is delicious. Everything on their menu from drinks to sandwiches to soups to pastries is very tasty. Space is tight but they have a spacious outdoor garden in back. Love this neighborhood gem.
The almond croissant was one of the best pastries I've had during my time in SF. You must get it!
Yum! Can't get enough of their delicious pastries. Helpful and good service and baked goods made with love.
As a European, it's always hard to find satisfying bread in the states. Their breads are great and pastries delicious. Love coming here, super cozy and nice. Better than tartine for sho;-)
if your in town, be sure to try  the almond croissants... they are delicious! One of my faves!

This is a nice little bakery shop with plenty of seating - the back patio is awesome. The service is friendly and quick. The pastries are yummy. Stop reading this, get there ASAP and start eating, then check out some of the shops a few blocks away in the Castro district.

Visited this location twice on my trip! It was close to my hotel in FiDi, the interior was nicely lit, and the staff was fast and jovial. I ordered New Orleans iced coffee each time and while it was decidedly good (10x better than Starbucks iced coffee, which basically tastes like smoke and ash and vanilla) I would like to try other offerings on the menu.

Blue Bottle was fun today. It's expensive and has branding. This one is in the FiDi and it's got a fun interior and the same drink menu. Actually, this one had a fizzy drink with sparkling water and syrup. It was like a citrus lemonade. I don't think it had caffeine and I forgot the name completely, but maybe it was fizz? I liked the time I spent meeting with an old contact in downtown San Francisco. This one is youthful, professional, and hip. It's for lifestyle and it's a place to hang out..whip out your laptop and drink something casually. Here's to Blue Bottle.

Good coffee and friendly service. I'm new to this coffee chain, but I'm a fan now. From the packaging, to the store layout, everything was simple and visually pleasing. This store in the financial district was also particularly stunning from the inside and outside.
AMAZING service! Drink came out to perfection. A wonderful start to another crazy day in the Bay!

It's no secret that Blue Bottle has great coffee. I recently tried their Hayes Valley espresso, and I am now a solid fan too. Not to mention that this location is super beautiful with a art deco feel to it. It does get busy towards the end of the work day, so plan too find another place to sit!

My favorite fancy coffee place. I love their ambience, and decors. They weekly change beautiful follower arrangements in the center table.  The baristas are so cool too.  They know how to make best ice coffee. Their famous iced coffee with blondie is so good together.  Their Affogato is addictive especially in the summer time.

Really nice coffee shop. I was visiting from out of town and stumbled on this place when I was looking for a coffee shop near my hotel. I typically don't like experimenting with new and different coffee drinks (I stick to my usual iced or hot latte), but I decided to be a little spontaneous and asked the barista what he'd recommend, which was some sort of New Orleans drink. I really enjoyed it and now hate that I'm rarely ever in SF cause it was really good. I gave them 4 stars because I wish they had more food options. I was there around breakfast time and they only had a few cookies and croissants, not a lot of options.
Everyone who works here is always so friendly & has a great attitude and genuinely seem to enjoy their craft. The New Orleans Iced coffee is super tasty too!

The best coffee in the city, although I do love  almond rose coffee from illy. There is something about bluebottle coffee that drinks very smooth for me which I like a lot. The stores are also bright, clean and efficient which is my favorite kind of place.Staff has always been really friendly and the wait times aren't crazy.

So I am a big coffee fan. I grew up in Cambodia and traveled to Vietnam a lot and these are big coffee drinking country so coffee was my go-to drink ever since I was a kid. I'm always out looking for the best coffee in every city and here I am at another great one in the city, Blue Bottle Coffee.Blue Bottle has become big enough that they are in whole foods and have multiple locations in the city, but that doesn't mean they become overrated. This is the first time I've been to one of their locations since I usually just pick up a cold brew at Whole Foods so I was pretty excited. I'm also a sucker for aesthetically pleasing coffee shops so I can get instagram worthy shots as well so this place was a hit! I got the Cafe Mocha with Hayes Valley blend and asked for very little sugar and it was amazing! The latte art is nice and cute and they filled it up to the very top so I hate to walk like an old lady to get to our seats and grab an instagram worthy picture. I also LOVE marble and this location is filled with marbles as their counter/tabletops. So aesthetically pleasing, check, marble, check, great looking cup of coffee, check AND coffee that actually taste as good as they look, CHECK! I love everything except the fact that they don't have wifi or outlets. This is pretty shocking to me because there are decent amount of seating everywhere and working at coffee shop is kind of a thing for me, so it was a bummer. Now...I am writing this review, on my laptop here...but of course I have to tether myself to get internet and I have an external battery pack to charge my laptop so if you do still want to do some work here, I highly recommend packing some external battery and having tethering or some way to access the internet. Otherwise, it is more recommended for catching up with friends or some light browsing that you won't kill your battery for. This is probably the only reason why I would put this place as a 4/5 instead of 5/5.TLDR: Great coffee, Instagram worthy coffee shop, no outlets or wifi.

Great coffee. Looks like it has classes for learning how to brew slow drip coffee. Nuff said.Ample seating with like ~25-30 ish seats to sit down and work at. No Wi-Fi and didn't see any outlets though :(. However there is the #SFWifi it is kinda slow and the Target Guest Wifi across the street. Very bright location with very big windows. Has some pastries and a great place to pick up some coffee making accessories. Not to packed on a rainy SF Saturday.Pros:-Supports Apple Pay.-Good amount of seating-Barista Training ($20 Brew Class Saturday 12-1PM)-Doesn't seem too packed-Bathroom exists before the elevators left of the security guard-Free Water beside the cash (they have cups you can use)-Not extremely loudCons:-No Wi-Fi-No Outlets (bring some USB-C battery packs for your Macbooks)
Oat milk latte. Enough said. Blue bottle does it again! Great, smooth taste. And this location is particularly lovely with the large arches and windows. Great for a morning coffee hit.

Blue Bottle is (admittedly) overpriced and extremely slow, but they are extremely consistent in the quality of their coffee. Amongst the different high end coffee shops in the city, Blue Bottle still reigns as one of my favorites (both for mochas and lattes). This one usually has a line out the shop since it's in a high-density working area. There's two payment areas but I've usually only seen one person behind the register, so the line moves pretty slowly for the high volume of patrons who frequent this shop. It probably doesn't matter in the end, though, because the space behind the counter is extremely small and the rate that the drinks are produced is alarmingly slow. There's usually a couple baristas for espresso drinks, and one doing the drip coffees and tea. I will likely still come to this location, but make sure you allot yourself up to 15m (or more) minutes during peak times, like in the mornings before work.
Good coffee but the wait and line makes me want to go someplace else. I had an Ethiopian expresso and just didn't like the flavor. If I go back I wouldn't something else.

I am type A, and when I was handed my waffle I was soooooo happy, and I said "Thank You" and the gal who handed it to me with a blank stare said nothing.................. now when one of my clients says "Thank You" I have the courtesy to respond, you know something like " Your Welcome" or "Have a great day"  not here.  So this note is for the GM, if you have an employee who isn't happy to be at work, or maybe she doesn't enjoy her job, maybe its time to have a chat and explain to her, that if she isn't happy being an employee, you have no problem making her a customer....................  at the end of the day its all about the user experience.  Now the next time I come in, if the user experience improves I will change my review............ it doesn't get any better then that.  Reciprocity is the key to any healthy relationship.  You all have a great dayMUCH BETTER on my most recent visit.

Blue bottle was my first coffee love when I first moved back to the bay about 6 years ago. Blue bottle taught me to appreciate a GOOD cup of coffee. Upon my first visit to Blue Bottle, my close foodie friend introduced me to drip coffee and encouraged me not to add in the syrups and creams and really appreciate the true flavors of the drink. I was shocked, mind you that my previous coffee go-tos were always the sweet flavored drinks from Starbucks. Funny how your taste buds can change overtime... Trying out Blue Bottle elevated my spectrum of coffee, but then again, maybe just being in the Bay Area does that to you anyways. It's true, SF peeps are coffee snobs and like their good coffee! Blue Bottle has always been consistent with quality and taste. Their flavors are really strong so I always love getting a latte to add in the creaminess from the milk. I also adore their HOUSE MADE LIEGE WAFFLES. 5/5 stars for sure. They are hot off the press, crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, with just a touch of sweet caramelized sugar goodness. This location itself is great. Tall ceilings. Spacious seating. But beware the line can get pretty long in the mornings. Ordering moves quickly but it may take ~10+ minutes to get your coffee.
My favorite cafe in the city. The mocha tastes very special and I love it, it is not too sweet but more of cocoa flavor. The latte is very good too.

I got the New Orleans ice coffee. It was pretty strong- a little while after drinking it, I felt like my heart was trying to escape my chest. Needless to say this place gets 5/5 stars from me. The menu is simple, but that doesn't seem to be an issue if they make the few things they do have very very well. The location is nice and there was a good amount of seating, though it was quite busy when we went.
Oh Blue Bottle, how far you have fallen. Once the darling of SF, now a world wide juggernaut with the backing of the vile Nestle corporation. I shall never return.

Oat cappuccino - 4 starsI was hesitant when they told me they swopped their soymilk for oatmilk because of the added sugar in the soymilk. I've had oatmilk before and thought it was terrible. This changed my mind about oatmilk! The texture was amazing, and it had a rather neutral, slightly nutty flavour. I think I actually prefer this to my usual Bonsoy/unsweetened Silk soy lattes! Now I have to hunt this oatmilk down...Drip coffee - 3.5 starsTo be honest, I can't tell the difference between this and other drip coffees I've had. It's definitely better than the ditchwater drip coffee you'd get at a 3 star hotel breakfast, but beyond that I can't quite tell.Chocolate chip cookie - 2.5 starsVery average. It was soft and didn't have a memorable flavour.

Came across here one time and decided to stop by and do some work. Coffee was good, nothing special, but I liked the vibe of the place. It's pretty busy though and there's not a ton of space, so it's a bit difficult to find a spot, but there's free WiFi.

Avoid this place like the plague! The staff is rude & unprofessional and the coffee garbage. I was a regular customer and it's annoying how every time I go there (mind you it's the same exact location) my drink ends up different. Whether it be hot when I asked for iced or with one shot instead of two. I simply can never win here. One would think since you pay so much for a drink the baristas should take the time to get it right instead of making you feel like a fool and smirking at their coworkers. Who ever is the owner of this place needs to get control of the workers or hire new people because the only reason I figure they're still in business is because they are close to the cable car route. I've never taken the time to write a review but people need to be made aware.

What happened to this place? This was my favorite coffee shop in the City and I used to stop in every morning for years. The cortados and lattes were always on point. The staff weren't the most chatty but were always prompt, professional, courteous and had me on my way in minutes. The opposite is true now. The staff is more interested in chatting amongst themselves and their friends at the bar and seem annoyed when you want to place an order. When you finally get your latte and mention that it tastes bitter and not hot at all, you're told, "That's how we do our Lattes here." With a little extra attitude added. I don't know if there is a new owner, since I don't see any of the old staff, but clearly they don't care about their customers or their product. What a shame. Save your money.

While the coffee is better than average, baristas are extremely rude, and management tries to gaslight you when you offer feedback privately through email in an attempt to avoid giving them less than five stars. Not worth the 6 dollars or the attitude.

Tried their Bhakti Chai Latte and house cold brew (they were out of the Kyoto cold brew). All I can say is that it was alright. The chai came out only slightly warm, ready to drink without burning your mouth but not warm enough.
Great spot. Free wifi. Gets crowded. I  recommend arriving early and order the food to go.

Coffee takes way too long and is not good enough for the price. To add to it, the staff is rude to customers. For a $6 cup of small coffee, one would expect some kind of decency. Asking questions or trying to figure out how to pay when their register isn't working is met with hostility from the staff.When their management is informed of the problems with their staff, they respond just as rudely, if not worse. They insist the problem is with the customers, not their staff, seriously, what the fuck?Save your time and money and go anywhere else, their coffee isn't worth it.

Contraband is the best coffee shop in SF. It might even be the best coffee shop in the world! I have been coming here for a decade and I am always so pleased with the coffee, and with the incredible baristas! Shout our to Jack, Erica, Manny, Sara, Alex and the rest of the crew. Thank you so much for always providing such a great space and for serving the best coffee & vibes in SF :)

I found Contraband just before going to brunch with my date. DRINKSBhakti chai 3.5/5 The chai was very spiced and sweet but it came out just slightly warm. I really wish it came out hotter for me to enjoy. It tasted mostly like warm milk with spices on top. AMBIANCE&SERVICEDespite the cool hipster vibe of the coffee shop, the workers seemed so uninterested and intimidating. No welcome, no "hi"s, just waiting to take your order. The cashier took our order, said "That'll be $9". I handed him a $50 bill, he dismisses me, turns around casually talking to his coworkers for a few minutes, took a group shot (of espresso maybe?), finally turned around and took the $50 bill from my hand. He returns my change with $10. I corrected him to say "Oh, I gave you a $50 bill." He returns the correct amount of change with no sincerity and a nice classic eyeroll. The interior has one large community table with limited amount of energy outlets. The music was obnoxiously loud- hard to have a normal conversation or study. The chai tea was just okay- nothing I would come back for. Prices seem pricey for the amount you get. Highly recommend this place getting new workers that like working with people. Don't work in the customer service industry if you don't like people- simple as that.
The matcha-turmeric concoction they have on the menu is badass...may look like hot baby poo, but it is de-lish! ;)

Addicted! I came here once before last year, ordered a latte and enjoyed it- wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Came back here last weekend on a cold and rainy day with the hubs- I insisted it is a great spot per reviews, and I shared my personal past experience was pleasant.The staff is a little intimidating, but we went forward and placed our orders. He ordered the Bhakti chai and I am almond milk latte. Much to my surprise, when we received our orders I somehow had an almond milk Bhakti chai- and it was the BEST mistaken order! The chai was creamy, slightly spicy and perfectly sweet! We loved it so much, we made a second stop that evening for a second round.The taste of that chai lingered with me all week, so I made my way down again, this time, per recommendation, ordering the pirate matcha chai. This was definitely more spice. The chai was overpowered by the matcha, but it worked well as I walked home through the cold. Would I order it again? Probably not- I'll stick to the Bhakti chai :)Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!
Great coffee and a cool atmosphere. This place takes all of the silly nonsense out of cafés and just focuses on serving really good coffee. Great work spot. Located in a cool area of town

I came here before a long shift and wanted something that would keep me up but lightly: the matcha latte seemed like a good place to start So I ordered it, deliciously savored the wonderful powdery foam this flavor gives and powered through a hectic night at the bar. Thanks y'all

This coffee shop was a short walk from the Nob Hill Hotel where we were staying for a few days. The lattes we ordered on our first visit were quite well made by Brett the barista and tasted very nice. The shop has wi-fi, very long bar height community tables, plenty of power outlets, some trendy art for sale on the walls, a clean his  / hers bathroom and some outdoor seating. I came by here every morning for a latte or cappuccino and every time irritating country & western music was being played. The male staff we encountered were a drull lot and couldn't crack a smile if their life depended on it. I usually didn't stick around long as I didn't like the nerdish vibe. There was a bare minimum of food for sale but they knew how to make nice coffees, that's it ! We had breakfast most mornings at Mymy cafe right next door...the food there is excellent !

Super hipster coffee spot with lots of natural light. It's small, but there is enough seating for about 25ish people so the space is pretty functional. I liked the display of pastries and unique offerings such as a spiced matcha and a turmeric latte "golden milk". I tried the steeply 6$ golden milk, spicy and creamy at the same time. 4 stars for free WiFi but I saw only one outlet?? Wtf. Get an extender maybe?Oh, and most of the seating is elevated so it's sort of a diy standing desk if you so choose!

I got the iced rosemary latte, it was good but very strong which I liked. Small little coffee shop, it gets pack in the afternoon. I usually go at night 6-8pm ish to get stuff done. Make sure your devices are charged because they have a few outlets. WiFi works fine!

Staff was nice and helpful. They took their time and explained all their drink options to me. It's too bad the coffee was so-so. The beans lack quality and the drink lacked flavor (I ordered a cappuccino and a latte). Also, the drinks were served lukewarm, which is the easiest way to ruin a cup of coffee. After explaining this to the barista, she took the two drinks off my hands. She then proceeds to just top off the drink to the brim with steaming hot milk, increasing the temperature but killing the flavor and quite frankly the experience. It wouldn't have killed her to remake the two drinks from scratch.

I used to go here all the time - I won't anymore. For my $5.50 latte, I asked for a splash of extra almond milk - and the other day I was received with a gruff "so that'll be the same price as a large" - mind you, the large that comes with two extra shots  + extra milk. I was shocked - I was charged $7+ dollars, and it was literally just a splash, and had never been a problem before. The man (gruff, stocky one with white beard) person working, who I assumed to be the manager, made a comment about emailing the staff to make sure it was never done again - and they lost a loyal customer in doing so. Also, if you get a drip coffee...half the time they don't fill it up and you're left with a huge gap. $5+ bucks for a drip coffee and not filled up? Thank you, next.Shame when mice nuts are turned into a mountain.Side note: The vibe is off, (although there are some rare, kimchi & dog loving exceptions whom I have made wonderful conversation with.) I would say half the time I go there, no one cracks a smile. Guess positivity is not returned often here. Save yourself a .75 cent almond milk fee & go elsewhere - hopefully they give a damn about their customers & their coffee is delicious.

Cute coffee spot that is quiet and clean. A little sterile and lacking personality though. GF and I came here for a tea date. Baristas were nice. We both had the Bhakti chai tea latte. GF had her drink made with whole milk, and mine was made with soy milk. I was impressed by and loved the spicy kick to my chai. Helped it be not too sweet!
Pros: good vibe ,nice music. Coffee is excellent.spacious.Cons: basically serves coffee , pastries may run out early. Very few electric spots.
Beautiful and delicious cappuccino, and the baristas are always super friendly and unpretentious.  Cute little shop on a nice quiet street, love this place!
Love this place. It's a quiet little nook, I go there every time I am in that area, the cappuccino is wonderful

A quick stop here on my way to the office has become not only a habit but an addiction.  The super rich flavors are unforgettable and irreplaceable by your average Joe on the street. Love how it's tucked away in a small alley too so its clientele tends to be people who truly appreciate a good coffee as opposed to those kids who need a sugar fix.

Omg it's liquid gold!!!! I ordered a cortado and it was just perfect! It's a one man show so don't go if you're in a rush. Even so, the barista was a gentleman and knows his craft. They take Apple Pay which is a super plus for me. I'll certainly be back for more!!!
Nice vibe. Milk for my macchiato was steamed too long - much hotter than it should be and flavor of the macchiato was burnt off.

The coffee here is liquid crack, proper cappuccino jolt with a nice foam. The barista was charming and bright and sincerely apologetic for the wait (he was just on break) But I understand the grind.The place is a little narrow curio of a coffee bar and actual bar serving coffee centric cocktails.I need to come back and try one of those "jolting" drinks ;) other than that, nice service and sufficient coffee.

This is the cutest and smartest way to buy all your daily necessities: coffee by day and a cocktail by night! Lol! The honey latte is so delicious! And the barista was so nice and fast! My friends and I were visiting from out of town and after a day of shopping we made our coffee stop.  We had moved on to another store when I realized I left my Zara shopping bag. Thankfully they had put it away up stairs for safe keeping. Thank you Iron Horse for great coffee and for saving the day!
The place which serves amazing drinks, hard to find in the whole city. The service is amazing. Perfect hidden spot in such a beautiful city! Love it!
Serious coffee and espresso pours. That's it. Better than bluestone, and less hassle than the big chains. No wifi, just coffee. Oh and it's a dive bar after 4PM. What's not to like.
Adult coffee on Maiden lane. Come for an eye opener (liquor + espresso) or just some good strong espresso. Don't come expecting Starbucks, this is proper espresso we're talking about.
They charge 50 cents extra for ICE. They charge extra for solid water cubes and less actual drink.. I'm so confused.

Probably not an old business can say it's new and really good place to go on weekdays , so many people recommend me to visit them and finally I did and which makes me happy to listen to other sometimes as well. I did enjoyed every minute that I spend here and the people who works inside are really polite . Coffee is great and the atmosphere is great as well. Love to see this kinda business around .
A bit noisy but really good cocktails, especially the grapefruit one! They often do events with a tequila brand and offer delicious tacos. Nice after work place

First time coming by after passing by this great cocktail and coffee hole-in-the-wall many times over the last few years! Their iced honey latte (tastes like real honey with a sprinkle of cinnamon) is amazing refreshing, would just come back here for that! Service was quick and was so glad they took Applepay as well!
Tiny little barista tucked in a great shopping/boutique area of town.  Loved the barista and he pulls a mean espresso.

You should go to this compact coffee hideaway before the influx of badly dressed tourists make it intolerable. Right now the lines consist mostly of young start-up lemmings who already the caffeine is well treated here. The irony is that this closet of a kiosk is located on Maiden Lane between Kearny and Grant, the heart of the tourist congestion zone presuming it has a heart. The young Dutch barista was quite friendly, and there are a dozen hot beverages offered including the $3.25 Cafe Au Lait I ordered which was brewed from Ritual coffee beans (photo: bit.ly/2r8g8nG). While others took their drinks to go and it was too wet outside to take advantage of their makeshift patio, I sat along the narrow wooden counter where I looked at the vintage cocktail lounge as the staff was preparing to open for the evening (photo: bit.ly/2JHEMCv). Take advantage of its low profile while you still can.COFFEE - 4 stars...quite smooth as it is Ritual after allAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...tight inside though hardly anyone sits and drinks their beverage thereSERVICE - 4 stars...friendly and unhurriedTOTAL - 4 stars...a hole in the wall worth exploring

Just visited again and the coffee and service we're absolutely stellar!  One gripe.... they no longer play metal. As an old rocker I eagerly anticipate having coffee and listening to some metal. Please reconsider!

Great little pop up coffee shop to grab some joe if you work in FiDi. I had a mocha when I was there and was pleased with the taste and the price. Wasn't really a line when I went and loved how it was kind of hidden from the main foot traffic of downtown.
Great dirty chai. Not much sitting space inside but cool aura. Outside tables and chairs. They offer adult coffee too so that's a plus
quaint location but latte pretty meh for pricenot bad for pick-up if in area but not worth traveling for

This is my favorite place for high tea in San Francisco. I've gone by myself, taken family + friends, and business acquaintances who are visiting SF. Everyone has had a wonderful time. By far the best scones I've ever had and though I enjoy their Afternoon Tea for One... my absolute favorite is their Chicken Pot Pie.

We had my daughter's bridal shower here and it was such a beautiful experience! The owner Amy, made sure everything was perfect. Our servers Barbie and Odelia were friendly and really nice. The place is beautiful.  It was a a truly lovely Tea Party!

Excellent service, tasty teas, convenience location is the good things about Crown & Crumpet Tea Stop Cafe. But this high tea restaurant is opened in the lobby of the building entrance. It doesn't feel as a good location for high tea! They also put in as many as tables they can. So we are feeling the pressures on the environment! The services are excellent. The waiters and waitresses was very attentive and very nice. The services are one of the best in my experience! They have so many choices of teas. I tried their House Private Blend and The Paris. Both are very good tasty teas. Specially the Paris recommenced by our waiter. The foods quality are below average! None of the items we tried was good at all! The salads come with the sandwiches are very old. We didn't try to eat it, but it is not even good for decorations purpose!

Came here with my family when my mom was in town. She spotted it while running errands in Japantown so suggested we all meet here.We made reservations but it was COMPLETELY dead when we arrived which was kind of weird. The entire building was dead. We had a large party of 8 people and ordered multiple tea sets. I also ordered a gluten free one. I think we had three afternoon tea sets for one, one nursery tea set for my grandma, and other people ordered a la carte from the lunch menu. Their ordering process is kind of weird and everyone is required to order something but its okay to share things once they arrive. We had way more tea than we needed in the end BUT they let you take them away in to go cups at the end which is a nice perk. The best deal here is the cake and tea combo because their cake slices are huge and beautiful. Service was very good the entire time and easy street parking outside. If you go a couple blocks away there is free 2 hour street parking as well!

just used a groupon for Crown and Crumpet! Super smooth process, the server was amazing, and we had a lot of food! We couldn't finish up the sweets but everything tasted amazing. I need to come back for the scone. *drools*

I have always known about this location, just never had the chance to drop by. For those who may not know where it is, it's kind of hidden within another building, across the street from the main Japan town plaza. It's a modern looking building and will be on the right side when you enter. (The other floors consists of different stores that have Japanese fashion and such, definitely check it out!)My boyfriend and I were the only ones there, so we were able to choose where we would like to sit. The decor is very cute and pink. It makes you feel like you are a little girl playing tea party with your stuffed animals when you are younger. We decided to do the Afternoon tea option for two. My boyfriend and I got two of their most popular teas and it came in a rather large pot with milk (must request). We also got a 3-tier tower that had finger sandwiches, scones, and other little pastries. The tea was delicious and the best part of the tier foods was the scones. Our server made sure everything was okay and addressed any questions that we possibly had. There were only one or two other parties in the area with us and he attended those tables with a lot of attention as well, even walking a woman who was on her own through their menu, seeing what she was interested in and would like. Overall, a very cute experience! If you haven't been to an afternoon tea, this is a great place to try!

Absolutely clean, cute, crown & crumpety. :) I always enjoy my visits here. Amazing scones and crumpets. Finger sandwiches are fresh and delish. Desserts aren't bad. I LOVE the their house blend tea and tea set. I literally feel like I'm having a tea partea with the shiny tea set. The service isn't rushed, people are literally enjoying their tea. The cutest part about this place is when I see little kiddies with their parents and friends having a partea. LogisticsYou should always make reservations. It's a small quaint space, bathrooms located downstairs. Shares a space of a theater. Metered Street parking or parking lot across the street.

This was a cute and very stylish place! We loved the Earl Grey tea and the macaroons. Adam was great we didn't have a reservation but he made room and sat us pretty fast and was super attentive . I will definitely be returning.

Crown and Crumpet is a friendly, cheerful place that offers classes for children to learn, without pretense, basic table etiquette and tea service. Staff are friendly and accommodating and go out of their way to create a positive and fun learning experience for each child. Five stars for creating an experience about manners and courtesy that had each kid asking if there were a Part Two to attend. Reserve spaces early as they tend to fill to capacity and class sizes are small.

I first want to preface that I came on a Monday, late in the day. It was quiet and my husband and I were able to have the place to ourselves. It's decorated with quirky pieces that flow well with the space, layering bold and soft color and prints. The waiter was delightful, helping with tea selections and menu questions, taking good care of us for the afternoon.I ordered the afternoon tea for one and my husband ordered a sandwich salad combo. The amount was just enough. I would say that the afternoon tea for one is not a complete substitute for lunch, as it's not high tea and the portions are more complementary with several pots of tea (I had two). If you're looking for american portions this is not the place, this is conversational portions, enough to fill you but not overflow you. I enjoyed my meal and time very much, never feeling rushed. This place can get very busy so I'd recommend a reservation and arriving early so you're able to fully enjoy your time. If you'd rather not get a reservation then come earlier in the week. Parking across the street is ideal and don't forget to explore the shops inside.

Our favorite tea stop this side of Marks & Spencer's!!  Love the excellent pastry selection (scones to die for!), sausage rolls and gsandwiches!!  Most importantly the staff is very friendly and accommodating!  We recommend this place to all our visiting friends and family!!

Such a cute place to have tea! And everything was delicious and high quality. We had a reservation for 4:00 on a Sunday. We were seated quickly and service was fast. The space is pretty loud and crowded though since it is in the corner of a shopping plaza. We got the strawberry fields (green/matcha tea) and a chai tea. Both were good and the tea was strong. For food we had two of the afternoon tea set for one. It came with two ham and cheese sandwiches, two egg sandwiches, two raspberry scones, and a variety of other foods. The scones were our favorite! So buttery and flaky. We'll definitely be back, especially for those scones!

Such a fun time celebrating our birthday with tea and wit! We sipped on Stardust, Swamp Water and Alice Drink Me teas. Our Trolley Dolly Adam brought the Afternoon Tea meal - finger sandwiches, warm savouries, scones and crumpets, with clotted cream, house-made lemon curd and jam, and bite-sized desserts. He even brought the birthday girl a cupcake and blew bubbles! We scored a great deal with a Groupon. Had lots of fun using their free Buzzy Booth to take fun photos.  And enjoyed the nearby shopping.
