Adam was our most fabulous Dolly Trolly and it was the best time on a rainy Saturday.The menu has so many flavors of tea.We had four pots of tea the Swap water made us laugh and the Drink Me Tea was super flavorful and the Stardust was my favorite and it had sparkles!The food was flavorful and generous and the photo selfies made us laugh so hard till we cried.Thank you for a super fun tea time we will be back again!

Stopped in at 5 pm for a SMALL pot of tea. Her first response was "ugh I'm closing up soon". Don't worry lady, I will be able to drink my tea in less than an hour. 6 people total in the whole place and she's panicking. Rolling my eyes right back at ya.

Had a lovely lunch with my granddaughter (our second visit). Service, ambiance and food were all excellent. Their lemon ginger scones served with Devon cream, lemon curd and strawberry preserves were scrumptious - I've had scones all over the US and England, and these were exceptional. Highly recommended.

I was somewhat disappointed when I entered Crown & Crumpet on Post Street.  The Tea Stop Cafe is located in the lobby area of a business building and I felt like I was sitting in the open area of a lobby not a tea room.  It was extremely difficult to find because of the location and they are only allowed to use a sidewalk sandwich board type of sign.  The table cloths are charming but when I looked under the table cloth I found that the white liners are very dirty and in need of a laundry.  Only one man was working and he did a superb job of attending to everyone by himself.  The scones and crumpets were delicious and warm.  The tea sandwiches tasty.  The desserts were so so...I'm not especially fond of sprinkles on so many sweets.  They offer a wide assortment of teas and the ones we tried were quite good.  I love the teacups and saucers which have wonderful quotes relating to tea printed on the cups.  I hope that this business will move to a better location.  Your shop at Ghirardelli Square was so charming compared to this shop.

This place is a real gem. Not only do they accommodate gluten free customers with superb quality goodies, but they were even able to accommodate my keto diet! It was difficult to resist the tempting sandwiches and especially the gf scones looked and smelled divine - my daughter (whose 17th birthday we were celebrating) said they were the best scones she's ever had, gluten free or conventional.The space is a little odd, sharing the entry with the an escape room and a small theater downstairs. Bit once we got settled in it was simply perfect. The decor, the service and the food were all impressive.

Wow wow wow, took my two favorite ladies into the city to celebrate my wife passing her CFRN! We arrived more than 45 early... we expected to wait... nope not their style.... they welcomed us with class and a smile! Made us feel at home! Staff was very friendly and efficient! The tea came out... great flavors.... then the very yummy finger foods... very enjoyable time in all! Will be back again soon

I have such lovely memories of coming here on Valentine's Day in 2016 with one of my best girlfriends. Granted I have not been back to visit since, as I moved to Los Angeles later that year, but I remember we had the best time. Our server was a jolly woman who was nothing short of perfect and offered us glasses of champagne while we admired the variety of teas and treats on the menu. I would have never thought that a tea room in such a modern building would be enjoyable, as I have always experienced high tea in cozy, quaint shops, but we had an excellent couple hours, enjoying all of the positive, happy vibes bouncing off the walls. Also, the parking garage across the street was great and made it possible for us to fully appreciate our experience, as there is nothing more aggravating than having to drive around for ages trying to find a spot.I would definitely stop by Crown & Crumpet again, the next time I'm in the area!

Barista: Hi, what brings you to this area?... coffee?My lost and confused look disguises my native SF face, mistaking it for a tourist in my own city.  I was meeting up a friend here and I was totally admiring the decor; the brick wall, the wooden tables, the outdoor patio-- excuse me while i soak this in.  Its quiet and spacious, perfect to get work done or meet up a friend and devise a plan to take over the world.The coffee was good and the server was friendly.  That brick wall though... *swoon*
Good coffee but Waaaaaaayyyy overpriced. $4.50 for the smallest ice coffee I've ever seen

One of the best cups of coffee in the city.  Great interior, red brick, modern seating, etc.  Bathroom is touch-less and clean.  Only downside is, and I feel like an old man for saying, is the music is way too loud.  A little hard to concentrate on work.  I will be back tho.

Hy everybody  A great place to sit and work.Plenty of outlets and table space. Oh and the creme brulee latte kinda rocked my world. great place to sit and work.Plenty of outlets and table space. Oh and the creme brulee latte kinda rocked my world.

Surprisingly big coffee shop! Located not in the best area but the coffee shop is cute and has outdoor seating in the back. Coffee is yummy! I also had a vegan cookie which was only okay but not bad. Great vibe if you are close by.

Great cafe with a well-balanced decor, vibe and business. The atmosphere is open and bright. There's an outdoor area in the back, well suited for SF's consistently moderate weather. The coffee is roasted in-house and the results are evident to the palate. Wifi connection is strong even during primetime. And there's a somewhat automated bathroom to remind you you're still in SF.
I'll definitely be back. Sextant has delicious coffee with an excellent fruity almost citrusy tang. Friendly service at the counter and nice tables and space to hang out or work.

Solid artisanal coffee shop in San Francisco, but I didn't really see anything that differentiated them from other artisanal coffee shops in the city. I stopped by around 11:45am on a Saturday, and it wasn't busy at the time. They had two pour over options to choose from in addition to the usual options of latte, etc. They also had a cold brew option available. I opted to try their Yirgacheffe Pour Over ($5), which was super smooth, but had a slightly acidic finish. They roast their beans in the back of the shop, which would be cool if they did a mini tour, or had a display window or something along those lines. Beans are around $14/bag. They also had some cookies available (vegan and non), but no other food options. Parking was easy at that time, and there were good metered street parking spots. I believe there is also one free street spot on the street right before the cafe.

After going there for a year, the staff still couldn't figure out the rewards program.  Each time I made a purchase, the payment screen told me I had rewards.  When I asked about it, I was told they needed to check me in manually.  Then they said they couldn't do that.  Then they said I must have entered something incorrectly.  Nice coffee, but it's just easier to go someplace else, especially in a city where "artisan" coffee can be found on pretty much every block.

Below-the-radar artisanal coffee shop with an emphasis on single-origin coffee from Ethiopia. Their pour-overs are exceptionally well balanced, neither bitter nor acidic (a sign that the coffee extraction was just about right, neither under-extracted nor over-extracted). They roast the coffee beans themselves. The espresso we tried was from Columbia. The latte is quite smooth with an earthy/fruity profile, the kind you have come to expect from good coffee baristas. Definitely recommended if you are in the area.The only minus is that it was freaking cold in there. The building is an old warehouse of sorts, I guess not very well insulated and not well heated. In this current SF weather, this can get challenging! Bring a coat or try to snatch the one table that is by the front window.

Wavering between 3 and 4 stars. It's a nice place that I wouldn't mind coming back to, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it. I would be more motivated if they made their pastries in house lol but they do source from good bakeries at leastStrengths:-Chai latte - it's on the sweeter and not spicier side which makes me sad but the drink is SO CREAMY and thick idk how they do it and it impresses me tremendously-free wifi that's strong and reliable-they roast their own coffee without coming off as snooty as four barrel lol the vibes here are more relaxedQuestionable: -Drip coffee isn't necessarily a dark roast in the grand scheme of things, but it's definitely a dark roast compared to all other bougie SF coffee shops (think ritual, st franks, four barrel). Maybe the roast level is comparable to equator and philz
Bad latte. Bad cafe au last. Rude barista. Creepy people walking around outside.Will not return.

One of my favorite coffee shops in the city. Natural light / lighting in general in here is not great, but the vibe is quiet and relaxed. It's nice that it's not crazy hectic as some coffee shops can be on the weekend. Pastry and coffee were decent and I was able to focus and get a lot of work done. Solid neighborhood coffee joint overall.

I had the mocha latte here and it was pretty good. Good quality coffee and chocolate from the mocha was just enough to get a nice taste without being too overpowering.The place has a nice vibe and is a good ares to relax and talk. Great seating both inside and outside (though it was a little cold when we went so we were inside).
Great coffee & lattes. Pretty expensive tough. Great atmosphere and very knowledgeable baristas.

So today my girlfriend and I wanted to come to SOMA, because we've been alot of places in the city so far. I wanted to go to a coffee shop to start our day and I always love to go to places that roast thier own coffee, part of the third wave culture. As expected, I ordered an espresso, which I don't mind to be too sweet or fruity, thats always a big thing in a good espresso. It had a nice chocolatey flavor, with some berry and a little bitterness, not bad! What was bad however was hidden in the crema, I could taste a big mistake, it was definitely a light roasted or medium roasted coffee since it was so bright, but the crema tasted exactly like burned chaff, like the roaster did not blow off the chaff of the bean during the roasting process. Overall I give the coffee a 4/10. However, I was with my girlfriend as I mentioned and she ordered an almond milk cappucino, and it looked like they make their own almond milk or at the very least a good quality one. When the cappuccino came out the barista, who also took my order with a passively boring and slightly aggressive temper, put a cappucino that looked like a milk fart. It tasted absolutley awful, and it mayve been the ingredients fault. I won't blame the barista, she knew how to pull a double ristreto shot computently. The coffee is too acidic for the almond milk so the milk coagulated due to the lack of pasteurization and overall was so terrible that I wanted to throw up. The "seamless bathroom" experience was nothing of that sort, it was so complicated and stupid that it should be scrapped all together. Get you stuff together guys, you have all the best equipment with the poorest execution I could imagine. Take advantage of you situation and make good coffee, the world needs it.
looooved this place. the pour over i ordered was delicious! the woman working was very kind, & she played great music (& had a beautiful voice). thank you for a great coffee shop experience!

Cool vibes, yummy mocha, oat milk for the lactose free. Good vibes to do work, some tasty pastries, the wifi works, the drinks are hot, the baristas are friendly, and it's got a cool warehouse feel throughout... what else can you look for in a coffee shop? Great spot to meet a friend, schedule a meeting, or jam away on a project.

Really awful coffee, unless you want a latte or something like that don't buy anything. Their coffee tasted like two day old bottom of the pot grounds from 7/11. They didn't have any options for sugar just one that was in an unmarked container. There was no half and half or creamer readily displayed I had to ask for it and it was left out in the paper container for I don't even know how long. I definitely regret spending my money here especially for how unfriendly the staff was.

As a 65-year old, perhaps I'm not hip enough for Sextant. Yesterday I wandered in and ordered a croissant and a latte. The barista handed me a croissant but forgot that a latte was ordered as well, so I paid again. She handed it to me with the comment, "latte to go." I replied that it was "for here," (she didn't ask) but that it was no big deal. When I asked another barista for the bathroom key, she gave me an explanation that I couldn't hear over the grinding of coffee, so I just left.These observations are not major. The coffee was good but it was the attitude that annoyed the heck outta me.  Little interaction, not even an "oops" when she forgot my coffee, and for $10.25 for a small latte and a croissant, it's just not worth it.I won't be back and I'm sure they will do just fine without me as a customer.

Good coffee at a reasonable price. I had half-caf and they had hot decaf ready in a carafe with the full octane freak out of a large brew pot. Nice and strong, hot without burning the lips off your face. Refills are $1.50. Friendly staff.  Some pastries available but they are hit or miss: one end of a raspberry scone was good, the other end was dry and pasty. The ham and cheese croissant had one microslice of meat but cheese was undetectable so it too was very pasty. Echh!  Four stars for the coffee, free wireless and ambiance. Whole beans also sold here.

Great little spot for good coffee! Also several snack options as well Lots of seating and not your typical hipster coffee shop. Just nice and unassuming.Staff is friendly and seem to be a family. Over 25 varieties roasted in house and sold whole bean.I like that all ages are here and some working and some just hanging out.Coffee is delish and refills are 1.50(for a coffee house not bad as some won't even give that option!)
Friendly service and large menu! Lots of variety of tea and coffee, breakfast burritos and sandwiches, fruit, and a lot of baked goods that look delicious. Wish this place could be my regular.
Cute place with delicious coffee. Fairly decent parking.Nice homey spot. Very welcoming and quick.I'll be back next time I'm in town.
This place looks super non-descript but I just ordered an iced latte and it's absolutely delicious--rich, robust and creamy. The perfect afternoon pick-me-up. What a delightful surprise.

Found this place due to a much needed coffee fix!!! The staff were amazing!!! The coffee was phenomenal and the staff made it so much better. I have a bit of a complicated coffee order and joe remembered after the first time!! Went every day for 10 days with exception of one due to power outage. Breakfast sandwich and bagels were good. Wide variety of coffees, teas and various drinks. They also roast their own coffee and sell beans. If your near chestnut street check them out, you won't be disappointed!!
Bad service. $5.50 for a large ice white mocha. The cashier was not so happy with my order. I repeated my order 4 times before she got it written down.
Great coffee / espresso drinks and treats from an independent business owner. Lots of seating indoors and they even have a couple of tables out front.

Visiting from Seattle and decided to stop on in. Coffee was great- nice and smooth with medium acid. Quiet and peaceful. They did mess up my tea order but it was fine all the same. Would be back if local.

Love coming to this spot during the week to get some work done as there is plenty of seating and outlets AND they have a great selection of tea and pastries. The people are nice and the space is clean.

I like this place, even though there's always a line, it goes pretty quick. Tried 2 breakfast burritos and they were okay. I prefer the one with pork.I always order a large iced coffee. First time I was here I told them cream and sugar (not knowing that they only hand you a black iced coffee and you have to do the rest yourself) Coffee is pretty strong tasting, so I have to double up on my cream and sugar.Although, they seem nice here, they seem to cater more to their regulars. Not everyone is treated equal.
Ordered a latte and a chai. Both taste awful. Like the milk was burned or maybe bad water. As a lifelong coffee drinker and former barista, I think they are off their game. Undrinkable.
Good coffee and good variety. Also had their protein puck which was so good but so many calories... oh well!
Good coffee. Affordable local spot. They had a good selection of pastry and other goodies. Located right on chestnut so plenty of people watching to take place.

They roast their coffee here to taste quite burnt, similar to the Starbucks coffee flavor. Their regular drip coffee and their lattes had a horribly bitter and burnt taste and did not reflect quality roasting. Lots of cream and cinnamon had to be added to these drinks to mask the burnt flavor. There are much better ways to roast coffee beans!
Good coffee and a good place to visit in the Marina District - will have to visit again soon.
Love their Madeleine - whether they bake it or not , I do not know. Really high ceilings give it a spacious feeling even when most of the tables are taken. Great reading spot with an European feel.
Very strong coffee, good prices. Lots of breakfast options from sweet things to breakfast burritos and bagels.
Amazing coffee and atmosphere. Can't go wrong with any option on their classic menu! Love the ambiance and old machine in the back.
Decent atmosphere, beautiful hand painted murals in Renaissance/Art nouveau style. Not bad, but very beige. Lots of beige. Standard coffeehouse menu. Nice staff.
Solid Milk Tea!  The robustness of the tea and the creaminess of the milk are pretty spots on. The egg puff is a little on the thick side, I wish they are thinner and lighter, hence minus 1 star!

They weren't super busy around 12:45pm on a Saturday, and I was able to place my order right away. It took less than 5 minutes to get my drink. I decided to try the White Gourd Milk Tea ($4.30 + $0.50 Salted Cheese Foam, yelp.com/user_local_phot…) since it was unique, and it was recommended by other Yelpers. This was definitely a solid recommendation! The drink had great milk flavor with a hint of nuttiness. The 25% sweet was perfect for me, and I would definitely order this again. They have a couple of tables to sit at, and also some counter seating, but this is a pretty small spot. I will definitely be back to give their other drinks a try! Parking was difficult in this area, but metered street parking is available.

Milk tea literally runs through my veins! I can honestly drink it everyday and not feel guilty at all. I'm so glad Little Sweet opened up. It literally landed on one of my top 5 boba places in the Bay Area and it really does deserve to be up there. As you order, you can adjust the sweetness through 25% increments and you can adjust ice levels as well. My absolute favorites from here are the Roasted Oolong Milk Tea and the Tie Kuan Yin Milk Tea. The tea flavors are remarkably pronounced and that's solely what I really look for when I wanna have a good authentic milk tea. And also, the drink ratios of milk and tea are pretty balanced in my opinion. It kinda sucks for me cause I always order the same thing once I think it's good, so I definitely need to explore the rest of their menu as well! In my belief, I bet their other drinks are pretty good as well, and they have a pretty large variety of drinks to select off from the menu; which can range from salted cheese drinks, brown sugar milk tea, and fruity drinks. They also have desserts such as eggettes as well! I will definitely be back again for more visits for sure! Oh, and also, parking can be quite a hassle just because there's mainly meter parking. But you may be lucky if you can find something within the residential neighborhoods as well.

I used to come here all the time, place was one of the best boba places you could go to. But after multiple price increases in a few months span, and a cup size change (less drink now) the quality has gone down and simply isn't as good anymore. For new people I would recommend the white gourd milk tea and okinawa milk tea.

The prices used to be really cheap which is why I'm giving it 5 stars! Its still cheap but it did go up. I give them credit though, for starting off at such a cheap price for quality tea & boba, and prices are still cheap too, atleast for most boba places. I recommend this place especially if you like more natural n "healthy" teas! Btw their teas can run a little bitter though, so keep that in mind if you adjust the sugar levels. I usually get the jasmine green tea and it doesn't disappoint, very refreshing taste. If it wasn't for the price I probably would've just gave it 4 stars though (charging station is a MAJOR plus!!!)

My love for boba has made me do crazy things. I would drive miles and miles for a good boba place or I would pay crazy amount of money for boba. Today I paid the most I ever paid for boba, $6.85 for a tie kuan yin milk tea with boba and egg pudding 75% sweetness and regular ice. I like it a lot, it reminds me of TP tea in Cupertino, they have the same exact flavor. Super creamy and good tea flavor. But I don't know how I feel about paying almost $7 for a cup of boba... the time will eventually come where boba prices be close to $10 and I'm not ready for it.There's very limited metered parking, you can order take out on yelp and park in red zone and run like hell inside and pick it up. That's what I did.

Little Sweet was a stop on my way to dinner. I ordered two drinks - a regular milk tea for my man and a White Gourd Milk tea for me. When I went to order I told the guy taking my order I don't really like sweet drinks so I wanted to go for 25% sweetness for my White Gourd Milk Tea. He said the drink isn't that sweet and told me 50% would be not sweet already, and I hesitated and he said 50% is the best since they basically water it down to tone down the sweetness so it won't be sweet. So I agreed for 50% sweetness with his reassurance.For toppings, I asked about white boba - like was it the type that's crunchy, bouncy from other places like agar boba? He said the difference was that it is cooked vs uncooked and that he would not define any of the boba toppings as crunchy or bouncy. I was thinking...why would I want to eat uncooked boba aka tapioca starch balls!? Turns out it is NOT uncooked boba - so do not be alarmed since he wasn't good at describing...After I ordered and tried it in my drink I can confirm that it is actually the clear agar boba balls that is offered at other places. I tend to prefer it to actual boba since it is less sweet and has a smooth bouncy crunchy texture - hard to describe but that's what I would say. PS: If you don't like sweet drinks - DO NOT ORDER 50% White Gourd Milk Tea - it is waaaay tooo sweet despite his reassurances - tastes like 100% sweetness. White gourd lovers - we knowww that the drink is sweet already - so I can't imagine what actual 100% tastes like. If you decide to come here maybe opt for 25% sweetness if you have tastebuds like me! The other order of milk tea was decent but nothing to write home about. Would I come here again? No. But if you do, I hope you get a more helpful person taking your order.

Pro:Variety of flavorsGood sizeGreat quality of tapioca, chewy and warmEgg waffles also availableThai ice tea boba was delicious, not too sweet. Served it unmixed so I got to mix it all myself which I thought was cool/differentCon:A little pricey Despite cost, I thought the boba was quite good! Recommend drinking this boba while waiting in line for Burma superstar.

Better than boba guys from my perspective. I love the white boba here and their milk oolong drinks are always amazing. I think this place is really underrated and I wish more people would discover this place since its not that far away from golden gate bridge and de young museum.

I thought the place was quite decent - had a lot of options with various toppings. Came around at noon and it wasn't quite as packed as some of the reviews I read claimed to have experienced, so it wasn't a negative aspect of my visit. I did get a bit bored of boba when my friends wanted to come, so I decided to opt for the banana shake instead - which was delicious and the strong scent and taste of banana definitely hit the spot.

I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints !! My go to is their white gourd milk tea (wintermelon) with salted cheese and boba. It's super creamy and the wintermelon flavor doesn't taste watered down like other places. Their brown sugar milk tea is just as good !' I honestly recommend anything on their menu.

Absolutely love this place.  My boss took me here a few days ago and bought me a drink.  I am thinking I want to come here every day before work for a jasmine milk tea.  It's really well made.  They are really popular.  I wish they had an online order for pick up app.  Great business. Boba is taking over!  I used to go to Starbucks but now just boba.

The boba was decent.The 45-minute wait (no joke) for 2 cups of boba with 10 total people in the shop was straight up indecent.Actually, I take back the first thing I said, I ordered both drinks (white gourd and tie kuan yin) with less ice and 25% sugar. One drink was inexplicably much sweeter and had 3x as much ice as the other one.Hard. Pass.

Their drinks are good.  The staff is very friendly.  But the prices are getting way TOO HIGH.  I remember when most drinks were only $4 or $5.  These days, drinks start at $5 and up.  And depending on what toppings you add, you can end paying almost $10 for ONE drink.  YIKES!!!

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME! We waited for 40 min, they forgot to make one of our two drinks and completely made the other one wrong! Everyone in line had a similar experience--drink issues, missing drinks, and waiting 30 + min for boba!!

I am giving Little Sweet 2/5 stars because we waited 25 minutes for our bubble tea after waiting in a slow moving line to order, and it was just ridiculous. We went at 1:30pm on a Sunday for reference. Unless you are prepared to wait that long (which we weren't), I would not recommend coming here - no matter how good the tea is. That being said, the tea, the slushy and the boba were all really good. I also thought the size of the teas for the price were great. The boba tasted fresh and there was almost too much of it which is always my favorite.

We waited 45 min for our one drink and one ice cream.  They then called the number after us and told us they forgot to make our 1 drink and the ice cream was completely melted.  Andddd our friends drinks were wrong. Horrible service, unbelievably slow.
DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME. Waited for 45min for two drinks, then was told that they didn't have the order even though I have the number printed out.
The wait was incredibly long. Waited over 30 minutes (from the time of payment) to get 2 cups just to find out that they didn't even start on it. We couldn't wait longer so had to get a refund.

Longest line I've ever seen and longer wait than boba guys which makes no sense.45 min - This is the longest I've ever waited for boba. I'm still waiting right now but I can't imagine non dairy milk tea to significantly blow things out of the water.--Just got the boba. High mountain tea and white gourd (winter melon) tea at 25% sweet. The high mountain is insanely bitter with very strong tea flavor. I can't even taste the milk in the milk tea. It's non dairy but it tastes like full blown iced tea on steroids. (think Chinese medicine level bitterness) The white gourd is pretty good and I would order it again.  It has a unique flavor and it is creamy. Either way, this is 45 min I'll never get back in my life. Please, please, please hire another person in the back. It shouldn't take this long to make two drinks when most of these items are premade.

It's a bar, restaurant, and cafe! This place has it all. They serve coffee, tea, Japanese desserts, beer on tap (including a matcha IPA from Kyoto), and Japanese curry. I had the black sesame latte, which has no coffee but good black sesame flavor! The second time I went back, I added a shot of espresso for $1. I also got the katsu curry, which was amazing. I think they make it really authentic, tastes like it's from scratch! I enjoyed the atmosphere, they play chillhop which makes it easy to concentrate while studying, and the workers are Japanese provided good service. There are a good amount of tables and outlets and it's pretty spacious for a small cafe. It's clean and aesthetic, I highly recommend!

I thought the curry was just okay. The flavors weren't all there and it was lacking something. Maybe we came on an off day. Cute idea with having it inside of a coffee shop, but if I want quick Japanese curry I'll go to Volcano instead.

Pretty good. There aren't that many tables, but it's nice that the place is spacious. They are open in the morning, and I would say they aren't that busy early in the day. It's a nice place to pull out your laptop and drink some coffee. Now for lunch, I had their curry. My friends ordered curry with add ons. I would say the curry has rich flavor. If you order their regular curry with no add ons, you will only get rice and curry. There aren't any meat in it, so if you want something tender in your curry, you need to order add ons. I would say the curry is mild to hot in spice level. I was a bit surprised that there was only one worker. As the they went on, more and more people showed up. Some came to get curry and some got coffee to go. Seeing how there's a lot of people, I think this place is highly recommended.

First time here and first impression. Very Kool vibe and order the katsu curry with egg. Very tasty. Also order a hojicha latte. Loving this place remind me of Japan. Highly recommend for lunch or first date. They also have beer here.

Great little place. A friend of mine spotted it a little while ago, and we came here to try it. Good, simple, strong curry with tasty toppings that you can add on. They've got a great selection of beers. I'm looking forward to coming back to try more.

I kept walking past this place for the past couple months and I finally had time to stop by for a late lunch. Prices are nice, friendly staff, & quick service. Tasty pork katsu! They have tofu options as well if you're into that. Definitely will be back
I always order the Kinako Latte and Katsu Curry with Omelette. Quiet place to read a book or get work done, there is wifi and outlets.

19.03.00     first visitCurry dish    Good strong curry made from scratch ... I did ask the guy           pork katsu was kinda dry ... which I normally never order this                    thin lean pork cuts fried will always be dry ...                     brined (texture alters)           tofu katsu was okConsidering I have tried quite a few japanese curry dishes           I love curry more in this place           and try the other toppings to make it my FAV dish ... getting close     hmmmm if they have these as topping ...          Chicken Katsu - Pre seasoned dark meat katsu or pan fried          Chunk of salmon poached in the sauce          Tater Tots or Fries for the beer drinkers

Fairly new to inner Richmond, nestled at the corner of 10th and Geary which you cannot miss. They were out of half of their topping options for their Japanese curry which made me hesitate but the outcome was good, keeping it to a minimal with just the scrambled egg option giving my palate more room to enjoy the flavors/spice in the curry sauce. Definitely took me back to the days I lived in Tokyo-- simplicity at its best. The egg was perfectly cooked and the roux was light to medium that did not leave me feeling guilty that I finished everything on my plate. Although next time I would love to try some of their toppings, seeing photos with the katsu, the batter looks light and fluffy-- possibly panko crusted?They also serve craft beers, draft of six and a couple bottled/canned options. Hope to see more Japanese & Japanese style beers to come!
First visit and extremely pleased. I had the scrambled eggs on regular curry but it's really curry omuraisu, or dressed egg. Just excellent flavor, beautiful presentation, mnmmm.....

I realized it was a different business than coffee time only after the sign was changed. I ordered The Katsu pork w scrambled egg (beautifully circled around the rice) which was really good though slightly salty.  The pork portion was smaller but really  good quality and with the rice and egg I was full.  We will definitely be back for a repeat meal.

I came in and knew I wanted a katsu curry. It wasn't too crowded luckily when I came in so I ordered right away. I know other places do curry and it kind of tastes instant, but this one did not taste like an instant curry. I sat down and my katsu curry came to me. It was spicier than I expected, which was alright but not so good for my sensitive stomach. The katsu was crispy and delicious. I was glad that not all the rice was drenched in the curry sauce since I do not like sauce on all of my rice. I do wish there was a little bit more katsu because I definitely had more rice left over to eat. $12 isn't a lot for a meal, especially in SF, but I just wish there was a little more katsu. Other than that, it was a pretty solid katsu curry.
Great Japanese curry and well priced, plus a great little craft beer list. This curry tastes so homemade and thick and way better than volcano curry both in flavor and texture.

I came here for the curry, and was surprised at how good it was. I've eaten at a few curry shops in SF, but this is the only one that actually makes a real Japanese curry that's worth paying restaurant prices.I had the regular curry with the scrambled egg. The egg was absolutely perfect. It was a shame to eat it. I'd love to see his omurice. That's probably be the best in SF.

Tried their matcha latte with almond milk $5.15 which was pretty expensive in my opinion and my latte had only a hint of matcha flavor. I will probably go back to try their curry because I love Japanese curryLooks like they have a lot of toast options

This place didn't quite do it for me... I'm not sure if they have a proper kitchen considering that our curry and matcha cheese cake slice were all served premade / microwaved and not fresh (we saw it and heard the beeps). You can tell the katsu was not fresh either because of how moist and non-crispy the bottom was: evidence of having been refrigerated and thrown into the oven prior to serving. I didn't order the swirled egg on top so can't speak to that, but I just couldn't get over the fact that the food was not made fresh.Utensils were also kind of grimy, so that really sealed the deal...it's a no from me.

Came here with some friends on a weekend. We got: matcha latte, latte, black sesame daifuku, matcha cheesecake, and two toasts. Atmosphere was good, we had a great time talking over some warm drinks and food.2 things that bothered me:- cheesecake slice came out with half of its crust missing. Didn't expect that kind of service here. - the water pitcher tip was crusting from the water buildup. Doesn't look like they clean it. Everything else was fine.The Daifuku sold there is just the 大福 brand unwrapped found in Asian grocery stores. Not freshly made in case anyone is wondering.From other people's reviews, it sounds like a lot of the stuff is not freshly made.Is it called Back Room or... Cutting Corners Cafe?

A unique concept! Back Room is a café, bar, and Japanese curry restaurant all rolled into one. I had a regular-size Japanese curry with (pork) katsu. The curry was served hot (temperature) and mild in a bowl with rice and perfectly cooked katsu on top. Pickled radish on the side, too!

Japanese owned cafe that took over what used to be a coffee shop - they should definitely put clearer signage on the sidewalk or promote the ownership change! I had the curry with katsu, and the hojicha latte. The katsu breading was delicious and the meat cooked well. The curry was flavorful but I would've liked a little self-serve section where I could get more ginger and toppings :)The Hojicha latte was tasty and authentic but I would've liked a stronger tea flavor. The vibe is great, and the owners are very friendly. Will be coming back!

Walked into this place ready to love it, but have to admit it was just okay.The Hojicha latte was so weak, and to my surprise, unsweetened.A big plus on the katsu curry was the light, crispy batter on the katsu. The pork was a little fatty between the crispy coat and meat. The portion is a little smaller than most places but it was enough food for me and at $11 (regular curry + katsu), it is a little cheaper than other places as well. The curry was not bad, it reminded me of curry from Tani's Kitchen but it was less savory than Tani's.

Walking in, we had no issues with the service. We were seated right away and the restaurant was about a little more than half-filled. It is a bit cramped inside, but not uncomfortable. Since the restaurant is small and gets pretty busy, I would say catch the waiters when you can. There was always one by the front and one making the rounds up and down. We came to try out the crepe cakes and bingsoo. 1)  The Pandan Crepe Cake-  The taste was a little disappointing. If you're a texture person, a bite through the layers of crepes and creme was pretty satisfying. But overall, you were hit with the same taste you'd typically get with any pandan pastry. Not mind-blowing, but not bad either.2) Volcano Bingsoo- Definitely for the gram. The dessert comes to you steaming and eventually fizzles out, so record it once you see it on the way to your table. As for the taste, I probably should've asked for more condensed milk, but the shaved ice is definitely top tier. It was all my favorite flavors textures, chocolate/corn flakes/condensed milk, etc. so my opinion on this dessert is bias if you're looking for something more on the "what makes it different" side. All in all, if you're looking for a place for the gram, this is definitely 5 stars. My standards aren't too high for a dessert, so taste-level, this might be disappointing to some people. But I would definitely comeback, overall, a solid restaurant.

The host's lack of customer service skills completely ruined our experience here.It was our first time here. We were so excited that there wasn't a line. We waited at the sign that said something like "please wait to be seated." There were lots of empty tables and the host did not greet us, or even look at us, and was just on his phone. We waited and nothing happened. So I went up to the host and asked if we were supposed to seat ourselves, and he was very rude, giving off attitude, and told me to wait in line. Uhh I was already in line and he didn't do anything. I'm really annoyed but whatever, I get back in line.  After a bit, he comes over and asks if we had a reservation. We didn't, so he said we'd have to wait. Then after a minute he ends up seating us anyways. It definitely soured our experience here, which is pretty disappointing because the person who took our order and delivered our dessert was sooo nice, and the bingsoo was pretty good too. Another thing that could have been improved - We didn't get waters until about halfway through our dessert and also didn't get refills until we were paying.The menu items are on the pricey end, but it does taste and look good. Very aesthetic for those Instagram pics.Mightttt come back but not super interested if that's how customers get treated. I'd rather go to Mandro for bingsoo.

Love the Thai tea bread box, and service is always great. The bannoffee pie was *not* good though. Many confusing flavors that weren't incorporated well together, as well as an overbearing hojicha flavor. Cheese tea is worth a try for fun.

I have been to U:Dessert Story a handful of times because there's always someone wanting to go! My experiences at Dessert Story have ranged from disappointing to great. What I love most about Dessert Story is how cute everything is and how visually appealing each dish is. One of the complaints that I have was that I came here on a Saturday afternoon and they were almost out of everything.Some of the items that I have had:-Mango sticky rice bingsoo (4 out of 5): love the presentation. The mango tasted quite fresh!-Igloos Kakigori (3.5 out of 5): snow ice on fire! It's good but not as good at the mango bingsoo-Volcano Bingsoo (3 out of 5): disappointing- wasn't much dry ice when it arrived at our table. The bingsoo overall was meh-Warabimochi (2.5 out of 5): we ordered this when we were told everything else was pretty much sold out. I was excited for this dish because I love Mochi and matcha. This dish is visually appealing, but didn't taste so great. We were struggling to finish this.
The tables were far too close to each other meaning too many people were crammed into the store. So it got too loud very quickly. The dessert was good but I feel it's too expensive for what you get.

The IG hype was real. I was really excited to try this place out after seeing it so much on social media. When I arrived, I didn't know it was a restaurant type business. I thought it was like one of restaurants where you walk up to the register order then sit down. We came in and they asked if we had a reservation and I was like reservation? We didn't but they were able to find a table for 3 right by the door so I guess we were lucky. The menu is great but there's pictures of the desserts so you know what to expect. We ended up getting:[1] Coconut Pandan Crepe Cake ($12.75) - This was okay, I think I would have rather had the waffle version. The flavor is light and not as strong as I expected. Not enough pandan and plenty of coconut. [2] Igloos Kakigori ($14) - I was more excited about the marshmallow fluff on fire than actually eating it. The fire was a bit anti-climatic for me. Thought it would last longer. Inside the mountain was the flavorless ice which is why the wooden cups of a kiwi syrup and condense milk was needed. Eat the top and start pour down the center to get flavor. We didn't know it but at the bottom of the bowl there was popping boba that was pretty good. Definitely a fun gimmick that I probably won't be getting again. Overall the experience was fun but in terms of dessert quality I thought it was just in the okay range. I think I will have to try the thai tea crepe cake and the matcha lava cake that everyone raves about. Will definitely be back again!TIP: Make a reservation through the Yelp app! We definitely got lucky with seating but I'm not going to expect that next time.

I've always been seated right away even when I'm with a group of people, the place is pretty clean, the staff is way friendly, cute little place, and haven't yet tried something from here I didn't like.

Worth the hype!! After seeing so many yummy post and ppl raving about this place I made this a priority reservation for my next trip to the city.  Since I had a bigger party (5 ppl) I made reservations, but we did go at an off time during the weekend, (around 3PM) and had no wait.Located right next to the infamous (& also yummy) Kitchen Story - this place looked really tiny, but was actually long in layout and pretty spacious. Really cute casual decor with a Farmhouse vibe, and service was quick/nice/efficient overall. Of course, I already did my yelp research ahead of time & knew what sweets to order - but pretty much all the desserts looked tasty & had an asian influence in flavahhh + modern plating/decor...which were both beautiful and unique. Let's Dig In:(1) Matcha Molten Chocolate Lava Cake - FN amazing!!! Beautifully warm and chocolatey cake with perfect gooey texture + filled with a tasty strong matcha lava. Soooo yummyyy!!(2) Boba Thai Tea Bingsoo - good but a tad bit too sweet, shaved ice had good texture, Thai tea flavor was strong, boba had a nice chew. Good bingsoo overall. (3) Mochi Garlic Toast - this was shockingly one of my fave things here. The bread was perfectly toasted and lightly garlic flavored which (SOMEHOW) went amazingly well with the sweet nutty mochi flavor - pretty much perfect blend of sweet and savory.(4) Young Coconut Pandan Crepe Cake - not the best crepe cake, but still really freakin good. Flavors were amazing and perfectly light in pandan flavor + also loved the coconut toppings and side of coconut cream. The texture of the crepe itself was a little too soft compared to others I've had, but flavors made up for it.(5) Matcha Latte - tasty! Lightly sweet, creamy, and super strong in green tea flavahhh - just the way I like it!(6) Hojicha Latte - lightly roasted flavah and a lil more milky than the matcha latte (which isn't my preference) - but still good.(7) Cafe Latte - okkkk overall, coffee itself was pretty light with a lot of milk, not sweet at all since you can add sugar yourself. Could do without this next time.

This is a little small desert place with alot of lovely desert selection. Their most popular one is the sticky rice mango. They have an option  for small or large. The small was a perfect size to share after dinner. The shaved ice is so finely milled that just melts in your mouth. They have a layer of mango sauce in between the shaved ice. And they also have mago on the side of the shaved ice and then sprinkled with nuts/seeds. I would love to go back to try their valcano desert which comes with Oreo, corn flames, chocolate  and something else. But it lost amazing with the dry ice coming out if the center like a real volcano. They look small once you walk in tbe, but they have a big seating in the back. You can also reserve seating for a big party.

What a gem, I am totally bringing friends here next time they come to town. Line was long but we finished everything .  Highly recommend the mango sticky rice bingsoo and kiwi kakigori. The pandan crepe cake was alright not as pandan flavoured as we expected.

My second time back was even better than the amazing first time. I've decided that it is in my best interest to try every single item on the menu.Needless to say, I will be back... again and again andagain
This is a critique. I hate this restaurant. I got a sickness when I went here. Poor staff and food quality.

One of my favorite dessert spots in SF! The asian desserts they serve here are a mash of Thai, korean, and Japanese influences. Everything they serve here is instagram friendly - and a lot of times those ig desert places lack in taste, but not here! The desserts are GOOD! Thai tea layered cake: not the best. The crepe tasted too well done and hard as opposed to soft and spongy. But the Thai tea sauce was greatKiwi kakigori: this is a Japanese style shaved ice - similar to the kind you get from Hawaii where they shave ice very finely. The kiwi flavor is really good and comes with lemon if you want it to be more sourMango sticky rice bingsu: the creamy korean shaved ice but with a Thai twist! This is a safe item to order if you don't want to try any of their other more unique offerings. Tastes really good!. It comes with a small dollop of green sticky rice.

This is an Asian themed dessert spot right next to Kitchen Story. A lot of their foods fall under that "instagram aesthetic", so you get a lot of young people here taking pictures - but the food itself is also pretty good!Through my visits I've ordered:Thai Tea Crepe CakeMango Sticky Rice ToastSoft Bread with Pandan FondueMango Sticky Rice BingsuThai Tea Crepe Cake:Out of everything I think this is the least worth it. The flavors don't stand out much at all and it's also an extremely small portion to pay $12 for. Not really memorable - I would skip this.Mango Sticky Rice Toast:Very filling because of all the bread and has the same sides as the bingsu. If you want a carby, warmer alternative to the binsu, you could get this. The inside bread squares are very tasty and buttery, but the outside of the brick toast is harder and cracker-like - typical of brick toast.Soft Bread with Pandan Fondue:If you don't like eating the outside crust of brick toast, but want the soft inside this is perfect for you. It's squares of the bread, prepared similarly to brick toast, dipped in a sweet Pandan or Thai Tea (pick one) fondue. We got the pandan and it was very tasty, but also super heavy/filling and definitely something you need to share among multiple people. Mango Sticky Rice Bingsu:My favorite out of everything I've tried so far. The mango sauce + condensed milk drizzled on top are the perfect topping to the super soft shaved ice. The softest and most even texture I've had for bingsu - beats out what I've had in Koreatown in LA by far. I also love that they have little pots of nuts and sticky rice to pair it with.I'm often visiting Dessert Story after a filling meal, but always find myself able to make room for dessert here. Looking forward to my next visit to try out more of the menu!

Most unique desserts I've seen. Ordered chocolate brownie volcano and it was yummy and big enough for two. Not overpoweringly sweet but just right. The ice cream inside is more like shaved cream crystals. Comes with some banana, brownie bites, a sweet syrup and Frosted Flakes for sweetness. Topped with whip and chocolate powder. Very small dining area so make a reservation if you can. However, the line moves quickly. Tables are extremely tight together, so it's an adventure getting your body through the 10" gap between tables All in all a pleasant experience. I would highly recommend this place for something sweet.
We came early just after 5pm and a good thing at that, a lined quickly formed.  Really thought out dessert dishes were fantastic! Ambience was nice, I would definitely recommend!
I love the amazing desserts, EVEn if it makes me feel sick from the mass amounts of sugar I consumed!!
I love the coconut crepes cake here! It's supper good especially the coconut sauce that goes with the crepes cake! I hope San Jose will have this desert place where I can go to all the time.

Nice environment with exotic looking creations. Clean feel to it but not enough ventilation going on in the inside. The lighting is a little bright. The workers there are really nice people. There were definitely smiles going on in the kitchen and that for me put me at ease cuz then I know there is Love in the environment.

Definitely a place for the gram or any social media site. We tried the Thai tea crepe cake which I thought was not worth the price. It felt like eating thin pancake layers with whip cream in between. The bingso however was fantastic! We got the volcano one and the aesthetics were on point along with the flavor!!
The nicest shopOwner ever, understanding and personal. If I lived here, I would stop by every day. Vegan options and the coffee is also great! So happy we stopped by.

Cute little cafe with really good coffee and Brazilian cheese popups.Very nice atmosphere inside here inside and out.On a sunny day, I like sitting outside on the peaceful corner.The cheese pop-ups, which I had never had before, are light and tasty.The best thing is that you get one free with a cup of coffee!  And the coffee is very good.I recommend it!

Yummy!  Ordered from this spot & had it in my hand super fast. The sandwiches are delicious though I preferred the tomato and basil. Hard to find gluten free sandwiches and even harder to find these tasty Brazilian sandwiches. Next time I'll pop in and gave them there.
The sandwich pop ups were delicious as well as the mushroom Gorgonzola empanada. Great neighborhood spot!

Saltroot is my favorite go to place if I want Pao De Quejo! They make it fresh if I order for pick up. The bread is so fluffy, soft and chewy unlike the other places that put more flour. The cafe also makes Argentina empanadas and they have vegan option. I definitely recommend Saltroot Cafe!

Can't say enough good things about this place.I usually buy 4-6 bags of the frozen Pao de queijo at a time. They're perfect to make into little sandwiches or bring to parties and super tasty.The coffee is good and the atmosphere inside the cafe is warm and cozy.

Such a cute little place and they do one thing really well -- cheese puffs. We love the original and the guava flavors. I especially appreciate the frozen puffs you can make at home. Gluten-free to boot. Great addition to the neighborhood!
A must go for every gluten free person!! Their pop ups are really yummy. You can eat them there or take them home frozen , bake and enjoy whenever you want.
Nice small coffee place with great service   The cheese Popups are great. Loved the Guava popup
Lovely little cafe. Great service good tea and coffee and the pop ups are to die for.  A wonderful place to get your coffee fix in a nice homely environment
Great service a nice little cafe! I got a drip coffee and it came with a free cheese popup! I choose the guava flavor which was soft, fruity, cheesy and sweet!

Love the Brazilian pao cheese popovers in flavors including classic parmesean and unusual guava jam...and that they also sell them packaged and frozen in other flavors such as gorgonzola, onion & parsley and potato & mustard. I will definitely try the other flavors.

I absolutely LOVE this place. It is so cute inside and the vibe is so relaxing. I tried both juices from here and loved them both! The empanadas are amazing the the cheese puffs are addicting! The staff was so lovely and there is nothing bad that I could say about it here. I can't wait to be back and try more food!

This place is amazing and a cute little cafe with great ambience and the owners of this place is real good people. Firstly, I have to say they have free WiFi and comfortable place to work and study with enjoyable music. O man, today is the second day I came back to this cafe and had to order the same thing again because yesterday I fell in love with their fresh made vegetable  juice. It's a recipe the owner learned that uses fresh ingredients to help our body, mind, and soul. So delicious as well! I had there latte as well which is really good and the best part is that it comes with a cheese pop up. Yum yum yum I also had their mushroom Gorgonzola empanada. I love mushrooms and the ingredients in the empanada is so flavorful. Lastly, I had good conversation with the owner here and she is very pleasant to talk to and very sweet. She even volunteers in India .... isn't that wonderful? Love love love

Cute little cafe on the corner filled with succulents!They got limited but good food options on the menu with some coffees and teas. Noticed they serve Intelligentsia coffee here. And you get a cheese pop free with a hot drink!I got the classic parmesan cheese pop (pao de queijo) with my coffee. It is not your traditional cheesy bread pop. It is made with cassava. The place also makes sliders out of the cheese pops. The empanadas section was quite interesting too. Good food overall and great service.

Brazilian cheese bread comes with every hot drink?! Sign me up!So good. Cute little find. Worth it to stop in and check it out. Not a huge variety but its a cute, quick stop. Plus, who else has brazilian cheese bread?
Love this place, great neighborhood feel in outer Richmond. Small plates, coffee and cheese popups are delicious.

Wonderful to have Saltroot open in the neighborhood. I tried their  Brazilan cheese pop ups and they are delicious warm out of their oven!  Even better yet, you can buy the frozen pop ups and bring the home to bake for parties.  There are five varieties (Parmesan, Guava, Gorgonzola, Parsley and Onion and Potato Mustard).  My favorite is the Parmesan!
Great coffee and amazing empanadas and cheese puffs. They also have sweets and juices I just haven't tried them yet.Perfect local cafe for a quick coffee or snack.

Just found this little spot on Yelp, and I'm in love! It has such a cozy feel and great for study dates. The coffee is just right (not too bitter like some places) and the CHEESE POPUPS are amazing! Such flavor packed in to these delicate little pastries. I've never had anything like it and will be coming back!
So sad they no longer have the iced white mocha  but still love them! Still buy their coffee in Safeway to make at home and it's just as good just black!

Very lucky to have Henry's house of coffee as my neighborhood coffee shop. That outside bench that get sunny at the perfect time everyday (almost everyday, it s the sunset after all) is my happy place. Staff is always friendly.  And their ground coffee selection is great.

Great price, quick and an amazing cup of coffee. I've tried the drip and an iced almond milk latte. The inside is very clean and looks like a cute place to study. I haven't tried the food but it looks very fresh

Don't have a whole lot to say, but I enjoyed my coffee. I've had better, but it was still solid. I think they roast it in house which is pretty cool. Smallish, but still a number of tables. Friendly feel. Not busy mid day on a weekday.They do have some food, but I didn't try any....

I honestly don't understand how this place gets such great reviews. Just went and had a mediocre cappuccino (at best) and the driest bagel. They have no fresh produce to put on the bagel which is questionable. My husband had the drip coffee and he threw it out after a few sips and we went down the street to Chalos for some Sightglass to salvage the morning. All in all, don't waste your money or time. This place is not good.

I am a very very picky coffee drinker. I'm a borderline coffee snob. I love Henry's place.The coffee here is always hot and tasty as heck. They roast on site so you know the quality and the freshness is top-notch. I can't say enough about the staff that work here. I am very demanding on service, and the staff here never lets me down. I love that it's locally owned and managed. You owe it to come by and get some brew at this place if you are on the west side.

Henry's is a lovely low key excellent coffee house. I arrived with my family last night from NYC and woke early which is my habit    Yelp sent me here as it is a five minute walk from my b&b.  Great great coffee.  And a very nice wait staff. As the locals came in the words were few as each persons desired morning caffeine fix was already known and being prepared. Just lovely

Coffee is absolutely delicious. A small but cute neighborhood shop.Only suggestion is if they close at 6pm, please don't start cleaning up at 5pm and turn off the oven. Late cup of coffee goes well with a warm pastry and more than once, did a customer come in asking for something warm with their coffee.

I bought my first nice coffee maker here,- a Bodum automatic vacuum-press. Henry is a very knowledgable resource for all kinds of questions pertaining to coffee, especially roasting. They sell an impressive array of coffee makers, Burr grinders, pour-over supplies, etc. I had the pleasure of Claudia recommending the Bella Finca which is an excellent dark roast for someone who doesn't particularly care for dark roasts. The staff (Claudia and Kate) are knowledgable, personable and helpful.

Very clean esthetic beautiful with a great selection of pastries, snacks and sandwiches. Very cozy European design. Perfectly made coffee and very friendly team. Love to go there. Love the Armenian food coffee and culture
Super disappointing! I ordered a cold brew and it tasted so watery! Was not good coffee at all. Yelp has misled me again. Such a waste of money. You can get better coffee anywhere else.

I try to come here once a week for coffee and their breakfast burrito! Super fast service. They know you're in a rush in the morning. They get you in and out quick! I appreciate that! Oh and I appreciate that they have a small bench for people like me who are waiting for their order. It's the small things that count ;)
One of my favorite places for morning coffee. This place opens at 6am which is really nice. The coffee is very good and morning burrito just amazing. Personnel is always friendly.

My friend had told me that this place had really good chai so I came to try. I got: -Chai latte: While the chai was flavorful, it was too sweet for me - that the first thing I tasted was the cane sugar and then the chai. -Croissant: ehh, very buttery and flakey but didn't really have a body.-Pour over: YES get the pour-over. I hear the Bella is really good and the barista told me that his favorite was the Conquistador. I ended up getting the Thailand which was described as nutty and smooth. For me, it wasn't so nutty, but indeed very smooth with a subtle citrus tone and chocolate finish.

Lovely coffee, lovely people. I've tried their regular house coffee, their iced coffee, their cold brew, and their kona. All great blends and well-brewed. They also have a small but good selection of food. I'm personally fond of their breakfast burrito (make sure to ask for it cut in half since it is really huge). All in all, a nice place to sit and do some work or catch up on reading. Not a lot of seating though, so you will likely have to share your table if you come by yourself. Nice crowd though, so I'm happy to share my space with others here. :)
Quality brewed coffee and almond croissant and for sure the rest of the pastries here! Im coming back again!

Making a pit stop at Henry's house of coffee on my Moms 60th birthday was such a great choice! Coffee and espresso was delicious! To top it off, the owners were kind enough to give us a tour and brief explanation of their roasting process!

It's a small coffee place and a Roastery. Saw that many people came drink coffee and buy beans. They have a simple menu with the very basic coffee. Asked for a Gilbrator or a Cortado which is not on the menu and the barista is willing to make for us. Finally ordered a small size cortado and a small size cappuccino with whole milk. Coffee taste is not strong enough with very little after-taste and the cappuccino is too hot, which is not very right. Cortado is better than the Cappuccino. Good that their coffee comes at different sizes (S, M and L). This is good and can fit the preference of different people! It's a small coffee place with only a few tables. Be prepared to share the table with others. It can be a chance to meet new people for some small talks.

Made a stop just to try their coffee and buy some to go while visiting from Los Angeles. I have been fallowing them on IG for a while and made a promise to myself to stop by when in the area. Finally I got to Stop by last weekend right before going to the Golden Gate Park for a walk. I tried the cappuccino and loved it. Delicious coffee and danishes. Everything we got was good and fresh. I noticed a lot of locals coming in for to go coffee and hanging out at the shop for conversations. Loved the atmosphere. Friendly staff and neighborhood. I'm glad we stopped by.  I have ordered the Armenian coffee online few times before and it tastes amazing. Fresh, finely grinded delicious coffee roast.  Perfect to make a good cup of Armenian co

Literally come in at least two or three times a week because I live a block away from this joint. The staff here is incredibly nice and the coffee is great. It's a great study spot too; they have outlets. There aren't that many tables but then again, the place is small. The owner himself is such a sweet man who talks to everyone. They have a coffee roaster and you can see all the beans that go in there. If you guys didn't know, they have a monthly subscription that you can buy. They'll send you two or three pounds of coffees every month and each pound is hand selected by the owner himself. The workers are so nice, too. I saw one of them helping an old lady out of the store :) Kudos to you guys! Thanks for being great.
I love Andytown and will drive out of my way just for their Matcha Plover. This location is nice, less of a wait than the Lawton location AND they have an outdoor space which is a nice bonus.

I love Andytown so much! Pro tip that this locations allows you to skip the big lines of the Lawton one. Also great outdoor space.Highlights:- The coffee quality is great - when I come by, I be sure to buy a bag to bring home. - Also like that they have Oatly or Califia - not sure which but definitely a high quality oat milk. - And I love the corn muffin, especially the savory one, and their chocolate chip and peanut bitter cookies. (I don't like the gluten free double chocolate mini muffin though - find it pretty dry.) - Very importantly, I also love the friendly staff - so different than the "too cool" vibes at Trouble.

Went here with my family for coffee/tea.  It's a small place without indoor seating except a small wood shelf/bench.  There is some limited outside seating-a wood bench in a U shape with a few small round attached tables.  They do have a restroom.  They offer mainly coffee and tea drinks and some pastry like scones etc.  One drink is a plover that is flavored and much like an Italian cream soda.  One of us had the huckleberry-flavors change.  I had the real ginger tea that had slices of ginger in it and I really liked it.  It helped to let it sit for awhile to really pick up the ginger taste which I happen to love.  It was a nice place for a short stop.
Yummmmmm. Cool little spot. I love the coffee and bread. Worth the drive out of the city and worth the time to hang by the ocean in sunset.

This was our first time at this coffee shop, and we really liked it. We got a hot chocolate with fresh whipped cream on top and a Snowy Plover; both were REALLY good. The employees are also nice and fun. We really liked the back patio seating.

Love this place.  Serves very good strong coffee. Staffs very friendly. They roasted their beans in house. East street parking. Very cozy atmosphere. Tried their latte first time. Will try their other drinks next time with the soda water!

Andytown is my go-to for espresso, it's always super good! They also usually have good and inventive pastries for a little bit of sweetness with your coffee.They also make interesting coffee cocktails (without alcohol) with sparkling water and whipped cream if you're looking for something special.

I just want to let all SF coffee lovers know about this little gem on Taraval near The Great Highway. I made my way out to the Sunset, after hearing great things about their coffee. It is a bright, cozy & cute space...with an outdoor area with seating in the back. First of all, the 5 stars are definitely for the awesome barista named Emily (just look for the blue hair)! If she crafts your coffee, you are in for a treat. I got the mocha with almond milk...o-m-geeeee...it was so on point...delicious, creamy & dark chocolate-y without being too sweet. Emily chatted to me while she was making it & really listened to how I liked my drink. Thank you, Emily, for making one of the best mochas I've ever had, my cute lil heart design and, well, just making the whole experience great. It would be awesome if they could add oat milk & a few vegan baked goods!  In the city, it is easy to be a coffee snob, with so many great choices...and this is one of them!

Came here on a Saturday morning and there was a line out the door. The line moves at an okay pace, but gosh the lattes are good! I highly recommend stopping by this place to grab a latte before you go to ocean beach or lands end! Patio area shields you from the ocean winds.

An employee like girl eating ramen at the front entrance of the coffee shop? I was greeted by this strong instant ramen smell. I guess big no no for that? I wish to smell coffee, not ramen?!? The vibe here also can't compare with the one on Lawton. It's just dead and the barista giving a not want to be here that kind of energy. I had their pour over, at least the coffee is decent. I then discovered avenue which is just across the street, they serve verve (not my favorite) and the vibe is much better.

I love andytown - the coffee, corn muffins (apparently gluten free), and the baristas. I was hesitant on getting the limited Philippines coffee blend, and the barista offered to make me a cup from the bag if I purchased it. Never tasted kalamansi notes in coffee before, not bad!5 stars for customer service, corn muffins, and ocean vibes.
Always a consistent cup of delicious coffee!  Baked goods daily are always tasty.  Highly recommended,

Enamored by their Snowy Plover on Sunset's rare warmer days, though today, strolling through the clean and simple facade, freezing at my core, warmed by the friendly baristas and a double shot of espresso, diluted with a perfect glass of spark water while tuning into the mood-setting lo-fi jams. A perfect beginning to SF's winter time. A-Town always held its place in my Top 3 coffee shops of all time.

First time to Andytown. The layout and staff is very guest friendly. Grab a coffee or specialty, sit down and relax. Ordered a Cafe Au Lait, good tasting house blended coffee, not strong but just enough flavor to burst through the milk.  Located in Sunset District (near Ocean Beach) by Golden Gate Park, it's a great place to pick up a hot beverage and head out to the beach.Happy Cafe and Fight On!
Love this coffee spot! The peeps that work here are amazingly friendly! Great for sunny afternoons- grab your favorite coffee here, bring a book and enjoy their outside patio!

As mentioned before, my housemate and fiancé purchased many items from here in the past but only recently had I actually ventured in and got some things. Staff are so sweet and helpful. I usually make my way here after a few mile walk and get one of their almond latte's with the brown sugar simple syrup which is very tasty and not too sweet. I still love their apple and sausage corn muffin. One of the few muffins I can still enjoy lol. Glad it's an easy pick up close to home. Gonna miss this place when I move next year. Prices are fair and I always tip. They have dog treats that for some reason my housemates dog can't stand (she's picky and SPOILED) but it's cool they have them. Totally worth checking them out if you're close by. It's nice to have something other than a bar in the neighborhood. I'm kind of annoyed at the choices for morning and afternoon fare in this area. I just wish they had more offerings. I think they'd do really great offering a simple breakfast sandwich and small lunch options since they are open as late as they are. Brownies only take me so far in life LOL

Great customer service and awesome coffee! I got the snowy plover...definitely interesting but very delicious! The homemade whipped cream is incredible and blends the drink together perfectly! Definitely will be a regular spot for me!

We had a group of 7 adults and two toddlers under the age of 2 yrs old this morning. The staff was just so friendly, so accomodating especially with my "high maintenance" order of almond milk latte with no foam, two teaspoons of simple syrup & extra hot. I'm a vegan:-) Several people got the Irish soda bread, and they absolutely loved it. Great atmosphere, awesome courtyard in the back with plenty of sunshine.
excellent coffee that is absolutely worth the long wait! great quality coffee but do note that the location is very busy so a bit inconvenient if you're in rush.

Checked this place out on my first visit to SF. Super friendly staff, great ambiance, and a good cup of joe. Tried the seasonal special minty mocha. It has a nice taste and all the flavors were pretty balanced.

Tips: $5 minimum on card Tips: all pastries (other than the oat bar) is $1 after 4 PM. Medium Chai Latte ($4 for to-go / $4.34 if it's for here). Not too sweet. Medium is a good size! Pretty mellow. At first I thought it tasted watered down, but I might just been use to the sweeter ones elsewhere. The more you drink the better it gets. Raspberry Peach Scone. Not as flavorful. Not too sweet so that's good. Seatings: 7 double seatings indoor and 4 outdoor seatings. Sunday around noon -- quite busy. All seats are taken. If you're okay with waiting around then you might catch some tables when folx are leaving. Menu: good options for bagels and pastries and drinks.

Great/pricey raspberry almond bar for $3 and an affordable large iced coffee for $3. Credit minimum is $5. Local spot and would come back if really really need ice coffee. Near and convenient to the N line.

Love the atmosphere here! I have been wanting to check out this coffee shop for a while now, and finally had the pleasure to check the Beanery out this past weekend. We came on a Sunday afternoon, and it wasn't too crowded. I ordered a Chai latte, which tasted like heaven. I will say, this place is super cozy, and has a few places to sit, and is a nice place to get work done. The ladies working behind the counter on this day were super welcoming and nice. I will definitely be checking out this spot more often!!

Average coffee shop. They don't specialize in anything fancy or over the top. They have your typical coffee and beans. Nice little shop not much seating and compact. Service was okay. They didn't sound or look happy to be there. Pricey place too.

Ordered two almond milk cappuccinos and a chai latte. Their cappuccinos were fine but the chai latte was way too sweet. Wish they had more types of cream cheese but their onion bagel was fine. Wasn't toasted much. Service was a bit gruff but at least they were efficient. Appreciate that they were open on New Year's morning.

Came on a quiet Sunday with my girlfriend. Not too crowded, enough seating, reliable WiFi, clean restroom, chill ambiance. The iced coffee and cappuccino was comparable to most cafes. Great for work/study sessions as long as you have good battery life. No outlets. Keep in mind that they also have a rule to take phone calls outside.
This cute coffee shop was filled with locals, so you know it has to be good. My latte was tasty and strong and the bagel was fresh and filling.

Great coffee and amazing service! I got my typical almond milk latte and it was served just how I love it -- super fast, smooth, and with the perfect amount of foam. Many thanks to Ron, who took the effort to make conversation, putting a smile on my face and everyone else's. He even walked over to me to offer me the wifi password, seeing that I took out my laptop (outside!). Super considerate and super good vibes.Beautiful environment with outdoor seating. Good place to go if you can work with the usual urban background noise, as it's right next to a lot of transit. Thanks Beanery and thanks Ron for a lovely afternoon!
a top of the line cafe with coffee drinks, food, ambiance and friendly personal customer service. a rare thing to have the person remember you even when you are a daily customer.
Awesome coffee and bagel choices. Honestly one of the best coffees I've had. Location is great. And service is friendly and fast. Prices are also pretty good! :)
Happened upon this place by accident. Nice atmosphere but busy. Coffee is good. Service very good.

Super good and simple coffee shop! There's not as much seating in the morning, but after around 12pm there are more open tables. Good coffee, they have a lot of different roasts you can buy. The drinks also seem a little bit cheaper (cold brew was only $2.50). They have a ton of tea options too. Service is SUPER quick, i always get my drinks immediately. The space inside is a little cramped, the tables are kind of close to each other. The only downside is that there are no outlets to plug in anything, but there's free wifi! Sometimes people smoke right outside and the smoke kind of blows inside. But overall it's a very quiet and calm coffee shop! Really nice to get work done/ read at!

I've become a semi regular here. The coffee is good as the roast the beans on site an if you get the house coffee, $2.25-2.75, not crazy expensive.  Combine it with a pastry & you can sit & read the paper (some people still read news papers) for under $6.  (Credit cards - with Apple Pay - accepted above $5). Good WiFi, friendly staff and good coffee.  Works for me.

Quick Summary:- Recommend the Cafe Au Lait because one gets to personalize their coffee (you will see what I mean once you visit)- Unique coffee ordering experience- Cute decoration (the train caught my eye)- The aroma of roasted coffee beans is spectacular- We came at a right time, but a line grew while we were drinking coffee- More of a grab and go coffee place because of limited seating spaceWe were lured into the cafe by the cute coffee bean roasting train near the cafe entrance. Since we were looking for a place to sit down and drink some coffee, we decided to try here. I was first surprised and confused at the four different coffee dispensers at the area, where there are sugar and creams, and I later realized why. I ordered the cafe au lait and when the received my order, it was a cup filled with foamy milk. I probably looked dumbfounded because the cashier gestured and told me to pour coffee from the coffee dispensers. There were four different types (one being decaf), and I selected the darkest roast. The coffee was SO GOOD! My favorite type of coffee is the taste where it has no sour and bitter notes. The french roast didn't include any of these, and after I took a sip, it left a lingering toasty aftertaste. Even my relative, who can't drink coffee because they don't like the bitter taste, was able to drink a share. I was even tempted to purchase a bag of coffee beans, but that will be for the next visit.

I just had a tea with some steamed soy milk. Great, yeah it's just tea. This review is for the sweetest girl/lady (long dark blonde ponytail fair skin I'm so sorry I didn't ask your name!) who was super friendly when I walked in. I was meeting a friend at the park, and I never come to this side of the city. My phone was dead and I needed to get to bart. I wanted to walk, and instead of being dismissive of the hour walk, she kindly gave me directions and also let me charge my phone. I can tell she really cares about her customers and is not one of those coffee shops who are only sweet to the regulars. Being someone in customer service, I always appreciate people like her. If I lived in the neighborhood I'm sure this would be my spot. Thanks again, and ps- I made it to bart and you're right it was a beautiful walk!

This is still a good time to meet a friend and have a chat. It is possible that the quality of the coffee has slipped just a bit. I missed the owner smoking his pipe in the doorway and hope he is alright, assuming he is still the owner.
Super cozy and sweet place. Coffee is amazing. The hot chocolate is great too. Will come back some time.
Hands down, best coffee in the Bay Area.
They don't take cards if you're just buying a coffee drink for yourself.  The WiFi is also super unreliable. Pretty inconvenient.

Great place to hang! Coffee roasting right in front of you, smells great. Staff is very friendly, and it's clean and comfortable. There is a parking lot across the street. Nice selection of teas, pastries and bagels, and oh yay, those chocolate chip cookies :)

The have pour over coffee!! Mitchell's ice cream with limited flavors and the sitting areas whether It be inside or outside is a must. It's so chill.
