The scone platter was a great accompaniment to the tea. There were three big scones topped with oats and with dried cherries baked into them. The platter came with 4 different toppings including a smooth butter, strawberry jam, blueberry jam, and cherry jam. The jams all brought a lot of sweetness and there were chunks of fruit to be found in each.Samovar is more than just a traditional tea shop as there were a lot of matcha variations which are very in right now, as well as some milk teas. They even have a full page of alcoholic beverages. The prices of the food were a little high but overall worth it for the experience.
Loved ambiance and light atmosphere! Delicious salmon and lovely tea service. Perfect respite close to Moscone Center and SF MOMA

Came here with my fiancé. I am fasting for Ramadan so I can't eat or drink. She's not fasting today. They didn't allow us to sit at one of their many empty tables because they require one drink per customer. I understand if the place is full but when it's half empty that's frankly that's bullshit.

Love the atmosphere, especially sitting outside on a beautiful sunny day with music playing from the concert. Very dog friendly, staff was helpful with choosing something for my daughter to drink. That to me says their knowledgeable with what they're giving to you. I LOVE when staff can help their patrons very well. Ordered the Caesar and smoked salmon salad. It was good, not over dressed. My daughter ordered the Greek yogurt and pastry basket. It's not disappointing, at least for her. All in all a wonderful relaxing place. Hope you can enjoy it on a fine weathered day like I was able to.

Such a great spot to be out and enjoying the sunshine on a nice SF day!I was grabbing drinks after work on Friday with a friend and wanted something chill. I'm at the point in my life where I don't want to deal with dark crowded bars where I'm forced to stand and not be sitting comfortably.Fortunately my friend works near Yerba Buena, and when she suggested we meet up somewhere nearby, I immediately thought of this place. They have indoor seating as well, but it was so nice and sunny that my friend and I opted to sit outside on their patio. We arrived a little before 5 pm and it wasn't crowded at all.As a tea lounge, samovar has an excellent selection of teas (mostly in the $6-12 range), but they also serve beer and wine. We both opted for a glass of their '16 Mont Marcal brut cava for $10. It was a light and refreshing sparkling wine, and we enjoyed sipping on it and catching up on a sunny Friday afternoon.They also serve food as well, but both of us had dinner plans already and we decided not to get anything here. Food is a bit on the pricey side, though, as you might expect from a place in Yerba Buena with such prime location and great views of the city skyline.

Dishonest billing - beware. As some prior reviewers have mentioned, Samovar has dishonest billing practices. They add the SF employer mandate tax and a "back of house service fee" plus tax to your subtotal. Then they ask you to tip on top of this grand total. When I entered my own amount on the tip line, they chose to round up my tip and basically took $5 extra from me without my consent. I called the manager twice to leave messages and emailed, and I have gotten no resolution to this in the past week and a half. If you go here, double and triple check your bill, as well as your credit card statement when it arrives. Too bad because it was a lovely spot, but this bad experience ruined my memories of my Mother's Day brunch there.

We were trying to get into Pink Elephant Alibi but couldn't find a seat, but we came here and there was availability for 6 on the patio. It started raining part way but they were efficient in getting everyone inside.There was a lot of tea options (since it's a tea bar) a bit on the more pricey side but the Masala Thai Tea I got was really creamy and delicious! They have bottomless mimosas too, as we were here for a birthday. The smoked salmon benedict was served on a biscuit  and potatoes were served whole and lightly pan-fried so the entire dish is very healthy. Even the sauce on top was avocado based.Very good vibes, bright, and feels open.

Is it typical for a restaurant host to "recommend" that orders be made "to go" because they will be closing the kitchen in half an hour...?!?  As if they just want my money and have no problem not offering me table service...??  Yeah, NO THANKS, Samovar...

Good food and environment. Long wait time and space is limited. The female waitress was very sweet and managed to cater to what I wanted. The outside table looks over YBG and quite peaceful. Next time I'll have to try their mindfulness tea and put my phone away

I love the ambiance/vibe of this place but that's all I can say. The food is plated nicely but they taste so-so and I'd be ok with it if it wasn't so small-portioned or so expensive.FOODI got the Salmon Egg Bowl and it comes with 2 poached eggs, 2 scoops of brown rice, and 2 small pieces of salmon. The egg's were not seasoned, the salmon was on the salty side, and the rice was lightly seasoned with some sesame and nori. It wasn't bad but the contrasting bland & salty taste really threw me off.  RECEIPT SURPRISEWhat floored me to give this rating is actually the new mysterious "Back of House Service Fee" (like Greg B. also mentioned). Afterwards, my friend, who used to manage restaurants, let me know that it's "tip for the kitchen staff" but common restaurant practice is to take this from the normal tip, not force it down your throat with fancy rhetoric.  They have one of the highest "SF Mandate Tax" (to cover employee benefits) but it should technically be absorbed into the restaurant cost (imagine the sales tax be broken down like % SF City + % SF County + % CA tax). What's even more hilarious is that they have one of those receipts with the "check a box between 15%, 20%, 25% auto calculated tip". And guess what? The % is calculated on the total + sf mandate tax + sales tax + back of house fee (kitchen tip). So they're essentially asking you to tip on top of tip. This wouldn't have lit me up if it weren't for the fact that it was half empty in there and we had to wave down the waiters to get attention. BOTTOM LINETake your money elsewhere!
Loved this place I will definitely go back again. The Chai was so good and we ordered this basket filled with goodies. Can't wait to go more often

I've been here a few times, and don't think its worth it. The tea is good, but if you're Asian, you know how to make better tea at home.The food is solid, but not something I'd go out of my way for.That leaves the experience... the decor and ambience both indoors and outdoors is hard to beat, but I've been here twice for lunch on a weekday almost 12 months apart and both times I sat for over 60 minutes before my food came out (and a half hour for tea and starters). The first time, I had to get a few items boxed and left early, and yesterday, my group was about 5 minutes away from it.I understand long waits for full service, complicated food, but the sandwiches and bowls on the menu hardly warrant it.I'd really suggest to management that they find some sort of appetizers that they can make in less than 30 minutes,  and consider serving them in larger quantities,  or put out complementary table crackers.  Tea and appetizers shouldn't take 30 minutes to bring out, and it's a drag to sit there for so long without it.They were nice enough to give us complimentary mochi to apologize for the wait, but having experienced this twice now, I'm probably giving up, or coming back during off hours.
I just wish there was more food options and better tea. The tea is nice if you don't drink good tea regularly.
Beautiful location, good food.. way too pricy with additional % charges. Good place for brunch on a sunny day.

I love the location of Samovar and the food and drinks are pretty good, but I'm growing frustrated by the deceptive pricing and hidden fees.First, I have found on three different occasions that the price on my receipt was higher than the price on the menu.  For instance, the Cold Brew Matcha is $7 on the menu, but is $8 on the bill.  They are always shocked when I highlight these discrepancies and only fix it with a one-time discount on the bill - they don't seem to fix the POS.Second, they charge an "SF Employer Mandate," as so many restaurants do.  As you hopefully know now, this is not a real tax and restaurants charge an arbitrary amount to cover costs to comply with the new law requiring businesses with over 20 employees to provide healthcare for employees. Samovar charges 5% of the bill, which is far more than would be required to comply with the $1.89 per employee hour for healthcare.Third, they now also charge an additional mysterious "Back of House Service Fee" which is 4% of the total bill. It's unclear what this money goes towards, but presumably compensation for the cooks and cleaning staff.  But shouldn't that come out of the revenues? Or the tip?Don't get me wrong - I'm strongly supportive of increasing the wages for restaurant workers. But I would much prefer that the restaurant raise prices than add these hidden charges to the menu. And charging more on the bill than the menu for items is just unethical and illegal.

Samovar once was a great tea shop near Dolores park. Like so much of post tech sf, it's gone way down in quality and way up in prices. Today - the final straw - I come to a nearly empty place and am told I can't sit for tea until my friend arrives! Sabrina was very nice, and said it was what she was trained to do. I was quite bothered but take her at her word that Jesse (the owner though she didn't mention his name) must have wanted that. Some of the tea is still very good like the blood orange puer and  the incomparable green ecstasy (sencha snd matcha). But even that has gone downhill from the original preparation and now quite bitter. If you buy the tea leaves, the instructions are often way wrong - like the green ecstasy should be cold brewed then ten seconds in 185 water - not two minutes boiling! The tempeh is great fir vegetarian but sickly sweet. Other nice dishes are the Japanese tea service. Once the tech bubble bursts, I imagine the shop will regroup and go back to its previous quality. In the meantime, buy Japanese tea as asakichi in Japan town. The matcha is much cheaper and much better. I buy the very best orange dot but it's the priciest. Jesse, please bring back the old samovar standards
Never tasted quiche sooooo delicious  Went back next day for moreWonderful flavors in the chai tea, as well

Not familiar with this bakery or how it operates because I'm not a local!! But i found it very odd how they do not call out any numbers or names for drinks??? Literally just make the drink and leave it on the counter in front of them. I only ordered a hot jasmine green tea and waited 15 minutes wondering if they were backed up on orders or what? After asking the worker if i pick up my tea here all she said was what tea is it and makes it within 2 minutes. No apology either. The lady at the register never said anything about where to wait or pick up drinks so obviously i was confused. Another lady too seemed confused as to where to pick anything up.

Extremely unassuming from the outside - you can still see the kfc bucket & Taco Bell logo under the awning paint, but I'm declaring this a MUST.Cardamom lattice, spicy sausage & provolone croissant, & prosciutto mozzarella sandwich. Every single one I said wow, wow, wow. My 7 month old actually got mad at me cuz I let him taste the cardamom filling and he wanted more.Standard selection of espresso drinks done wonderfully & saw they sell lactation tea which is cool for my nursing mama's. Husband says the bread is sold at Birite as well but these pastries are welllll worth the trip if you're not nearby & parkings not bad at all
First time here I loved it and there's parking big time score! I had the chicken mango sandwich and it was delicious!

Went here on a whim to grab some pastries one morning. I couldn't help the smell of all those goodies getting baked. Warning: the line looks crazy and overwhelming but it kinda goes by fast. Definitely worth the wait. It's kinda hard to see what they have on display since the line blocks it, so be sure to take a through look. It's a bit hard to order since you're kinda yelling over the counter and trying to point at what pastry you want but I do hear the sandwiches are quite good.

Yes, yes, and yes do come here!Their crossants are made with real butter and have that flaky quality. Forget anyone who says Costco and Walmart crossants are just as good because they obviously wouldn't know a good crossant if it smacked them in the face.They had a really good banana chocolate crossant, but as most of you know their Cardamom Lattice Bun is their signature pastry.I like to get their bread if I'm hosting a football or 4th of July party, it goes great with dip, but any of their breads are delicious and baked feesh daily. They have a breakfast cookie whoch has pumpkin seeds and is a cross between a cookie and a scone for all you breakfast people out there.For you lunch people, they have sandwiches, and they haven't forgotten about you coffee lovers-they have you coveres as well!
Seriously !!! Ended up at Jane ON FAT TUESDAY!! Got a King Cake TOGO = Delicious !! Also had the Sausage Biscuit Sandwich! AMAZING ! Will be back!

The pastries are good and tasty. It's just this particular one with the custard inside, I found a small plastic wrap inside the custard, while chewing. Pretty surprising  Hope this was just a rare incident.

So I've officially hit up all the Janes! They sell some of the same baked goods here as in their cafes, obviously, so we had to try something unique to the bakery!Strawberry Rhubarb Black Sesame Durum Tart: HIGHLY RECOMMEND. This was sooo delicious. We shared it amongst three people, but I could totally eat one myself. The crust was black sesame and the filling tasted slightly nutty; I loved the texture of it. The strawberries added a nice sweetness, and the tart, overall, had the perfect amount of sweetness.Crazy Cookie: Marshmallow, corn flakes, chocolate chips. Ooey, gooey, crunchy, chewy, and sweet all in one cookie. So much going on, but it works so well. I loved the contrast of these textures.I just didn't like how they don't post the prices on the cards naming each item.It's located a couple blocks down from Japantown!
Love this place! Always consistently amazing food and service every time. You have to try everything on the menu cause it's AMAZING! Keep up the great work!

Who knew you were here?!  Stumbled out of the Imperial Day Spa after a relaxing acupressure session to this amazing smell of fresh baked goods and lines of eager customers. Who has an appetite after being walked on - yet onward I went. Walk inside and you are greeted by stacks of fresh baked breads and cases of treats from cookies to muffins to Nutella brioche to vegan veggie sandwiches. In Janes it's not about where you start just be sure to keep going down to the coffee bar. Be kind to your servers and leave a tip too. Enjoy!!

Try their Cocoa Nib Kouign Amann, it's really good! Earl grey currant scone, Cap n' crunch cookie, n Vanilla berry crunch brioche are good too. So, pretty much evryth are tasty! New spot for patisseries.

The first time I stopped at their bakery location, when it first opened, it must have been an off day because I couldn't find any vegan options. This was surprising because their regular locations always had muffins, cookies, etc.However, having gone more recently, I was delighted to find a few different cookie options and muffin. My partner got the chocolate chip cookie and I got the blueberry banana muffin. And that muffin was seriously one of the best vegan ones I've had in a while. All too often vegan muffins can be on the dry side. But the fruit in this muffin was plentiful and gave it the perfect consistency.Now that I know to look here for vegan pastries, I'll also need to try some of their breads. The loaves, etc. behind the counter look excellent!

Ordered a sandwich here for the first time and ended up waiting 10-15 mins. While everyone after me got their orders. Front person checked on my order and it was finally ready 5 mins later. However, I ordered it to eat in the bakery and was told they would call my name when it was ready. All I heard was "sandwich!" And the guy in the back was looking at me cuz I was the only one left waiting. He had put my order in a huge take out box instead of on a plate. Then I noticed that there were no spinach on the sandwich like it was written on the menu. Had to go tell the the guy in the back that they didn't put any spinach on it. Not a great experience. Definitely not worth $10 as it was also pretty small. I did like the bread and bought a sourdough baguette so I can make my own sandwiches! Nice employees in the front though.
This bakery is awesome...live the early morning hours of operation and being able to purchase warm freshly baked breads and pastries.  Coffee was amazing.
My favorite bakery in SF!I'm here 3 times a week for fresh bread. The polenta/olive loaf, fig walnut and sourdough are all perfect.The best kept secret  at Jane's is the Roasted Cauliflower Sandwich.
Exceptionally good chocolate banana croissant which is the first time I hv in life. It's buttery, moist and has good enough amount of filling. It's definitely an encore.
Their pastries are above average and for that I give them 4 stars. Best time to go is early morning to early afternoon. That's when they'll still have a decent selection.
Had the Mandarin Honey Brioche & it was DELICIOUS! Sad we only bought one (and ate it before we could post any pictures)!

Love local breakfast spots! This one is so incredible that they are open wayyy past breakfast time! Lovely location, with ample seating and space for a bustling city. I can't speak for their famous baked goods, but I can sing the praises of their dragon fruit chia bowl. They had a solid selection of bowls and other healthy choices to choose from, but k was drawn to this striking dish for a refreshing midday treat. It was perfect. Not too hot or too cold, it was full of flavor (and antioxidents!) The toppings were delicious- I wish there were a few more! A bit skimpy on the chia and berries, I like my bowls very textured, but it was still yummy! One star off for the service, we had a small group of 5, and the staff were more intent on moving us up and out then making sure we had an enjoyable stay. Also, the prices are ambiguous when ordering, and were (onviously) rather expensive. Clarity on pricing would be great! Otherwise, a lovely experience. Would love to go back and try some of the baked goods!

Awesome bakery with a wide assortment of  croissants, brioches, danishes, muffins and other goodies.   Also got a sesame bread.  It was fresh and had an excellent crispy crust.   Why did it take me so long to find this place?  Sooooo good.
This place is soo cute! The mocha is delicious and I thought from previous experience that I didn't like churros, but they are so yummy here!
Very cozy, very tasty, very friendly. Love it! Sandwiches, Empanadas, Churros, Bagels, delicious coffee and beer and wine. Yes Chalos, Yes! Yes Yes!Amazing Wonderful
Super delicious on a nice cold day! Great customer service, area is clean and relaxing, enjoy a churro/coffee with your group.

Empanadas are pretty good and service was awesome but lacking on the churros and unfortunately no WIFI. I get it, this place isn't known for Churros but just saying it's meh and basic. So definitely skip that on the menu. However, the empanadas are pretty darn good! I wished I could try more! Also, I really wished they had WIFI, what coffeeshop/cafe doesn't have WIFI? how do you expect people to gather here if there isn't any. Anyways, HIGHLY recommend for Empanadas!

I was so excited to see this restaurant open so close to my home and got there about 10:30am on a Saturday. Ordered their plain churros and a spinach and cheese and a carni empanada. Waited quite a bit for the order. When I got it, the Churro was super greasy and hollow inside. And smelled and tasted like old oil. The empanadas were not as greasy, but the cheese in the spinach empanada was still in cubed form and didn't look melted at all. Slightly disappointed but I will try another day

Empanadas and Churros... I feel like the world would be a better place if we had more places like this. Let's start with the CHURROS. $4 for a basket and dipping sauce? Sign me up. I prefer the sauce to be in the side cause sometimes you wanna just enjoy the churro by itself. This is the best Churro I've had in the Bay Area so far, (I haven't done much Churro hunting out here) but so far this is the best. I think there's a tad bit too much dough but size can be a little thinner. The sauce is a great complement. It isn't too sweet so it's not just sweet on sweet.As for the Empanadas... I ordered 3 different onesCarne - The best out of the bunch, the flavor in the ground beef is the highlight. (baked)Jack Cheese - This was okay, nothing special unless this is your favorite type of cheese (fried)Spinach with White Cream - This would have been a Home run if the ratio of the white cream to the spinach was at least 50/50. Its more like 80/20, they packed a lot so much spinach in there that Popeye would be proud. Didn't try any coffee but I bet it would go great with the Churros. As for the empanadas, Fried is the way to go that crunch doesn't compares to a baked one.I would recommend and I'll probably be back to try some other things

Empanadas are soooo good!  Gotta get them fried - any of the three carnes, champignones (mushroom), Jamon and queso - all are delicious and full of flavor.  Friendly warning, juices flow out of the bottom so be sure to napkin up properly and don't eat and drive!  Bonus: owned and run by some really good and friendly people.  Locals coming back home to share some international tastes with our community.

Nice place, but don't get the hot chocolate. I would give the empanadas a solid 4. I enjoyed the two I had -- carne and espinaca con queso -- and am excited to come back to try different ones. The crust was flaky and not too oily, and the fillings are flavorful and unique. I knocked down a star because the drink options are still lacking. My hot chocolate was underwhelming--essentially a $3 large lukewarm cup of chocolate milk. I saw the baristas making it behind the counter and they just squirted chocolate syrup into some milk. I hope this place can get more non-coffee options besides hot tea and soda (e.g. iced tea, lemonade). Also, make sure you come with your own water because their free water is weirdly lukewarm, too.

Yum. Yum. Yummy yum yum!!! I dropped in for a snack, did my meeting, and then went back for lunch. Ultimate in delicious comfort food. The ones with cheese are best. Order the dipping sauce for the sweet churros at the end. I don't live close but will find excuses to head there!

I really like this place, I've been here a couple times, I've had about 6-7 different empanadas and they were all delicious. The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because they don't have any sauces to go with the empanadas, besides a basic bottled hot sauce. Get some chimichurri to go with your empanadas and you guys will have a real home run on your hands.

I was looking to expand my churro experience outside of Costco food court churro; I haven't had any churros outside of the ones from Costco!As others have mentioned, don't expect to come in here and have a grab and go lunch. I really like the fact that they make their churros and empanadas fresh to order, but at the same time, I wish there was some brief nod to the fact that they appreciate your patience waiting around.The three pieces of churros ($3.95) plus a side of dipping sauce ($1) was good. Just the right crunch, but the inside was too doughy for my taste. Is the middle of a churro supposed to be like this? Costco's are cooked more thorough, I believe, and doesn't rely on the dipping sauce for flavor. These pieces were barely coated with sugar, no cinnamon. You almost have to get the dipping sauce... :(

I have tried so far the baked and the fried empanadas and both were delicious. This place is very welcoming and they have a nice extensive menu to enjoy while working there or stopping in to have a coffee and empanada. We are happy with this new place opening up in the sunset neighborhood.

Chalos has a great selection of empanadas (really enjoyed the carne and pollo), as well as Sight Glass coffee-definitely try the Chalos Special (cold brew, espresso, coca-cola, whipped cream, and a cherry). They also have sweet and savory churros. Definitely worth the trip and will most definitely be back!

Just happened by this new place on a walk. Very nice ambience and excellent empanadas!! Will have to work my way down the menu. Coffee was equally satisfying. I tried the cafe Bonbom, espresso shot with condensed milk. Very nice.Proprietor, the eponymous Chalo's , was at the register and very gracious and personable. Nice change from the usual pretentious art house cafe  or chain place. Nice neighborhood spot. I'll be back !!!!

After reminiscing about churros in mexico city, I recalled a new place my friend told me about in the Outer Sunset. I stopped in to get some as a snack before heading to dinner. I got 1 order (3 churros -$3.95) + a dipping sauce of dulce de leche (+$1). Note - they do make you wait since they are made to order so don't expect to just run in and out. Even though you have to wait, I love that they are fresh. Maybe my expectations were high because they were being made to order, but they were very doughy and not crispy at all. Also, they were very lightly sugared. I would have preferred more sugar. I had to use the dipping sauce to enhance the favor and without the sauce, the churros would have been too plain to eat alone in my opinion. I also got a shot of espresso with some condensed milk on the bottom. It was good, but not worth the price.The place is a cute spot for a quick bite with friends and I love the minimalist, hipster-ish decor. Good place for a cup of coffee and some fresh churros.Since I am in the neighborhood often, I will stop by again and try some of their savory churros and empanadas.
Best empanadas in the city and great coffee. Super friendly staff. Beautiful interior. Very fair prices for extremely high quality food.

Finally got a chance to check out the empanadas here. We tried 3 of them so far (pardon if I don't remember the proper names: the carne (ground beef), the ham w mozzarella, and the mushroom and cheese. Oh man! So far the mushroom and cheese is my fave! Lots of mushroom for that savory taste and plenty of cheese. Tip: for those who wants a slightly healthier option, you can request the empanadas to be baked, and not fried. Still tasty, but without the grease. Also tried the churros. Didn't want too sweet, so we didn't get the Dulce dipping sauce, just plain. It was ok. Will definitely come back to try the other flavors of the empanadas.

Food was  Excellent! Service was great, very friendly staff. Prices were very reasonable. Great for the Parkside. If you just want coffee or a Latte and a Churro, they have that also. I definitely recommend!
Fried empanadas! Pretty unique! And so much better than baked! Similar to Dominican pastelitos! Light  and airy and bubbly crust! Yum.

The empanadas are delicious and you can tell the chef is passionate about them. Churros were not so good, though. The texture was a bit tougher than I like and the flavor was bland.Why the one star? Their suggested tips (on the POS/iPad) are calculated on top of tax. This is unethical. Tip should be calculated before tax, not on top of tax.
The hours were changed (although not on Yelp).  I scheduled a meeting there at 4 since the posted hours (on door and Yelp) were until 5.  A piece of paper shows the modification to 3:30.
Cute little cafe for your coffee and bagel needs. Cozy spot to relax for a while. Good service.

I used to come here for lunch, but stopped coming when owners changed. Ladies working here are very rude. If being a b*tch is ok in China or where ever they are from, it definitely will not work here!
Very friendly and relaxing environment - staff, ambiance, patrons.  They know my order and are welcoming. Great food and drinks.

Comfortable cafe with wifi and some good food items. They have the best oatmeal bowl in the area--old fashioned rolled oats in milk topped with plenty for fruit! Their veggie bagel, and veggie sandwich are tasty as well. Coffee and tea options are not too special. Their chai is housemade, but very sweet. I frequent this place!

Although there is much I used to love about this place as a neighborhood coffee shop (I live across the street), I was recently really disappointed. My husband and I buy coffee here about once a week. They'vev always been a bit strange about using a reusable coffee cup you have - I think because they feel you are trying to get free extra coffee (which for me is not the case!) Today, I dropped my cappuccino as soon as they gave it to me. I had not even had a sip or left the shop. As they started to remake my drink, they rang up my order on the cash register to charge me again. I was surprised! When I asked if I was actually being charged, they said they could as a 1-off charge me for a smaller size. I decided I'd rather just go to another coffee shop at that point. It's only a few dollars, but it just feels disappointing as a way to treat your regular neighborhood customers.
Not a fan of whatever type of espresso they use, but the milk was steamed perfectly. Probably would try somewhere else next time.

Sweet Maple was a few blocks from our hotel. We looked for nearby breakfast places. SM got good reviews. We had breakfast and it was very nice. I felt that the prices were high, so, the two following days we went two doors to the left and had great food for less than half of what it would cost at SM. SM is good for impressing a date, but for less complex food, save a few bucks and check out Cafe Murrano.

This is a nice little cafe. It has a lot of the ordinary staples of coffee shops such as your Chai lattes and mochas and what not. They have bagels and sandwiches and oatmeal for breakfast and a lot of pastries. The staff is pretty friendly and the WiFi is great. I enjoyed the coffee and oatmeal that I had and was able to get some work done. I highly recommend it.

As an API person I love the efficiency of the staff! Wow. What a wonderful old style SF cafe. Great place to chill, work, eat and just check out of our over tech infused city. Affordable and funky and THANKFULLY not too trendy!

Charming little cafe with a WONDERFUL staff and great, affordable food. I come here almost every weekend to get coffee and occasionally breakfast if I'm wanting something quick.Highly recommend their breakfast bagels, the oatmeal, and their veggie panini!
Great place! Small but has a wide variety of foods and drinks, great little cafe. Oh! I can't forget they have free wifi.

Great service. Nice atmosphere. Solid food. Not a huge selection, but what they have is great. It's a nice touch that breakfast sandwiches come with a side of fruit. Definitely a place worth checking out for a quick bite or if you want to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee.

Stopped by for a quick morning coffee to start my day. Nice quaint little spot. Looks like a good place if you want to study because it was quiet and cozy. Free WiFi as well!The coffee was strong enough to jumpstart my day and more flavorful than your average keurig. It's also a nice spot if you need something to hold you over while waiting for sweet maple, it's right next door.
Yummy bagels, enjoyed them with hubby. Delicious cream cheese bagels with tomatoes and breakfast bagel. Great both of thrm
I really liked this little cafe. Free wifi! good connection. Legit salmon lox bagel. A good spot to work with your laptop and chill.

Love this mellow place.  It's a cozy and clean neighborhood cafe that's great both for hanging out or getting a lot of work done.  The food is surprisingly good for a coffee shop (fresh ingredients, hearty portions) and the service is super efficient and nice.  Reasonably priced.  Only downside is that it closes early.
Great place to work or catch up with a friend: free wifi, good coffee, friendly staff, not to crowded!
Great place to do work. Quiet not too busy and lots of outlets! Great environment to focus, smooth jazz in the background. Friendly staff.
Staff are friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed. Not a lot of seating available if you want to lounge around for awhile. Good for a bite and to get a bit of work done.

The breakfast bowls here are exceptional! I got the red velvet bowl and my friend got the Buddha berry bowl; we were both very pleased! The inside is adorable and was very clean. The portions were generous and everything was very healthy. I found it to be a little bit overpriced but it was delicious and everything was made to order. I would definitely be back!

For perfect balance I recommend the Citrus Hazelnut Kale Salad with added Rhizocali Tempeh added. The magnificently fresh kale, sprouts, and carrots are a crunchy base for the powerful 9 layers of flavor infused into the tempeh. The fresh citrus, nuts, and figs give a delicate sweet/sour finish to the generous sized portion.
Cozy tea shop with wonderful teas. The matcha latte and chai were comforting on a rainy night in SF. I could have spent a whole evening here!

Came at 9pm (they close at 10) to enjoy a nice dinner on my birthday and they decided to close the kitchen early. They could have still served us but clearly cared more about doing less work than they needed to so instead we walked out hungry and sad in the rain with an unfortunate bitter taste in our mouth about this place.

My favorite Friday night spot, yes this is where I'd like to be on a Friday night. Alcohol has never been my friend, but açaí bowl, fresh juice, and wonderful savory goods are my thing. It's a super small place and the food will take a long time because they mostly make from scratch. So deal with it. Hippies take time to make good food. Some people get annoyed with the time, but if you know this spot then you know to chill out and enjoy the wait. Which is super hard for a lot of folks. I get so sad when I see people be rude to the staff, it is rare but I've seen it. I love this place and no one could change my mind.

Really love the vibe here and all of the great ingredients! However, I had a really unpleasant customer service experience here. The woman working the counter got annoyed with me when she turned over their POS system and my Apple Pay didn't go through the first time. Then came waiting for the smoothie I ordered. I waited for 20 min on one smoothie because the aforementioned woman proceeded to do everything from refilling sauce bottles and making orders for customers who came after me before thinking about the single smoothie I ordered. When she handed over the smoothie she just gave me the stink eye and to top it all off, it wasn't even the right smoothie. I didn't even have time to say anything since the 20 min wait made me late for my class that night. For a place so well intentioned and centered on great ideals, I was shocked by how unprofessional the staff at beloved was. As much as I loved their offerings, I will not come back because of such poor service.

I ordered a smoothie bowl and it took literally 30 mins for the staff to make it. 30 mins for a smoothie. When I eventually got it, it was pretty good, but I won't be going back because of how long it took. Not worth it when it takes less than 5 minutes to order and get an açaí bowl from Project Juice down the street (and it's $11 at Project Juice vs. over $14 at Beloved Cafe).

Homemade Chai w| Walnut Milk + Coconut Sugar. Pretty tasty.Teeny place but super cuteEarthy decorSmall outside seating area for 4Small indoor nook seating for 2 Small bar seating for  4 - 5I'd return!

This place has it all. A lovely warm and comforting atmosphere, paired with delicious food and drinks. I've been here twice now. Most recently, I had their Red Velvet Smoothie Bowl and a homemade Chai. The bowl is packed with nutritious deliciousness and makes a decent sized breakfast (or snack!). The chocolate flavors in it are rich but the beet gives it a bit of earthy flavor that's unusual but absolutely delicious. The chai was perfectly spicy. Previously, I had their golden milk which did not disappoint! The people who work here are also great. They get busy since it's a small place, but they make all customers feel welcomed and valued.

First time diner and I loved the dal, kale salad and juice. Staff was friendly. I only give 3 stars because the website says "This is your escape from the city, your sanctuary..." and I went on a night where I really needed healthy food in a peaceful space. Instead they were blasting pop tunes making it hard to have a conversation without yelling. On a normal night maybe Id be singing along with the staff but this night it was really distracting.
Beloved Cafe is over the moon delicious.  The place has very limited seating so I recommend getting there for an early dinner.  Mostly vegan except for the honey and ghee.

Trying to be health conscious and connecting with the community to share with them the chiropractic services I offer can be difficult. Not here! No pastries to be tempted by that are healthy! A massive selection of elixers, teas, smoothies, and foods. Can't wait to be back!

Fantastic spot for healthy food, juices, smoothies, and tonics in a cozy and relaxing nook.The folks who work there have such positive energy and always make the day better as a result.Highly recommended.

You know that dreamy low glycemic, organic, sustainable, healthy, medicinal, vegan/veggie good for the planet food joint you've been dreaming of? This is it. It's all the goodness from the world packaged into a little mission spot for you to receive love . Service is great, food is great, decor is great. Don't sleep!

So damn delicious! The staff is super warm and friendly which matches the aesthetic and the food! It's a small, quaint spot but don't that deter you from coming to indulge.Faves are the dhal, the tropic smoothie and the granola bowl but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

Absolutely incredible meal options for the healthy eater. I cannot speak more highly of the fresh ingredients, delicious combinations, and very friendly staff. I wish more cafes like this existed! The quinoa bowl and the berry oatmeal are two outstanding options.

Really cool little cafe, with long hours! Superfoods abound on the menu in many guises, from teas to elixirs, smoothies and bowls. Not much seating, and it doesn't take long for the place to fill up. I have found the service slow if 4-5 people arrive at once. Most of the menu is vegan-friendly.

My friend and I both ordered the green goddess bowl which was made of pure, fresh ingredients and tasted delicious. The sacrifice in having this bowl is being treated like a nobody and having to wait at least 30 minutes for the bowls. Upon arriving, there were two employees neither of which acknowledged us in this very tiny cafe where we stood no more than a foot apart. We finally had to say something to get their attention and order. We sat outside because the inside was too crowded and it was a beautiful day. Once we were done I brought our bowls back inside and the employee looked at me without saying a word. In fact, I was the one who said thank you - not sure why, but probably out of habit and having manners. The couple sitting across from us outside was waiting for 20 minutes for their juices and after being scolded from employees for filling their water bottle at the cafe's communal dispenser and for asking about the status of their juices, they decided to leave without waiting for their order to be completed. For me it's not only about great food/products, but about the service which this place does not have.

I tried the second option on their Savory menu. It is Delicious. So much hearty flavor packed into a healthy possibly vegan meal. I'm so happy I found this place, albeit moving forward, I'll have to choose either a meal or a matcha. Being that everything is made in house, the matcha is a bit pricey. But I'm sure totally worth it. I tried the walnut milk in mine, first time trying walnut milk, not sure its my fav. but they have many other options, and I'm not afraid to keep trying. I'd recommend this place. Didn't take long, although they were packed when I arrived. It's a cozy place, with an otherworldly feel, sort of like if an apothecary housed a cafe. But isn't that what food is? Medicine. Food is medicine. So, I'm leaving you to finish up my meal. Five stars!!!

I love this place I wish they had one in Lakewood ca but I guess I'll have to visit every time I come to sf. I've tried other places in Sf that have to bowls and juice but honestly none of them compare to beloved cafe!  I will miss you until I'm back in sf

Omg one of my favorite coffee shops in SF. We had the Mexican chocolate frappe and the horchata iced latte. I love latin inspired drinks. Horchata is one of my favorites and to have it with some caffeine is the cherry on top. Sometimes it can be hard to find parking here due to it being on Valencia/Cesar Chavez. Awesome spot to grab your caffeine for the day or sit down and do some work. There are multiple tables with a nice ambiance. Not quiet enough though if you are looking for a silent work space.
The BEST coffee I've ever had!! You must try the horchata latte. Iced or hot, it's always delicious!!Friendly, attentive staff & a relaxing ambiance-- 12/10 recommend.

This has been my spot for years now. Their horchata latte (hot or iced) is the best. I also love their fruit juices. The coffee shop is pretty chill and they never mess up on your order. I wish they would open one in San bruno,ca that would be awesome.

Horchata coffee is why I come here. All they're drinks are good tho. The place is very calm and relaxing, they're are usually ppl on their laptops doing work. I also enjoyed the chill vibe music that was playing.

I'm from out of town, but everytime I visit the City, I make it a point to stop by Tierra Mia.  It's the only place I can get my fix of horchata goodness.  I dont know what it is about their beverages, but I need it like a crack addict needs crack? Haha... anyways, if you've never been, make sure to add this place to your itinerary.

I came in for tea, but looking around I could tell coffee was their specialty. My friend ordered the horchata latte and I decided to follow suit. Since I didn't want alt of caffeine, I ordered a decaf horchata latte with almond "milk" and couldn't have been happier! A small was $5.25, so a little steep, but I would order it again on an occasional basis. Right before I was ready to order, the 2nd employee went on break so I had to wait a little longer than I had planned since each drink was a bit time consuming.The cafe had a pleasant atmosphere and was roomy, the unisex bathroom was clean. Overall a pleasant experience.

I had a good time at Tierra Mia, stopping by for a quick snack and coffee because I had been forced to get up early and rudely denied any coffee prior.The decor here is pretty cool, with some aeronautical antiques and comfortable chairs. It's a very casual place that I can definitely see people lounging around in.The service was very prompt as well, with it only taking a few minutes for my mocha and almond croissant to be delivered.The mocha was good if you like sweet coffee drinks, but to be honest I prefer less sugar and a more intense chocolate flavor. An extra shot of espresso and the removal of half the sugar would have probably been more to my liking. It was good, just too much like dessert for me.The almond croissant was also good, but reheating it by microwaving it doesn't leave me with a very good impression. I'd prefer it was reheated with dry heat, like a toaster oven, rather than internally steamed, which is what microwaving does. It wasn't ruined, just kind of suboptimal to me.Overall, if i were in the neighborhood, I would come here versus Starbucks or Pete's. But I'd go to Blue Bottle or Philz if that was available.

Loved the horchata lattes! Spent my rainy Saturday evening with my boyfriend here. There's comfy couches and nice tables to study that are spread out enough to feel like you have privacy and space. Super nice atmosphere and a great place to hangout/study!

One of my biggest pet peeves is when 1 person takes up a whole table for 4 lol. Can't suggest it's always good for groups but definitely a nice place to get some work done. Cute little cafe with amazing drinks. I'm not a coffee expert or anything, but ever since Tierra Mia, I've learned to appreciate coffee. I've tried almost all the frappes by this point and I gotta say Horchata Frappe and the Mexican chocolate frappe are the ones!!! Hot or cold both never disappoint. Sweet. Creamy. Delicious. Really friendly and helpful baristas who will take the time to explain every drink and make it the way you want. Also reasonable prices for some coffee. Free and reliable WiFi as well as a couple outlets on the walls. Worth a try if you're in the area and need a cup of coffee!

Finally some decent Cafe con Leche. It may not have been Miami, but it was pretty close. The staff here was super cool. I would definitely come back in the future to get the Horchata Latte.Tierra Mia Coffee has a nice spacious cafe and the setup reminds me of a few places I've visited in South Florida in the college are by University of Miami. My only disappointment was that they didn't have many Cuban pastries - if they had some guava pastries or some Puerto Rican pastries then this place would be probably the best place I've been to.Still - major points for having a real Latin coffee and not some made up hipster stuff like most of SF.

Found a parking spot in the rain right in back, so thought I would stop in. Nice open place with a really well laid out counter and baked goods display. I decided on a Mexi Mocha & a feta & spinach croissant. The folks behind the counter were super nice & warmed up my croissant, which was yummy. The mocha was xlnt as well. Ive found a new favorite place to go.

Came here today all the way from soma in hopes to make it before closing time. Walked in (front door was still open) 5:04pm and got turned away because I was 4 minutes too late from their closing time. Looked up the Oakland location and see that they are open until 9pm. Yes, the drinks are awesome here but who can drink them if they close at 5 and or open at 7:30am which is very late for a coffee shop?! The schedule here makes no sense. To the owner: pay for an afternoon shift and maybe you'll keep some customers. I'll be making the trip to Oakland from now on.

Out on our adventure hubs and I needed to recharge. This coffee shop is the absolute reason I love coming to big cities. It's away from touristy places and just super chill. When you get here please try their horchata cream! Its like the horchata shake I get from Portos (best bakery in the country) the hot chocolate is really made well with steamed milk. Foam is super think and enjoyable. Scene us really northern california vibe. Its cozy and has a bunch of outlets everywhere. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. I'm not a coffee drinker but they got a lot of good things here.

Great coffee!!  The coffee was very rich, not bitter.  Loved it!  The place is very cute and clean!  The coffee was great!  They were pretty much out of baked goods at this time, some come early for food.
Some people may find this spot a little snooty, I think bougie is what kids are saying these days. But, this is my local Bernal café. The Cafesito Cubano is very good.

The atmosphere of this shop was great. Maintains a homey feeling while being modern at the same time. Personally, this was a great place to study for me. The shop plays soft music and the sound of the coffee machines isn't too loud. However, I'd suggest getting there early if you don't want to worry about getting a table. The shop started to fill up around 11 AM. The walls have plugs, but not at all tables are near plugs. The coffee was great here though! I thoroughly enjoyed my super foamy latte. If you're the type to camp out at a coffee shop all day, take note that the shop only serves pastries- no sandwiches and stomach-filling foods.
Great place for a study spot. Not too loud and crowded. Outlets almost everywhere. Horchata frappe is strongly recommended if you're a frappe fan. Staffs were nice.
Amazing! Pastries are delightful! My favorite is their almond croissant with almond custard filling, divine! Love their Latin twist on typical drinks and pastries. A must try!
Would've enjoyed visiting here if the girl cashier didn't mug us and rolled her eyes at my friend and I.  Overall, good drinks.

I've walked by this spot every time I walk on this part of Mission Street, but my inner clock was not dialed to coffee time until recently when I actually entered the cafe on a whim. I've actually been to the other Tierra Mia on Broadway in Oakland to meet a former colleague, but I threw balls to the wall and ordered one of their specialties, the sweeter than sweet Horchata Frappe (review: bit.ly/2xrOCDY). I noticed they serve that sugary confection here, but I tried to hold the reins tighter by ordering an 8-oz Cappuccino Italiano since it was a coolish afternoon even though I know it's a major faux pas to have cappuccino after 12 Noon (photo: bit.ly/2OEQT5O). I didn't get grief for my order, but I certainly got plenty of sugar as it was a most dessert-like drink for the middle of the afternoon. The chill vibe in here helped me nurse it before I tossed half of it away. No offense to the barista but it wasn't quite my taza de the.COFFEE - 3 stars...a stellar cappuccino if you want something for dessertAMBIANCE - 4 stars...relaxing vibe on this particularly urban stretch of MissionSERVICE - 3.5 stars...nice crew hereTOTAL - 3 stars...just sweeter than I wanted...or neededRELATED - Looking for dining options in Bernal Heights? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2MMXXMk

This place is super cute! They had a very interesting set of flavors and I had the pineapple basil. Delicious! They have a really cute back area where it is super chill. Wonderful day to come out when it's nice weather. Will come again!

I heard so many good things about their donuts I was really excited to try them I bought two different gluten free donuts.  The first one had a very sweet crispy outside and almost no flavor at all. Very disappointed. I not sure I will bother to try the 2nd one I'm concerned my mouth is feeling a little raw. There might be a preservative that I am reacting to

I love coming to Dynamo for coffee and donuts on the weekend! Because it's in Mission and I live in Haight, it's not exactly convenient for me to make weekday trips. They always have a different (large) selection of donut flavors and I've never had the same one twice. I like to mix it up and try new things and I've never been disappointed.The coffee is great and they have milk alternatives for those of you who need it. The staff are always nice and fun to talk to.
Creative and tasty donuts; good coffee; nice space and cute garden out back; and a super nice guy working there.What more can you ask for?!
I go here more often than I should. The baristas make a mean latte and the gluten free donuts are delicious. I'm a huge fan of their buttermilk lemon donut.

Good coffee and donuts. But the worst mf customer service ever!! I waited 30 min for 2 coffees and a donut. And it wasn't busy at all. They didn't start making my coffee until I had said something. Also they didn't apologize for the long wait. Shitty service seriously and an attitude problem.

gluten free lemon raspberry donut and two other flavors to choose from (sorry spacing on the two other GF flavors I think it was carrot and chocolate  orange). get there early cuz last time I was there after 12 on a saturday and they sold out. delicate icing with perfect level of sweetness and cakey donut that was moist not dry. ate the whole thing quite quickly. Nice dude at the counter with great positive attitude.
I'm not big on donuts but I f-ing love this placePassion fruit and chocolate has such sharp tartness it is amazing!!!
A Dynamo Donut review, in haiku:What more can I say?You can't walk by and not swoop.Carbs and a coffee!

Way too many weird flavors. Made a point to walk there at 8 am so I could get the chocolate vanilla. The inside vanilla cream tasted like lemon. Nothing on the menu said it had other flavors in the cream. Will not go back.  Nothing beats Bob good old fashioned donuts straight from the fryer.

I had high expectations after seeing all the great reviews, but I feel like the donut was pretty mediocre overall. Granted, I only tried one donut, the chocolate hazelnut lavender. It was a pretty okay donut but it wasn't necessarily outstanding. I feel like it's nice if you're in the mood for donuts but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

Went to dynamo donuts for the first time yesterday and I'm so surprised to see how this place has good reviews...After I paid, I decided to tip in cash and one of the baristas rudely said, "Wow, no love here" because they assumed I wasn't going to tip them even though I did. I would definitely spend my $6 and buy donuts at Krispy Kreme. I will not be coming back.
Good quality donuts! I like the donuts which are moist and not too sweet. We have not tried everything, but our family 's favorites are vanilla bean, chocolate rose and caramel del sel so far.

Dynamo Donut is hands down our favorite donut anywhere... and we go out of our way to try a good donut. But we don't want just any donut... we're not in it fir the sugar. In fact, a donut that's too sweet gets a thumb down by our vote. We want to taste to varying flavors and interesting combinations which is just what we get at Dynamo. Today we drooled one of over our favorites, milk chocolate passion fruit. And yes we tasted the passion fruit. We also had zucchini oat which had a nice moistness to the dough. Then we bought our friends donuts too. Although one didn't appreciate the quality so he won't be getting another. We come all the way from Santa Cruz on our way to our volunteer shift once a week. Every visit feels good because we are greeted by nice people who listen as we rave and question each donut. Nd they almost get into with us sharing their favorites... and sometimes they even throw in a free one... because "you have to try all the flavors."Tips..... you have to try the maple bacon. Coffee is great with them all, and they serve a good cup. If they're serving up something savory that day, throw that in to your order. We've had the savory quiche and bread pudding and were impressed. A couple times we've gone for a dozen, not a cheap thing to do. But when life threw us lemons, we made lemonade by visiting dynamo.

This is a great hangout for a sunny Saturday morning with some friends. There is a cute back patio that's dog friendly, and the service is very friendly. I regret to report that I didn't have a donut, but I was impressed how good the quiche I got was. I'll definitely be back to try the donuts. The coffee was also tasty, and they topped off my cup before heading back out into the street, for which I'm thankful!

My boyfriend & I were really excited to try these donuts as they look delicious but we were rather disappointed from the unpleasant aftertaste as the multiple flavors were overly ambitious. Paid $16 for 5 donuts. Not worth the hype. Only positive was the staff were friendly & there is a cute little storefront to order from.

Oh, this is what all the fuss is about!? I finally got a Chance to try the coffee here. Excellent! Next time I'll get a pastry or donut. It was tough to resist the smell but I was in a hurry. The place has a 50's diner charm that is not lost on me. I'll definitely be back.

The donuts are good but the service is horrible!  They run out of flavors so go early.  Today server was rude and box she put donuts in fell apart as I walked away! Go for the donuts, not for the staff.

Coffee stop for years and years one sip and remember that the espresso is a notch too bitter but no complaints here. Just after 7am no line yet. SUPERB DONUTS. Great service I am happy!!! Five stars and five hearts!!! Thanks you guys!!!

I walked 2.5 mi to get my grubby paws on these beautiful gifts from heaven! (Obviously, I didn't have to walk, but when your diet consists of mainly donuts, it's not a bad idea to get in some cardio in between meals. I'm sure the AHA would agree.)There are just SOOO MANY different kinds of donuts. I initially thought of practicing my self control and getting just 2 but, as you can see from my photo, that did not happen... Rough life, I know. My two favorites:The Caramel de Sel is just salty enough to really bring out the sweetness of the caramel. I would be perfectly happy if I could just spend the rest of my life eating the caramel de sel icing with a spoon. The Meyer Lemon Huckleberry was ever so slightly zesty/tangy in a way that made you appreciate the delightful sweetness that followed. I was getting these to-go, you know, for my "friends", but the temptation was too great. (My "friends" were totally understanding though.)
Nice hip cafe, with great live music each night, can feel the real SF !

Born an raised in the mission district, an this spot by far is thee worst, overall attitude was horrible on numerous occasions,  but whoever the bartender or manager some lady, I couldnt believe how rude this lady was , flat out blaiten disrespectful, all the good places burned , to bad this shithole still sits

I order something @ Revolution cafe on 22nd. A male person was talking mess to me and hitting the table with a knife. His not right in the head. I got my money back from the Cashier person then I left. The lady running the cafe seems to know the male person who was harassing me very well did nothing about the Issue.  I never got my food I told the lady running the café I want my money back and I'm never coming back again.  This is situation happen around 12:25 PM Wednesday May 8th 2019.

My wife has taken our dogs (German Sheppard's) here several times and sat on the patio while getting a coffee or beer without issues.  One day this rude server came out and told us we couldn't have our dogs here because they would scare off customers.  First off it was noon and this place barley has anyone that actually goes in this place at this time. 2nd we walk by the place the next day and the was a lab hanging out on the patio.  I could understand if we took the dogs in the cafe but isn't the point of having a patio is so you can sit outside with your dogs. Whatever...

Born and raised in the mission and utterly disappointed in the rude behavior of staff/manager of this place. I've gone here frequently in the past during quiet times with my dog. Not had an issue. This time Comment was made by this staff person that  " too many dogs coming here" . There were no dogs outside and only 2 people sitting outside at noon on a weekday.  I and my friend had 2 dogs and it was obvious that because they are german shepherds we were asked to leave. It was obvious that if the dogs had been the little squeaky types no comment would have been said.  Overall just rude behavior by someone who obviously doesn't like dogs  because her actions were not necessary as our dogs were behaving and on leash.
Fell in love with this place at first sight! They always have jazz jam sessions in the afternoon. Lovely vibe!

Love this place. Unpretentious, chill, no frills, but so good.If you're looking for a place to kill some time, or even spend a relaxed evening sipping mixed drinks or cheap wine, here's your place. They often have live jazz/music. They have a lively patio. And the energy makes you feel like you're really part of this neighborhood establishment. Wouldn't recommend for date nights or fancy tastes, but otherwise - good spot.

Good live music and fun friendly service staff. Nice selection of beer, wine and food. Only disappointment is small size with limited seating. Does have outdoor area for those wishing to talk instead of listening to the music.

the music is great but make sure you buy something or else the rude bar guy will make snarky comments at you. He asked if I was even a customer and then proceeded by saying "you know we appreciate when people buy stuff" Check your staff revolution cafe.... I will not be looked down upon by your condescending employees for simply enjoying the music.... I will never come here again thanks but no thanks... get some manners

(personal experience) This place is shitty place for food, especially breakfast. Ordered egg sandwich with cheese and ham. Never got the ham. I wanted it on croissant, they didn't ask what I wanted it on. The wait staff was more concerned about the music playing and dancing to take my order correctly.The English muffin wasn't even toasted and no butter.They state it's a 2 egg sandwich but only one egg.I got the driest shittiest egg sandwich I've ever had.I wanted milk for my coffee (I don't like half and half), when I asked for milk, it "was a chore" for them and I got an eye roll for asking for something they were providing but the task of putting out the milk was never done.NEVER GOING BACK AGAIN, EVEN FOR THE MUSIC OR BEER!!!
First time for me to visit SF and mission district and this cafe is classic. I was meeting friends there and we sat outside, but there is live jazz band which will definitely be a spot to chill.

These reviews make me laugh! The recipe for having a great time is to chill out, order a beer, sit down, either listen to the music or watch the fun happening outside, and just be a part of the scene. It's not complicated (ambitious? Do all of these things at the same time, knock yourself out!).If you want killer service or food, go around the corner where there are a zillion options. If you want to chill, listen to music, have a beer, and watch people - you can't go wrong here.

If I could give this cafe zero stars I would. I tried to order a latte with soy milk and the cashier (if I can even call her that) wasn't only a rude ass with her short answers but basically gave me whatever the fuck she had "left in stock". Don't advertise that you have soy milk on your menu then bitch and moan and say "they ran out in the stores I heard it on the news" because it'll make me think your incompetent and not good at sarcasm. If I wanted the sass I would've went to Starbucks. Latte itself was abysmal.

out there on 22nd street down in the mission what will in a few years be the edge of the mission arising out of some sort of inverted twisted and rounded mobius strip of a joe south song i love her she loves me i don't fit her society whoa-oh-oh edge of the mission that is becoming zuckerberg's missiontucked away on 22nd on the corner of a nouveau transpo alley tables on a little porch outside tables and built-in benches inside small bar for ordering in the backis the revolution cafea coffee house that yes maybe it was your father's coffee house heck maybe it was your grandpappy's but that's cool it's still there and for those of you who can't wait until the end to hear the up the down for those of you that like to charge the clit and forego the foreplay the place it's got my thumbs up it's my go-to place when the universe beckons me to the missionbut for the more curious but those who insist on details you can look on medium search for joeschmuck look for eat a peach with love and know that the revolution cafe is tolerant of all friendly to most and very special for those in the knowour barista bartender she can pull a draft or an espresso or both effortlessly casually she should be smacking gum and calling you darlin' maybe she does just not me but she's sassy sardonic and sincerely silly presence of a woman who could give a shit about your opinion unless it agrees with hers then you're ok you're a decent personpeople with sketch pads and utensils of color distribution tend to gather here there's an artist here today he sits outside alternating between his own chin and hismandatory black chuck taylorsdefinite hipster with a five hundred dollar digital canon bandoleered across his shoulder not tech bro more a couple several rungs down the economic ladder and admire his etchings give him a squeeze and a wink whisper nothings sweet or otherwise into the ear resting behind the bouffant and instantly i'm jealousbut he soon leaves with his little red lunch box of pencils and charcoals and admirer's phone numbers and facebook accounts and the cutest sparkliest chica of the bunchand inside is the mellowest chillest thirty-seven piece jazz band complete with jazz ensemble i still don't know how they squeezed them in there like some swinging cool and groovy clown car the jazz ensemble they play brubeck to cover up the droning roar of those flying fascists buzzing our burgh marketing their murder machines while trying to coax via some sick sort of sinister pied piper routine coax our children to sign on the dotted line or at a minimum have them be sun-yellowed vinyl top with matching yellowed whitewalls and naugahyde bucket seats a raspy voice sneeringhey wanna piece of candy little girl and if you wanna read more well i told you where to go just visit medium and look for joeschmuck

Everyone who visits the Mission should hit up this spot. Lucky if you're around when they've got live music playing. Interesting personalities abound. I've never had the food but ambiance and drinks are solid.
I haven't been here yet. I want to but I can't seem to get any action from the Music Calendar. It has not loaded for me for about 5 tries. Guess it's for locals only.

So disappointing! Came here with my husband to meet up some friends. Ordered a beer and a tea. 25 minutes later our friends arrived and ordered coffee and drinks (5 people). Ordered at the counter and taken everything to our table no service! This "Italian" server brought one small plate of hummus and told us "for parties of 6 and more we charge 20%".So here are my thoughts,  first  we are not together,  therefore I fee we should not be charged automatically 20% on an order of 5 people. Jokingly we told her "we leave here, 41 years in the city". I understand that tourists are not familiar with the tipping "in restaurants" in the city. She "placed in question that we were not together"  seriously? In addition. The $ 10.00 she asked for its even more than 20%. That said we don't mind to tip even 25% if "deserved" but her answer such as " shame on you you can go somewhere else" I believe is the disappointing and unacceptable as well as extremely unprofessional. She definitely needs to be coached on people skills and customer service or change job since clearly she is not getting paid enough given her attitude.

I'm a longtime customer here. No more. I was just yelled at as I used the restroom "Restroom is for customers only!!" 4:30 friday.  The one time I just needed to use it without purchasing anything. But I am a customer and have been for 10 years. No longer and won't be having our weekly get togethers here anymore. SO unnecessarily rude and aggressive. Shame on you.
A good place for locals to get good yet affordable meal and drink.  The live bands are always enjoyable to listen to.  Outdoor seating is a bonus!
Absolutely unique place that is a wonderful combo of live music every night, amazing crowd and lovely friendly bartenders.

I am a tea drinker so it is nice to find a coffee place that takes tea seriously as well. They serve Rishi tea, which is great, and if you get it to stay, it comes in a very nice tea mug, not a coffee mug, which was a great touch. My husband had a latte that he said was also delicious and we got food as well. The apple cider donut and the fig/goat cheese/honey toast were both delicious. It was really breakfast perfection for us.

Clean and bright environment, good music, friendly staff and delicious milk alternatives including house-made almond and cashew milk. First time trying Nitro coffee. Will be a neighborhood go to.Just heard they will be (or possibly already are) offering a $75 cup of 803 coffee, I'm not that much of a coffee connoisseur but maybe someone in SF is Last time we were here I ordered 2 of the same drinks, I got one then waited about 5 minutes and the second one never came. I went to the counter and they apologized and quickly made another and said the way it was entered into the system was wrong and it didn't appear on two lines so it wasn't clear there were two drinks. But again the issue was quickly corrected.
The coffee was okay, nothing delicious. I got the cream cheese rhubarb pastry which was okay. Not blown away by this place and I was expecting much better based on other reviews.
Loved this place! Went this morning for coffee and pastries. The morning bun and avocado toast were delish! I want to try the lox toast next time. Coffee was tasty and strong. My new go-to!

Stopped by Klatch to get a bite during my morning walk in the neighborhood. Found a very pleasant, mod interior. The decor is  spare with open space, floor to ceiling windows along the two sides facing the street. A lot of natural light making the cafe feel more spacious. Blond wood, concrete and glass.There was a tempting display of Craftsman & Wolves pastries. Lovely to look at & nice to know I don't have to haul myself to the Mission to get these goodies.I'm not a coffee drinker so I can't speak about their coffee-related beverages. Just went to pick up a pastry and ended up choosing a chocolate croissant. Since this is delivered from C&W of course the pastry is room temp. When I have the pastry in hand, I notice it feels very light & airy. The croissant is tinted light brown so it looks like there is chocolate in the pastry dough. My first bite I find the taste very faint. The sugar on the outside gives the croissant it's hit of sweetness. Biting further in I find the finger of Valrhona chocolate that I was looking for. It's a t-i-n-y finger of chocolate so I'm mixed about this. Is this to assuage feelings of guilt about eating this indulgent pastry or in keeping with the light image? Je ne sais pas.There are a few cool coffee magazines for aficionados lying about. The workers are busy keeping the flow behind the counter going. Since this cafe offers fresh savory food as well, I notice there's prep going on to make avocado toasts. Maybe next time.Back to the chocolate croissant. I'd say it was disappointing. Nice & light but I was looking for more flavor. I don't taste the buttery richness that I look for in a croissant. It would also be nice if there was a little more Valrhona chocolate. That's just my inner glutton speaking. At $4.85, it's not an inexpensive pastry. So I'll look elsewhere for these treats.Overall, I like the ambiance and service at Klatch. The cafe is still relatively new. So we'll see how it settles in. But definitely a nice change from going to other chain coffee shops. I'll be back to check out more next time.

Was excited about this place ever since I saw the signs advertising the opening. Since they opened I have been three times and each was disappointing. The batch coffee is acidic and the pour over was watery. One small plus is that the guy did a good job steaming the milk for the latte but I barely tasted the coffee. No power outlets and rude staff add insult to injury. At the prices this place isn't worth it. Peet's is around the corner and Contraband is up the street.

The pastries alone would bring me back. Coffee is good, they have house made vanilla and caramel hard to find in SF. Owner is responsive and kind and just gets it. Pastries are the bomb and interior sparkling clean.

Stopped by for a quick pastry and latte pick me up. Was very happy to have some delicious creme brûlée style latte (more sugary than my average expectation but it was extremely delicious). The chocolate croissant with churro style sugar also perked me up with each delicious chocolate chip-filled bite.

So thrilled to see a new coffee spot open up right by my morning bus stop, but I questioned how good it'd really be. It is flippin' DELICIOUS!!! Having been back at least 3x in the week, I can confidently say they serve one of the best vanilla lattes I have had to date (the whole milk one was best, but nonfat milk works well for more frequent latte fixes). The pastries are from Craftsman and Wolves and perfectly pair with the caffeinated beverage of your choice. My fav so far? The apple cider cake donut. Last time I popped in, I noticed a breakfast menu (they also have lunch-y foods like avo toast)- will need to try out something the next morning I'm there.

One of the few spots that pulls a great espresso. Speak with the baristas to understand what type of flavors they're pulling today. It often differs from whats on the bag, and is surprising when someone gets it right.Thrilled that there's finally a good coffee shop in the neighborhood. Space is clean, staff is friendly, and the team is receptive to feedback (they lowered the music volume and are bringing a sound team to make it a more pleasant experience). Also get that cookie with an espresso from Craftsman and Wolves. It's dope.

Good lattes and service. Clean, roomy and has wifi. Excellent for groups or individuals. Baked goods were just ok. Everyone was happy and nice. My friend was afraid to take the full cup of latte so the worker brought it to our table - so friendly and nice. Recommend this place for work and relaxing at. Will go back again!
Great coffee and great pastries (they order from Craftsman & Wolves, a delicious local bakery). Clean and comfortable inside seating area.

I wanted so badly for this coffee place to be good but after 2 attempts at two different orders, I am not planning on returning. The coffee is very expensive ($6.50 for an iced coffee with milk) and I went back wanting a plain iced coffee and they were out of cold brew (coffee shop doesn't have coffee?) so they offered me an alternative, nitro brew, for a dollar extra ($5). The first thing I noticed was it was sour. Upon notifying the barista, she assured me this was the intended flavor of the coffee (I trust her if she said it was, but I personally don't enjoy sour coffee, maybe that's just me). If I am going to get a simple coffee order such as an iced coffee, I plan to go elsewhere to get it simpler and cheaper.

I think this place is new! We stopped by this place since our friend lives nearby and we were going to her place later in the evening. The ambiance is quite nice, with long wooden tables and chairs, and wide windows that allow you to get plenty of sunlight and to see out into the streets. They have a selection of pastries that look quite nice including kouign amanns, and a variety of coffees. Unfortunately there weren't too many options for non-coffee drinkers like myself, and the prices were a bit on the expensive side (most coffees were around $4, shakes were $7-8, and pastries were $4-5). Still, they have fast free wifi and a nice space to work!

Legit Nitro cold brew. The nitro cold brew was very smooth and had very little acidic taste, probably one of the smoothest nitros I've had. It had the signature cascading foam like a Guinness. Highly recommend.

One of our favorite coffee places!! They originally started in SoCal. LA to be exact! Everytime we were in LA, we would make it a point to stop in. They've recently opened here in SF (Franklin St). Soon to have another location in the Mission. This is going to sound funny (and I happen to be severely lactose intolerant). My very first time at Klatch, I ordered a mocha shake. Back then, pat milk was just starting to hype up, and I saw they had oat milk on their choices of milk. Me getting too excited, I told the lady I wanted a mocha shake with Oat Milk. She looked at me kinda funny and started to explain that their shakes are made with ice cream that contains dairy....I thought for a second, and said, what the heck! Let's make it anyway! She smiled and said ok!! That was the start of the love life between oat milk and mocha shake at Klatch!!! Lactose intolerant or not, best mocha shake ever!!! At this location, they serve pastries from Craftsman and Wolves, another one of my favorite places!! Come to Klatch Coffee for some really good coffee. Oh hubby loves their cold brew as well! We also ordered pastries: smoked ham, swiss cheese & mustard croissant and the hidden star apple cider cake Donut w/ cinnamon sugar!! Staff is awesome!!!
Excellent coffee and Craftsman & Wolves pastries in a bright, new space.  A great new addition to the neighborhood.
Great coffee and the roasts are scrumptious as well. I had both the goat cheese one ( sweet) and the avocado (savory) and both were great treats with the coffee. Will be back!!

Finally Klatch is in SF. This is my favorite coffee roaster. Even with the likes of saint frank, sightglass, and others I still preferred to get my coffee beans from Klatch online. Space is super clean with great food from a local bakery and a wide variety of beans for purchase- oh and WIFI (unlike every other good coffee shop in SF).

I stumbled upon this place while walking around looking for a cafe in the area, and I'm glad I did.  The seating area was really spacious, clean, and modern.  The staff were also super friendly and welcoming!I had a cold brew and it was really smooth and easy to drink.  I would have added a bit less ice, but aside from that, it was solid.  They didn't have wifi when I stopped by, but they said that they will have it after this upcoming Monday.  Once that's up and running, I'll definitely be back the next time I need to get some work done.  Definitely stop by if you're ever in need of some decent coffee or a good working environment.
Food is good, but the tasteless music that they blare is a turn off and makes it unpleasant to eat on the premises.

Unfortunately,  this location is not as good as it used to be.   Very sad because we used to love this place for lunch.   Last two times we've been here it was dissapointing.   The avo toast had zero cheese,  hardly any tomatoes,  and the poached egg was cooked through.  The toast on the fried egg sandwich was barely warm and the bacon was barely cooked .

Highly recommend the cheesecake!We came here on a Sunday at around 4pm and got lucky to have the last slice of cheesecake!! There was also no pastry left so definitely come earlier. The cheesecake was so light, fluffy, and creamy at the same time. It had the perfect balance of sweet and tangy. I also thought that it had a hint of citrus which gave it a refreshing touch. When I got the cheesecake I thought it was pretty big and I would have problem finishing it. Turned out that it wasn't enough! lol. I think I could have eaten a whole other slice. The crust was so good too, different from regular crust. One of the best American cheesecake I've had!
