For the area, I give this place five stars for 4 reasons:*No lines*Great coffee and pastries (but these can be sold out by mid morning on the weekend)*Large portionsTheir wi-if is strong and it's such an easy place to get a filling breakfast when most other breakfast places on the weekend in the area can feel a bit greasier and are super busy, all morning long on the weekends. I'm v happy they moved into the area!!
The $14 avo toast (before SF taxes) lives here.  Lots of hipsters and IG photos. Food was pretty good and their cheesecake is amazing.  Very SF.

One of the best butter croissants in town! I usually grab one on the weekends and being em home to make a breakfast sandwich. The almond croissant and the matcha doughnuts are really good as well if you want something on the sweeter side

This bakery is so GOOOOD! I've had the sandwich, the croissants (my fav), and today I got the hazelnut tarte. The 4 stars are because the past two times I've come ~1:30 or later and all the croissants are gone. The blood orange one, I'm salivating thinking about it and disappointed I couldn't get one of those stuffed croissants.The space is open and airy, you can bring your dogs. There's no wifi so you'll need a hot spot, but it's a great place to hang out, read, etc.
Croissants are out of this world.  Really different and interesting flavors.  They are also nice and flakey.  The avocado toast is also pretty good.
This is my $23 salad to-go that I waited 40 minutes for after service with an attitude. I work around the corner and won't be back.

Visited two years ago when I visited SF. I remember they had some creative pizza slices, so I decided to visit again this time. Inner decoration is typical SFy manufactory style. Good for insta. I had avocado toast this time. Oh. My. Gosh. I know it's $14 but you gotta get this avocado toast. It's so good. All ingredients are so fresh. Tomato chunks and pea shoots really add certain aroma into the taste. Poached egg on top is a bonus. York goes well with the bread. Seasoning is very balanced. Everything is subtle, making you sort of feel the layers of the taste subconsciously. Anyway, it's my last meal in my 5-day visit to SF this time. I'm gonna remember this avocado toast. I hope next time when I visit, it's still here. (Sadly found some of my previous bookmarks are marked "closed" on yelp. Oh the competitive SF food industry. )

This place is very SF. Expensive pastries, avocado toast (yes, I ordered it), and fancy coffee. I ordered 4 pastries, 1 avocado toast, and 1 matcha and the total was $42. SHEESH. The selection on a Tuesday late morning was pretty minimal. There were about 3 types of croissants and a handful other pastries. The monkey bread is SPICY, fyi. I had no idea that there was cayenne all throughout until I gave it to my kid. Haha. The space is well... spacious. There's stadium-level seating that I've first seen at Boba Guys in San Ramon but you can work up there if you don't care about back support. Otherwise there are plenty of other tables, and those will get quickly filled up as lunch time nears.If we're comparing this place to Mr. Holmes or B. Patisserie, I think it's better for lunch but the aforementioned two are better for pure pastries.
Yum! Everything here. The croissants, Belgian chocolate cake (amazing), cheesecake, avocado toast, falafel salad, cappuccinos... Great decor. Couldn't love this place more.

The coconut cream croissant... ohmygawd. I'm going to have dreams about this one. The croissant is perfectly flaky and the filling is so light and delicious. And of course I've been trying to limit my croissants but now this?! Ruining me!!

Bakery is not bad, but their breakfast was kinda a joke. I got their Breakfast plate ($17), which came with scrambled eggs, potatoes, turkey sausage and a baked good of your choice. Aside from the Almond Croissant I picked, the rest was so bad. For the price, I was expecting something like what I'd get from Plow. But their sausage was dry, potatoes were bland and no crispiness on the edges, and eggs were just slightly better than Mickey D's. Next time I will just stick with their croissants.

We went for breakfast while on vacation on the recommendation of a local.  We had a breakfast sandwich, loose leaf tea, meyer lemon croissant (yummy), goat cheese and spinach quiche and fresh coffee.  It was a weekday and there was plenty of seating and friendly staff.  Nice place a few blocks from Market street.

Coconut croissant? The best thing ever. Avocado toast? Yum. Their 'pizzas'. Fantastic. Great service. It's always full. The prices are so San Francisco. Not sure what was happening today but it was so freaking hot inside. Hope it was just a broken ac because in summer it's gonna be a total sauna.

I didn't really like the drink or food at this place. The girl serving was nice but the quiche had no flavor and practically no goat cheese and my drink was mediocre at best. What was most annoying was when we asked for our drinks to go but they came in regular mugs. We asked the barista to switch to Disposable cups and he just handed us the cups to pour the hot drinks over the counter ourselves. Come on dude.
Great Ambience, food is Amazing- Creative- nutrition conscience Great coffee barI wish they have more space to seat the crawl during breakfast !

The avocado toast is total perfection. My husband and I got into a serious marital conflict over the last banana croissant, but we survived by getting a couple of close second place finishers. Everything was on point.

Beautiful, open space. Friendly, fast service.  Croissants are flaky and buttery (as expected from a top notch bakery). Flavor profiles of the pastries are delicious: turmeric monkey bread, ginger banana croissant, za'atar and orange blossom croissant, and passion fruit and yuzu tart. Prices are on the higher end. If you're in the neighborhood, it's worth a stop in for a treat. Look forward to returning.

Fantastic quality latte and delicious bagel sandwich all for $10. Amazing find! I'm so glad I stopped in and I will definitely be back. Friendly service, about 8 tables, and even some outlets. Nice place to sit and enjoy you snack and drink.

A cozy neighborhood spot with a nice tea selection as well as good coffee. Service was friendly. I got a cappuccino and spinach quiche, the quiche was good and came with a lettuce tomato and broccoli salad on the side. I could have done without it honestly,  there was no dressing so I didn't eat it, it seemed to be there to get a higher price. But it did look fresh.

Wanted to skip Starbucks and go local.Four people working. Handful of orders - nothing wild. It is 945am on a nice Friday. 15 minutes later I have my coffee. I took the risk because I had some extra time. Just thankful I didn't make myself late to work. They started making the coffee 10 minutes after I ordered it. There were two people ahead of me in line...Not organized, and appreciate the person behind the counter that recognized it. Have come here in the past and enjoyed it but for me, not great for my commute towork - better for a day with a book. And I WILL be back for that day. Because the vibe is really great

Neighborhood coffee shop right next to the laundromat. Nice mellow vibe. Too bad they're already out of the croissants for a little ham and cheese snack this morning to go with coffee. Ordered the bacon quiche which was the special today.

Been a regular here for 12 years. I love this place. The staff is friendly, fast, accurate and there's always good music playing. They are very generous with bagel toppings and the best latte in town. Support local!

I just moved to the NOPA neighborhood and have been sneaking around the area to test the cafe's, and this one is a gem! Their building blends right into the character of the neighborhood, and once inside it's super cozy with a rustic bohemian vibe. There's a lot of the menu I haven't tried yet, but their pastries are delicious and I think my favorite drink so far is the iced latte with oat milk -- very creamy, well-brewed espresso, and the roast is not too acidic or smokey. Baristas are super friendly and attentive, and maybe it's packed during certain hours but in the middle of the day on a Wednesday it's not crammed with laptopers like a lot of the places on Divisadero. Not sure if it's dog friendly yet, but they have a small outside sitting area as well and the park is only a short walk away. I can't wait to try more of their menu!

it's ok. if you like blue bottle, ritual you won't like it here. overrated by the yelp people. especially in sf where you find great coffee, it's an OK place. the music, style is nice and grungy if you are stylish and all that. small and airless seating space though.

I've been a regular here for years. Everything is delicious and the staff is super friendly. Great spot to get something to go but also nice quiet space upstairs to hang out or work on your computer. Best bfast bagel in the neighborhood!
My go to coffee shop! I get my morning drip here, and beans for the week. Ali is so friendly and always remembers my order. This place is a great, neighborhood staple.

My favorite coffee shop in the bay area. This a truly neighborhood joint, but everyone is welcome. Ali, the owner, is a longtime fixture in the neighborhood and can pretty much tell you anything you need to know about SF history, politics and personalities. The most important thing: you get an extremely good, strong, smooth 16 oz. coffee for $2.30. Excellent sandwiches, soups and pastries as well. A real Western Addy treasure.
Happened to be in the area for work , stopped by for a coffee and bagel . Very nice staff . Speedy service. GOOD COFFEE Looking forward to my next visit .

I've been here twice since moving to the neighborhood, and can already tell I'll be a regular.PROS:-When you buy a bag of their beans, you get a free 12 oz coffee-Soy milk at the coffee fixin' counter-Spicy chai soy latte was great-WiFi is fast and reliable.-Enough table space for working-Chill vibe, nice music-Friendly staff-Wide variety of food itemsCONS-My banana nut muffin was good but not sure where they get their baked goods from. I really like going to cafes where I can get a fresh croissant to go with my coffee.
I love the iced lattes here! I appreciate how they spend a lot of time and effort for each drink. The natural lighting is beautiful inside and it's truly a homey neighborhood café.
Best mocha I've had in a while. Super friendly staff. Bagels and cream cheese at least $1 more expensive than most places but doesn't matter because coffee is cheap but really yummy.
Awesome service here! We had two coffees and a heated turkey croissant. Cashier was super friendly and recommended the croissant sandwich, offering to heat it up for us. I'd come back :)
The Best Little Coffee Shoppe In San Francisco ! Coffee & Teas , Waters & Juices . GREAT Sandwiches & Bagels , Cool Vibes Music ! What Can I Say , It's The Best ... : )
the beverages are quite meh and lack consistency but i will undoubtedly keep visiting because of the convenience and charming grungyness

Stopped at this place because it was close to my friends apartment and convenient while visiting but have come back a second time when it was not so convenient because I had the best soy latte ever. Really good, not expensive, easy peasy.

I got hot cocoa here before, and it was good. What prompted me to write this review, though, was that they let my 3-year-old use their restroom after they had already closed for the day, and we hadn't even bought anything. Potty accident averted!I thought the world should know that those are the kind of people who are running this place!

Typical frumpy, grubby SF neighborhood coffee shop. Good bagels and friendly service but no window shade to block out the obnoxious sun. As a result a lot of tables in this small place are left unoccupied even when it's busy. Too bad the owners can't invest in some shades. Also the service is a bit slow. Maybe another cash register when it gets busy would help. In any case it does not seem like the space is used very efficiently.

I like this place, but sadly they get so mobbed that sometimes getting in is impossible.  They have very fresh desserts and food here.  Their matcha croissant has a nice color and texture.  Yummy ginger matcha.  I like their cake with the cinnamon red bean cream.  Desserts are flavorful and light.  Their prices are high.  Portions are small on the food, but well prepared.

If you love matcha this is the place for you! I've always being looking for places that provide dishes and beverages with high quality Matcha. It doesn't doesn't only have good quality Matcha but it incorporates the ingredient beautifully with the dishes and beverages! If you're not looking looking for Matcha there are other items on the menu that are delicious! Alos the pastries are delicious!

Black Sesame Banana Almond Croissant was so so good. The flavor combination of the black sesame, banana, and almond balanced each other well. I wouldn't have thought to mix black sesame with banana but it worked. The black sesame definitely made the croissant seem less sweet. The croissant was really flakey and crispy. So worth getting!Matcha Latte was definitely better than other ones I've had. You could taste the matcha and I really liked how it wasn't super sweet.Stopped by on a weekend around 9:30am and it was pretty crowded. It's a order at the counter and find your seat kind of place. Will definitely come back to try other things on the menu but it's definitely on the pricier side.

The PERFECT place for matcha fiends!!! I'm obsessed. I always make it a point to stop by whenever in the mission in SF! Love the matcha quality, cute aesthetics, and variety of food they serve. It has always been consistent with every visit and never disappoints. My go to is obviously the matcha latte (different dairy options ofc), matcha cream pie, and the cheesecake! This place does get pretty packed, and they sell out of certain foods sometimes :-(

Updating this review to 5 stars. This place has been opened for about a year, and it's POPPIN'. Literally. We came at 9:15am on Sunday morning of a three day weekend. It was a PACKED HOUSE, say whaaaaaa. Dang, people are committed to the cause of gettin in IG photos with the good morning light. Anyway, onto the menu. I've tried a few of their drinks. Their matcha is delicious. For a more unique drink, try their hojichata. I also like their black sesame tea cake because it's not too dense or sweet. They have a good selection of pastries and savory foods. Service: 5 stars! That's the really reason I updated this yelp review to +1 ( or + star). We wanted to hojichata, but we couldn't remember the name of it and  didn't see it on the wall menu. So we ended up ordering the hojicha latte. We got it and were disappointed. Too much milk, meh. Give me that hojicha, rice, cinnamon, vanilla & agave (hint: those are the ingredients in the hojichata). My friend asked the staff about it, and they said the hojichata was on the paper menu. Que lastima, we misordered! Fret not though, the staff happily replaced our drinks with no extra charge. They were busy at the time, yet they were extremely friendly about it. Because of that service I said "I am going to update my yelp review". And now here I am. The end.

A beautiful place for matcha connoisseurs, tea enthusiasts and lovers of sandwiches. We had a mix of food such as the egg sandwich, Katsu Sando, matcha cream pie, matcha latte, hojicha latte and matcha cream puff. Out of everything we tried the best item was the Katsu Sando! It is $16 sandwich but the tenderness of the meat, the soft bread and flavorful sauce made it worth the price. Definitely would order this sandwich again. I'm a matcha lover but preferred the hojicha latte over the matcha one! Would absolutely revisit again on a less busy day, the ambiance is beautiful, trendy and modern Japanese.

This is a matcha lover's heaven! We came on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed with matcha lovers. The matcha is really high quality and authentic. Everything matcha flavored is strong and not too sweet. We had a matcha parfait, yuzu scone, black sesame strawberry roll, matcha cookie, and ginger matcha latte. Wish our stomachs were bigger, I really wanted to try the lunch food options as well. But everything we had was so good, I couldn't even pick a favorite. It's a cafe style restaurant so you order and then are shown to a table, at least on the weekend. (There is a notice on the table that says on the weekends that laptops are not allowed and you must order food before being seated). The food that is made in the kitchen is brought by a server to your table. Service was good and pretty fast, but we just had desserts and drinks, not the food. Really looking forward to coming back soon and trying the lunch foods. I love authentic little spots like this!

Matchazuke was amazing!! Got the Katsu sandwich and was so good. I definitely want to come back and try all of the food on their menu! Drinkwise, the cold brew matcha and the americano matcha. Unfortunately, both were a little watery.

I had bookmarked this place for a while now, and it has definitely lived up to my expectations. Of the desserts we ordered, my favorites in this order were:1) Matcha Cheesecake with Chocolate Crust 2) Stonemill Cake3) Matcha Creme PieAll of these desserts were not overly sweet and presented the high-quality ingredients extremely well. The Katsu Sando was also enjoyable as the pork was not too oily and was nicely complemented by the light, fluffy bread.The interior is also really aesthetic and modern!

I came here in September with a friend (yes I know it was a long time ago) We ordered the Iced Matcha and the Iced Ginger Matcha. I thought both were decent. Im newly getting into matcha so Im still used to that Starbucks matcha (Dont judge me). I would come back to get a second opinion and tasting.For food, we ordered Chicken Katsu Donbori and the Katsu Sondo and it was delicious! Don't be fooled by the small looking portion. My friend and I were so stuffed we couldn't even finish our Katsu Sondo!

Heaven for matcholics!!You can get Match everything from drinks to food in here. Ordered Matcha latte: above average matcha latte. Hojicha Latte (light sweet): I love Hojicha latte better than the Matcha latte because it has the unique roasted flavor.Sake Chazuke: the bomb! The matcha dashi that they use for the broth is so intense. Katsu Sando: huge portion! The tonkatsu (pork cutlet) is so juicy, and the bread is so soft. Souffle cheesecake and matcha cream puff (Too much food for three ladies, didn't get the chance to try them all.)

It's a great place for those who are into anything matcha related. They have good matcha drinks (and offer oat milk to substitute cow milk, which is a plus), and a wide variety of matcha pastries. The flavors are good, but not as great as you would expect considering the prices. My favorite dessert (the most flavorful in my opinion) is the matcha roll cake. The cream puff is my bf's favorite, but a little too bland for my taste.

My first time at Stonemill Matcha. I was not disappointed. I got the matcha lattes and matcha cream puff.  It was Monday morning around 11 when I came. It was super short line. The service was awesome. My drink was amazing and my cream puff was delicious. It's great place to catch up with your friends. Just chill out. I'm definitely coming back.

I'm currently obsessed with matcha lattes and decided to try this place out with a friend.  We got the ginger and rose matcha lattes and they both were so delicious.  The line was out the door when we went but it does move very fast so don't let that change your mind ... there were matcha pastries and parfaits but we went there after lunch so didn't get to try those. The parfait looked really good,  I might try that next time

My favorite breakfast place in SF. I come here early (right when it opens) and always get the house Japanese pickles, chicken okayu, and the hojicha latte. All three are the best asian breakfast I've had in SF. The chicken okayu is soft fragrant rice porridge stewed in chicken broth with mushroom, pickles, seaweed, and a bunch of other goodness. It's the highlight of their menu and I'm normally a pastry/sweets person. I've also had their matcha latte, matcha affogato, and black sesame cream puff. Everything is good but I still stand by the pickles, chicken okayu, and the out of this world hojicha latte which is the perfect balance of sweet and rice/barley oat tea. Prices are kind of expensive but it's SF so no surprise there. Come here early to avoid a line.
Cute little Japanese cafe with food & delicious pastries! Love the katsu sando, brewed green tea, sesame cream puff with banana. The matcha cookie was too matcha for me and I love matcha!

Have you ever wondered how much caffeine is in a matcha?  If so, do like we did. Wander in to Stonewall Matcha at 4 pm on a Sunday, enjoy some tea and some tea-infused desserts, and then when everyone you went in with is up at 2 am and not at all tired, it begins to sink in that matcha has a lot of caffeine in it.  A LOT.Lack of preparation aside, if you pace yourself (and we did not since our drinks and dessert all were chock full of matcha) Stonemill Matcha is good alternative option for a tea spot in the city.  Our group liked the almond milk matcha.  The warm ginger matcha latte was even better, with a nice shot of fresh ginger syrup.  The interior is minimalistic, from the Scandi- light woods, to the sparce artistic signage and limited, well-selected baked goods in the case, to the steampunk tea making areas, to the simple black pottery. Desserts here are a mixed bag, our favorites being the matcha parfait (sundae) and the strawberry roll cake. Their matcha cream puff looks beautiful, but the cream puff shell was extremely hard and off putting. The matcha pie looked appealing, a fluffy matcha meringue , but the person in front of us got the last slice of the day. Food items are slow out of the kitchen and timing is off.  We had received and finished our teas before desserts had even arrived at the table.All in all, a good option if you like matcha (and don't mind staying up late!)

We were looking for something new to try out on Mother's Day. We are lovers of Matcha and thought that Stonemill would be fun. We arrived and noticed right away that there was a sense of confusion when entering and exiting. It's a bit tight at the front door and the seating is pretty odd and tight. We all know that sitting outside on Valencia can be a challenge with all the characters both bathed and not bathed. They should really work on that area. Now let's talk about the treats that they serve here. We chose to have a dessert tasting and it was great! We ordered the soufflé cheesecake, black sesame croissant with banana filling, the matcha cheesecake with chocolate crust, a slice of the matcha cake , the matcha pie and finally the matcha parfait. To top it off with matcha Lattes. Not one of them disappointed . Give this place a try for great sweets and all Day energy with there bright green Matcha.

My sister and I stopped by today, and we loved our food! I ordered the ginger matcha latte and matcha cream puff, and she ordered the matcha latte and matcha almond croissant. It was all so good!  I will say that the ginger in my latte was a little strong, but that may just be because I ordered it lightly sweetened. We went there at about 10 am on a Saturday, and the line wasn't too bad!  We had enough time to peruse the menu and narrow down our options (we wanted to order everything).  The staff was incredibly friendly and served us quickly.  I will say that I'm not sure how this place would be considered a good study spot.  The restaurant was super crowded and all the seating is hard wooden chairs, but if that's your jam then go for it!

Great foood and pastries here! I especially love the salmon rice green tea soup bowl and the Katsu sandwich. The salmon bowl was full of unique flavors, just the right amount of salty and sweet, and it was very comforting. The Katsu sandwich was also bomb; the bread was surprisingly soft and melted in my mouth. However the drinks were just okay to me.Tried both hojicha latte and matcha latte but wasn't special.Wish they served normal lattes here/coffee options! Highly recommend for their food!

Bluestone Lane is a chain of Australian breakfast cafes with several branches in SF.  Yes, you can definitely get your vegemite fix here!  We came here for breakfast and although service and food quality was decent, it took a long time to get the food since the kitchen was overwhelmed.  3 stars overall.We ordered:1. The Golden Latte and Beet Lattes were both made with Almond Milk and were pretty good.  The turmeric and cinnamon really gave a spicy kick to the latte.2. Oatmeal was creamy and loaded with coconut, cashews, cranberries and almond.  However, the oatmeal itself had too much sugar added.3. Avocado Toast must have originated in SF and makes for a pricey but healthy light bite.  Here they mashed up a ripe and creamy avocado with some lemon and red pepper flakes.They don't take cash here, so pay by card.

I came here with a friend after Rumble Boxing and both got the salmon toasts. The toast was delicious and the interior of the place was cute and relaxing. This is a good place to go to get coffee and a simple breakfast/brunch.
Slow WiFi, expensive food and drinks, gets crowded. Paid $5 for a super small latte. Can't stand this slow WiFi... had to switch on to McDonald's free WiFi from next door that ended up being faster!

I found this spot on Yelp during a recent work trip and needed a quick lunch in between meetings. Unfortunately I had pretty bland avocado toast and my coffee wasn't anything great either. There's nothing worth returning here for.

Best place to have breakfast in the area! Amazing avocado toast with tasty bread, solid cappuccino, and surprisingly good croissants. I'll definitely stop by next time I'm in the area.By the way, their app is easy to set up and use. I generally hate dealing with too many apps, but that one didn't take much of my time.

AVOID THIS LOCATION. I am typically a big fan of Bluestone Lane. I frequent 2 other locations in the city on a weekly basis. This location, however is abysmal in both service and quality. The employees here are rude and untrained. Case in point: on a recent visit I ordered a regular latte. While I was waiting for my drink to be made I noticed the employees preoccupied with other tasks INSTEAD of making my drink. After over 5 minutes of waiting, I inquired what the holdup was. Apparently only ONE employee at this location knew how to make a latte and she was on break. There were 3 other employees working at the time and NONE of them knew how to make a latte! How can you work at a coffee shop and NOT know how to make coffee?!? I asked for a refund and they unapologetically gave me one. I will NEVER be returning to this location based on this experience.

I went for some coffee and was denied service because they wouldn't accept cash. Cash is US currency and is legal tender for all debts, public and private. I'm done with this place. This is discrimination at its best

The cappuccino with oat milk is to die for! Avocado toast is pretty awesome too! Love the ambience and the staff. Very friendly atmosphere. I make it a point to visit this place on every trip to San Francisco.

I don't see what the fuss is all about. It's like Starbucks for hipsters. The coffee was average and lukewarm. The avocado toast was bland and unimpressive.I tried it only once and I went straight back to Blue Bottle Coffee. Blue Bottle's coffee is definitely way better.This place is pretty to look at, but the tables don't turn often enough and we had to clean our own table.

Unfortunately this place is not what it use to be. Food quality is nominal. Don't bother ordering anything but the avocado or salmon toast. Everything else is old, and slimy. Workers don't seem happy any more. They have one person collecting your dishes while your still eating. Obviously in an attempt to get seats freed up. What happened Bluestone? Your rainbow bowls and oatmeal use to have fresh fruits and vegis. Now I'm lucky if I can eat even 1/2 of my meal1 -  for coffee 1 -  for seating
Espresso the way it's supposed to taste, not the corporate way.  Delicious small meals like smoked salmon on whole grain bread.  Fresh-baked goodies.  They do not take cash so be ready for that.
There're a few seats here. You can expect it's usually full cuz the food and coffee are good.The avocado toast was great and fresh.The mocha was good and smooth. It's a nice place for tea time

Came here per the suggestion of a friend and ordered an Americano for about $5 before tip, which is expensive. It was a decent Americano though. My friend had the avocado toast and an iced coffee for almost as expensive. I guess you're paying for the location. The avocado toast was yummy and served on good bread, which is a plus, but is it worth the price? Meh. The atmosphere is nice, though, and has such great colors for being right next to an alley of homeless people. I don't know if I'll ever choose to come back, but it could be a nice place to have coffee with friends that isn't Starbucks.

This is the right one of these coffee spots to visit as they do a full breakfast menu. I think the breakfast bowls are amazingly good, the coffee is spot on, and I enjoy the fact that they open at 7am for those of us with some jetlag who skipped dinner. I come here pretty often, and look forward to staying downtown so I am nearby.

Absurdly overpriced! Also, given the price of the salad bowl (14$), I expected the poached egg to be poached and not hard-boiled. Other than that, the coffees are pretty decent and the ambience of the place is good.

Their gluten free avocado toast is amazing. I understand how millennial that sounds, but it really is! The avocado is seasoned enough to be interesting without over powering the natural flavor. So good.
A little piece of home (Melbourne) in SF - complete with tins of Milo and Vegemite. And Melbourne prices too... sigh!
Good ambience with clean quarters and plenty of sunlight for having coffee with friends or for some light work! Their Magic coffee is pretty good as well.

Card Only! A friend and I ordered the Avocado toast and Salmon toast and both were good! The salmon toast was full of flavor and I found it delicious: It's served on one bread but it's super fulfilling. Definitely will come back and try something new off the menu!

I passed by this gem of a place on my way to work one day and decided to try it out.  There were a ton of fancy sounding coffee/espresso options on the menu that I as a coffee noob didn't know, and I unfortunately was in a hurry and didn't have time to ask.  So I opted for an old faithful, matcha latte.  The latte came out in a couple minutes and was delicious!  I'll definitely be back sometime to try the toast and their different kinds of coffee drinks.
Best cafe for doing work or studying. I love Oakside because they don't play music. It's not fancy or trendy but they make a good dry cappuccino and the staff is friendly.

Wish I knew about it sooner! I stayed at an Airbnb neighboring this cafe and enjoy breakfast here on my last day. I knew my flight home would be long and tiring so I ordered their BLT ($12). The bacon was thin and crispy to perfection and lettuce/tomatoes were crunchy and fresh. Ordered on sourdough which was slightly burnt but still enjoyable. Sadly, witnessed some hatred towards the staff when a lady couldn't figure out how to forward her email to the desktop they have. To my knowledge the cafe offers printing and if you do not know how to use basic technology do not take it out on the staff.
Lady was nice, my smoothie was a little too sweet for me but my kids loved it. They have a printing service Incase you need to print something for the DMV.

One of the best cafes I've been to in a while. It's a quiet little place, perfect for studying, reading, or just taking a break. Everything was prepared quickly and the food was amazing. The green tea smoothie is to die for, the mocha chai latte is pretty good, the bagels are great and the sandwiches are amazing. Highly recommend
I came in hoping for a decaf coffee.  They didn't have any.  They prepared a decaf Americano.  It didn't have a great flavor.  The barista was not friendly.

YUM YUM IN MY TUM TUM!! Very fresh ingredients and kind service! The owner is very kind and sweet! My husband I walked in for a quick lunch and found ourselves enjoying every bite! Definitely bringing our toddler to enjoy!

I run past this cafe all the time. I finally came in one day when I needed a small break and something to drink.The only matcha drink they have here is a matcha green tea smoothie. Be warned, however, that the matcha is not fresh. When I asked for the matcha to be unsweetened, the staff pointed to a metal container that seemed a little old and mentioned that she couldn't separate the sweetness because it was pre-mixed.That aside, this seems like a great place to work and/or study. The people watching can't be too bad either, since the Panhandle and Golden Gate Park aren't too far away.OVERALL a tough three stars for Oakside Cafe. Not sure if I'll make my way back, but not a horrible experience.

The food is so-so. However there is no better place in the neighborhood to hang out and do some work! Free WiFi, relatively quiet (the blender excepted), plenty of outlets and lots of seating! The ladies behind the counter are sweet and I'm a fan of the neighborhood-y, slightly shabby vibe.
I love the homey vibe in here! Great place to enjoy a good breakfast, relax and prepare for you day!
So so service. You will need a jacket to sit inside since it's very chilly. The smoothies aren't made with real fruit. Nowhere to quick hang your jacket in the bathroom.
Great place to grab a bite and study! Everything is very reasonably priced and tasty. Staff is always friendly.
No nonsense café. Great value. Upstairs area is quiet and spacious.
Sweetest women who work there, favorite spot in my neighborhood that doesn't feel overrun by hipsters... and the prices reflect that
Do NOT get the breakfast sandwich. It's a dry bagel with microwaved eggs. Mine was so salty that I gave it back and left.

Delicious sandwiches, good assortment of drinks and desserts.  Friendly service, and nice interior with variety of seating options.  Don't miss the seats upstairs.Yes, shut the door after you enter and exit!  It does get cold, especially for folks seated near the door.  Note: women are much better at closing the door when they leave. Anecdotal evidence.

Coffee was good. Sandwich was just ok. Staff weren't very nice or personable. They seemed irritated and annoyed that paying customers were coming in to get food and coffee. Body language from the main chaser was inexplicably negative and unwelcoming. I tried killing her with kindness but she wasn't having it. I also observed her serve a few other customers and her tone didn't change at all. I honestly just wanted to order and get out of there because they were so impersonal to EVERYONE. And to think I went there over Peet's across the street because I wanted to support small SF business. I guess I'll get go there instead next time I'm at the DMV.

Quaint little coffee shop. I only had the coffee, no food. Coffee was good and they do have free WiFi so you can get some work done. No complaints there. My knock on this place is the door. I know that seems stupid but it doesn't close unless you actively push it shut or someone opens the door so far wide open that it gets enough momentum to close on its own. After sitting here for a while, the door closed about 50% of the time. Why is this important? Because on days when it's cold outside (like right now), I don't want to be sitting inside freezing because the door doesn't close! I feel like that's a simple fix for a place like this so hopefully this changes soon.
Bad coffee, not friendly service, below average breakfast sandwich. The only thing I liked about this place was free wifi. I will not go back unless I am so hungry and there is no other place open.
Got my order wrong. Service was not very friendly. Food and coffee was delicious. Price reasonable for the city.
I have been there just once. I ordered Bagel with veggies and it was nice.Good and quiet place to it sit.

The first thing I noticed in this place was the unprofessional staff. The guy at the register looked like he wanted to go home and applied zero effort. Next was the touching and scratching of hair while simultaneously working on people's drinks. I should have walked out right there, but I didn't because I noticed a little to late. Now the drinks. The coffee falls flat on flavor and tasted a bit watery, to the slightest extent. I also ordered a dirty chai, which was just okay. The ratios seemed a bit off on this as well.

Had to wait a few hours to check in to my hotel after flying in so came here to sit for a little and have a coffee. The coffee itself was good & it was really pleasant to sit and people watch. I liked that I could get my iced coffee for here in a glass so I sat for a little while which was definitely a plus. I usually don't mind paying around $6 for coffees but my latte was $7 and I've definitely had better. If you're coming here for the atmosphere and vibe I'd recommend it but if I lived here I wouldn't come here specifically for the coffee. Come here earlier- the line was out the door when we left around lunchtime.

Pretty solid coffee shop near the China Town area. I like this place because we were staying a mile away, and wanted a spot to hunker down for a bit in San Fran. Not too many spaces have seating for a mind numbing laptop experience, but this place looked good according to Yelp and we took the chance. All in all, pretty glad we found it; the ambience was a bit loud, and lively with all the people (a good thing for me). The staff were nice as well; I ordered an espresso and their breakfast sandwich. The espresso was clean and not bitter, and flavorful. The sand which has the best runny yolk that spilled all over my computer and pants (totally validating how spot on their egg sandwiches are and how all egg sandwiches should aspire to be).Go to this place with confidence, and a hungry stomach!

I stopped by 3 PM on Tuesday for a midday coffee and snack. I ordered an iced almond milk latte and croissant. The barista had a good attitude and was super upbeat. I love their espresso and pastries! This place has a cool layout and is a great place to stop by if you're around North Beach.
Worst espresso I can remember of, and one of the most expensive too ($3.35+tax). It is so acidic that I had to spit it out and rinse my mouth with water. Disgusting

An adorable cafe with a unique layout. Has enough space to study or work while sipping on their yummy mocha! Lots of natural light and even outdoor tables and benches are available if you want to enjoy the sun when the weather gets warmer.

Love the coffee here. The decor is so aesthetically pleasing and it is close to places where there are lots of things to do. A block away from City Lights! The avocado toast is actually fairly priced! Coffee was expensive, but no more than anywhere besides maybe Starbucks.

One of the best Cafe in SF!! A little pricey, but it worth for the quality. Their cappuccino is the best. I love their hot Chocolat as well. Another reason for me to go there is that they sell the baked goods from Starter Bakery. Almond croissant and chocolate kouign amann are the best!! As for the service, it depends on the staff. Some are super friendly, but some are not.

Avocado toast and coffee were great. Simple and delicious. Service was not fantastic: the guy knew there was a line but was on his phone anyhow and the girl making coffee had to take over. Also... $1.25 to add vanilla (that I didn't even taste). They charge 3% for employee healthcare too, which is cool if the employees are welcoming and actually good. I asked where to put my dishes and was rudely pointed to where. Honestly, won't be back. There are much better places around SF than here.
Cool little hipster spot. Utilized the space well. Coffee was standard, nothing to love or hate.

I have been a long-time fan of the Réveille Coffee Co. truck that sets up shop a couple blocks away on Sansome, but this was my first time taking my talents to the brick and mortar. While I can surely understand why some have described the space as feeling cramped, I had no issue finding a spot at one of the counters on a rainy weekday morning.My go-to here is typically the matcha latte, which has such an incredible flavor. This time I went with just a regular ol' latte, though, and found it to be nearly just as delicious as the matcha lattes I am so accustomed to. The physical store also has oat milk, which fans of my reviews by now know I am a gigantic fan of. If you haven't had an oat milk latte, you haven't lived yet.Seating can be a bit cramped, as the building is one tiny little triangle on a crowded corner of Columbus. But the internet is great and there are plenty of outlets if you're staying for awhile. They have a kitchen and food, but I was only interested in beverage, so I don't know what they offer. If it's anything like the espresso, I'm sure it's worth a shout.
Disappointed that the hot chocolate and chai tea tasted bland. On the up side, the space is pretty with natural light and lots of bar seating.

I found Reveille to be a bit pricey, even for San Francisco, but you can't argue with the quality - the coffee and tea (and food!) are on point ;). This Reveille is located on a busy intersection in North Beach, so it's such a transformation to walk inside into the warm, cozy (and sometimes quiet, but sometimes loud-ish and busy) environment... Or you can feel free to take your treats outside to hang out in their outdoor seating section, just off the main street and perfect for people watching on sunny days. The staff are friendly and helpful and can give suggestions if you're stuck. Great experience(s) here and already looking forward to my next visit :)

Reveille Coffee Co. (San Francisco, CA)We were staying near Chinatown and found this coffee spot on Yelp.  Reveille Coffee has a 4-star Yelp review average and since the review count is less than 400, I am assuming this place is also new.  We arrived right at opening and the staff was barely setting up the place.  I was craving a cold brew and found it odd that in this day in age a cold brew wasn't even on the menu. That's usually no big deal since a good and strong iced coffee should do the trick.  I had their iced coffee and wasn't too impressed.  I tasted more water, than coffee.  I also didn't get that boost of energy that I was looking forward to.  I was regretting my order just after a few sips and wished I went with their iced Americano.  Overall, my experience was just okay.  The service was at least up to par.

Cool little cafe with a very artsy feel! It's a corner cafe and they used the space well.The mocha and latte we got were both yummy! They have food as well, as there's a kitchen in the back. Great place to stop by to study or for a quick coffee after a meal.

I expected the coffee to be decent, but it was very disappointing. I ordered a regular cup of coffee and and an iced almond milk latte. The cup of coffee tasted like sour hot water. The latte didn't even have a trace of coffee in it. I only tasted milk. I'd expect a $5 coffee to at least taste like coffee. Definitely won't be coming back here. On top of the bland coffee, the workers seemed to be busy chatting with each other instead of caring for the customers.

This is my favorite Reveille in San Francisco! I like the location on Columbus that's lovely for people watching.I dropped by to read a book with a cozy drink. The cafe is quite spacious, and there are plenty of seats by the windows with a lot of natural light. I got a matcha, and it was yummy (not as good as at Stonemill though). There's an xfinity hotspot that works super well + there are plenty of outlets and a gender-neutral bathroom. Bonus points for being super insta-worthy and aesthetically pleasing!

Literally the worst hospitality ever - to echo what other people said no one acknowledged that I was a living person. Even when I ordered, no one spoke to me. It was like I was bothering the baristas. Maybe that's the business plan?? Who can know. Coffee was fine but not would not go back.
Great coffee! But even more amazing chia bowls. Delicious and large and perfect for the dairy free, gluten free People of the world.

Conveniently located right next to Chinatown, and a great place to enjoy coffee and do some work. I appreciate the place actually has outlets, as opposed to the recent trend of some cafes removing theirs. The background music choice is great for focus and light conversation with friends. I'd come here regularly if I lived in the area.

Worst smoke salmon bagel. When u ask for a smoked salmon its not supposed to be cook! Well this guy put the smoke salmon to heat in the microwave wth!? O_o and he says before giving it to me " i suggest you to est the bagel as soon as possible because customers complains that it tastes fishy so i suggest them to eat it fast" so i open it right away give a bite ans feel the smokes salmon hot and disgusting and i say if i asked for smoked salmon cuz its already cook cured to eat why do u heat it up? He says you have to tell me before not to heat it up ! And im like wtf? Everyplce in my entires life never heat up the smoked salmon sir . How am i supposed to know you so dumb that you will heat it up? And he says " well ur supposed to tell me " i just wasted $9 for something i didnt eat and was disgusting as hell. Never coming back

I got the Five Star hot chocolate and hazelnut liquor truffle!  The hot chocolate was decent but honestly, not much home to write about.  Definitely better than a Swiss Miss but, for the price, not proportionately in the range of a Dandelion chocolate.The hazelnut liquor truffle was pretty damn good for just a dollar, though!!  Crunchy, nutty veneer that encapsulates a complex boozy filling.
I absolutely love the truffles. Probably the best I ever had. The shop doesn't look like much from the outside but the flavors are very very special and comply make up for it. Come and try(!)

I ordered here from online here earlier today. The process was extremely smooth. I ordered 16 hazelnut, 8 black and white, 8 caramel, and 8 dark chocolate. It was 36 dollars for the 40 truffles, which comes out to 90 cents each truffle. What a steal!  There was a confirmation email sent to my email, and the order was fulfilled through GrubHub for delivery. It was an estimated 30-40 minutes for delivery, which was extremely accurate. That's faster than if I were to go out to their store, find parking, go inside and order, then go home! I indicated on the delivery notes, that I wouldn't be home and to just drop off the delivery on the porch. A text message was sent to me indicating that the delivery was dropped off. That gave me a sense of reassurance. When I got home, I opened up the packaging, to see the different flavors were put in separate bags and labeled. I put them onto a little tray for the guests when they arrived. The dark chocolate and hazelnut pieces were distinguishable because the nuts used for dark chocolate had a more toasted look. However, I couldn't tell the difference between the black and white pieces with the caramel pieces. Both of those flavors were coated with cocoa powder on the outside. Not a big deal since my guests have no allergies to anything. The only downside are that you can tell these truffles are definitely handmade. Normally, that would be a good thing! But these were a little on the not pretty side as they were rolled in non-uniform circles. It seemed like they didn't put that much effort in making them look pretty. They still tasted delicious. I would definitely come back here in person when I have more time.

I don't know about all the five-start reviews, maybe the flavor is great. But I had horrible experience ordering online and over the phone. The website says offer delivery, but not intuitive. I called and was told the gift boxes showed online were not available and that they don't do delivery. The person told me to use some delivery app, he didn't speak English well - that's fine but not patient as well. He repeatedly said "I'm busy" when I was asking how to choose flavors, then he just hanged up. It was quite a bummer.

I'm a recent transplant from New York. I don't have a dog in the fight, just trying to find good truffles in San Francisco.Apparently the chef here is an alum of XOX. We tried XOX, loved it, but Castro is closer to us, so decided to try them. Hard to believe he's an alum because:a) the truffles at Five Star are *significantly* sweeter (I actually couldn't finish the hazelnut)b) not nearly as smoothc) no complexity to the ganachePerhaps more suited for an American palate, XOX is truly French.So when there is someone else who does the same thing, but better, I'd say thanks but no thanks.XOX is in North Beach. I am yet to find any other good ones in the city. I tried the bon bons at Jade and Christopher Elbo. Jade doesn't know chocolate at all, plus shells are way too thick. Elbo does mostly milk, and I only do dark. I found a fantastic one in Calistoga, though: Earth & Sky. Reccomendations? Leave 'em here!
I LOVE these chocolates. All the flavors are fun and delicious. I prefer the ones without nuts but try them all! There is a crunchy super thin layer. They look ugly but are truly wonderful

Delicious melt-in-your-mouth truffles made by an incredibly hard-working man. They're the perfect pick-me-up to help you walk up the hill, and a box makes a great host(ess) gift. The hot chocolate is also excellent. I haven't tried the other items.
Got vegan truffles for Valentine's Day here. I really enjoyed them. I would definitely purchase again.

Not fancy, just fantastic.  I don't write a lot of reviews - only when I think a place is really deserving.  Five Star Truffles certainly is.I was doing a little job across the street and saw the sign and decided I needed a cup of coffee.  Ended up with coffee and chocolate, then more chocolate.  Everything was delicious and made perfectly.  This place is exactly the kind of place you would describe as a hole in the wall, and be reluctant to tell anyone else about because you would be afraid it would be discovered.The owner is super friendly, thoughtful and considerate, and as far as I can tell does EVERYTHING himself.  He's the kind of guy who recognizes you when you come back, and remembers you.  Make sure to chat with him for a minute and you will see....If I lived nearby I would certainly be back frequently.  I did end up getting twenty truffles for my partner -- who kindly shared some of them with me.  They did not last very long though.  Think I will need to go back, darn it.
The truffles and hot chocolate here are to die for. The Earl Grey flavor is my favorite.

Be careful when ordering online. First their website is not intuitive. I never received an order confirmation email. I had to keep emailing them to find out what happed to my order. They are hard to reach and the customer service is null. When they make a mistake with your order instead of being apologetic and compensative they refer you to their shipping disclosure.
Delicious coffee comes with 1 free truffle.  The coconut truffle is to die for.  Customer service is fantastic as well.  The shop is cozy and clean.
Quick, friendly service; delicious coffee; truffle was absolutely heavenly. Exceeded expectations.

Pretty amazing little coffee shop we walked by just walking back to our car.  Went in for the free truffle to come with our coffee but the Five Star Mocha is very good and coupled it with the Rum Coco truffle.  Would definitely come back!

This business has great coffee and lattes, and tasty truffles! If you buy a coffee they'll give you a free truffle. They are friendly and generous and let us socialize and always welcome new guests and tourists. Awesome community business and really nice people. :)
I accidentally stumbled across this hidden gem. Got the banana. Chocolate and vegan coconut truffles Dee-licious !! A must for your chocolAte fix

Considering how much we enjoy strolling the Castro, Jamie W. and I rarely find ourselves walking on 18th Street west of Castro Street. No particular reason. I just think people like us get used to their routines, which is my roundabout way of saying we had no idea this shop existed until we saw the sandwich board that announced free truffles inside (photo: bit.ly/2kBntdo). Now why would we pass up an opportunity like that? I wanted a little caffeine after dinner, so the idea of buying a $2.25 cup of coffee seemed reasonable to me for a mouthful of sweetness (photo: bit.ly/2kBvrD4).Now choosing which truffle turned into quite a challenge as the display case was full of all sorts of variety from peanut butter to cinnamon dark chocolate to rum coco to even vegan truffles (photo: bit.ly/2laYj2p). I settled on the hazelnut once which was covered in them in pulverized form (photo: bit.ly/2jQlahQ). Oh yes, that was certainly a pop of goodness well worth the mediocre, overheated cup of coffee I bought. Should I come back for the $33 40-piece gift box or the $45 60-piece gift box? Such decisions should be made when I'm standing on a weight scale, so I remember how ridiculous that question is.TRUFFLE - 4 stars...lovely mouthful there though the coffee needs to be thrown outAMBIANCE - 3 stars...just a little shop, nothing moreSERVICE - 3 stars...oh so quietTOTAL - 4 stars...another one won't kill me, right?

Stumbled upon this gem on a rainy morning in San Francisco. I came in for the coffee but left with a box of 20 beautifully handcrafted truffles. The owner gives away a free truffle with each cup of coffee. Once we tried the first truffle, there was no way we were leaving without buying a box of 20 for $15.

This tiny shop is the best! Tons of delicious truffle flavors and vegan options too! Love that I can get delicious vegan truffles that are just as delicious as the regular ones. They also have several flavors of Mitchell's ice cream. Haven't yet tried the hot chocolate but heard is fantastic so it's on my list.
Great coffee. Employees are nice. Just not very organized. There were 3 employees this morning at 7am:  two chatting, only one making cofffes, customers waiting

Smooth, cappuccino. One of my favorite places to get a cappuccino. Compared to sightglass, which I also enjoy, it's much smoother. I could go for either but if you want to get specific, this is what makes blue bottles cappuccino stand out.This spot in particular had a nice interior.

My favorite Bay Area roaster since 2005! Loving it. Their New Orleans Iced Latte is AMAZING! Chicory infused coffee, slow cooled overnight and poured with milk and ice when you order.   If you haven't tried it yet....

This specific Blue Bottle is amazing. All blue bottles have high quality coffee, but this one has the friendliest and kindest staff. They always make sure to take care of everyone that walks in bending over backwards to make people happy.

Fun fact: I used to work at a Blue Bottle when I was 20 years old. I'm ashamed to say that I totally embodied the hipster barista attitude mostly because I was 20 years old but also because that's who I worked with! Coffee hipsters with ironic mustaches who rode fixies. Oh, 2007. It is now 2019 and Blue Bottle is all grown up with its investor money, beautiful standardized minimalist interior design, and fancy floral arrangements. I grew up too and now instead of having a coffee hipster job I have an engineering semi-hipster job. Anyways, this is the location closest to my work and I go here twice a week. What I really appreciate about this location especially is that if ANYTHING goes wrong (they're out of the milk you wanted, they took too long, they gave you the wrong thing) they will do their best to fix the problem and then in addition will give you a card to redeem for a free coffee! I think this has happened 3 times so far and when it has happened  the mistakes were all not a big deal to me. But it was still cool that they do this to make sure you're happy. Hipster attitude has been completely eradicated! Go to Ritual for that lol. (I still love Ritual, JUST SAYING) I usually go for a single origin Africa drip coffee (hipster habits die hard) or a latte with oat milk.

South Park is a hidden gem in SOMA. I live so close yet never visit as often as I'd like. Knowing that Blue Bottle Coffee is here might encourage me, though I have plenty of coffeeshops in Mission Bay where I live. I like that this Blue Bottle location is quite spacious. Once you order the front counter, you can choose one of many seats throughout the coffeeshop.Hopefully this doesn't get them in trouble, but I've brought my ESA husky into Blue Bottle and sat with him at the round table on the right-hand side of the place. Pretty sure they're dog-friendly because there's a water bowl right outside. Anyways, great spot to host groups or just catch up with a friend, which is what I did.Even if you don't hang out inside Blue Bottle, there's plenty of seating around South Park. Definitely sit outside if the weather is nice or go for a stroll around SOMA. Love the Blue Bottle brand and visiting all their locations. This is probably one of my favorites because it has lots of seating and isn't usually very crowded.

Came in on a summer day for an iced coffee. Does anyone drink their coffee hot anymore? Anyways...I heard great things about Blue Bottle, so my expectations were fairly high for this new and trending coffee shop. The lady who helped me was very welcoming and explained the different blends they sold. It's always great knowing that your barista knows their stuff!I ordered the least expensive blend and got it with almond milk. The only issue with Blue Bottle that I have is that I feel like the price doesn't match the quantity nor the quality of what you get. After a few sips, I figured that it was smooth and mellow, but nothing seemed special about it.Perhaps I don't drink enough coffee to have developed a palate for it, but I surely didn't quite get the hype around Blue Bottle.

I'm not a coffee person but generally i try coffee when i have to be fresh. But the coffee here was amazing. I ordered for a mocha with extra chocolate and it had mud coffee flavor which i loved and couldn't stop sipping over it.! The place is super cool and has cute staff members too ;)
Love Blue Bottle! It's always a bit packed but worth the wait. I set up a lot of meetings with clients here and the waffles are always a hit.

This Blue Bottle must be the least efficient one in the city. I waited 25 minutes today from the time I placed my order until my single latte was ready. I've seen busy Blue Bottle and busy cafes, and it doesn't seem to be that this location has more traffic - they just seem incapable of keeping a consistent pace - it's really strange to watch the Espresso station - the people working there just seem to be talking their time, joking with each other and seeming to be trying to figure out how the equipment works, all as the tickets for orders spill out of the machine beyond their ability to even put them in the queue. My latte was terrible to top it off. I give up - this is one Blue Bottle I'll be avoiding.
Stopped on in to get myself an iced coffee. They had a very delicious cold brew. It is relatively small but it felt like it packed a punch so it was more than enough coffee.

Really like this spot!Coffee: DeliciousService: Super friendly as alwaysAtmosphere: Beautiful spot with great lighting and cute furniture. Wish they had WiFi (some reviews said they have it, but when I asked this past weekend, they said they did not).

I don't have a problem owning up to it - on several occasions in the past, I've outright said I didn't think Blue Bottle was worth the hype.  Maybe it's because my taste in coffee isn't discerning enough (Pike Place is my go-to), but I just never understood why Blue Bottle was so revered.  That is, until now.  After all of these years, I finally figured out what the problem has been - I just haven't been ordering the right thing!  I KNEW it couldn't have been me...ha!Out of all of the different ones I've been to (here, Mint Plaza, and the Ferry Building), this particular Blue Bottle is by far my favorite.  Besides how it's (relatively) close to my office, it's also got a great feel to it.  The minimalist look, the spacious feel (compared to its sister spots), the fact I've always been able to snag a seat the times I've stuck around to enjoy my drink...not much to complain about!  Most importantly, they keep the line/crowds moving surprisingly fast!While I'd always stuck with their hot drinks in the past, I finally decided to try something different and ordered the NEW ORLEANS ICED COFFEE with Cane Sugar, Milk, and Roasted Chicory ($4.25).  Now, I don't want to oversell this, but talk about a game changer!  Not only did it have just the right amount of milk and sweetness to it, but it packed the perfect caffeinated punch - not overly strong, but it had a delicious, robust flavor to it.  Delicious!Now, as tasty as my drink was, I'd be remiss not to acknowledge the fact that Blue Bottle is obviously on the pricey side.  Delicious to be sure, and certainly of better quality than the likes of Starbucks, but not all that cheap either.  Not that it would stop me from coming back again, not when I've finally discovered the drink to get to fully appreciate all that Blue Bottle has to offer!FOUR AND A HALF STARS rounded down for now.
GOOD，sort of better than Starbucks. I mean Starbucks is good enough. I ordered Bella Donovan. Enn a small cute place but too many people noisily.

The best Affogato in the city! I love it -- it's a very bright and open spaced café. The only reason why I rated them with 4 stars, is that they don't have any outlets and no WiFi. I had only 1% battery and thought I would be able to charge it here, while I enjoy my Affogato, but that was unfortunately not the case. Overall, very yummy and they play pretty good music.
No wifi. That's crazy in this day and age. WiFi is the main thing I need at a coffee shop. No chai tea either.
Favorite coffee on the block for sure!! Great staff-cool atmosphere-and most importantly, great products!

Very relaxing, lots of space, counters, table along the window, big community round table..Tables along the windows is great natural lighting for people to study and do their work. .Counter space meaning there's a bar where you can watch them make drinks. It's quite nice and relaxing. .Big community round table - great for large groups or one who wants to spread their work all over. .Drink - so I tried their elder berry sparkling water with cold brew. It wasn't my favorite, due to the flavor and not enough sweetness. It was just different, either love or dont like it. They were nice to let me switch back to my regular. .My regular to go to is the new Orleans. But the girl told me they have oat milk and I'm like yasss! It's one of my new favorites so this is how your order it. One new Orleans with oat milk.  .Of thing I noticed about their coffee is that its strong, and they serve you these big ice cubes which slowly melts and doesn't water down your coffee. .Overall this is one of my new blue bottle coffee spot to actually chill when I'm in the city. Comfy with space, and air flowing in and out which is quite refreshing. Thanks for reading and have a yelptastic day!

Hello to the best coffee in www. Blue bottle made me such a coffee snob. Why do you have to be so good. My bf and I are literally addicted to Oat Nola. We could finish 2 in an hour. Yes it is that good.

This Blue Bottle Shop has more flow customer coming and look more upscale than the Berkeley location.I adore their interior design of this corner coffee shop. It amazes and reminds me that, things don't always have to have a bunch of items in a room in order to catch ones eye. Best way to describe it is a simple and mellow vibe close to the SF ball park a couple blocks down.The iced coffee to me was a little bit bitter and water down. I'm pretty sure there was a couple of grounds inside the pitcher that were not caught by the filter. I like coffee strong and that was NOT strong at all. I notice they do "pour overs" big fan of that, and will be back soon to see how well executed they can make one.Just note this place does have support or have WIFI like most shops would. No pets are allowed in the shop, so be ready to tie your four legged friend outside, to the nearest pole within eye distance.
This place cinnamon rolls brings me happiness! There hot Chocolate is amazing and the coffee is too. Im sure all locations are great, but this is where i had my experience.

I used to love Philz, especially when they first opened on mission, the original location, you would even see Phil himself! It was great to watch someone go from having a spot to sell coffee in a grocery store on Folsom and 24th to owning the spot and turning it into his own coffee shop, then to expand into owning multiple shops around the city and in other cities! I even worked here for a time. That was years ago. First of all, we used so much beans for one cup- enough to make a whole family a whole pot of coffee in one cup- and to cut it we use cream w 60% milk fat! That's the whole reason it's 1)addictive 2)expensive. No matter, it was fun, original and it worked! Phil knew what he was doing. The difference between a small and a large is abt 3 coffee beans and 1/4 cup more water, so again- great marketing and great way to get that money. All of this is fine and still much better quality then the cancerous fake coffee they sell at nasty Starbucks. Fast forward to years later- the whole menu has been simplified. Everyone who works there hates their jobs, probably bc they're never gonna get paid enough, so that's understandable, can't blame them. But it certainly carries over to the quality of the beverages which aren't getting cheaper. I don't want to pay $5 for a stomach ache made by a sad underpaid and overwhelmed employee, especially knowing what the quality once was and has now been reduced to, as with any chain store. I'm sad to say that over the last 3 years especially Philz has declined tremendously in quality, but they're making so much money, who cares right? It's just a hype now. All it's done is raised the price of an average cup of coffee in every neighborhood you'd find a Philz. That being said, there's a donut shop across the street with no line that's very affordable although less "cool" and another one on the other corner owned by very sweat Thai women, they have very affordable food and beverages, don't care if you're the coolest hipster in SF, they are more than happy to serve you and you will get that small business appreciation feeling!

Taste: 5Value: 4Service: good!Stopped by this place for some caffeine after a trip to the Asian Art Museum just around the corner, and the quality did not disappoint. Came with some others who had a special roast (sorry guys, I forgot the name because...I don't actually drink coffee) - but they were wowed! This was their first experience with Philz (they are Starbucks people), and they could taste the complexity of the beans. I'm glad it was a hit with everyone. I got my usual Philz go to drink - the mint mojito mocha special! The perfect punch of caffeine without as strong a coffee flavor. It wasn't overly sweet either, which I also appreciated. Thankful that great coffee places make some things for those of us who want (or need) a little splash of caffeine but appreciate some other unique flavor profiles than straight coffee.

Ordered through the app twice and got sweeteners and milk in my coffee even tho I selected none. Customer service refers to "make sure to double check order" even though my order was right in the first beginning. No compensation or anything. Really disappointed paying twice for a mistake made on their crappy app.

Cool!  Chill environment. My first time ordering coffee from Philz and very happy with my experience!Staff super helpful and friendly.  Wasn't exactly sure how to order and when I let the girl who took my order know that, she was very helpful in helping me choose my coffee and customizing it to a tasty perfection. Loved her patience and friendly demeanor. It's busy in here! Always someone at the counter. But the line moves quick and the work flow is really efficient.  I love the organization: you order your drink first, that way they work on it while you wait in line to pay. By the time you've paid, your drink is ready!! I ordered a "Philtered Soul" coffee. It's so fresh and strong. Awesome.I also ordered an egg avocado that I was expecting to be sort of quickly made.  I wasn't expecting it to taste so good and fresh. The toast was so soft and the crust had a perfect crunch to it. They seasoned the toast really well too, tasted like olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper... PLUS a chopped hard-boiled egg was like the cherry on top.  I'm raving about this because I'm so happy and surprised. The first time I ever went to a Philz, I told myself I wouldn't go again because my experience wasn't good at all. I'm glad I came here though because this store is so different and just made my experience good, I'd love to come back.

So I came here because this coffee shop is only available in San Francisco and it was recommend to me by multiple San Fran residents. I really loved the space and environment of this place and the service is impeccable. You go up to the baristas who are really knowledgeable of all the drinks there and will help you pick out what you really need (especially for someone like me who isn't an avid coffee drinker) and then you go to the next line where you pay for your beverage/meal. Everything up to this point was really great, the seating was comfortable, there's free water and a bathroom; but the coffee was no Bueno. I really wish I can give this place a five star because the customer service was amazing but the coffee itself was wayyy to sweet to the point where I had two sips and my stomach was upset. I definitely should have went up and explained but I was in a rush and didn't have time to stand in line. I feel as though this review is semi-incomplete so I do recommend people to come by and try their coffee. If it wasn't for the sweetest, I can see why people love their coffee. Definitely will come back next time for a redo !

Philz gave me chillz... and the sh*tz (but that's normal). The coffee was delicious, but I felt a little attacked by the barista. I am not an avid Philz connoisseur, so I simply asked for an iced almond milk latte, to which he responded somewhat snootily, "we handcraft everything here, so that's not I thing. But I can make something like that". It hurt me a little bit emotionally, but the superb coffee healed me right up.

This is most likely my favorite coffee place to grab a good drink. I usually drink tea and the Philz tea is delicious. The quality sometimes varies based on who makes it and the customer service isn't too great, probably the location. I love Philz and I'm sad they no longer have a location on Van Ness. I walk to this location instead now. The mobile ordering app makes it very easy to pre-order, walk-In, and leave without much social interaction. This saves me a lot of time!

I was inclined to get the Iced Mint Mojito Coffee again (because it's THAT good), but decided to go with a warm drink given the rainy San Francisco weather. I went with the Philtered Soul, a medium blend coffee, with sugar and cream and it was SO GOOD. I'm not huge on my hot coffee being too sweet, so I was worried the chocolatey notes plus the sugar and cream would be a little too much, but it was the perfect amount. Also, big shoutout to Leon, one of the baristas, who made our experience one I will always remember. He had the warmest personality and hooked my friend and I up with a Kouign Amann!
Friendly staff and they are  very helpful for finding the right drinks , store is very large with a lot of seating and they have amazing coffee and I really recommend the Mint Mojito

I must say it's the best!!! As the moment you walk in to the moment you take that sip!! It was my first time visiting this coffee shop before my interview.  The young gal was so nice and not only that we connected on the boldness of the coffee with a splash of cinnamon!! Would definitely visit again-
Not bad. Good service, good iced coffee, nice Wifi. Just a bit pricey, but comes with quality. Would come back occassionally.
Mint mojito is my favorite coffee drink of all time! Creamy and not too sweet. There was a line on Monday around 1 PM, but it moved quickly.

As always, the staff have it all under control. The ordering system keeps everything running smoothly and you'll never wait too long for your drink. If you already know the deal, I don't need to explain about the coffee. For those that don't, Philz make the most wonderful drinks--their iced mint mojito is a life changer and so perfectly sweet, refreshing, and delicious. Sadly the coffee I had here wasn't quiiiiite up to the usual standard. I guess it didn't taste as strong as usual? I'm sure it was just an off day as Philz is pretty much my go-to. Huge space if you're laptopping.

Being from the East Coast, I've never been to Philz Coffee or heard much about it. I ended up here before the Women's March and was impressed with the personal touch this coffee shop chain has. It feels like something straight out of the 90s. Maybe "Friends" would hang out here. The staff was very chill and friendly despite large crowds for the nearby event. Prices were fair too and there was plugs and Wi-Fi which was great because my phone always seems to be dying in San Francisco. I had a chai tea and it was great. I will go back to Philz Coffee again and consider this shop if I'm back in the area.

I'm giving this place 5 stars, why? It's a chain you say, you're so hipster you say....you're so TRENDY--no, I'm friendly. And the workers here are too. Splendid service, prompt and moving, there's plenty space to sit but the only thing is is that being in the location it is, it gets packed and people WILL fight you for charging stations (this almost happened to me once. ALMOST) anyway. I need to stop using caps, I swear it's the caffeine. This place is best for a break when you just need coffee and back to work you go.
Spectacular cup of super clean tasting java  Perfect recommendation, great service, cool vibe

Reasonably priced coffee and tea, great and tasty options, quick service, tasty looking eats (will get some next time). The mint mojito iced coffee was really good! Somewhat limited seating options, but then again I came on MLK day...

Before I go any further, I feel like I need to start this with a disclaimer - I LOVE Philz.  Across every single one I've been to (including this one), I've never had a poorly made drink nor have I had to suffer through an awful experience.  As such, it feels both weird and uncomfortable to be giving them just a three star review.  It's just that, with all due respect, I'm not nearly as fond of where this location is as any of the others I've been to...Like any other fan of Philz that's out there, I've made my way through (most of) their menu and I've found my personal list of go-to drinks.  Mint Mojito, Tesora, Mocha Tesora, Gingersnap, Philz Harmonic...any of these will instantly put a smile on my face!  Specifically here, both the Tesoras and Mint Mojitos that I've had from here were just as good as the ones I've had from any other Philz.Unfortunately though, while the drinks and service have been (mostly) fine, I don't particularly enjoy coming here.  It's not Philz's fault, and the Tenderloin/Civic Center area is improving, but I hate how I seem to get panhandled every time I come/leave here (sorry if that sounds elitist, but it's true).  What's more, with their spot on Van Ness temporarily closed, the lines here can get longer than normal.  Add in how nearby parking isn't always readily available and coming here isn't exactly drama-free.If this happened to be the only Philz that was around, or if I happened to work in the area regularly, I'd be much more willing to endure the hassles in order to get my regular fix of Philz coffee.  However, with so many other locations around SF (and the Bay Area) that are much more accessible to where I frequent, I'll save making a return trip here for the next time I have to go to City Hall or do jury duty at McAllister.  Which, hopefully, won't be sooner and will be far, far later.

This place is great! Not only for the delicious food and drinks (Specifically Canopy of Heaven and Phil'z Ice Tea), but the charismatic customer service. Thank you Leon and Amanda for making our first experience a pleasant and comfortable one. We were at this location because we had to go to the Federal building across the street and decided to hangout at Phil'z for about 5+ hours because the environment was a great one! Breakfast burritos (great portion size)Avocado toast with egg and za'atar (BOMB)Baklava (delicious)

the coffee was pretty good, not crazy expensive, and the cashier/owner(??) was so kind and helpful. the place itself is small but cute, with a couple tables (perfect for a coffee date). highly recommend that you check it out, especially for the service and the atmosphere
Very cute little coffee shop also serve sight glass coffee here. Friendly service as well.

This is my go-to when you want simple but well-made breakfast/lunches. And the coffee is always good. It's a one-person show so prepare to be a little patient when it gets busy - but at least everything is made to order/fresh.
Service is always great. Love getting the kids the fresh squeezed oj while I get my coffee and morning bun.
Awesome coffee and one of the best pastrami sandwiches I've ever had - it was served on delicious dutch crunch and perfectly toasted. My friends loved the service and will definitely be back!

I couldn't muscle through the thick air of pretentiousness spilling out of Ritual across the street, so I ended up here and it was a good choice. It's a cool little place. Chill old-school gypsy jazz type-stuff playing on the speakers while I was there, Good vibe, seemed like the customers coming in were loyal to this place. And the barista was a nice guy.Only reason I knocked it down from 5 stars was due to the pedestrian mainstream-brand food products, stuff like Oroweat bread and english muffins and philadelphia cream cheese, which is all just not my personal preference...so go ahead, half of you call me a snob and the other half call me an environmentalist.

I've recently started going to this spot to do work in the mornings, and I love it. It's a tiny little shop, but it's quaint and has an incredibly well-priced menu. The sun that reflects in through the front windows makes me happy and get good vibes going any day. I'll be coming here frequently while I live in the Haight.

Cafe Mec is a great addition to the Upper Haight neighborhood. The space has been renovated beautifully, and the shop gives off a hip, East London-meets-San Francisco vibe.
