My friend and I stopped in for Iced Coffees and weren't disappointed. The two men working in the store were friendly and prompt. Glad to see these types of businesses popping up in the Haight :)

This is my neighborhood favorite. I could come here and sit with a latte or glass of wine for hours. I feel like I'm in France for the time I'm there. The jazz and international music is fantastic and the live performances on some evenings is incredible. Also, they have oat milk for you fans of it!

I was very happy that this was the neighborhood café during my Airbnb stay in San Francisco.  In addition to the charming French bistro decor, they serve a French toast that is so impressive I immediately FaceTimed it to my family back home!  This beauty was so light and fluffy it was almost like a flan. And served with fresh fruit and a berry compote it was as beautiful as a little birthday cake. Definitely glad that this cafe was part of my mornings and is a great memory of San Francisco.

5 stars:-Because you feel like you are in France-Open later than most coffee shops-cute location-Has beer and wine -Feels very neighborhoody and cozy-Has outside seatingI like how it has a little something for everyone whether it be a nice space to come and do work with a laptop, people watch at an outside table with a glass of wine, or meet up with friends for a coffee.

The number one thing this cute corner cafe has going for it is it doesn't try to be trendy. You know what I mean, like the minimalist white cafes overflowing with plants and paying extra for the Instagrammable factor. Soleil is old school and it's refreshing.I'm still exploring the coffee scene, but the food is okay if you are looking for a bit. So far I've tried the Tortilla Espanol (hard pass) and the Trout Salad, which was actually pretty good and it's a mountain of salad. Overall, Soleil is better for drinks, a lite bite, strong WiFi, and good conversation. Come here if you are looking for a classic old school cafe.
Great environment, exactly the low key place we were looking for.  Mimosa, latte, baguette...yes please.

Just popped in this morning after experiencing an indifferent service and weak coffee from its neighbor down the block. A friendly good morning greeting, great coffee (always serve double shots) and lovely fresh croissants. If I lived in this neighbourhood it would be my go to place.
Excellent food, coffee was good and the ambiance is chill.  We tried the salmon sandwich and the vegetarian with hummus and they were both very good. Toilet can be cleaner.
Liked my coffee, its located at a nice chill area. Service was great, the barista was greeting everyone with a smile and a conversation..exactly how a coffee shop should be.

Walked into this beautiful cafe and decided to order their organic house brewed coffee as well as a cheese danish.  They do have a $4 credit card minimum so if you're just coming for coffee, be aware. The coffee is definitely good quality and had a fantastic flavor to it. It is on the more expensive side but that's the cost of having an "organic" label slapped on it. I absolutely LOVED the cheese danish. The filling was nice, creamy, fluffy cream cheese. Highly recommend ordering this. They had cream, whole milk and soy milk out. Not sure if they had other options behind the counter. There were some fruit flies by the milk.

This was a cute cafe and alot of options. It's very inviting and many areas to sit. As we entered we were greeted by the staff and they asked us if we needed any help with the menu they could help. We ordered 2 lattes, french toast, and a ham and cheese croissant. They were all delicious and came out quickly. The atmosphere in this cafe was very calm and relaxing, a perfect place to lounge about or to get some work done. It's not too busy and a perfect place to meet up with friends. I've been here a few times with my friend and it was always a good experience. I highly recommend this place.

This is a lovely French cafe where I go to do some writing given their free and fast WiFi. This is a cafe where the evening food is just as delicious as their pastries. The service is always warm and friendly. It feels like a spot for locals. The only downside is the prices (which given SF prices is just something you have to swallow). The other thing is that the cafe doesn't have outlets so bring your laptop fully charged. The food is reliably tasty- I really enjoyed my sandwich and the salad was actually quite tasty instead of an aside. The wine list is quite comprehensive as well as opposed to the typical 3-4 options

A must stop in your breakfast rotation in the city. Everything I've had here is right. They know how to prepare fresh food and great coffee's. Whether you know it or not, French coffee shops are your favorite.
I can do the same thing with same quality at home at about the same time. Nothing too special worth the price but the atmosphere is the key- relax

CUSTOMERS BEWARE!I went in yesterday and ordered a hazelnut iced coffee. The coffee was too acidic and I wouldn't recommend it. Maybe they were having an off day since the reviews here seem positive. What prompted me to right this review was after checking my bank account this morning, I noticed they charged $4.75 on my card when I clearly remember my total being $4 (the card minimum was $4). The cashier handed me a receipt to sign and I did. I didn't add a tip and just signed it. They must of tacked on the $0.75 later. This is totally unacceptable and unprofessional. No business should be secretly adding tips to a customer's purchase without their knowledge. I won't be back.
Love this cafe! Came here for the first time just now. Try the chefs salad.  I will be back for sure
Great little traditional café. Good options and prices, GREAT location. I recommend sitting outside if the day is sunny and nice out.

Often imitated but never duplicated! Soleil is the real deal and continues to stand the test of time. I've been coming to this charming cafe for years and only today realized that I've never written a review for it.The staff are great as is the coffee. At some point, they switched to Equator as their roastery, which I personally enjoy very much. The baked items and prepared menu are also on point.

We discovered this lovely cafe today. We loved it. We had the salmon sandwich and the goat cheese & red peppers sandwich. They were so fresh and delicious. The French bred was one of the best we had in San Francisco. We also had their French Rive Sud Pinot Noir to go along with our lunch. It was the perfect combination. The staff and the owners are so nice, professional and welcoming. Try to eat at on of the tables outside in the sun. You will be in for a treat!

Pro: Came to watch the world up at a French cafe and the environment was amazing. Packed house.- latte is GreatCon: I asked the cashier what their best brunch option was (Sunday) and he said the tortilla espanol. So I said I'll take it. There are no prices on the menu so I find out as I pay its $16+ but I figure I'm going to be here for 2 hours so why not and the cashier suggested it as well so it must be really good. Reality check: there was no tortilla and it was the furthest thing from a Spanish dish. See picture. There's sliced French toast which tasted very undercooked and poorly made. And then there's salad and tomatoes surrounding the dish. The title of the dish was misleading and the eggs sorely undercooked. I would not recommend this dish. I didn't eat any of it.
The Spanish tortilla is excellent. I have to have it every time in SF. This time I called ahead while in the umber from the airport and had the driver drop me off at the cafe. It's the best

Stumbled upon this place after having brunch at Kitchen Story! My gf and I were super tired after the long drive from SJ to the city that we desperately needed a pick me up. We were walking around and yelped a few places and decided to go into this establishment! Ritual Coffee Roasters is a tiny little coffee shop located in the heart of Castro. It has a minimalistic feel to it which I digged - bright, open, and airy.I ordered the latte with soy milk and a chocolate chip cookie. The latte was very enjoyable! It had a nice sweetness to it, with a good amount of  covering of hot steamed milk. The chocolate chip cookie was also delightful. Perfect amount of sweetness and softness (the cookie is quite large so you can def share it with someone). A great combo! Can't wait to come back

My daughter and I asked several bystanders on the street where Ritual Coffee is in the Castro. We were so glad to find this gem! The staff were personable and helpful, and we enjoyed their cheerful humor. The coffee was so delicious, I bought a bag to talke home! Small, ambient, and welcoming space!

3/5 stars for poor value on a mocha (-1) and the non-dairy up-charge (-1). 1 x $6.25 Dandelion Mocha1 x $1.00 Oat Milk (soy and almond milk are the same $1 up-charge)Sum of the Line Items Above?1 x $7.25 Out-of-the-Door Total

In a busy city with busy lives, it is a relief to know there's places like this location. It's conveniently across the gym I go to. It's so relaxing to sit, enjoy an espresso, and look out the window. Special shoutout to Joey, who works here most mornings. He's a story teller. He'll make you a drink and tell you bits about the coffee: it's region, the farmers, flavor profile.  Ritual is one of my favorite coffees in the city. Customer service here makes it feel like you're in a friend's living room

There are many reasons I love Ritual, and it was such a treat when this location popped up in my neighborhood.  I am not an everyday coffee drinker, but when I do decide to partake, I am grateful Ritual is here!  I love supporting a local and female owned company, and the staff at my local Castro location are always fantastic!  Through all the staffing changes which is to be expected with service industry, they always seem to be staffed with kind, friendly, and knowledgeable staff.  The lovely people working here are defiantly part of my coffee Ritual!

If you enjoy good coffee, friendly staff and an occasional sweet treat this is the place for you. Unlike Starbucks or Philz, this is a no frills spot - no big comfy chairs, no spot to park your laptop for hours on end. For me, I see this as a plus!

Super cute little coffee shop if you're walking around the Castro area. My boyfriend and I were walking around the Castro and stumbled upon this little gem. It's quiet smaller than the other Ritual roasters in the city, but it's quick, easy, and convenient. ;-)

The first review of 2019 goes to Ritual Coffee Roasters. Ritual Coffee has like 6-7 stores in SF including their roastery. I decided to try this spot in the Castro today. I looked through the list and it was expensive. I was wishy-washy until I decided to get the "cherry bomb." This drink is a cold drink with ice. It has tonic water, cold brew, and maraschino cherry syrup. It was created by a barista at one the Ritual SF shops. It was alright. You stir it up. It had a cherry kick with cold coffee and ice. It was interesting and $6. I have nothing better to do than amuse myself with SF cafe creations like the "cherry bomb." Well, keep on inventing new drinks and people will try it.

I have no chance to try their coffee . The customer service really bad. The lady in the pic is so rude . She made me leave . Here's the story: I walked in with my toy poodle dog , Not even completely walked inside and she start yelling : " you can't walk inside with the dog "  I went outside and there is no sign shows no dogs or Service dogs only . I feel so bad for the business owner. Those people make your business went down. We don't support haters, there are already too many . She need to be fired . Won't come back.
Great coffee. Absolute shit service and rude entitled staff. Not a single smile, thank you, or effort towards friendliness. Terrible start to the day.

A small coffee shop in the Castro District. This is a fairly small cafe and it is mostly for those to-go coffee drinkers. Don't expect any tables or working space here! I appreciated their pride related items that were for sale here. I mostly docked a star because the barista failed to make the drink presentable :/

Yes, Ritual is one of the better coffee chains in SF. They are experts in the craft. I must say, the folks at this location are also a bit pretentious. I asked if a specific drink could be iced, and the guy pretty much scoffed at me. Cool. Generally, I found the menu a little short, and the food items weren't as enticing as other similarly-calibrated coffee shops. But I'd be happy if this was my local spot.My husband's seasonal dandelion latte, which had a special chocolate in it, was very decadent and nice. I ended up getting the daily drip, which was fruity and a good pick me up.Tiny location with a few spots to sit for a few minutes.

I've been here several times and each time my latte was just perfect. Sweet and creamy with great espresso, I drizzle it with honey and each sip is bliss. Really skilled and friendly baristas. I find myself going out of my way to visit this place. One of my favorites in the city.

Cute little spot on Market Street. Great Cold brew, and a decent selection on pastries. It's just a coffee bar, so there's no lounging around here to enjoy your drinks. Like take your drink and go kind of place.  There are a few benches along the wall though. The woman working was friendly, and I was in and out. There are multiple locations. However, they're not very big yet. I hope they stay this way. Nothing worse than getting bought out by Nestle or another large corporation. I'll completely stop buying their coffee like I have with Blue Bottle.
iced. horchata. latte with espresso. enough said.
The best third wave coffee in SF at this takeout cafe. Near perfect vegan almond milk lattes/cappuccinos.
Excellent coffee, baristas were quick, friendly and kind, and my latte came with a beautiful heart on top. I love the cards they give out with directions on making pour over coffees.

This is my everyday coffee place. I have tried so many places to get my perfect latte and this is where I finally got it.  People working there are super sweet and genuinely friendly. Any other place is a compromise for me now.

One of my preferred spots in Castro to get my coffee fix.  There is very little seating but it's great to pick up on the go. It is also located next to my favorite candy store in San Francisco, Giddy.
Cute little cafe, and most importantly, very delicious latte - good job guys! Nice sitting area outside.
Takes so long to get your food/drinks and they turn out bleh and overpriced. I dont mind paying for good food, but as I said...bleh. Been here 3x's just to make sure it just wasn't an off day.

We love this place. The chai tea is phenomenal. The farmers market, which is an egg white quiche with mushroom kale peppers onions and Monterey Jack is awesome. We also love the Japanese blueberry waffles. I always ask for extra blueberries, so the puppy can have her blueberries too. Don't walk, but run to SPRO coffee lab. Located in the new mission bay area, what a wonderful addition to our neighborhood.

Ok, so here's the deal. I never rate anything unless I've tried it several times. So...Today was my fourth visit, and they surpassed expectations again.  I've tried six different menu items, and they're all prepared to perfection, creative, and amazingly delicious.  Try the Mash Up and add a sausage. It. Is. Ridiculous. The shrimp and grits will rival any in the city as well.  The Southern Belle is astounding - a genius take on a waffle by using red velvet and cream cheese frosting. Prepare to drop the mic. The owners are usually working the truck and are friendly and passionate. Their story is awesome, so if they're not busy, get to meet them; it makes an amazing meal even better with some personalization. Happy eating!
Great little spot with Amazing coffee and food! They make their own chocolate, syrups, etc. from scratch with organic ingredients too. Their chocolate chip cookie is ridiculous as well

Wow!! Really good coffee. I had the Mardis Gras with soy. It was a cold brew, but I don't remember what was in it. Regardless, Soooo tasty and just what I needed for a midday pick me up. Great service, great area, great price. I'll be back when I'm in the area!
Found them at off grid missionbayHojicha was best I've ever hadIced was delishTheir tomato soup was incredibleTheir menu is designed for discerning palateCan a food truck get Michelin rated?

Great option for a casual brunch on the weekend. Excellent options for a quick bite and unique beverages! I had the black swan charcoal latte which is on their secret menu, and umami bomb which is effectively avocado with salmon on rye toast. Topped up this meal with a delicious black forest pastry. Everything was extremely fresh and appetizing.  It is located amidst many other food trucks. I definitely recommend trying this out.

really creative coffee, tea, and cocoa drinks. very tasty and novel. would not recommend the food though. so expensive for such little portions. most importantly- DO NOT GET ANYTHING "SOUS VIDE" there like the sausage! one bite and it seemed completely raw, pink inside, soft (not plump or juicy). my girlfriend took a chance eating it thinking it was just their method of cooking but she got serious food poisoning, feeling the indigestion almost immediately. willing to give this place another visit for just their coffee drinks. gonna pass on the food though and you should too.

Never disappoints. The smokin' is the best combination of salmon, capers, wasabi, onions, ricotta, micro greens and fluffy sourdough toast. The bread pudding tho! Damn, never had better. Love the fruits, however I wish they also had strawberry and choc chip bread pudding (just personal preference). High recommendation to a consistent business that always delivers.

I hate that I love you because you're not cheap!!If you come here, you MUST order the umami bomb. It's basically an avocado toast with a Japanese twist (it has umami seasoning on it, fish roe, and truffle oil). I would say this is my favorite avocado toast in SF. It is very small though :( one is diet size, two is more of a meal.I also love their matcha / geisha kiss drink, and I always substitute with oat milk! One of my few places in SF that has oat milk. This truck looks very unassuming, and I probably would never have tried it if my friend didn't recommend it! Now its one of my favorite trucks! :)

If you're here, order the Hojicha latte with oatly's oatmilk! They got the Hojicha from Stonemill, where I'm the big fan of their dessert. It's def pricier ($6.5) for a decent 12oz than Stonemill, but goddamn it I live so close to this place that I cannot escape not thinking about it. And bonus point that they use oatly oatmilk so it's game changer to the drink. Well we gotta support local business, right?

Spro is located in a food truck park with a bunch of other trucks! However, on a Sunday morning, most of the other trucks aren't open yet, so we opted for brunch at Spro. I got The Mash Up, $10. It includes a parmesan potato puree on toast topped with eggs, truffle oil, chives. It was absolutely tiny. I felt so jipped. It was pretty tasty but not worth $10.

The single worst espresso shot I've had in my life. Long wait, over priced, and the espresso tasted like spoiled milk mixed with cleaning agents. I had to throw it away after one sip.I don't know how a place that is named after their espresso can have such a terrible product. Buyers be warned. I'm never coming here again.

I came here the other day to kill some time before picking my girlfriend up from an appointment. I ordered a bone dry cappuccino. It came and the barista knew it wasn't really dry so she insisted on making me a new one. Granted the second one wasn't very dry either I appreciated the effort and did love my coffee.
Get the Black Swan -- charcoal latte. It's perfectly sweetened and beautiful to behold. It's off menu.
This is my favorite breakfast spot in the city! The Mashup it's to die for!!! The truffle parm potato puree is decadent AF on top of that toasted sourdough bread.

I've been here twice now... 100% recommend!  They use no yucky commercial syrups... everything is as pure & unrefined as possible.  Try the Orange Blossom Oat Milk latte... for a lesson in subtle sophistication!  Order "less sweet" so you can enjoy the quality coffee, perfectly fluffed milk of your choice... in the nuanced flavors they add.  After being in ID for 4 yrs (& being fr WA state)... I can't tell you what a treat it was to have 2 excellent 'Spros 2 days in a row!  (Visiting CA for the week.)
Great coffee! Terrible food. My sausage and egg was terrible. The toast was burnt and the sausage was raw. Just awful. Not coming back.

This is a review specifically for their red velvet waffle with cream cheese frosting. I was interested in their food offerings, but they were already out of a few items I wanted to try at the ice cream festival. We opted for the red velvet waffle which was served warm and slightly crispy. It was delicious. A little bit on the sweet side overall. Hope to try some of their other foods sometime.

I'm actually not a huge coffee fan, I only drink it to survive when I really need to. So I was pleasantly surprised when I liked my coffee here. I ordered the Cool Hunter a cold brew blend with grapefruit and elderflower. My boyfriend got the Geisha, a matcha latte-esque drink (both $5). While we both enjoyed mine, we thought his matcha latte was too sweet after a few sips. Their entire menu is pretty creative; maybe this place will turn me into a coffee fanatic.

Friendly staff, nice bathroom, good vibe, tea quality was fine. Unfortunately the WiFi only worked for about 10 minutes (slowly, but fast enough for my purposes) before crapping out. I wouldn't come here if you're looking for a little internet access; it was kind of a waste of a few bucks for me.

I wanted to get some coffee and hang out, I couldn't find anything where I felt confortable around the Bart until I found this little paradise! Prices are reasonable, the environment is very relaxing, and the drinks are really good! Thanks!

The main thing this place has going for it is convenience: good location near BART, and I've never had to wait in line. However, the coffee is a little sub-par for third-wave coffee -- it tastes over-extracted to me and the microfoam isn't as creamy as it could be. Still, it's passable.The pastries leave more to be desired though. They're better than Starbucks, but that's not saying much.Come here if you're in a hurry, but if you want good coffee go to Ritual. If you want good pastries (and have a lot of time) go to Tartine. As far as small cafes on the corner go, this place could learn a thing or two from Linea Coffee on 18th just off Mission -- it's a tiny place but they manage to have excellent coffee and good pastries.

Probably the best coffee shop in the mission. They could totally take advantage of customers considering their prime location but they are super cool. They were kind to let me chill and work there without ordering since I had just eaten across the street. I was able to stand and work, facing their big window that looks out to mission street. Love the music as well. I'll be back- I heard their coffee is awesome!

Another customer and I were standing outside a lil after 6 and they remained closed. There were 2 people inside and they both looked at us and still didn't open. I approached the girl inside and just shook her head not sure what that meant but you are losing customers. Your hours of operations clearly indicates 6 am but you are inside still preparing after 6 with the doors closed.
Sometimes coffee is just wonderful. Oh and then there is a view and a raspberry scone. Life is good. Coffee with a view!!

seating is uncomfortable..furniture needs to be replaced. coffee isn't amazing not terrible either...wanted to like this place but probably won't be returning here anytime soon.  get the space is limited..they seem to give off strange vibes if you have more than one bag in your hand. it's hit and miss like any coffee shop.

i would like to give it a better review but my experience there was not a good one. i live a block away and walk by at least 3 or 4 times each day. i noticed they were selling a nitro cold brew which i really like so i decided to stop in a get one. i ordered and asked the guy who took my order if it could be sweetened (since it's cold sugar won't really dissolve properly so most places have simple syrup to sweeten it) he looked at me like i was crazy so i asked "should i just sweeten it myself?" he said "yeah" and asked me for $6.25. $6.25 for a cup of coffee! and they couldn't sweeten it?!$6.25! really?i didn't say anything cause i was in shock (sort of) but to top it all off it wasn't even good.the guy behind me ordered an americano, his was $3.25. was i ripped off?
Disgusting coffee costs 2.75 for a small. Bland chai over 5 dollars with non-lactose milk. Curated hipster interior. TLDR: overpriced hipster spot with bad drinks.
There are two floors. It is a great place to work or meet with people. Free WiFi and relaxing 70s and 80s rock music! Right now it is playing You've good a friend by James Tylor.

Nice spot with great baked goods. Capps are usually seriously lacking and far below the quality of haus, four barrel, blue bottle, and ritual. I actually tossed the last two after a couple sips. Too much foam and burnt espresso. Reminds me of the 90s. Shame because it is less than a block from me... I wind up walking.

Good coffee poorly made. If you like lots of micro foam on your cappuccino like any other average American cafe, come here. If you prefer third wave properly made espresso / cappuccino, maybe avoid. This place may have changed hands recently and it's gone downhill IMHO. Just look at this cappuccino....
Cool, little shop near the 24th and Mission BART. I came here to get a little work done, and found the upstairs space else be cozy and productive. Space on the smaller side.
BEST white mocha I've ever had! I asked for heavy cream with it instead of milk. Soooo rich and perfect! Thank you!

Nice little coffee/tea shop with adorable seating area upstairs. Offers plenty of vegan options (including vegan butter for vegan baked goods), as well as a plethora of vegan milk offerings (e.g., soy, oat, coconut, walnut, rice, macadamia...you name it, they have it). The GM is also extremely nice. I'd definitely work from this location again and possibly up this to five stars.

Service was slow and not very good. I coughed after trying my husband's espresso--I think it was the worst one I have ever tried. Hot chocolate had way too much sugar in it, as did the walnut banana bread given as samples. I really appreciate that they have vegan snacks, and I love sweets, but there was too much sugar in these for my taste buds. There was some kind of ongoing breakdown in communication between the cashier and barista, it just seemed odd. She made my drink wrong, no big deal. Later I went toward the back to use the restroom and there was a weird "bathroom closed today" sign. I inquired and the barista/manager/owner said she closed them for the day because she didn't want homeless people coming in and using them and was unclear about letting me, her customer, use it. After some continued back and forth with no movement made to let me access the restroom, I started looking around outside to see where I might be able to go next and told her I couldn't wait much longer as she seemed to be waffling on letting me use it and her tone became very rude, totally unnecessary as I was polite the entire time. Not impressed with the service or what they are selling here. If you can't deal with issues like people using your bathroom who aren't customers, why have a coffee shop in Mission with a view to 24th Street BART and why keep both doors open? Weird place, won't be coming back.
Really bad. Definitely don't recommend this place. Go to Starbucks, or even McDonalds if you want better coffee/service.

The worst! Just another clueless gentrified coffee shop in the mission! They know ZERO about the coffee they're selling and the prices are ridiculous for the size and the drip crap they're pouring. Never again.

Closes at 5 on Sunday! My friend and I came here to finish up some homework on a Sunday. I had done some research and realized most of the coffee shops with WiFi closed early on Sunday but this one was open until either 6 or 7 (this was a few months ago so I think they might have changed their hours). We got settled in, ordered our coffees and set up our homework, only to be told we needed to pack up because they were closing 1-2 hours early. I asked if there was a special occasion of some sort, but there wasn't really any reason other than wanting to go home early. I really hate that because we went out of our way to get to this coffee shop specifically because it was open later than everywhere else. It really just through us off. I just feel like if you say your hours are one thing, and even have them posted--but you enforce something different, that's extremely inconsistent and misleading. Having accurate hours is important because people tend to plan their days based on time, so when that's altered, I ended up wasting a lot of time because I trusted their hours were accurate. Anyways, I hope they enforce their hours better in the future.

Simple and straightforward!  It does the trick right out of bart 24th street station!  I was looking for my coffee with chai, but mainly also the bathroom after staying hydrated during this sunny Saturday!  They make chai iced tea with an extra espresso shot well and they provide almond milk on the side! Enough seating to support this spot!  Came here for the convenience and on the way to werk!  Caffeinated and got my work on!
Great vanilla latte and a delicious breakfast sandwich in a very cute and cozy atmosphere. Would definitely go again!

Balboa Sandwich: Absolutely hit the spot. It's a must-have combination of turkey, bacon, and avocado.Black Bottom Cupcake: Decadent and moist. Try it if you're in the mood for a rich dessert.Ambience: Plenty of seating, great mix between place to study and place to have conversation. Service: Efficient and friendly.

Comfy cozy place, but very spacious. It was a late afternoon when I was there and while the front area was full, the space in back had plenty of space and a ton of tables. Almost seems like a tiny library or college student union. The bagel and lox I had was very good. Loaded with Lox. Very tasty and filling. The latte I had was good, not memorable, but well made.

Spacious, with a great selection of drinks and snacks/meals when your body requires a much needed distraction from studying / focusing. The seats on the "mini upper level" (booth-like seats) were extremely comfortable -- the warm coffee, usual mistiness of San Francisco air, and the suspended lighting instills a cozy feeling. Haven't tried any of their bagels or other pastries but the latte definitely hit the spot after a large breakfast

Good place to study or get work done. Foods pretty good as well, and they have beer and wine:) gets crowded though. I've come here twice where there is no table available, but after a few minutes something seems to become available. Really like this place.
Cute little place to get a coffe and get some work done during the day, very calm and spacious. A treasure in the city! Coffe is great, favorite place in the area.
Lots of options for coffee and tea. Nice space with lots of seating. Stylish decorations. A great place to stay an entire afternoon.

I used to enjoy this place and deal with their terribly SLOW service but after this last visit I will no longer be coming here. I ordered the hot pastrami sandwich. Came out with lettuce and tomato and COLD . Never seen that before. Their online menu is different from the one in the store so don't waste your time looking at it. After I waited 10 mins and the 4 people who ordered AFTER me got their sandwiches I decided it was time to say some thing. Please see pictures below for the pathetic sandwich they gave me. It's criminal that they charged me $10 bucks for this thing. I wish I could take my tip back. Do your self a favor and save your self time and money and find a better quality place.

This place is so close to Golden Gate Park, that if you want coffee, it is your best bet to go here. Looking at Yelp's rating, we decided to give it a try. And left very disappointed - staff was helpful, and the ambient was nice, but we came here only to get a coffee, and it was not great.I've ordered Café Caramel, and it was so sweet - that it was painful to drink (I have sensitive teeth), I've asked staff to make it less sweet, which they honored, adding there more coffee without caramel, but still the result was not tasty and blent, that I couldn't finish even half of it. So I give 5 stars for ambient and friendly staff, but 2 stars for the coffee itself.

Ordered lady lox bagel sandwich with a hot coffee, and they were both really good. Really nice staff and the cafe was super cute and cozy. Glad I stopped in! Also, the cafe is within walking distance to Lands End.

Very nice interior decor and coffee was amazing .. felt like no added sugar and perfect. Got the white mocha and could actually taste the white chocolate .. highly recommend this place if you are around

A worthy successor to Zephyr.  Peaceful, quiet, welcoming.  Good selection of teas and coffees and pastries. Fast wifi.  Many electric outlets.  Pleasant service at the counter.  a great place to work.

I ordered a sandwich near their shift change so they were counting tips and the woman that was making my sandwich was also counting tips she went back-and-forth from counting in handling money to then making my sandwich I said something to her like you should wash your hands after dealing with money and then food and just gave me a thank you very much every time I come to this café something like this happens too many other good options on the block avoid

$8 (after tax) for an everything bagel with cream cheese and a medium peppermint mocha. Bagel -- bagel is toasted nicely. The cream cheese isn't my favorite kind though. It tasted like a chunk of cream cheese being slapped on there. There are just too much for me and they aren't those spreadable kind. (-1)Peppermint mocha -- amazing. Taste really good. Not too sweet and have the perfect taste of peppermint in it. Environment -- i came around 12 pm on a Sunday and the seatings are already packed. I found a table in the middle of the front room and am super grateful for it. Free WiFi. Perfect for studying.Update:-1 live piano playing is a little too loud for my personal preference. They're playing in the back room but it's still very loud where I'm sitting by the entrance). The sound of piano is competing with whatever the shop is playing over their PA system.

Large coffee shop with plenty of seating! The back area includes a wall of books available for purchase for $5 each. Quick WiFi, clean restrooms, and (relatively) easy parking makes this place somewhere you have to visit if you're in the area!Sandwiches are really good too! I recommend the Balboa.

Best cafe in Outer Richmond. If you need to get work done, this is the place to come. So much seating, that fills up quickly, but if you hang out for a minute, you can find a table. The coffee is great and food options are simple and delicious. Fantastic college library vibe inside.

The coffee. The staff. The food. The place (look at the photos). You can pay more for coffee but if you are in outer Richmond why would you go anywhere else? You can NOT get better coffee and certainly you can't get the great, local coffee shop experience. Quintessential San Fran.

A great study spot, and a lot of people are aware of it, so it can get pretty crowded even though it is pretty big.For my coffee fix, I got a vanilla latte. They unfortunately ran out of mugs, so it was given to me in a to-go cup. It was a little too sweet for my taste as well. Their BLTA sandwich was so delicious though, and their prices are very reasonable, especially if you consider that I'm planning to park myself at a table for a couple of hours. Make sure you charge your laptop though! People battle it out for tables by the outlets, and not all the outlets appear to be working.
Wonderful environment to work or chat!  Large area with many tables and high ceilings. We enjoyed tea though there appeared to be a good coffee and food menu.
What a great place. Excellent mochas. Apparently a great place to study! The interior looks like an old library. Give it a go.

Good service, interiors, and food. It's a nice place to sit, eat a little something and get work done. I came here to study for a test and was pretty happy. It's a tiny place tho and gets busy in the morning- keep that in mind. They have a bunch of non dairy mills and things that can be made vegan so it's pretty adjustable in that sense too. It's right on the Street, therefore convenient to get to. I liked my coffee and I also liked my breakfast sandwich. They have a choice of breads too.

Flew into San Fran and my Airbnb was right down the street. I ordered a cheeseburger and fries and both were tasty. I regretfully saw the man next to me enjoying what seemed to be the world's juiciest nachos of some sort and wish I could've ordered them myself. My meal was about $13 total. They offer complementary water glasses. Friend order a pesto sprout sandwich, she loved.
Oatmeal with blueberries and crepe with chicken and salad was very good! Very cozy place!
I love this place the pancakes are good and the beer is often on happy hour with a few IPA's on draft. Good for anything from breakfast to snack before going home!

Little more than an hour before closing and the last croissant in the pastry window is gigantic. It wasn't chocolate however so I told her nevermind and ordered the falafel appetizer. But the thing must have been half a foot tall and a foot long! So as she rang me up I says okay give it to me. She surprises me with a big thwack of Nutella on the side. 10,000 karmic brownie points she gets from the Buddha for lessening the suffering with this beautific slice of joy. P.S. the falafels were crispy, sinfully crispy, probably fresh out of the deep fryer. With just the right slather of hummus and then tahini and a little bit of tomato and onion and parsley salsa. Tastefully presented on a sushi platter. Okay the lettuce leaves were a tiny bit wilted but we have to have some perspective on all this Nirvana.

Nice casual ambiance. Good place to work if you don't mind casual noise and probably being next to two friends grabbing a beer and catching up. Great food. Friendly staff. WiFi but it's not the best all the time.

I'm gonna have to agree with the low reviews here, unfortunately.I got a hamburger with fries, and sides of mushrooms / onions / bacon. I received a pretty normal hamburger with fries, topped with mushrooms, onions, and bacon, which would be totally fine if the burger weren't $20. I wish I were kidding, but I'm not.The hamburger tasted pretty average. The extra veggie toppings I got were decidedly not really worth the extra price. There are a lot of other spots I'd rather get.
Just paid $20 for an hour wait and no omelet. There were too many employees doing nothing and not paying attention. Too bad cause the food looked pretty good

Came in this  morning for a quick bite on a  break. I was greeted by the cashier with a  laminated menu. I ordered a breakfast sandwich priced at 7.00 ( view photo) After the cashier rung up the item it  came out to 8.90 () So I  inquired about the increase and was informed that the menu hasn't been updated,  but the board menu HAS and will reflect the prices, well, I  looked at the board menu and found another discrepancy in the price ( view 2nd pix) So I asked the cashier,  " Shouldn't the establishment honor the price shown on the menu?" And with attitude and rudeness she replied,  " Yes, but there's Nothing I can do about that, I have no control over this" Ummmm  What happened to customer service and professionalism? If the establishment advertises a price, THAT price should be honored, not get irritated and loud talk the customer, am I wrong?
Judge by the picture. No filter. The saddest side ofBacon I ever had in my life. The granola was good but very unhappy with the bacon.

I've stopped here every time I've seen a show at the Independent. The food is great, I'd recommend looking at their specials. The nachos are really good and the falafel is great. Their happy hour is also super solid as well. The service is very friendly.

I been coming  here for the past 8 yrs . Service is always good ! But the food is getting worse every time . Crepe hard as a rock ! And cold coffee . Under cook pancake .   I think I have to look for a different place
I had the Chilaquiles and I must say it was Delicious! The Thai Ice Tea on the other hand was not so great. Seating is very limited but nice chill vibe.

The barista, April was very helpful and friendly and directed us to a table that we could sit at as I have a child who I needed to sit at a particular location for enough room. She was friendly and greeted us with a smile and went out of her way to locate an area that we can sit with my daughter who is in a stroller. We would love to come back to this particular Cafe because we really appreciated the customer service.

One of my favorite San Franciscan neighborhood cafes. Staff is super friendly and food pretty decent with lots of healthy options. Love their Benedicts. Most of the stuff here are verysonable prices for SF standard. It also has free WiFi and you can bring a book or laptop to sit for a few hours. Gives the neighborhood a bit more human community feel than just some high-end overpriced restaurants which NOPA is increasing developing into.

This place is a cute little cafe on Divisadero. They have a variety food like salads, sandwhiches, burgers, tea, smoothies, and so much more. I got the Petaluma sandwhich and it was ok it lacked flavor so i probably wouldn't get it again. However their side salad is pretty good and i added feta cheese because a salad without feta is like a ceaser with out parmasean cheese. Anywho..... I also got the jasmine green tea and that was nice touch to my meal. This place is warm and cozy and they have WIFI which is a plus! I worked here for a few hours without any disturbance. I will definetly come back. If you're in the area you should check this spot out.

This place is so cute and perfect to just chill out and be on your computer or read a book! You can order beers, teas, lemonades, coffee, etc. I got a breakfast burrito and it's SO GOOD and I got the lavender lemonade. The baristas are super nice and will make your day even brighter :)

What a pleasant place to spend a working morning! Lovely ambiance with cute, jazzy music and friendly staff. I ordered a cappuccino which was incredibly cheap by SF standards, nicely presented with some foam art and totally delicious! I thought the breakfast options were rather pricey but the size of the portion and the exemplary taste/crispiness of the accompanying potatoes more than made up the worth. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good cup of joe and a friendly place to catch a couple hours or WiFi, or just a fresh and wholesome breakfast :)

Great, quick bites! The breakfast burrito with chorizo is a must-try. The crepes are next on the list (must add chicken). Just had dinner here for the first time and really enjoyed their chicken nachos and tortilla soup specials. 4 stars because the seating is not ideal, some of the tables and chairs should be replaced. Other than that the food here is delicious  and the employees are friendly.

Been coming here for 10years. Every year they change cooks, but the cook this year sucks. I order a Veggie Burger with fries. It seem like they used recycled fries off of a bussed plate. No literally this picture is what I got, for real. The burger tasted as if they added nuts and seeds in it.I also order a #29 (Firenze) for my sister the sauce was oily and red. It suppose to be orange and creamy. On top of that, there were no sundried tomatoes.They are serving poor quality food no of days. However, I'm very disappointed in Bean Bag Cafe, for I been loyal to them for a decade. On my diet days I usually order a (Golden State) salad, now I'm afraid.Food for thought bypass the food and order drinks instead.

The OG Philz!This Philz location was actually the first one I ever got to try their delicious iced mint mojito at, so it was pretty cool to learn at that visit that this was actually where it all started.Fast forward to now, I've tried just about everything on their menu, and have not been disappointed. To be fair, there have been some times where my drinks have been lackluster, but the baristas have always been eager to fix them. This is something that I really appreciate since I've gone to other coffee shops in the area where baristas will seem extremely annoyed if you ask them to remake your drink.Nowadays, I'm more of a tea kind of gal, but I would still definitely recommend the iced mint mojito if it's your first time visiting. If you are in the mood for tea, my go-to's are an Istanbul treat (light cream, light honey, extra mint leaves) or a half green tea/half black tea (light cream, light honey, extra mint leaves).If you're contemplating going to Philz, just do it! Promise you won't regret it- especially this location with its quirky ambiance, comfortable seating, and its friendly baristas :)

My first time at Phillz and it didn't disappoint! Delicious coffee and I love how each cup is freshly made. Love the touch of mint in the coffee. I found this to be an interesting and unique experience than other coffee shops. I was a bit confused on how to order at first but the baristas were helpful! Excited to try a different drink nexttime.

Was super excited to try the original Philz Coffee location and it did not disappoint!! The interior is super quirky with painted mural ceilings and a lot of artwork scattered around.  The coffee selection was awesome.  We ordered a rose latte (yes the basic white girl in me was screaming with delight) as well as the Philtered Soul (which had some awesome but not overwhelming chocolate flavors).  You have to be willing to wait in line to order and then again to pay, but I would say the wait is well worth it!!

Coffee: 5 starsService and communication: 2 stars They say this is the OG Philz so that's exciting. And I understand service changes from day to day or even hourly based on the customer climate and other variables. But 7AM on a work day when the baristas are chatting it up with each other, I find that a bit disrespectful. There is a great option to order online and just pick up - this is definitely the only route I will go from now on if it's a grab-and-go situation. Bottom line, Philz is delicious. Get the large Tesora with cream. Like sweet? Ask for sweet! Like really sweet? Ask for really sweet!
What's the point in being so good, they don't open until 6 "Bankers Hours" frustrating!

Ok, so this was my first time at a Philz and had no idea how the setup work. Everyone was friendly and explained the ordering process without me feeling like a complete dope. I was very impressed with the number of selections and was also give a good recommendation based on my preferences. Very tasty coffee and I would definitely come back!

Wandering around the Mission in SF, we wanted coffee.  This was the highest rated place on the list, so in we went.  The business is busy, and it is confusing what you actually need to do.  First head to the back and stand in line for a coffee person.  Choose your coffee.  They prepare your chosen coffee one style - pour-over.  If you don't like this style, too bad.  You then wait around for your coffee.  Once it is handed to you, go off and pay at the front. The coffee I had was Ambrosia of the Gods.  It's a middling strength coffee and silky smooth, so points for a good cup of coffee.  The person making the coffee was nice and cheerful.  The person taking the money was gruff when I obviously got the directions wrong.So points for a good cup of coffee and the general coffee shop vibe.  Minus points for confusing directions on how to order a cup of coffee, noise level, and grumpy money taker.

TALK ABOUT SUPER FROTHY! Stopped by on 24th to grab my regular "ecstatic iced coffee" extra creamy and extra sugar. I wanted a cup of coffee that was going to have me jumping off the walls going "Ku-Ku for Cocoa Beans right before work, mission accomplished I'm hyped up.The Philz Coffee Team here is awesome. I love it that they ask you is your coffee to your liking and the consistency to your preference, so they can make a change. Their set-up station in how you pick your order up and pay for it, to me is a bit "backwards." I could tell a few newcomers were somewhat puzzled and didn't know whether or not  to wait or just go ahead and pay for their coffee in advance. I'm pretty sure just like the one in San Mateo, you order first and then pay. I would have to say Philz is better than Blue Bottle Coffee. That's right I said it and "I'm sticking to my guns." (;
This is the best location for Philz coffee hands down. Iced mint mojito is delicious so creamy and sweet.

I got the coffee of the day. Pretty good and very well priced. Atmosphere was nice but not the best place to do work as electrical outlets are impossible to find or near places where there is not a table.

If you've never heard of or been to a Philz Coffee, Mission Philz is worth a visit, because it's the first ever Philz Coffee that opened in 2002. The coffee, of course, is what everyone comes here for and although I don't drink much coffee, my husband swears by Philz. Unlike most other coffee shops, Philz does drip coffee and is a lot stronger than an equivalent espresso coffee drink. Also, unlike other coffee shops, Philz has a unique take on ordering coffee. As soon as you enter Mission Philz, if you don't see a line, go all the way to the end of the store behind the bench (look for the signs), and wait for a barista to call upon you. Once they call you, you tell them what kind of coffee you want and which size you want. Philz believes in "making it perfect"; so, there's no milk and sugar station in this coffee shop. If you need more of something--like cream or sugar--you go back to the barista who made it for you and they'll help you out. If you're like me--that is you enjoy a creamy, sugary drink and would never drink black coffee--go for either the Mint Mojito or the Ecstatic iced coffees; I like to get mine "sweet and creamy". If you're not sure, the baristas are really friendly and will help you pick a coffee (or tea). After ordering, you head on over to the front of the store, near where you entered, tell them what you ordered and they'll charge you. (Yes, they rely on your honor to tell them what you got.) This is also your chance to get some food. In the last few years, most Philz Coffees--including the Mission one--have started carrying a selection of baked goods (like some yummy almond croissants from local bakeries), pre-made burritos, and freshly-made bagels. My husband and I sometimes get breakfast here when we're in a rush; our favorites are the Philz Bagel on Za'atar and a warmed-up almond croissant.After paying, head back to where you ordered and wait for the same barista that you ordered with to call your drink. There's a bench that you can sit and wait on while your drink is made; it usually takes a few minutes. Once you've had Philz, be warned that you may become a regular (like my husband)! One of the great things they've done recently is introducing a mobile app that lets you preorder and have the coffee be ready for pickup when you get there. This is a huge time saver! These days, my husband almost always uses the app to order.Lastly, while all the newer Philz's have chic, modern interiors, it looks like Philz has intentionally kept this first one true to its beginnings and the Mission. Both outside and inside, nothing seems to have changed since 2002, and while it may not be as fancy-looking as some of the newer ones, once you visit this one, it'll have a special place in your heart.

Tesora! NUFF said! I love this blend. Powerful, robust, warmly spiced, with a hint of cacao tanins roasted out of the beans, perfect without sugar and a drop of cream -- and for a coffee aficionado, what more can you ask for than a place that grinds your beans fresh for every single cup?
I did not have the coffee, but I had the tea. Frankly, the tea tasted burnt (which I didn't was possible). Also, the price of the tea was ridiculous. It was more expensive coffee for a tea bag!

We stopped into to Philz Coffee after walking around the mission district in San Fran enjoying the street musicians, art murals and beautiful weather while on vacation. We weren't hungry enough for a full meal, so we settled for coffee and whatever pastries they had available.I tried the canopy of heaven, and while i'm no coffee aficionado... it was great! It's a lighter roast coffee, which is my preference. Kelsay is a decaf coffee drinker, and she tried one of their specialty coffees. I can't remember the name, but it wasn't her favorite... but she is more of a starbucks white chocolate mocha kinda gal, so that's not a knock at all on their coffee.All in all, it was a great impromptu breakfast, and the atmosphere is wonderful!

I love this coffee. Of course that's token to say since they've caused all the rage in the bay but this specific location is where it all began and you feel that tinge when you take a sip there. Although it's always so packed and cramped at this location so you really can't enjoy your coffee with the ease that I like to but to go is a wonderful option. There is a hurried sense but I guess I can't really be surprised since the mission is like a body magnet these days. Anyway, have a philtered soul or cool down with a mint mojito. Either way you're bound to stay up until the cows come home so plan an adventure, matey.

This Philz Coffee may be the best coffee shop i have ever been to in terms of service & taste.Mint mojito, Philanthropic, Philharmonic, & Canopy of Happiness are my favorites.Plus, a large cup is a bargain at $5 (compared to SF price).
If you are roaming around Mission District and looking for a cool coffee shop with unique coffees and chill vibe go to Philz.
Best coffee I've ever had in my life. Better than Peet's I like Peet's but Philz was so good! Tried the one in Walnut Creek but just didn't taste the same as it did in the city!
Good coffee, friendly staff, and relaxed comfortable atmosphere.  Didn't get a chance to try the food.

If you're like me you're probably thinking... who is Phil, and why are people raving about his coffee!? Well, I still don't know who Phil is but what I can tell you is that his coffee is some of the best in the mission. I had Water Dance (light roast) and it was perfect as I'd hoped. Each roast they have, they also list for you the tasting notes so you get the exact flavors you're going for. My husband got a different light roast and we were both super pleased with our selections. You have to stop in to Philz if you want the best coffee and a fun eclectic ambiance inside. Warning though, it's often pretty busy so if you're trying to sit down and hang for a while, you might be waiting on some seats to open up. I took this as a good sign!!!! Totally recommend!!

Stopped by on a Saturday morning for a Cortado, and surprisingly didn't have to fight any crowds to get a drink quickly. Cortado was perfectly done, espresso was bright and acidic with just enough bitterness to cut through the milk. The space itself is just so cool, and Bobby the barista was super friendly and clearly knows what he's doing with espresso.
Excellent coffee. Nice little spot in town to get a drink and rest or chat with a friend for a few minutes. Loved the mural on the wall and the tiling design on the wall. All-gender restrooms.

The owner said they're going to swap the Nicaraguan component of their espresso blend for an Ethiopian bean in a couple weeks. (Said should result in more clear fruit notes, with less of a brown sugar, plum undertone).I thoroughly enjoyed the shot I had today and I'm looking forward to tasting the beans again in a couple weeks :)Reading the other reviews makes me want to try the oat milk also :)
66 6th Street...show them some love:)Cute gallery, yummy coffee (which you can get with a CBD shot) and nice soothing selection of teas!Great service sprinkled with smiles and some sass!
Coffee itself was decent but the surrounding area felt unsafe and many storefronts were empty. Nice service though.
Wow! Cajata Goat milk latte! You must try it! So so so good! I like the small coffee shop!
Got there right before closed, still made me a good coffee (Espresso Breve drink) very super good just what I needed at 7:00pm!
Awesome iced cajeta latte- well prepared, smooth and just slightly sweet.  Service was also great and super helpful... would swing by again if I was in the neighborhood
Their oat milk latte is hands down the most delicious espresso drink I've ever tasted.
Adorable place, unpretentious, friendly staff, great coffee, and they have cool art in the back. This is one of my favorite coffee shops!

Quirky, chill cafe in a busy part of Market. I feel for this biz, because while it's in a bustling area, there's competing forces that make running a business here difficult, like its central location and frequenting of homeless people to use the bathroom. (Big props to the folks working here, though, who are kind enough to let many use the bathroom.)The barista was happy to see us, asked if we were from the area, and let us know about the gallery in the back. The art was by a gay artist with large, bold, cartoon-ish paintings; and I liked the brightness and humor in them.Tim M got the cajeta latte, which uses a slow-cooked caramel (like dulce de leche), and it was unique and very smooth. It had just the right amount of sweetness. I got a shot of espresso, which was also tasty and fruity.I like the plants in the front window, which gives the space additional liveliness and an organic touch.Worth the stop!

Get some art with your coffee. Super rad gallery with some finely curated vinyl in the background. Support good beans and better people. Tenderloin lucky to have Bobby and his badass spot. Much appreciated PS--Next up on the record queue, some janxta funk from PJT! (Pimps of Joytime)

Great addition to the neighborhood, with your usual go-to espresso drinks, as well as a couple interesting teas and specials. The interior manages to distinguish itself pretty well in a city full of upscale coffee shops, and the art gallery in the back is a great conversation starter if you're here with company. In other words, this is an interesting spot with an uncommon point of view.The drinks taste about as good as you'd expect them to at this price point ($5-6 for a latte), but it's definitely easier to swallow the cost if you tell yourself that you're supporting a local small business.The cajeta latte is as good as everyone says. (A little sweet/indulgent for my taste, but what do you expect--it's caramel.)Service can occasionally be detached and standoffish, even if you're the only patron there. Not unfriendly--just not particularly warm and engaging. To each his/her own!

I like to support local businesses when I think they're quite good and I was impressed by Pentacle. The atmosphere is a gay haven from the likes of 6th Street with good espresso, an art gallery, & lots of lovely plants which I really appreciated. There is a simpleness to the menu, a contemporary flair, & of course I think this is an important place for the gay community to come congregate amongst the cool vibe. This is a great addition to our community with the SF Aids Foundation round the corner & the Needle Exchange across the road.

The barista is really friendly and the coffee tastes amazing! If you have time, check out the gallery in the back too. Stopping by was a great way to relax before heading back to work, and I would definitely come back again.

I'm not from the Bay area but I thoroughly enjoyed this little coffee shop. Talked to the barista a little bit about San Francisco coffee culture and he explained that the shop is fairly new (about 7 months old). I had a traditional macchiato and it was very good.Even the customers were friendly, pointing out where I could place my used cup.Art gallary in the back was a very nice addition.I hope this coffee shop does well, and I hope to visit it many more times during my trips back to the bay area.
Well worth the walk here. Once you step inside you're in a completely different place. Coffee and teas are fantastic. What a San Francisco coffee bar should be about!

Cool coffee shop, and they took an interesting twist with the mini art studio in the back. The area around it is really pretty rough, so it wouldn't be the worst idea to go with a friend, but not completely necessary. A woman walked in asking for change and water, and the people in the coffee shop and employee working were all really nice about it, so that was cool.

Every barista is amazing, they're helpful if you're looking to try something new (or just indecisive like me). They always have art installations in the back, they support local artists! I recommend the iced cajeta latte, it's life changing. You're welcome.
This is the best cup of coffee I've ever had! I got the latte with oats milk here. The aesthetics in this coffee place is flawless. I'm sad I don't live in town and will be craving their coffee!

I will start by writing that I did not have coffee here only the Brekkie Sandwich.The Brekkie was good not great.  They used nice ingredients and the toast was soft and buttery.  I think it's a stretch as a $7 sandwich.  $5 yes.  $7 no.  This is a small corner spot on 5th and California with 2 outside tables that seat 2 each.  It was nice to sit outside this morning.  This is more of a coffee spot than breakfast spot.

This place is great!  Cozy neighborhood spot perfect for a midday pick me up. The service is always on point. The guys here are always attentive ready to serve and help. They actually seem like they really enjoy what they are doing:RARE.  I've never had a bad experience here. I only get the americanos or coffee with espresso that's my thing.

Spic and span, simple but delicious coffee inspired by a Chicago Boxing Match; unfortunately the first time Ali was defeated. Historic news clips and some memorabilia spot the walls, and some mellow hip hop playing this afternoon. Close to the laundromat. Grab a latte to sip and pass the time!

Super sad/disappointing - they have DISCONTINUED the ricotta toast. (they said they were replacing it with something soon.Service was painfully slow. looks like the avocado is smashed to order - which maybe I would enjoy - but since they get an order for it every other customer - maybe make a batch for 15 toasts, then start again - it would still be super fresh - but faster.We ordered the avocado toast and the breakfast sandwich (it was light on bacon - maybe 1.5 slices), a chai and a mocha. It was about $25. we left hungry.The water glasses could be used as thimbles - seriously I have never seen smaller glasses.

Definitely a good spot if you have a minute to relax or even on the go, The Richfield has you covered. I'm more of a cold brew coffee guy but I do occasionally get a matcha latte, the bf usually gets a flat white and something else I can't remember lol..oh and the chocolate banana muffin is good as wel

I love this place so much! It's a block from my apartment and I feel so lucky to have it as my local coffee spot. The drinks and pastries are all delicious, they let me bring my dog in, there's outdoor seating, and it's cozy AF. The best part of this place though is the people who work here. I'm not sure how this owner screens his applicants but bravo because every individual who works here has such a kind calm soul.Thank you Richfield for keeping me caffeinated and happy.

The Richfield is a great local coffee shop with a good amount of outdoor seating to relax at!  I've gotten the cold brew ($4.50) a couple of times and it tasted a bit lighter than what I'm used to getting at other places, but it was still smooth and pretty good.  Something I super appreciate and love about this place is that they serve their cold brew with coffee ice cubes so your drink doesn't get watered down!  It's such a small and easy thing to do, but I've never seen any other place do this before.  It really shows that they care about their product and it shows they care about their customers' satisfaction.The couple of times I've been here, the toast has been sold out unfortunately.  I usually come later in the afternoon, so I'll be sure to make a visit earlier in the day sometime to try those out!  Definitely recommend a visit if you're ever in the area.

Super cute small coffee spot! The workers are very knowledgeable and helpful with the menu. they answered all my questions and helped me choose what to order. Not very much seating, but they have a counter to stand at as well as the several small tables. Would return!

I have been to many coffeehouse while traveling and few of them make a quality cup of coffee.  Richfield does not disappoint.  Our group had lattes, a flat white, and an Americano.  All of these had the correct ratio of milk to espresso, or water to espresso, along with correctly pulled shots. The baristas obviously love coffee and put that love into each cup.

Great little cafe. And when I say little.... like tinyyyy. Super friendly people. Good coffee too, I tend to be pretty picky and they have my approval. Also avocado toast.... no need to say more. I wish I lived nearby to walk to this place each morning.

I don't write many of these but I had to write about my experience at the Richfield. As soon as I walked in I was greeted with a friendly smile and my order was taken right away. The place is tiny but has a comfy atmosphere. When my latte was ready it was brought out to me with another friendly greeting. Everyone here (employees and customers) seem comfortable and pleasant. The drink itself was excellent and the milk was super foamy. The almond croissant I got was also very good. There's also some outdoor seating to enjoy the weather when it's nice. Not a great place for working but if you just need a good drink and a place to read/hang out this place should be considered.
Good coffee and nice atmosphere, a bit crowded inside but can't complain about anything else!

I was in the area and wanted a coffee and stumbled upon this place. The Richfield is a small little coffee shop in the Inner Richmond district. There are a few tables inside and outside, and they offer free WiFi. There is a nice vibe here, I saw a couple people chilling and some doing work! I looked at the menu and ordered the Cold Brew. The Cold Brew was good, smooth and not too bitter. It came with coffee ice cubes, a very nice touch to keep the ice from diluting the drink.I came on a weekday afternoon and found street parking fairly easily. The staff was nice and friendly. Convenient neighborhood coffee shop to visit if you're ever in the area!

Very popular coffee shop with locals. Good food, nice people, cool vibe and serious baristas.  These guys moved into this space a few years ago and made themselves part of the neighborhood. This is the 2nd location of Snowbird coffee.  And now they have opened a 3rd.  Come here more than once and you'll see the same people working here. Very quickly they get to know you and offer great service.  If you're a high quality coffee fan and you haven't tried this place you must soon. If you have already then you're probably a regular!
Great coffee and food! The shop is a tad small but very cute! Great customer service!
I really wanted to love this place, but my brekkie sandwich was totally burnt. The service/friendly faces were also lacking.

The employees are super sweet. They have this bomb chia pudding just ask for some honey to put on top . The place is small & intimate. They have a short menu of breakfast food but it's more like a light bite to go. Definitely coming back :)

Finally--a good coffee spot in the neighborhood! The food is a little on the pricey side, but it's what you'd expect for San Francisco. I had a latte and it was excellent. It's a small place, so it wouldn't be a great location to hang around for a long time or hole up for a work session. The Richfield is definitely my new go-to spot for Sunday morning coffee on my way to/from the farmers market.

What a cute little coffee shop! It's pretty easy to miss as it's in a funny triangle at California and 5th. This is what good coffee should taste like.After living in Australia for a number of years I'm always on the lookout for a real Aussie style flat white and this did not disappoint. Exactly the right size and the espresso was smooth and perfect. I was only visiting SFO for a couple of days and made sure to come back 2 mornings in a row to get my FW. I found them on Yelp and they definitely earn the great reviews.

Brekkie Sandwich - lives up to the hype.  Simple ingredients, but delicious.Cold Brew - they use ice cubes made with coffee to keep the brew from tasting watered down as you savor every sip.  So novel and simple that not even the big coffee chains do it.  Props to The Richfield on that.Seating - they promptly opened at 7:30 and I got one of the few seats inside.  Enjoyed a good book while eating and drinking.  Small interior, but very relaxing.Will try their Avocado Toast and a hot brew next time...
This place is a godsend during busy festival days with it's quiet, gentle atmosphere and delicious beverages.

Please never leave. This is a wonderful place to come for a break from all the hustle and bustle that is Japantown. The iced drinks are my go to. I especially love the iced mocha. The owner is a sweetheart. When it's super warm, she has air conditioning, which is a plus for those increasing hot days.
Mario!  This place needs an update.  Rug is dirty Ceiling has a big whole.  Owner doesn't even make eye contact or smile

I found this to be a cute hole in the wall tea place with fine china teacups.  Tan Tan feels homey, cozy, and like it's stuck in time in the ever busy and trendy Japan center.  Looking at pictures at Yelp I had wanted to try other offerings here.  I've come back no less than 5 separate times since and every time it's closed.  The phone rings and rings during business hours with no one answering or a machine picking up.  I thought it might just have gone out of business but I asked some other business around and the general consensus was 'sometimes she opens, sometimes she doesn't, sometimes she just opens up later or closes earlier'. I find that to be a really weird way to run a business.  It's disappointing because it's very cute and one of the few places that has whisked ceremonial matcha tea (most places just do a latte with pre-sweetened powder).  If already in Japan Center it might be worth checking out.  If they are closed and you are looking for a ceremonial matcha tea fix Kisako downstairs has that as well as there is some new place downstairs that has matcha frozen desserts.

I popped in to get a coffee to go..No go..must throw away your hustle bustel and sit down and enjoy your coffee served in dainty cups surrounded by Victorian accoutrement. Excellent coffee and atmosphere.
I really loved the cups that the drinks came in. It's a very cute and quiet place to sip some tea.
A tranquil  coffee shop located in busy shopping mall, love it! Good coffee, tasty deserts

Never did I expect a place like this tucked into a corner in the Japan Center, it feels like a world away. Tan Tan is a quiet oasis in the hustle and bustle with the feel of a British teahouse. The furniture and linens are beautiful, the glassware is gorgeous and the environment is tranquil. We came in, ordered at the counter and the woman working there told us to sit and she would bring them to us. I noticed that everyone else there had some sweets but since we had just come from the YES event at Matcha Cafe Maiko, we were very full and sugared out. Next time, I totally plan on getting something to snack on as everything looked delicious.After about 5 minutes, the woman brought us our drinks in REAL GLASSES (my favorite!) I had a cappuccino and A had some genmaicha tea. My cappuccino was really good with just the right amount of foam and A's team was great as well. We lounged around for a bit just enjoying our time and the conversation. I do not think this would be a great place to come and work as I don't think there was WiFi but it is not meant to be that kind of coffee shop. As such, this felt a bit stuffy but honestly, I really enjoyed it. It was a bit expensive for a coffee shop but when you consider how peaceful it was and the service aspect, no complaints. I will definitely come back when I am in the area and have some time to sit down and enjoy a hot beverage.

Unironically, giving this five stars just because they have a power outlet available. Other cafes I saw like the crepe shop next door have their outlets taped up if they have them at all. The public outlets are all locked up. As someone spending money at this mall, with a dying phone, Tan Tan is an electrical oasis. The atmosphere is quiet and refined and relatively British rather than French, with fusion staples like iced matcha affogato "floats". When I was here, the other three patrons were all elderly women socializing or reading. The music is quiet ambient neoclassical and acts as a white noise machine. The owner seems fine with people buying one drink and staying a while. Perfect if you want to nurse a cup of tea and read a book. There's a nice outside view of the city. Is it the most gorgeous view? No. But if you like to watch the rain in the city, you will like it.
What a charming coffee shop! A totally different experience from the Starbucks and bluebottles of the world - quiet and unassuming and not trendy at all, but wonderfully charming.

If you're expecting or hoping for a quiet cafe to relax, finish homework, read a good book, work on your planner, or catch up with an old friend. This is your cafe.If you're expecting marie antoinette frills or a "rustic modern" cafe decor, hipster music or a double mocha vanilla spice unicorn frappucino-- This is NOT your cafe.:) Hope that saves a few of you from any further negative reviews over irrelevant details.
Came in for afternoon tea after a movie. The place was empty.  We ordered a chai, jasmine tea, and matcha tea.  Cutest tea cups and good quality tea.  Only downside is cash only.

One of my favorite cafes in Japantown. This cafe serves full teapots of tea, coffee, and a variety of desserts. They have about six to eight Japanese teas. My favorites being the matcha and hojicha. The hojicha comes in a teapot with a with an adorable teacup and the matcha comes in a traditional Japanese tea cup and includes a traditional dessert with beans. The coloration of the cups and the entire spot has a Victorian style that allows you to feel like you've stepped back in time upon visiting this place. The desserts are also impressive. Initially when I saw the term parfait I was assuming it was just going to be a boring mix of items, but I was wrong. The parfait I purchased had kiwi, strawberry and oranges in whipped cream mixed throughout layers of green tea ice cream. It was a flavor filled extravaganza on my tongue and totally worth the wait. A few final tips about this location is that it's not always open when Yelp says it will be. I always look to see if the half door is open when I visit Japantown and if I'm lucky like Alice in Wonderland follow the teas and crumpets to a delightful tea experience. Also, it's not a big place so I'd say it's good for groups under 5 as there are only about 16-20 seats in the entire place.

Great matcha tea service here. Ceremonial matcha came with red bean paste. Cute and quiet interior and traditional feel to the place. I would definitely come back for more traditional matcha experiences!

I really loved this place until the woman behind the counter told the four people in my party, that we had to squish together at one table because 3 customers needed to use our tables, TO PUT TWO TABLES TOGETHER , FOR THEM? The owner or counter woman.. RUINED IT! Boooo Tan Tan! Shame on you! Your customer service has left a bad taste in my mouth.
Great little shop with good food, tea & coffee. Everyone there is very friendly and inviting. Can't wait to go back.
The green tea float was really disappointing. It was kind of watered down and they didn't even use matcha ice cream!! Not only that, it's cash only. Cute decor though..

The traditional matcha (green tea) was served with anmitsu (red bean paste). It's a good flavor combination. Coupled with light cream cheese cake. Which were not so great of a combination with match, but I couldn't stop myself from ordering it.Speaking of which, I think the cake was priced at $6 or up. There was no price tag for the cake. But the tea was priced at around $5-ish, and the total came up to nearly $13.I mean, it's ok, the cheesecake was ok.Well, overall this semi hidden victorian decorated cafe is overall a cute place to read and sip.

It's all about the matcha green tea float, which was tasty and came with stevia on the side and a small ball of vanilla ice cream floating on top of the green tea made from real matcha. I wouldn't have known about this place if it weren't for Yelp because there are no pictures or advertising outside the shop. That drink is merely a subtle one-liner on the menu sitting on the counter.My favorite part about the drink was how the vanilla ice cream was so cold that it started freezing the matcha green tea around it. Great for a small sit down break while walking around in Japantown or to just chill and do some reading. There were only about five tables and no outlets, so not appropriate for busting out a laptop. More for some chit chat, sketching, or reading a magazine/newspaper/book.I liked the old-timey furnishings, but it made it seem catered to an older audience. It didn't have the frilliness of a tea room nor the hipster vibe of modern day coffee shops. More like the dusty victorian design. The service is just okay -- the lady owner doesn't really speak fluent English and isn't very inviting either. Must be a tough life running the small coffee shop as she hardly seems to smile.

Fairly classy, quiet coffee shop tucked in a corner within the building (not the Daiso building) in Japan Town side by side to Sophie's Crepe. The door is cute. The setup is cute. The owner is cute. The drinks are cute. The view is cute. But, the overall matcha drink I got here was just alright. My friends and I got both the matcha float and the plain matcha tea. It was good! Don't get me wrong! But I felt as though it was lacking. It wasn't sweetened, and tbh, I prefer that! But, don't know. The feel of the shop is great, but I don't know if the drinks lived up to the fanciness of the place.
