Perfect for a quick warm drink. Clean and well designed! When I have appointments in the area my wife enjoys drinking coffee and reading here, she says it's lovely!
Great atmosphere, food quality and friendly service - like the new beach pics. Get the muffin and chicken salad.

They have an unfriendly policy of kicking you out right at 3:00 pm on the weekends. They serve food and drinks, but then tell you leave right at straight-up closing time. To put this in context, I spent $75.00 for two salads, a sandwich, and three warm drinks, and then got kicked out before finishing. Restaurant tradition is to stop serving food, but have staff work on closing up in the background as customers naturally finish their meal. Instead, at 3:01 the stacked chairs on the table right next to us. When I mentioned this to a gentleman who worked there, the response was "we hear this every weekend; we can't do anything about it." I disagree.The food is quite good. Coffees were excellent. The interior is bright and friendly. This two-star review is based on the idea that a restaurant experience is a success when all notes are in tune; getting kicked out is the dissonance here.

When this place opened up, I wasn't thrilled. I wanted a regular coffee shop that didn't look so sterile. However, I fell in love with their bone broth. Like madly in love and willing to pay $4.50 for a tiny one. And their avocado toast is amazing.

I cannot get enough of As Quoted! So lucky they are in the neighborhood. The Chinese Chicken Salad is crave-inducing, the Herb Salad is divine, the Avocado Toast is so satisfying. I spend too much time thinking about their chocolate chip cookies!All gluten-free, all in a clean, friendly location. Love it!

This is my favorite cafe in Presidio Heights. Not only is the place adorable, but they also have great food and drinks. They also happen to be gluten free.I typically order the turmeric latte, which is one of my favorite turmeric lattes ever: fresh turmeric, fresh ginger, almond milk, coconut oil, sea salt, black pepper and coconut sugar (I prefer it without the sweetener, but my palate steers towards the savory side). I've also had a couple salads from As Quoted and they are super delicious and satisfying. Highly recommend stopping by this place if you're in the neighborhood!

An amazing little gem that I am so glad I stumbled upon! A rare great experience for gluten free people - all of the food is hearty and delicious.I personally loved their open face sandwiches (mostly because that's my preferred way to eat gluten free bread). Their decor was simple, white, modern. A place that is pretty quintessential breakfast on a sunny calm morning. Will definitely be going back!!

As Quoted:Overall:Great experience. I came to As Quoted, a cafe in Presidio Heights, at noon on a Tuesday.  Staff members were friendly and service wasn't too slow. The atmosphere was lively, but not crowded. It was sufficiently relaxed for me to do work (*write my yelp review). I'd expect weekends to be way more chaotic, so if you are lucky enough to work from home, or not to work at all, visit on a weekday! My only complaint is the price. It's a bit expensive. Food:I ordered avocado toast with smoked salmon, a banana muffin and a chocolate chip cookie. The avocado toast was pretty good. I generally don't order avocado toast on principle. I am pretty sure I can buy a really good loaf of gluten free bread, mash up a ripe avocado, add salt and make my own kickass avo toast. Or, better yet, buy some spicy guacamole and gluten free chips. I seriously don't understand the avo toast obsession. But I broke my rule because I wanted something with bread and smoked salmon (visit As Quoted on the weekend for a bagel and lox!). I was impressed with the toast. It had a consistent texture that didn't crumble after biting into it, even despite not being toasted! The toast also had more flavor than your standard gluten free bread (*cardboard). And the avocado mash had some unexpected red pepper bits that added an extra kick! And of course the smoked salmon was an excellent touch. I doubt I would have enjoyed the toast as much without it. The banana muffin was the best item I ordered. Dry and crusty on the outside, and soft and moist on the inside! It had the perfect ratio of banana chunks to muffin. I may go order another one. I have no self control. The chocolate chip cookie is pretty good too. Although I wouldn't call it a chocolate chip cookie. There aren't chips. It's more like completely chocolate on the inside. Okay, changed my mind. This cookie is mind blowing. I LOVE the amount of chocolate in the inside. What a concept! (Yes, I am eating the cookie as I write this).Gluten (aka the devil) Situation:100% GLUTEN FREE. Come through fellow celiacs!! Order ANYTHING from the menu. Without fear of being poisoned. Enjoy! Question:What does the name mean? Why "As Quoted" (which I just quoted. Ha!) Thanks!
Love this place! I have celiac and a dairy intolerance and had the best meal ever! So excited about this place and will definitely be back.

A hidden, unknown spot in the Presidio Heights but amazing for healthy, good-for-you options. Came here after a workout class with my friends. The interior is simple, minimalistic and white. I would say it's both a great spot to come with friends and to come alone and get work done. I ordered the herb salad with the green goddess dressing. Added chicken and a poached egg on top. Overall, tasted great; the only think I would say is, you should order extra chicken since they didn't put much on mine. My friends ordered the avocado toast and the yogurt bowl. Personally, I am addicted to hazelnuts so I was biased and loved the yogurt. P. S. They have oat milk - get the matcha latte with it!
Nothing but love for this place... great food, drinks. Try the purple protein smoothie, an Andytown coffee, choc chic cookie, Cobb Salad or the banana muffins... you won't be disappointed!

Worst breakfast place I have ever been to in SF....and considering how much we eat out, that's a very difficult mark to reach! We ordered in, and the server brought my wife's meal on a plate, but brought mine in a to go box. Instead of offering to fix it and bring it on a plate, the girl behind the cash counter said "it's ok, we just got the tag wrong" and proceeded to give me a fork and knife!!!She brought my glass of wine 15 min into the meal and it was warm!This place is a dump. Pretentious but crappy service. Very disappointing, especially since I had high hopes of this neighborhood joint.

I love this place!Giving them four stars because they can't get their To Go orders straight!At least 80% of the time something is missing! I do check before leaving but it's a hassle to open the boxes and one feels like an jerk while checking. They need a special person for To Go orders! It's difficult for the counter person to handle the job.

Went for lunch. Very nice location, bright, airy, warm. Food: Taste was ok, I ordered The Herb salad. It was missing more flavor (salt and citrus/acid). Price was very steep for what was served. Drinks: I would return for coffee and tea.Over all a nice location, friendly staff, and decent food.

Not sure why you would go here with a Starbucks around the street. Location in itself is nice, cute neighborhood. Quality of the coffee is not good, coffee beans are burnt giving an off flavor (This hasn't changed no matter how many times I decide to 'give it a second chance'). Service is mediocre. Wouldn't recommend.

Adorable place that could use some work on logistics. 2 person seating tables along the entry, bar along the side, two big tables in the back that can seat 6-8 ish. Pros:- cute space - decent coffee and food is tasty. Taco salad for $15. Cons:- Steep steep prices that don't quite correspond to value - WiFi is spotty. Don't recommend this spot for working - slow service, I waited for my food for FOREVER and eventually just walked over and picked it up from the counter

This place is a weekly staple. I'm a creature of habit so often order the same thing, taco salad, turmeric latte (best in the city), & a banana muffin. I do change up my salad from time to time, it's hard to go wrong here. The atmosphere is peaceful and lovely so occasionally I'll bring my laptop to work. The mochi waffle for brunch is a gluten intolerant/celiacs dream come true! A favorite SF spot.

I went out of convenience initially but now I've stopped.  The lattes are good but all their prices are whacked and portions are small except the salads.  Lettuce is pretty cheap after all.  Service is good.  They also leave this small plate of fries out near the register which I always find odd.  Perhaps it's to let you know that a side of fries is like six fries so don't expect more . Lol.
Beautiful paleo food, and beautiful and peaceful setting. well thought out menu with gluten free dairy free options

Gluten free heaven! Also great to take your baby--back area seating with lots of room and really sturdy tables (moms & dads you know what I'm talkin' 'bout!). One of, if not the BEST gluten free spots I've been to. And amazing almond milk latte. Thank you for a great breakfast!
Wildly expensive for what you receive. My large coffee was filled only 3/4 of the to go cup.
It's a bit pricy compared to the restaurants around. The food tastes okay. Their real price doesn't match the price on yelp.

Came in here for brunch. They weren't accommodating even though it was just past 12. Who doesn't serve brunch past 12 on a weekend? Would recommend they clarify their yelp profile and change their brunch hours on the weekebd

This cafe is a gold mine of amazingness. On the outside, it might look like an ordinary coffee shop that also serves up sandwiches or food or stuff. Wait till you actually order food though. You will get some beautifully plated food. The pictures speak for themselves.So it looks good, but is it good? Spoiler alert: yes. The food tastes as good as it looks. Pair whatever you get with a cup of coffee and you got a solid meal that won't break the bank. I got myself a cobb sandwich, a minestrone soup, and a cafe con leche. Ah yes, did I mention, sandwiches come with a salad or soup which is just as substantial as the sandwich itself. So yes, I had a great meal.There's space to study and all, but honestly, it's great to just sit down and eat too and live in that moment of good food and coffee.
Laid back neighborhood gem. Tasty menu, fresh ingredients, gracious proprietor who's always glad to see me and is never too busy to wish me well on my way out :-)
I just had the best ceased salad!! The food looks & tastes like art in this unassuming cafe. So glad to have come in here. I wish we'd ordered more food now!
Yummy mushroom soup! Latte was very milky and seemed to need another shot of espresso so I will add one next time.
this place is way differently priced then advertised on yelp the salads are mostly around $15 and the coffees are pricey

My absolute favorite place for breakfast and working on my computer. This place is the best place in Inner Sunset to work on your computer or study and still have good coffee and lots of food options. They have WiFi and a few outlets to plug into if you need to charge your computer which Starbucks DOES NOT HAVE! Everyone working here is super friendly and they are always happy to see the regulars and remember peoples names, especially the cook, Pepe, as he is ALWAYS there! Totally a "Cheers" vibe "you always wanna go where everyone knows your name " The food is pretty good, it's a little more expensive than some places but but not by much and I'd rather come here where they make it feel like home.
Always friendly staff and great food!I live very close and it's one of my favorite neighborhood spots! Great for breakfast and lunch.

Loved this little spot! Spent a few hours here during the day on a weekday. The food was delicious. And filling! According to the reviews I expected serving sizes to be small - that definitely wasn't the case. Each of the sandwiches (on extra delicious bread) came with either a medium-sized bowl of delicious minestrone soup (varies by day) or a medium to large-ish salad. I got the Brie cheese turkey sandwich and the guy got the California. Highly recommend them both. Great quality ingredients, fresh bread, and friendly service. Will definitely be back!

My friends and I came when we were starving and it was around 1ish it was filled but we found a place for us to sit. The sandwiches were really good. It was simple but extremely filling. The bread was really good but when we asked if there was any honey in the wheat bread (because my friend has an allergy) they didn't know, so unfortunately she had to eat her sandwich with the bread :( the lattes were not that great either our coffee tasted like pure milk. But over all I think what mattered was the food which was great

Disappointing food. Mocha was watered down with no chocolate. Latte was also watered down and bad flavor. Food took over 30 minutes when it wasn't busy. The food also didn't taste good. It looks like they don't have a kitchen either so not sure where they cook their food? Many places within walking distance are 10x better for the same price.

Stopped by this cafe to grab a quick bite and get some work done. There are several tables around outlets and there's also free wifi which made things convenient. Not too crowded too, so it was easy to find a spot. I ordered the Tuna Salad Sandwich with Minestrone. Really Really good. At that price point you can't get much better than that. They don't skimp you out on any of the ingredients, you'll get a generous amount of everything. The plating is also very clean. It kinda makes you feel like you're eating at a fairly upscale restaurant. It definitely adds a level of class to the casual cafe setting. The minestrone came out hot and each bite was so just as good as the last. The only thing that was underwhelming was the strawberry banana smoothie. Tasted kind of watered down and not as fruity as I wanted it to be. The people that work there are also such sweethearts. That and the food are definitely enough to keep me coming back.
This is going to be my new favorite spot. Tons of tables, quiet, great WiFi, lots of outlets. And the FOOD. If I could give 7 stars, I would.
Food presentation and flavor was significantly better than expected, really loving this place.

Cute local-favored spot. Pretty quiet during the week.Very sweet and thoughtful owner. Can't sai my chai was the best I've ever had, but it's the standard stuff at every coffee spot. My gut feeling is I should order actual coffee stuff here like a cappuccino next time. Bathroom is clean and reasonably large. Lots of seating with cushy seats.

This is a super cute restaurant in the inner sunset. Perfect for brunch if you feel like eggs Benedict but really could do without the fifty hour wait to get into the hot spots around town. We had the smoked salmon Benedict and the regular Benedict with bacon. Both were served on top of classic English muffins and alongside with an artistic dollop of Tabasco, fanciest Tabasco offering ever! The eggs were accompanied by a beautiful pile of fresh fruit, sitting atop another fancy dollop of yogurt. The whole presentation was just beautiful. The coffee was strong, and got us set for a great start to the weekend. I couldn't have asked for more from this place. I'll definitely go back!

Most underrated place in Inner Sunset! The food is so fresh and good. This is not your regular sandwich place. It's like fine dinning but in a very causal setting. Relaxed and the staff is very kind. Every time I go in there they are quick and kind. Service with a smile! Love the soup and sandwiches! So good!!! Check it out! :)

Excellent as ever! Still recommend cafe la flore for food or coffee! Friendly service and always a good spot to study. I don't come here as often since I live far, but still would like to visit when I'm in the area!

Hidden gem in the Embarcadero/ FiDi area! I forgot how awesome this place is! The coffee is great and locally roasted. None of the pretense or crowds of Philz or Blue Bottle and obviously better than Starbucks. It's tucked away in an alley so it's harder to notice, but it's part of the charm.

Paramo is my go to coffee house. This place was recommended to me by several of my co-workers and I have been going here a couple times a week for over a year. I typically have the same order every time i go. Vanilla latte with two or four shots. However, when I went today I was sadly informed the owner took vanilla off the menu. I was shook, this can't be true!! Where will I go to get my Vanilla Latte? Other than the amazing coffee the staff is ALWAYS friendly and provide exceptional service. PLEASE BRING THE VANILLA BACK FOR THE LATTES!!

Really nice coffee. I would give their cappuccino a 4/5 for the richness and depth of flavor. There were only three window seats but it had a nice view. I'd probably try more places before coming back to this shop.
Excellent coffee and service at a better price than Blue Bottle. They also play great music!  Very glad to support this group of dedicated folks.

Great espresso drinks and chai latte. Very quick service. Note that there isn't any indoor seating, but there are tables and chairs outside in the common area, so it's good for grab and go or a casual meeting, but not a good spot for sitting down to work on a laptop.

Was in the neighborhood and was looking for a non chain coffee place. Kinda ran into this place along the shops near the Embarcadero shops near the Hyatt Hotel. They had a small shop and it was exactly what I was looking for. Cafe Mocha wasn't too sweet and not to bitter. Baristas were friendly and they also had baked goods. If your in the area and wanted a handcrafted coffee which is not from a super chain of coffeehouses, this place is for you.

Small, cute coffee shop near the Embarcadero. I love their dirty chai which has the perfect amount of chai vs espresso. Not too sweet and not too over powering. Their scones are great as well, but I wish they would heat them up. The chocolate scone would be perfect with a little melted chocolate in the middle.

The coffee was really delicious, so I have to give them stars for that. However, if you are looking for a place to work, this wouldn't be my first pick. The actual place is very small with just a tiny little table to work. You can work at the tables outside though, but that's pretty weather-dependent (and knowing sf, it's most likely to just be cold and windy). Plus, no outlets is a thing. But if you're not coming to work, hit this place up for a good coffee.

Cute little coffee shop in the embarcadero. I really enjoyed their vanilla latte! It was just the right amount of sweet without being overpowering. They also offer almond milk for those who can't drink or don't like milk. When I visit coffee shops I look at not only their coffee but also the ambiance. The baristas were friendly and the coffee shop was really cute. I would definitely go again!

They have pu-erh, my favorite black tea, so it makes for a great place to meet up with coffee loving friends or for interviews. Just be aware the seating inside is very limited, and outside can be noisy and chilly

Love this place! The espresso and milk is perfect! Every time I go, the quality and taste are consistently wonderful. There aren't a lot of options but it's not a Starbucks. It's a place that caters to people who actually love coffee and don't need weird flavors added to it to enjoy it. Keep it up Paramo! You have a loyal customer right here.

"Coffee is a language in itself" -- Jackie ChanAnd the "language" spoken in this small coffee shop in Embarcadero Center is smooth and pleasant, but it does not lack the required caffeine kick that we all look for when we toss up a shot of espresso or two! The barista's at this Embarcadero Center location are very friendly and good at what they do. Co-founders Gabriel Boscana and Robert Myers source and roast their coffee beans from Flying Goat Coffee, local importers in Healdsburg. They have a commitment to the local community and engage in charitable activities in the neighborhoods they operate. Read this to see how they are taking on climate change: goo.gl/DcJBUx
Hands down my favorite white marble countered hole in the wall coffee stop in SF. Try the cappuccino or the iced coffee. They have nice succulents too.

Incredible espresso! Went here 4 times on my previous visit to SF. Big fan of their espresso. When I come back I will absolutely be coming back. Right around the corner from the Hyatt Regency as well.

Almost indistinguishable from Blue Bottle, (tastes like they roast their beans slightly longer though) but cute little location and with way shorter lines than the BB in the Ferry Building. Great little spot to drop into on your way to the embarcadero plaza shopping.

Good enough coffee for me, friendly baristas, quick service, it's perfect for a break.This is purely personal, so at the risk of TMI, it's just far enough from my office to get away for a bit, but not so far that I have to run to get back to work. What I'm really looking for is an Italian-style coffee bar where nothing is to-go and customers stand around for a few minutes drinking out of real cups with saucers. Also, an espresso costs around one euro. In the absence of my dream place, this hits the spot.
I like that they offer organic coffee. I also like that they offer paleo muffin options and sheep milk yogurt. Call me a snob, but they roast their beans a little too much for my taste.

First visited this place yesterday. It is a very nice spot. There is nice seating right in front of the barista station and as well as next door in the apartment lobby lounge. The wifi is great! Lots of windows which give great lighting. Coffee: Honestly, the coffee doesn't stand out that much but that is not to say that it is not good. It def has a good standard taste. Outlets: Many people were saying there are no outlets. In the main space, that is true. Move over to the lobby lounge area and they are in the couches. Service: Very friendly baristas. Def recommend if you need a spot to chill or study. Great vibes.
One of top coffee shop in san francisco. My usual order are regular latte. In my book, coffee here are better than blue bottle!

11am quick service.Espresso drinks simplified - the cappuccino is disguised on the menu as "espresso + milk". Get it in a 12oz and it becomes a latte.The ginger scone is fantastic and other varieties looked enticing.Friendly service and non-pretentious espresso in a well designed space for an average San Franciscan price.

Came here for the free wifi and good reviews. Was blown away by their Turkish coffee which was sweetened and SUPER strong, just as promised. Service was also super friendly and accommodating as I changed my breakfast order a bajillion times and also asked for the bathroom to be opened just as many times. Would definitely recommend if you want some strong coffee and easy, open work space.
Nice place, you feel welcome and at home immediately. The cappuccino was ok as well as the carrot cake. We chatted with the owner who was very nice, I would return if in the area.

This is hands down the best cafe in SF. Zahra is so fun and her cafe is the best place to work. I recommend a bagel with all the veggies and an iced coffee.  If you are lucky she will give you an ice cube made of coffee shaped like a gun. ALSO- health score of 100, that's hard to come by :)

Yelp reviewers gave 4.5 stars for this place. I was a little disappointed. The almond milk Cafe latte was mediocre. I wanted it "extra extra hot", it came tepid. The almond milk was too thin so it was like drinking weakly brewed coffee. My son ordered Turkish coffee and it came very sweet.  However he later said he could get used to it.  Two things that were redeeming: 1. The staff was very friendly and sweet; 2. The back patio with painted frescoes was cute and nice place to sit.
What a great spot! Thanks for a fantastic service, delicious menu items and reasonable prices. Nice backyard and clean decor with flowers smelling fresh... next level
it's filthy, the bathroom smells horrid and food and coffee meh

The chocolate cake was amazing! Haven't tried anything else but definitely going back. Took one star off only cause I felt like I was in a hospital the lighting was so bright inside, so I took it togo instead of staying there.
Loved the owner and her vibes lots of love poured into her shop and you can tell. Her customers and employees all seemed very happy great spot all year round unfortunately I'm from out of town
Super grubby place. Food is ok is all. Coffee basic. Tea cheap stuff. Very poor wifi.Cash only so they cheat the taxman.

Back when I was a young upstart musician, I would frequent this waterhole. This was back when I would get high... If I could recommend something, get the Turkish coffee. It's the most expensive beverage on the menu. Delicious and neat after taste too. Shout out to Clyde Always and Gerald running the Sunday night jazz!
A great little cafe, in a very convenient location. Love the outdoor patio and the wide selection of foods and drinks. Bring cash if you are coming or be ready to use the ATM they have.

The Niçoise salad was good, and they give you a couple slices of bread to go with it. A lot of people were hanging out here on a Saturday morning, working, reading, eating, or out in the back patio. The lady who seemed like the owner was very friendly. There is free WiFi and just an FYI, it's cash only! I definitely want to come back to try some of their popular bagels!
I was really surprised by the place. Service was extra ordinary and very thoughtful, great place to chill for a few hours. Good food, nice band. Thank you!

One of my favorite cafes in San Francisco - and a cultural landmark! I first started getting the soup and salad special here back in 1992 and have been returning ever since, same owners! It's heartening to be known and welcomed so warmly. Delicious food and kind people. Worth a visit.

Hands down the best breakfast bagel I've ever had.  As opposed to the norm where the bagel comes as one, all elements of the bagel were deconstructed, plated so simple yet beautiful.The EGG was the highlight. It was a perfectly browned round omelette; not scrambled like I am used to. The entire cafe had a very chill and relaxed environment. Many parties were just of one, enjoying the World Cup that was playing in the background, or reading the newspaper. There is a cutely decorated backyard patio for seating as well.
Like it says on the menue, the sandwiches are actually made with love. Super friendly service and very vosy and comfortable couches makes you feel like you are in a living room

Hands down the nicest cafe in town. Not the best food, or coffee - but by far the best people and community. Fantastic place to work, especially in the beautiful backyard. You are always met with a smile and a LARGE cup of coffee, that priced much lover than normal.

This is simply my favorite Cafe in the world. Yes, it's a bold statement, but it's true. The coffee is incredible. Whether you're drinking hot, black coffee, cappuccinos, lattes, or whatever caffeine fix you need, you will be well taken care of. They have tasty, fresh, well-made products at a great price. The salads, soups, pastries, smoothies, egg breakfasts, bagels, sandwiches, and everything else on their menu hits the spot. ALL the ingredients are fresh, delicious, and most importantly, made with love.The wi-fi is quick, space aplenty, and a beautiful back patio. The cafe supports local artists, has open mic Friday, and Jazz on Sunday evenings. This place is magical.And it's all because of Zahra and her incredible staff. Zahra (and the Cafe) are institutions in San Francisco and the Lower Haight. She is the sweetest, realest, and most loving person you will ever meet. Please take the time to have a quick conversation with her and your heart will be fuller, your day will be better, and you'll feel inspired to take on the day. I love Zahra, I love the Cafe, and if you are ever in San Francisco, take a trip here to have a cup of coffee, some breakfast/lunch, and spend an hour or two relaxing in this magical place. You will be very happy you did.

A warm and welcoming neighborhood cafe with couches, tables and artwork. We enjoyed the salami and prosciutto sandwiches made on fresh French bread. The bagels come loaded with cream cheese and tomatoes which were tasty. The iced mocha came with large ice cubes and a soothing but hardy strength for morning wake up calls. Don't forget to bring cash as they are cash only with an ATM in the corner. We grabbed cash at the citi bank atm in the CVS across the street first.

Being a creature of habit...on my way to hunt for some vintage vinyl, I'll stop at Cafe International. I have been going there so long I used to do my homework in there when I was going to SFCC. They had a nice selection of baked goods. The coffee was good...lot's of space to spread out if you are working on something that requires some elbow room. The restroom is opposite of the front door across a giant room. They can buzz you into the restroom so there isn't a key. I walked in and had to pee so I asked to be buzzed in...I thought I heard her say something and looked back "Sorry, did you say some..." "You gotta buy something!""What?" I really didn't get it...after hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars...I'm not a VIP by a long shot, but...really? I'm not going back...there are so many small business that cultivate relationships.

I'm not much of a coffee drinker (I have the taste buds of a child) but I couldn't help trying this coffee shop because I always walk past during my commute. As you have probably noticed from the photos, it is very ~aesthetic~, minimalist, & hipster. It's located in Chinatown, an interesting choice of location.I got the cocoa cappuccino and I really liked it, which is surprising considering I am a coffee heathen whose rare consumption of "coffee" is a Starbucks cookie crumble Frappuccino (basically a milkshake). The barista was friendly and we had a nice chat when I dropped in to try the place early in the morning. It was mostly empty when I came by but apparently it gets pretty busy around 9ish. Definitely try this place if you're a coffee snob or if you just want a nice, Instagram-worthy photo while wandering around Chinatown.

Visited here when on vacation to San Francisco!  What a find Reef, beard Brian and little Brian are Awesome!  They are so knowledgeable - this is so much more than a coffee spot it is a coffee experience!!So many different coffee options and different drinks.  We ended up going all 3 days we were in town. If you are in San Francisco - make it a stop! You can pass it on San Francisco Mason and Powell trolley lines.
Happy Coffee is the best! And you'll get that here!! Props to my new friend Brent...I will be back!!

It's the small things that make a business stand out. And this place does those small things well. The staff is friendly, the coffee tastes great, and the cable car rolling past, humming and clanking, is the best music to start your day with.

My favorite new coffee shop next to Peet's!   I live around the corner & come often.  The crew are really friendly & the Cappuccino's are wonderful.  Small selection of sweets to enjoy as well.  Small shop with no seating inside but two benches outside.   I love this small place & hope they do well!  Maybe they'll extend their hours later on??
I ordered a latte and was letting it cool for a moment before I drank it. The barista came over a minute later with a new latte, saying he wasn't satisfied with the first one.

Wonderful little coffee shop. It's normally staffed with just one really awesome and kind barista at a time, so be patient and expect good coffee. Oh and it's right next to Chinatown. What's I like:-Coffee?-Affordability. $3.50 for a cappuccino is good in my books.-Great staff! The whole rotation of baristas are awesome in their own way.-The shop itself is small and cute.-Accessible by cable car.-Very personal experience.What I dislike: -Nothing! Keep on dishing out great coffee.-

I'm writing this 5mins after I left. I stumbled to this place as I was walking around Chinatown, reminiscing childhood memories. I've never thought a coffee shop like this would exist so close to a place I cherish a lot. The ambiance definitely caught my eye. The decor was spot on- very simple, elegant, and peaceful. This place is not your sit down coffee shop, it's more of a stop and go place. There are no chairs inside and it's a bit small. The menu consist of various unique coffee and tea. I went with the vanilla spice latte, and it was very delicious. The cable car runs through from time to time to really give you that full San Francisco experience.  I'm slightly bias with The Coffee Movement as not only did I enjoyed the good coffee, but the awesome childhood memories it brought back.

This is an amazing coffee experience! It's not really a place you would go to sit down and hang out as the space is very small, but if you're just looking to taste some really incredible coffee and enjoy the experience, I can't recommend this place enough!

Definitely a good addition to the neighborhood, first time today 4/26/19 and the espresso tonic had the espresso favor and aroma with a clean slightly carbonated finish.. worth a try if you like iced drinks and want something slightly different,so.....after finishing that I ordered a 2nd drink the honey lavender latte, you could definitely smell the lavender but the taste was very light... worth a try if your in the area

So happy this place opened in a quiet part of Nob Hill. Very welcomed addition that serves awesome (smooth, never bitter) espresso drinks. Staff is inviting and warm, space is bright and clean, and it's my new coffee spot - even if I have to walk past a half dozen other spots on Polk to get there.  Well worth the walk. Thanks Brian and rest of the team. Be seeing you on a regular basis with or without the pup.
Great coffee! Thank you to Brian for his hospitality. Highly recommend the cafe tonic with the Yukro from Madcap.

Such a great find! It's a fairly random location, but well worth the walk from the financial district. They had a number of espresso options but I had Heart out of Portland. The guys who run the shop are super nice as well.

The service from the folks behind the bar was impeccable in every way. They even offered for me to park my child's stroller inside...My cappuccino was delicious. Was disappointed that they had ran out of croissants and was treated to a cookie instead. These guys are magicians, and in a sea of pretentious java I'll sail with The Coffee Movement.

Walked out of my friends house and could just smell this place. Had never noticed it before but the smell is amazing and you can't miss it. Walked in and got the lavender latte probably some of the best coffee ever. And I hate coffee. I never drink coffee. It was my absolute hangover cure. Also shout out to the barista for hooking me up. Will definitely make this my Saturday morning coffee stop. Because the coffee place next to my house sucks. Definitely worth walking five blocks.
One of the best lattes I have ever had.  Great owners, no ego and fair prices.Lots of options for single origin drip and baked goods.
Their cappuccino is really fantasticI was planning to do some reading here but unfortunately they don't have chairs...

I found this little gem one Sunday when I was in a crisis of wanting to go out, but not knowing where to go. I saw that they were closing in 40 minutes, so I rushed over from where I lived and managed to get in the door with about 20 minutes to spare.This is a small, but well-lit and clean shop. If I had to model my future kitchen area, I would use this shop as inspiration. It's minimal, no-nonsense, and really puts the focus on the coffee and how it's being made. I'd go as far as to say that the all-white interior was so that the coffee could provide the colour. I've been here twice, having ordered a cappuccino and a latte. Both times, I was in awe at how much grace and passion went into making my cup. The attention to detail in providing an experience was evident, as I also was passed a lid on a small saucer. Talk about making me feel special.Both coffees were ready to drink, at the right temperature right away. I couldn't taste any hints of the espresso being burnt, and it tasted oh-so-smooth. I knew I couldn't get my coffee from anywhere else now. I'm ready to spend a lot more money here in order to try everything on the menu.It turns out you can really taste the love someone puts into making your coffee.
Very good espresso. I actually just had to have two :) friendly and nice barista/owner. Happy we made the trip here on a rainy Saturday morning #espressoismyboyfriend

Great place and the taste of coffee is just  mouth warming and  refreshing. The place is very well furnish and the sitting arrangement is also nice. The peaceful environment also gives the relaxation to the mind. The  various flavored makes the drinking of coffee is  just awesome.

I went here back in Feb, before Valentine's Day with a friend. We both got hot elephant chai lattes, for there. The drink itself was good but undrinkable for like 30 minutes because it was WAY TOO HOT I burned my tongue and that wasn't all that was burnt that day. I went to go grab the drinks and they did not come with plates and the way their cups were, the arm to even hold the cup up was very small so the moment my skin came in contact with the cup, instant burn to my middle and ring finger. I had asked the barista if they had plates and just quickly said no and continued to make other drinks. I thought to myself, "you'll be alright Mimi, you've dealt with burns before" but as the day went on my fingers started to welt a bit. And here we are now into June and both my fingers are still not healed, everyone I've showed it to has told me it looked like second degree burns. My sis in law said she had it happen to her and it looked like mine and it didn't heal for a year! Its kind of gross to look at so to have had it for about 4 months already and having tried everything I could to make it heal faster this is quite upsetting. So please tell the baristas to make the hot drinks at drinkable temps, it's been bothering me ever since I had to finally write a review :'(

I'm a huge chai fan!! So you can imagine that I was super excited to try this chai bar. Along with my excitement, I was hoping to have the best chai ever! Especially since I'm no chai expert and wouldn't consider my tastebuds to be extremely refined. However, I found the chai here to be just OKAY. I ordered the tiger spice chai. It was good, but I want WOW'ed. BF wasn't a fan at all (but he's also not a huge chai person so don't expect to convert anyone here). And prices are on the higher end for a cup. Atmosphere is chill. It wasn't too busy when we came.
So much space to do work, which is great. Downside is that the chais are way too sweet.

Coincidence~I am listening to Rio right now as I type this review lol.We used the Ritual app for their $1 promotion to order this turmeric chai drink! And wow this was the best chai I have ever had! The warmth of the turmeric spice went well with the chai. They have oat milk, and oat milk is the new almond milk-it's thicker and creamier. Proceeds from specific drinks go towards wildlife conservation!Very spacious-looks like the perfect study spot!

I really wanted to like this place. I ordered the iced tiger chai with espresso and it honestly just tasted like sweet chai flavored milk. I was expecting a strong chai flavor with a hint of espresso, but all I could taste was sugar and milk. The drink was also on the pricier end (about $5-6) - I don't mind paying for a quality drink that tastes good, but the chai here wasn't my cup of tea at all.

Spacious cafe, perfect for study days. I wish it were open later hours (closes at 6pm), but I can't ask for everything.I tried the tiger chai, their specialty. I've had a lot of chai lattes and tbh this one didn't stand out to me that much. Nonetheless, it was still delicious and at a standard sf price.Probably wouldn't come out of my way for their drinks, but it is a nice place to study at. Worth trying out

Came here with coworkers today and was really excited since David Rio is my favorite brand of chai. The vibe I was great and there was enough seating for us. Most of us had the chai flight and were sadly disappointed. Most of them tasted like mildly flavored frothed milk. Hoping this was just an inexperienced person making our chai but this did not meet my expectations.I'll probably go one more time in case our experience was a fluke but overall pains me to say you can get better chai at Starbucks.

Came here on the recommendation of my sister, who knows that my go to drink is chai. I was super excited to try this place and had some time to kill before an appointment in the afternoon. I got an iced vanilla elephant chai with whole milk. Good chai flavor but not too overpowering, also the vanilla added the perfect amount of sweetness. Also, plenty of seating, looked like lots of people come here to chill, work on things/study, or just grab lunch. They also have a chai flight that looked pretty good too. Will definitely come back to try that!

Had the Elephant Vanilla Chai as a treat. Enjoyed it. Did not, however, enjoy seeing my digital receipt for my purchase later on--a 25% tip was added to my total, and not by me. I didn't agree to it, and find that to be HELLA shady. Will not return.
Fantastic chai. Always hot. Cart attendant is so nice. Flavor smooth and consistent. Wish they would come to Sacramento.

I had to use the internet close by so I walked in. Great workspace. Free wifi (you have to sign up with your email/fb account). Big tables. Tons of outlets under the seats. Chill vibes. Music in the morning is on point.I didnt have their chai since I'm not a huge fan of chai. I was going to order their tea but it was too expensive for 16oz of hot water + loose leaf tea ($4.50). I did have their cheddar bacon scone ($3.50). Pretty tasty but wasn't fresh.If I was back in the area and had to use internet, I would definitely stop on by.

I stopped in for breakfast and damn.  I'll be visiting this place regularly when I'm in San Francisco.  I had a veggie breakfast sandwich that was very generous and a dirty tiger chai that was excellent.  Very impressed.  Service was lovely, too.
I usually never go for Chai tea at cafes, but walked in here to try..And must say, I really enjoyed the Elephant Vanilla tea.. no additional sugar or cream needed!It was just refreshing!

CHAI! I'm obsessed with it. Coffee makes me jittery so I drink tea instead. Drinking Chai is one of my favorite ways to warm up during cold winter mornings. It relaxes me yet gives me the energy to start my day - Chai is magical.Chai bar is a one stop shop for everything Chai! You want a Chai latte?  - Come to Chai BarYou want to brew your own? - Buy the powdersYou want a boba? - Add it to your Chai LatteDon't take sugar? - They have sugar free on the menuYou want coffee? - Add it to your chai to make it a dirty chaiThe list goes on and on!I ordered the Chai flight for $7. I was pretty sad that the flavors were pre selected. Of course the best flavor was the original tiger spice chai. A second would be the cub chai which you can really taste the ginger. The third would be the white shark (though I honestly don't think the flavor is memorable). The worst flavor was the boldly spice. It tasted really diluted and no flavor at all.I also ordered the Elephant Vanilla Chai and really liked its creaminess and sweetness. Though you can barely taste any strong aromas of chai in this one.

I was on my way to grab my fav-Philz-when I came across this place. I love chai so I was immediately drawn in to look at the menu. There were so many to choose from and I was overwhelmingly delighted. After asking the sweet cashier for her suggestion, I went with a large peanut butter chai. BEST THING EVER. Took my best friend back recently, got the seasonal apple cider chai, SO GOOD TOO. Does not disappoint! Yummy AND for a good cause.

wow this place is amazing. i was walking down market street craving a warm drink and saw this chai bar. i got the tiger spiced chai which was SO delicious, probably one of the best chais i've ever had which is saying a lot considering i'm indian. the flavors and spices were so aromatic and i couldn't get over how tasty and creamy it was. they have so many different options & also a plethora of dairy preferences. the entire atmosphere of this place is relaxing and cozy and the message and theme of the chai bar is a great decision. price is on the higher side but it is soo worth it. i would highly recommend coming here!!
Great place in a not so great part of town. I recommend the flight if you either like chai or are new to it.
Great quality and unique flavors! Wait time is short and customer service is great. It's definitely a space where you can work remotely.

I've been here a few times in the early morning and absolutely love their various CHAI drinks! Lots and lots of indoor seating (great if you need to sit and get some work done) and outdoor tables, soy milk has no added fee, and employees are always happy to adjust your drink to make sure it's right. 5-star customer service!They serve breakfast sandwiches, will have to try one next time!

Everything here that I've tried so far is delicious!The Tiger Spice Chai, Medium Power Chai, the Elephant Vanilla Chai... all wonderfully chai-y and made very quickly.You can sign up for Ritual here to get $10 to order with, so that's 2 free medium chais right there!It's a bit pricy, but that's because the quality is so good. It's a nice space in here as well if you want to stay for a chat or to study.

First timer and I already love this cafe! I was looking for a cafe suitable for work which meant it needed free WiFi, outlets, sufficient seating, and white noise. This cafe not only met all of my needs but beyond! The first thing I saw when I came in was a small station for free water refills. I was SOLD. Do you know how stingy some cafes can be when they are reluctant to give you water? To me, having free water available at a cafe enhances my experience a lot (probably because I'm not a big coffee drinker). I was then delighted by the beautiful interior decor and furnitures. I came here on a Tuesday at around 10am. The cafe was mostly empty with lots of free tables and outlets. Oh the outlets! There are so many underneath tables and booths. The only complaint I have is the lack of lighting. It was a bit dark for working so I moved closer to the window.

I love this place. I had a cold brew here. They also have a lot of seating and would be a great place to get a drink after work. There is two bars, one on the front and the other in back. I definitely will be back and want to sample a hot coffee.

Think I found my favorite coffee place in the city (for working purposes). What can I say - it has good coffee, usually flexible seating, decent lighting, and free WiFi. All of which are easy said than done, and this is a total package. It is located in the FIDI next to BlackRock and Nasdaq, and about 4 mins walk from me. Most people here grab seats to finish some work quietly, so I've enjoyed consistent efficiency while being here. I have been to other few around the area, but the interior vibe was too casual/social, and made it hard to concentrate. Happily becoming a regular here!

This is one of my favorite places to in downtown San Francisco to work from. There's plenty of tables and outlets, and most of all, it's not super noisy like other coffee shops in the area. They also have a decent beer selection, so if you feel like you need to get some creative juices running, then this is the perfect place for you to work. The staff is always friendly too! I've never had a bad experience. Great place to stop by if you're meeting someone for a coffee.

Super disappointing. Ordered an iced matcha latte and it tasted like straight up milk. Color of the drink was light green so there was barely any matcha put into it. Came here because I thought it was a spacious place to do my work but the drinks just ruined it :(

I found this nice coffee shop on Yelp when I was looking for a study/work place with wi-fi in the city. It was raining outside but the atmosphere inside was pretty cozy so I enjoyed my work session there. I ordered their matcha latte and asked to make it not too sweet and they achieved the perfect sweetness level for my taste buds. The baristas (two guys) seemed like the ?owners? and were very friendly.Overall, very happy with my experience but it lasted only for 40 minutes because they close at 6pm and I had to leave :( It would definitely be my go-to place if I lived nearby.

In the city where it's a major struggle to find a non crowded, semi-quiet space to work in cafes, Red Door is an absolute gem in SOMA. They serve a solid latte featuring Verve beans and a delicious Dynamo pistachio donut. Plenty of seating (inside and out), WiFi, and outlets to match. Seems like I've already praised to much--I hope word doesn't get out!

They have the best avocado toast in town. Imagine a combination of avocado and spices? I couldn't so I tried it. Luckily they worked perfectly on me :-)They got a nice collection of coffee and chai derivatives. I love dirty chai.

I had a couple of hours to kills in FiDi before a client meeting so I decided to park myself at the Coffee Shop. I decided to get the cold brew ($4.50) and asked for single pump of vanilla flavor but was told that apart from simple syrup they don't have any flavor shots. The barista was friendly which is the case in most of the coffee shows in FiDi except Peets.The cold brew had a clean non-acidic taste as expected but it lacked any real depth of flavor and felt monotonous. It did the job of keeping me busy for an hour or so and I was on my way as a happy customer. 3.5 stars rounded to 4 is how I'd rate this place.

I love coming to Red Door to meet with both clients and friends -- it's spacious, never overly crowded (at least in the morning), has a variety of drinks and foods. So far, I've had their green tea, hot chocolate and iced chai -- all have been delicious with no surprises.Avo toast -- good ratio of avocado to bread, and I've always been full afterThey have some kind of croissant-PLUS pastry, whose name I always forget.  What I mean by "plus" is that it's even more buttery, flaky and sugary than a normal croissant.  I've only had it once, and it was a huge sugar bomb.  If I worked out more, I would probably get it more often... as it is, I have to be careful.

Good coffee but the WiFi wasn't working for me or for any of my neighbors, when I told the employees, they didn't seem to care too much. They said it's working and that was that. I ended up using my hotspot since I had already ordered coffee, but for a place that advertises "coffee and connect", they maybe should have decent WiFi.

A not-too-crowded cafe in the bottom floor of a SF skyscraper. However, it's modern borderline futuristic interior defy the "cozy" cafe stereotype. While the non-crowdedness would draw me in to work there, the lack of natural light and access to windows is not ideal for me at least. Has all the coffee/tea drinks you would want, but they're also accompanied by the SF pricing. They also offer a small selection of pastries and 3-4 types of toast on Acme bread. Toast looked good and not too expensive, but it took the one barista quite a while to make it, creating a line at the register. I'll probably come back on my way to work. A clean, solid, and quiet cafe.

The place is really nice, the matcha latte was good, but $6.50 for a small matcha latte with almond milk is just outrageous. I typically don't complain about price, because I understand the business needs to run, but I'd much rather put a $6.50 toward a large boba guys than for something I can make myself at home.

This is an indoor POPOS in the NASDAQ building. The entrance to the space is on 1st (where the Nasdaq ticker style banner is). The coffee shop is currently serving Verve coffee, which is alright. Bathrooms are within secured spaces, so you have to ask the lobby security to buzz you in  Lighting is dim but there was a lot of seating, electric outlets, and good WiFi.

This place is located under the NASDAQ company building. As a result, it's filled with the people I assume work there. Down the street, you'll also find Equator Coffee under the Linked In building filled with Linked In workers. It's interesting. This was my first time exploring coffee shops that were located in company buildings. The staff wasn't exactly excited to see me, but they got the job done quickly and efficiently. They offer not only coffee but some beers as well! How nice. Wifi password is accessibly presented on the table. Spacious seating. Clean bathrooms that are a bit of a walk away because they're in the company building and require the staff to buzz you through. I ordered a cold brew. It was nothing out of this world, but I was able to get some work done along with getting caffeinated. You don't find too many SF coffee shops offering wifi and a bathroom so that was very much appreciated.

1. Yes they have bathrooms!!! (It's at the lobby in the building next door, and it's clean and secured) - just had to clarify b/c I saw some reviews noting that they don't.2. Entrance is not on the street side. It's further into the center of the block - follow red sign on Howard Pros:- friendly workers!- comfy and spacious work space - outlets in booths :)- not too loud or quiet- clean and secured bathroom - outdoor seating available- they serve alcohol :)Con:- the lighting was a bit dim - went on a cloudy day- not a big food selection , or one that I saw atleast- drip coffee wasn't the greatest...I'm a big coffee drinker and no coffee snob, but I found the cup to taste a bit sour. Perhaps a bad batch? Overall good experience! I like the location as I was able to walk to transbay terminal in 5 mins for my commute home. And the booths were a great space to keep me productive on my work :)

My go-to pick-me-upper for the afternoon slump. The first reason I kept on going back was for the matcha latte. Then I fell in love with Third Chai Blind (Chai tea with espresso!). Pretty latte art too.They have a small selection of donuts, and they're not labeled. I pointed to one... and surprise: bacon maple. The donut is so soft- feels like biting into clouds. Maple glaze wasn't sugary. The crispy and smokey bacon cuts through the decadence. Yum...yum.The place can get crowded in the afternoon, mostly for meetings

This was a great coffee spot in San Fran. I was staying down the street and was in town for a convention, just needed a spot to chill out and catch up on work and emails and the like. I squatted here for a few hours one morning, and I found it to be more than easy to chill in.  The food was decent, I think I had a donut or some other sort of pastry - the tea was great, there is wifi and plenty of outlets. Basically, everything you'd want in a coffee shop.

I'm starting to see a trend where coffeeshops don't offer free wifi anymore (ahem blue bottle). That just sucks. Going to a coffee shop isn't the same anymore now that owners are trying to shoo away their customers as fast as possible. Well, I cannot say the same for Red Door. They have spacious booths and a long table in the center with free wifi. The drink selection is a big sub par, but the open space and light definitely makes up for it.

This is by far the best coffee shop in SF, let alone the whole Bay Area.  Great drinks, spacious booths, outdoor seating, lots of outlets, and most importantly GREAT PEOPLE.  Trevor and the rest of the team truly care about customers and go the distance to make sure you are happy.  They are nice, cool, and a ton of fun to hang out with in the store.  I am proud to call Red Door home!

This is the first time I have tried their coffee. It was very good. (Better than the mermaid place which is the crematorium of coffee) I really don't need to say much more since the place was non-stop packed all day. So that alone speaks volumes to me about how good they are. From when I went in til I left and then the few times I walked by they were constantly slammed. I will definitely try them again.
The coffee is great. But the staff is super snoby and leave much to be desired. like dont make fun of your customers taking pictures of the murals across the street from your shop.

Cashless establishment. Keeps out the riff-raff, I suppose. Thousands of San Franciscans are unbanked, especially around mid-Market. There are plenty of banks within 500ft with after-hours deposits permitted. Cashless payments are a tax on cash-paying customers and restrict privacy.Thankfully, the SF Board of Supervisors just passed a ban on cashless businesses, which will take effect in three months.In the meantime, check out Cumaica around the corner for coffee.

One my favorite locationsI have visited a number of Blue Bottle coffee locations, but this one is one of my more favorite. The location is not as scenic as the Ferry Building one for example, but the store itself is nicely setup, the people working there are very friendly and welcoming, and of course the coffee quality is great, as always. Here is a short history of Blue Bottle coffee that I wrote for another location's review:It was in Early 2000 when W. James Freeman, a coffee loving freelance musician, had enough of commercial, I call it corporate, coffee and decided to take matters in his own hands. His goal was to sell freshly roasted coffee beans to snobbish caffeine junkies like me who cared about the aroma and taste of freshly roasted coffee.  He made a vow: "I will only sell coffee less than 48 hours!"Things went very well for Blue Bottle Coffee mostly because people loved their products, so much so that it expanded into San Francisco and then the rest of San Francisco Bay Area. Then in 2010 they opened their first New York location. Then in 2017 the unthinkable happened. They became an almost corporate coffee! Nestle purchased 68% of their shares!
Yummy cold brew. Super convenient to Van Ness Station. Not too bitter has good aftertaste.

Good coffee. My go to is the New Orleans or Mocha. I do wish they would revert to using the blue straws again. The new compostable straws get soggy fairly quickly (the taste of paper in your mouth isnt great) so I always take two now. I get that its environmentally friendly, but there are potato straws for example which dont break apart

Very quick service. I ordered a New Orleans iced latte with almond milk and it was delicious! I like my coffee on the sweeter side so of course I added more sweetener :)Coffee was fresh & did not leave a sour aftertaste! Highly recommend!!
Great People, great coffee. The line moves pretty fast. Seating area outside is nice space to hang out with friends to chat or just to sit around and chill.

Coffee kept good quality at this location. Both Latte and Cappuccino I ordered were very good. The waiting time just a bit over my expectation when I visited. Other than that, coffee and environment were not bad. Will definitely visit again.
I loved Blue Bottle, but they sold out to Nestle. Google baby formula, child slavery, union busting. Can't go back. Vote with your feet.
The atmosphere really sets it apart.  It's rare to really feel comfortable at a coffee shop, but this one does that in spades.

I've really been enjoying Blue Bottle's Americano. I don't really know much about coffee and usually when I end up in a coffee shop I have no idea what to order nor how to order it properly. But I have found I enjoy an Americano and so it's my go to order anywhere I end up, which is to say I've had quite a few. Blue Bottle's is definitely one of the stronger I've tried, and it just tastes of higher quality. I don't know any other terms to describe it better than that :)

I love Blue Bottle, but I'm not a fan of this location compared to the much speedier Hayes Valley one. If you have all the time in the world, you've found the right place here.I've been passing through for the past few months on my way to work, and noticed that the staff is frustratingly inefficient. Usually it's 2 baristas making the actual coffee, 1 cashier who may or may not jump in to help with the coffee, and 1 worker who's just sort of standing there. Anybody I bring here comments on this as well. Even when there isn't a rush, they still work at a snail's pace. Watching this staff genuinely makes me so antsy, I would totally volunteer to jump in and help them pick up the pace. Again - love the product and convenience of the location, so I'll keep going - just really wish there was more sense of urgency here.
Perfect so cute and coffe if substance and high quality cute cafe and greatest coffee

I went here recently when I was visiting San Francisco and I was pleasantly surprised. I had heard good things about Blue Bottle Coffee, but I was afraid it was going to end up just being hype. However, I went recently and got a cold brew and really enjoyed it! Someone else ordered the pour-over and it was really delicious too!I've only been here on a weekend, and on a Saturday afternoon there was mostly no line. The baristas were super friendly and we got our coffee quickly (the cold brew was prepared as we were paying and the pour-over was ready after another minute or two). I can imagine this place could get packed on a weekday during peak hours, but from what I know it was definitely a tasty, quick, and well-worth-it stop on the weekend.

Over all I enjoyed my coffee from this blue bottle location. My only gripe is the guy made my coffee and left it empty about an inch from the top. I am aware that there has to be a certain ratio of water and beans but for $4, 10oz of coffee left me feeling a little unimpressed.But that is the struggle of someone who enjoys good coffee and a good value for my purchase.

I'm coming here more often!! My fiancé used to live on 9th and Market, but I never ventured down this side of the Twitter building. To think I've been missing out on this hidden gem for years. Next to Blue Bottle, there's a cute strip of parklet with artificial turf and lawn furniture.I took my dog here to meet someone. I had her watch my dog while I went to get coffee. All the baristas run an efficient operation because of how busy it gets. Fortunately I ordered when it was less busy. Closer to lunchtime, it got crazy packed.Because it was a warm day, I settled for a nice cup of cold brew. I put in some half & half. Delicious. Blue Bottle never disappoints. Baristas are always friendly and professional. Coffee is always tasty. They always setup shop in the most convenient locations, next to big businesses.If you've never been to Blue Bottle, check it out and spend some time reading or catching up with a friend in the parklet. Even though the coffeeshop is a tiny, quaint spot without seating, most people would probably grab their drinks to go anyways and go back to the office.
Best coffee around. I live in Texas, work for an airline, and no trip to the bay is complete without a Blue Bottle stop, soo good.

The staff is really nice and the coffee is super fast! Definitely pricey (maybe that's just SF - I'm new) but I've been happy with everything I've ordered. If you want something a little sweet I recommend the New Orleans iced!

Okay Blue Bottle Coffee. I see what you're trying to pull with the cute cafe aesthetic and the fancy ingredients. But don't be fooled, this place is overrated. I got the cafe mocha and rhubarb pound cake. The mocha was actually pretty good, not too sweet like most places (*cough* Starbucks *cough*) but the pound cake was so so at best. Moist but I'm not entirely sure rhubarb can hold its own in there. I don't mean to be overly critical, I just don't want to get your hopes up.
The lady on the cashier was very unfriendly and it was something wrong with a coffee as I had stomach pains after it
Good coffee and pastries but the service from one of the ladies working on Sunday, May 12, 2019 at around noon was terrible. Terrible attitude. Complained to the owner and he was very nice!

Stopped for gelato during afternoon break and the woman helping me was very friendly and kind! She offered sample of lemon cookie gelato and gave cute cup to put both vanilla and lemon cookie gelato I ordered! The gelato especially the lemon cookie was excellent! Recommend stopping at the cafe for sweet dessert and service!

This is a nice cafe I have always walked by on Haight Street. I may have visited once, but I only remember trying it for real today. I had trouble deciding what I wanted. I kept asking for things, but the total was too much at like $12 and then like $9...so I settled an espresso and bagel with cream cheese. The bagel was jalapeno and toasted. It took a while. I liked the espresso and it came in a cardboard cup. Um, so I am like all about how people present the espresso shot haha. Well, it was a nice breakfast snack on Haight Street. I took my public transportation back and forth. I walked around Haight Street early morning and every shop was closed besides this cafe pretty much. The cafe is homey and has enough variety, but some items do add up and get expensive..I had to change my mind and tell her I was not used to it. It's worth a shot.

I tried their Jimmy Hendrix drink, a White Mocha with Lavender. It was so good! I loved the sweet, soothing flavor. My friend got a coffee with espresso and liked it. I thought the interior decorating was great. The customer service was nice, and the girls working there were nice and attentive. They even gave me a little taste of their gelato. I asked for a sample of avocado but she gave me chocolate instead. I didn't have the heart to tell her I had actually wanted avocado, but luckily it tasted really good anyway. Very nice little place.

This is the cutest little mom & pop coffee shop on Haight & Ashbury!! The owners Tamar and Vasken are such kind people and they know all their regular costumers by name. Their house coffee is the best! As a student who drinks a lot of coffee I can't even compare the campus coffee to the coffee at Cantata. If you're in the mood for something more sweet they have local gelato from Marin, in all delicious flavors like honey lavender, avocado, cheesecake, lemon cooke and much more. Definitely a place to visit if your find yourself on Haigh & Ashbury!

My favorite coffee shop in the Haight!  Good, strong coffee and super friendly owner and baristas.  I always feel so welcome when I walk in.  The decor is funky & interesting and there are outside tables.  They don't have a lot of food selections but that have awesome gelato!

Coffee beans were decent. Expensive for no reason..oh wait its on Haight. The customer service was ok just cute girls behind the counter playing pretend Barista. I ordered a caramel latte and they were confused and unsure about the drinks. Wont be back.

So I'm visiting from LA, staying in an AirBnB in the area while the husband is working and decided I want boba! Huge boba signs surround this place, so I quickly looked up yelp. Okay, there's 4 stars, good pictures of drinks, looks good enough, let's give this a try. Nope, nope, nope. I ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba. Granted, I can REALLY taste the tea, due to the bitterness of it, the milk, and to my disappointment, hard boba. A few were okay and chewy, but the rest were not. Needless to say, I threw away most of the boba and forced myself to finish the milk tea since I spent almost $5 on it. Hopefully their coffee is better, but I'm not tempted to even try.

Very nice cafe- well decorated for Christmas.  Even the Hallmark  Channel could not have done a better job!   The coffee is excellent and the service is great.  In particular, Elana was very nice, conversant, and interesting.  I have switched shops!!
Nice place had Boba- half taro half coconut with almond milk instead or regular milk. Spent $6.50. The girl was very nice- good customer service and tastey little drink. Good pit stop!

Love this place, can't complain about anything. It's a little small but if your lucky enough to be in there, you're special! The employees are nice, care about there shop. Delish everything. Love their teas with boba, cookies, gelato is good. Today I ordered lychee tea w/ lychee boba my bestie had lavender tea which was AMAZING! I just love sitting and people watching with a great drink in hand..It's a must every time I'm in Haight.

Sorry, but as a person with their fair share of boba milk tea in their life, this was the worst I have ever had. Most of the boba was hard, while a few were nice and chewy as it should be in my opinion. What I'm thinking is there was a really bad or old batch in there. Although this is not their fault, I forgot to mention to cut down on the sugar, so mine was a lot sweeter than I'd like. However, the sweetness had this candiness to it that I didn't like.I do want to say the drink came very quickly though and service was good.

The girls who work here are super nice and it's a convenient place to get coffee, but the boba is way too sugary and the breakfast burritos are literally the same ones I get from Costco that they microwave and then charge $6 for. The outside patio is cute and seems like it would be a fun place to people watch.

Just sort of an old school cafe with decent coffee and these pre-made breakfast burritos that are good enough, though nothing to write home about. Seems like people like gelato but I'm lactose intolerant so I wouldn't know.
Why is the breakfast burrito not fresh and made in house? It's one of those boring microwave situations. Skip it. Coffee is pretty on point though not of the quality I expect. Shrug.
We got coffees and water for 6 people there and they wouldn't let me use the restroom because I only had water. They wanted $4.95 extra just for me to use the bathroom.

Delightful coffee shop in the middle of the weirdness that is Haight Street. The staff were all pleasant, and my caramel latte was perfect. I also loved the seating outside. I definitely recommend this place!
Nice people, cute store, good location- but coffee just tasted like bland warm milk  plus it's very overpriced

So let me start off by saying I've been here twice.  The 1st time was cool. However that was not the case when my friend and I stopped by to grab a couple of drinks.  I ordered a Mexican Hot chocolate (made vegan) . After it had been made I tried a couple sips and it was extremely bitter. My friend had ordered an iced soy latte, which was terrible (according to her, I don't drink coffee so I didn't try it). Bc we were both dissatisfied with our drinks, I went back and asked if they could remake the drinks.  When I shared how bitter the Mexican Hot chocolate was one of their responses was,  "that's how it's supposed to taste. "WTF,  I'm Mexican! I've had hundreds of Mexican hot chocolates,  they are NOT supposed to taste bitter. So after they refused to remake our drinks, I asked for a refund, which they denied.  Then I asked for a manager. The same chick that said the drink was supposed to be bitter replied, "I am the manager and we don't refund nor remake drinks. "  Like you don't make mistakes? Gtfo. Fuckkkkkkkkkkk both of them (especially the one wearing the USF sweater). Additionally, as I was walking out another customer had mentioned that they made the wrong drink.  The barista made a new drink bc she fucked up! What happened to "we don't remake drinks?" Both chicks were regarded by many (including ourselves) as pretentious, get over yourselves.  You make coffee.  Make it right, it would help if you weren't so busy gossiping.

Nice little coffee shop in Mill Valley. Found this place by accident. Love their Matcha and housemaid chai latte. The  pastries were ok. The staff were friendly. The wait was not long at all got my food and coffee and tea pretty fast. Don't like the parking lot but other than that  everything was good. There are also small shops around that are pretty unique. It's a must try. Will be back for sure next time I visit Mill Valley

Small but solid coffee shop in a cool corner of Mill Valley and a cool spot next to some neat stores. Equator coffee has some quality coffee that could rival all the top brands. My cappuccino was solid. Small baked goods section but good none the less. I love stopping in when I am in the area. Popular with bikers coming through the area. And always fun grab some caffeine and browse the shops. Need a fix and in town? This is the place to stop to stay and drink a coffee or take away.

This is it. This is the best mocha I have ever had.Having previously gone to the Equator in the Tenderloin part of SF I had already thought that Equator made the best mocha, but I needed to try it once more to reassure the thought. I didn't get lucky the first time, Equator really knows what they're doing. Their mocha is not sweet like other places, there is a wonderful smokey flavor that I believe must come from the roasting of the coffee beans. The smokiness is paired nicely with the chocolate flavor and wow it is so good. I try mochas in other places, and actually typically get white mochas, but this one is exceptional. The atmosphere of this location is amazing as well. A coffee and surf shop? Sign me up. Equator Coffee you are very dear to me and thank you for such an amazing experience. I will keep coming back when I'm in the Bay.

Best coffee game in the area. Great spot to stop before heading into the city. Special dietary needs for your coffee? These guys generally have most everyone covered. Small and intimate. Great place to sit and chat with someone you haven't caught up with in a while. Enjoy this small piece of serenity before crashing head first into the bustle of the city
Consistently good coffee and pastries. I wish they did have more food items for my breakfast runs in the morning.
I stopped here to pick up some beans for home. The coffee is great. This place was packed on a Saturday morning. The wait was about 10 minutes, but the service was good.

Bomb. As always! I love their little hole in the wall and the patio seating. My mom and I grabbed a coffee after hiking all morning in Muir Woods; it was the perfect way to end the morning. They have limited staff so it takes a little while for them to make the drinks, but they line to order goes quickly. It's worth it anyways!

I am a huge fan of Equator coffee but very disappointed this visit. My drink was not extra extra hot like I ordered it and my daughters mocha had very little foam on it. It was watery. Yuck!!  Still love the atmosphere of this cute little place.
Love this coffee shop! It's cute, cozy and the service is always awesome!  No matter whose working the cappuccino always come with a heart and the perfect amount of foam.
Having most of their inventory made in-house, this coffee shoppe curates their flavors to a "tea" and it's delicious. Love it, great with great company.
Place is really good good location nice vibe the only negative I can say is a little weird getting in line to get your coffee but outside of that no complaints.

11/11/18 Update - More of the same if not worse. Line wasn't even that long and tons of team members behind the counter but mass confusion between them and arguing with each other.  You would think with 5 or 6 people behind the counter that it would move quickly and efficiently.  Not so much - moving as slow as ever.  The person taking our order didn't even really know the menu.  Not sure what's up with this Proof Lab Equator location.  ___________________Previous - Currently standing in line out the door at the Proof Lab location.  We are regulars at the Larkspur location and it's better in every way.  It starts with the employees at Larkspur - Dustin and Jeff.  They actually care where as you're treated in this location as if they're doing us a favor by providing coffee.  They always run out of the tacos at this location where we've suggested that they double their order like Larkspur and it was completely dismissed.  The response was that we should get there before 10am and we asked don't you want a higher ticket and margin from us - seems like good business and common sense.  They always run out of Oatly here and we've asked how about proactively forecasting your need here and increase / order ahead like Jeff and Dustin do at Larkspur.  Guess the reaction - basically dismissed.  Lastly, the work area behind the counter is pretty disgusting- this location isn't clean and team again just doesn't seem to care much.  We're only here because my wife is addicted to Equator and our kids go to Mathesium so in a way have no choice.  The alternative is SBUX across the street but it's basically the same thing.  Yes, this is intended as an insult to basically call this Equator location a SBUX so if management is reading this then hopefully point taken.  Thank

We've been here twice now - once because I saw a surf shop, and then bam!  Coffee! This is situated along the road next to the surf shop w/ such cute surf decor that rightfully fits the posh area they are located in.  It has plenty of seating outside in the front or outside in the back and a lot of parking spots available.  Most importantly, their coffee is on point.  There is usually a huge line, but when we got there, it was just us.  Once we were done the ordering, the line grew 20 ppl long!  The Barista was joking about the long nonexistant line... I get it now...I ordered an espresso that is serve w/ some sparkling (a must) and a few glazed donut holes.  It hit the spot.  They have plenty of pastries and lunch offerings, such as croissants, donuts, boiled eggs, sandwiches, variety of coffee, including matcha latte and Pacific Soy milk.  This totally doesn't seem like it's a small boutique chain, but it is and they do it well.  Will most certainly be back.p.s. the "employee only" bathroom (as shown in a photo on Yelp) was offered for me to use as a customer.  :)

It's very Southern Marin Hip, backed up against Proof Lab Surf Shop and sharing a parking lot with a Surf Camp right off the freeway on shoreline highway on the way to the beach. The kids that work there are friendly and laid back. They make a great iced vanilla late. Probably been here now half a dozen times. Lots of entrepreneur looking 40 year olds in Patagonia, with 3 Land Rovers in the tiny gravel parking lot, but that's Marin. I have this on my radar when I'm in the neighborhood as a must drop by. You should too!

This is a small intimate coffee shop with great quality latte. I normally get my latte at Joe & Juice in SF financial district at my office. I always thought their latte was pretty good, but until I got one here! The latte here has more bold and depth in flavor. Good stuff! Plus the pumpkin bread was unexpectedly moist. I was expecting it to be like Starbucks quality but oh no! Their pastry is just as good as their coffee. The only thing is they have free Wi-Fi so you can bring your laptop and work, but there is no power plug...
