I only eat gluten free, and the bread they use is tiny and tasteless (even with the avocado and seasonings on top).I thought the coffee would cheer me up but the coffee looks nothing like the photos nor does it have any robust flavor.I truly do not recommend this place even though it has a high Yelp rating.
Best cappuccino I've ever had. Great customer service. My new favorite coffee place.
Omg I dream about their avocado toast. The matcha latte was also great. Amazing cafe, highly recommend!
If a word could sum up the flavor of their cappuccino, I would say basic. Small cup of $3.50 basic. But seems like a peaceful place to study or chat, but not for me.

I'm sure the coffees, teas, and etc are amazing. But I ONLY come here for one thing, the amazing special bread they sell only here. Literally buy a few pieces to freeze love it so dang much. But I can't disclose which hahahahaha or you mofos might empty out the shelf before me next time.

I knew about this coffee shop in the summer of 2003 when I did an internship and the art dealer needed a sponsor. Martha Bros. was a local sponsor and so I heard about Martha Bros. They put a Martha Bros. in the Sunset near 9th and Irving. I have visited sometimes to sit in the cafe, but I decided to get something to try today. It turns out they have a decent assortment of bagels and so I picked the $5 bagel with tomato, cream cheese, and egg...no butter on bagel. Then I tried the iced espresso. Not all cafes offer an iced espresso note. This one was served in a cardboard cup..um that's not fancy, but I'll take it. The cashier was attentive enough, and it was early in the morning. The bagel was good and I ate it. I don't need to get myself a bag of gourmet bagels to eat everyday in one week, so I can do this once every other week. The espresso was decent and I had some milk with it. Martha Bros. is a decent cafe in SF. This spot is nice to spend time in. It's near UCSF. Then I hopped on the Muni to get to  Haight Street and walked around. Then I got home eventually. Everyday has its way of being forgotten...

My fiancé and I love going to Martha's for a quick cup of coffee or to sit and get some work done. This is a popular spot near UCSF's campus that's great for snacks and coffee. When we were last in, they had 4 different types of coffee cake. How could you ask for more!? There are also breakfast burritos and other fantastic treats! We love the atmosphere and it's very close to a muni stop! The staff is very friendly, and always so accommodating! We will continue to frequent Martha & Brothers!

This place has a lot of potential: good selection of food and coffee, good location, nice windows , etcI where it needs improvement : playing music with commercials, awkward seatingToo many table crammed along the sides , awkward cabinetry that should be removed The door positioning makes the seating next to it uncomfortably squishy. I would consider replacing those tables with a laptop barThe space in the middle of the room is not used well; perhaps a community table would be better there

The workers at this place are rude and unapologetic to their customers. They do not inform you about the ingredients in their pastries, which could easily cause an allergic reaction. That's not even the main issue: when you suggest they give warning as to what the food contains, they turn it against you as if it's YOUR fault for not knowing what THEY used in THEIR products. That's not the right way to treat your customers, who would have been happy to keep coming back here had it not been for the awful service and inability to be receptive towards feedback. I would advise against coming to this place.

This place deserves ZERO stars. My bf's 2 year old son accidentally ate their protein power bar which contained peanuts- there were absolutely no signs. He ended up with anaphylaxis and stayed in the ER. Luckily he is okay but when we called them to warn them what happened and to put up signs they were unapologetic, rude, and even said "Oh we tell everyone there is peanut butter" Clearly they did not!! SHAME ON YOU Marthas. We are going to seek legal action due to their negligence, danger to community and lack of accountability to consumers.

I stopped by on Sunday November 11th. Got a coffee and the protein bar in the picture below. Nowhere in the sign in front of the bar did it mention it had peanut butter in it. My son is very allergic to peanuts. Long story short, I spent all day Sunday in the ER while my 2 year old son was going into anaphylactic shock. So on to the one star. My issue with them is not only that they didn't have a sign up stating it contained peanuts. But the very unapologetic way the staff handled the situation after. I spoke with them and they more or less said "sorry but it has peanuts and we tell everyone it has peanuts". Uhhh Yes that's great but what happens the one time someone doesn't mention it? Why not have a sign for such a common food allergy? I wouldn't come here. And this isn't the last they'll hear from me.
Love this little spot - they have a nice little stretch of sidewalk seating as well as a comfy indoor nook for working, chatting, meet ups. Good friendly service and an overall neighborhood vibe.

Man... This is by far the best cafe to work from near 7th since there's a ton of outlets and great natural light. I've been here twice now and around 10AM each time one of the workers starts her shift and starts to randomly SHRIEK. I have an aversion to loud piercing noises and it actually forced me to leave and take my lunch money elsewhere. Check the other reviews - I'm not just being sensitive.Today's noises included:- Random shrieking every 2 minutes or so. I'm talking moving from normal indoor voices to a loud piercing shriek.- Loud imitations of a dog barking- An intimate piercing conversation regarding a "FREAKING PLAYBOY" while some quiet girl waited 2 minutes to order an iced coffee.- A colleague continuously "shhhhhhh"ing her counterpart but then laughing while she screamed (laughed?).- A real quote from her today: "he doesn't love me, he loves everyone walking on the sidewalk with boobs and a butt. He's a FREAK"I probably won't ever be able to come back to this cafe after this review. I think I'll cut my losses. You've been warned.

Martha & Brothers is conveniently located off 5th and Irving, just blocks away from the UCSF Parnassus campus. In fact, we were so close to campus that we were connected to the WiFi! Anyways, Martha's is a nice place to study if you wanna step out of the library and into a cafe. The music isn't too loud and they fit as many tables as they can (though they're rather small tables, at that). I ordered a medium iced latte ($3.75), which in my opinion wasn't that special. But I'm open to trying new things as well in the future! What other reviewers have said about the workers being loud can be true, but with headphones in it really wasn't a big bother. Also they close at 5 which I thought was odd- I wish they'd extend this.

Small corner coffee shop in an older beautiful building. I got the hot chocolate. Note that when you ask for small,  they mean small. It is more European measure than American. The cookies were great too,

If you have anxiety or PTSD I would not come here. The workers scream laugh or shriek without warning. Extremely loud and very panicked sounding. It can and will easily trigger you if you are a trauma survivor or trying to focus on your computer. Coffee is good, food is okay. It's a coffee shop.

Stopped by this place for coffee and do a little work on my laptop today. The two ladies working there were carrying on like they were at a backyard BBQ. They weren't just loud. The big girl was screaming off the top of her lungs. Once in a while she would catch a customer staring at her and she would say "sorry". But then she would just go on laughing and screaming. No exaggeration. Screaming. This went on for about 45 minutes until I decide to go work in the peace of my own home.
Love this local spot! Not pretentious and over priced like most coffee spots these days, just good coffee and food!
Extremely rude staff.  Very small selection.  Frequently smokers stand outside by the open window.  One of the worst coffee shops in SF.

Quaint cafe in Inner Sunset! Mostly filled with friendly UCSF students- as this spot has good wifi, outlets, and ample tables for laptops. The iced mocha was splendid!My only complaint here is that the toilet was ..unstable? You know that feeling when you're on a chair but one of the legs is shorter so you're left kind of teetering?

FYI: On Dec 11, all drinks are $1 off. The perfect place to grab a coffee and study or just get some reading in. Space is limited but there are as many tables and chairs as could possibly fit in. Music is played at a low volume so it's not too distracting.I ordered the iced chai latte and got an iced latte. I was pleasantly surprised because even though it wasn't what I wanted, it was very good and very strong. Definitely kept me alert which was what I wanted.

The best coffee in SF. I was visiting my childhood neighborhood and found my favorite coffee  just blocks from my old home. So delighted. Great friendly service in a family owned and operated company.  Great prices. Great location. Erica behind the counter was a charming lady who knew her coffee.
Gruff service and a slightly sour chair latte. The space is clean and bright with some indoor and outdoor tables.

I hate to leave negative reviews for small local businesses, but I went in to get a sandwich and it was pretty awful. Just a bunch of stuff thrown on a roll and melted together. It's pretty rare that I don't find a sandwich redeeming, but honestly I couldn't say anything good about it.  The house and cheese croissant I had was acceptable, but nothing to write home about.
The pizza is awesome, and the service and staff was great! For a cute little place, we got a lot! Great for the kids and a friendly place.
This place has the BEST pizza in all of California! It is a hidden gem and I am glad to have had the chance to eat here while visiting.

Friday night is pizza night and it is seriously the best pizza I've ever had. My husband and two kids agreed. Everything is homemade and fresh. The crust was crispy and flavorful (since when does crust actually taste good?)! The sauce was perfection. I am gushing. It's a neighborhood gem where everyone knows each other and new friends are greeted with zeal. We absolutely loved meeting Xan! So glad our friends brought us here. This will definitely be a go-to for us anytime we come to San Fran!

Great little place for a delicious sandwich. Bread is amazing and fresh!  (Took a loaf home!)Service is super friendly , too!  Found good parking on Lane street behind the building and could go in the back door!  My daughter just moved to the neighborhood and sent me there to pick up our lunch!  I will stop by next time I am up from San Diego!

A fantastic cozy and friendly neighborhood spot worthy of a visit no matter where you live in San Francisco. Hungry after a short morning run, this artisan bakery caught my eye. And nose! I was welcomed by the smell of freshly baked bread and Xan, the baker and owner. The cinnamon roll was gooey and warm and the frittata, just perfect. I washed it all down with a delicious cup of coffee and a mocha. She uses the finest ingredients and is a master of her craft. Thanks Xan for sharing your delicious food!  Also, grab a loaf of bread to go to. Many choices, including the challah which I look forward to sharing with my family tonight. And finally I can't wait to come back and try the pizza!

I had a break in between work and was looking for a coffee shop to get some work done and get a quick snack. There were no coffee shops in the area coming up on Yelp (there was a Peet's but it was in a supermarket so that doesn't count), so it was great to see this one come up! It's on a main street but it's a wider, quieter street than other parts of San Francisco so it was easy to get you. There was free parking around the coffee shop which made the positive experience (so much of a San Francisco is finding parking, so finding a spot within 10 seconds was exciting). It was in the afternoon, super mellow and we were served quickly. I ordered the house iced cold lemonade- it was so refreshing and delicious! The only thing is it's pretty small for the cost and a lot of the glass cup is filled with ice. There were homemade croissants being made for the next morning which looked delicious, and I loved how they were making it where we can watch. Overall, great coffee shop and I'd love to come back and try their food items (pizzas, salads, sandwiches) and hopefully can have a larger lemonade with less ice!
Hand made pastries and breakfast croissants. I go here whenever im having a rough morning and it never fails to make it better :) also the mushroom latte is dank.

This is one of my favorite neighborhood stops. I have tried several sandwiches and each one has been delicious. My current favorite is the portabella sandwich. It is Open faced and features pecorino perfecto cheese and grilled onions. It is closely followed by the house-made pizza in my affections. The house made bread is delicious. To wash things down, you cant go wrong with coffee or maybe an Italian beverage. I usually go for a San Pellegrino, and usually the limonata, But I recently tried the Lemoncocco. To quote their website "This is an awesome drink!" It's lemon juice with coconut creme. It' not carbonated and positively delicious cold. It's not sweet and quite refreshing. It will probably be my go to when I stop in. I am partial to sweets. If your, try a cookie or pastry. they are delicious and make a rainy day or lonely cup of coffee better. The owner, Xan, is a frequent presence, which is nice to see. Highly recommended.

I absolutely love my local bakery! Not only does Xan bake up delicious loaves and pastries every day, she has a delicious selection of pizzas plus breakfast and lunch items, including my favorites: the lox bagel with pickled red onions and capers, and the melted mushroom sandwich. All this, plus espresso drinks and cold drinks, great art on the walls, and a sweet and friendly proprietor.

Fox and Lion Bread is a hidden gem. A small local bakery cafe local in Bayview/Hunters Point. I was here on a random weekday to get some work done. The cafe is quiet and provides free WiFi. They have a good amount of seating available for getting work done or catching with a few friends. They have a variety of sandwiches available. I tried their avocado toast. It is served with a whole avocado with some salt, pepper, and olive. This toast was simple, fresh and delicious. I had a toast and coffee for about $6. You can not beat this price! Fox and Lion Bread serves affordable and fresh food.

The sandwich menu here is unconstitutionally delicious!! Everything sounds amazing. I ordered the tuna melt and the egg salad on avocado toast, mushroom mocha - all absolutely delightful!*pro-tip: they have day old baked goods for $1! And they still taste fresh and amazing!
This is a nice little whole in the wall. The staff was friendly and the open face tuna was very tasty. I will definitely visit again.
This spot has great espresso for those looking for something better than Starbucks garbage. Foods good too. Excellent place to hangout. The staff is very friendly

This place is delicious! I've gotten the Nicks Sandwich, sub mushrooms for turkey. Out of this world amazing! The service is nice & friendly. The vibe of this place is great. Can't wait to come back for pizza and brews one Friday night.

Got a pizza, avocado toast, large sandwich and a soda for $20.I mean, seriously? Is it 1995 again?My new favorite spot in the neighborhood for sure. Incredibly good bread and cold cuts. Friendly service. Can't wait to come back.
I recently began renting an office in the neighborhood and I'm so happy I found this spot! Their baked goods and sandwiches are delicious. I personally love their veggie sandwich.
Wonderful sandwiches, soups and pastries! Their pizza is my favorite in San Francisco. Definitely stop by on a Friday to check it out.

I think they have really good & tasty sandwiches. But the reason I'm giving them 3 stars is because I think the bread on the sandwiches are super hard!! I wish they can find a way to make the bread softer...pleeease?!
This is my go to bayview sandwich spot.  Always good for a delicious lunch.  Plus Xan is super cool, like hella cool

No internet, no outlets, no restroom. I don't mean to slam this place because they were very friendly but, as a fellow barista, and just as a normal person who expects at one of these seemingly normal attributes from a coffee shop, pretty bummed after discovering none after I ordered my bev. In their defense, I'll take responsibility and say I should have checked before ordering.

The latte was great and there was soooo much to look at inside the store! I wanted to buy ALL the merchandise/pins/art stuff (thankfully I didnt). I recommend getting a croissant from Tartine bakery, a latte from here, and then walking a block or so to chill and eat your food at Dolores park!
Cute little place and great coffee. I love the Joe Cool iced coffee :)

Asked the barista to make my cappuccino extra hot and he said, "it will come out one temperature." Attitude much? Turns out that temperature was lukewarm! Aw. Hell. No. So unfortunately I was forced to talk to this dude again. He made it again with an attitude but at least it was hot!Updating my review and rating due to the owners response. Now it all makes sense! Dude had that "this is my last shift so fuck you" attitude towards other customers so I guess me asking for my cappuccino to be extra hot was just the last fair trade coffee bean to break this salty barista's back! I may checkout Faye's again when I'm in SF because I must admit once hot my cappuccino was delicious!

I LOVE FAYE'S! Absolutely one of the best coffee places in SF. I look forward to every weekend to make it out here and treat myself to an iced latte or iced coffee. Their iced coffee is PERFECT --- not burnt, acidity or bitterness lingering (and their prices are SO affordable). Their lattes are yummy, and never disappoint~ They also sell cute trinkets, cards, and rent videos! Very enjoyable experience.

Cool combo of a coffee shop and a video game rental store. The barista was friendly and got my espresso shot out so quick it was like he whipped it out as soon as I placed the order. Espresso was fresh and delicious - not bitter at all. They had a line building up when I came by and since it's not your typical coffee house, I think this indicates the quality and service you can expect to receive here.

$1 coffee for a teeny tiny cup that's perfect for my consumption levels rocks my imaginary socks. Have not seen this elsewhere in SF and I really like coffee shops. And there's a sunny window (weather dependent of course) in which to perch on a stool and be glanced at by the passersby on their way to Dolores Park. Well at least it makes me feel like a local when I do this. ALSO: Cute gifts and design items. There's a video shop in back too! But in two visits I haven't even gotten to perusing it with all the entertainment in the front of the shop.

Pretty solid for $3.00 huge size coffee.I like their selection of films as well with lots of Criterion Collections and important European Art films.Films by Federico Fellini, Wim Wenders, Chantal Akerman, Akira Kurozawa, Peter Weir, etc ..The place itself is cute and not pretentious although that I would completely understand if hipsters likes to come here too.I'm not a hipster and I like this coffee shop.

Great little coffeeshop with a ton of character. I've spent many a happy time browsing through the art, cards, and knicknacks, as much as through their excellent DVD collection. They have an old-style card catalog cabinet where regulars keep their handy coffee cards. Oh, and the coffee is great, and the delicate and delicious pastries are a huge improvement over most coffee shops! :)

I love this place! Shops like Faye's are what make cities great, and I was lucky enough to live a block away one summer. The $1 coffee is the last great deal in San Francisco. The DVD selection is great and a good value. On top of it all, one of the last places where you can buy a hard copy of the newspaper. And oh, their honor system loyalty punch cards are super fun.

Fayes Video (and coffee and other stuff) is a great little store! One large section of the wall is devoted to little print media items like greeting cards, notebooks, calendars, and pins. All are made in limited batches by what appears to be solo artists, and many were handmade. The only drawback here was that there didn't seem to be much SF artist representation, the prices were a little more extreme than other places like stores in Japantown or Serendipity, and the selection wasn't enormous. Fayes also seems to be known for its video section. To round it out, there was also a barista on duty running a mini coffee shop. While we didn't get anything other than a cup of water, the attendant was super friendly and was chatting up other customers about their drinks and the movies available in the back of the store. I might come back to check out the movies or to grab a cup of coffee, but I think next time I might look for places with larger selections like Serendipity or the card store on the first floor of Japantown's westernmost shopping center building.

My airbnb host put it best: video shop turned dvd shop turned coffee shop. Unique and cute neighborhood place. Everyone that came in seems to know each other.Got an iced coffee and it was pretty standard. Glad this place is walking distance from my airbnb and is a nice relaxed place if you don't want to wait in line at Tartine.
It's a cute little shop! There are a lot of options trinket wise put up. The barista made me a dirty chai that was more like muddy water. He 100% did not care about the job he was doing.

My dog, Moe, and I have been going to Fayes for 15 years. It's the best way to start the day -- great coffee for me, excellent dog treats for Moe, friends and neighbors, and art! I love Fayes more than cheese. (That's big praise.)And the chalkboard. Read the chalkboard when you visit.

I had a great experience here. Forgot to ask his name who worked last Wednesday evening but thank you!! I was freaking out trying to get a Lyft to catch a flight from SFO but somehow it was not working at all and my phone battery was so low. I came in to this place and ordered a cup of coffee telling him my situation. They did not have Wifi however he let me charge my phone and also told me to try connecting my phone at the end of the block as he knew the reception on this street was somehow bad. He was so nice and helpful and I successfully got a Lyft to arrive at the airport on time! Phew. Their coffee was very good. I wish I could've stayed there longer! Thank you
Our barista was nice, the coffee came up quickly, and my cappuccino was delicious. Also this place is a video rental store which is hard to come by these days, so check it out.

Why is the barista so angry at the world.  Was very curt , when we asked what their specialty drink was,  she angrily answered "coffee!".  She wouldn't even let us throw our disposable coffee cups in the store and made us walk to the trash can "by the bus stop". Why is short haired lady so so mean?

Wow! Great find in the Mission/Castro area! I originally walked to Tartine Bakery but as usual, the line was too long for me to wait for a pastry. Worth the wait if you REALLY want good pastries though! When I walked back on 18th street/west towards Dolores Park, I noticed Fayes Coffee and Faye's Video store about 50 feet away from Tartines. I have walked by this place many times before but wanted a 'bite' to eat this late morning.I quickly "Yelped" Fay's Coffee Shop and noticed very high ratings so went to check it out. Faye's Coffee shop has a nice old-nostalgic SF 'feel' inside and was quiet when I went (10:50am on a Monday). The Barista was very nice and helpful. I tried the cold-brew coffee $3.25 1 size only/16 once aka large. It was smooth and unlike other Cafes, he completely filled the cup even though I requested "lite ice". They had a decent selection of pastries i.e. your typical croissant, scones, etc. but had mini-fruit pies and savory ones i.e. quiche & chicken pie and I opted to try the Chicken Pie. He said it was from a local SF shop from the Inner Sunset area (Peasant Pies??) It was very good! As you can see from my picture, it was fresh, crust was buttery flaky and full of meat inside! It was light on the vegis' but was included. There was the right amount of onions and the pie wasn't wet/oozing with liquid when I ate it (prefer in min-pies) but was not dry whatsoever!They DO HAVE Stevia sugar and all other condiments for your coffee/tea including Almond, soy milk and usual non/low/regular Milk.I highly recommend Faye's Coffee Shop and look forward to coming back soon!
Passed by Mission district in the early morning stop here for a coffee. :) very interesting little coffee, videos shop! Chilling relaxing enjoying my morning coffee there great experience!

A dying industry but this place keeps fighting the good fight.  The best thing about this store is the selection.  I found movies not available on line such as Deliverance and Deer Hunter to name a few.   Rentals are a buck w a 3 night rental.
Very nice coffee place. Friendly stuffs, nice atmosphere, nice decors. VERY GOOD Coffee! Strong bold coffee, I also like they use eco friendly cups and utensils. Will come again if I am in the area!
This is cute coffee shop located on Market street! Their matcha latte was amazing. The flavor was perfect. Not to sweet and not to bitter. And the heart on the top is a huge plus!

This is my favorite spot for coffee and ambience. I love the Barista team is outstanding!!! Meg, Grady, Christina, the morning shift is my extended family. No matter what I want to drink coffee or tea wise it's here. I find myself here at a minimum twice a day. Love you guys and the coffee.

I love this place so much. I got a small oat milk latte and it was perfect. Even had the cute lil heart. Stevia in the raw would be a better addition that truvia but glad they had it as an option. Quick service and overall good ambiance. Of course it's busy

I love stopping here before I go to work. The Vanilla Latte gives me the right boost before work. Plus it's tasty. The decor is nice if you like the hipster vibe. And all around a nice little place to stop in if you are looking for a nice caffeine boost. I promise that you will not be disappointed.

I had been to a lot of small business coffee shops during my visit to SF and this was compared to a lot of the others.  I am not a coffee snob at all, but I also do not like the extremely fancy/sugary drinks out there.  That said, I wanted something in the middle for my morning pick me up.  Same as my experiences in other shops, this one stacked up about the same as they want patrons to enjoy the coffee in it's purest form with little to no added flavors.  I know a lot of people enjoy that style, but the vanilla latte was just ok for me.  It was better than the other lattes I had endured elsewhere so that's a bonus.  This place was also extremely close to where we were staying so I guess that was another benefit.
Fantastic capuchino and espresso! Great service as well with a cool atmosphere. Love that they have urban remedy drinks too.

Nice little coffee shop in the middle of Market St. I ordered a drip coffee ($3) and was happy to see that they have the honey out, as I like to use it for sweetener. I would have liked another non-dairy creamer option out aside for Soy, but that's alright. The person I was meeting with suggested the spot. The seating is scarce inside, but they do have a few bar seats along the cash register/pick up area and some more facing Market St., front row for people watching. There were plenty of seats outside as well, but due to using my laptop I stayed inside to charge. Cute decor, nice vibe, and very friendly service.

Stopped by to get a Shakerato. Small 8 oz cup of 2 shots espresso (I asked for 1, because I want to sleep tonight), cream, and some brown sugar. I got the Scratch Caramel, asked for light sweetener. Didn't really taste any caramel, but tastes strong, rich, aromatic, and creamy. A great midday pick me up. However, it's HELLA EXPENSIVE. $3.75 for a couple sips of espresso......

Randomly walked in to get something to drink and discovered Equator Coffees and Teas.  It is a nice coffee shop to sit and watch the people go by on Market.  They offer indoor and outdoor seating which gives you options while you sip your coffee and people watch.  There is also free wifi if you want to have a place to get a little work done.Since it was a beautiful and "warm" day for San Francisco, we skipped the coffee and decided to get some iced teas. We ordered the iced black tea and the iced rooibos chai latte. The black tea was refreshing and the chai latte was creamy and full of spices.  The service was friendly and helpful when it came to deciding what to order.  Next time I will have to try the coffee.

Boo! I have afew friends who have worked here so I keep trying it...its never any better. If you are a coffee snob dont go here. If gas station coffee and sour coffee are good to you then by all means. Staff is nice but not knowledgeable about coffee at all

Nice place to sit in a bad part of Market St.  Given the high quality of their beans the cappuccino is amazingly meh....Underextracted, watery. I guess their machine is hard to use to get it right.  Otherwise fine.

Great little coffee spot on Market in the Tenderloin, right next to The Warfield. There's some seating on the inside plus a few tables outside, and free wifi if you need to get a little work done. Their iced latte with oat milk is solid. 16oz for $5, so it's about on par with city pricing. I stopped by for about an hour and a half earlier today, slowly sipping my drink while slapping away at the keyboard. Can't remember if they were playing music or not, as the doors were open to the noise from outside. I actually enjoyed that and was able to get some quality work done.

Ordered a large vanilla latte with oat milk; 2 words: ON POINT! It was sweeter than I normally drink coffee, all because i forgot to ask for little sugar, but it was soooooooooo good! Highly recommended.
Been here a few times and am addicted to their lattes. Everyone is friendly here and the service is pretty quick. Decent prices too!

I've been here a couple of times and the coffee is horrible. Chai tea so sweet that you can't even taste the spices. Coffee very bitter and doesn't have any undertones to it. Overall not worth the high prices that are listed. Don't waste your time here.
I love Equator! The CEO is so inspiring with such a great mission as well. The coffee is unbeatable!!
Discovered this while I was in SF. Their vanilla latte is very similar to a coffee shop in LA called, "Commissary", which I LOVE.Definitely will be back next time I'm in town.
Great affogato. Nice, shaded outdoor seating available. Very clean interior and restrooms. Friendly staff.

Service has notably Improved since they first opened. It's still confusing to figure out where to order and pick up your drinks. But it's nice to have an upscale coffee place on this part of Market Street.

I finally get it when they were preaching abstinence in high school!I had to abstain from drinking coffee for one week to truly appreciate how good the coffee is here. At least good enough to write a review about!I've been to Java Beach a dozen times but today was special. The coffee tasted fantastic. I got a 16 oz Colombian, it took me a minute to figure out which one I wanted as I stood in between a Bernie's blend and the Colombian.What is Bernie's blend anyway? Is it strong to the point where it would force me to become a champion for Democratic socialism, or is it light to the point where I have an early dinner followed by an episode of Matlock or Murder She Wrote, either way I wasn't going to find out, not today!Good coffee and 4 out of 5 stars you ask? Well if you must know, the employees were chit chatting a little too much and failed to see the distress in my eyes, I was in a hurry and the N Judah waits for no one!Note: Please tip the cashiers and servers, SF is expensive and they're doing their best! :D
Eh it's ok, kinda pricey tbh. Water is not very fresh, granola fruit bowl not that good. 4:20 PM

An hour wait for a hot sub.  Our bagel came out. Coffee came out.  Missed an Italian soda. Soup came out.  But no sight for the sandwich till an hour later after several times of checking with the server who keeps telling us it's coming.   By the time the sandwich came out the soup was cold, the coffee was cold.   Being a local for years I have to say too bad, won't be back.
Nice bustling neighborhood cafe. Tasty scones & assorted breakfast pastries, bagels, sandwiches and more. Plus good coffee and friendly staff

Love, love, love this place! My favorite breakfast and coffee in the Sunset district. Had a butterscotch latte with almond milk that was to die for. It was on the sweeter end but so yummy and delish if that's your thing or your in the mood. Otherwise, I would opt for the caramel latte which was perfectly done creamy and frothy and not as sweet. Good coffee here! They have amazing pastries and sandwiches. This time i tried the veggie bagel with its pesto cream cheese=delicious! Previously I've had their soups and was super happy with all I've ordered. The place is full of people in the morning, seems like a lot of locals and maybe some visitors as well. The inside is a rustic beach theme with surf board shaped tables I adore. They also conveniently have plugs built in perfect for working on your laptop.

Hippie cafe, serves both food and coffee,  medium vibes, nice small terrace/seating. Servants were kind of struggling, but not to the point of making me disappointed. Very close to the beach and golden state park. Ideal if you can work remotely, start your day with a walk in the park, work and then call it a day with a Sunset gazing and then take the famous cable car to Downtown. Just beware, it can get too windy to walk on the beach or sit in the terrace

Sure seems like the hip joint to be at if you're on the beach and want that good cup of coffee or a nice little snack this is a place to check out. Seem to be busy most of the day because in the middle of the afternoon it was still busy. But worth the wait oh, and we were happy with what happened as far as our coffee and snacks give it a try see what you think if you want fancy move on if you want a nice little Beach Cafe to get that coffee this is the place

A wonderfully located little coffee house to grab a warm drink and a bite after your long stroll on the beach!This place is always HEAVING when I come here. The line is out the door and everyone is dying to come here - which must be a testament to just how good they are!There's limited seating inside, but if you're lucky enough to find a spot, they have free WiFi, and you find most people here bring their laptops and stay for a while.I've been here a few times, and can confirm their Hoyt chocolate and latte are delicious, and their HUGE chocolate chip cookies are definitely big enough to share... or to keep half for yourself for later ;)Parking can be tough around here, but it's open (you don't have to pay) so that's probably why.I'll definitely be back next time I'm up strolling on ocean beach!

It took about 30 minutes to get a grilled cheese sandwich at Java Beach Cafe today. People who ordered more complicated hot sandwiches after me were served before me.After waiting all that time, I was served two slices of barely-toasted sourdough bread (not pullman bread like it said on the menu) with sliced cheese, disassembled. The picture of what I was served speaks for itself.Seems as though it was thrown together quickly. As a local who has been here many times, I am disappointed to have had such a low quality experience today and am embarrassed to have taken visitors from out-of-town to dine here.

Java beach on Sunday.  It took 15 min to get an iced tea.  They took everyone else's name but mine and never called me or called out my drink.  When someone who ordered after me was called up for their drink, I bee lined to the counter from the waiting area to follow up. There, I find what turned out to be my order sitting on the counter, most  of the ice was melted with heavy condensation on the cup.  Obviously it had just been sitting there.  I pointed this out to the barista, who starred at me blankly, and offered no apology.  Although apologies to others for their delayed drink.  It was a sour note to what was an otherwise unusually beautiful day in the Sunset.

Sitting here now. Java a beach Cafe was the first place I came when I was traveling alone to San Francisco and one of the only places I felt truly at home and at ease. Now I live here and I can run to Java Beach Cafe. I am a lover of community based, local, friendly, warm and inviting coffee shops. Having lived in multiple states this might by far be my favorite Coffee Shop next to Aurora Coffee in Atlanta. I can still get a newspaper, can look to my right and left and see people chatting and catching up and the baristas are so very kind. So Grateful for this magical spot. I hope to be coming here when I'm 70 and catching up with friends. For the love of human connection and coffee Java Beach rules!

I love this place. 1 star off is for price. With the foot traffic they get there, especially from locals, I think they can lower prices some cents. Perfect location and cool staff. I've gotten their lattes, a sandwich, and other small things.

Waiting over an hour for a sandwich. Was told the wait would be around 30 mins. That's fine, over an hour later, no one is hustling, still no sandwiches, not even an apology. How do I get my money back and leave?
Slowest service on the face of the earth. Waited 25 mins for a bagel and a BLT. Mediocre food. I love to support local businesses but I can't do so here in good conscience.

Excellent place to hangout for a few hours for work / catch-up; got great coffee, food options, and ambience (love the casual set up). In addition, it's 2 min walk from the beach. Will come here whenever I'm around.

Every single time I come here the order is messed up. Every. Single. Time. I've even had times where its taken 2-3 retries for them to do make what I ordered. SHould not be this difficult to get what I order, especially for the price

This place has gone to shit. I grew up going here and now the quality and vibe has sufferedMost recently was my last straw. I ordered a hot veggie sandwich that is $14. The price is one thing but they fucked it all up.I said no lettuce and even the ticket says no lettuce and it's loaded with lettuce.They smothered it in mustard and the last failed to mention it comes with mustard when I asked.Also, literally the tiniest slither of Avocado and only on one side. For a veggie sandwich that's $14 you expect at least a normal amount let alone a slither on one side. Lost my business for good, and to think I drove I t of the way to support a business I grew up going to.

Ordered late with extra shots, been waiting a while then I asked  where is my coffee she told what's did  you ordered ?Late! !!!!! We just charged you three shots!  Frustrating isn't it ? I have to wait for couple more orders when I got my coffee super coldwhatever.
I love their hot chocolate  service is friendly and upbeat, I'm always in and out whenever I'm crunching for time.

Cute cafe, with a nice outdoor seating area (across from the beach) and a cosy indoor area. They didn't have a lot of bakery/sweet options, but we tried this Irish Soda bread which tasted like a scone but looked like a cake, probably wouldn't get that again & a cinnamon scroll, this was quite big and yummy. The coffee is self serve which is cool & iced latte was good!

I used to like this place a lot. Their coffee is good but the quality of service has gone down so much, to the point that you are too frustrated to enjoy your coffee.Probably won't be back for a while.

I come to San Francisco once a year, and this has become my go-to if I want a quiet, lovely spot away from the convention centre. Great for meetings, dates, or to catch up with friends; I just wish I drank coffee and not tea! This is one of those places where I see what I'm missing out on!
This barista stand is your savior if you are at Moscone Center looking for (good) coffee.

I really loved my last visit to Sightglass! The coffee shop is located in SFMOMA and I think it's just a really cool place to relax and enjoy a cup of great coffee in between exhibits. I loved the coffee so much that I decided to buy a bag of their beans. Roast date was only 2 days prior too. Yummmm.I got a cold brew on my last visit, but now I really wish I got a cappuccino or a pour over. Can't wait to go back!By the way, the actual cafe is on the 3rd? floor of SFMOMA and you need a ticket to get there. Lucky for you, if you want to enjoy the coffee, you can also get it from a small stand on the first floor.
Amazing coffee, may be some of the best in the area. Even though we didn't visit the MOMA, we were actually served and the barista was extremely nice. Would visit again!
Sightglass has the best coffee, period. What a beautiful location,  and I am  really happy it is close by. My go-to drip turned out to be perfect. People do need to clean up after themselves though!!
Super simple creamy tasting coffee. Came in here to get away from the crazy conference life. Super quiet and peaceful. Highly recommend.
The hot latte is quite bitter, which may attracts people who enjoy bitter more than balanced taste. The seating area with interesting SFMOMA videos is good.

My favorite cup of coffee and now I can grab it on the go. They just opened a kiosk inside the atrium of the SFMoMA. You do not need a ticket to buy a delicious cup of coffee to go! The staff is helpful and definetly know what they are doing. The kiosk is open from 8am to 5pm during weekdays.
Loved my vanilla iced latte. Perfectly strong and not too sweet. I wish coffee came in a larger size! ‍

Exactly what you would expect from Sightglass. Wonderful experience, amazing baristas, great customer service, and fantastic coffee! As per usual they have raw sugar to use. No simple syrup though (you can request Agave as a substitute). You do need a ticket to the museum to go to this location! And of course you can't take the coffee around the museum (it's priceless art, come on). But it's great to have such an amazing option for coffee while visiting MOMA!I got my normal pour-over and it is always worth the price! They move people through the line quick, and really care about keep customers happy!

What could be better than drinking delicious coffee while surrounded by inspiring, innovative art?? Answer: not much! So happy that Sightglass Coffee now lives inside this beautiful museum. The staff are kind, down-to-earth & great at their jobs, and the coffee does not disappoint! Stop here when your feet need a little break from wandering the museum & enjoy the top-shelf quality coffee & service you've come to expect from Sightglass Coffee.
Sightglass has literally the best coffee, and to have this location inside favorite museum is a dream. The baristas are nice & helpful (not stuffy!), and the space is beautiful. Love.
If you ever go to the SFMOMA be sure to stop by this Sightglass! Great coffee, tasty pastries and a friendly staff make for a great spot to take a little break as you enjoy the exhibits.
Good to see Sightglass in Sfmoma. Nice location and coffee ! Enjoy a cup of espresso in the museum can be one of to do list.

Why is it that every place that has amazing coffee is nowhere near where I live!?! My cousin is a regular here and brought me here when I came down to visit. Dudessss it's ridiculously amazing ya gotta try it! It's so good! The service the quality... Just go here!

3.5 stars Obviously the location is perfect. After strolling the first few floors our legs were tired and we wanted to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee. The coffee is scent but it great. Every table was dirty which was annoying given they charged almost ten dollars for two espresso drinks.

Yup, I like this place and will definitely be back the next time I visit the SFMOMA. As others have said, this Sightglass location is inside of SFMOMA and you actually can't access it unless you have paid to get inside of the museum. I'm cool with that though. They serve all of their drinks in ceramic cups and there is a designated area that you can consume it. I ordered a 12oz mocha with almond milk (vegan), but the ceramic mug looks like it's closer to 10ozs. That's cool too--I also like 10oz drinks too. I'm really having a good day just relaxing at one of the small round black tables and drinking my coffee. It's actually pretty perfect and I already decided that I definitely want to recreate this experience again in the future. I definitely will be coming back the next time I am at the museum.
As a diehard fan of french roast coffee, this coffee is awful.  Incredibly acidic.  And crazy expensive!

This is such a nice option to have for a quick coffee before, during or after viewing art at SFMOMA. Well designed interior and tasty coffee make it a great fit for the space they're located - 3rd floor in the older part of the museum. We love this place and it's been a great go to for a little extra pep in our step while walking around. I wish they had a few more vegan options when it comes to pasties/treats. They occasionally have a biscuit or cookie but not consistently. Glad it's here though.

I was craving a bagel and cream cheese and I was so excited to try this place. I went out of my way to come here and it was just alright. I got a sesame bagel with tomato and onions. I would've been happier going to Noah's bagels- seriously!

Love it. Ok who am I kidding. What coffee shop have I not liked? Anyway, I love their interior. It's so simple, contemporary, and hip. Coffee is great in a very good location. I had their breakfast egg sandwich (    ) and it was absolutely delectable. This place is a great stop if you're looking for some coffee and breakfast in town. It was better than the other coffee shop I had earlier in SF. I don't even remember the name of the other one.

Good coffee, good sandwiches, friendly service. Lots of nearby techies show up here for a coffee break. Seating at stools along the windows offers a nice view of the street. There is also some more comfy seating as you head towards the restrooms.

I come here a lot because it's near my work. Coffee is always yummy and staff is usually awesome but man oh man their prices are crazy high. They charged me $4 for 1 piece of plain toast. I love their affogatos but they tend to turn off the machine pretty early- last time i came between 3-4pm they had already turned it off.  The best part about this place? They are dog friendly! For this reason I'll keep on coming
Amazing coffee and amazing sandwiches for a quick and delicious breakfast. The salmon bagel and avocado toast have been the best I've tasted amongst even brunch spots.
Delicious coffee!! Always treat myself to a quad latte on Fridays! Every one who works there is extremely friendly and upbeat. Always look forward to my weekly treat en route to the office!

A modern and welcoming coffee place feeling a bit more Twitter and Uber than the downtown tenderloin intersection of its location.The service was friendly and casual, albeit a bit distracted despite being the only customer.Seating was ample, but largely only stools facing the large outside windows.  A fine place to stop for a few minutes, but no where to sit with a laptop or face a friend for a conversation.The coffee was ok. A bit weak and more floral than I'd prefer. Creamers are offered, but they are unmarked and not cold, and no heavy cream option - sorry LCHF Paleo kids.It's a fine place, but with so many nearby quality coffee shops, it's hard to recommend.

I'm so happy to find another place that serves affogatos! I only know about a handful of businesses that serve them in the city. They use Counter Culture beans which is originally from North Carolina and more widely known on the East Coast. The lattes were delicious and the baristas were friendly and accommodating. I'm pleased with the seating options to read my book but it can get annoyingly loud when there are coffee rushes. A lot of the corporate employees in the neighborhood come here for their coffee breaks. Anyway.. please don't close this location!
Sick vibes, awesome employees, great music, and just an overall great place to stop by, relax, and grab some good coffee!

Ordered a decaf cappuccino and got a caffeinated one.I understand that this is a coffee shop, and I'm the odd one out for ordering fake coffee, and I probably should have double checked with the nice barista, but I got the wrong thing, feel very anxious right now, and wont be sleeping tonight. urgh.Everything tasted great, and everyone was nice.

Came here in the morning for a cup of latte and mocha. When we entered, there were a good number of people working at the tables and having a small bite. We ordered through an app as we walked over so we didn't have to wait in line and they prepared everything perfectly on time! The drinks were ready to be picked up by the time we walked in. You have to admit that the coffee art here is very intricate and beautiful that it's worth a photo opp. Their flavors are more on the bitter side with a perfect hint of sweetness, which I love!
Cute coffee shop with chai with just the right amount of spice. Not much seating is available, but they do have free WiFi and a good hearty selection of meal foods.

Great Service! Great Coffee Selection & food is delicious. Def a great morning treat! Avocado toast is a must!Everything Bagel w/lox is a double must! Triple almond Latte is a "triple" must. I'd be careful, these drinks are potent and will hype you up! Trust me I know. #jitters much?

The decor of this place is cool. The bar section has a modern look.  The bartender was nice. The kitchen closes early, so not the best place to hit up after work. The design of the bathrooms is not the most sanitary. Meaning the staff use these restrooms and I wouldn't feel comfortable ordering food here. Just my opinion, feel free to check this place out on your own.

This is my go-to cafe. San Francisco's best chai, and everyone who works there is super friendly. Little more on the pricey side but definitely the best place in the neighborhood. And they always have good music playing :)
I love this place.  My favorite when I am working in the City.  The coffee is so smooth and low acidity.  I love it!! My go to is the Latte.
Overpriced mediocre coffee- I ordered a vanilla late for which I was charged $7- the coffee was very mediocre- should have walked an extra block to get Peet's.
Super friendly service. I love the chai and the different pastries they have...especially this particular croissant they have sometimes. Super yummy

Tried this place because of a groupon. I didn't end up getting a coffee/drink. So this review it just for their avocado toast. It was good and decently priced at six bucks. It was a little busy though they had one guy making the food. Bread was slightly too burnt for me - a good brown would've been nicer. But simple avocado with just salt and some red peppers. Nothing too fancy and it was two slices cut into triangles. So pretty filling also. Would get this again.

I love this place. Come here with my boyfriend all the time in the morning. The coffee is WAY better than Peet's coffee and super delicious. I haven't really ordered much outside of that, but I highly recommend coming here just to get a good cup of joe.Apparently they have a really good Brie sandwich, but we've never ordered it because my boyfriend doesn't like mushy cheese. It looks delicious though.

One of my favorite breakfast spots! Breakfast little egg sandwich tastes amazing with the garlic aioli, sriracha and the bun they use. Chocolate French toast (only available on weekends) is basically a pressed chocolate croissant and it's delicious. Their drinks are always great too. Staff is extremely friendly and food and drinks are always consistent. I usually am there at least once a week!

I'm sitting in the restaurant as I write this bcs I'm so excited about this place.  It's tiny (only two tables with two chairs at each table) and the menu is short.  But, with that said, I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.  Love the charm, the food, the smallness, the kindness of the lady who took our order. We ordered the Breakfast Little and Almond French toast and both were amazing!  So happy we decided on this for breakfast.  If you're lucky enough to get a table, you get window seat viewing all around, minus the kitchen/coffee area.
Delicious breakfast. I highly recommend the breakfast sandwich with garlic aioli. It's a hidden gem in SF. Don't miss this spot.

Great breakfast food. Very unassuming place given its location, but it's definitely worth checking out. The breakfast little is a great breakfast sandwich (egg, bacon, cheese, garlic aioli, sriracha sauce).

This is my first time coming here! (Totally by accident because I missed my weekend morning CalTrain bus to Bayshore station, so i had to take a car to the station) I love it! Super cute cafe!!! Total hidden gem in SF! The women that run it are so lovely!!! I got the spicy Mexican mocha ( it's spicy- you have been warned if you're sensitive) and the Mr. Fancy pants (mushrooms, honey, garlic, olive oil, and toasted cheese- absolutely delicious)!!! I will be coming back!!! I will go out of my way when I commute to try this place again! P.S. I found out they own the restaurant Breakfast Little on 22nd st. Never been there, but if this is even a hint of that, then I'm so down!!!!!

Such a great little coffee spot. Only two tables inside, but it is nice and cozy. The drinks and food are always on point. Whenever my sister is in town, she has to get her Senorita here. It's cinnamon goodness. I personally like the Mexican mocha. Love the french toast but they only have it on the weekends (I think maybe Friday too?).  The breakfast little sandwich is good, too. This place is a little on the pricey side, but it's definitely worth it.
Just waited 20 minutes in line and was told that it would be another 20-30 minutes and that they were out of most foods! No seating ... no restroom!

French toast was great, they were out of original. The almond French toast was the best option, though. Don't be fooled, they say they give you a couple sticks and syrup but it's more than enough for one person. The almond French toast is croissant styled bread with almond filling and toasted almonds. The Littles toast is more of a sandwich; you have the option between one or two eggs with/without siracha. The bread they used for it was really good, not too heavy with a garlic aoli! All in all, great mom-and-pop stop! Don't plan on eating inside due to how small the space is, but was worth the stop!!

A charming, cozy little hole-in-the-wall coffee shop. Really cozy. As in, there are two tables in the dining area, and the entire space could fit within a decent-sized master bedroom. Nevertheless, it is a great place to sit down and have coffee on a quiet Sunday. My sister and I decided to have brunch and coffee here one morning; we read over the short menu of food items and were excited to try the King Kong Toast - a toasted sweet bread with hazelnut spread, topped with bananas, walnuts, and condensed milk. The coffee was nice enough, and the toast tasted as good as it looked (can you ever go wrong with bananas and Nutella?). My sister probably summed it up best, though: "Delicious, but I probably could have made it myself."Overall, an endearing little café with friendly service, definitely worth a stop if you're in the area.

Such a cute little hole in the wall Family Owned Cafe! I have lived across the street from Piccolo Pete's for almost a year now, and today finally had a little time to check it out! Service was quick and friendly.We ordered: Mr Fancy Pants toast - garlic, olive oil, Brie Cheese, mushrooms, and honey.SO SIMPLE. SO GOOD. Seniority Coffee - pretty good tasted like Mexican hot chocolate, can't complain! Cafe is suuuper small and only has 2 tables inside so prepare for to go orders!

This place is a really awesome low-key neighborhood spot. When you come upon it you wouldn't expect much but they make really wonderful food and they have really great coffee. The owner is super nice and the staff is really warm. The space is a bit small so I would say grab what you want to go but if you're lucky you'll find a table. They just opened a second location, can't wait to check it out. Last time we were here the homeless guy came in asking for help. So we decided to offer our cup of coffee as we waited for our purchase. And the owner overheard us and treated us to a drink which was really awesome and nice of him. One nice gesture lead to another. Super pleasant experience.

My fiance introduced this place to me when I moved to the neighborhood. We love coming here on weekends since it's just a quick walk from our place and are never disappointed with the food and coffee. Typically we get a Breakfast Little and Mr. Fancy Pants with Chai Tea Latte and the Spicy Mexican Mocha. I love that the Mexican Mocha is actually spicy. Although the space is very small and can only seat four people in its entirety, we haven't had a problem getting a seat as most orders are from regulars to go. The people who work here are also very friendly and the vibe of this place is just very cozy and comforting. I hear they have opened up another place in the Mission and will be checking that out soon!
Great breakfast selection and taste. A Gem in the neighbourhood! Highly recommended. - Singapore tourist
I love coming here, one of the best coffee shops in town, the service is always very good as well.

Great sandwiches, great selection. Rice and gumbo. This place is old tyme San Francisco.Live band sometimes and sports photos and memorabilia.They do close at 5 pm sharp, so make sure you get there early.

The french toast was the most unique and truly the best my girlfriend and I have ever had. The Mexican mocha also lived up to the hype. The neighborhood and atmosphere was great, conviently off of the 101.

On our way to the Dicken's Faire we stopped here for breakfast. Delicious food and Mexican coffee was spicy and tasty. Very small place with only two tables, but seats outside. They seem to do lots of take out, they are fast and reasonably priced. The French toast is amazing!
Really great coffee and great staff. The French toast and egg sandwich are out of this world. So are the cookies and raspberry lemonade

Wow, what a discovery! Anything you order is super-delicious. My husband insists that no matter what you order be sure to order a French toast, too! He didn't and is still regretting it. Above all, you have to order the spicy Mexican mocha. But you have to be good with . It's not always easy to find. Thanks to the kitchen team for a delight stop. BTW, this is really a to go spot. There are only two small tables. So, eat while you're still parked because you will not want to spill or loose any of your brekkie. And some items are open-faced toast. With a Mr. Fancy Pants be prepared with lots of napkins to catch the honey an Brie drips. Yummm.
Love this neighborhood gem! The owner, Andrew, is incredibly nice, and the food is fabulous. Try the almond French toast and the breakfast little. Wash it down with a bitter-sweet mocha.

I make an effort to visit Blue Bottle whenever I visit San Fran. I love the smoothness of their coffee and the lovely balanced lattes. The lines are usually long so be prepared to wait unless you get there early.

Affogato and the waffle was what I ordered. Omg, so good! Although the wait was really long for the waffle, it was totally worth it. It was crispy yet fluffy with a slight hint of sweetness that is perfect with coffee. The affogato was good also. I do prefer it in a cup vs the bowl they gave me though. It made drinking the espresso a bit difficult as the bowl as shaped a bit funny. Totally need a waffle and coffee shop around where I live though!

Blue bottle coffee has this simple aesthetic to it that's so pretty and makes you want to stay in their store! There's always a line at this location but it goes by really quickly. I love the New Orleans iced coffee with almond milk, it's the perfect amount and not too sweet! I also really like their affogato , the bitterness of the expresso is perfectly balanced with ice cream. So yummy ! If you never tried blue bottle , you must!!

The coffee is ok (espresso/cappuccino), waffelgato was interesting, and the stuff is always friendly. But they often mess up the order! Both times I ordered espresso "for here" they brought it in a paper cup. Even after I talked with a bartender and told him that I really wanted an espresso cup, not a glass or anything like that. It just tastes so much better, folks!

I love this place. There are tons of options when I come to SF but I always end up getting blue bottle when I'm near the ferry building. The coffee here is really superb.,it's rich and creamy and I love the designs. I get the mocha which already uses ristretto shits so I don't even need to ask!! Great coffee shop!!

Yummy coffee with pretty design. I got almond milk latte and my friend got the mocha. Both very pretty and yummy. No sugar or any sweetener needed! Great place to stop for coffee after getting off Embarcadero Bart station and before a walk somewhere. Plenty to look around and see/buy around it at the ferry building also.

I understand the hype. I've​ got to say, after trying it, Blue​ Bottle is worth any line to get your hands on some coffee. The cool aspect of this location is there are two areas to order! In general, I am obsessed with the simplistic design of this coffee shop and love the branding that they have on their coffee cups and paraphernalia​. Despite the line that we encountered, it went quite quickly. The barista that was taking our order was extremely friendly and took the time to explain the drinks and make recommendations according to our typical coffee preferences. She instructed my sister and me​ to order the New Orleans, and she was right on point! The New Orleans is an iced cold brew that we ordered with Almond Milk. Although​ it was made with Cane Sugar, I did not feel like it was extremely sweet but rather the ideal combination for an enjoyable drink. I was impressed​ by the taste of the Cold Brew itself that was strong but not thankfully not especially acidic or bitter in taste. Safe to say, I enjoyed my first Blue Bottle experience and would highly recommend it to San Francisco goers.

I got the cold brew. It was strong but I wish they have other alternative milks. They only have almond milk. The service was really quick despite a line. They have compostable straws and containers, which I really appreciated!
Took a long time (~20 mins)to get my hot chocolate(whole milk variant). It tasted decent, and had an artwork.

There are two Blue Bottle Coffee locations in San Francisco Ferry Building literally within 20 -30 steps of each other and it seems like they often get confused by me and many of my fellow Yelpers! One is inside and on the north end of the building. The other one is a stand outside on your right as you walk north on the Embarcadero. They both serve high quality coffee drinks, but at any given time the line at one may be shorter than the other, so you may want to check both locations before committing to the line in front of one. Here is the review I wrote for the other location. The good buzz from Oakland!It was in Early 2000 when W. James Freeman, a coffee loving freelance musician, had enough of commercial, I call it corporate, coffee and decided to take matters in his own hands. His goal was to sell freshly roasted coffee beans to snobbish caffeine junkies like me who cared about the aroma and taste of freshly roasted coffee.  He made a vow: "I will only sell coffee less than 48 hours!"Things went very well for Blue Bottle Coffee mostly because people loved their products, so much so that it expanded into San Francisco and then the rest of San Francisco Bay Area. Then in 2010 they opened their first New York location. Then in 2017 the unthinkable happened. They became an almost corporate coffee! Nestle purchased 68% of their shares!Corporate or not, Blue Bottle coffee tastes and smells wonderful. I discovered Blue Bottle coffee in 2007. Those days the choices were fewer and simpler. These days they have so many fancy names for the choices they offer that I've lost track, but the favorites that I recall are 17ft Ceiling and Hayes Valley Espressos. I usually ask for a long pull. It gives me a mouthful of fresh coffee flavor and the caffeine kick I seek! If you are around the Ferry Building, this location is a very good place to try their coffee. The baristas are very friendly and helpful and the location is great.

This take away coffee shop is on another level. The coffee is extremely good - no burnt coffee bean taste. The baristas are well trained, the snacks are always fresh. Service is quick even though there is always a line a mile long. Then - the flowers! Oh my goodness, can't get over the amazing fresh flowers that is changed every week, love love love!

This is a little version of the Blue Bottle coffee shops, perhaps, Blue Bottleito.  You won't find fancy siphon machines where the baristas are literally scientists in a lab, nor do they serve the best Avocado Toast I've ever had (66 Mint St, SF).  Despite the short comings, they're serving some of the best coffee in all the land. A little 2-man crew, super nice and talkative.  We were cracking jokes and talking burgers (what else is new?).  Needless to say, great guys.My double espresso was so good, and at $4.75, just about the right price.Love Blue Bottle.  Love the 1 Ferry Building.

My boyfriend brought me here after my food coma from Hog Island around the corner. I had heard about Blue Bottle, but never actually seen one, so I was pleasantly surprised. Their drip coffees are wonderful, which is what my boyfriend likes to get. I usually order an Americano, but I enjoy my lattes too. I suggest trying your coffee without any added sugars. Really taste the coffee because it's sooo goood. Service could be better. Wish these guys smiled more. Coffee snobs. Maybe it's part of their charm.

A great cup of high quality coffee to-go. Service is surprisingly fast given the small setup, cashiers and baristas are friendly, and things are kept meditatively simple.Choose the kind of drink you want and the type of bean, full stop. Make a special request for an alternative creamer. No sizes or any of that syrup stuff. And of course, pay the San Francisco price.I watched the baristas from the viewing window as they went about fulfilling orders. Their process was interesting:Receive order on receiptGrind beans for that particular roastFill espresso handleWeigh the loaded handle to make sure the proper amount of beans is in itFlatten and press it down with a stopperInsert to machineDispense and add whatever the order calls for
Great coffee, had the oat milk late and it was so tasty. Took off a star because of cost.

Great coffee at a great price! The location within the SF ferry station makes it an advantageous get away for the day. We coupled our afternoon coffee with gluten free pastries from Mariposa. An excellent pairing that you must try!

Blue Bottle is a staple for good coffee in San Francisco. It's not cheap - $5 for a drip coffee, but it's reliable. I stopped by this morning for a cup as I was halfway through my walk around the Farmer's Market and the line was pretty long. However, the line moves faster than it looks, so don't be scared off. If you've never had their New Orleans cold brew before, I'd highly recommend it.
Oat milk latte and Blue Bottle chocolate to start the day. Best breakfast ever? I think yes. Plus, love that BB now offers Oatly! Best dairy replacement on the market.

I love a nicely made latte, just a straightforward, consistent, no sugar or syrups or hoopla, delicious latte. You can get just that at Blue Bottle. Some espressos are more bitter, some bland. Blue Bottle is really good. A definite must stop on Farmer's Market days.

I've been to this location the most and love getting their waffles! It is so perfect for my morning commute the day I don't have time for my breakfast!The coffee here isn't so bad, and I would order Almond Latte from time to time. Not my favorite, but better than a lot of places. Their pastries are really sweet, so I kinda stopped ordering just recently. (except for the waffles!) Their baristas are not that friendly so don't attempt to become their BFFs. I learned the hard way and would only speak to them when I order, and nothing more. What I don't like about Blue Bottle Coffee in general is that their coffee is always SO hot, and yet they don't offer any coffee cup sleeves and if you ask them for a second cup, they might roll their eyes before handing you one. Been there, done that. This place accepts cards and there are public restrooms nearby.

I live a few blocks from this lovely cafe and it's my go to. The restaurant itself is adorable. The decoration is is light, bright, and you really feel like you've stepped out of San Francisco for a bit. The food is so Instagram friendly ;) its delicious too. The staff try very hard to accommodate, but it feels very Parisian hah! The cafe and coffees are delicious and strong. The baked goods are nice.I am there mostly for the atmosphere :) this place gets a 5 stars for me as a cafe

Really wanted to like this place, tried it twice and I just can't. Service was deplorable both times we were seated then ignored for fifteen minutes while other patrons were seated, drink orders taken and given menus. We actually had to flag down the waiter for menus both times. The Croques are good although I find the bread to be a little thick. The last visit, all three of us ordered a croque and were expecting our orders to be served with the salad stated on the menu, they arrived with French fries. When we asked the waiter why fries and not the usual salad we were told that the chef had changed the menu, the menu still said salad, probably still does. I don't feel that fries with a fried sandwich is very appropriate, especially for breakfast?I think this could be a great spot if they just worked on their service and menu a bit.

Small bakery in the corner street. Reasonable wait time. Most reviews talk about good food but poor service, but we were lucky with both.1. Chocolate croissant - 42. Salmon and egg scramble over croissant - 4 1. The croissant was delicious. We ordered it at the front bakery. I think there was an entire bar of chocolate in the croissant. Mmm. 2. The egg scramble was very well cooked and soo soft. The salad had a mustard dressing which was delicious as well. My friends had the croque madame And eggs Benedict they said it was really good, unfortunately I did not have a taste. Good place to come for brunch, I would come again. Also the service was great but the presume it was because it wasn't too busy.

So, I've given this place two stars and I'll tell you why. It's like they hire college kids who have never worked in a cafe before because they don't seem to know how to do the job and the service is beyond BAD.The tables around us had food left on them that no one even bothered to clear and we were there for 25 minutes and it wasn't even busy!  Gross....Plus it takes way too long to get what you want to eat. It could be SO much better with the right people working there.Get some people in there who actually care about your experience, and who keep the place clean. It's not-that-hard, but somehow this place misses it BIG time.

I think I wanted to give this a higher rating. This Cafe certainly has that unique and cute atmosphere. French.You should come for brunch though my girlfriend and I only came for an afternoon coffee and pastry on a Sunday afternoon. The pastries ran out by the time we got there at 3pm. So we only ordered a chocolate croissant. I got a macchiato. I would say it's pretty average and you could go to a neighborhood coffee shop for a cheaper cup. But they have really nice decor and it's fairly quiet, so you could definitely enjoy your conversation.Come earlier! I may update this rating based on an earlier experience, but the chocolate croissant did not impress me.

The service is not the best as times, but what do you expect on a Sunday in the Castro??? Give them a break! They need to go out sat night too! ;) ... the food is amazing, fresh, and yummy. Coffee is tasty. Definitely a great neighborhood brunch spot.
Food is actually pretty good. But found live spiders walking around in my salad in my salad. Not pleasant and would not recommend.Makes you wonder what else is wrong with the food.
Wonderful food, drinks and atmosphere!  Disregard the 3 stars as people are impatient and don't know how to wait for a good thing.

Here's the deal- yes the French pastries are amazing. Quality and delicious. However, probably some of the worst service I've ever experienced. Super slow, long lines, and I've waited 15 minutes for an espresso to go. This last time, we sat for brunch and a waitress didn't approach my table for over 20 minutes. I had to flag her down...and even then I was received with and eye roll and an "I'll be with you in a moment." It's unfortunate that they don't really care much for the patron experience.
Very nice place, always full on weekends but i think is overpriced but of coarse you should try it!!!
Best croissants in the city but the coffee takes for EVER!Next time I'm getting a coffee at Reveille and picking up a croissant here to go.
Very airy place with large windows that let sunshine in by a street corner.  French music.  Lovely space.

I live near this bakery and love the people that work there. They are great and the food is awesome. I was really upset though because one of my favorite baristas, Leo, no longer works there. He made great coffee and had a positive attitude which was great to see every morning. What a loss to the bakery and company that he is no longer there.

An exceptional feat--pain au chocolat (chocolate croissant) too dry on the outside and raw in the middle (baked at too high a temp?). People seem to come to be seen for brunch or simply to enjoy the cute Parisian cafe-style seating. FOOD: Croissants piled high, a dream of airy pillows of butter held together with flour... a dream shattered upon the first bite into this golden deception. As stated in the TLDR, dry throughout and a dense hunk in the middle. The pain au chocolat featured a generous squirt of too-liquid chocolate (the highlight of the pastry--who doesn't love sugar?). Haven't tried the prepared dishes, but as a business that markets itself as a viennoisserie (with an Instagrammable "I croissant/heart SF sign" outside), I would expect the croissants to be the star of the show. Despite the 3-star rating, the line is always out the door on weekends. I will not be joining it. I live nearby and walk the dog by the window nightly, where I see plenty of croissants on a sheet wrapped in Saran wrap. Fingers crossed that these go into bread pudding and not back on the display. SERVICE: Personable cashier who rung me up made the experience great! Service and ambiance are the redeeming factors at Le Marais, though I can't comment on table service.AMBIANCE: ADORABLE. I have to believe people come for the ambiance. I love the Cinderella blue paint, the reed-woven cafe chairs, the tiled interiors, and the charming 19th c. font. Aesthetics are spot on, and a photo on a weekend at 11am (dogs & strollers at the sidewalk cafe, enthusiastic conversations at cafe tables inside, the marble pastry display counter)... a perfect picture of gentrified SF. I guiltily love it as much as anyone else, but won't be enjoying it due to my love of good food.

The meal was tasty. The coffee just right. The dining room clean and inviting. The service, mediocre at best. The biggest challenge here is a lack of management. When this places closes down, it won't be a surprise. Clean and well-stocked, Le Marais has a broad selection of lunch foods (some healthy, some not), drinks, pastries and other bakery items. Unfortunately, like far too many businesses in the Castro, the service is hit or miss. On my visit (and my previous visit last week) service was scattershot. There was little attention to detail (like checking in to ensure my meal was correct, asking if I might like something additional, providing a check so I could pay the bill and get out of there) and definitely no attempt to sell any food (no upselling, suggestions, etc.)This was the first time I did not tip my server (I am a former server).

I mainly come here for the food, but it does get very crowded, so I normally take it togo. The espresso here is not the best. It doesn't have a rich flavor, but it does the job. The service was not great, I've had to pull the waiter every step of the way. But I also understand there a tons of people they need to attend to.If you want to taste their tasty bakery treats (the quiche and chocolate chip cookie are my favorites), you better get there before 11 because they ALWAYS sell out.
I really loved everything about this place. It was pretty busy when I went, so the service was medium but overall it was a great experience and the food was great.

Fantastic croissants and pastries! Some of the best I've ever had. One con, the kitchen only opened up at 9 but we got there at 8:30. I don't think I saw that anywhere on the menu or the website which is frustrating because we had to wait for half an hour eating pastries and drinking coffee till we could order real food. Not really a complaint though because the croissant and my matcha latte were delicious. Get the breakfast board! Such a great deal!

The owners should really read these reviews! Potential but the staff will ruin them. I've been here twice. 1st time the woman waiting on me was nice and it wasn't a long wait. She just didn't know her product line. She said a pastry that I bought was lemon curd when it was orange marmalade. I don't like orange marmalade. But today was awful service. The 1 guy who was waiting on everyone was so busy flirting with a gal that the cue got really long. He continued when he reached us so much that I didn't order my coffee because I was now running late. Shaved head, beard and doesn't wear his glasses, so he told the gal.

The place is very nice and calm.The service is horrible.How does a coffee shop on saturday at 9 runs out of brew, and is 15 mins wait cause they forgot to brew a new batch, answer get an Americano. If the coffee boy would be making coffee instead of video chatting in front of the machine and moving just his hands, (dont forget to look busy) maybe i could have coffee. Today.You can have a fantastic shop and a very polite crew, you still need service is a business.
