Such a beautiful tea shop; it's very spacious, clean, and bright. We did the tea tasting where they offer you 3 teas of your choice to try. They explain the origin and how to properly steep and such. These teas are nothing like the ones you buy at the grocery stores, of course. There are so many choices of tea and ceramics...tea pots, tea sets, etc. This place is by no means cheap, but you get the quality that you pay for. They also have teas on the cheaper side, but some that can get pretty pricey. It's definitely worth a trip...once you try these teas, you can't go back to PG tips!

This place is still the absolute bee's knees. I take all my friends exploring SF here for a relaxing, educational, and delicious tea tasting. You can't beat $10 for 3 tastings of the most delicious and delicate teas you'll ever have in your life. The ambience here is everything as well. Wooden furniture, ceramic cups, and moody music to transport you into the most peaceful place.Don't forget to use their bathrooms because they've got the cutest tissue paper holder.

This is a beautiful tea shop. Everything here is laid out in a very nice setup. They also give you tea cups to try out when you walk in, so you can sip some tea while you browse.There are also tons of ceramics for sale here. Tea pots, cups, coasters, etc. They are definitely not cheap ($100+) but I did find them to be aesthetically pleasing.The teas also seem to vary wildly in pricing. $30/oz is not uncommon here, but there are even more expensive teas here. They do offer some samples if you decide to buy any tea, which is nice.

My friend and I had a lovely tea tasting experience here! Our tea tasting leader was very knowledgeable about tea, and answered all of our questions - we had a lot! We tried a sampling of teas that were earthy, slightly sweet and tasty. Tea tasting here opened our eyes to new types of teas from around the world, and we bought a selection of tea to take home and enjoy. Thank you!

Such a pleasant place to be! The shop itself is so beautiful and airy, and the moment you walk in you get hit with a super strong tea smell, which is amazing. We signed up for a tea tasting, which is $10 and lasts around 20-30 min. You get to sample three of their teas, guided by their expert tea brewers. They have a really nice selection of teas (mostly oolongs and greens) from China and Taiwan, and they said that the owner goes back to China and Taiwan each spring to get the new tea harvest. Teas range from $18 - $40 ish per 30g, which is usually enough for probably 5-6 pots of tea. Highly recommend as a fun experience!

Excellent tea, just did a tasting, but be prepared for some Pacific Heights uptight gong fu.  Some of the techniques (and wastage of beautiful unsteeped high quality tea leaves because they rush you through the tasting and only brew twice - hardly giving you time to sip them after they cool down) pained me. They seem to have a strict protocol and are not able to relax around it (at least the guy serving me wasn't).  He was also rushed despite the store being empty, and kept dumping the tea that was in the server into the garbage before it was drunk.  I was able to discern that the teas are high quality, albeit very pricey.  I would love if they had a different tasting protocol, maybe next time I'll request a more relaxed tasting of only two teas. Or offer to pay for a double (full hour).

Wonderful experience! I came here with a group of friends (total of 5) for some tea tasting. There is only one table to sit, but we were lucky that no one was there. Tea tasting is $10 per person and you can have the worker choose the tea for you, or chose from their selection. Because it was our first time, we had the worker choose the teas. Quality of their tea were great! The aroma and the taste were on point. However, their tea selections were limited compared to those in Chinatown. They had a wide range of oolong tea, but only four green tea. You can purchase your tea there in 2 or 4 ounce. Some teas are at $ but others are $$. They have a good amount of tea cups and pots, but too pricy for me to buy. It is located few blocks from Japantown, so you can always find parking there. There are several buses that stop by the area. It's not a hard place to find.
Have fun hanging out while I was waiting my husband to pick me up after hair cut. Nice people nice tea. Thank you Song's.

A beautiful tea space and ceramics too. Wish we had known about the tea tasting hours but sadly made it to the shop after 4pm. Instead, we received wonderful help from the gentleman at the counter who let us try the Four Season red tea. We ended up spending $20+ for 2oz of a green tea. 2oz is a surprisingly large amount of tea. I know I'll be back again bringing friends the next time we visit SF. For future visitors, this space offers all the things you need to make delicious tea at home; it is not a sit down with a fresh cup of tea shop unless you make arrangements for the tasting.

My friend and I were in the area walking when we passed Song Tea & Ceramics. It looked like a cute place to get tea so we went inside. We discovered this place did tea tastings for $10 a person, so we did that. The man who did the tea tasting (I don't know his name) was so knowledgeable about everything that had to do with tea. He also was really sanitary and knew what he was doing. I really learned so much in the 30 minutes I was there. We tried three different types of tea. The types of tea we tried were white, oolong, and red tea. I'm not a tea lover (much more into coffee) but I really enjoyed the experience. If you like tea you will love this place so much. They sell tea and ceramics such as tea kettles, cups, and much more. I really loved the vibe of the whole store.

The tasting was an awesome experience! The lady that helped us was extremely knowledgeable and gave me a new appreciation for tea. She explained the origin and background of each type and guided us to understand what to pay attention to through each pour.

I really liked my experience at this place. I randomly wandered in with another person while talking a walk. We sat down for a tea tasting. It's 10 dollars per tasting for about a 30 minute experience. The owner, Peter walked us through a intro into tea. He was really upfront and didn't overlay us with too much information. The tea is good. I definitely want to come back for another tasting. It was a relaxing time. I appreciate the amount of work put into the aesthetic of the place. Everything is minimalist and fresh looking. The teapots seem to range anywhere from 100-450. Maybe one day I'll get started on that epic tea set...

I like it!I like the Tea Tasting for $10. It's a fast way to try out different teas. I did it for the "red" teas - and I get to choose which teas to try. I'll definitely come back for another tasting with different teas.Peter loves his tea. He knows where they come from, what the tea cultivar is, and can tell you the gist of why teas taste the way they do. And as I am tasting it, he describes the tea flavor and smell, and the description is on the spot!

My friend and I had such a lovely tea tasting experience here! I highly recommend trying it especially if you want to relax. They don't take reservations for the tasting but when we walked in it was only about a 5 minute wait and we shared the table with another group. The service was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The tea tasting was only $10 each person and lasted about 30-40 minutes. It was really worth it.We tried a white tea and two types of oolong tea based on our own preferences which were all amazing. You get three servings of each tea. I loved that the lady explained how the tea was made and the proper techniques for serving tea. The ceramics that they use are beautiful and add to the experience. You can also buy them in the store from different artists and regions of the world (mostly China and Taiwan).The store itself is beautiful with tons of natural lighting and clean, modern decor. I was really impressed with the entire space. The owner Peter rotates the types of tea served here based on the season so it changes throughout the year. The store is about 4 years old and I only wish I had known about it earlier!

I cannot say enough about Song Tea. The tea tasting experience is worth well beyond $10. The opportunity to try some of their best teas was incredible. The experience was intimate and felt very tailored to us. We got to see close up how to properly brew good tea and understand how delicate and beautiful the process truly is. The teas were wonderful and each had such different body and flavor. They have a limited tea from Taiwan (Mr. And Mrs. Chen's Oolong) that was beyond delicious. The staff was incredibly pleasant, experienced, and knowledgeable. They truly added to the experience (Justine) was hilarious! I will be back. Loved my experience.

I tell all of my tea lover friends about Song Tea & Ceramics because this place is truly magical. First of all, if you're looking for a place to hide from the SF rain for an hour or two, this is the place to be. The space is simple, open, and spacious, homey, and also perfect for this Instagram shots. (+++) The tea tasting : $10! In my opinion, the tea tasting is probably the best thing here. I do agree that some (ok most) of the teas here are quite pricey so the tasting is a good option for you to try those $$$$ teas if you're wondering how magical they taste if they're $100 for 2oz. The tasting used to be free actually if you buy something afterwards but I guess they've changed since so many people do the tasting. The time frame usually range from 20-40 minutes depending on how many people are in your group and who's demonstrating the tasting for you. You can choose up to 3 different teas from their list (maybe even 4 if you're lucky) and the staff will guide you through the brewing process. They will usually serve you three rounds of each tea for you to get a taste of how the tea changes in flavors through the different steep / brew.  My favorite is the Buddha's Hand. The smell and flavors are absolutely amazing. I feel like I've learned so much more about tea from each session! My first session was with Nick (whom I believe is no longer there) and my second session was with Peter (the owner). Both were very knowledgeable and you can see that everyone in the shop is very passionate about the teas. Peter did apologize for not being as talkative as Nick so if you have a question you're dying to ask, don't be afraid to ask away!

Beautiful space with hard to find teas and elegant hand made ceramic tea ware. Staff (or owner?) was super friendly and knowledgeable. You are greeted with a sample tea of the day as you walk in and it's a soothing and zen experience to browse the shop with a lovely warm cup of tea. They also offer tastings for $10 per person for three teas and lasts 30-45minutes. Didn't have time but will consider next time.

How have i not reviewed this place yet? this is the tea shop of my dreams!the space is austere, simple, elegant. there is a bookshelf in the back filled with tea books. some are even bilingual (which is really neat).i was waiting for friends so i sat down and started reading a bit. then my friends showed up... with more friends... and before i knew it, the serene tea shop had exploded into a noisy space.  one of the employees even fled to the back because she's a bit on the shy side. oops.i apologized profusely to the owner, who laughed and told me everything is ok and to calm down. he didn't realize my jitteriness is my default state. tea tastings cost money but you get to try multiple. I sat down with some friends and we had tea. the owner answered my random questions about flavor and brewing details. i ended up buying two different teas. one is their Shanlinxi Winter Sprout. The other one is a Lishan red (which i can't remember the name off the top of my head). the winter sprout is my favorite. i call it my cotton candy tea. i drink it but only when i have time to savor it. it is precious. the other tea my boyfriend loves (i like it too, mind you). it's sweet and fruity and subtle. when i run out, i'll have to order more. and i'll even be happy to pay for shipping.

Beautiful place with apparent passion for teas. Went in for tea tasting on a rainy day ($10 per person), the perfect mood for some warm tea.You can pick your own teas or get recommendations from the staffs who are very knowledgeable. They have unique white, red, green, black, aged tea, etc. We picked ours from different regions in Taiwan since we had a lot of Chinese teas already.The staff walked us through the three steeps of each teas. Now, this is where you can unfold the characters of the tea. Each steep will give you different impressions and aroma. It's like playfully teasing layer after layer, waiting for it to bloom and still appreciate it after the petals have fallen. (No, really.)Come with an open mind, enjoy the whole ceremony, do not rush this moment. :)The tea:1. Buddha Hand - A very well balanced tea with equal seriousness and playfulness. It has a distinctive chocolate-y aroma which were apparent on the second steep. Took a while for is whole character to come out but well worth it.2. Gahhh, this one I forgot the actual compete name. It has winter something...Anyway, the tea leaves are harvested in Lishan during winter. So it has high sugar compound, hence the sweetness of it. It also has the scent of pear. One of the most playful of the red tea or black tea I have tasted. The second steep was really delicious, but it comes to maturation on the 3rd steep.3. Okay, forgive me, I forgot the actual complete name again. But this tea shouldn't be hard to find. Just ask them for the tea which has been aged for 50 years. Repeatedly roasted years after years until the leaves have stabilized. The rich roast came on the first steep. Magnificent. Serious with a hint of high mountain crisp. It has a bit 'thick' aftertaste, so you may want to save this for last.

Quite spendy . Honestly, there's a lot of marketing and packaging upsell. For those who know and are used to traipsing around tea places in Asia, it's a bit hard to swallow the price gouging.I've now tried 2 teas that I own, and a few cups of other tea flavors from friends who also have Song.But flavorful tea boutique it is--- and very aesthetically winsome.

If there was ever a place that served amazing matcha anything, this would be it. Located in Japantown, Matcha Cafe Maiko has amazing matcha everything. Soft serve, lattes, floats, you name it. If you want hojicha, they got that too.The line can get long but it goes by pretty quickly considering how they have both regular orders and a guy moving through the line taking your orders.The cafe itself is small but there's plenty of walking and places to go after you get your order.

The matcha here is delicious and definitely of high quality. The taste is phenomenal; it's very rich and flavorful. If you want matcha or hojicha, this is the place to go to.The soft serve just melts in your mouth and the wonderful taste and scent of matcha fills you. I really like hojicha and was impressed with theirs. Their hojicha tea is rich, fragrant, and strong.Though the lines can get long, the wait isn't that bad. They take orders and complete them fairly quickly.

Yessssss matcha! This place is inside of the Japantown plaza and you'll probably see a line here. I got the matcha parfait which was sooooooo good! It came with mochi and other toppings. Price is totally with it for the quality. Highly recommend!

Tried many matcha cafe in the Bay Area, I think Matcha Café Maiko has served the strongest matcha flavor soft serve in town. Rich matcha flavor and creamy. Unlike many other matcha soft serve that is icy and no flavor or too sweet, this is the best so far!
Heard a lot about this place and finally got a chance to try it out.  The latte matcha was delicious and look forward to trying other options then next time I'm there.
Really yummy, but didn't satisfy my sweet tooth. ( I had the ice cream btw). One this is certain though, everything on the menu looks really pretty, so it makes for a nice thing to post on your ig.

This is THE BEST matcha soft serve in SF. I dream about this ice cream and often visit Japantown just to satisfy my craving for this soft serve. I'm usually one to explore different food experiences, but I've never felt the need to try another matcha soft serve after Cafe Maiko.
This is the best Matcha ice cream/froyo in San Francisco. Although there are always lines, it doesn't take that long and is worth it.
Great place to grab some matcha dessert! We had the matcha ice cream in cone, it was presented nicely and tasted very good! I highly recommend this place for matcha dessert!
Great variety of matcha drinks for those really into strong matcha flavors. High quality stuff. Wish they had Oat milk for those who are trying to go dairy free.

It's quite ironic but I actually am not a huge fan of Matcha but was told by a friend that I had to come try the Hojicha soft serve. My friend totally hyped it up saying it was a delicious tea like flavor so when I came to the cafe I ordered myself one cone with a mochi ball on it. Without tasting the flavor ahead of time which I'm sure you can do if you just ask. Either way it was worth all the hype. I thought it was delicious and I'm still not quite sure what Hojicha is but I assume its some type of tea. The waffle cone was also delicious my only disappointment was that my stomach was too small to finish it. Honestly they pack that soft serve in the cone and I could not finish it all. 10/10 would come back maybe next time i'll get myself the Match and Hojicha swirl. It also looked delicious.

I been seeing people post this on Instagram, so I had to stop by after eating lunch to get my dessert fix. Came on a weekday afternoon and thank goodness there was no line. I asked the cashier what was their top selections and she was able to provide me with a few things. This is definitely a Matcha lover's paradise aka my kinda paradise. I didn't want to go overboard and get like 3 items lol so I decided on the Maiko special- basically the whole shabang- comes with a shitload of toppings like green tea cake and some jelly things topped with matcha ice cream- they had their Horjicha seasonal flavor at the time so I asked for both matcha and that one. For the price, I don't think I would come back-I think i paid close to $8. I just bought it to try once and to post it to the gram haha.

This place has the best matcha soft serve ice cream in SF. I am a big matcha lover and I love their matcha. The matcha soft serve was very authentic in a way that it had rich matcha taste and not overly sweet. The hojicha flavor also had a strong tea taste. Both flavors tasted great separately but they took over each other's flavor when mixed together. I should have ordered one matcha soft serve and one hojicha soft serve instead. This store is very popular, so be prepared to wait in line for like 30 min during weekends. But the wait is totally worth i

The place is so cute and as you walk up you smell the waffle!There is a line depending what time you go in the day but it is worth the wait. The matcha soft serve is really good and the waffle koi fish with the picky and chocolate sticks just hit the spot right after  a nice dinner.

Wow, I really enjoyed the soft-serve!! You can absolutely taste the matcha. The hype is real. The darker matcha is defffffff the way to go. The hojicha was actually sweeter than I thought it'd be tho.

We came here to get a drink because we were waiting for daeho to call us.  There was a line of about 10 people but it went by pretty quickly. I wasn't too sure what to order, so ended up getting a cheese matcha drink, I should have stuck with a warm matcha because it was so cold outside.  The cheese matcha drink was pretty good and not sweet.  My friend ordered the gold plated matcha cone,  the gold was great for IG but not for eating because it made the texture a little weird. I will be back to try their warm matcha drinks.

I first tried this place in Honolulu, it's super! Sooo gooood. This time I tried the one with gold. Taste? Actually you don't feel that much since it somehow melts into the ice cream. Try it definitely!

Lines long, but service is prompt and great! As for the matcha it is dark & not as sweet as some other places, making the matcha taste much more prominent. Personally loved the sweetness level and bitterness.  Other family members preferred it sweeter. Honestly would love if the hoijicha could be a little bit creamier, still refreshing and strong tasting though!

So it was a nice warm day at the cherry blossom festival this year and after 2 hours of walking with my brother and friends, the thirst started to creep in. Cotton mouthed, we decided to look for a spot with some nice refreshing drinks.We went inside the shopping plaza and noticed this shop just across the bookstore had a huuuge line! Figured it must be good; my party didn't want to wait but I said shoot I'll wait, I wanna try this out!I got the matcha latte while I was in line. There was a worker that took orders on a tablet for people in line who were ready to order. This drink, I kid you not is the utter definition of a 5/5. It was so good: not too sweet, strong matcha flavors and most importantly very refreshing. I was expecting to wait 30 to an hour in line but thanks to the employee with the tablet I got my drink really quick (less than 10 minutes)! I want to go back to Jtown just to get it again but I live across the bay, maybe sometime soon I'll make a trip back. I can't wait!

Everything about the Matcha Cafe is super amazing, and I just came here with my friends with me for the ordering of the Japan Center in SF, and I ordered a Medium Maiko Matcha Special, and it was super good for the ice cream, and my friends ordered a Kokuto Hojicha Cream Large, and Soft Ice Cream (Mix), because it was super everything matcha. I love this place so much, because it has everything about matcha place!

Cute little neighborhood creperie. There was only 1 person who did everything, but he was efficient. I got a giant croissant, which had powdered sugar and slivered almonds, along with a mocha. I saw they have Mexican chocolate so they made it with that at my request, and it was pretty good. There are fancier brunch restaurants in the city for the same price point, but I guess the bigger servings make the difference.
This is an extremely sweet wonderful place. I've lived in glen park for 4 years and for whatever reason I never stopped by. I really really regret not wondering in here earlier.

NOT dog friendly. This location is listed as a dog friendly, and even though there was a small poodle in the cafe, my black and tan 50 lb mix was turned away with the owner saying sorry we can't allow dogs. Even though there was a dog. And no one else but the people with the dog and me. Rude.

I! LOVE! THIS! RESTAURANT!!!!!Higher ground coffee house is one of my favorite breakfast food restaurants! It is so delicious! I definitely recommend coming to this place. Everything from the potatoes to the omlets are delicious. I also love the neighborhood that it is in. The atmosphere is lovely and I love the food soooooooooo much! Xoxo  Mimi Kuo
Great omelette. Cool laid back vibe. Definitely a nice pace if you want to feel like you're escaping the city, I went with the Florentine today. I'll definitely be coming back!!

I highly recommend going to this place. The people there are all very friendly and the atmosphere is very light hearted. This place is a one man show, taking orders in the front, making food in the open kitchen and keeping up the coffee. The (presumable) owner runs the shop on his own, so the food does take a bit of time. The customers did not seem to mind though, all of them seeming to be understanding. If you're in a rush, this place is not for you. I ordered to go, getting a bacon, egg and cheese bagel, and it was very good. The cheese was gooey and melted all over inside of the egg. The bacon bits were plentiful enough that each bite I took, there was always some in it. The bagel was toasted well and was a good vessel for the protein. All in all, a good experience and nice to see local shops doing very well. I would come back and get a sit down meal next time.

This place serves the best savory crepes I have ever had in San Francisco! I liked the variety of crepes available. They were super fresh and warm. Very filling too, so make sure to come in with an empty stomach!The area was super cozy and decorated.The only bad part about this place is not being able to find a seat. I was lucky to find an empty seat in between two groups of people who sat at the table when I came in and were still pretty much there by the time I left. I'm assuming they were there for at least 1 - 1.5 hours because there were no dishes on the table when I first arrived and left.. This place is worth it even if I have to sit outside on the curb near the pigeons!I do plan to come back some day in the future!

A complete gem of a place. Was staying at an Airbnb nearby and grabbed a lox bagel and crepe. It was lovely and we managed to snag a seat outside. Couldn't say no to a hot chocolate - it was all truly delicious.
The coffee house is a cozy neighborhood space among a lovely village-like ambiance.  Order the Mexican hot chocolate as an afternoon reprieve!
This is a cozy place to go alone or meet a friend. The coffee is flavorful and the pastries fresh and good. The location is convenient near the Glen Park BART station.

Great place! Came in with my 3 friends for a bite, after a night of abusing our poor bodies with too much wine. I ordered the Italian crepe, which came with a side of potatoes and a mixed green salad. Ordered a delicious frothy latte as well. The crepe was delish. Crispy along the sides, hot and gooey center. The zucchini was sliced thin and definitely tasted sauted. The whole meal was good. Felt like a neighborhood gem - which it most certainly seems to be. F or Sunday brunch, it was the perfect spot. Close little tables, but didn't feel too crowded, very quaint. Excellent! Will be back again.

When I lived here for 6 months 22 years ago, this was my favorite breakfast joint. Just checked it out again this past Sunday since I was somewhat in the neighborhood (well, I was really near the Haight for yoga, but since I live in Pleasanton, that's close enough). Everything is freshly made to order with great ingredients, and yummy combinations. The omelettes are good, but their crepes are what set them apart. Good strong coffee too; tasted like a strong dark Italian roast. It's a small dining room, no more than 12' x 12' and it gets crowded, but I've never NOT gotten a table (though truth be told, I would eat while sitting on the sidewalk curb in front of the store if I had to). Have faith- place your order and by the time your food is ready something should open up. Warning: cash only!!!

This small coffee shop near glen park is adorable and comfy. There was one man who made our orders, so everything was fresh and made on the spot, which was a small touch I liked. My friend ordered the Croissant French Toast ($12.75) which is the most popular dish on yelp and I was NOT disappointed. It was amazingggg 10/10!! I've never had a croissant French toast and was glad this was my first. I ordered the Chicken Delight Crepe ($14.75) which was ok, the chicken and spinach was good, but crepe was just average: 8/10. Overall, the dishes are on the pricier side, but I think the French Toast was worth it.

This is the place to grab coffee and breakfast in the city. Authentic Italian approach to omelettes and coffee, the French toast wasn't bad at all either. Service was quick and friendly if a little rushed (it's a quaint hole in the wall ... so that's exactly what you want!) Prices were reasonable for intown and more then reasonable given the quantity of food!  A visit here will add an at home first-hand touch to what life in SF should be and would be if you lived here!

This is my husband and my favorite neighborhood eatery for breskfast.  We enjoy the relaxed atmosphere and the intimate setting. The coffee is great and the food is yummy.  I love the "greens" that have a light dressing homemade by the owner who is usually behind the counter preparing your meal.  Family owned and operated.  They accept CASH ONLY, so be prepared.

Clean, cozy, warm and friendly service. Come in here and turn off your cel phone and take in the history of this authentic place. You come in all stressed from the daily grind and leave a calmer and kinder person. Love the food and yes, I ate it all!
First time here. Won't be last. Small but nice little place. Omelet was good. Coffee was good. Staff were friendly. I'm glad I visited.

Awkward line out front, and free for all. You go in and order, no table? You I still go in and order, now this is where you get aggressive and make sure that if one is freed up you get your table.The guy at the till could give two sh*ts about you and service, order your food, wait!Now the food isn't that great, I won't be back. It's ok and expensive and CASH only, did you hear that IRS? CASH only, and it's inconvenient.Now, I know I'm a redhead but, maybe because I am, they discriminated against me! I'm kidding, everyone gets the same bad service but people reviewing cause they're gay or Hispanic really need to stop the victim act, the service doesn't exist and it's totally forgettable.

This place is all I need whenever I can't stand the ever so present toxic masculinity and capitalism of San Francisco. Higher Grounds is that safe haven where I can feel safe, and dream that communism is finally the norm. Even the horrid service and rude attitude from the staff makes me feel like I'm finally in that Venezuelan paradise Bernie Sanders promised us. Yes, I said it first Yelp, this is definitely the special spot Bernie would go to if he lived nearby. Every customer here is so unique: amazing tattoos, fabulous mustaches, most creative fashion - with the occasional Marina girl in leggings who somehow got lost here - yes my friends, Higher Grounds is where you need to go to get your fix of uniqueness and eclecticism! Now about the food. Well. It's average. But getting to finally sit down to enjoy your mediocre brunch is what it's all about: Higher Grounds figured out the best way to generate chaos and destruction amongst "hangry" patrons. They have no waiting list system and you first need to get in, order your grub from a confusing set of black boards, and then go outside again and wait for one of the very few tables to free up. Everyone else outside is already waiting to sit down and eat. You'll feel the primal instinct of mankind, sorry I meant peoplekind, coming through the dirty looks other people will give you. Good luck fellows! Finally: cash only my dear comrades...
Very transition place to have brunch. The food is tense and special. It's worthy to take the whole morning to seat by the woody table.

Love this place.  The coffee is fantastic, the pastries all home-made early each morning.  You must try the frittata and the Mochi muffins.  Amazing.  I find the staff very friendly and polite.  I don't know where those comments about people being unfriendly come from as I go here every single morning and am greeted with a big smile.  The young man who bakes the pastries comes to greet me each morning as well.  Great place!
Friendly staff, quick and efficient service, good food, always has a nice feeling to the place. Definitely recommend.

This coffee shop is located below Cloudflare. I came here with my colleague during a normal weekday & after lunch time to get our doze of caffeine fix. I ordered a cafe latte and the line wasn't too long at that time. The shop wasn't too crowded and there were several available tables. It is a good place to chill, chat and get work done. The price for the beverages were pretty average and somewhat the price you would get in SF. I would definitely come back again to try out other coffee beverages.

So far, I have been to this place once. I love this place! I had their coffee and banana bread. The banana bread was sweet and moist. It was perfect with the coffee. Welcome to the bay, Cafe Lambretta!

Cafe Lambretta has been part of my morning routine ever since it opened. It's really evolved over the last year and I think Michael (the manager) takes feedback to heart and is constantly improving the space and the menu. But also can't fault them for liking and making their coffee their way.

Solid food. Great service. Easy vibes. I freelance at the company above the cafe every few months and really appreciate this cafe, its owner and employees. When I use to get wine working past 5pm the baristas always hooked it up with full glasses and made sure I got the most out of their delicious happy hour. It's a nice place to meet with coworkers or do an hour of work away from the desk.

I don't know why they have so much attitude!!!!I got a drip coffee at 3:45 pm and the taste of it was bitter, it was burned or the coffee was sitting there fo a while. I had almost drank one third of it with pastries and then told them about it. They asked me if I have gotten the coffee long ago that since I bought it, the taste changed!!!!!!!!! The steam was still coming from my coffee, that is how still hot it was.Then they wanted to gave me a new one and the filled the new one the same amount that I had left from my first bad coffee. How rude!!!!!!!!!!!!So much attitude! The price of drinks are like luxury, so why attitude?!?!I don't know why every time that we go here, its like baristas are annoyed at us!

Awesome coffee, great food, real people. Definitely not a corporate chain like the Blue Bottle Starbucks lot. They make the best cappuccino in the city. Banana bread will have you begging for more. Vintage scooter collection is super cool too!

Came in on 12/19Ordered breakfast sandwich, drip coffee, and matcha strawberry muffinSando- too much green onion, burnt bread, blanddddddddd. There was no seasoning to be seen here.Partner ordered tuna melt, same problem. Blandest thing in the world. (1/5 stars at best for prepared food)Coffee- pretty good drip. Not old or burnt tasting. Nothing special. (4/5)Muffin- really good. I love matcha so much, so this was heaven.Staff- acted like they had better things to do than to do their job. Vert short.I do not think I will be coming back. I can get lackluster coffee elsewhere and do not want to deal with employees who act that way.Plus food is not good.

This place is THE VIBE. No lames sitting around at their computers, no ballgame punks with backwards Giants hats waiting for their sandwiches, just sick scooters and sicker coffee. Shoutout to Hay(?) for that dope Mustafio -- I have no idea what she did but it was one of the best I've ever had. Nice pastries as well. Haven't been for lunch yet, but I don't really eat lunch, so....
Ok Coffee. Terrible service. I mean if you think your local coffee shop is bad and pretentious, this is worse. Really the worst kind of SF you can ever imagine. Really. Just. Tear-ih-bull

Mixed feelings about this place. The coffee is good. The vibe is almost comically hipster with the cute scooters, concrete floor and baristas that act annoyed that you're around. But apparently the owner legitimately loves Lambrettas & Italian culture, so the decorations are not a front.I wonder if the owner knows though, this building used to be a discount motorcycle supply store in a dodgy neighborhood. I bought my first helmet there back in the late 90s when I had a Moto Guzzi. The fact that it's a now a fancy pants cafe is so symbolic and gives me pangs of nostalgia.
To be fair, the coffee at Lambretta is good but the over-the-top hipster snobbery should deter any person of sense from patronizing this patronizing cafe.

Five years ago - the last time I regularly frequented this neighborhood - it was something of a specialty coffee desert, with few decent speciality coffee options, and there was a furniture shop at this location. Things are a little better now - there are a handful of quality coffee places - and this is one of the best. The coffee here is at least good as, if not slightly better than Blue Bottle. My usual is a cappuccino, and here they strike a great balance between everything you're looking for in a cup - dark/milky, sweet/bitter. This is an attractive spot for a great cup of coffee and if you're in the area you should definitely drop in.

The worst.. Native San Franciscans...beware.  This is what you are talking about when you complain about Your City.  I'm from The Bay and have lived here long enough to know that these bad cafes with the hipster ridiculous in full flight marks the dead end of what makes the City great.  Make The City Great Again and don't come here unless you are into seeing the Transplant Sheepeople at their hippest and hypest.
Love this place! Great coffee, good selection of pastries! I highly recommend coming here for a quick lunch and/or happy hour! The line usually moves fast and there's ample space to sit.
I visit here from Tokyo Japan. Very good espresso and food!~ banana mochi muffin is very nice. Thank you!

Undrinkable latte. Bitter and sour. Weirdo almond milk, does anyone like this chemically flavored crap?Music too loud and concrete floors reflect the sound making it almost impossible to have a meeting here. Midget sized seating for the malnourished and stunted. Too cool for itself, or at least for me. Won't be back, even thought the two wheeled old timer carcasses are nice.
Love the artistic Italian scooters!!  The food and staff are superb.  I wife and I will keep coming back every time we visit the city

Cafe Lambretta is a convenient place close to AT&T Park. My dad and I stopped by on our way to the A's-Giants game and were surprised to find that the restaurant was only half-full. We both ordered sandwiches and they came out in good time. I personally recommend the hot pastrami, by the way.It's a short walk from AT&T Park and a great spot for relaxing with friends or by yourself.

Love this neighbourhood and how it feels real and not like how SF city has become - where everything is overpriced and urgh. Taraval is a great area - good food, affordable prices and this cafe is awesome.Love how it has healthy options, and yummy desserts and the coffee is great, affordable and service is good too! $4-ish for a large soy cap, wow!! I love it!!!Am coming back for sure
Top notch espresso, Great customer service (Sebastian)that quad espresso had me on cloud nine.I love this place........

I came here on an Saturday morning, very calm atmosphere and friendly staff. I ordered the everything bagel with turkey and iced coffee. The bagel itself is delicious, not sure who their vendor is but they are a great texture and very fresh! The combination of lettuce, tomato, turkey, cheese, and egg really hits the spot! I live a nice walk up the hill to Antigua and will definitely be back to try more of their lattes and teas! Thank you guys for a yummy Saturday breakfast sandwich!
I had their breakfast bagel and a hazelnut latte. Their prices are pretty reasonable for the area, plenty of seating space for working. Staff was nice.

I have to admit I'm not a coffee drinker. I come here for their teas :) I love how they have a variety, my favorite is their green tea hot / cold always great!Lastly, their wait time could range from 3-4 minutes depends on how busy they are. They have lovely music playing in the background.

Antigua is the best coffee and breakfast cafe in the neighborhood by far! Alejandra is THE BEST! She is a superstar in Antigua! I go here every weekend for breakfast and order the lox bagel and breakfast burrito with bacon for my girlfriend. We look forward to it every week and it never disappoints. I brought my mother here three weeks ago when she visited, and she loved it! That's how awesome this place is. See you next weekend!

This coffee shop is very much a welcoming, family owned establishment.  The service is great, the food is yummy and their chai is good.  I keep coming back here because I love the breakfast bagel I get.  Yum yum!!

Antigua coffee shop is the perfect place to make a quick stop if you are waiting for the L car. I've gotten a couple of items here, my three favorite being the iced vanilla latte with almond milk, mocha Frappuccino, and the breakfast burrito. The iced vanilla latte was perfect since I went on a pretty hot day. It was extremely fresh and cold. The flavor was strong. The only downside, which happens to all coffee, is that with the amount of ice they put in, the coffee became very watered down. The Frappuccino was mediocre, nothing special. It was extremely heavy and rich and the chocolate flavor just overpowered the taste. I was not able to finish it and I just froze it at home. The breakfast burrito is build your own. It comes piping hot with your choice of bacon, acacias do, etc. If you want a more healthier option, you can request it in a spinach wrap instead of corn tortilla.

I gave Antigua numerous chances since I live close by. Time and time again it has disappointed with mediocre coffee that varies heavily based on which of the 9 ladies make it. Never seen a smile from any of the workers, which is a worthwhile statement as I've been here many times due to proximity. The food is terrible after trying about 8 different dishes, super low quality sausage and bacon, over done eggs.The last straw was my mistake of ordering a pork "panini", which they forgot and I had to ask about, receiving it after my wife was finished eating. The menu description began "our slow roasted pork bla bla bla". Let me more accurately describe the sandwich - "Cold store bought pulled pork in deli Italian roll with Sirracha mayo". The pork was dry pulled pork, not slow cooked pork (big difference), came cold and not to mention completely not a panini with no grill marks. That's like saying we have a hot dogs and then serves you up a cold corn dog, wtf. I know there aren't many great breakfast/coffee joints in SSF, but never again.

So caffeine and I don't get along, but I love the taste of coffee so often go for decaf drip or americano options. Antigua's decaf americano is one of the best-tasting coffees I've had in a long time -- rich and smooth and full of flavor. At the risk of sounding pretentious, it really has a lot of dimension that's further highlighted by a little cream but doesn't need any sweetener to balance things out. Rarely do I daydream about the coffee I want, but this is definitely one of the few. Hopefully their caffeinated options are just as delectable :)Their breakfast burrito and bagel sandwiches are fabulous too.

Antigua is a nice little coffee shop on Taraval. And while it's a coffee shop, there are some nice breakfast items you can get too! So coffee is plentiful and prepared well. You'll definitely get some smooth and flavorful coffees here. Breakfast burritos are quite nice here too! Everyone here is so welcoming and kind and you'll just get all sorts of feel good. So yeah, sweet and simple. Good coffee and people.

The "girl with the bangs" provided excellent service to me and my daughters and the latte, cappuccino, and coffee we had were all in point. Best foam in my cappuccino!!Very sweet little local cafe. Beautifully decorated nice menu.I wouldn't put a lot of stock into the (IMHO very personal) one-starred review. Someone was obviously having a bad day and it wasn't the barrista. If your order wasn't up to par, or they got something wrong, let them know in person, I mean, what are they supposed to do over the phone anyway? Mistakes happen. Support local small business. (Possibly) women- owned too!
The coffee was pretty good.The sweets selection was a little small, so we went down the street to Shark Teeth with our coffees.

This is one of the best coffees i've ever tasted. I got the Iced White Mocha and it was incredible. It is a cute little coffee shop and the prices are great, $3.15 for a large iced drink. Will definitely come back here. There isn't a lot of seating because the space is so small.

I enjoy smaller coffee houses because it offers variety in a world filled with huge giants like SB and Peets. It's important to support small business owners and give em' a try. They take pride in what they do and their shop is quaint and cute. I've been coming here since they took over from what used to be Brown Owl since I went there once I didn't return which might be why they are no longer there. Now Antigua, it's run by a nice family.This IS the best place to get a substantial breakfast on the go. Filling and tasty, only $6.50; a fair price for a breakfast delight. They have what you want when it comes to a Cafe. Wifi, smoothies, bagels, hot & cold coffees.
Cute little shop with amazing breakfast sandwiches that are loaded up with cream cheese and veggies along with great drip coffee, all at a decent price.

Veggie sandwich was delicious with feesh veggies. My daughter had a bacon, egg, cheese croissant which she said "so good". Had the house blend coffee which was just as good and bought a bag to take home.

Came here on a Saturday morning and it wasn't crazy busy. The ladies working here were very nice. They have a long coffee and tea list and a separate list for food and cold drinks. They prepped the drinks quickly and everything was very tasty. I ordinal had the chai tea latte. It wasn't overly sweet and it had a nice kick to it (delicious spices). Would come back in a heart beat.

It was my first time going there today as I live a couple blocks from there but was very skeptical trying it based on recent reviews. It seems cozy and a nice cozy neighborhood cafe. The girl working today seemed nice enough. Wouldn't say she was pretty friendly but she didn't seem rude either. I got vegetarian bagel and their cream cheese tasted very basic but okay. Coffee is definitely very good

I have been staying with a friend nearby and found this coffee shop. It's been a great spot to come for smoothies and breakfast - both the burrito and the bagels were delicious. The baristas have always been friendly and the service quick. Great place!

I love Manny's. Food and coffee are actually pretty affordable, and it's good. I love the events they have often, and it's nice to have the spot activated and lively. I had the shakshuka and it was lovely and probably far better for me than my normal lunches.

We went to Manny's because we always walk by and wanted some breakfast. We ordered coffee, the yogurt bowl with fruit, a Frittata, and an Imperfect Bowl. It's a great breakfast option if you are looking for a unique place with healthy and filling food. We got our fair share of greens and fruits from eating here and it's got a great vibe as well. Customers who are eating sit towards the front of the place, near the cashier and if you are looking for a quiet place to do some reading or working, there are tables in the back for that. Their calendar is full of community events so it's a great place to grab a coffee and check out what they have coming up next. I wish San Francisco had more places like this.

70% of Americans work virtually at least one day per week. If you're one of those individuals, Manny's is not the work/study-friendly environment for which you're searching. They pride themselves on interpersonal connection and an environment that supports this concept, but are not inclusive to those solo patrons seeking a productive workspace. Their laptop policy requires customers with laptops to work in the back of the shop, which is termed the "event space," which is a recent change in their policy (previously, it was no laptops allowed on weekends only). Rushing in one morning around 8:10am hoping to prepare before a 9am meeting, I asked about the event space and was told it was closed for a private event. I assumed this would allow accommodation to work within the shop, especially since every table was open except for one, but this was an incorrect assumption. I was told no laptops were allowed in the building until the event space opened more than an hour later. Had the delivery been a bit more apologetic, as this was their deviation from their policy, I'd have understood. Sadly, the barista was unapologetic and brash. I truly wish I knew this before placing and paying for my order. If I can't have a safe and productive space to conduct my business, then I'd rather not contribute to this business.Manny's is in an incredible location and in a beautiful building. I wish their policies were welcoming to all, especially those whom wished to work in their space (particularly during weekday work hours).

Atrocious experience. 1-star. Manny - and the culture that he engenders at his establishment - is not just one that is bad at customer service - it goes beyond that: The way in which this place is run simply boggles the mind. Today, I showed up to do write a book report. For this I need a laptop, and a book. I ordered something. I sat down. Not too long afterwards, Manny approached me to tell me that there was a "policy of not allowing laptops after 6". Now this is his shop, and he can do whatever he likes, but why have such an asinine policy that makes no sense? He went on to tell the 8 or so other people quietly working, reading, watching, talking on their laptops that they had 15 minutes to shut down their laptops. Sure enough, everyone including myself did so, and when I looked back, the place had just become barren. Now it wasn't like he was saying "this space is reserved for people eating dinner", which is what a restaurant would say. He wasn't even saying don't read! He was saying you could not read _on a laptop_. This strikes me as extremely ideologically motivated. It's one thing to tell restaurant goers that the establishment is just for food. It's another to tell coffee-shop goers minding their own business that they cant read from their laptop. What about reading from an iPad? Kindle? Paper? Post-it? Those types of ideologically motivated rules make it clear that Manny puts idiotically motivated ideological premises ahead of customer service 101. Manny's, you have lost a customer - as well as the couple next to me who complained of the very same thing.

We stumbled upon this place while walking around the Mission and it was such a nice surprise!The brunch was great and the services amazing.There is a back room we're you can sit and read books or be on your laptop which is also pretty! Highly recommend!

I'd been meaning to come here for a few months when a friend suggested we meet here for tea and catching up. Was really pleased by how spacious it was -- it's rare to find an indie coffeeshop where you feel you can just ... *be* ... for some time, without feeling like you're just occupying a table.Hoping they have debate viewing parties in the coming month / year. Will definitely be back for those.

The speaker list here is wild! It's really impressive how there's something interesting there almost every night. I got added to the listserv and feel like i'll be there on at least a monthly basis. So far I've only had a beer there but I'm sure I'll start getting some of the food too. It looks interesting.
Love the Halloumi salad! A fabulous blend of textures and flavors!Love the space of Manny's! The staff are super friendly and welcoming.

Books & coffee in an open space. Nice to have inexpensive beer (Tecate $2). Service is slow & barista was a bit unresponsive last couple visits (i.e. when I mentioned light on ice, I got handed a whole cup of ice and few drops of coffee mixed in). So service can be more warm and welcoming. Otherwise, nice addition to the neighborhood, ty Manny!

Who knew this spacious spot on the corner of 16th and Valencia was swirling in political controversy? Apparently owner Manny Yekutiel has been the subject of weekly protests over allegations of Zionism. Frankly I find the notion of political protest and point-counterpoint arguments rather refreshing because it's a 3,000 square foot venue for left-leaning activism with a full calendar of community events. Or you can just hangout and have lunch like I did in the bar cafe section upfront. Laptoppers abound here, but I managed to find s small table surrounded by s lot of vibrant local art (photo: bit.ly/2JdEN46).There were only four items on their lunch menu and there was a decided Middle Eastern twist to them. I ordered the $11 Cauliflower Salad, which was quite a diverse, colorful plate of harissa-roasted, turmeric-pickled cauliflower florets drizzled with tarragon green goddess dressing and mixed with tomato, cucumber, pickled onions, pepitas, and a lentil quinoa grain blend (photo: bit.ly/2Jep58D). To go with it, I had a bowl of the $6 Farming Hope Soup of the Day, which turned out to be a bountiful, lighter-than-expected minestrone (photo: bit.ly/2ITeuk4). Maybe I should spend more time getting my political consciousness raised.FOOD - 4 stars...Middle Eastern flair in healthy local fareAMBIANCE - 4 stars...true community hangout with a more relaxed vibe for the politically unawareSERVICE - 3 stars...a tad befuddled TOTAL - 4 stars...nice change-of-pace with a higher purpose in the MissionRELATED - Milling about in the Mission? Here's a collection of places I've visited and reviewed: bit.ly/2NHtst6

Went in for the first time to work on homework with a friend with no knowledge of anything about this bar/cafe. Kindly asked the bartender (tall guy with flashy clothes, colorful dreads and lots of piercings) if we could sit at a table that said reserved. He was EXTREMELY rude and responded, "I mean there are dirty glasses on the table so obviously not." Proceeded to read the napkin holders that said "no laptops on the table." So my friend suggested that we just clarify that with the bartender. I was hesitant but I asked him and he started raising his voice with me. I didn't want to cause a scene but there are nice ways to express rules. I am not one to write bad yelp reviews because I know it hurts businesses but I have never been verbally assaulted the way I was here. Will never return because there are so many good bars and cafes in the city. I work in the service industry at a bar and I would never treat a paying customer like that. (We would've bought a drink before we left if we weren't yelled at and verbally assaulted)

Manny's is the best place on Valencia to hang out, meet with friends, new business associates or do some work on your screenplay. The snacks are tasty, but might not sufficient to replace a meal. I like the almond toast! I highly recommend checking out the schedule of events. Manny is well connected in politics and often brings interesting people in for Q&A or round table discussions.

Wow wow wow - DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESS- I went there to do school work for an online course and am told - after paying and logging into their WiFi that I have to close my laptop - The owner starts name calling me, repeating that I'm "privileged" to think a coffee shop is a place to do school work... it's 1:30 in the afternoon, that's what a coffee shop is for many students. The owner is an arrogant unapologetic man.

Really great event space and excellent team here. The vibe is chic, modern, and relaxed. Fantastic place to chill and get coffee/food and to participate in one of the civic discourses/events happening here on the regular. Shout out to Manny who has created a space for community here, on a variety of different levels.

In absolute love/awe with this place.  They blend food and coffee with ethics and morals.  Food is locally sourced and made through a culinary training program to provide on the job experience for those that need it.  They also have a pay it forward program for anyone wanting free coffee...just make a donation with a purchase and it's placed in to a fund to provide.  I love that this place does all of that!!!   Oh. And the coffee was great too!

Very hip and social cafe in the Mission! They offer both coffee and draft beer, with an array of food options. They're run by Farming Hope, a local nonprofit which provides transitional employment to low-income citizens in our community. There's an adorable selection of books for sale to the back. The reason they are getting less than five stars is their laptops-use policy. It seems all well and good; an attempt to get people to look up and socialize in real life. But sometimes you just need a cafe where you can work and have a beer. Space to sit and use the laptop is limited, an often full. I will consider Stanza before coming here again.
Great chill spot to hang out and have some drinks with friends. I love their coffee and hummus.

Great social justice-oriented cafe with a huge event space. The cafe section: run by local nonprofit Farming Hope, and the food is delicious, fresh, and ultra affordable for SF. Just had a huge fresh veggie bowl, with beets, spinach, and tons of protein from an egg, lentils, and quinoa, for $8. What!?There's a little bookstore nook operated by a local independent bookseller and a giant space in the back where you can lounge and work during the day and attend panels and talks in the evening. Everyone from groups of local teachers to 2020 presidential candidates comes through. This is the kind of space the Mission needs.
Update - the WiFi is now limited to windows of time. Its is not super fun when you get booted out for an event. Still a good spot, but it's no longer what I am looking for.

Comfy space, solid curated food and drink selection, interesting concept. Socially conscious. Great date spot, great work spot. Lovely addition to the neighborhood. Sad that they're mired in absurd local conflict and hope it doesn't drag them down... Keep it up, Manny's! :)

Great coffee. I come here at least twice a week. i really like the menu and choices of dark roast, medium roast, and of course the ice coffee options.I have never had a bad experience here. The coffee and service is top notch. The lines can get crazy but here is a tip, get the app and pre order online and just walk up and pick up your coffee.

I walked into this Philz Coffee as I have many times before. This time, to purchase 1LB of Ether ground coffee to take home with me. The cashier kindly offered to grab me a bag and grind it to my liking, and charged me for the coffee. I paid, and left. When I received my Square receipt in my email, I noticed an almost $4 tip that was charged in addition to my purchase of coffee which I did not leave. The cashier didn't even swing the tablet for me to sign so I couldn't have accidentally hit this myself. It's really disappointing and frankly, I was going to let it go but it really pissed me off. I was already long gone and back to my office when I noticed, and didn't bother walking back -- plus it ends up making me look like a jerk -- "I didn't tip you". How awkward. I'll be reporting this fraudulent activity to my bank. Please be careful and make sure to always sign for yourself when using the Square system. It's unfortunate even nice baristas at a great coffee shop will go out of their way to steal from you.

I went during peak hours, which will usually takes around 5 min for them to take your order and around another 5-7 min for them to make your beverage. This was a very pleasant visit, the barista (I forgot their name but they were slim with glasses and short hair) who took my order and made my drink was very professional, kind, and the soy mint mojito that they made was the best soy mint mojito I've had in a long time!!

By far the most hectic coffee shop in the area. The line is usually long so I recommend mobile ordering ahead. They actually have a very organized system for mobile ordering where orders are placed on the top shelf until they're 5m or so past their pickup time, then they get moved down a tier and sorted alphabetically. They'll even put your drinks in a tray if you've got multiple ones under your name.The service here is usually friendly, you can tell the group is bonded together because sometimes they're a little less professional than the other Philz I've been to, laughing and having side conversations before calling up the next customer. My other gripe about this place is the inconsistency, the worst Mint Mojito's I've ever had are from this place. It seems like every barista makes it differently and the worst variation is at this shop. I'm not sure if it's because it's so busy that they're all rushing to service customers, but I usually prefer Blue Bottle up the street if I have my choice.

Got a free drink, but that ain't why I'm writing this gotta give the homie Sailor (sp? Hope that's how you spell it) a shout out for being super cool and for making my day. In the city everyone is rude and smug all day like it's the thing to be. It's refreshing when someone is chill and treats you like a human being, especially in service industry . So thank you sailor for doing that and being on that positivity hype.

Excellent coffee and customer service. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. POUR OVER ONLY. Decaf options available with cream and sugar custom options of light, medium, and heavy. Cool, casual atmosphere with gender neutral restrooms.

Mint Mojito Iced Coffee Large $5.60: I feel very lucky in that I don't feel I need coffee to function, so I just treat myself now and then when I just want it for the taste. I'd go broke very quickly if I drank this on a daily basis. I don't usually like mint too much but it works for me here. It adds a nice refreshing aspect to the coffee. The barista encourages you to try it once it's done, presumably so they can fix it if needed, but I've never had a problem. I usually get this or the Gingersnap depending on what I'm in the mood for. *****My Star Ratings: 1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry. 2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return. 3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to. 4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already. 5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.
Just yes. I am from Chicago.. But every time I come to san fran I NEED PHILZ! So delicious!

I don't usually do reviews. But I create an account just to say that this place makes amazing coffee. I've been satisfied ever my first time here a few days ago and the price isn't bad considering you're in the city. Also a very nice place to do work (except peak hours which are usually noon). I appreciate the hip-hop music being played. Another main reason why I like coming here :-)

Went here because Emma chamberlain raves about it and she knows what's she's talking about! The coffee kept me going the whole day as I was out and about in the city and they have some yummy food items too (I recommend the avocado toast and the banana bread was good too). If your looking for a coffee place that will fuel you all day head over to Philz!

Friendly staff. Enjoyed a mint mojito and it was made just right. I don't go to Philz often but whenever I'm in SF, I try to stop by. There's a lot of coffee shops in San Francisco, but Philz has an app now to do mobile ordering for those mornings where you don't want to wait in long lines.

Honestly , this place should put some other coffee shops out of business. I'm not sure how Starbucks or Peet's can survive in the vicinity of Philz. This is real excellent coffee. Perfect beans. Perfectly roasted. And then brewed individually for you after you order. Perfectly. Fresh. Never pre made. Now if you like to add all sorts of stuff to your hot, caffeinated beverage and you don't really drink coffee for the taste, or you don't have the experienced tastebuds that come with being a 3rd generation coffee snob and you can't  differentiate some of the best things tastewise that coffee can offer, then you may not appreciate this place. But if you have a discerning palate and appreciate the finer things in life (read coffee) then you will come to love this place after the first delicious sip. Enjoy.
This has been mine and my spouse's favourite cafe in USA. have tried most of the flavors and we have liked them all. Most favorite is Tantalizing Turkish.
good people and good coffee. anyone giving under 5 stars probably is also that guy who stands up as soon as the plane lands.

Ordered the Mint Mojito iced, sweet and creamy. It's my to go drink at Philz as with most people. Baristas are very nice and friendly. There's a decent amount of seats indoor and outdoor. Outdoor was a bit cold but on the rare occasion on a nice day in SF, it's a good spot next to the Embarcadero to meet up with friends or chill here.

Good service and nice employee and delicious and all employee and kindly employee and best Michelle and Roy and kindly employee and make very delicious and happy new year and Kevin too and kindly and kindness and so nicely employee at Philz coffee and all employee happy new year too
Great coffee and it was empty yesterday which is always a plus! The space is so nicely lit and open, feels very sf and friendly !!

As someone based in NYC, I always look forward to the next time I can go to Philz and grab their amazing drinks. This location is crowded but the lines move pretty fast. If no tables are open inside, there's a lot of empty tables outside to do work at when the weather is nice.

Ordered a silken splendor and was told to put my own milk/sugar in the drink, granted they don't have any soy milk out for the customer to add to their drinks. Pretty much was told to do the barista's job even after insisting a couple times it's the barista's job to make the complete drink, milk and all. Definitely not returning to this location.

OMG I absolutely love Philz Coffee. Currently sitting here enjoying my cup of Hot Chocolate.. It's so cold outside, with every sip of my perfectly sweetened drink my body warms up!!! The crew here at Front St.. have great customer service and good vibes.  The free WiFi makes for perfect streaming of Rick and Morty while sitting in this calm, cool and quiet atmosphere... I'm sitting here with a gentleman whom I just met!! Philz not only provided a great cup of HC I now have met a new friend!!!! Thanks Philz!!!!! I prefer Philz over Starbucks and Peets anyway!!!!!  I work on Market and 1st and right next door is a Starbucks. I happily passed it up in the rain and quickly came across the street to Philz!!!! Rain, sleet or snow could Not keep me from Philz...
Service is noooooo good. I just come in a little earlier ro pick up my order. And the guy said you  need to came back later. You can not stay here. No world...
Super friendly staff with flexible menu- nondairy options! Also, big cups worth the price. Cute interior. Open early enough to grab coffee before work.

This is one of our favorite neighborhood coffee shops. The owners are super nice and remember their frequent customers. We are usually there in the morning for a cup of brewed coffee (in pump carafes) and toasted bagels.  They make specialty coffees, too. The outside seating is perfect for our dogs as they longingly watch us eat our bagels and beg for a morsel or two.  And, yes they get a treat! There is spacious room inside if you prefer to eat indoors, too.

Based on my first trip I am happy to come back!I only got the ham Vietnamese sandwich but it was exceptional! Why?Because it was after 2pm when most bread for inexpensive sandwiches has gone a bit hard - this sandwich was great!! Fresh as morningtime bahn mi in Chinatown Looking forward to trying the coffee drinks. I'd love to give this sweet cafe 5 stars after I discover that the coffee is exceptional too :)
Now that's a great Vietnamese sandwich! Friendly staff. Quiet and spacious environment. Thank you! See you soon.

Local secret! I don't live in the city but visit often, and went to Ilana one morning with a friend who recommended it. I got the Vietnamese iced coffee and a raspberry crunch muffin, which was warmed up. The coffee was absolutely perfect (no need to add milk or sugar) and the muffin was DIVINE. Straight up fresh raspberries baked into the muffin. So the next time I found myself in the Richmond area in the morning, I came back and got the same thing, plus the bread pudding, which I heard good reviews about. That was also exceptionally delicious. I adore places like this that are so unassuming from the outside, but such a goldmine when you try it. I'll always come back when I'm in the area!!!

This review is only for the bahn mi sandwich, taken to-go. Probably the tastiest bahn mi I've found in SF, and I've tried a lot. I generally get the vegetarian and the chicken. The lady who makes it is so sweet, too. The best deal for a sandwich in our neighborhood.

good sanwhich, i had the steam pork with pate. the bread was toasted with a nice crunch on the outside while soft on the inside, seem to be a good and new bread. the pork cake was nice and seem to be fresh too, the pate was just okay. over all it was a good breakfast.
Love this place, always is clean, and the personal is nice they always welcome you with a wide smile, i like the food and the pastries.
Best bread pudding everScrumptious sandwiches Coffee is aceVery polite and cheerful staff Restroom is super clean Mahalo ilana coffee you guys rock

Super friendly, clean, very affordable delish food from bagels to Banh mi to muffins & cookies! Free wifi and outlets at tables make this a special find!Prices lower than most other cafes...local regulars give it a warm friendly neighborhood feel.I come often!

This is a great little cafe. I came here because I read the reviews about their bahn mi sandwiches and was not disappointed. They were crunchy, flavorful and filling. I also tried their green salad and it was kind of basic but still pretty good. I had a Vietnamese coffee and it was good but I wish they had not put so much ice in it because the goodness was over too fast. Overall, I do not have any complaints about the food. The best thing about this cafe aside from the great bahn mi sandwiches was the relative affordability of everything. The service was fast and friendly too. They have wifi which is really good. In total, I would say this is one of my new favorite cafes in the City.

I've been hanging out at this cafe for quite a while. I don't usually write a review, but I feel like to write something this morning.The ban mie is definitely the best, mostly I get the bbq pork one. The baguette is very well toasted, crunchy on the outside soft and bit chewy inside. The pork is very tasty with the carrot pickle and cilantro along with extra jal apenos. Sometimes I have the croissant egg and cheese for breakfast. The toasted croissant is soft and flaky, combined with melted cheese on the egg is the perfect breakfast. The coffee is great as well, strong not watery. Overall reasonable price with great quality food. And the owner and the girls were very nice and friendly.

ilana's Cafe is not your average basic cafe as though it seems. ilana's is run by a married couple and they are honestly the sweetest. The staff that helps​ them behind the counter are just as nice. What I love about ilana's is how quick and convenient they make your food. This cute cafe has your basic cafe foods, drinks, ​and delicacies as any other cafe HOWEVER, taste so darn good. Plus, they also have cheap Vietnamese sandwiches ranging to about $4-6! The food here overall is cheap and so good. I always get the vegetarian sandwich over wheat bread -- one layer of mayo, one layer of mustard, lettuce, tomato, avocado, alfalfa sprouts, and provolone cheese, Sounds simple yeah? But I promise you it is SO fresh and good. I like to get an Iced Vietnamese coffee on the side. Their Viet coffee is so strong with a good amount of sweetness....so if you need to wake up, I​ assure you this will haha. ilana's never fails to impress me and I can always count on them for a yummy, convenient, and quickly made order :))
One of my fave places for banh mi. My go-to is combination w/ extra pate. Soooo good!! And it's inexpensive too. Definitely one of the best spots to get a banh mi in the city.

Such a nice, sort-of-hidden gem! I've been coming here quite frequently after I discovered it. They're opened really early in the morning, and it makes for a nice study/coffee shop. It's pretty quiet, but guests come and go very frequently. I order the combination Vietnamese sandwich (yes, for breakfast)! This is one of the few places I've found in San Francisco that offer authentic Vietnamese sandwiches at an affordable price! And they're not slacking on their meat, either! They also have many other breakfast and lunch options, and they have a variety of coffees and teas. There's usually no problem with finding a seat. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. Oh, and there are outlets too! Service is always great when I go. Food and coffee come out so quickly. Will definitely continue to come here!

Hey, nobody likes girls in spandex more than I do, but I wasn't about to stand in line for half an hour at Home, the trendy cafe that was my original destination.So we wandered a block or two to Ilana's. No line, no wait, just a clean cafe where a tea, latte, and muffin costs $5.65. Take that, $8 avocado toast hipsters!

Unpretentious well-priced food and drinks. Has a mixture of indoor and outdoor seating for casual eating and food comes out relatively fast for to-go orders. Patrons all seem like regulars. Sad to be moving away and hope to see it thrive
Love to stop for a coffee break while walking the dog. Great coffee and am very fond of the pork Vietnamese sandwiches.
Great place to stop , the coffee was excellent and the breakfast sandwich delicious, one of the places that I need to visit whenever I'm the neighborhood

Delicious tea, not the friendliest service.Wandered in on my birthday weekend on a visit to Everlane. It's such a great location, near Pica Pica and other local businesses. I was so excited to have found a lovely tea shop on my way-- you know, one of those perfect surprises that make a great day even better.The shop itself is tiny, aesthetically pleasing and had a lot to choose from on the menu that sounded great.I settled on an oat milk matcha latte with a little honey for sweetness. It was heavenly. My husband isn't a matcha guy, or an oat milk guy, but he kept stealing sips of my drink.Only 4/5 for service though. Staff was efficient, but not friendly. I felt like it was one of those places where I had to warm up our cashier into 'liking' us, before they were genuinely pleasant. Not something I like to do when I'm the one patronizing a business.But all in all, we will still come back next time we are in the area for the amazing matcha latte.
Best tea in town. Recommend their chai-it's incredible. You can get it in loose leave to make at home or have them make it for you.
Why tf is there hentai wallpaper in the restroom?! More appropriate for a sex shop than a tea place. Chai I ordered was oversteeped and bitter, the milk was scalded, and it was $5.25.

I got the matcha boba tea and although the matcha was very good the boba was too chewy. It kept getting stuck on my teeth and eventually I couldn't finish them. Boba should be soft and little chewy but this was little too much .. next time I will get just the tea without the boba. Oh and did I mention it was over $6 for the boba tea? So not worth it ..
Hands down the BEST masala chai I've ever had!! Love the concept, love the decor, love the service!! I'm so addicted, I ordered their chai online: samovartea.com

This place is hippppp y'allllllll. I wasn't sure if I was going to coolness poisoning upon entering, however, I survived and was won over by the experience. Their chai, which brews away in huge cauldrons near the reg, is fantastic. Truly fantastic... Not to mention the totally awesome spoon they scoop it with. Get it with whole milk, take a seat on the multi-level seating structure and enjoy life.

I had a matcha latte when I was here last with almond milk and a tiny bit of honey and it was the best thing ... It was earthy, dark, and made really well in that I didn't choke on any matcha clumps! I don't know if I'm sensitive to caffeine (not usually), but this definitely kept me up a bit longer than expected. Kind of on the ~more expensive side~ for a tea, but it's definitely a treat I wouldn't mind rewarding myself to once in awhile. 11/10 would come back to try their other drinks!

After walking around the Mission on a cold day, we decided to check out this spot to get something to warm us up.The location is awesome, right on Valencia- around BART, shopping and great restaurants. I got a regular chai latte and my cousin got the drink that comes with turmeric. After growing up with these drinks they were much....spicer than I was use to. The turmeric one could have gone with just a dash less of the spice. On top of that, the milk had its skin on their and that definitely was not the most pleasant thing to drink when I was sipping. Just for the price and what it was I just left feeling meh about it. But definitely worth everyone going and giving it a try for themselves.

As someone who comes from a chai/tea loving family, I have to say this place does serve some pretty authentic masala chai. Loved the service, decor and the vibe of this place!Can't wait to come back and try some more things!

I'm addicted to their vegan chai. They brew it fresh every morning with whole spices and it boils away getting delicious. It's always nicely balanced - strong and not too sweet. Their toasts aren't bad too!

I should preface my review by saying I may not have ordered strategically on the menu to really give this place a solid rating. I was in a post-cold phase where I was coughing violently every few minutes and really just wanted something simple with a spicy/cinnamon flavor for my throat. I ordered an herbal Ocean of Wisdom tea, and here's where my preface is a little important. It's hard to expect a lot from herbal tea, but I was still hoping for at least a bit of a stronger flavor and not such a watered down tea. I also think $4 plus tax is slightly absurd for water and a tea bag. I will say though, I tried the masala chai that my friend got and while I was underwhelmed, it was more worth it for the price. Cool tea bar concept that I think they could easily take to the next level with some more thought!
I love their matcha bowls - so clean and uplifting!After yoga I like to come here and get my chill on.Worth the 5 dolla.

(Rating 4.5/5) I was looking for a place to study / do work for a few hours after work near 16th st BART station, and this was the only spot that 1) stays open past 6PM, 2) accepts card, and 3) has free WiFi. The cafe is on the smaller side but I had no problem finding space for a gf and I around 6:15PM on a Wednesday. Samovar has an extensive tea and pastry selection which was perfect since neither of us wanted more caffeine. I would definitely come back to Samovar as a place to catch up with friends or read (we both liked the background music!), but not to do work as they don't really have tables to place laptops on.
I love tea and it's been hard to find a place that just cater to tea and not coffee. This is like tea heaven!! They have so many selections and they t

I may or may not be addicted to their Cacao tea. It tastes like thin mint Girl Scout cookies in a cup, I swear. For a tea lover, this is the spot.
