They have a wide selection, smells amazing inside because they are constantly brewing their famous chai tea. Definitely recommend trying the chai too!I've gotten food here a few times - the "to go" breakfast in a mason jar are quite good. I like the salmon and eggs. They also have gluten free bread for their toast and it is quite yummy.

I found myself walking in the Mission during a windy day with a light drizzle. So I ducked in to grab a hot cup of tea to join me on my walk and was hit with this gorgeous aroma of chai that I couldn't ignore. It was intoxicating to say the least.Turns out they have two huge copper cauldrons of prepared chai tea (one vegan with almondmilk) that they constantly brew and stir. If you're a lover of chai tea like I am this is one of those places that requires a visit. It's got to be in my top 3 of all time that I have ever tasted. It's not cheap, but it's well worth it on occasion.The location is unfortunately the size of a shoebox with barely any seating, so this is more of a grab and go place for me. I'd for sure come back for another chai tea if I'm in the area.

Met a friend here recently for tea. The space is a bit small. Was quite busy yet many patrons were taking their drinks to go. I ordered an Ocean of Wisdom which was an herbal blend of Rooibos w/ chai spices. It was solid. I feel Timeless in the East Bay probably does a better herbal drink yet this was solid.My friend enjoyed her Spearmint Sage drink. I think this spot would be a good place to try their chai or connoisseurs of green tea.Probably one of the better spots to enjoy a cup of tea in San Francisco.
Strong matcha boba, high-quality tea, the boba is rubbery, cool shop, prices are high unsurprisingly 8/10 ($6)

Walking into Samovar was a relief from the rain pouring outside. I was in the mood to try some great matcha, and I've heard nothing but good things from Samovar. The location super convenient- located near 16th street BART, and lies in my neighborhood!AMBIANCE is beautiful- stone walls and accents with dark wood floors, and well lit due to windows at the main entrance. I wish there was a bit more space, but it fits the mood they're looking to achieve; it's more of a space for just enjoying the tea, not for lounging. ORDERED Shibumi matcha bowl ($7).DRINK was wonderful. I've had a lot of matcha these past few weeks, but it stands out here. The taste was not too pungent, especially toward the end, and the bowl was a nice touch. I was able to sit down, enjoy the taste, and take in the space. OVERALL a fresh four stars for Samovar. What a great experience to make up for a rainy day. Looking forward to making my way back.

This placed is a real gem.  I had the Golden milk Turmeric and it was a perfect balance of turmeric coconut and almond milk and raw sugar.  You could taste the fresh and spunk of n turmeric. I  also had one of their pastries and it was delicious.

This is just an amazing place.  Love the environment and all the various places to sit around the nursery after you buy your coffee (or for me, the Dandelion Mocha).  I am not a big coffee drinker, but this location is so unique, I would come back here just for a beautiful place to share a cup of coffee (hot or iced) or tea with a friend...looking forward to going back soon!Happy Eating!
Coffee was very good the atmosphere was fantastic, heated benches, surrounded by lush foliage. The Bearclaw was good but not worth $5.

Coffee shop and plant store in one spot? Count me in. I first stumbled into this place back in June. Having already patronized their café in the Mission District, Hayes Valley, Haight and Castro District, I knew I was bound to check out a new coffee spot.Ritual Coffee tucked away in the back corner inside Flora Grubb Gardens? It's a really wonderful idea. I like this concept.Of the items I have been here, my latte is always ready to retrieve within minutes of ordering. The service is excellent, orders are completed fast and the baristas are very friendly. This is good quality coffee crafted with care, of course it is finished artistically.If seeking to get a good cup of coffee anytime for any reason, then Ritual Coffee Roasters got you covered.
Beautiful setting, in Addn to amazing coffeeSetting = indoor outdoor nurseryInteresting folksEasy parking

I like Ritual's coffee but I think it is borderline criminal to charge eight dollars for a tea. I came to the gardens to check them out and grab a tea. Tea is just some leaves and hot water. It is usually priced equally to or cheaper than coffee drinks. The tea here is $8. Especially given this location's geography, it is a slap in the face to nearby residents and workers looking for a quick tea. There arent many other places around here to get a nice tea. Ritual: you can do better.

I went to Ritual when I went to check out Flora Grubb Gardens. Ritual is nestled in a corner of the nursery's store. Even tucked away like that, it seems to have a following. Considering the serene location, I imagine people find it to be a nice retreat. there is only a few bar stools in terms of seating, but you can take your coffee into the garden and sip among the succulents and other green things. I wasn't actually looking for something hot. I just wanted something refreshing.The Cherry Bomb hit the bill. It is NOT sweet. It is a fruity, refreshing jolt to the system that will wake you up and put a pep in your step. It's really pretty, too. It even comes with a cherry on top. After your of buying $5 coffee at Starbucks, I didn't bat at eye at the $6 price tag. They also have pretty good cookies too. A bought a nicely packaged bag of thumbprints for a gift. my Mom offered me one later that day,The cookies were just the right size to hold an entire mini peanut butter cup on top. They were a bit of crumbly of crumbly, buttery goodness. if you live strong coffee balance by serene settings and some good people watching try this little slice of awesomeness in Bayview.
A really cool place, with a nice vibe, good coffee, and some pretty fantastic cookies.
I love this place. Worth the price. The setting is nice, too - being able to sit in a garden and sip delicious cappuccino. The place in the Mission is also wonderful.
Great Vegan Pastries! And amazing location, feel like you are in nature in the middle of SF.

Buried in the Bayview's Flora Grubb Gardens this little coffee bar can fix you right up.Kinda hidden in this garden center Ritual serves up a decent cup of Java that can be enjoyed either inside or outside yet far from public view.
The location is really nice,looking around the succulents/plants was a plus but the coffee itself is okay.
Wonderful little new-missio....i mean Dogpatch spot.  Let's see how long it stays wonderful before the Crapple laptop legion invades and ruins it.

My wife and I stopped here since I had seen this on one of the weekly yelp articles. It is very nice to navigate through the plants and decorations of the nursery, and you can make your way to the back where the coffee shop is. My wife got her usual Americano and I got a pour over, which I can't remember what the beans were called. It was nice because they grind the beans for each cup but neither of the drinks were anything to rave about. Probably would not be back since it was out of the way to get here.
I just don't care for the coffee, the taste is bitter and it has a funny after-taste. Nice ambiance!

Strong coffee anyone?This place has coffee that will wake you up.I'm not a fan of super strong coffee but if you are this is your place.It's locally made, which is great since it's not mass produced and if you're a local they'll remember your drink.The service is nice, and maybe it'll be your "ritual" to come here often if you're a local.

A coffee shop located in an oasis like garden/plant shop. Seems a bit out of place and unexpected given the surrounding neighborhood but I'm sure it's a welcome addition to neighbors and perhaps a sign of changing times (gentrification). The garden offers many places to sit and sip your coffee. Great weather in this part of the city.

Nestled in the back of a lovely plant store, this shop serves up deeelicious drip coffees from around the world. Their menu lists each coffee's flavor profile and country of origin, so you know ahead of time what you're getting and where's it's coming from. They are definitely expensive, but worth it on special occasions

Pretty nice coffeeTucked away in the back corner of a flower/plants store, this place is really easy to miss!But the coffee is good, like the other Ritual locations. Everything is made on order, which you can see due to their open kitchen layout.The service is excellent--wait times are fast. Even though there were a lot of space because it's tucked in a corner, the orders came out real fast so there was virtually no wait.There is a separate "room" area in the back where they have seats just for Ritual customers, kind of like a "backyard", which is nice.The only downside is when we asked for one of their tea items on their menu, they ran out, but it happens. Not their fault.Overall, definitely worth coming back whenever you are in the area!

I love this place...the coffee is in the back...so while you walk over to order, you get to admire all the beautiful plants, succulents and outdoor decor. The menu for coffee & teas is limited, as are the pastries...however, it was the best almond latte I've had. Please, please, please start to carry some vegan food options!! Then we will definitely be back!!

Visited since I'm new to area and would like to find a go to coffee shop. Ritual had great reviews so really looking forward to it. First, very unfriendly, any question was treated  like an imposition. I could understand if a lot of people waiting for service but I was only one there. So I left without buying. Came back next day, new person a little more friendly but no genuine smile. Ordered cappuccino and mushroom egg to go. Smallest cup ever and egg was cold said had no way to heat it up. Charge $15. An expensive and Very unsatisfying experience. Will not return.

You have to tip them otherwise you will get shitty coffee. The cashier and the baristas have their own jargon or gestures to figure out who tip and who doesn't. Usually when you paid the cashier greeting different way obviously so the barista can figure out.I tip but didn't tip at the beginning and when I was only familiar with starbucks. The coffee quality is totally different. What they do is put a lot of sweets or put grounded mint. It only happened every time I didn't tip. Never happened When I tip and you can see how the barista and cashier communicate when you pay for your coffee.  Kind of funny. It's located in front of my place so I go sometimes bit I feel like I got forced to tip to nor get bad coffee? Isn't this right Philz?

Marking 1 star because we ordered in front of 3 people and specified that the chamomile tea should NOT have mint due to severe allergy, but it ended up having mint.  It was clear that 2 people didn't really know what was in the chamomile tea when we asked.  Girl who took the order seemed like she was in training since she couldn't really remember what we ordered.  Guy #1 seemed experienced since he was able to tell us what was in it when we asked.  When our drinks were finished, we asked if the tea had mint and Guy #2 had said he forgot.  Then, Guy #3 quickly re-made the drink.  If someone is in training, better supervision should have been done.  How many people does it take?  Write it on the cup or something when you're taking the order to make sure you make the right drink.  We only ordered 2 very different small drinks, hot chocolate and chamomile tea with no mint.  Hot chocolate was odd like it was just water and a chocolate powder because it was so thin.  The egg and sausage breakfast sandwiches were good.  Speed was ok.  This would have been 3 stars if better care had been taken with the allergy because uou can semd someone to the hospital.

Excellent coffee! I recommend looking at the website before going as the counter menu does not contain some of their more fun specialty drinks like the mojito brew. Excellent options and incredible service. I wish they would open a store in my home town.

Well done Jabers!  It all started about 17 years ago on 24th Street in the Mission District of San Francisco when Phil Jaber started Philz Coffee. Three years later, Phil's Son, Jacob took over as the CEO and lead the efforts to expand. We San Franciscan managed to keep Philz a secret for years, but the cat got of the bag when in 2015 this family business got the funding it needed to go global. Philz coffee is "slow" coffee, so if you are on the run and need a cup in 30 seconds, this is not the right option for you! But if you are looking for a tasty, strong and kick ass cup of coffee made by friendly and smiling faces who make sure your cup is filled with drips of exotic brew, then we are talking!We all have our favorites when it comes to coffee, but I am dark roast kind of guy and I can tell you that all the dark roast options on Philz menu are delicious. You may decide one is better suited for a specific time of the day, but taste wise, two thumbs up!

I came to this location for a coffee meeting. The coffee is standardly delicious, you can't go wrong with Philz. The only issue we ran into was it was too cool to sit outside and there isn't much room for seating inside. On a warmer day it wouldn't have been an issue.

Love Philz! We went there 3 mornings in a row! Coffee is delicious and different - I had Tesora every day and husband had Jacobs Wonderbar and daughter had Iced Ecstatic. Their food items are also great - we had breakfast burritos. The servers were super nice and accommodating and patient with us as newbies full of questions. Cafe atmosphere was fun and welcoming. I hope Philz comes to my hometown!

I still don't understand why there's no Philz coffee in New York! The mojito coffee is absolutely a-mazing! If you're picky with your coffee and you'd like to a) customize your coffee to every single detail including type of sugar & milk WITHOUT any communication issue b) avoid time waiting in line Go get Philz app! It's a very user friendly app with easy and clear instructions. I LOVE my honey mojito latte, it's by far my favorite non-alcoholic drink in San Francisco. (tip: if you LOVE the smell of mint, you can ask your barista to add a leave or two to make the entire drink more flavorful)

Philz please come to New York :( the mocha tesora was excellent and rich, and I love how they customize your drink and ask for a sweetness level. No wonder it's the go to for my coworkers in sf! The chai was good too, although next time I'll ask for it a little thicker and less watery. I did walk in Thursday morning in February and did an abrupt about face - there was 10+ people in line! Better for an afternoon pick me up :)

I tried the iced coffee rose today (a new drink they are testing out) and it was very tasty! It's interesting because they blend the rose water into the cream. You can still adjust it for light cream and light sugar. It kind of tastes like a rose latte but not quite as it's not frothy. Overall would definitely order this again!

Guys, this place is busy busy busy in the mornings. Just accept it but don't let that long line deter you. It's right outside the temporary transbay bus station. Expect to wait. Inside is so cute and welcoming, with a bunch of stuff to look at from the artsy menu to the mouthwatering baked goods display. It took a while to place an order at the bar, even with three baristas working. But I got a Philtered Soul coffee and pumpkin chocolate loaf. Both were fabulous yummy choices. Loaf is on point, so delicious with the pumpkin notes coming through strong, and you definitely should choose to get it warmed up. Big enough for two or save the rest for a snack or next breakfast. I don't think I've ever sniffed my coffee so much before. They ask you how you want your coffee, sweet or not, cream or sugar, it's really personalized to your taste! Philtered Soul is a medium blend of chocolate and hazelnut and my new favorite cup of Joe. I want to try their mint mojito next... I've heard many many good things about it as a result of me just walking around with a Philz cup lol. Can't wait to go back and stand in line! I'm serious!
My favorite of the Philz locations. Beautiful, well-decorated space and the baristas are always joyful.

I love Philz!! It's been awhile since I've had Philz and I was glad I found one nearby work. It's a bit of a walk but worth it for some yummy coffee. Inside is similar to all Philz, super spacious and I loooove how it smells inside. All the employees I've interacted with have been super nice and welcoming. The environment is always great to be in! I used to always get the Mint Mojito (super basic, I know) but it is that good! I recently started getting the Esctatic and ALWAYS sweet and creamy! Sweet and creamy is the way to go!! When I had it again the other day, it reminded me how good Philz is. I've also tried the Tesora and that one is yummy too! I'm not a coffee snob but I enjoy a good coffee. I will most definitely be back to this location!

A pretty standard Philz chains. Their coffee and tea are great, but super pricey. This location in particular is a bit on the smaller side, with only 4 small tables (only 2-3 of which have outlets), and one large table. There's some outdoor seating as well.The order system at Philz has always confused me--it's entirely possible for two people to order the same thing, and because they don't go by name, someone else can easily grab your drink. I waited over 30 minutes for my drink, wasn't sure if it never got made or if someone took it. I had to lose my table (bummer) to go ask the barista about it, upon which it was quickly made.

The staff at this Philz is especially friendly! Other than that, this is a fairly normal Philz convenient to many workplaces in the area. The amount of space where you can camp out with a laptop is fairly limited though, which is a bummer. Be prepared to bump elbows with strangers.Note: there only one big table to work at apart from the smaller side tables. The height of this table is to accommodate handicapped folks, so keep this in mind if you're short. The table will probably be uncomfortably tall for you.

I live right by this spot and am consistently happy with the coffee / tea I buy from here.The service is almost always perfect and the ambiance is also pretty good (can be crowded M-F during peak hours).

It's one of the only coffee shops in the Rincon Hill area, and it's open on the weekends, when everything else seems to be dead in Rincon Hill. I had the Turkish delish tea, which was excellent, although very expensive at $3.70 for a small.  The area is nice, with a few long tables with outlets along the edges, and wifi was very fast for a coffee shop.  But the music was so loud, which made it hard to concentrate on work.  It'd be nice if they turned it down, given that much of the clientele seemed to be working on their laptops.
This cafe is great! The coffee is always good and the baristas are always friendly. It also happens to be right by my bus stop so whenever I have a few minutes to spare I'll run in to grab a drink.

Just like how most Starbucks chains are fairly similar, the same rings true for Philz. I was greeted with the same warm and welcoming customer service of the baristas. My barista was very helpful and informative when I had some questions about what coffee drink I should get. I absolutely love the mint mojito and it is usually my go-to at Philz, but on this particular day, I decided to try the mocha tesora and loved it! The mocha tesora is basically their tesora coffee with chocolate, its rich in chocolate flavor, not too sweet, and still has that coffee taste. Both the mint mojito and mocha tesora cost $4.50.I really like the space of this Philz, very room, lots of standing room and sitting options.

I am constantly under caffeinated and tired, and Philz (this one in particular) is my one true savior. Their blends are strong enough to carry me through the day. This location is perfect because it lines up with my commute, and I can slowly sip on my tesora as I am walking to work in the morning.I like being able to customize my drinks based on both creaminess and sweetness. Although I really like they gingersnap and mocha tesora, I tend to get regular tesora (creamy with almond milk and no sugar). Also, a little life hack: bring your own mug to pay for a small (plus, it keeps the temperature much better than one of their compostable ones). If you are in a rush, you can oder using their app ahead of time (often a life saver, but you can't use your own mug in this case).
Excellent Thai latte and the Bagel with tomato and cucumber was OUTSTANDING! My daughter is obsessed with Philz and now I see why.
Super cool little coffee/drink bar with great food! I had the chicken sandwich and it was amazing. Served with fresh salad topped with a fresh sweet vinaigrette.
four of us had a glass of wine before dinner down the streetvery nice place...happy hour prices couldn't be beatfriendly staffrecommended!
First time here and it is a nice coffee shop with friendly service and strict rules.  Laptops are welcomed but you have to use a small table.  Coffee is great and the patrons are friendly.
Terrible coffee, overpriced food and worst of all rude service. They might as well told me to go f**k myself, that would have been clearer.
Great coffee for decent prices. My usual is is a large latte sub almond milk and it's excellent! Bonus, they have reward card. Laptop use is limited to 2 hrs tho.

Hooray!   Found a new neighborhood place!  Cute place where the cable car turns a corner.  Extremely friendly staff.  We felt like true guests in their home.  We got salmon bagels and some drinks.  Fresh and good!  Will be going back here often.

I have a Sunday ritual of visiting a different coffee shop every weekend and enjoying an Americano and a good lunch. So I thought I'd start leaving reviews on these based on three criteria (5 being the best): Food, ambiance, and extras. You're probably wondering why I'm not grading on coffee? Well because I'm not an expert, but what I do know about is the above topics.  Food: 4They provided quite a vast selection of food options, from sandwiches, salads, baked goods, and small bits. All of which were made to order. I ended up having the chicken pesto sandwich that came with a salad. I do have to say it was satisfying, however, I feel like the chicken might have reheated, prepackaged meat and not sure if they made the pesto in house. The salad was just greens with a little bit of dressing. The soft ciabatta bread and cheese was what saved it for me. Again, overall satisfying, but which it was fresher ingredients. Ambiance: 4This shop is super cute and if you're looking for a neighborhood vibe, this is it. The shop had huge windows that let in a lot of light, which I loved! So I was sure to sit by the window on the bench that spans across the wall. Though there were cushions on the benches.. they were worn out and flat so wasn't the most comfortable. The staff was really nice and helpful when ordering and delivered my food to my table. The cafe is made even more charming with the trolly that rides by from time to time. It was pretty quiet despite the trolly, which is was surprising. Overall, very cute and welcoming cafe.Extras: 5So one of my pet peeves is when you go to a cafe and they have bad wifi, Nook had very strong wifi which was easy to connect. However, on the weekends, there's a 2-hour limit, which really wasn't an issue for me, since I only stayed that long. They also had a good amount of outlets to plug into against the wall which is nice to see. Parking wasn't too bad either, considering the location. I feel like anything past Van Ness, parking get's difficult, but I was able to find a spot just up the street. Luck? Maybe. Overall I really liked this shop and highly recommend checking it out. I went around noon and it wasn't super busy, so might be a good place to meet up with a friend for lunch or work on your laptop to get somethings done.

One of my absolute favorite cafes in the city! I always come here Sundays for a cafe day to get some work done. The ambiance is really calming and there's lots of light that comes through the windows. It's a really chill and low-key cafe, but that is what I love so much about it. Free wifi, plenty of outlets, and good coffee. It's normally just filled with people doing work or reading. It is family own, and the owners are so kind and nice. They never hurry you out, nor make you feel you've been there too long. I seriously love this place!
Omg I think I found my new favorite coffee shop. Open till 9 daily (later than a lot of places). Good coffee, outlets, cozy in the SF rain, seat cushions. Will be back :D
Beautiful place with an amazing view and great variety of drinks. A very and calm and peaceful place to hangout.

Great casual spot for a coffee, wine or light meal.  Friendly service, quiet and a great place to work on your laptop.  I had the vegetarian tamale pie, it was one of the best I'd ever had!  Check out this spot if in the area.

We came here for a coffee on a Thursday evening. It was a few minutes before their closing time, but they happily let us in and and the owners here were the nicest people that we have seen. I didn't wanted a beverage in our group, but the owners insisted on giving me a tea or coffee on the house. We had really nice conversations with them and had a good laugh. I wish we lived close by so we could stop by more often. Oh, and the drinks were also good.

I love this small caffe/wine bar! The new owners that took over about a year ago are lovely and the food is delicious. The nice lady at the counter noticed I was watching her make hummus so she gave me a very generous sample to take home and try.

Adorable cozy little nook in the heart of Russian Hill, with free WiFi and AMAZING bottles of wine - haven't had a bad one yet! I just got introduced to this sweet little place by a friend and am in love. The new owners, Rana and her husband, are often working behind the counter and are the sweetest people ever - I notice how they really look after their guests and treat them like family. It's a gem of a neighborhood corner spot. C you won't be disappointed. Also love it when the cable car zips around the corner! Quintessential San Francisco!

New owners and they are sweet! What a breath of fresh air. I have lived in this neighborhood for many moons and it is so refreshing to see the new owners here actually being at the cafe and meeting their community. I am sure the last owners were just fine and great (I have loved Nook a long time) but never once did they shake my hand and send me a hummus plate. I love their vibe and so happy to have them here!
The new owners are super friendly and have amazing food! Definitely get their pesto sandwich or pizza.
Hands down the best cafe in Nob Hill! Ever since they changed owners a year ago, this has been my go-to spot - also worth mentioning that I took a girl here for a first date and we're now married :)

The Nook is under new management so ignore all the negative reviews you see below. This is the first cafe in SF where they said "don't worry, this is your cafe" and didn't pressure me into buying anything. But, of course, I ended up getting a chicken pesto sandwich and pizza and it was fantastic. The new owners are extremely personable and I highly recommend stopping by just to have a chat and coffee with them.

One of the best Cafes in San Francisco. New ownership made the menu 10x better while keeping everything that was great about the space. It's a dream cafe to work from or people watch.I love reading here in the evenings. Great lighting, and calm atmosphere makes it feel like home. Visit Nook if you can, it's wonderful.
Cool cafe in San Francisco. Went there like 3 or 4 times already to get a cup of coffee and to get some work done! Plus the beagles are great!

This is a wonderful San Francisco cafe! It is a reliably comfortable and friendly place to relax while enjoying a cup of their consistently exceptional drip coffee (I hear the espresso drinks are good, too, but I'm a regular black coffee drinker, myself). The owners/operators are this cute and gregarious couple who take pride not only in brewing great coffee and making tasty sandwiches, but in being part of the community. They know most, if not all, of their regulars (and some semi-regulars) by name and order. This place is a classic neighborhood hub and often hosts local artists on its walls for sale. Most of the artist are quite good and I often find pieces that I would (and have) purchased. Go say Hi to Nel and Mel! You won't regret it.

We found this local cafe on the way to see the painted ladies and.. wow... such a great, quiet little local business that not only had great service and food, was friendly and  nice to relax in and enjoy a coffee. Make sure you come here and experience their amazing hospitality. A must!

A cute cafe tucked away from seemingly everything. It's the sort of place that if you lived within a block or two, you'd be over all the time. I got a latte and it was nothing special but it did the trick and for these sorts of spots, that's what you're going for. Frankly, if it was some super fancy latte (a la ritual, and that's not a knock on them) this place would be too crowded and it'd kill the vibe.

Such a great place if you're looking for a quick lunch stop. We were sight seeing in the area and stumbled upon it. Definitely recommend the Dutch crunch bread, it's delicious. A nice little local stop for sure.

Came in for a friend's art show. It's a quaint coffee shop with good food and coffee options - everything about it is a solid above-average experience, but not "wow I'm amazed." What sets them above is the owner -- or who I took to be the owner... maybe the manager? A charming British woman who obviously cares about community and service. I don't get out of my typical bubble of places enough anymore, but if I lived nearby, I'd be at this little cafe more often.
Very friendly staff and delicious coffee. Try their sun dried tomato cream cheese on a sesame bagel!
A great place for a delicious cup of coffee or hot chocolate. It is a fast walk from where I live and very friendly Staff.
Love this place -- favorite place to get a sandwich in the Hayes/Alamo Square Area. Owner is a really cool guy and the chicken pesto sandwich is delicious.

This has got to be the best cafe in the whole city. I brought my family we all enjoyed the drinks and food. Our personal favorites were the chicken pesto sandwich and the chai latte. The service is welcoming and the staff are nice. If I could rate it 20 stars I would!
It was wonderful cafe near the painted ladies. The staff guy was nice and coffee and muffin were soo great. I do recommend!!!
Nice place! Good sandwiches, but the price is a little high. Good customer service, the restroom could be better.  Good luck

Delicious Veggie sandwich!!!!I was here around 1:00pm on a Friday and it was not too busy but enough to have some chatter going on inside the cafe.A perfect spot to do some reading or work on your laptop.Or before you head over to Alamo Square Park to see the The Painted Ladies ;)
Cute place to go, near the alamo square and the painted ladies! Calm street and next to a vinyl shop!!Cute neighbourhood and gooood service and coffee for nothing $ :) Enjoy !!

Walked in for a small bite and some rest after a whole day of walking and sightseeing.. ordered the avocado toast but put a spin on it adding peanut butter. The man behind the counter (presumably the owner) was slightly taken aback by my request but seemed curious to give it a try.Turned out delicious!

I had the pleasure of having lunch at this awesome café today with some friends. Coffee, Ice Tea & sandwiches and they were all awesome plus the owners are some of the nicest people around! Give it try you won't be disappointed!
Went to see the painted ladies and was hungry for lunch! Stopped here and was super impressed! The chicken pesto sandwich is great, and the owners are super nice and know all their regulars!

First things first, Wow the sandwiches here are delicious! It's a small little cafe and it looked a bit sketchy and run down but don't let that fool you.. go inside and try out the sandwiches they have to offer. We got salmon avocado (4/5) and a chicken pesto (4.5/5) sandwiches. They say never judge a book by its cover and this place takes that saying to the top! The sandwiches are on steroids! They are quite large and filling. My friend ordered the zebra mocha and she said it tasted more like a hot chocolate. Run down place but great sandwiches for a quick bite.

New owners are great! Friendly and professional. Good music, clean, great coffee. Feels so homey as soon as you walk in, the place is very welcoming and you feel right at home. We'll definitely be back when we are in town next.

I just popped in for a bite and to charge my phone, I was nervous because the place is a little rough inside. I asked to have a turkey blt(not on the menu, but a combo of two items). He obliged and was really friendly. He rang me up for my sandwich and a drink, totaling $14. I was a little surprised thinking the price was a bit high(sandwiches $9.45), but when he brought the sandwich out I was seriously impressed-- it was really large and super well done. The bread was awesome too! Great spot to pop into it you're by Alamo square.

Wow, the owner of this cafe has a really bad attitude. I placed an order on Seamless and when I arrived, he went on a rant about how the old owners set up Seamless and he "wants nothing to do with it". Apparently there was a change in ownership 3 months ago and the new owner doesn't want to take online orders. The problem is that Seamless and GrubHub still accept orders from here, and he refused to contact the sites to remove his business. He said "it's not my responsibility", told me to call them, and then made me pay a second time.I understand the situation is not his fault, but as a business owners keeping the SAME BUSINESS NAME, it's your responsibility to cover all aspects of the business, including systems that old owners left behind. I really wanted to support this local cafe but it's not worth it the debate.
Morning due is great! I think it's family owned; if not it sure feels like one! Also, I've never had to wait for a table which is clutch so close to Castro.

We really enjoyed our lunch at Morning Due Cafe. We had a standard breakfast and pancakes and the Beyond Burger (Vegan - Plant based) and both were great. It's a really nice vibe inside with ample indoor and outdoor sidewalk tables too. Everyone was incredibly friendly and welcoming as well. Now that we know about this place we'll definitely come back too! Highly recommended!

Love Morning Due! Such sweet, accommodating staff and great, classic brunch food. I usually get a convoluted custom omelette with feta and chorizo. So good and the gluten free bread really seals it. The coffee is great, ambiance inside and out is very cozy.In general the vibe is welcoming and rare to have a place in San Francisco that is unpretentious and semi affordable for breakfast staples. Highly recommended!

What a lovely find! We decided to find lunch around Dolores Park and stumbled upon this wonderful cafe. We ordered the Mediterranean wrap and turkey club both with salads and there was more food than we could eat! Fair prices, delicious food and lovely conversations with the cashier (possibly owner?) Looking forward to returning!

The food is good and it was delivered quickly, so thank you! My issue is the plastic containers and unnecessary plastic utensils and napkin wrapped in plastic! Gah!There are so many better options that are compostable. Also, when delivering to a residence, no cutlery is necessary. Anyway, rant done. I just feel guilty "recycling" 4 huge plastic containers for 1 meal!
Cute, local feel.  Personable staff!  Loved the cashier, server, maybe the owner I got to talk to. Loved the experience and the conversation.  Definitely have to stop here!

I will be brutally honest. The food is bland, mediocre and uninspired at best.  I started coming here because Chow closed.  Chow was my go to when I was hungry and didn't want to wait an hour for weekend brunch.  I've been here a few times now and the food is consistently disappointing.  The food is just plain sad and tasteless. They don't use any seasoning.  No amount of black pepper, hot sauce and ketchup can save the food. You dont leave this place feeling good...and not even really satisfied. The 2nd star is really only for the fact they are friendly, there is no wait, and the decent cafe vibe. Chow wasn't great, but definitely a lot better.  I dont think I'll be coming back. Sorry, I tried to like this place.

Such a wonderful breakfast Saturday morning!!! We came for breakfast because we were in the area.  The place is cozy with a warm vibe. We had EXCELLENT service.  Make your own omelette and potatoes were soooo good! Hope we can come back.

I was here visiting with a couple of friends, and this was a great stop. The service was great and so was all the food we ordered. They even went out of there way to set up a table outside in the sun for us. Next time i'm here again I will definitely be coming back.

Really like this cafe! I had the bacon,avocado,cheddar avocado omelette and my friend had the chicken and bacon omelette. Everything was tasty and I like how they make their omelettes. I will deff be coming back! **The bonus about going to this cafe is that it seems like it is family operated and they're really nice:) Also it's conveniently located next to Delores park.

When I went here, it was rather late at night and there were a lot of open tables. The meal I selected was the veggie wrap which was surprisingly good and full filling. I really liked the different flavors and the tastes. It was my first time here and I loved all the different options on the menu. I also liked how you just walk in, place your order, find a table and they bring out the food to you. The reason for 4 stars is that I am not in a hurry to go back and try more things from them right away. If I am in the area and mostly everything is closed, I would visit them or if I am craving something different on their menu which I am curious to try other things as well.
Great food, great service. Potatoes are the best!! Cheap big mimosas/overall well priced food
Cute little cafe with friendly staff. We randomly wandered in and got a seat right away. Food was ok and they have pitchers of mimosas which gets you pretty far in my book lol

We had the most lovely afternoon at Morning Due! Soup tastes like it came from grandmas kitchen, latte is one of my favorites in the city and the salad was so fresh and delicious ! The staff is always so kind. We are going back very soon!
Had a lovely lunch - amazing salad and lattes! We sat outside in the sun! Great service!  Can't wait to go back!
Upgrading my review to 5 stars. I always stop here for breakfast when I am in the Castro from Minnesota. Good food friendly staff and s relaxed atmosphere make it a good place to come back to.
Absolutely delicious!! Best breakfast I have had in a long time. Next time I make a trip to SF I'll make it a priority to come here. Amazing!

Dutch Benedict:1. Taste was mediocre at best and something was hard and crunchy in it ..2. Breakfast potatoes were literally soft unflavored potatoes..Scramble:1. Bread was soggy (you can't package bread in the same container has other heated food..) 2. Avocado was bad and severely spotted with the stem still in it ..3. Scramble itself unappetizing at best.Pros: Price was reasonable *food was delivered so obviously have to have lowered expectations but flavor was really the biggest letdown. Hopefully one off ?

I used to enjoy eating here-no more.  I resent having to pay a surcharge on credit card sales.  I feel the business should absorb this-it's part of the cost of doing business.  Having a tiny sign posted, lost in the crowd of other posted signs, does not count as notification to me.  When I balked, I was greeted with attitude.  After all, they told me last time I was there.  Since I eat out nearly every nite, I didn't remember and I didn't see the tiny sign.  My book club and I will choose a different place to meet in two months.  I think there are new owners here-perhaps a family operation.  By the way-no complaint on the food.  But making a customer feel welcomed goes a long way with me.
Great place to walk to from the Haight-Ashbury neighborhood. The service was excellent and food was good too.

this is stellar work, the cinnamon toast is divinely sweet and tasty. their chai was dank and wasn't diluted by the oat milk. will say customer service isn't supremely impressive but it's a tiny place, get in and get out and you're good

No thank you. I can't understand why the coffee here is the same or similarly priced to other cafes in the city. It is obviously of lower quality and roasted dark to hide the lack of quality. I have had better coffee at 3am in a diner in the middle of nowhere. The decor looks like all of the items were purchased at the same garage sale. Cute, in an "I think I'm cool" sort of way. The toast is basic af. Butter & cinnamon sugar for $5?! Anyone that is willing to pay that much for a slice of bread is insane. Same goes for the coconuts. Open your own or buy the juice in a can and save serious $$$ without having to endure the vitriol from a self-loathing employee

Well what a first impression of a place that wasRecommend to me an my fiancé by a friend, it was definitely a horrible experience for the simple fact that the employees are extremely rude ...I hadOrdered 3 drinks an only got 2 of them and afterTelling him I ordered 3 not 2 he didn't even apologize for his mistake and expected me to pay again for something he didn't pay attention too ... it is a really cute spot which is why I was taking pictures an the employee rudely said I couldn't take pictures ...over all I'm disappointed over the horrible attitudes these employees have just for that I wouldn't come back ..horrible customer service!

Nice little coffee shop in outer sunset. Limited selection of pastries (they run out) but overall good choices and a broad array of coffee drinks. Service was pretty slow, but it's like a no-rush California spot.A few spaces to sit inside, but looks like most folks take away and parking is a challenge in that neighborhood.
Best coffee in San Fransisco period. Love this place down to earth people. I love their espresso and toast.

That cinnamon toast though!!! We stopped by for the first time on a Saturday morning for coffee and toast.  I was surprised to find that there was a line out the door and the place is TINY!  There was room for about 5 people to sit inside.  We waited about 10 minutes to order and then were lucky enough to find two seats at the bar.I ordered a drip coffee which was nice and strong and then we shared cinnamon toast and the peanut butter/banana/honey toast. The cinnamon toast was delicious and I would order that one again.  The peanut butter toast was pretty good but the honey made it pretty soupy and messy.  If it weren't for the cinnamon toast, I likely would have given this place 3 stars but the toast set it apart to me.

Solid coffee! Really good coffee, rich in flavor and depth, with just enough of cream/milk. Also tried the cinnamon sugar toast which is....BOMB! So good. I would come back whenever I can go get this. It's like buttery sweetness rolled into one. The avocado toast is also pretty good but tad basic for me. Overall great coffee place. The only thing is it's small, very small, and lines can be long and cramped while waiting in the doorway. Line means relatively fast so probably still worth waiting in line. Love what this place is producing.

The staff sucks.  They act like you are bothering them.  I work nearby and love the coffee but several times I've gone in there and the baristas are having a conversation and they don't even acknowledge that I'm standing right in front of them trying to give them my business and pay for their overpriced coffee.  Today I went in and they looked at me and continued talking. I just walked out.  I get they want a certain punk rock vibe but learn to some customer service. Some of the people that have worked there a long time a great but all the new kids they have working there suck and make me want to never go back. It's a shame.

** I just wanna dove into a poopFiled with their leant butter + banana cinnamon toast**Finally made it here after .. idk .. 3 years that I've had it bookmarked. The cafe is definitely Small with a boutique vibe, & some indoor seating (maybe 4-5 on the bar). Trouble has decent coffee (somewhat bold, chicory undertones , gave me a good DINER coffee vibe).Truly people come here for the toast - yes TOAST which is honestly pricey ($7+)  but soo dang good !- cinnamon toast was their first endeavor but they have other options ...-'avocado toast (if you'reCraving savory)- my personal fave: peanut butter honey with bananas - omg this kept my full until 2pm . The toast was thick and dripping with honey. Jesus this was everything Yes - you can make this at home - but sometimes you want the simple things to be perfect :-)

Great hole in the wall coffee shop. Jasper served me and he is AWESOME. Super friendly, super helpful, great convo, really good dude. Thank you Jasper for the undertow with Honey. You nailed it. Cool little spot for quick coffee. The inside is very small, but the service and atmosphere is 10/10.
Don't get bent out of shape! I can't tell you who but someone is doing a doc about this place! Embrace it! Enjoy it! Think "The Weiner's Circle" - fucking goldmine.

I've been coming here for many years as a final pit stop along my bicycle and motorcycle rides before heading home and the service it seems has been declining with each visit. It's easy to forgive standing at the counter for several minutes before someone on the other end acknowledges you exist, but the last time I visited, the shop was closed up at 5pm on a Sunday and there was a "be back in five" sign up so I waited, and waited, and waited. As I waited several would-be patrons join me there and then leave me there. After ten minutes the staff shows up and slowly begins to set things up on there end with the doors remaining locked and not so much of an acknowledgement of my presence. When you're on a long bike ride, it doesn't serve you to idle for long while your heart rate drops to resting rate. After feeling like an idiot for waiting another ten minutes I realized this is no longer worth it and decided to grab a bite next door at the Thai restaurant instead. In conclusion the espresso drinks they make are not worth waiting for like you're the last thing in the world that matters to the business, the most dominant flavor in their beans is actually "burnt", and it's actually not hard to make a piece of toast with 1500 calories worth of sugar, salt, and saturated fat slathered over it taste good. Who knows if I'll ever be back...

This place is pretty shitty all around. The coffee is usually burnt. The person making the toast is also handling cash from patrons with their bare hands without washing. The staff has also been unacceptably rude. I'm a pretty patient person and I haven't dropped in here in a rush, only when I had plenty of time. I've been here at least a dozen times before, but after what happened today, I will never go back. I ordered toast and waited for longer than a half hour with no warning, not because they were too busy, but because no one was working the toaster for the 20 minutes after I ordered. I needed to get going and politely asked if I could have a refund. Even though they hadn't even started my toast yet, the cashier intentionally tried to embarrass us by announcing to the entire coffee shop that everyone would be delayed because of us. It only took 30 seconds to grab $5 in cash out of their wallet and hand it to us. We weren't being rude, we weren't being pushy, we just didn't want to wait any longer in a stuffy, loud coffee shop instead of spending the beautiful afternoon out on the beach. This place didn't use to suck but it does now, and how much it sucks feels intentional. Go to Andytown if you want good coffee or prefer to interact with decent human beings.

I came awhile ago for the cinnamon toast (which wasn't anything out of the ordinary), and the cashier handled cash and touched my toast without washing his hands. Gross, but I didn't really want to say anything. On top of that, their baristas and customer service in general just give off a crappy vibe. They act like all customers are coffee connoisseurs and will roll their eyes at you otherwise. That was my first and last time there. Basically, just go to Ballast or Andytown nearby.

I'd been here once before, loved the cinnamon toast, didn't mind being ignored by the sulky but quiet barista. I was with two friends and didn't really mind. I wanted to go again to get another piece of toast, so I suggested meeting a first date here this afternoon. The experience was so bad it made ashamed for the city of San Francisco. I kept hoping a tourist will never experience the incredible rudeness of the barista. He ignored us for a few minutes when we got there, sitting at the counter, and he was just wiping the counters. When he finally asked what I wanted, as I ordered "a decaf....." he barked that they didn't have decaf and snarled at me. He didn't offer another suggestion (I know they have tea). Then my date ordered toast. We were four chairs down from the corner where the Square pad is. The barista looked back at us and said, "If you want to pay you gotta come here." So my date got up, walked three stools, and paid. I went outside to look for water, and when I came in, my date was exiting the bathroom in the back. The guy shouted, "Hey! You can't go in there! I'll get in big trouble! Like, you could get me fired!" I shot back, "There's no sign, there's nothing that says customers aren't welcome." "YOU COULD HAVE ASKED IF WE HAD A BATHROOM!" I replied to his back that shaming customers is never good for business. All the while, some kind of acid punk rock was playing so loudly we couldn't talk. I'll never go back and I'll be sure anyone I know won't either. I live in the city and am incredibly proud to always support local businesses. Not this one.
Best earl grey tea latte I have ever had (called the girlfriend). Get the cinnamon sugar toast it is amazing! Great little coffee shop highly recommend.
When I'm in the neighborhood I always get a latte at Trouble. So delicious! They really know coffee!

Horrible staff. I just came in on the phone and told my gf to wait while I ordered. Just saying that, the woman working here told me I had to take my call outside. Keep in mind:1) the place is literally empty. no customers.2) it's raining outside. hard.3) they're playing punk rock music at 1000db, so there's so much noise already, my talking couldn't possibly make any differenceThis place sucks. Completely. What a horrible bunch of people. Go anywhere else. Andytown down the street has better coffee, a nicer space, and nicer people. Outerlands is also better in every conceivable way.

The people who work here are so unbelievably rude and full of themselves. I came in talking to my gf on my phone and told her to wait a second to talk as I wouldn't be able to hear her. The barista tells me, "please take your calls outside." They are playing punk music at earsplitting volume, the place is empty, and it's raining outside. These people are godawful.

Went here for the first time and order a cappuccino! First of all service was  ! There was no " Hi, can I help you" or even a damn smile! The lady who hand me that cappuccino didn't even smile! It was like I was bothering them ordering a cappuccino! Top of that I tip $1 which cost $5 was a terrible cappuccino I ever had! Definitely will stick to Starbucks or my two favorite place!

Traveling to San Francisco on Memorial Day's  weekend we stopped by this boba tea shop on a recommendation of my boyfriend's friend. As we entered the place it was very clean with modern touch and a huge menu. I ordered Matcha green tea and the boyfriend ordered Earl Grey milk tea. My Matcha Green Tea was made with whisk green tea and milk not from those green tea powder drinks that was made at other tea shop therefore it was excellent!! My boyfriend's Earl grey tea was made with Hong Kong style tea and condensed milk it was good as well. The tea was delicious  but the boba was a bit hard after it has been soak in the ice a while

Boba Guys has become a major boba chain now. There's one in every major neighborhood of SF. Hopefully that means their lines will be more spread out and manageable. I was happy to stop by this one because I was in the area and was super thirsty. Their drinks hit the spot!

I was so excited to try this place out and was easily dissatisfied. The matcha green tea was just ok. Nothing special. The boba balls are what bothered me most. They all stuck together making it nearly impossible to drink my drink. I did not enjoy.

Wow. Just wow. I got the strawberry matcha latte and it was so delicious. Perfect level of sweetness and not too much ice. The matcha flavor was rich and strawberry complemented it well. I also appreciate that oat milk is an option. I got mine with almond jelly and it's definitely a new favorite. My bobarista was also really nice and suggested wonderful drinks. Very instagram worthy aesthetic and will definitely be returning when I can!

Admittedly, I had been avoiding the strawberry matcha latte since I've discovered Boba Guys thinking the strawberry puree would just be too sweet.Oops.I can definitively say I've definitely been missing out now! I was surprised at how well the strawberry puree complemented the matcha. Using oat milk also gave the drink a nice thick, creamy undertone. Definitely competes with my default matcha latte with almond pudding which is consistently good. My old favorite, Muscat Oolong, has unfortunately been wildly inconsistent as of late depending on which location I go to.Speaking of location though, this Boba Guys is centrally located on Divisadero but I'm surprised it doesn't have later hours! Still, it's nice to have yet another location to get a sweet drink!

Boba Guys has become well-known throughout the Bay Area ever since people started posting their drinks on IG. However, I've heard mixed reviews about Boba Guys in regards to their actual beverages and boba. Their menu is pretty simple and they pride themselves on having the best boba along with using Straus Family organic milk. My friend really likes their Jasmine Green Milk Tea so thats exactly what I ordered.// BOBA // Jasmine Green: Green milk tea made with Tea People jasmine green tea blend. Floral and silky, best with Straus Family organic milk. I honestly did not care for the actual boba which is a huge component of the drink. It didn't have the chew that I love and the drink itself did not stand out at all. Unfortunately, I did not care for Boba Guys. The boba was below par and the milk tea itself did not stand out in comparison to the countless other boba spots.

Quick and friendly service! Great bubble tea just like all the other locations. The boba is especially good, much better than any other bubble tea I have ever had. Wish they had it in Toronto ! It's around 5-6 dollars for a regular size drink. Tried the strawberry matcha, it was very unique and I'm glad I tried it once. However, my go to would be the plain matcha.

Decent boba guys quality as usual. I'm always a fan! Best part about this location is the fast service (at least on the 2 occasions I've come). I've almost never had to wait more than 1 minute. Soo if you want a quick stop and fast service, this location is for you. Pro-tip: on a sunny day, I highly recommend taking the boba guys with you and enjoying it out in Alamo Square Park!

With so much diversity in the Bay Area,  it is a given that there will be multiple boba shops opened throughout the bay. However, my all-time favorite boba place has to be boba guys. For fruity drinks, the taste is fresh and is filled with flavor. The boba is soft and chewy and does not get hard over time, like most boba. Boba guys is known for their milky drinks. My favorite milk drink is the Thai milk tea. The sweetness of the drink is greatly paired with the chewiness of the boba. However, boba guys is not a place to find authentic asian boba. It is very "Americanalized". However, if you are looking for a place to find good boba and good flavor, boba guys is the place to go.

I've been to other Boba Guys locations in SF, and while I like their drinks, I wasn't too impressed with the drinks I got at this location. Don't get me wrong, they were decent, but just not that great. I had a caramel milk tea with boba, and it tasted alright. My brother had a matcha latte with boba, and my husband got one with chia seeds. The chia seeds hadn't been pre-seeped, so he had to wait until they were plump, which was kind of annoying. I'd return to try their other drinks, but we all felt the same about our drinks: they were ok.
So much food coloring in their instagram drinks. Nothing special as many people hyped it as so. I prefer Little Sweet and iTea for their authentic and freshly brewed tea. Expensive pricing too!
Best boba ever!! We got the strawberry matcha and each sip took me a little higher to heaven. It is a bit sweet but perfect if you're looking for a pick me up!

Decent boba place but nothing stood out. I happened to come by here on a Monday afternoon. Place wasn't crowded but there were a few people in the store. I was able to find parking pretty easily. Just make sure that you're parked in the free zone. We came with about a group of 8 so having one person working did not help at all. It's totally expected to wait when we mob the place but some people were waiting 20 minutes just to place the order. Another staff would be very beneficial. Staff was really friendly though! Helpful in every way. Drinks were pretty average for a boba shop. Matcha latte tasted good but had nothing special to it.

Hot jasmine green tea with oat milk 50% sweetness with no boba was perfect on a cold night. One thing I will complain about is the placement of their special drinks/food menu. The main menu is on the right-side as you enter, hanging above the seating. The special menu is tucked into the left-side, against the counter. I was originally craving some honey toast, but decided to curb the sweet tooth with boba. Sadly, after ordering, I saw they had kaya toast and honey toast on the special menu.

Meh...Had the Hojicha green milk tea, with oat milk,  50% sweet, wirh boba, and less ice. Tea flavor was good, boba was a little al dente for me.Daughter had rose green tea with boba. Flavor was good.2 stars for the price. Holy moly, $11 for 2 drinks?! I guess that's why I live in the EAST BAY where my drinks taste just like theirs for less than $8!

Make sure to go at a time when it's not so busy!! The line wasn't that bad honestly, they know how to crank those drinks out!! I love how many choices you have!! And it's fairly cheap too, which is helpful since some places can overcharge. Absolutely love it and I need to go back

Stopped by Boba Guys this past weekend for a refreshing treat and decided to order the Black Sesame Latte w/ their house made Almond Jelly. Yum! The flavor of the black sesame was prominent but not over the top and I like that the drink is made with almond milk since they don't allow for substitutions or sugar level variations for this drink.The almond jelly was also very good. Not too sweet and the perfect amount of firmness. The workers make the drinks really quickly so if there's a long line; wait it out, it's worth it! Just a heads up, Boba Guys doesn't have the typical large array of drink options like other boba shops. They have the essentials (i.e. Jasmine Milk Tea, Thai Tea, Coffee Milk Tea, and so on) but they also have some pretty innovative and unique drinks. For example, their Matcha Strawberry Latte, Muscat Oolong, and Strawberry Cali-pico. They also have a Specials board near the register if you're feeling extra adventurous. Check it out for yourself to see what all the hype is about.
Best location, never crowded and always fast service. Classic, 25% sweet, with oat milk is the way to go.
I can't say enough how much I love Boba Guys!! Everything I've tried skip far is delicious. The strawberry rice milk is my favorite!

The atmosphere was fun with a lot people. The Strawberry Matcha Latte is really good. Also the Peach n Cream is also very good. The line looks long but it goes quickly. The service is pleasant and fast.

It's my first time trying out this place. I ordered my usual jasmine green milk tea with no ice. Came out with the perfect consistency, not too watery. They also allow you to use your own containers if you bring em. Will come back to try other drinks!

My office has a tradition of visiting a boba place every Friday. We recently tried Little Sweet and I'm so glad that we worked it into our rotation! The restaurant is small but very cute. I ordered the Honey Milk Green Tea (light sweet, with tapioca balls). It was delicious! Sometimes boba can be a lot for me - but Little Sweet hits the spot. I'll definitely return on future Friday boba runs!

I thought this place was okay, but it could also be that I got their milk tea (honey green milk tea), and it looks like they specialize in smoothie ish kinda drinks. I probably wouldn't come back because I'm more of a milk tea person. The service was good though, staff was nice and attentive.

The place is pretty small with no tables, but a bench to sit and wait for your drink. I got the Rose High Mountain Milk Tea, and it was pretty good. I got standard sweetness and light ice. If you don't like it being too sweet, I'd suggest getting about 70% sweetness and light ice. Recommendation(s):- Rose High Mountain Milk Tea

Small boba shop a short walk from Union Square. I got my usual iced jasmine green tea with no sweetness, no milk and no toppings.The tea was very strong and the cup was a good portion for the price.I also got the matcha egg puffs, which I thought were better than my boba. It had a strong matcha flavor and was on the bitter side, which I like.3.75

This is a very small boba/tea/smoothie shop in downtown SF, at a very convenient location!! It is amazing how they have squeezed the business in this little spot without making it feel cramped. I ordered the passion fruit green tea with little sweetener and little ice. It was perfect but it really took a while to get it ready. I understand probably having more than two people behind the counter will be too crowded, but they need to be efficient. Hope it improves in future...

This is a new boba spot that opened in my office building downstairs. I go way too often due to this convenience. I have enjoyed everything I've tried thus far from milk teas to fruit teas; always opting for 50% sweetness and light ice! Price is slightly higher than other boba spots in this area, though not by much. As the location is a bit tucked away, the line isn't as crazy as other spots nearby. They are offering gift cards at a 15% discount, which is such a steal if you work nearby! Definitely take advantage of this if you enjoy the spot. 4 stars instead of 5 as the staff doesn't seem to understand you half the time and also due to the lack of seating.

The strawberry watermelon slush with added boba $7.50 was okay. I appreciated the substantial amount of salted cheese. It was more like a salty blended cream cheese. I got random, large bits of cream cheese, which were actually kind of good. The boba are prepared too soft for my personal preference.The drink itself got warm quickly in my hands as I walked around Union square. I think they need to make sure they refrigerate the individual components of the drink before it is blended so that it stays better chilled. I think I saw them use fresh watermelon which is a plus. I don't know about the strawberry. The in-store menu price at $6.50. Even with the $0.50 charge for boba, the total for the drink seemed to be more than the price posted. Tax?The cup is too tall. The boba straw is too short for it. My concerns with these new boba places using thick plastic cups are that they use more plastic to produce the cups than the normal cups and that the stores and customers don't recycle them.

Located on the sidewalk level of the building in which I work, Little Sweet calls to my boba tea-loving coworkers (and there are a lot of them).In years past I've downed my fair share of the boba, so while I'm the low-carb guy nowadays I did head out with my peeps to celebrate the successful software release. I ordered the black coffee, always a good way to measure a restaurant's way with the little things, while they ordered a variety of the boba offerings.My coffee was marginal, at best, but that's not why you're reading this review. The boba judgement I heard on the way back upstairs ranged from "good" to "pretty good" across all the flavors and mixtures ordered. Something around a 3.5, so let's be generous (they're a new place, after all).Conveniently located in the downtown tech corridor, near to Union Square and a lot of the shoppings, I'd say Little Sweet is worth a visit.
We drove by another Boba Place with a long line and were able find parking near Little Sweet so we got lucky and ordered a coffee boba and a tea boba.  They were made just right.

3.5 stars so I'll leave it at 3 since they just opened and they can improve! Cute little boba place near work with lots of drink selections to choose from. It's a smaller storefront with an area that can probably fit a litt less than 10 customers inside to order at the counter and wait. There was no line when I arrived around 5PM on a Thursday. I ordered:* brown sugar milk tea with boba (75% sweet)* creamy green tea (75% sweet)* original egg puffs My order came out to a little over $15. The lady working was quick with my order and I received everything within ten minutes. I had to wait a little bit for the lady to take orders of the customers that came after, but I wasn't in a rush. I enjoyed my brown sugar milk tea and the boba was sweet, slightly chewy. The creamy green tea was alright. I liked that it had a stronger tea taste, but the cream wasn't as salty as I'd like. The egg puffs were not anything great either. It almost tasted like a pancake and I have definitely had better at other boba places. Overall, I'm glad that there's another boba spot, but everything was average. Their prices are slightly higher than most places with a regular milk tea being $4.80 (not including the topping...). However, I would love to try the other drinks on the menu when I'm in the area.

Nice lil boba place next to my work. I actually prefer this than walking down to boba guys, since the line is always packed out the door. I had the jasmine green tea with 25% sugar. I didn't taste any sweetness too it though which is fine since the aloe balanced it out. I paid around $4.5 for the drink, which is good for SF. They also have egg puffs, I love egg puffs so I'mGlad that's there. Place is smallSo definitely better to take the drinks out. Check it out.

tldr; I waited 20+ minutes for my drink when it wasn't even during busy hours (3pm on a Monday), my drink didn't have any tea flavor just milky and too sweet for 50% sweetness. Overall this place is not bad but not good.Little Sweet opened up right in the same building but downstairs of where I work. It's super convenient to come downstairs and be able to grab a cup of boba and stroll back to work within a minute, but that's not what happened.It wasn't exactly busy when I went. It was a Monday afternoon around 3pm (my Swarm check-in tells me I was at Little Sweet at 3:07pm to be exact) there was a group of 4 in front of me before I ordered. I stood by the door waiting for 10 minutes and realized I have a meeting I needed to get to at 3:30pm; thought to myself... I'll make it, I'm so close to work. 20 minutes passed and I still didn't have my drink. Finally at 3:24pm they handed me my Roasted Oolong Milk Tea with boba (50% sweet, less ice, substituted fresh whole milk for $0.50). My total drink came out to $5.80 (more expensive than Asha!)When I finally took a sip of my drink, I expected more "tea" taste, but all I tasted was milk and super sweet boba. Honest opinion, I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it, and that's never a way to describe boba.In conclusion, I probably wouldn't recommend this place since there's so many other boba places around (i.e. Asha [my favorite  and only boba place I'd recommend], Boba Guys, Sharetea, Black Sugar)I'll probably give this place one more chance in the future but if I end up with the same experience then they have lost a customer.

Downtown SF is poppin with boba places now! I tried Little Sweet's other location before and was not too big of a fan, but wanted to check out their new location. There was no line when I went, but my drink took awhile to come out. There was one lady making all the drinks while the owner was training the other employee. They also serve egg puffs and ice cream.I ordered the Strawberry Watermelon with Salted Cheese foam. The drink would have been better if it was colder, but the smoothie was room temp. The boba here is also hella soft and chewy - I usually like it a little harder. I'm always comparing cheese foams with Happy Lemon's, and the foam here just tasted like whipped cream. Some improvements could be made with customer service. The workers are all azn and do not know much English. The price on the screen was different than the price that they charged me and it took awhile for them to understand the issue. There was no apology. The owner just whipped out the remaining balance in change and gave it to me. For the price - I paid $7 for my drink - I left unsatisfied.
Love the White gourd tea! Cute little shop with friendly staff. Would totally recommend.
Hidden gem in San Francisco. Their tie guan yin milk tea are a must get, and this place are good for families and friends.

This place is really strong in their tea! If you have to stay at the office late or need a wake me up, this place is your go to spot. I ordered the jasmine Milne tea with boba less ice and 50% sugar and it was a little too bitter for me. I didn't mind it because I can taste the tea and I love that about this place. After drinking this tea, I could barely sleep at night. The next morning I still have energy after sleeping for less hours. I am giving this place a 4 stars because they are kind of stingy with their boba and give you less than most places.

We heard there was a new boba shop so we had to check it out. My girlfriend ordered a milk tea and I ordered the honey green tea. Both drinks were 100% sweetness and no ice. They charge you 25 cents if you ask for no ice, which is weird to me but whatever. Babe said the milk tea was good, but I didn't like my drink. It wasn't sweet enough and I only drank half before throwing it away. The staff were friendly and answered any questions we had though so that was nice. The honey green tea could use improvement, but it was still a good experience.

So excited that Little Sweet finally opened up a location in the FiDi not too far from where I work. I used to go out of my way to their original location in the Richmond district because their drinks are that good. This location is small (no seats) but service is great (very efficient). I got the yogurt green tea (50% sweet) and my coworker the coffee milk tea with boba (also 50% sweet). The sweetness level was perfect. We both enjoyed our drinks. They use non-dairy creamer in their milk teas which is great for those who are lactose-intolerant. Will definitely be coming here more often for my boba runs.

We saw this new place in our neighborhood and we wanted to check it out! Small store but it's really cute. Great service. I got the black milk tea with boba and my wife got the passionfruit tea. She got hers at 25% sweetness and I got mine at 50%. She thought they were both perfect but I would have gotten them both 25% higher. Still, very good. The boba has a great taste and texture. Will definitely be back again!

I've always loved their pastries, but now that it's in noe valley close to where I live, I've finally had a chance to eat breakfast off the menu and it's amazing! Definitely recommend the overnight oats with seasonal compote and the BLT with basil aioli. which is even better if you throw a fried egg on that bad boy.
Lovely food.  Tried the filing falafel salad and turmeric (ginger) latte.  Both were delicious.  Comfortable, clean and fresh atmosphere.  I wish I was in the neighborhood more often.

24th Street in Noe Valley will always have a special place in my heart and I like and welcome this new addition here. Seems so does many others as this place was PACKED on a weekend morning. Lots of strollers outside, families - very Noe. We grabbed a couple coffees, a croissant and a Puffin (a sort of a bread pudding-ish pastry) to go. I didn't expect much from their coffee but it was surprisingly good and so was their flaky and buttery croissant. However we took a real liking to the Puffin that my husband (the pastry fiend that he is who secretly hates sharing) decided we each needed our own so he turned around to grab a second one while we were walking back to our car.
Very yummy! As usually go to the one downtown but I wanted to change the place so I went to Noe valley. And it's also yummy. I got a egg Benedic. The hollandaise sauce is good. The coffee too.

Great new addition to the Noe Valley brunch scene. A bit different from their SOMA location. Well designed space. Went in for brunch and enjoyed their fried egg sandwich. Pastries are super yummy so make sure to try at least one.

This place is too precious by a half. The croissant was pretty flavorless and the texture was all wrong. Our meal took a really long time, (there were many empty tables, ie, not busy) and the potatoes were WAY too salty-and I really like l salt. There's a much better place just across the street. Don't bother with this one. Way too expensive for the quality.

Great addition to the neighborhood--I love the food, pastries, drinks, and ambiance. It's more of a nice sit-down place than many other cafes or bakeries in Noe Valley. Kind of pricey, but hey, that's SF. The reason I gave it 3 stars is that most of the time I walk in they seem to be understaffed, and some important job isn't really getting done, whether that's clearing tables, serving food, cooking food, or something else. Today there is one person to take orders, make drinks, serve food and clear tables for the entire cafe, the self-serve water pitchers have all been empty for awhile and my iced latte came as a hot latte but I don't have the heart to send it back because that one poor guy is working so hard. Hopefully they improve their staffing soon!

Really good croissants, especially the almond one! The tea and matcha coffe were really good. The inside is nice and it has nice background music.I will definitely return here again for brunch or breakfast.

Yum yum yum...first off, I'm vegan, and my friend (who isn't vegan) and I were looking for a bite both of us could enjoy. So happy we found Vive La Tarte. Jacob was fabulous...helping us order the perfect things. I got the avocado toast with no cheese, no egg...and an oat milk mocha with melted dark chocolate...well, all I can say is it made me very happy. The chef/baker even gave me some house made hot sauce that made my avocado toast even better! Let me just say that I love and appreciate it when there are a few nice vegan choices! All vegans have friends & family who are not vegan, so it just makes sense to have something for everyone. Great staff & nice, bright space too! I'll be back for more soon
This place has great coffee, amazing pastries, and was stroller friendly! It's my new favorite spot in Noe Valley.

I'll update this once they get their staff sorted out. The food looks amazing and I'd love to try it. Unfortunately, it never came. I had to seek out a server twice and then a third time letting them know we hadn't gotten our food yet. There was only one person at the front and it seemed as if the their computer had stopped operating. Naturally the line was getting longer. All the tables were full of dirty dishes and the person who clears the tables was not in any particular hurry to get them cleaned. He even watched as a new group started clearing it themselves and walked passed them without even asking to help. The other waitress was on her lunch break and was eating her food watching all this disaster ensue. She never even tried to help. I do understand needing a break but it's shameful to watch your coworkers struggle and not offer to help. Eventually I'll try this place again but will give it time. For the price, I'd expect much much more.
I stopped in to pick up the bread today. Friendly staff. GREAT bread!

A welcome addition to Noe Valley for sure! A and I stopped in for a light breakfast and were really impressed. I love casual, counter-serve restaurants for breakfast and this place totally fits into Noe Valley and the general family-friendly vibe. We ordered:-Butter Croissant - A wasn't super hungry so he just got this. I tried it and liked it a lot. Good croissants aren't THAT hard to come by but they definitely had some more interesting pastries such as a Tumeric Monkey Bread that I really wanted to try-Avocado Toast - This was FANTASTIC. I don't know if it is the bread or the combo of toppings but this may have been one of the best avocado toasts I have ever had. It is definitely expensive but honestly so satisfying that I would not hesitate to get this again. The portion is big AND it is pretty to boot!-Drip Coffee - They use Intelligentsia (I believe) and it was very good and satisfying. I do wish they would do re-fills for orders staying in the store but I also didn't ask.Overall, everything was great and the above came out to ~$20 which isn't cheap but also isn't outrageous. This place was really busy on a Sunday morning but we were able to get seats. I highly recommend this place if you are in the area and I really look forward to coming back and trying more of their menu.

I dropped by VLT , new location in Noe Valley, exceptional bakery I got  chocolate chip cookies ridiculously good.  They have 3 locations in SF, will be back soon to try the tacros it's their croissant tacos" they look yummy may have to go to the ferry building to get those.

This is a great new addition to Noe Valley! The pastries are superb - especially the orange blossom croissant. They also have a great selection of breakfast/brunch dishes. The space is really nicely done with a simple, modern aesthetic that is warm and inviting.
