Wow!  We popped in for late afternoon coffee and were quite happy.  Great Americanos and an excellent orange blossom croissant!  There was just one guy working, and he seemed pulled in many different directions, but as a new business, I imagine they are still figuring out the right staffing levels.  This is a welcome new coffee shop in Noe!

Love having Vive la tarte in Noe Valley, enjoy the ambiance, the food a just about everything about it!.  My only complaint, and why it's not a 5 star,  is that the special croissants that are available at other locations of Vive La Tarte for some reason are not available in Noe Valley.  The first week they had some of these special croissants, banana etc but since then they've only offered the basics which are not nearly as much fun.

Great baked goods incl the turmeric monkey bread.  Self seating and some shared tables made for a small element of uncertainty about relaxing, coupled with noise from next door party.  $14 (one) slice of avocado bread seems over the top, but tasted good.  Egg dishes met with meh reviews.  This place is a better bakery than a breakfast spot.

Five stars for their coffee and pastries. Orange croissant was delicious!Two stars for their breakfast plates. The vegan bacon was inedible and the potatoes/eggs were just meh. Not worth the hefty price.

I used to live around here and I was beyond excited when the Vive La Tarte was in construction! I moved away but now that I'm visiting, I knew I had to stop by. This location has really cute decor and a light, airy vibe. I got a latte ($5) and an almond croissant ($4.50) for breakfast, both were delicious! One thing I love about Vive La Tarte is that their croissants are perfectly flakey and they are huge! You definitely get your San Francisco dollar's worth.

Met a friend here for a late lunch, while wfh one day. It wasn't crazy busy and we were able to find seating, with more seating available which is always a plus at an SF cafe. I had their egg sandwich where I subbed the ham for avocado instead, it was amazing - only thing I would say is the red chili chutney inside is insanely good, but it was so sparing and not nearly enough. The sesameLatte was really good too and I def will be back.

This spot is amazing! The breakfast sandwich is perfection, the kaya toast is divine and the char sui sandwich is out of this world. Every baked good is delicious, both great for dining in or taking on the go. I've gotten treats from here every time my parents come to town and they love it! Also only spot in SF I know of you can get homemade butter mochi! Jimmy and Kate and whole breadbelly crew know what they're doing - go here if you know what's good for you!
Excellent. Slightly too pricy even at SF standard, but~ hey, it's all about food. Beautiful bread, cute little spot, great for breakfast.

I loved my visit to this new little place - I think they said it's only like 4 months old. the owners are so nice even though we showed up 20 minutes to closing time (4pm). Hubs tried the kaya toast which is something I've never tried before (had a cheater bite as I'm not supposed to eat a lot of gluten). It was sweet and quite fluffy. Breadbelly has some nice gluten free options which is super unusual for an asian-bakery style cafe. I had two GF menu itemsGyeranbbang: savory egg green onion pastry thing - was a nice generous piece as big as a larger muffin and delicate tastingChoco Soba-ko Cookie: tons of sesame seeds and chocolate but not overbearing on the chocolate flavor.Nice bright cafe space in a quiet part of the Richmond district.Super friendly staff.

I never thought I would like bread this much.  The kaya toast here is delicious and very reasonably priced at about $6.  The kaya topping was sweet and complemented the yummy milk bread.  The salt they add on top is a really great finish too.I also tried the 50/50 drink, which is half tea and half coffee, sweetened with condensed milk.  The combination seemed really weird to me at first, but it definitely worked.  The drink was super refreshing and you could taste the best of each component inside.  I would definitely get this again.Seating is a bit limited during peak hours, so coming here to work isn't the best idea.  I would definitely recommend a visit to try the toasts and drinks here if you're in the area!

The kaya toast is sooo good. It's a fresh baked milk bread topped with coconut and pandan jam. Extremely heavenly! I also got the Moscavado Cookie which has coconut, sesame and moscavado sugar. It was okay but I would not recommend it.I was a little disappointed because the breakfast sandwich they had on the menu didn't have the scallion jam, instead it had fermented chili. And they were out of their not-ube tart because "sweet potato is out of season". Two items that I really wanted to try but couldn't. One star off because I got a pretty weird vibe from the workers (except the girl, super friendly chick.) The guy who was standing at the cashier area had his back turned the entire time to make drinks and avoid customers. I felt his cold shoulder vibes the entire time I stood there trying to decide what to get. The other guy who brought out my toast handed me the plate awkwardly. He handed out forks and knives to everyone else (who ordered the toast) except for me. Strange...

Great Service and even more delicious treats.Got the following items: instagram.com/p/BwoDj7Bh…The Kaya Toast is probably what's everything to rave, colorful, instagram friendly, and delicious.My only hang up on this place is, I wish the seating was a bit more comfortable and a bit more outlets. But of course, you have to strike a balance because you don't want people to camp at your spot all day like a Starbucks.Cheers, keep up the great work!

Inconspicuously tucked away in the Richmond district is this delicious coffee and pastry shop. Looking for parking on the weekend is rough but if you're willing to walk a couple blocks it's not too bad by Park Presidio for free street parking. Clean, modern atmosphere. Order at counter and grab a seat at the table. Pricing is comparable to any good coffee/pastry shop in the city like Mr. Holmes. Had the Iced 50/50 and kaya toast. The drink is delicious , half coffee and half black tea sweetened with condensed milk. Reminded me of Hong Kong milk tea, flavor was perfect not too overwhelming and definitely refreshing . I had to google what kaya meant since I never heard of it, apparently it's a popular Singaporean item. It's made with pandan and coconut milk - very smooth and not too sweet. Bread was crispy on the edges and soft on the inside. Yummy! Will have to go back and try other items in the future.

Yay, I'm their 100th reviews!!!1) Do yourself a favor an get their Kaya Toast. It's UH-MAZING!!! 2) Char Siu Sandwich with their glazed sauce and roasted pork was delicious an great to share with others. 3) Anko sticky bun was so so for me. My least favorites. 4) Cucumber and avocado salad had great texture & crunch. 5) Friendly and accommodating staff. Definitely will come back to try other things on their menu. I hope you give this lovely place a try. Cheers! The simple things in life.

I wasn't expecting the kaya toast to be anything special, but it was amazingly. I don't usually like kaya Toast because it's so sweet, but breadbelly's kaya Toast paired with unsweetened coffee is perfect. The bread was so fluffy and buttery. The coffee was strong and had a nice dark roast. The place is a little small with limited seating but if you go on a weekday you should be fine.

Everything is great here provided one is open to the flavor profile on offer. Nice to see high end chefs wanting to craft feel-good food in a comfortable and relaxed setting. The Kaya toast is better than the one I'm used to from Singapore because the bread is so much better (made in-house). If you don't want sweets, even the mushroom broth is great. They constantly are trialing new and innovative things, which I also appreciate. Lastly the staff are kind and courteous, willing to explain and help navigate the offerings (especially if the line isn't too long).

The kaya toast is wonderfully fluffy, served warm, and is "not too sweet" when you get the right ratio of coconut pandan jam in each bite :) I enjoyed the not-ube-tart but wouldn't go out of my way to get it again; I ordered it knowing full and well that I wanted taro, not purple yam, but then again... it's in the name.Really friendly service. I appreciate the option of coffee or beer - it's kind of hard to find a cafe/bakeshop type of place that'll serve alcohol, so Breadbelly really hits the mark. Perfect for breakfast, brunch, or just a snack. It looks like the neighborhood's welcomed Breadbelly with open arms, as there's a line out the door in the mornings. When I've stopped by around 1:30pm or so on the weekends, there's hardly a wait and plenty of tables to choose from.My favorite things, hands down, are the savory options. The breakfast sandwiches are fantastic! I like the char siu sandwich (so tasty, with homemade bread), but the price point comes in a little too high for what I feel like I can satisfy at dim sum.

Can I give 6 stars? Or 10 stars?! Not even sure where to begin with how much I am in absolute LOVE with bread belly. I recommend going soon before it gets too crazy crowded. It's easily going to become the next "it" café.... Lines out the door in no time. I'm even hesitate to write about it because I want to keep this gem to myself- but I can't it's toooooo gooooood! You. Are. Welcome. We went in on a Thursday morning around 11 am-only one other customer in. No line. The place had easy parking on a side street - great location. The café is pristine- clean & minimalistic. Wonderful place to get work done/study. Succulents galore without being basic or obnoxiously hipster (hard to do). Now let's get to the food- I ordered the Kaya Toast (griddled breadbelly milk bread with coconut-pandan jam). One of the most wonderfully done toasts ever EVER EVER. It's very sweet- but in a delicate way. The bread is the kinda thing I will actually dream about. I want to eat that every day for the rest of my life. The coffee was insanely good- top notch espresso- I'll never sleep again because I want to drink it all day every day. The pairing of the two - match made in heaven. Move over Avocado toast- Kaya is in town. Oh, and the service was phenomenal. Top notch. Attentive and kind individuals. Went above and beyond! Can you tell I'm a bit obsessed?! Counting down till they open again tomorrow morning so I can go back. Yeah. That good!

Everything about Breadbelly is delightful! The cafe's food is yummy and their ceramic cups/plates are beautiful. We came on a Saturday morning and fortunately there was parking and plenty of tables inside.We ordered their kaya toast, their roasted garlic toast, ube tart, and the black sesame horchata drink. Both of the toasts were delicious. The pandan flavor on the kaya jam was flavorful but in my opinion, there was a bit too much. Ube tart was very sweet. The tart part reminded me of the classic Chinese egg tart pastry- thought it was an interesting twist. Tasted like what you'd expect (wish marshmallow wasn't that sweet). The only downside is that it's kinda pricy. They also forgot one of our orders but they were very nice about it and refunded me.

My roommate and I were actually really excited to try this place since we live close by in the Richmond. From the reviews and photos it looked really cute. We came here on a Sunday morning looking to try out a new study spot. We both got a 50/50 and shared the kaya toast. For the price of $6, the toast was nonclimatic. The 50/50 was great though. What knocked off one star for me in this review is that they never made it clear they do not allow laptop use and studying on the weekend. We would have appreciated a sign or knowing that before we bought stuff. It wasn't until I asked for the WiFi was that communicated. The staff asked us to put our laptops away once it got crowded which was basically an indirect way of asking us to leave. To me, it really defeats the purpose of being a coffee shop if people are not allowed to do work or hang out for at least a few hours. I'm hesitant to come back for a second time because of the policy and the way that was communicated by the staff.

I visited a Breadbelly popup stand for their Kaya toast and man it was amazing. It was the perfect amount of crunch but softness in the bread (believe it was brioche toast?), and just a subtle hint of salty sweetness in that base. The match spread was choc full of tea flavor and was a creamy and dreamy sweet concoction; it was the perfect ratio to boot. I'm really looking forward to trying more of their breads at the store itself!
Great spot for coffee and Asian-y pastries, sandwiches, etc. It's kind of like a bourgie version of 85 Degrees.

Beautiful, adorable breakfast/brunch place with creamy bread and photogenic, quirky baked goods. My friend and I were craving savory food, so we ordered the breakfast sandwich and egg pocket. I also got a black sesame horchata out of curiosity and my love of anything black sesame. Overall, this cute place is definitely worth checking out and splurging on at least once.The breakfast sandwich was warm and toasted to perfection. The red pepper spread was too spicy for me (I'm not a fan of spicy food), but my friend loved it. It's like a gourmet twist to a breakfast classic, a bit expensive though for the size (like $8).I was a little skeptical at first of the egg pocket being cold (I'm not a fan of cold asparagus or cold bread) but the biting into the freshness of the bread combined with the creamy egg salad made me forget all of my initial doubts. I inhaled that delicious egg pocket.The black sesame horchata was the most delicious (then again, it's literally a hybrid of two of my favorite flavors, horchata and black sesame so I'm biased). I'm so glad that I wasn't "cheated" as usual and the tall glass had the perfect amount of ice in it rather than way too much. It was creamy, sweet but not too sweet, and tasted like rice-y black sesame. I was okay with not being able to taste the cinnamon, since I'm pretty sure it would clash with the sesame.If I come back to treat myself one day, I will definitely try their famous pandan toast and yummy-looking cake.
Kaya toast - 5/5Cappuccino - 4/5Anko sticky bun -4.5/5Not ube tart - 3.5/5Service - 4/5

A place that feels that vibe of California hip. The Mapo chilli makes you wish chilli was always this good. The Koya Toast with an espresso is what weekends should always be. The hit of salt ascents the sweetness wonderfully. The food tastes better than its Instagramy following could ever capture. The mini quiche's savory punch will knock your tastebuds down. It's citrus zest draws you in like your first crush. Breadbelly is that crush you wish was in your neighborhood.
Decent coffee, pretty small place but its not their fault of course. Tiny bit of seating, enough for maybe 5 people total inside

Ordered an americano with oat milk. I am giving the three stars merely for the taste of the coffee and how cute the spot was. The other two stars I wish I could give if I was greeted and felt wanted. The heavier set gentlemen who was the barista was very out of it and seemed like he hated his job which really made the experience not as exciting. I was so pumped to come here because of locals referring and then to enter into such negative vibes was a disappointment. I really enjoyed the coffee so the coffee is great just need to work on smiles and hospitality because that makes each place feel and worthy of returning.
I got a latte with oat milk. The latte had 2 shots AND the Oat Mill was included (there was NOT a separate $1 charge for it)It was very smooth and easy to drink. Highly recommend!

Haven't been able to make it out here because of the location--and I came in with some higher expectations being one of the more popular coffee shops in SF as well as earning quite the reputation. I was met halfway with my expectations. The espresso was very bright, almost too forward--similar to that of a lime. The body had been pretty faint, leading straight to the finish. The end was more dark, dark chocolate--comparative to eating 85% cocoa, with a smoky after taste. I had a cappuccino to lead after to see how it would hold up, the flavors had become a lot more complex being dispersed through with milk. A lot more balanced and pleasing. I was told by a friend their drip was better than their espresso? I'll have to come by again and see if he holds true with his statements. Not bad Linea, not bad
Really exceptional latte from here.  The flavor of the espresso was rich and complex.  Very nice staff.  Great find.
No restroom available and limiting seating, but good quality coffee. The walk down Mission street gets a little rough, but this is a good place to grab a coffee and re-group.

Love oat milk (it is replacing my old trusty almond milk) and this place carries it! Trendy and chic from the outside, I was surprised to see just how many awards this place has for their coffee when i walked in. I dropped by for an oat milk cappuccino over the weekend before making my way to Craftman & Wolves for a pastry.
No waffles despite lots of waffle photos here on Yelp. "Haven't had em in 2-3 years" -

Best spot I've found in SF in a couple years. I am not sure why the new craze is coffee and espresso that tastes like coffee-flavored water. Linea serves real espresso, with full pulls that have a kick. I had a cappuccino and was pleasantly surprised to get something that actually tasted like a cappuccino. I wish the trend was leaning towards strong (tasting) coffee and not that light fruity hinty stuff everyone is charging $6 for. Linea, at least, is on board with serving good coffee!

I love Linea Caffe and their small eco-friendly semi-Italian style coffee-espresso bar on 18th Street in San Francisco's Mission District.  They roast micro-batches of coffee several time every week sourced mostly from Brazil, Guatamala, Columbia and Ethiopia, which are often award winning and reserve lots.  They also feature great espresso (using their own espresso blend) - one of the best I've tried and always have their freshly brewed coffee of the day.  My favorite for making my own pour overs is from their Brazilian beans - grown by several organic and sustainable farms in Brazil.  Linea Caffe was launched by Andrew Barnett, considered by some to be a third wave legend.  Among other things, he has been a Judge at the World Barista Championship and Cup of Excellence Awards.  While they only have one location in San Francisco, they will ship freshly roasted coffee directly to you the day it is roasted.  Yum!
Solid cappuccino, though priced slightly higher than Ritual and Blue Bottle. ($4.50) It was a beautiful day for Carnavale and coffee. Cute interior with outdoor seating.
Coffee tastes good, sweet and nutty, they toast their own, cappuccino spuma is smooth with a heart shape. Yum!

Linea is my neighborhood cafe and I go religiously every weekend to start the day. The staff is friendly and their coffee is high quality and delicious. I typically get a latte with almond or oat milk. I'm so thrilled they have Oatly (oat milk) as a dairy free option. The shop itself is simple and nicely designed/decorated. They have outdoor seating.
They stopped serving waffle 3 yrs ago.  The person at the register looked bothered when I asked questions. Iced americano was watered too much, but cappuccino was good.

Came in for a to go cold brew with almond milk. One of the guys shouted "try the oat milk!" so I did. It was my first time having oat milk and it was great! Great experience overall for such a brief interaction.
I love this little shop! We happened to walk by and had to stop. All the features in the window caught out eye. We got the strawberry soda. So good and so unique.

Linea makes some of the best coffee in the Mission, quickly and consistently. It's a small hole-in-the-wall kind of place so is better for takeout, but they do have a couple of tables outside and a bench inside if you want to take a moment to ponder life.Coffee quality is very good on different days and with different baristas; they do a particularly nice job with the crema, and I've never experienced the overly-milky latte another reviewer mentioned.Only downer is that the folks who work there are always so glum, I seriously can't get anyone to crack a smile! It is a hipster coffee place so I know some surliness is expected, but they look so blue I want to jump the counter and give them a hug. Maybe tomorrow I'll shout them a scone or tell a knock-knock joke, see if that cheers them up. Stay tuned.
The baristas are good, preparing the drinks exactly as they show be made. The place is simple, basically just for getting your caffeine dose.

Terrific coffee and delicious light-as-air waffles. Surprisingly, this is one of the few places in San Francisco carrying top-notch Brazilian coffee beans, but they don't carry them all the time. Wonder why that's so when Brazil is a major coffee-producing country that's also close to the U.S. If you get a chance, try Brazilian coffee grown at high altitudes.

Small, hipster coffee shop a short walk away from Dolores Park. The menu is small and straightforward and the woman who took my order was pleasant. I ordered an iced coffee and it was bold - just the way I like it. Seating is limited. There was a small bench inside and right outside the entrance as well as a few beside the cafe. A good place to stop for a pick-me-up while exploring the mission or chillin' at the park.

I never drink coffee but now I'm addicted to their Latte. Music's fun, vibe and people seem very friendly. I like that you can walk to the back of the space and see the exhibitions they run at their gallery. It's a cool place to hang out, work, study and enjoy a cup of coffee.

Love the vibe and the coffee here! I feel lucky to have found it on a bit of a rainy day last week. The barista was super nice and I had an awesome pour over from a local roaster. I'm looking forward to coming back, there's also an interesting art gallery you can walk through in the back of the cafe. Was cool!
One of my favorite coffee places in SF. Love all the art and good coffee! They have a local roast that is great. Give the cortados a try here too.

As much as I love the dog décor and smoothies here, the hours are frustratingly inconsistent (and don't align with the hours posted on the door). I work a couple of blocks away, and 9 times out of 10, this place is closed when I stop by.Delicious smoothies, though, when they ARE open.

This is IT. Mandy the owner is a real sweetheart.  Such great vibes here..comfortable  and welcoming. Set in an old pharmacy and full of amazing vintage pics and bottles. The food, and coffee, are delicious and fresh. I visited here every day of my recent vacation and plan to come back next time! A great asset to the community!

Adorable neighborhood cafe! Friendly staff, delicious cafe, and a great menu selection. Plus it is decorated with pictures of dogs!  Also has fast WiFi. I would recommend stopping in for breakfast, lunch, or coffee and a work session.

LOVE this dog friendly cafe, friendly owner Mandy, and the creative latte options! Perfect hippie throwback 2 story place, and if you miss having a dog in your life it's a great spot to get in some pooch time. 5 star ambiance, quirky like SF!

A very cool cafe decorated in a very charming manner, with upstairs and downstairs seating  and featuring breakfast selections,  lunch options, snacks, smoothies, coffee and espresso drinks and fresh juices...  The proprietor is a culinary school graduate who is personally responsible for most it not all of the food offerings and who has otherwise placed her personal stamp on all aspects of the cafe's operation.  A great place for a meeting or date if in the area.

I've lived a couple blocks away for months now and finally tried Karma last week. I'm so mad at myself for not coming sooner!The cafe has a great ambiance- two floors, plenty of comfy chairs and little nooks to hang out/read/do work in, and beautiful decor. The cafe is warm on chilly days. They offer water infused with lemon, cucumber, and ginger!I've only had a chai and a pesto panino here.... but both were great and I'm looking forward to exploring more of their menu while I work here. The weekdays are not bad at all, pretty quiet, and there's usually good music and a dog hanging out to perk up your day.

ONE OF MY MOST FAVORITE CAFE SO FAR!This is a 2-story local cafe in the corner of the street. When I first walked in I saw the sign 'GOOD VIBE ONLY.' I knew suddenly I was in the right place. On the wall of the first floor, you will see tons of dogs' pictures frame hanging on the wall. These are all the dogs that have visited this cafe. I love everyone who takes dogs seriously lol There are so many food and beverage selections. When I ordered my iced mocha, he asked specifically how I wanted. I love dark mocha and that was just exactly what I needed. IT'S JUST RIGHT. You can enjoy the lively vibe downstairs or walk to the second floor where you will see a huge lovely octopus on the wall. You can peacefully work on your project quietly there.Will definitely come back next time I visit San Fran!!

I don't know what it is, but their bread tastes like soap/cleaner. So far I tried their banana bread and focaccia bread (two weeks apart) and they both had the same soapy/cleaner taste. At first I thought it was a specific ingredient, but now that I see BOTH the items taste like it, unsure what it is.Ambiance is cute and laid back, a beautiful cafe. Slightly over priced.
This sweet little neighborhood place is friendly even if you have no dog. The special bagel of the day was well made and a pleasure to consume. The staff where friendly and helpful. Enjoy!!
Delicious breakfast panini with bacon! Also love the Berry smoothie. One of my new favorite cafes!

I absolutely love everything about Karma. The staff are so sweet and honestly what's better than a cafe that encourages people to bring in their dogs?! Their smoothies are delicious, especially the pb&j, and the breakfast sandwich is amazing as well. I love having this cafe in the neighborhood.

This place is amazing! Not only do they have fresh yummy food but they make their own vanilla syrup for the vanilla latte, which I am addicted to. Sandwiches and smoothies are great. They also offer homemade peanut butter dog cookies! AND they are extremely dog friendly. So much so that there is a house puppy named Shiloh. Stop by, it's super cool.

Cute Cafe in a residential area, plenty of people hunkered down to work for the day and it's a comfortable environment so I can see why. The smoothie I had was good, might not be worth going way out of your way for but the ingredients were fresh and it was served with a smile.

A slice of wonderfulness is served upon entering Karma Cafe. Maybe it's the bubble machine outside. Or the vast delicious menu. I grew up in SF and when I walked in here I felt the vibe of SF alive and well. I order a healthy fresh juice and smiled. Going to make this place a regular weekend stop when walking my dog. And Shiloh the puppy is charming!

What else can I say except I love this place! Unique 2 story cafe in a quiet neighborhood. Great food, great coffee, they use Sightglass, good food, friendly service. I loooooove the vibe, if I had a cafe, this would be it, if I died and went to heaven and it was a cafe, this would be it. Painted in a periwinkle blue, strung with fairy lights, butterflies everywhere and positive quotes all around. And I mentioned how good the coffe, food and service is!!!! All I can say is.....I'm in love.

Feeling healthy but wanting something delicious? Well karma cafe is the place to go! All the drinks here are absolutely delicious! A bit on the pricey side ($7.50 for a smoothie...?!) but understandable because of the ingredients used. One of my favorite drinks here is the lavender lemonade. The floral crisp taste is perfect for a nice sunny hot day. It's refreshing and delicious! The mango avocado smoothie is very subtle in flavors but it does make me feel super full after drinking half of this. They had samples of their PB&J and this was amazing. It felt like I was eating a PB&J sandwich without the heavy carbs. Can't wait to try the other items on the menu. Highly recommend for the drinks. And who doesn't love the cute puppy running around. This deserves 5 stars on its own!!

I just happened to come across this place one Sunday morning and I loved it!! There's just such a warm, positive aura about the place. Their smoothies are also amazing!! The picture shows Very Berry and Coconut Mango. It's all natural with no additives. As a bonus, everything they use is compostable!! Don't forget to say hi to Shylo, the cafe pup!

Beautiful Cafe with so many subtle touches! There was a lot of love put into this place. The upstairs is an awesome nook, perfect for work/studying. This is now my favorite smoothie place in SF! Highly recommend their Coconut Mango smoothie!

Awful Coffee and Service.  I took my mom here on a Sunday thinking it would be a nice laid back place.  Oh no.  First of all, after we paid 4.50 for a cup of dark roast coffee that we explicitly asked for right from the get go.  She tasted it and said it was pretty weak. Instead of asking for a refund, she  went up to the counter and asked if this was indeed a dark roast.  Some woman behind the counter at the top of her lungs said that this was a great medium roast (she said it was a dark roast when I paid for it) and no one had complained ever before. Really?  Was all that necessary, not only did it stop up the entire conversation in the cafe and get all eyes pointed on us, over a freaking cup of coffee but how rude and unprofessional.  Karma cafe my ass, don't go here if you are expecting what you paid for and decent service. What a rude loudmouthed entitled jerk. A Starbucks two blocks away was a better choice. They knew how to actually make coffee. And that's saying something since heck its a Starbucks.

So sad because I really wanted to like this place. Caesar salad was coated in the thick dressing and was so hard to eat :( tiny plate with a little lettuce and paid $3 extra for a few tiny pieces of questionable chicken. Menu said it came with egg but didn't. Costed $11.50. Such a bummer... extra star for the cute dog.
love this place. good food, good coffee, good wifi, lots of plugs, lots of tables, fantastic environment.
Good coffee and green tea. Nice open space and friendly service. Not the watered down stuff in the touristy areas.
Nice place to sit and do some work or relax and get your mocha  or tea on.   Decor is pretty fun. Love the French vibe it creates.

Great space in outer Richmond. It is a quiet environment and is quite spacious. The coffee and food are both excellent. The staff is polite and attentive. There is no parking, but side parking is nearby.

Love this little neighborhood coffee shop and cafe. The food is good. And coffee is good too. Not sure if I would travel too far to get to the place, However it is around the corner from my apartment. So is very convenient when I am lazy and want caffeine or grub. Free WIFI. Gotta love that.

Wow just discovered a new study cafe!  It's very spacious and was not busy when I went.  It's pretty quiet and they play jazzy music so getting work done is no problem. Ordered: caramel blended drink (medium $4.60), russian tea cake ($1.50)

It's a nice warm environment that invites locales of the Richmond district. They're drinks aren't the best but good enough. Their sandwiches, breakfast bagel sandwiches and other menu items that they prepare there are pretty delicious though. But the best part is that the staff here are the friendliest.

This is a cute and quirky cafe, with what looks like play sets decorating the wall. A good amount of seating, small tables, but plenty of outlets. This place is which is great in terms of a study cafe for a study buddy or two, but not huge groups.I didn't order coffee but was underwhelmed by the coffee cake I ordered--dry and not that flavorful. I tried some of my friend's tea which was served as tea bags in a teapot. Standard study fuel but nothing remarkable.

Awesome place for sandwiches and breakfast. Fast service. I ordered an smoked sandwich and American breakfast.  The owners are Chinese and they provide American type of food at surprising reasonable price.  The smoked sandwich was very flavor and they put lots of stuff inside.  The restaurant is across the street of the Russian church on Geary ave.   I was happy to have found this place and for sure i will come back for sure if im in the area.

This is a great spot to do work or study. Plugs everywhere and there's free WiFi. The cafe options are not amazing, but it helps to have something convenient to snack on (like coffee or a sandwich). I had to ding a star because they charged me for a cup of hot water...

This coffee shop is surprisingly amazing. You would never know from outside the delicious-ness and wonderful atmosphere! the food is great!The staff are very sweet and wonderful people. There is an excellent selection of sandwiches that are very very yummy! The coffee and lattes are amazing, the baked goods are really tasty and affordable and the environment is warm, welcoming & cozy with couches, tables lots of space, & fast internet.

Cafe Enchante is a coffee shop with an abundance of nice corners to enjoy a coffee, dessert, meal, or snack. It has an agreeable mix of students, web surfers, business folk, and friends. I've tried a number of their coffee drinks, which are mostly decent - even if there may be a "burnt" taste to their drinks. (Over-roasted beans, most likely.) Believe it or not, this cafe was even bigger a few years back. Regardless, the amount of edibles makes this closer to a bistro.

I first came upon Cafe Enchante 10 years ago when I just started going out with my husband whose parents still live around the corner from here. We used to come here and study as it's quiet enough since most folks study or work here too. I occasionally come here to study now but mostly just go for the coffee. All the staff here is friendly including the owners- it's usually the same staff and they remember me so we have engage in conversations.This would be my go to place for studying if I lived in the Richmond but I don't. There also doesn't seem to be too many coffee shops in SF that 1) this size and 2) is quiet enough to study or work from. I love this place but wish that their food prices were a bit lower but I get that running a business in SF isn't cheap. They used to serve Snickers latte but not anymore. Their smoothies are delish. It's also a good place esp on a rainy day to just sit there and read a book.WiFi is free and it's my to go spot when meeting with friends who live in the Richmond. Support your local coffee shop folks!

Decided to come here to do some studying for finals. The menu is pretty big so it took me a few minutes to decide on what I wanted. Workers were nice enough and gave me enough time to figure out my order. I ended up getting a medium vanilla latte (~$4) and the San Franciscan sandwich without mayo and cheese (~$7-8). The drink was good but I would have preferred a stronger coffee taste so I might get an extra espresso shot next time. Sandwich was delicious and was worth every bite. There was a good amount of all the veggies and meat and I appreciate the fact that the sandwich was hot when prepared. WiFi is easy to connect to (just ask a worker for the password) and there's lots of space and outlets! I'll definitely come by again when I want to study in a quiet cafe

Tips: $5 minimum on card Environment: A very open space with several seatings (chairs, couches, long tables). Great for one person to a group of people. The music is played very quietly. A lot of people are here to work so it wasn't loud at all. However, there are also people who come here for food and socializing. Free WiFi -- password can be requested at the cashier. There are several outlets throughout the shop. I'm here on a Sunday afternoon and it was not crowded at all. Service; The staff is very nice and friendly. My order came out to a total of $4.34 but they were super nice and allowed me to pay with card (read the tips). Now I know! Order: I ordered a medium Caramel Mocha with whipped cream in a mug. It tasted great. Warm and sweet, perfect for my soul. The whipped cream and caramel drizzle gave it a nice touch. I also ordered a Golden Gate sandwich on sourdough with no cheese ($7.86 after tax). The bread is toasted well and it's a basic turkey sandwich so nothing went wrong. It tasted good, nothing special. Others: They have an ATM in the shop. They also have a lot of snack options aside from the pastry selections. They sell granola, chips, and cup noodles!Overall, it's a great place to be. With good drinks and variety of food options. Clean bathroom and fast WiFi. Plenty of seatings and it's quite!

very welcoming spot. free wifi and great coffee selection.  enjoyed some coffee and apple strudel bites while waiting on a friend.  nearly every seat was taken at 6 pm on a Monday night. a popular venue indeed. very quiet with most people working on homework or projects and a father and son playing on their  laptops.a larger space than most, -45-ish seats-and a large chalkboard to select coffee. only negative is that its pre-brewed j stead of fresh brewed pour overs

Cafe Enchante and its sister cafe, Cafe Promenade, are both great coffee / sandwich / work on your laptop spots. Good and very reasonably priced food, friendly staff, consistent wifi, and they're both open until 10 PM. I prefer the size and layout of Promenade, but it's a bit further out in the avenues.

Terrible terrible place; got to the register to pay, there was a roach running around so I naturally screamed lol they looked @ me as if I was delusional even when I said "there's a roach here please kill it, I can't". The cashier was a young girl the fact that I had seen a roach did not seem to even phase her! Then the older guy wearing glasses came by, "trying to look for the roach" but every time I would point at the terrified roach he would move things around & be like "where, where, I don't see it".Finally, I got offended to have them ignore my concern as a customer. I said, you know you guys really have to catch it and kill it, specially since you serve food here  I walked off saying "sorry, I just can't eat here, you can cancel my order"

Cafe Enchante is a great go-to neighborhood cafe. The bagel sandwiches are all delicious, the coffee is good, and the service is quick. This is a great place to grab a coffee and chat with friends or get work done if you need to. Casual and no pretension.
Amazing atmosphere for someone who likes to work out of a cafe. The prices are super reasonable, the food is delicious and there's always enough space.

I had such high expectations. A French bakery run by actual French expatriates. The last time I had had a chance to buy a true brioche loaf was at Le Bon Marche. I had considered taking one back to the States in my suitcase. At Les Gourmands I bought the almond croissant, a mini pain aux raisin, an oranais. As others have noted, the croissant dough is not light, buttery and flakey, but has instead a 'soggy' quality to it. The almond filling was not a pure almond paste, but rather an almond mix. To me, the dough seemed too sweet. The pain aux raisin was forgettable. The service was lovely and I was greeted immediately upon entry with a 'Bonjour Madame' just like in France. The setting is peaceful and I got 2 free samples ;). Overall the food was not for me, but I wish them well and much success.
Amazing.  All of it. I live near by and everything here is always great. My favorite is the almond croissant. If you ask them they will warm up their treats.

To have the best croissants no need anymore to go to France just go to Les Gourmands Bakery in San Francisco to get the best of both worlds. Best almonds croissants in town and one of the best quality and flavor I had in America. They have it all, financiers, pethivier, Pains aux Raisins, brioche etc. Very great service. 5 stars eyes closed.

We are so lucky to have this bakery in SF. Much attention to detail, the family is so friendly and all of the pastries taste incredible. Reminds me of the amazing European bakeries and the decor and aesthetic inside are awesome. I would highly recommend stopping in, I'm certain it won't be your last.

Excellent pastries. The almond chocolate croissant was out of this world. I also had the raspberry tart, amazing. Right as we got there they gave us a free sample and I was hooked. Friendly folks with great pastries.
Amazing sandwiches. Bread is so soft and delicious.  Got the turkey pesto.  At first I wasn't impressed by how it looked...but once I ate it, I wanted a second.

This is my first time and I completely lose it ..... I got 4 in once. The smell is so good, the pastry is crunchy, and the filling is rich and tasty! I've been looking for a good pastry place for a long time! This is the place!

Ok first things first. How I found this star bakery? YELPED ittttt. I walk in to this amazing sweet smelling French bakery. The first thing I noticed was how delicious it smelled. Ok who am I kidding.  First thing I noticed was cutie pie behind the glass in the black beret to my left. "Voulez vous ku che avec moi c'est soi" The aroma of sweet smelling bread just lured me in with every breath and every step to my chosen pastry. Which I just noticed is not on display anymore!! hmmm were they just selling me the oldies but goodies?? I don't care!! It was delicious anyway!! I'll do my best at explaining it to you. The pastry resembles a flat cinnamon roll, minus the sugary coating. With little round chocolates in between the creases. The bread was moisty moist. Not too sweet just perfect. On top drizzled lightly white crocodile. Jk I meant to write white chocolate but auto correct wrote so I kept in in hopes someone will find it entertaining. Or chuckle with an inner laugh or a LOL one.Behind the glass everything looks so tasty. It is too. The little pastries are just that small and deli. The super friendly guy. He was all smiles from the moment I walked in. It was almost as if I'd walked into another country all together, like maybe Paris?? Or a different era. There was a ‍ lady too, next to the happy  , she also giggled with us. There's definitely something special about a place when you walk in and it takes few words to burst into pure giggles. He was so sweet get it? The sweet pastry shop? Ok so he let me sample the croissant. It was like the movies. The croissant made a perfect crunch in my mouth. Then I sampled the brioche. Another super soft yummy thing. How shall I leave you today? With a soft suttle exit maybe a on the cheek. These wordz maybe. I'm a ‍of wordz thanks to my Yelp review today.(that's supposed to be a wizard) Thanks for reading!!! Come by Les Gourmands French Family Bakery and sample for yourself!! You won't be dissatisfied!! Arrivederci! Bonjourne!! I just stopped to read other reviews. I'm goin back in folks haha..for a financier and a choquette lol. Lez do thiz thang.  Ciao bello!! Très bon !! Très jolie soirée !! I don't know what soire means I just wrote it k bye!!

Was looking for a French bakery, and this place nails it. I'll be back again soon for an indulgence, but perhaps not on a regular basis due to the cost.Clean place with friendly, knowledgeable staff. I was given a few samples, which the staff (I believe perhaps the owner) cut right from items on display. The mini, sugared "Courgettes" (like a gougere but puffier and with large sugar flakes on top) were perfect in texture. The regular croissant was very flakey and buttery, but didn't quite tear apart under my teeth as I would've hoped for, but a 90% nonetheless. For a large pastry and a Courgette, I paid $7.00. They were divine, but with prices clearly above Tartine prices, I wouldn't be able to come here as often as I'd like.
We live nearby and go often. So glad they started selling bread/baguettes because they are THE BEST. Pastries and croissants are all delicious.

Great delicious pastry! I've stopped here multiple times to get their almond croissant, as well as the regular one. They deserve all 5 stars for pastry no question. But I am taking 2 stars away for unethical customer treatment. When I asked if they have a coffee today, they showed me a pot with a regular drip coffee. I said sure. They quickly added it to the bill and swiped my card. My card was already processed when I saw that coffee was $4. Small drip black coffee cup. I am ok paying this money for hand crafted coffee, and when a price is stated to me in advance. This however felt like taking advantage of your customers. This treatment gives me a feeling they might be having hard time staying in business an acting desperate.

Loveliest spot and everything is great about it! Fromstaff to feathery, fresh, and warming selection! Would choose this place over and over once close by and bring friends. Thank you for your wonderful coffee shop and hospitality. I wish you unprecedented success!
Love the pastries, just the right amount of everything.  So light and crisp. The bread is amazing as well.
Love this place. If I could afford a constantly expanding wardrobe, I'd eat everything they made, every day.
Do yourself a favor and go here. The folks who work here are fabulous and their pastries are LITERALLY as good as it gets.

Just moved into the area and was drawn in by a free coffee w/pastries sign (a Monday special). I used to live in France and generally have low expectations re: French bakeries in the US, but Les Gourmands was the best surprise! I got their mini amandes, which was perfect and generous with the almond paste. I will definitely be back very soon!

Owned and operated by French expatriates, one of them a fifth generation Baker, it was with heightened expectations that Les Gourmands was entered Tuesday morning, the location at 280 5th Street a bit difficult to access by car during rush hour but at the same time resulting in high foot traffic and fresh selections continuously being baked to replete supplies.Decorated by an artist known as Nairone, his minimalist approach allowing focus to remain squarely on Tarts and Viennoiseries spread across a lengthy counter with names and prices displayed on small stands, it was while perusing the options that a woman identifying herself as Catherine offered guests samples, the corner of an Apricot Croissant crunchy and well-laminated with just a bit of Jam adding sweetness.Located at one of SoMa's most bustling intersections and thus able to justify higher prices than the typical Bakery, $7.80 per Tart and $5.00-$7.00 per Croissant on par with Tartine and more than Neigbor or b.patisserie, it was after assessing the choices that nearly $30 was invested, first bites of the Almond Apricot Tart finding Preserves relegated to the center and the edges a little dried out though the flavor was pleasant.Continuing with Fruit, a $6.40 Chausson Aux Pommes challenging Les Gourmands assertion that everything is organic and locally sourced since the interior tastes like store-bought Pie Filling, it is fortunate that the seasonal Chestnut variety fared much better as a result of toasty Cream inside crunchy, separated layers.Apparently hiring only "zero experience" bakers according to their website, an 18-month apprenticeship intended to train new artisans while also decreasing labor costs, it was while watching one man coach another in back that the "Almond Croissant" was cut in half, the thick Custard not only unexpected but overcooked while the $1 Chouquettes fortunately lived up to their acclaim as one of The Bay Area's best baked goods thanks to a golden exterior flecked by Sugar Pearls and an center that is eggy yet open and light.
So much fun to sample, then to fill a box of delish French baked goods to nibble on and then to bring gifts home to my family.

Yikes, three check-ins here, at least as I'm writing this review. A dangerous place but in a good way as this is as true a French bakery as you could find in these parts. If I close my eyes, I can pretend I'm in a back alley of Montmartre watching Gene Kelly dance with Leslie Caron and uttering in French, "Hey you two, knock it off! We have public decency laws around here!" But alas, I open my eyes and I'm in SoMa where the fecal matter piles high as an elephant's eye. For the past couple of years, the operation has been owned by fifth-generation baker Sylvain Chaillout and his parents.Their craftsmanship is quite evident the moment you start perusing the pastries through the display window (photo). They're hard to ignore especially if you're in a "I know I shouldn't..." mood. On my virginal visit, I thought I'll try a $1 Chouquette because they looked cute and puffy like a mini-cream puff made of pate a choux (photo:?bit.ly/2WQpnpI). Sylvain looked at my modest order and gave me a complimentary one for good measure. Generous and they were bitefuls of Gallic joy. On my second visit a month later, I saw I could get five Financiers for $8. Financiers? Sounds like a Wall Street pyramid scam.They're actually small French almond confections somewhere between cakes and a cookies. Imagine my joie de vivre when I got home and found a dozen in my little bag (photo: bit.ly/2I4cEMO). That Sylvain. Very generous though it felt like a cautionary tale for me as I started eating them like Pringles potato chips. So buttery, a lot like Madeleines but with a Paula Deen bitch slap to them. So on my most recent visit yesterday, I went whole hog and ordered the $5.50 Oranais, an elaborate vanilla croissant-like treat with apricots (photo: bit.ly/2WJtUdI). So flaky, so messy, so tasty. Si mechant, si bon...PASTRIES - 4 stars...the craftsmanship was up there and so were the decadently buttery flavorsAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...prime corner SoMa location but that high sneeze guard is absolutely necessary if you know what I meanSERVICE - 5 stars...Sylvain knows a repeat customer when he sees oneTOTAL - 4 stars...plaisirs décadents en françaisRELATED - Exploring this part of SoMa? Here's a collection of places I've visited and reviewed: bit.ly/2H0vGTV

The Almond chocolat croissant was so good! The orange brioche was meh, but the lemon brioche was pretty good.The ham & cheese twist was pretty yummy as a savory treat. It's super hot inside this place! They have a free small coffee on Mondays and they have some good beans here!
I love this place! Great selection of tea offerings and they have really cute gift boxes too. My favorite is the wellness and serenity tea. Highly Recommend!

Great tea selection and they give you samples if you ask. I always come by here whenever I want tea. Better yet, if you aren't sure what you want but describe what you want the tea for or what flavor profile you like, they'll go ahead and make a lot of suggestions.Definitely recommend coming here if you want to pick up loose leaf tea.

Awesome hidden gem in the neighborhood. They let you sample teas and they have lots. I was in a rush but couldn't decide so I picked up a few blooming teas that they had prepackaged. Many teas with fruit flavors and higher qualities for those that are advance tea enthusiasts. They definitely have a customer base, while I was in the shop, a return customer came in and just read off her order and waited for it to be fulfilled.

Excellent sampling service and mini lessons of various teas. I will be back soon to purchase, as soon as I force myself to finish off my tea bags at home. Wanting to switch from bags to loose tea (upon hearing lecture from visiting cousin).

You get to try all the types of tea they have and the owner takes her time to explain the different type and how they could be beneficial for your health.  They don't have cheap prices but quality stuff so don't expect run of the mill products either.

Amazing service and selection of tea! I know nothing about tea and the lady was very patient and explained to us all different types of tea. We also told her we didn't plan on buying much tea and just came to learn more about it and she still let us try like 10 different types of tea.
The person helping me was super nice and gave me a cup of tea (of course i had to pay). Also. Picked up some super good peach flavored tea. Yum

You gotta love a legitimate tea place.  I walked in and said my ailments and she (Ying) told me which tea would work for me and the benefits.  I asked for some sugar or honey. She said NOPE this is a traditional real place. She said you need the taste the full flavor of the tea. I got a cup of the bitter tea. It taste very bitter but my cough seems to have settled down. She also gave us some information about the Pur Eh tea and why she enjoyed that tea.  We had a sample it was very nice. If I lived in this area I would be a regular at this place.

This place is amazing! I found out about this place because of a video Tasty posted on Facebook. Jenny helped me out today and has great customer service. She asked what type of teas I'm used to and then suggested some and let me taste them. There were other people there so whatever they wanted to taste she also let me taste. If she's doing a pot of tea why not let everyone taste lol. Awesome. She's very knowledgeable regarding the teas. I loved it here. I want to show it off to everyone. The teas are the best around. Very worth your money. Sorry I didn't tip you Jenny, next time I'll make sure to take enough money.

*** In Short ***Long-time neighborhood shop offering an extensive array and knowledge of teas.*** In Depth ***Having eaten in the area many times over the years, I've seen and passed by Aroma countless times, but never actually gone in. Not that I have a dislike of tea: far from it! But it was only until recently, learning that tea *wasn't* the cause of my teeth stains, that I started getting back into it. And what better way than to stock up on loose leaf teas?!Stopping in one day after lunch nearby, my friend and I sat down to a (free!) tea tasting session with the surprisingly hip and hilarious owner of the shop, sampling almost a dozen varietals, and learning quite a bit about the origins and differences during that process.With so many teas available, ranging all across the quality spectrum, it can definitely be hard to choose, but they help find tea samples that meet your particular interests. That said, even that can be a little off, as I didn't like most of the initial teas enough to commit, only coming across a couple at the very end of my tasting session. Part of the reason for this is probably due to them brewing a much stronger tea than I myself prefer, so keep that in mind while taste testing.***Accessibility Info***Venue - Not very large, but very spacious, with just the single counter in the back for the register and tea tasting, so accessibility shouldn't be too big an issue.Bathroom - Don't think they actually have a public one.

Free tea tasting? Hands down best tea shop in the city the owner is very knowledgeable and an expert when it comes to the teas. Whenever I'm in the clement area I always take a second to visit the tea shop. During my visit I usually get offered a teacup sample of a different tea. blue people tea is my favorite and is a must try when visiting. They also have a variety of tea sets and tools. I love that you can buy the loose leaf teas by the weight, I always make jokes about buying an  1/8th of loose leaf when visiting (I work with cannabis)

This is a really fantastic tea shop, decently priced and Hayman really knows his stuff. They're constantly brewing tea so you really get a feel for what you're getting (and might find a few you didn't know you needed!) love it
Had a great time today at this place. Very educational tea tasting, the couple that was attending to us were the owners of the shop and they were very nice.

Visited this shop during a stay a few years ago. BEST DAY EVER. Sat with the owner and his friend and sampled 50+ teas. Told him what type I like and he found me two new favorites. Left so satisfied and such a fun experience!Fast forward two years and I'm out of tea. I see they have a holiday discount online and fill my cart. I wait too long, the code expires. I email and they reinstate it for me! I paid for standard shipping, and they rush shipped it anyway. Such good customer service and as always, the teas speak for themselves. Gave two tea sets as gifts and both recipients are over the moon. I cannot recommend this shop in person or online enough!

Aroma Tea Shop on 6th is - in this Yelpist's humble opinion - a national treasure.  Truly exceptional customer service combined with an extensive and high quality selection of teas make for an unforgettable experience.  Whether you are a tea connoisseur or just a casual sipper, your visit to Aroma Tea Shop will make you smarter and your day better.Tucked away on 6th, right off of the hustle and bustle of Clement, is the wide-windowed, yellow canopied storefront that can best be described as being to tea what the Library of Alexandria was to books prior to its tragic immolation.  This tiny storefront contains a magnificent collection of the finest and most desirable cured leaves of Camilia Senensis.The store, as one of the owners Haymen kindly explained to me upon one visit, is set up in many ways like a modern dispensary.  Canisters of tea and a small selection of brewing and drinking-ware line the walls of this tiny tea shop.  The centerpiece of the store is a tasting bar, where up to four people can comfortably sit and sample teas of their choice or, better yet, teas recommended by whoever is working.Your dialogue with the host over tiny steaming cups of freshly brewed tea is the real heart and soul of the Aroma Tea Shop experience.  No matter who your host is, they are going to know everything you could possibly want to know about all of the available varieties, and they are more than happy to share this wealth of knowledge with anyone who cares to inquire.  It's basically like going to a bar, except your bartender is serving you free samples of finely aged Scotch from his private reserves, which he picked up during his latest trip to Scotland, and telling you all about it.  And instead of getting wasted, you are being uplifted by the soothing smells and flavors of teas of all varieties.  Time flies as your senses are stimulated and your mind expanded by taste after taste of Aroma Tea Shop's carefully cultivated selection.My recommendation is that you go when you've got time to kill.  I've easily ended up spending 45 minutes to an hour there every time I have gone, shooting the breeze, sipping brews, and educating myself one of the world's oldest and most popular beverages.  Be sure to buy a couple ounces and tip your host a dollar or two for providing a 5 star experience.  These people are experts without the snobbery, and their product is of the highest quality.

This amazing tea shop is a gem. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit with the proprietor who was quite knowledge and friendly. We sampled many delicious teas and left with about 8 different kinds. Highly recommended.

Haymen was a wonderful tea host, I didn't realize how much goes into the tea process, oxidation, drying / firing, its wonderfully interesting and greatly enjoyed the tea tasting he gave, pu-er was very interesting, tasted better then it smelled say the least, the mi xiang honey was one of my favorites also supreme zheng. So many choices and haymens passion and personality is enough in itself to return. Sadly I live on the east coast, plus side I can order online with FREE SHIPPING
Great selection of teas, and the girl that helped us was extremely knowledgeable.  I bought an Yixing clay tea pot and several teas, can't wait to use it.

Stopped in here to for the first time ever to buy some milk oolong and the counter person was in the middle of doing a tea tasting for a bunch of white dudebros. She was talking about the puerh like it was some kind of frat house challenge -- like "Oooh! This one is super stinky." She was also totally ignoring me & not making eye contact, so after waiting by the register for a few minutes I just left. I honestly do not feel the urge to ever come back - felt like a total tourist trap.

I thought this would be one of those intimidating places where the proprietor would try to explain the finer nuances of various tea leaves to which I would respond with a glazed stare. But no, the most intimidating part of the shop is the over 150 varieties of tea on display in various canisters with photos on their descriptive labels, most literal translations and others comically tongue-in-cheek. Jamie W. and I came here after stopping to smell the roses and whatever flora they have at the San Francisco Botanical Garden. The high praise on Yelp lured us in on a slow Saturday afternoon when we had the full attention of the very young staff (photo: bit.ly/2eDdrH8).There was no sighting of owner Haymen Da Luz, whom I heard was quite the colorful connoisseur, but his staff did him proud with their thorough descriptions and obliging behavior during our generous tea tasting. The selection covered the full range of loose leaf teas - jasmine, white, green oolong, black, pu-erh. We went for the sweeter ones like Chocolate Mint and Peach Momo White Tea (photo: bit.ly/2uKhQ12) before settling on a purchase of the Coconut Green Tea which was deliciously Mounds-like in flavor (photo: bit.ly/2ukLiZh). There were all kinds of tea accessories available including little clay pots and gaiwan sets (photo: bit.ly/2tPiOF9). It's definitely worth a return visit to get a further education on the joys of tea.TEA - 4 stars...really subtle flavors that linger in the palateAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...cute little space packed with quality...love how they explain they don't sell boba because their teas don't suck ballsSERVICE - 4 stars...informative and attentiveTOTAL - 4 stars...really a treat on a quiet afternoon if you don't overstay your welcome

I've always liked this place a lot, since it opened actually...The people working here are always very nice and inviting and make the coffee with great finesse and wonderful know how, like I trust that I'm going to enjoy my cup. This is probably one of the best places to have proper coffee drinks like when you ask for cappuccino, you're getting espresso with good foam, pinch of steamed milk. PerfectóAnyway I'm rambling, awesome place, awesome peeps and awesome location."You got it dudes" yeah I went there.
Great Americanos and friendly service in a cozy yet welcoming setting!  We enjoyed our chat with the barista, and appreciate the flyers about local events on the walls.

Love our hole in the wall mission coffee shops. Walked by after a filling meal but still couldn't resist getting a couple things!* Seaweed pastry (forgot the name!) - 3.5 starsThey usually run out of this early but I was able to get it at 2:30pm on a Saturday! It had an interesting savory filling, but it was a bit dry.* Cappuccino - 4.5 starsThey have great espresso drinks here. My favorite, we just noticed, is the cup that blatantly makes fun of Philz!

Good coffee but so much hatred inside on the walls towards the president no bueno.They need to just focus on there coffee and be more inclusive and loving even if they disagree with the president. Very sad.
Edgar was cool af. Good hire Nabeel. My mocha was perfect. Thanks for never using sugar that gives me cancers.  & keep up your high quality.

"We want to do a lot of stuff.... We're not in great shape... We didn't get a good night's sleep... We're a little depressed... Coffee solves all those problems in one delightful cup."  --Jerry SeinfeldI'm probably not cool enough to be a regular customer here, but I managed to pass under the radar and ordered the $3.25 Americano to my immense satisfaction (photo: bit.ly/2OGNjHV). That had a lot to do with the professionalism of the barista who made a point of treating all her customers equally. The space itself was tiny, but that didn't seem to bother the hipsters who were hanging out almost zombie-like against the wall. They just wouldn't get out of the way when I tried to reach for a cap for my cup. Don't worry, I'm cool.COFFEE - 4 stars...rich blend well turnedAMBIANCE - 3 stars...a little too compact with no place to sitSERVICE - 4 stars...a stellar baristaTOTAL - 4 stars...more hip than grand but grandly hipRELATED - There are a lot of places to get coffee in San Francisco. Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2v6aa8D
Casual delicious neighborhood coffee place with limited seats and friendly staff. Espresso-based drinks are top notch.
Hole in the wall place with reaaally good ice mochas. More of a grab and go place given that there isn't really any seating
Super friendly, and serve delicious lattes! The art in the walls is cool in this tiny spot.

Best coffee place in town. Great customer service. Love the ice mochas here.  I asked the barista what's good here. He asked me what I liked. I love chocolate and he whipped me up the best chocolate ice mocha you could think of.

Cute little hole in the wall coffee house ! I ordered the ice latte and my boyfriend ordered an espresso shot on ice, both drinks were made right away and tasted great! I just wish they had more room for seating.

It's a cute spot here with cassette tapes of jazz mixes with Duke Ellington and Ella Fitzgerald amongst the madness of the Mission. Try it out cause the owners are cool people, I got a good vibe from them. Dude made my almond milk latte really well, and the milk was nice and frothy, so I'm happy. A little pricey but I'm happy to support this little place!

Located on Mission Street (a few blocks north of the 24th Street BART station), Grand Coffee is a small shop that offers your usual coffee/espresso based-drinks. They also offer non-coffee beverages if that's your jam, but my guess that if you are choosing to visit a place with "coffee" in the title, you are looking for a cup of Joe. I've tried their regular coffee and their Americano, and I thought both were well done. The Americano was smooth and not overly acidic, and the coffee was good even without cream and sugar. They offer Cuban pastries as well, and while I haven't tried them, I thought it was great that they offered something different than your usual cafe snacks. The service has been consistently friendly when I've visited, and there's a casual and welcoming vibe to the place that makes it very appealing. It's a small space, so I don't think it'd be great if you are looking for a place to work for long periods of time. However, you should definitely check it out if you're in the area!
Best neighborhood coffee! Wonderful staff and delicious beverages. Not much room to sit, more a grab and go place. My dog loves to vacuum up the pastry crumbs outside!

Best small coffee shop in the Mission.  I don't drink lattes so I can't really comment on the milk drinks but the Americano was perfect.The best part is the staff; good, honest service without the pretense of the pour-over crowd.

I didn't have a chance to even try the coffee when I was getting close to buy the guy from the store told me in the most bad possible way we are closed. I've been to places where they even had the decency to hear what I have to say but this guy didn't even care. If I could I would go -1 in customer service.

My cappuccino was bad: it was not had and it had no foam at all. It tasted like coffee you would get at a gas station. My partner had a soy capp which was just as bad+they charge extra for soy milk. Too bad, I Iive close by and heard good things about this place. Im lucky I still have Linea
Great coffee. I'm a tea person and I can tell that this is not burnt, citrusy or bitter. A perfect cup made expediently and with care.
The barista was incredibly rude to my mother, and the coffee drinks were very bad. Everything tastes of burned coffee beans. No idea how this place is so highly rated. Go to ritual instead.
My favorite coffee shop in the Mission! The baristas are friendly and the service is amazing. Also I love the ambiance, its small but quaint in a way and I love the decor. Best local spot.
It's one of my favorite boba places in the city. I do recommend it.  I like the location by Octavia. The only problem is finding parking.  The drinks are good.

Heard about the hype and decided to give it a try since I frequent in SF. I came at 12 and there was absolutely no line! Got a dirty horchata and a lychee green tea with aloe. The drinks were very delicious and refreshingMy boyfriend got a strawberry drink it too was very good.Not sure what the hype is about 8/10 nothing crazy

One of the most hyped up boba spots I've ever been to. Every time my GF and I are in SF she always begs me to come here. But every time we pass by it there's ALWAYS a line out the door of 25 people or more. Finally got the chance to try this place today and over all it was pretty good. My girlfriend ordered the dirty horchata and I ordered strawberry tea Fresca (because I'm not much of a milk tea type of guy) both were delicious. Don't see why it's so hyped though but it did taste really good. I recommend going when they open to avoid the long lines. We arrived 10 minutes after they opened and there was no line.

This location is beautiful and trendier than the other shops! We had the korean banana milk and it was the right amount of sweetness, with a nice taste of real banana and creamy milk. We tried their in house boba for the first time and enjoyed the size of the boba but wish it was slightly more al dente. We enjoyed this location and wish it had more outlets for a place to do some work. Overall great spot for boba once again.

This location is probably my favorite one! The employees here are always super friendly and accommodating to your drink preferences and are so knowledgable about the menu and how each drink is made/tastes! I also like going to this location the most since it's one of the more spacious locations in SF. Parking around this neighborhood though can be very tough and tricky, so be careful! Drinks and service are always consistently great here and this location doesn't seem to get as crowded as the other locations around the city, so that's another plus. I just wish they started some sort of rewards programs for regular customers that come in a lot (more often than they should, AKA me).

Got the horchata drink, it wasn't very good, i'll have to stick with the traditional boba milk tea drinks.  Talking a step back, $7.00 for a boba drink I finished in 2 mins wan't very satisfying. 35% is just ice, talk about expensive ice.  The horchata boba drink had a weird sweetness I can't quit put my finger on. The inside is clean but not very comforting.  This will be my last time at a boba guys, though it was a nice run, from SF in 2015, to LA this year,  back to the Divisadero location, now officially hanging up in SF at this location.  Adios!

My dreams came true being able to come and try Boba Guys. Haha. I am such a boba fiend. But really the boba texture is incredible. Made in California. Just do it. Traditional teas and special seasonal menu items. It's a must try. And let's talk for a hot second about their reusable stainless steel boba straws, get one. Recommend the strawberry matcha Latte for caffeine. POG and strawberry rice milk for the non caffeine drinkers.
Get my boba fixed in weekend! I like this location because is never get crowded. The drinks are WAY better than San Ramon. Quick service and easy to find parking.
The girl was so rude that worked here and the tea wasn't all that. I went because it's hyped up but my experience sucked lol

Favorite boba place in the city, and I'll tell ya I'm ADDICTED to boba. I get weird with a Lavender Rose mix with almond milk and of course boba toppings. My only wish is that they sold boba before 11 cause then I could pick up boba before work, but I guess I should thank them for that cause otherwise I'd be broke ‍

I love boba guys but I recently came here and felt like the quality wasn't as good. Maybe it's just this location compared to others, idk. I always order the jasmine milk tea with boba. However, my drink tasted like it was mostly milk and barely had any tea flavor. The boba was softer than usual (not as chewy). Not the best but I still love other boba guys locations.

Boba guys is one of my favorite boba shops around! I was looking forward to trying the new spring/summer flavors, especially the korean banana milk for a while, and finally tried it out. Got the large ($6) and it is NOTHING like korean banana milk. It should have been called banana bread milk or something. Take out the Korean!!! Nothing about it is korean!! The bananas tasted fermented or super old and had an almost bitter taste (?). I love boba guys but this drink did not meet expectations. I drank a couple sips and threw it away. I'll probably only stick to my regulars for now. So don't get this if you're expecting the korean banana milk taste.
We got the strawberry matcha milk tea and jasmine milk tea. Got less sweet and it was perfect

every time i go here, an hour later, I get a sore throat.especially if the short Asian guy with glasses works there, or the tall Caucasian female with the green tipped hair works there.I suspect it's the Asian guy with hipster black glasses causing it.EVERY TIME.they have a good sanitary score, and I'm not allergic to dairy or anything, so it HAS to be him...I've had drinks at ALL boba places in san Francisco, but this Boba Guys is the ONLY ONE that gives me a sore throat EVERY TIME.what the h3ll do they put in their drinks??Department of Public Health anyone?

Really like boba guys but made an order for a party and they cancelled my order. I seen people make many orders but I tried to get boba as a team building opportunity but I feel disappointed. May need sometime before I give it another shot.
false advertising. they do not deliver through Postmates. we put in an order at 10am they cancelled it at 12:30. A $110 order. Apparently, they would rather deliver disappointment.

I used to love this place but after this incident, I have a bad taste in my mouth about boba guys. My work decided to have a little "boba party" and so we ordered on postmates about 2 hours before we wanted it delivered (we ordered at 10am to be delivered around 12-12:30pm). The order went in to boba guys but boba guys decided to cancel the order at 12:51pm, which is already almost an hour after when it was supposed to be delivered. If they had let us know there was an issue after we had put the order in, then I wouldn't have a problem but the fact that they let us know AFTER it was already supposed to be delivered is ridiculous and awful customer service. We gave them two hours to notify us of any issues. On top of that, their phone number isn't a real landline so you only have the option to leave a voicemail or email them, never speaking to an actual employee for help.

As locations pop up, the quality of this place is going down. I ordered two drinks: black sesame latte with boba and almond jelly, green tea latte with almond milkBlack sesame latte came with no boba in it.Green tea late lacked green tea flavor. Basically like we're drinking green almond milk.Definitely thinking twice before coming back to this location. Hopefully it's just this time.

You can never go wrong at Boba Guys! I ordered the Matcha de Leche (iced) and enjoyed it! If you like matcha, then you'll enjoy this drink too! The mochi donut (Mango Passionfruit) from Third Culture Bakery was superb! If you like the fruity taste, then order this donut! Can't wait until I go back for the drinks and donuts!

Tried Boba Guys today for the first time. I'm usually a matcha girl but was feeling adventurous so I got the Ube Halaya and my partner got the Korean Banana milk (with oat milk). We both ordered normal sweetness levels but mine was iNsAneLy sweet and his was hardly sweet at all. Both of them were a bit grainy as well. I would probably try this place one more time for the matcha which I hear is really good but my expectations are much lower. The shop has a great, instagram-worthy vibe to it which I really enjoyed but the drinks were just so-so. Not worth $13 for two drinks.

Probably the most inexpensive and very fresh sandwiches i had in the neighborhood. The prices here are so low you might not believe it. But the sandwich i had yesterday was the super fresh. The bread was soft the tomatoes were ripe and the meat was nice. If i want something fresh and tasty on a low budget this is the place  i am gonna be.

Quaint little cafe. Stumbled upon it just being in the neighborhood and craving a breakfast sandwich. It did the job and satisfied our taste buds. They also sell good coffee. I can't remember the brand but it was something local like Ritual or Bicycle (don't quote me on that!).

Nice neighborhood coffee shop. Came here while waiting for Hong Kong lounge II. I love that the coffee and items here are not expensive and the staff were very friendly.More of a temporary place to stop and get coffee / food with friends, maybe to go. Not a place to work from a laptop.I got the house latte which was delicious! They sell bicycle coffee and it's great. Service can be a liiiittle slow.

Tiny and good!I was in this neighborhood and desperate for coffee and small bite for breakfast. Someone waiting for her bus pointed me to Earth's Coffee. This place is almost easy to miss because it is in a subbasement like space and it is small. It is a family run business and the young lady who is at the counter is an amazing multitasker. She takes care of everyone's orders, and greets all the regulars at personal level and they seem to like her.I ordered my coffee and it was so good that I decided to have a small breakfast and sit, eat drink my coffee and watch people walk by for a few minutes; All good!Bottom line, great one stop shop if you are in a rush.

Found this gem walking down the street. My friend and I were waiting for a table near by so we thought why not check this place out and it was so worth it! I got the Thai tea 20oz ($3?) and my friend got a chai latte. I only had one sip of the chai but for what I remember it was pretty decent BUT OMG THE THAI TEA it was so delicious! It was a little on the sweet side but I have a giant sweet tooth so it doesn't bother me that much. It had a strong tea flavor which I appreciated. Also saw that they have ice cream? I can't wait to go back and try their ice cream

I always walk right by this place and mean to step in. It's a bright, well-lit cafe full of plants, some seating, and a neighborhood vibe without neighborhood prices.A large Thai Ice Tea is only $3.50!! A small steal in this city. Milk substitutions are only $0.35 cents and they have both almond and soy. Their chai was good as well, but ran a bit on the sweet side so ask for less sugar if you're looking for something more earthy.
Such great and fresh sandwiches, love the tuna and egg salad sandwich. Also an incredibly friendly staff. So happy this is in my neighborhood.
Good food and drinks but the internet is too slow to use... I would come here much more if the internet were usable.
