Lots of coffee shops near by, for the best quality, service and prices. Earth coffee is by far the best around.

This place is great!  I popped in on a Monday afternoon after a doctor's appointment at CPMC, and was pleased.  My ginger chai was delicious, and my maple doughnut was pretty good too.  The service was very friendly, and they brought my drink out to my table, which was nice.
Best place to get sandwiches! I bring all my friends and coworkers here and they always ask to go again. Great family run place! I stop by usually one a week or so, alway delicious!

Such an awesome place!! Came by during one of my lunch breaks and ordered the tuna sandwich on wheat bread. Not only was this some the of freshest tuna, but the order was put together within 5 minutes. I didn't even have a chance to take a seat, as I heard my order being called. When I unraveled the sandwich at my desk, the tuna was splurging out. It was easy to tell that they weren't greedy with their portions. All the veggies tasted super fresh and the bread was toasted to perfection, making the entire sandwich just excellent. The price was also very decent, as the sandwich was worth every penny. I can't wait to stop by again and try another item from their menu. Totally recommend this place if you're looking for a quick bite to eat around the area.

I walked in here after having lunch at Native Burger a couple of doors down. I wanted my daily fix (java) & after perusing the drink menu, Ginger Latte, caught my eye. I order one with non-fat milk & to my surprise it was absolutely delightful. I will order again. Not too strong, you can definitely taste the ginger, just right.
This place is awesome. Filled with good food, smiles and quick service. The lady behind the counter is always happy...and my kids love coming here to eat early morning donuts ;)

I came here around noon after completing some work nearby at the Indian consulate. I ordered a cuppacino and a turkey sandwich on Some bread (can't remember it's name). The coffee was great and the sandwich tasted very fresh and nice. Would definitely recommend it.
Teas are fantastic here and the workers always kind and great at their job. Love coming by here on my way home from work.

Walked by this place and the look of it intrigued me -- it looks homey. I'm glad I looked it up because I saw they have a ginger chai latte so I walked back to try it! I love chai tea lattes but am constantly disappointed that most places sell milk flavored chai rather than chai lattes with strong spices and ginger flavors. I got a ginger chai with whole milk and my friend got a ginger chai with almond milk. Assuming both drinks were made with equal chai ingredients, I think the almond milk let the chai flavors through more whereas the chai flavors were more masked by my whole milk. It was definitely good with the ginger flavors, but still not as good as the chai from Samovar (they're the same price)Ugh at the $5 minimum to use a credit card Friendly, prompt service

I am vegetarian and this was my to-go place when I worked down the street. If you are looking for fresh and fast, ---this is it! Also the business owner runs the place all on her own and she is amazing!
Consistently awesome coffee. Always get cappuccino here. I wouldn't recommend eating here though - I ordered an egg sandwich once and saw eggs warmed in the microwave...

Came here to get some work done. Stable wifi, 7 download speed, 1 up, locked with password, and since it's small place, few if anyone else competing for bandwidth.  Music isn't loud, not distracting.Veggie sandwich is very good, would order again.Friendly fast service.
Stopped in for a quick latte and nibble on our way to the ferry. I got a dirty chai latte- fantastic. Quick and friendly service, as well as an amazing book collection!
Love this spot! They are friendly. Great experience, a very cute space with amazing coffee. I felt so cozy at outside.

A bit off the beaten path that most tourists take (unless you're on the way to Fish), but definitely worth it! A cute interior despite its very bland and structured exterior. The drink of the month was a Rosé Latte, but it's made with rose extract, nothing alcohol related. (When I asked the reason for that, the barista just chucked and said "It sounds fancy.") We got a hot Rosé Latte and iced Vanilla Latte, and both were delicious! Light, flavorful, and very creamy; I'd definitely purchase more if I lived in SF!Also, shut the door after you walk it; it doesn't close by itself, so save everyone else a chilly moment.
Solid coffee, cute and comfy atmosphere! The lattes with house made rose and vanilla syrup were delicious. Friendly and quick service. Wish I lived in the area so that I could come back more!

This is by far the BEST coffee I have ever tasted. Omg!!! The pour over was amazing. It tasted so fresh and light and just delicious. The salted chocolates that they had with it paired perfectly with it. I didn't need any cream or sugar in to coffee. My husband ordered the Vietnamese coffee. This was also very delicious. Wasn't overly sweet and strong like vietnamese coffee should beCustomer service blew my mind! Greeted right away, given heads up on length of time, etc. They even checked up on me like a restaurant would!I truly wish there was a spot like this where I lived.
The. Best. Coffee. I had a perfect cappuccino. Unfortunately they forget my quiche in the microwave, it was a bit nuked.  Music was a bit loud.  However, the coffee is 100 percent worth it.
Cute little cafe next to the Firehouse. The Ethiopian coffee was amazing and just had to rate them. Great service and would definitely be back when I'm in Sausalito.

WHOAAAA!!!! This place was awesome! Stopped by here because my wife was in the mood for coffee. Saw the amazing reviews and was not steered wrong. Upon walking through the door, I was already blown away by the space. It very big. It's a great place to relax and not be overwhelmed if there's a ton of people in. I didn't look at the menu, but my wife stated they had Vietnamese iced coffee (which is my favorite). Although it was not a Vietnamese spot, they hit this one right on the nail. It was the perfect balance of sweet, creamy, and strong. I swear, they did this coffee better than most Vietnamese places I have gone.My wife ordered the pour over. It took a lil long to receive (they did give us warning), I think it was totally worth it. I only took a sip of hers since she drinks black coffee, but it was so smooth. You really didn't need any additives to it at all. The owner/manager saw that she was IGing the place and bc she was, he offered her a piece of chocolate. I have no idea what chocolate it was but it was the best dang chocolate I tasted. I do wish there was a place like this where I lived.

Best. Cappuccino. Ever. Sweet laid back atmosphere, nice music, local flavor. Not quite on the main half mile of tourist shops but it was packed. Service was super quick, I ordered, paid and before I made it to the end of the pick up area my drink was up. Staff were super friendly. I would definitely stop in again when in the area.

This is our regular coffee shop in Sausalito and we love it!!! Equator coffee is fantastic but mainly the guys that work there are all so friendly and happy.They also have delicious dog treats for my Bulldog! So he's a happy client too!

Casual light coffee place with great coffee and an even better patioThis place is really cool; especially if you are planning on spending some time there! They have a large really nice patio that makes you wonder if this place should do more than just coffee! But that's all they do now and they don't really well. I got my cappuccino to go and I have recently gotten over my habit of adding stevia to my coffee. The cappuccino was delicious and I was really able to enjoy this one without adding anything to it

This is the best coffee house in Sausalito . I talked to the owner and he's a nice guy . I found out it's a family business and I was happy with the coffee flavor . It's great . I will be back soon with my fiends .

We had the most wonderful experience with the team at Firehouse Coffee & Tea last weekend. "The Ethiopian drip coffee is the best cup of coffee I've ever had." Additionally, I highlight recommend the Summertime in the City tea!What was more special than the incredible food (from Victoria's) and beverages from Firehouse, was the incredible hospitality and excellent service from DJ and the team. Thank you so much! We can't recommend a better spot in Sausalito (or anywhere else). Excellent!!

Wow such a cute little coffee shop connected to the Firehouse (hence the name) in Sausalito!Been living in SF for over a year now and finally decided to check out the other side of the Golden Gate Bridge. First stop, a cute coffee shop.This place checked off my list perfectly and exceeded my expectations. First, they have cool options to choose from (I love when Coffee shops do this) - they even had a drink infused with CBD - WHAT! I ordered something basic but good - Iced Honey Lavender Latte with OAT milk :D +10 bonus points from me. Cashier and baristas were super friendly. Drink was delicious, my friends ordered the Vietnamese coffee (so good, my friend ordered a second one in the time we were here). To top it off, we enjoyed it in the nice sun of their outside patio area!

After realizing Point Bonita Lighthouse was closed on Wednesday, it was an easy decision to reroute to five-star rated Firehouse Coffee & Tea. Between surrounding police vehicles and it's tasteful red decor, the cafe was easy to find. Menu offers standard cafe fare, though there's enough variety from sweet treats to quiche and tamales to satisfy all cravings. I grabbed a large latte to warm up after being in the rain. It was pretty good, but nothing spectacular. My SO felt the same about his iced mocha. We thoroughly enjoyed our meals, chicken tamale for me, bacon and asparagus quiche for him. Overall, I'd come back if I'm ever in the area. The service is hospitable and the cafe has a vibe that encourages both productivity (free wifi for customers, smaller 2-person tables and a larger work area) and leisure (couches and magazines on coffee tables that make one feel at home).

Completely stellar coffee!! We stopped by twice when we were in town and loved the oat milk cappuccino. Cute guys working there and it's next to the fire station so let's be honest that all women should flock here!
Hot cocoa is really good.Banana bread is also tasty.A cup of tea in a rainy day is a perfect place to be.

So many things to love about Firehouse! Affordable quality coffee, friendly staff, and cozy atmosphere. I wish I lived closer to make this cafe my work spot! The couches are incredibly comfortable and many people are working on their laptops, so it's definitely a chill space.The staff was very nice and they provided recommendations. We could also see the baristas welcoming and engaging with most of the customers. This says a lot about them!

I've been visiting the Firehouse since they first opened and how lucky am I to live so close to their wonderful coffee house. As soon as one walks inside, it's a friendly ambiance and the staff and DJ (owner) is so welcoming. The coffees are super tasty and their meals delicious too! Aurelia offers superb service and is so personable and attentive to one's wishes. She makes each cup with precision. I highly recommend her ice vanilla lattes- they're divine! I enjoy going there for both a quiet time to work on my laptop and also during social hour with friends, its a perfect place to truly enjoy coffee & teas! :) Thank you Firehouse!

The staff here was so kind and nice ! As I love the sweetest things, I gave 4 stars. You'll love this place if you're a normal-taste-person tho! (Remember I'm a sugar digger) LOVER's LANE, love you forever :)
If you want boba, this is it. Don't play yourself. They also have a dope assortment of Togo snacks

Got the Korean banana milk tea. Service is great, and they give good recommendations. The line is pretty long--I think we waited about 20 min before ordering, and probably another 15 minutes before getting the drinks. The drinks were okay--Im not so sure that they were anything out of ordinary.

i love their strawberry matcha latte + boba! i think i just like the combination of strawberry puree, matcha, and milk, but boba guys' boba is also very nicely chewy and the right amount of sweetness for me. this is probably my favorite boba spot in sf (next favorite is asha in berkeley). i would imagine their jasmine milk tea is pretty good too, and i have friends who like their lychee milk tea if you like sweet stuff.

Crazy line outside. Small and very crowded inside. Had to wait in line for at least 20-30 minutes just for boba. Decent pricing and decent tasting. Not all that. Landlord next door was getting mad that at this place because people were blocking and in the way of residents who lived next door.

It's fine, but not sure what the hype is all about. Boba milk tea doesn't taste so different from other good places. They don't seal the lid, so don't plan to shake it up. Opens early but no boba served til after 11am.

First off, the guy taking the orders was very personable( I didn't catch the name)! He recommended us multiple drinks and seemed to know his stuff pretty well. We ended up getting 3 based on those recommendations and we were pleasantly surprised on how good they were! I got the strawberry matcha latte-definitely recommend this one! The wait time for drinks was within 6 mins, but maybe that's b/c we went right before the line started forming.

My first time trying Boba Guys was magical. I got the Strawberry Matcha (with Soy Milk bc I'm lactose intolerant) and it was the best decision of my entire life. The boba itself was perfectly made and it came in different sizes which is okay because we as humans also come in different sizes. The matcha to strawberry ratio was ideal and I was in absolute awe. Every sip I took was like a new experience and I am definitely coming more often. Devin is my favorite worker because he's so enthusiastic and hard-working. You see how long the line is yet they still manage to give you your boba in time :')

Preposterous! Someone actually modernize the old school boba flavor. I want to hate this but I can't. I've fallen in love like the way I fell in love with Octopath (my profile picture). Their Class Milk Tea with Boba is to die for. The line is to die for, literally because it's too long. I mean who would wait that long for a boba shop? I would, because this place is just great.

I fully expected not to like the strawberry matcha milk tea, but went with it on suggestion of other patrons and the employees. It was sweet, bitter, a little tart, creamy. The strawberry was a fantastic pair with the matcha. I can't wait until I'm back in San Fran to try more flavors.

So good! I got the Original Signature Milk Tea with boba (75%) sweetness and it was really good! My family orders the strawberry matcha latte and Ube drink!!  love Boba Guys and it's drinks never let me down!
Lines were pretty long (~30 mins wait) but I really like their Matcha Latte with oat milk. I wish they continue to have the Matcha Latte with caramel.

Came here in the morning for a strawberry matcha latte. Unfortunately, they don't offer the boba pearls until after 11am, so I went with almond jelly. I decided to opt for almond milk as well. Since this drink is one of their specials, you cannot customize the sweetness level, however, the employee was kind enough to decrease the strawberry puree to limit the sweetness level. The 3 colors of red, white, and green make this drink super picturesque (read Instagramable in this day and age), and you are recommended to mix the drink before enjoying. I'm a huge fan of both matcha and strawberry, and the marriage of the 2 made for a delightful drink. Really enjoyed!

Intro: San Fransisco has for the past 5-10 years been growing at a very high-speed rate and consequently become overly saturated in new businesses, one of which being boba shops.  It seems like nowadays a person could meander to the corner of a block and stumble upon a place that sells boba.  Boba Guys is one of those businesses that began during the tech industrialization of the Bay Area.  Since opening, they have crushed the boba game and have become an instant go-to whenever I am craving that good tapioca.  Drinks: Black milk tea is my choice of order whenever I pass by a Boba Guys.  I know, extremely basic but wait a minute, for good reason.  I've had the black milk teas of at least 70 different milk tea stores around the Bay Area throughout my lifetime, some good some bad.  Boba Guys hits it right on the money and delivers a great standard milk tea.  The tea flavor is strong but not overbearing to the point of bitterness, which is probably the most important attribute of any tea drink.  The boba is delectably chewy and slightly sweet, adding that fun and interactive part to your boba experience.  For sweetness, I like to choose 50% and let the tea, milk, and boba carry the other half of the load.  Overall, Boba Guys makes a brilliant black milk tea, one of the reasons why this store has become the boba Goliath it is today.

I didn't understand the hype until I tried Boba Guys. This location is hard to find but it's right next to the Stockton Tunnel. I ordered the Strawberry Matcha latte and the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea. The strawberry matcha drink was out of this world. I was surprised at what a delicious combination it was! People aren't kidding when they say this is good. The Hong Kong style milk tea is a pretty solid choice. It's a classic. I realized that even after the ice melted in my drink, it still tasted pretty good. I underestimated how good Boba Guys is. I would go back.
Obsessed with boba guys!! I tried the ube with oat milk. It was ok for me. What I'm obsessed about is the strawberry matcha with oat milk!! The best!

Good bubble tea for sure, but worth waiting in line for? Probably not. I visited their Union Square (Stockon St) location since my hotel was only a few blocks away. On a Saturday afternoon, there was a line of 20+ people outside. I decided to see what the hype was all about, since I had some time to kill. They have an efficient ordering system, with someone taking orders from people in line. So even with 20+ ppl, the actual wait was only maybe 15 minutes. Boba Guys has some interesting drinks that I don't often see at other places. I opted to try one such drink: strawberry matcha latte. It was good. Creamy and strawberry with some bitterness from the matcha. Good, but not wait 15 minutes for good. Overall, a Boba guys is an excellent bubble tea spot. Just don't expect much more than that - bubble tea. And probably not worth waiting in line for.

After trying this for the first time, I get the hype. I got the basic strawberry matcha with tapioca and it was really good. I didn't adjust the sugar so I was worried that it was going to be super sweet, but that wasn't the case. Their bubbles are cooked well. And despite getting the most basic drink, I do appreciate the variety on their menu. They are a bit slow though, given the number of employees they have working. I was at the front of the line so I didn't mind lol but I did see a few people behind me leave.

Got a small Jasmine milk tea with almond milk. Not creamy, tasted too sweet (got the recommended sugar level), and was watered down. I've had the strawberry matcha which is amazing but I guess their non-specialty drinks are meh.

Order: Jasmine Milk Tea with Oatly, 50% sweet50% was just right for me, and the tea flavor was there, but I couldn't tell if they forgot the Oatly or even just milk in general because it was so watered down and there was no creaminess whatsoever. I think the tea to milk ratio could definitely be improved. I do suspect that they did forget the Oatly since no oat/malty flavor was present whatsoever.
Really flavorful boba. CNA be really long line waiting at any time. Great for Instagram.

I'm not one to usually order a mocha but the barista spoke very highly of the chocolate they use so I took her recommendation. I was not disappointed- the drink was rich and velvety but not cloyingly sweet (something that often deters me from ordering mochas). Ambience and aesthetic were simple and clean with the succulents, the marble, and the accents of blue. Also, who doesn't love perfect cubes of ice?! It's all about the details. Would've given 5 stars but the prices were relatively high. Overall, definitely would come back!

Literally just walked by and decided to come in for a quick bite. I got the avocado toast and the matcha latte. They have a wide selection toasts and bowls. The toast had a lot of avocado and the chili flakes were actually a nice addition that I'm not used to. It is a little pricey from what I'm used to but still worth. They don't take cash as a warning. Food and drinks came out fast. Decor is cute and peaceful and workers are super nice. If I'm in the area I would definitely come back.

I am visiting San Francisco from Dallas, TX and this is a very cute coffee shop! They have gotten on the toast band wagon... I had the sliced banana, honey, cinnamon & almond butter. The only reason why I didn't give them five starts is that there is not a lot of room to sit. There is a small bar height table with stools that looks out to the street!!! I highly recommend this place the coffee & toast I had was awesome... I told my friend who lives in the city that it's a must try!!!

Avocado toast was great, so was that banana toast.But what really makes this 5 star is the lounge next door, just walk you boxes items into the hotel lounge and enjoy the plush seating and good tunes while sipping your morning beverage of choice.Great quick bkfst spot!
This place is alright. The avocado toast was fine but nothing special. Chai latte was decent.

What a lovely, cozy little cafe! Great range of menu options across both the sweet and savory spectrums. Delicious coffee artfully crafted. Decor was warm and welcoming with plenty of seating options. The raspberry croissant was one of the most delicious pastries I've ever eaten! Would definitely come back again and hang out for a while for a peaceful and leisurely weekend breakfast.

super cool coffee shop / lounge , cold brew is on point and the cookies are bomb. as for service the gentleman that facilitated our order could not have been more pleasant . I'm certain our four day trip will include another visit. be well, pal!

So this place is new and it does not deserve the poor rating it has now.  The drip coffee is delicious and the avocado toast is piled high with avocado.  What more can you want???  I went yesterday and got a large drip coffee (Black).  I was told it was the Flagstaff roast.  Very smooth and flavorful.  The avocado toast had lots of flavor and there was sooo much avocado.  YUM!!!!  I love the backsplash behind the counter and the hotel it's connected to is doing a super cute display with books.  The space is small and there isn't a lot of seating.  It's not a place you go to camp out for hours.  I grabbed mine to-go and will definitely go back

While they have gluten free options and on trend lattes like the golden (turmeric) latte, the service was abysmal. The size "large" latte was equivalent to a Starbucks tall. When we checked to make sure we were receiving a "large", we got a very unfriendly and condescending reply.  Then they put the gluten free order on regular bread. When we went back to correct our item they promised, but then promptly forgot, to "run it right out" to us... it sat getting cold.  Additionally, if you want to sit and eat your food there you need to use the neighbor hotel's lobby/lounge. The lobby was lovely, though!Also, they over package and create too much waste. However, if you want it to go and they get your order correct, the food was good.

I love the aesthetic of this place - kinda obsessed with their paint job actually. The service is also super nice (although, lots of people working and not many customers - but I think they're just relatively new). Also, great and convenient location for me :DOrdered a large iced latte and a banana almond toast. The bread is too thick and doughy for almond butter. It's kind of a chore to chew on. Redeeming factor is that packaging is cool. My toast came in a slide out box! However, it seems we can't post boomerangs anymore :( Also, the large latte just seems like more milk more than anything. Not a huge fan. Would come back and adjust my order next time!

Surprisingly good, rating is worth it. We tried Beanstalk out for coffee/breakfast - nice light airy open location, collection of furniture that probably was hipster chic 18 months ago. Coffee was acceptably good, we were a little worried about the food options... we shouldn't have been, bagels/sandwiches were really really good.Boy had the Bush St with sausage - I hoped there'd be some leftovers - there weren't. Mrs had the Mina's Veggie - again I hoped for leftovers, and again I was disappointed.

I've passed by Beanstalk Cafe almost every week and I've noticed a pretty good amount of people always inside...so on this nice, sunny San Francisco afternoon, I decided to give it a try - for an iced coffee.Walking in, it's a pretty spacious spot. There's ample tablespace to work or study and the interior is fairly quiet.I decided to order an iced coffee cola to go which features espresso, seltzer, Torini vanilla syrup, and ice for just over $5. Definitely make sure you shake it up or stir well as the syrup was on the bottom upon delivery. On first sip, it was pretty good! While the coffee overall wasn't too strong, the bubbles from the seltzer totally hit the spot this afternoon. Overall, I'd still choose Andytown's Snowy Plover in Sunset for a seltzer iced espresso, but it's nice to have this option available in the Richmond moving forward!

Food is alright, service is pretty slow. When I went to order the other day, the guy at the register was too busy looking and texting on his cell phone and didn't realize we were waiting to order. Looks like a decent spot to work out of, but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit here again.

Coffee and sandwiches with beer & wine options.. I mainly come for breakfast the sandwiches are really good here,nothing fancy but they hit the spot..the coffee options here are pretty standard but they do have some stand outs i.e the coffee cola and the pour over coffee hit the spot..or even a reg iced brewed coffee, they also have good amount of sitting
Love the coffee and bagels! Staff is super nice. The cafe is a nice quiet place to study and has natural light which I really enjoy. One of my new favorite cafes.

This place has the nicest sandwiches in the Richmond. Possibly in the world. Everything about their sandwiches is so precisely perfect and fresh and crispy and tasty and mmmmmmm. Plus the lady who runs the place is super nice and they did a lovely job of the remodel and they serve Contraband coffee and the place is warm and inviting and clean clean clean.

I became a regular here really quickly in the 2 weeks of winter break I had from teaching. I needed a nice little spot I felt was cozy and comfortable enough to sit and do work but also drink enough coffee to keep me going and eat tons if needed. I really love their set up with their couches and lounge style chairs. They also have a long table set up where 8 people can sit at and then a few group tables as well. The first time I saw that there were little signs on the group tables saying reserved for groups so I didn't sit down and looked like an idiot standing there looking for somewhere to sit (place was packed) and the lady behind the counter told me not to worry that I could sit there but that they put the signs there to let other people know that it is a group setting table so if a group came you couldn't hog up the table. I was totally fine with that and down with sharing a table with anyone. It was awesome that this place was packed but still was peaceful. There were many people working but also a family in there as well with their kids just drinking some coffee and doing their thing. I think it's amazing how the atmosphere here is the same no matter what just really chill and everyone about sharing their space so everyone has space. Oh now on to the things I ordered: Mint Mojito Iced Coffee: So I ordered this here because this is my usual coffee at Philz and I wanted to see how someone else did it and I actually like this one much better. The mint flavor wasn't as overpowering which made it taste really nice. It was the perfect balanceRegular dark roast roast of the day: I love my coffee black and each time I go their dark roast of the day es muy muy delicioso. The darkness of the coffee matched the darkness of my mood of having to do work on my breakBagel Sando: I kinda rolled my eyes that the sandwich is called a Sando but then I remembered there are people like Rachel Ray who say things like EVOO and that's the norm now. I'm from the east coast so I always judge bagels anywhere else but the sesame bagel was delicious. I got bacon in my bagel sandwich and it was the perfect bacony goodness.
Awesome breakfast sandwiches: pastrami, sausage & co. Try the morning glory as well on the sweet side.
The food and coffee are good, the space is cute and pleasant. The reason it's not my go-to coffee shop is the shoddy wifi. It's a major disappointment, I cannot get my work done here.
What a cute cafe in a neighborhood location. The owners are so friendly and make a great latte with Contraband coffee. Perfect for a work spot at breakfast or lunch.
Nice neighborhood cafe. Coffee is delicious. Comfortable seating. Relaxed casual vibe with comfortable seating and some outdoor seating. Close to Mountain Park, to grab a coffee for a walk.

This cafe is exactly 1/4 of the distance from my place to GGPark. The perfect location to fill my desire, NO need for espresso! Let's face the facts: 1. It is a cute, relatively new, cafe in my section of town; 2. They make a solid espresso and a very good cappuccino; 3. Lots of seating; 4. The staff is very welcoming (of course, I never go anywhere during rush hour.) I would say the music is hit or miss, There are few plugs. So, not as many squatters as other cafes. Which is Great news!! So, give it a try. I think you'll like it.

Pro:  charming and peaceful atmosphere Cons:  poor WiFi, incorrect hours listed so I had to leave soon after arriving..I would have chosen another café had I known they were closing 1.5 hrs before posted time.  Also did not love the $6+ matcha latte
Love the coffee! Great variety of sandwiches too!They have WiFi  and variety of tables for small and large groups. Great meeting place and also table outside for keeping your 4 legged friend company.

I've been coming here for some time now. This is an updated review.In a good way, not much has changed. The food and coffee have both been consistently good. I'm here a couple times a month, and have yet to be disappointed.INTERIOR:Large windows, spacious, industrial shabby-chic. The door and windows face north, so it never gets direct sunlight--might be a good thing if you're trying to use a computer next to the window. But it often feels cold, would bring an extra layer when visiting.  Otherwise, it is quite comfortable. THINGS TO IMPROVE:1. Faster InternetMany people come here to use their computers; and unsurprisingly, when that happens the internet gets real slow. Sometimes, it gets so bad that it becomes difficult to get work done. I've gotten so frustrated a couple of times where I went straight home to work.2. More power outletsThere are simply not enough of them for a space this size. Would definitely recommend making more of them available to the customers.
Tried this place out for a quick breakfast. Both my husband and I had the Cragel breakfast sandwich, mine with bacon and his with sausage. Pretty tasty!

Decent coffee. Hot matcha latte was a soothing experience for my friend with benefits, in the morning after a long night. Coffee tasted great and was a perfect temperature, as hot and tasty as the night beforeI had the iced coffee. Which was equally as satisfying. I ordered the bacon egg and cheese on everything bagel. Sandwich was great but the bacon was too chewy so I had to take it off the sandwich, but not too disappointing. Probably come back for coffee.
Great comfy place. The wine is a nice surpriseThe Bush Street sandwich is terrific. A mellow neighborhood vibe .

The food and drinks were expensive but the menu is extensive. I'm mostly shocked at the terrible service. Like other reviewers said, the staff are pretty indifferent... you could wait 10+ minutes with them talking to each other behind the counter in front of you and ignoring you. There was a line of people waiting a good 10+ minutes and they did not acknowledge anyone.But the strangest thing I saw while I was in there was that a group of people (I assume their friends) came in who they greeted warmly and then they asked two people who were ALREADY SITTING to get up and move so that group could sit there instead. I'm appalled, and I was just watching. Seems like they are CAPABLE of providing decent service.. as long as they know you. If they know you, not only will they come out from behind the counter to greet you but they will make other people who are already sitting get up so you can have those seats. But if they don't, good luck LOL. Hope no one they like more than you comes in otherwise you'll have to move.Shame because the lattes were cute and sandwiches were decent, although pricey.
It took the staff 30 minutes to make two breakfast bagels. It seemed everyone's order was taking that long as well. Place is nice but the service could use improvement.

Qualitea is situated in what otherwise is a vacuum for good boba (I'm not a fan of boba guys). On my most recent visit, I tried the lime sparkle made without yogurt and with less syrup + boba. The drink had a nice refreshing taste without being super sweet and the boba was of an appropriate texture.
I Ordered  the passion cooler, it was very good.Lots of boba, the ratio was just right.

The drinks are awesome! They deserve the name, it is really "Qulitea ". This is my first time to try this place, my wife and I loving and probably will come every weekend. The environment is nice and new. The most important thing is the workers are very polite and sweet, able to deliver good customer service that I never had in other boba shop. This is a MUST try place, definitely gonna recommend my friends to come. 10 out of 10!

Food: I got the Rose Petal with lychee topping. I think the drink was just okay. Price: Drink was 5.25 in total. I think that this price was tad expensive even with inflation going on.Service: Food came out at a decent time considering the fact that there was only one employee at the timeWould I come here again? probably. to try other flavors

Fantastic bubble/boba tea in the middle of a beautiful area. Staff is super accommodating, even made my girlfriend a brand new one (free of charge) when she just didn't enjoy what she ordered. Customer service like that is a rarity and it was very appreciated.

I only tried the matcha blossom and it was ok. The boba was hella good though great texture and slightly sweet, the chunky strawberry syrup was good as well, but once mixed with the matcha the whole thing has a super light watered down texture and taste..Definitely not like boba guys

Great addition the Castro! My only gripe is that their hours are off. They close at 8pm which is slightly bizarre since you'd think they'd want the after dinner dessert crowd, and they open a little later at noon, missing the pre lunch crowd (yes, it's a thing). Theyve missed out on my business a couple times just in the last month because of their hours.But their staff is great and super helpful

Best boba I have ever had!!!! I got the peach tea and it was so flavorful. The tea taste was strong unlike other places were it tastes watered down. The actual pearls were so good, perfect amount of sweetness and great texture. All the tea is brewed from fresh tea leaves and everything is organic. If you are in SF definitely stop by!

QualiTea is a boba shop located in the Castro district. Their drinks looked pretty decent on yelp, so I decided to give this place a try. I came on a weekend afternoon and it was fairly quiet. I ordered the "Matcha Blossom" - basically a strawberry matcha latte. Look wise - it's layered and pretty like boba guys. Unlike boba guys, the drink was super water downed and the strawberry puree did not taste like strawberry at all. I can't pinpoint what the drink tasted like, but the flavors did not jell with my tastebuds. The consistency of the boba was too hard for my liking as well.Maybe it was an off day? Who knows but I did not taste the quality at QualiTea.
This place has a nice variety with out it being overwhelming.   The girl behind the counter is really friendly and happy.  .

Cute little shop in the Castro. Came in on a rainy Friday afternoon. No line and no customers inside the store, there were plenty of tables and they had a wide selection of games to choose from, so it looks as if this place might get crowded possibly on the weekends or at nighttime. It's nice how they offer custom drinks or their pre-made set of combinations. The drinks came out within a couple of minutes of ordering, however, at 75% sweetness, they tasted a bit watered down already. There was also a lot of ice in the cup, but I guess we could have ordered less ice.  We didn't orders boba, and opted for jelly instead, so I can't say anything about the boba. I like how they offered free candy and dog treats on their side table!

Taste: 10/10Quality: 10/10Customer service: 3/10We were here on a Sunday morning, and the staff was just rude and seemed like she didn't want to be there. Maybe we went on the wrong day?Would come back for the tea, but definitely not for the service.

The drinks aren't that great but the cashier seemed like she didn't know her drinks. I asked if their drinks were on the sweeter side but she replied with " i dont drink sweet drinks". That doesnt help me. At least let me know what customers normally ask for. She didnt really seem to know whats popular either and just read off the top 10 drinks on the board or something. I got th

Taste: 4Value: 3.5Solid tea place located between two sections of the bustling castro area. I got the matcha blossom which seems to be very similar to boba guy's strawberry matcha latte. The tea taste is authentic and had the perfect amount of strawberry puree. At 30% sweetness, it was delicious. Boba itself was on point texturally but could've used just a but more flavor. Without the free topping coupon, this drink runs for $6 which seems very pricey for boba these days. Coupon works on weekends and any hour - gotta appreciate that!

I came across this place before I went to the airport since I'm out of town. The atmosphere and decor is so cute and modern. The area is kind of small so it was hard to seat 5 people since there was already a big party inside, so we just sat outside which wasn't too big of a deal since it was gorgeous out. The menu options were great and unique, I got the deluxe punch and it was REALLY good. It wasn't too sweet, or too tart, but really refreshing. The prices are really reasonable too and the cups are cute and not too dinky, like most bubble tea shops. 5/5 would recommend and come back :)

Whenever I'm in the area I always like to stop by qualitea for their drinks. The quality of the tea drinks are pretty decent. There's nothing wrong with any of the drinks that I have tried! I tried the golden oolong and the matcha blossom and I honestly have to say that both drinks are pretty decent. The golden oolong has a pretty strong tea flavor and it has just enough sweetness at 50 percent. It's not watered down nor is it disgustingly sweet. The matcha blossom is my other fav drink, it's similar to boba guys strawberry matcha latte. It has exact same layers except this one is slightly sweeter with the purée but the matcha flavor is still there and it's nice and not too strong.  I've been here a few times and I do t mind making my way back here for other drinks in the future! Overall, it's been a good experience each time! Only gripe is the parking in the area, it's not usually the best but if you come in a weekday usually you can find some parking: Total : 5

I've been here a couple times... Drinks : My favorite is the  deluxe punchNice and refreshing if you don't really want milk tea this is a good option.And for the milk tea when you a the cream cheese I think is a good amount. (Idk why I see someone was complaining  when I saw her picture she draws the red line and only shows the cream cheese starting from under the cap, there is still a good amount of portion in the cap, the cap had some extra space its not flat , plus it will not taste as good with toooo much cream cheese.)Taro is a good option as well if you like taro . Store: This is a good place for friends to hang out.There is a long table that can fit 6-8 ppl Out door sitting area (good for sunny day) Table games lot of options , like to hang out with my friends on the week days , weekend is more busy sometimes there might  not be  enough for a groups of ppl  so you guys will need to wait a little. Free WiFi ~ And there is dog treats!!!!!! Customer service: It's cool, the cashier does everything . Including making the tea . She always give me a friendly vibe , expect when is busy then she is really busy  making drinks in the back. * if you are in a hurry, just stopping by for a quick take out drink don't recommend busy hour in . (Just like other boba place  as well I went to i tea at Irving st the line took so long as well  and there is 2 siting area that's all . ) Not really sure when is the busy hr I think it depends on the days .... Usually I'll come in around 12 pm or 6:30pm and I don't really have a problem.  Not sure about weekends I usually come in week days .  Overall, I think is a good place for ppl to sit in, relax and drink :)
The cheese cream topping is good but not as nuanced as STEAP's.My main complaint here is they didn't provide the itemized receipt and there were no prices listed for the new menu items.

I am an AVID bubble tea drinker. I get it at least 2 times a week. I like to try out different places and I've gotta be honest , i didnt LOVE it here. I always get taro milk tea. It wasn't sweet, creamy, like usual, instead very bland and watery. She remade it for me which I greatly appreciate and that makes me give it 3 stars instead of 2. Tha ambiance of the place is casual and clean, modern.

This place has great taro milk tea!!! The taro flavor doesn't taste overly sweet and artificial like other places that use powder to make their taro drinks. Though, this might've been the result of me asking me for 30% sweetness. QualiTea's taro milk tea actually tastes like taro. There were even bits of taro in the drink. The place itself is small and has enough room for a small group to hangout and play games. At the time, there was only one worker so service was a little slow, but it wasn't too long. Drinks are fully customizable and build your own drink options are available.

I liked the vibe and feel of the place - patrons are working creatively or hard, and bold coffee selection and pastries complement the ambiance accordingly. Would def come to work on something unique and creative and sip some strong coffee.

This may be the worst experience that I have ever had at a coffee shop. We stopped by as it was a place close to us that had great reviews on yelp. I ordered a Pirates(spicy green tea latte) and a bacon and chive turnover. The latte had so little taste that it was just like drinking warm milk. One of our friends had finished her drink and food before I got my turnover and it took another 10 minutes after I had to remind them that I still didn't get my food. When I finally got it, there was so little filling in there that it was extremely disappointing! On top of it all, my other friend ordered 3 things and only got only 1 upfront. She reminded them about the others, but eventually we just ran out of time and could not wait any longer to give any more reminders to get her last item. There are so many coffee shops around here and would not recommend for anyone to waste there money here.
Great Mochas. Shitty WiFi. Don't come here to do work on your computer. Also will ask you for you information to spam you with marketing emails. Don't come here to do work.

Great coffee shop in the Yerba Buena area of SoMa.  * Coffees are great with a variety of single origin coffee.* I love the cold brew, and they have both nitro and draft versions.* Generally nice ambience worth live edge wood tables.* Outdoor seating is available, though sitting outside is not recommended.* Staff is friendly* Prices can be a bit high, but alas, San Francisco.

I've been going to Contraband for the past few weekends. Each time I've gotten the Bhakti chai latte, dirty. I've gotta say, it's a damn good chai. Great start to a Saturday morning. The shop itself is in the smaller side, and usually most of the seats are taken. I always get my coffee to go.

Really good spot. I was in the neighborhood for a conference at Moscone and wanted to get something beforehand so I walked over to try Contraband. Very good cappuccino, and an excellent selection of morning pastries. Comfortable spot, fairly small so it's not a place you'd hang out in for a long time, but very worth stopping into.

I frequent this place very often. The past three times, the customer service was super horrible. At a coffee shop, I don't expect them to be Chetty or hold a conversation, neither do I expect them to have a small talk,  however, when you walk in, you don't get greeted. The past three times exactly these things happened: I was not greeted, then I first said hello, they asked me what do you like to have? To which I responded, how are you doing today? And age of three times, three different employees on three different dates ignored that question and went straight to asking me what I want to drink.I thought at first they were being racist towards me. So after I ordered I said thank you, and didn't even hear a " you're welcome." I continued to be polite and before leaving I smiled back and said have a great day, and still they just stared at me without a response. Not that it makes any difference, but I had walked in in my business attire, it's not like I am a homeless or anything. If I am paying close to five dollars for a small coffee and a tip on top of that every single time, I think a " thank you " would be nice. As far as the coffee is concerned, I love the taste. But the female cashier, and two other mail cashiers, they were all same. No customer service skills, no personality, and very short.

Yeah, this place isn't me though I wish it were me. I'm just not the type that can speak fluently about the subtle differences between coffee roasting techniques. In fact, I knew I would be lost when I couldn't find a simple house coffee on the menu. They serve one but only after you get a full narrative about their various pour overs and the countries of origin for their beans. It was about four bucks, and it took about a whopping ten minutes to brew (photo: bit.ly/2WPtZMW). The result didn't taste markedly different from the coffee I've gotten at the corner market. But that's my fault, right?I came in to have some coffee while I devoured, I mean nibbled on the oranais pastry I just bought at Les Gourmands. I'd guess the median age of the clientele was roughly 22-1/2 and as typical a self-absorbed crowd as I've seen in similarly positioned artisan cafes. I was here over a year ago when it was brand new in the neighborhood, and the customer base has remained the same. Back then, I had a $3.75 cup of Rooibos Tea that more comfortably satisfied (photo: bit.ly/2I2VoHQ). However, I felt more like Cliff than Norm at this hipster congregation spot. Oh wait, not Cliff...Frasier. Yes, Frasier.COFFEE/TEA - 3 stars...well OK thenAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...pretty much like every other artisan coffee business...btw that stepdown has got to goSERVICE - 3 stars...certainly talkative TOTAL - 3 stars...the name is edgier than the vibe

They have a rectangle table inside with ample space for each person seated to have a laptop, notepad, and coffee cup. Plenty come to study / work and can potentially be a great networking opportunity. But what I liked most is that the stools were tall enough for me to swing my legs without touching the ground (I'm 6'3). It's the small things that count! Today was my first visit, unlikely my last.

The most friendly people who serve amazing coffee.I once walked in when the credit card system was down and they took only cash. I did not have cash and they still served me.Customer service at best.Contraband Coffee rocks!
Pretty good coffee. My preference is their expresso. Strong and full of flavor!Nice interior with the classic SF wooden table, you can't go wrong wood ;)
This is a cool place in SoMa. Noise level is low, their matcha was excellent (exceeded my expectations!) and service very friendly. Great for working (free wifi) or catching up with a friend.
It has a lovely vibe. They have a nice songs playlist. They have a pretty good coffee!

Went there this morning (Veteran's Day) at 8am. The cold brew was a little weaker than I am used to but fine and the male barista who helped me was great. HOWEVER, I found a woman's ring on the floor of the bathroom. When I brought it back to the counter and placed it in front of the newly arrived female barista to let her know that someone had lost it, we had the following exchange:Her: "You can throw that away."Me: "I can throw that away?" (It was now literally right in front of her.Her: "Yes, it was on the bathroom floor all day yesterday."Me: "So you want ME to throw it away for you." (Again, I would have to reach across the counter to do so as it was closer to her).Her: "Yes."I foolishly defaulted to my polite self and retrieved the ring from in front of her as instructed. I guess I have cooties now. I sincerely hope her manager reads this.

The coffee was good, but it was pricey for what it was. The coffee shop is a nice, clean looking space, but it was not homey. People set up shop there to work on their laptops, so no one was talking to each other. (If you are looking for that quiet kind of place, this is a good one! It's small though, so you would have to get there before the other people do.) The vibe felt too cold to have a conversation with my friend, so we took our coffee outside and walked around instead.
Coffee tastes like dirty water. $5.50 for a quad americano and it was so watered down, I could almost see the bottom of my cup. No crema whatsoever.

At 4.50$ for a small coffee you better be working at Twitter or square to pay for the coffee. Who am I kidding... everything in the city is overpriced Decent coffee 3.5/5Good space to sit 4/5Wish they had small bites or savory offerings as well

Much smaller than it looks in photos. Coffee is way overpriced, even for SF, but I did enjoy the rosemary flavored iced latte. It's actually not a great place to work - they have very loud Top 40 music playing constantly, and it's not air conditioned, which can be hot on a sunny day.

Excellent chai! I tried their golden latte-- it was nicely steamed and had a spicy kick. The turmeric powder DOES settle so I would recommend not taking the last sip in the cup. Price wise, it cost me a over $5 with tax for the smaller size. In general prices here are on the higher side.The cafe has a nice modern industrial feel. There is one big tall communal table in the center of the cafe, with some high top tables along the windows and two seater tables against the walls. It looks like a decent place to work. There is a self serve water area and a co-ed bathroom (that needs a code to enter).

I enjoyed their espresso drinks (cortado, macchiatto) twice during the conference at Moscone Center.  It is on expensive side, but coffee and atmosphere (SOMA) are pretty good.  Location is also convenient.

Super fun co-working space, flexible, modern; fast internet love that it has coffee as well as alcohol. There are conference rooms and phone pods (though the wall is slightly thing). I really like the credit card based hourly option

This place is beautiful! They have a small cafe and bar if you'd like coffee or an alcoholic beverage. Inside the venue is quiet and a lot of people inside are working on their laptops. They have a few rooms which you could rent for few hours, all have different price range. We were in the Porter Room which had a TV for androids phones so you can do screen share, the TV did not have apple TV and the apps on the TV (youtube, netflix etc..) did not work. The rooms next to ours did have apple TV since it appeared on our laptops. So if you're planning to use apple TV consider this part.Everything inside is bright and clean, beautiful establishment.

Wow! What a great venue! I attended a summit here and didn't know what to expect. The outside is deceivingly humble :)  With its exposed brick, multi-floor, multi-room features, I was very pleased with the the ambience Covo provided!  Covo was able to house over 130 people comfortably at the summit and is very clean; not. Just in cleanliness but also in style. I love the uptown decor and comfortable seating. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. I'm not in the city too often but I do have a lot of friends, family and business colleagues who are always looking for a venue for their event. Since Covo accommodates both events and co-working spaces, you can bet that when they ask for recommendations, Covo will definitely be on the list. Thanks Covo! Til the next time!

I've been a member at Covo for almost a year now. At first, I was impressed by the warmth and spaciousness of the environment. The main floor is open and inviting, and doesn't give the "cubicle farm" feel. There's a delightful coffee bar and wine/beer space that also offers food from local vendors. (I adore the baristas and bartenders, who learn the names and tastes of regulars impressively quickly.)I've held any number of interviews and consultations upstairs in the general area, which is bright and accommodating. The lower level is the member's area, which is where I head when I really need to buckle down and focus. Upstairs is a good people watching and connecting point for me, while the member's area allows me to grab a seat to work from my computer without distraction.If I didn't come by so regularly, I'd happily enjoy dropping in as their drop-in rates are highly reasonable. If you're looking for somewhere to work for an hour or two, or even want a regular office space without the office vibe, Covo is the best!
Nice place for a meeting or some non-office work. Coffee is solid, food could be a bit better.

I really like this place. The interior is really well done. Bravo west elm. Good place to work and socialize. It's reasonable priced. The architecture is brilliant. Kudos to everyone who made this place. I think they should put up more of these. Brilliant idea!

The first time I came to Covo last August, I was genuinely impressed with the expansive work space that was constructed and designed for budding start-up entrepreneurs. There was plenty of room for laptoppers and even conference rooms in the back. Somehow the edgy vibe was enhanced by its location near the somewhat hellish intersection of Sixth and Mission intersection where who knows who or what can walk in panhandling. At that point, they allowed Jamie W. and me just hang out on a couch in the space and explore the space at our leisure (photo: bit.ly/2qPNDfO). Apparently those days have ended.Back then, Jamie enjoyed a $9 bottle of North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout, which was quite delicious (photo: bit.ly/2qPVo5C). Months later, we came back here to meet for tea and noticed that the owners had found their footing by renting the space for private company parties and limiting us non-start-up types to the cafe portion in front. The problem was that the parties were not so private, and it became louder as the evening progressed. The bar scene became a bit obnoxious with entitled, ADD-addled youngsters elbowing their way onto the bar where we were sitting (photo: bit.ly/2rpcfJg).We had no complaints about the cheery server who attempted to give us attention despite the distractions. This time we shared a $3.95 beaker of the Jasmine Pearl Green Tea (photo: bit.ly/2qPU4j1), and it was quite soothing with a bit more flavor than the Whitman-inspired Leaves of Grass herbal mix we tried last time with lemon verbena, peppermint and tarragon (photo: bit.ly/2rpjm4w). I still think it's a very worthwhile space, and perhaps on a non-rental night, it could even be nice just to hang out in the cafe section. But not that night. Their fearless company leader was leading a chant. Time to go. TEA & BEVERAGES - 4 stars...nice selection of beers, and they make a fine loose leaf tea in French Press beakersAMBIANCE - 3 stars...liked the space but when it gets crowded, whoa...SERVICE - 3.5 stars...server was kind but had to deal with lots of demanding youngstersTOTAL - 4 stars...kudos for having a business close to Sixth Street...and a fine cup of tea

This is a good idea. Those of us running our own businesses, sometimes out of cafes, want to snuggle up to those of you running your own businesses in co-working spaces. We invented you after all, when we launched our businesses from laptops in cafes in the early 2000s. It warms our isolated little hearts to see that the next generation of entrepreneurs took our ideas and ran with them. So opening a café in the front lobby of your exclusive and hip looking co-working space, well it's generous of you. It's fun to work alongside your hustle and bustle.I'll forgive the barista her eyeroll when I asked  her what cascara was. I ordered it, not because of her limp explanation but because the manager butted in and told me the whole story: the cherry fruit of the coffee bean treated like a tisane! ? Yes, please. It's a lovely drink that seems to be trending in the city's cafes right now. Delish.
I really like this place. Even though on mission they are more tucked away then other shops in the area. Great service and coffee, easy to find a seat. One of my favs
It's a little pricier than Starbucks but the atmosphere and conversation make it totally worth the extra expense. The coffee is pretty decent too. This place is an easy recommendation.

I was walking down the street headed to Blue Bottle and hoping I could find a comfortable place to sit and work for a couple hours when I passed by Covo. Their large signage outside talked about food and drink and a space to co-work. I decided to step inside and inquire what the deal was. They have free seating up front if you just want a coffee or you can pay $3 an hour to step inside and have a really nice co-working space. You still have access to the coffee bar (which also serves beer and wine) and find a station to power your laptop and drink your drinks in comfort. It's not as noisy as you'd imagine, even with teams working on prototypes and people on calls with their clients.This was a total surprise win for me and at $6 for a couple hours, I think it's a great deal.

I've been here a handful of times to meet up with friends and it's a solid spot in SOMA! First time, came here for happy hour. Covo's beer and wine selection is great. They have an impressive list of craft beers on tap and a really diverse wine list. The bar space is beautiful, light-filled and spacious. The owners and bartenders are friendly and add to the overall good energy of the space. The other times I've been here in the afternoon and got coffee or tea. Covo carries Equator Coffee and it's my favorite. The baristas understand how to craft a good drink, whether that's a latte or daily drip. Hot tip: get the matcha latte! As a small business owner, my "office" is changes daily. I can't wait to make Covo my go-to-spot. Good meeting spaces in SOMA past 6pm are hard to come by and Covo even stays open pretty late (9pm).

Beautiful new coworking space with both coffee and wine/beer bars! The organization of the space is great, with different types of seating for individuals and groups. Whether you're a startup business or a well established entrepreneur, this space provides you the perfect environment to get stuff done, complete with some really useful amenities like meeting rooms, phone booths, printing, and, of course, free wifi.
Delicious lattes, friendly atmosphere, and engaging folks A wonderful new addition to Soma. Looking forward to trying the blood orange cider next time I drop by.
Very nice selection of curated wine and beer on tap. Selections are on point, worth a stop by for happy hour or night cap!

Covo is my go to, everyday coffee shop! The coffee is great and the staff really cares about me and making great coffee! The food choices are also delicious. Thanks Covo for making life better in mid-market. Also, they have lightning fast free Internet. You guys rock!

Wow! I finning got here. The weather was chilly, there was a little line and there are only few tables inside. But!!!The food is really great, portions are quite big. I set outside on the table and left this place full and happy! Definitely will come back.

Delicious!I had the soup in the main picture (solyanka), as well as a ground beef pierogi.Both were wonderful.I only wish I had a chance to try out some of their pastries, which looked amazing.  Next time!Definitely worth a stop.

I like their food but I'm honestly so sick of this one brunette middle aged woman who works there and is always rude and slow. I ordered online so I wouldn't have to wait, and I asked her if my order  was behind her. She ignored me, walked to the kitchen, came back and made me wait  line even though my order was indeed ready and behind her the entire time. They need to figure out a system for online orders and keep her in the back away from customers. So disappointed.
Love this place. It's a must go to every time I'm in San Francisco. Start the day with a coffee and beef and cheddar piroshki   You can't go wrong with trying anything on their menu.

This was my first true Eastern European food experience and it was extremely good. I'm a sucker for basically any type of dumpling so the vareniki were my favorite. The only thing to note was the line was incredibly long, and the seating is mostly all outside.
Best bakery in the Richmond district. I've eaten here many times and have never been disappointed! Fair prices and amazing food plus they have 5star for rewards!!

This is exactly what I had in mind when I wanted to find local, hole in the wall, delicious finds when I visited San Francisco. They do get pretty busy and the menu is on the wall and kind of hard to read, so it's a good idea to show up prepared with what you want to try. Or, do like I did and get a few different things to taste. Whether sweet or savory, the pastries were delish.

Thank you to good friends that know about good food. I came here on a Saturday and didn't have much of an expectation as Cinderella looks like a modest coffee shop. The menu is on a board and you first order then take a number to put on your table. Seating is very limited and outdoor. After eating, you bus your own tables.We ordered the borsch and blinchiki with sweet cheese. Food came out quickly and was warm. The borsch was very good and filling, and it comes with some of their sliced bread. The blinchiki was delicious and comes with raspberry jam and sour cream. The food was good and I'd definitely come back to try other items. They have a wide variety or pastries on display too. Service was fast and friendly.

Yes there will be a line but the little snacks I got were totally worth the fifteen or so minutes of waiting. I got a little savory cabbage pie and a strawberry cream puff croissant type thing and an iced tea. Not sure how but the iced tea was really good! It was really smooth and didn't taste oversteeped if that makes sense.The cabbage thing was fine, and the croissant was amazing! It was so rich and buttery without being too sweet, pretty much my favorite kind of snack. Everyone else's lunch and real food items looked really good too and I would definitely come back for a real meal!
I like the food they serve, nice personnel, very convenient location.The food is always fresh,  my favourite is "potato vareniky" never forget to order. Also I like "borsch".

I recently realized that Cinderella has delicious baked goods, and I'm obsessed. I've lived in the city forever, grew up in the Richmond, and visited this bakery once with family in the distant past. The ownership changed years ago, and the restaurant/bakery grew in popularity over time. And apparently the quality improved significantly with the new ownership, because I don't recall being impressed when I originally ate here or seeing the line out the door and down the block. I'm not really a dessert person, but what I love, I love a lot. Napoleon cake is up there. And Cinderella's is the best I've had. This afternoon, I finally tried the strawberry custard croissant; it was sold out other times I stopped by. I think the custard is the same they use in the Napoleon, but there's a lot more in the cake. I wish the croissant were a bit more moist. Overall, it's pretty good. I'll probably attempt to get here in the morning so I could try this pastry at its most fresh. My best friend's mom said the restaurant next door will close and sell the space to Cinderella. Hopefully more space will be positive all around. I have slight concern that quality might suffer.
Lovely cafe, even better food. Pelmeny (dumplings) and blinchiki (Russian crepes) were on point. Borscht was also great!

Very polite and great Russian greeting people . Their soups are well made , bakery that kids love so much  and their stake sandwich  super good . Unfortunately we do t have anything good in SF anymore ( Russian food wise ) but luckily we have Cinderella u til 9pm .
Amazing food! And staff are super friendly! Must stop breakfast place! If you're from SF, lucky you! And anyone visiting from SoCal or anywhere else definitely STOP BY!

We had a delicious breakfast here before venturing out to the seaside parks. The line was a bit long but it moved quickly. I do wish I had time to see things before having to make a decision, as it felt rushed once I finally entered the bakery. But the layout makes it so once you're in you're next in line. And you better know what you want because the line is long! There was just so many amazing looking items to choose from. All that we tasted were delicious so no complaints. I just want to go back so I can try even more.

I wish I had a faster metabolism so I can come here everyday. Ugh. The Fried Piroshky selections at Cinderella's are a must. My favorite one is stuffed with Potatoes and Mushroom. The texture of the dough is so soft and chewy; it's seriously the most delicious savory pastry I've ever had in my life. I've also tried the Beef with Cheddar, although I wish it had more cheese. It looked like it was filled with all ground beef but maybe the lady gave me the wrong one? So I'll probably try ordering again to see if it's any different. Regardless, it was still delicious. Another one of my favorite things here that I can't really find anywhere else is their Blinchiki with Sweet Cheese. Omg. This is honestly my BIGGEST guilty pleasure. It's the most buttery crepe stuffed with a heaping amount of sweet cheese filling, literally foodgasm. And to think it's already so rich as it is, it's also paired with a side of (I believe) Russian sour cream & raspberry jam. This is the ultimate dessert for a cheat day, I can't get enough of this one. It's very unlikely that I'll ever get tired of this place since the menu is infinite with a million different things to order. Dumplings? Salad? Soup? Cake? Bagel? Everything here is so good, don't miss out!

Good comfort food. Rye bread was very good, main dishes were hit and miss. The drinks were poor, though. I would not expect a drip coffee in such a place to be good, but their signature drink - compot - was just sweet.

A quaint little Russian enclave serving some classic Russian items like borscht and pirozhki. I think now I know why we had the cold war. The Russians didn't  want the borscht recipe leaked to the West. This was my first encounter with borscht soup, I have to say that is some damn tasty soup. Now, if you've never had borscht, like me, I highly recommend getting down here.
Kharcho soup was hearty and just what I needed! Got a ton of pastries to take home as well.

I've lived near this place forever and finally dragged my butt out of bed to try it. Overall it was pretty worth it! I'm giving this place 4 stars solely because I was really looking forward to trying the blueberry brioche and their strawberry croissant but I think those may be weekend items?  I visited on a Friday morning and I didn't see either. So I opted for the crepes, and I cannot remember the Russian name for the life of me lol.I got the strawberry with sour cream crepes and they were delicious! It only took about 5 minutes for them to serve it to me and they were piping hot. The jam that they serve it with the crepes was delicious. If you're looking to branch out from your regular croissant, I'd highly recommend! They give you A LOT of sour cream and jam and I was tempted to take the rest home. The place itself is pretty small but there's plenty of outdoor seating. If you come first thing in the morning it's pretty chill. Also the staff is super sweet - they all greet you with a good morning. Overall this is definitely a place I'd visit again - I have an excuse now to come back and see if they have any blueberry brioches in stock ;)

Right by the 4th & King stop is this little hidden gem. They caught me on such a bad mood but did not waver in trying to make me feel better through their positive customer service. I've had Philz in various locations from downtown SJ, Cupertino, and Sunnyvale, but this one right here takes the cake in service. It's been two months since that occasion, but never too late to show some support to the wonderful staff. 5/5, tip them well

Coffee and food are great but when making orders be sure to double check your stuff. I made the mistake of not checking and Phil charged me for 5 burritos and only gave me 4! Phil even got all the orders for pastries wrong. Dude answering the phone who I assume was Phil was unapologetic and he hung up on me twice! Typical "Phil."

I love Philz! They have a bunch of blends that come customized (hot/cold, sweet/unsweet/ how much milk and what kind, etc). No fancy lattes or anything just great high-quality coffee. The iced mint mojito is unique in the best way. Pro tip: try secret menu items cinnamon french toast or oatmeal cookie- they are a combination of different blends and are to die for.

Friendly staff and great & creative mixed coffee drinks. I love a few of their coffee blends and dislike others, but they have plenty to choose from. Only downside is that ordering drinks takes awhile. If you see a line longer than 5 people, it's at least 10m until you get your drink.
Very happy with the coffee and costumer service!staff is very personal and friendly with little to no ego. Refreshing in the Bay Area.

Busy corner location near the ball park and China Basin. Staff is friendly. Menu is standard (drip coffee and hot tea only). Seating is limited. Parking is available on the street (difficult) or in a garage. I wouldn't plan on having a business meeting here as you most likely won't have a table.

Well what can I say, I've been coming to this location since 2013. Seen so many awesome workers come and go, I would consider myself a regular that most people see around for some time now. Unfortunately I had a really bad experience a few days ago. I ordered using the Phil's app because my card got stolen, once inside I asked if I can order food by ordering two drinks through the app(more expensive than the avocado toast) I was told we normally don't do it but we will this time so I completed the order, then it just went down hill from that moment. I was told by another manager that it's against policy then after a short conversation she said ok just this one time. So I waited about 20 minutes and asked about the toast in which a different girl came out and said "no" in a rude manner and said they will refund me. Don't tell me yes and then have me wait only to tell me no, it is very unfortunate with so many memories I have made there and I am not sure about giving it another shot but I doubt I will come here again, the management has declined over the years, as a local of SF resident and frequent regular I would expect better goodwill service than what recently occurred. The most concerning thing was in which the manner I was spoken to, condescending attitude tone which was not helpful. Situation could've been diffused but seems like someone's ego got in the way, wish you the best.Next time if this ever happens to a regular customer, I would advise a simple solution  to say, "we understand what happened so we will give this one the house just pay next time" which I have done before.

This is probably the best tasting coffee/pour over I have had in my entire life. Our coffee drinking has been completely destroyed by fast and convenient kcups but that coffee tastes just awful! After searching for a phenomenal cup of coffee, I tried out this spot while visiting SF and was mind blown. The coffee is strong with an amazing taste. I got the Philtered Soul light ice and light cream and sugar. I hope they open more locations out of state bc I am addicted!
Philz never disappoints. Iced Tesora with cream is the best.
Terrible service. Woman making coffee was being mean to me and absolutely condescending. Never coming back again.

My local Philz, this is the perfect location right next to the Caltrain station to swing by and grab a drink.Don't even try finding parking around this area as it's completely congested with Caltrain traffic. If you really need to, I'd travel south to the Mission Bay area across the bridge to find some street parking, but I'd recommend avoiding the situation if possible.Same solid Philz drinks here, it's a perfect location for pre-interview drink or to get some work done outside the office if you work in the area.

My go to is a nice hot Mint Mojito. Warms my soul! Cops come here in the afternoon and the seating gets somewhat limited. A few desk areas and outlets if you want to bring your laptop. But don't come here to work if you break out in dance when some good music blasts the stereo.
The BEST coffee shop I've to try ever!!! The mocha Tesoro is my favorite!! Nice atmosphere and very good service. Good start for your morning!!

Tried to give this place a second chance because maybe one of their workers had a so called "off day" but to my dismay the same rudeness I encountered a few weeks ago occurred again two days ago. I don't know who manages this place but instead of allowing your workers to converse amongst each other, maybe they should focus on working and assisting their customers. This location seriously needs to get their SH!T together.
The Ecstatic (iced) and the cinnamon roll was the best part of my day. It's only 11:30am, but still. This spot doesn't disappoint. Tons of roasts and everything is spot on.

This Philz isn't so spacious, but it has some outside seatings. Also, as same as other locations, their WiFi is good. Of course, the taste of coffee is certainly Philz!! One good thing is this location isn't so crowded compared to other Philz. When you go to the ball park (AT&T Stadium), this location is nice to stop by. Staffs are always nice and helpful to choose your coffee!!
This might be the slowest coffee spot in all of SF. Took almost a half hour to get two Chai teas. Never again.
not exactly the best coffee place. IDK what the hype is all about!!!! The service is very slow and there is no place to sit

Was close by this Philz so I decided to pop in for a their mocha. The service was nice and friendly as always. However, the mocha wasn't so great - it didn't quite compared to the mochas I've gotten at other Philz locations.

First time here. Visiting San Fran from Fresno, and the coffee was amazing. Service was fast and friendly. I was a little unclear where to start because you dont go to the register first like Starbucks. The barista gets you what you want, and then you check out.

I have a friend who raves about this place and their chocolates. We had the opportunity to stop by over lunch and I'm so glad we did!Small shop with a cute llama theme and attentive, friendly staff. I ordered 4 pieces for $11 (without the box). Here are my thoughts:-Deeply Dark: Luscious and decadent-Jasmine: Floral and really yummy-Guava: Juicy, loved the pate de fruit texture!-Champagne: Pretty sure I tasted the 'fun' in thisThese were some of the best chocolates I've ever had, I would love to go back here for a small treat for myself or to buy gifts for folks!

Lovely place with truly fabulous service. It is walking distance from MOMA. I have been here twice and both times tried their hot chocolate. The chocolate is not exactly hot, it strikes you as more warm but it is delicious, delicate, and not sugary at all. For an added bonus, they ask if you want their house-made chocolate marshmallow in your hot chocolate. Get it! It is super delicious. The service here is fabulous. The young man at the counter (didn't ask for his name) is very attentive to your chocolate needs. He crafted my hot chocolate like it was a delicate oil on canvas. And I would highly recommend their handmade chocolates in a box, get them as a gift for loved ones or yourself. They offer a variety of imaginative flavors. In short, this place is a true treat for lovers of chocolate.

If I'm ever in the Rincon Hill area of Soma I like to stop by this cute little neighborhooody fine chocolate/coffee-stop.  The chocolates are small for $2.75 but they pack a lot of flavor and have pretty designs on top.  There are some unique flavors, my favs are the tea ones like the Duchess of Earl or Jasmine tea.  In addition to chocolate pieces, they have hot drinks, chocolate bars (you have to try the potato chip and pretzel!), and gift box sets.  They can do customized logos on the chocolate pieces in bulk, so it's a great idea for corporate events.  This is a great place if you work around here otherwise it's hard to get to and not open on the weekend.

I love the flavors and chocolates here. I'm a bit sad they're not open on the wkends which makes it a bit challenging to get here on a weekday. I got a few small boxes for my bridal party and they loved the chocolates!! All the truffles taste high quality and are subtle and I love the packaging.

I tried a lot of their flavors and I must say, they are the sweetest bombs. They are well made and the flavors really come through. I shared them with a lot of my colleagues and all of them really enjoyed them. I just feel like trying every flavor.
