I pass by this place everyday and I have to keep myself from going and buying more chocolates. They recently completed 5 years and their Alpaca event was really cool.
A wonderful "small town" feel. The owner is always there and the whole team is super welcoming. Love the llama-everything!!

The chocolates at Socola are made with love. I have tried several varieties of their hand crafted chocolates and highly recommend! They have some very interesting flavors such as durian(!) and sriacha which I am personally a big fan of. Don't worry the durian truffles from Socola are not overpowering like the fresh fruit, pungent enough to clear an entire room. These contain a much smaller amount mixed in with chocolate which is a great combination. Their store is filled with alpaca themed furnishings. These range from stuffed animals to art work on the walls. Their mascot is Harriet the flying alpaca (which by now should all make sense). They had an event today with two alpacas that you can pet in real life. Also some of their chocolates are subtle hint that left handed people exist. I'm one of them. 5 stars.

I worked very closely with the shop owner Wendy on a very large order. I reached out to Wendy in hopes of getting custom imaging not only on the packaging boxes but on the chocolates themselves. Not only are the chocolates amazing but so is the customer service. She was very attentive to detail, able to customize and create our vision, and communicated quickly and efficiently throughout the process. I was confident throughout the whole project that the end result would be perfect and it was. I can't wait to work with Wendy and her team in the future!
I love this chocolate shop! The truffles are delicious and creative -- the cognac is my go-to, but the passion fruit, guava, and Vietnamese coffee are close contenders. Do yourself a favor and go!

Off the beaten path but well within walking distance of the SFMOMA. The bagged chocolate covered medjool dates were delish, although pricey. The cold brew was yummy. I was pleased to discover that this place is true Asian sista powered, that is truly owned by two Asian women who are sisters.The chocolate chip cookie was nice and soft and chewy!
Unbelievable combinations of chocolate and coffe. I absolutely love it each time. Great for during a reading session.

Great place, friendly staff, but be advised there is no wifi. Not exactly a great place to get work done, but their hot chocolate is pretty amazing! Averaging 5 stars for the drink & 3 stars for the atmosphere.

Lovely chocolates.  Fun and subtly decorated.  They have a hint of whatever flavor they are infused with so they are not overtly sweet or overpowering.  Might be my new favorite chocolates in the Bay.
Delicious latte served quickly with a smile - great spot!  I also enjoyed the seating and the music.

Really cute spot for chocolate and coffee. They have these adorable stuffed llamas everywhere and printed on everything including the treats. I got the truffagato with a marshmallow on top. It's truffle with espresso so it was rich, bitter and sweet at the same time. It was actually pretty dark too but a nice mid day pick me up.

Moon Cake Time!  Socola produces a savory Moon Cake Truffle!  A little salty in the inside with an inner looking eggy looking thingy.  Innovative chocolatiering satisfying the whims of their clientele!  Nice!  Enuf said!
I love this place! Super friendly staff and great coffee and chocolate selections. It's my go-to for a good latte. Also, there's always something new to sample :)
Visiting SF for a few days and this was probably the best coffee that I had. The Mocha w/ Almond milk was excellent!
Closed for an undetermined time due to water damage to the building!Too bad, was excited to try them.

The moment I stepped inside, I was in alpaca heaven. Who doesn't love an alpaca theme? A monster, that's who. I haven't tried the coffee here, but the chocolates are tasty and adorable. They aren't overly sweet and are melt in your mouth goodness. My favorite was the earl grey. You can really taste the tea flavor.

I've been here once for Saturday Cat-toons and another for the Friday Fondue and both were super fun! The Friday Fondue is nice because it's a legit dinner. I thought it was going to be some measly bites but we actually got full from it. We had veggies (which they offered to refill), lots of fresh bread, and steak (which was more than enough) along with dessert fondue. It's actually run very well and a great date night in my opinion. The cats are hilarious to watch and I did the fondue before playing with the cats as it was the earlier time slot. At the end of the evening we even got to pick out a pair of socks from the store which we thought was a nice touch to the end of our evening. P.s. they have a lot of fun pins and patches and all the cat related items you can think of

This was my first time visiting KitTea with my friend and I loved it! The tea was delicious and the cats were very playful and sweet-- Ron was so cuddly! Our session was at 4:00pm; we came a bit early and were able to watch the cats play through the viewing window. I loved the little handbook that was provided with small bios about each of the kitties. The employees were also super kind and knowledgeable-- they helped introduce us to the cats and showed us how to play with them!

Cute place. The cats are cute and well kept but the place has a medium weird smell. The space has tons of toys for the cats and comfortable seating. Tea is always hot and kept and at arms reach. I'd definitely recommend a few more food options and tea flavors!

Visiting the cats here was the most magical experience. It goes without saying that the cats were all perfect, friendly, and sweet, but there were so many other great things about this place! Everyone who works here is so kind and helpful, and were very attentive making sure everyone, cats included, was having a good time. They got the cats to climb on people's backs (and took great photos for us!) and were generally super friendly and enthusiastic. They even remembered my name as I was leaving. The unlimited teas were also delicious (I tried the Hojita and Sencha), and the atmosphere was so nice thanks to the many comfortable places to relax, and the calming music playing. The hour in the cat lounge went by so quickly, and I wish I could've stayed all day. I left feeling so relaxed it was like I'd just been to a spa. So worth it and will definitely be returning.

Overall I thought that this place was pretty great. It's endless tea which is nice and a bunch of cute cats. Most of the cats were sleeping but they were a about 5 cats who were lively. One even chilled on my lap for ten minutes. I would come here again:)

My family had a great time today at the Kit Tea Cafe! All the staff were super nice, helpful and informative. The lounge was clean and the air purifiers kept my husband's cat allergies from bugging him too much (he didn't pet the cats). The cats were mostly pretty sleepy but very welcoming of pets especially if you were patient. Some were active and that was fun too. Desserts and tea were yummy. Cute items for sale. Bathrooms were super clean. We'll definitely be back!

I went with my cousin here and we had a lovely time with all the kitties. Kitties are very well behaved, they don't hiss or scratch, and they're open to being pet. It looks like they take good care of the kitties. The tea is also very good.
My 10 year old loves cats! We had a wonderful time with the cats. The staff was very friendly and outgoing. It was a fun afternoon in the city!

Such a great place to spend an hour and $25! Sitting in a room with sweet kitties and seeing exactly what your donation is supporting makes for a great visit! My kids loved petting and playing with the cats and enjoyed some chocolate milk as well!
KitTea is a place you can relax, hydrate, and watch some peaceful felines. Also, use their restrooms. Their heated bidet with multiple settlings set my standard of living way too high.

Overall it is a pretty nice place. However, you just need to make sure that you go at a time when most of the cats aren't sleeping. The younger cats usually are a lot more active but the older ones sleep a lot. I recommend either going early in the morning or later in the evening. They also provide free tea which is nice. They also have a lot of cat merchandise, which is really fun.
Came here for a mental health day and it was EXACTLY what I needed. The atmosphere is the loveliest and so are the cats. 1000/10 coming back

Kit-Tea was such a fun family activity! The kids loved all the different cats and the environment is very cute and clean.Their favorite part was watching all the cats jump up when it was snack time and they loved being able to give a couple treats to the cats!The hot cocoa is homemade and was delicious with whipping cream and a marshmallow!Definitely recommend this as a fun activity for cat lovers and kids!!!

Okay, how can anyone give this place less than 5 stars?! It combines pretty much my two favorite things in the world - fluffy kitties & tea! A few friends and I dropped by for a 1 hour session with the kitties around 6:30 pm and we were pleasantly surprised to see most of them awake and ready for playtime. We at first drifted over to the tea station (set up by the windows) before diving into cat bonding time. I loved the Hojicha! Definitely give it a try. The rest of my 58 minutes inside KitTea Cat Cafe was spent trying to make friends with the cats. It felt like a lot of unrequited love but alas, I still had so much fun staring lovingly at them. (maybe one day they will love me back) I loved how our KitTea representative would get the cats to hop up onto our backs. It felt like such a unique experience! We also learned from him that KitTea Cat Cafe rescues cats who would otherwise by put to death and rehabilitates them to be comfortable around humans and I just absolutely love that! I wish I could give another star just for that reason. By the end of this interactive experience, I was ready to embrace my future as a cat lady. I truly can't wait to return!

Wonderful environment to destress! Would've been helpful to have a sign up on the wall for what we can do in the meantime before going into the kitty room and what the protocol is before going in (taking off shoes/hand sanitizer) because it was a little awkward to stand around not knowing what to do with myself. Just a small thought :)

As a crazy cat lady myself, I couldn't have asked for anything more!! Amazing staff, delicious teas, and adorable cats??? I wish I could come back every day! I'm glad that I went on a weekday afternoon. It was very quiet and chill which was so relaxing! I'll definitely be back :)

My friends and I had a wonderful time at KitTea this weekend. The staff were extremely helpful and really made us feel welcome and well informed about the cats. Unlimited tea was awesome, and the food we ordered was delicious! Super recommend this place.
These gattos are so cute! I had a pleasant experience and the teas here are great! They also sell cute merchandise too! Highly recommend.
We had a great visit at the cat cafe. The employees were great and we really enjoyed our time with the cats!
What a great experience! to ply with the cats for just a hour are very relaxing. this is definitely a cat lover spot!
Nice peopleGood foodClean spaceWonderful coffee drinksI really like the egg sandwiches here
Great food prepared and served by super nice people in a clean and comfortable environment. Everything is good here. An awesome addition to the neighborhood.

Duke Ellington's signature tune was "Take the A Train", but mine ain't "Take the L Train". I barely ride it, but one day, I rode it and forgot to get off at West Portal. As I was cruising down Taraval, I got off at 23rd and found this spot just a block away in front of McCoppin Square. It was a good thing because I was trying hard to avoid the neighborhood greasy spoons to get some lunch. Lots of comfort food in these parts but healthy? Yeah, not so much.I tried the $8.95 Fiesta Salad, a bowl of organic mixed greens and kale tossed with dried apricots, avocado, walnuts, and sunflower and pumpkin seeds, all of it drizzled with balsamic vinaigrette (photo: bit.ly/2LnnCQ8). I asked for chicken, but they either forgot or ran out. It didn't really matter because it provided a tasty freshness in an unfamiliar part of town. OK, I've been to Marco Polo Italian Ice Cream and Kingdom of Dumpling and Taraval Okazu Ya and... OK, I lied.FOOD - 4 stars...there's a fiesta in my saladAMBIANCE - 3 stars...tiny spot and I'm not sure why there's a mural of Siena on the wall (photo: bit.ly/2VNCCL5)SERVICE - 3 stars...quick, quickTOTAL - 4 stars...nice to get a salad out thereRELATED - Sauntering in the Sunset? Here's a collection of places I've visited and reviewed: bit.ly/2EI8eIJ

I love this place. My wife and I always come here to eat for our lunch break almost everyday.  we love their el Frances and turkey club with matcha green tea smoothies.  i don't mind muni/metro noise passing by... the worker know what they're doing with their foods and giving us spilt foods without asking us because we usually spilt the food. I highly recommended!!!

Stopped in for a quick breakfast and this place exceeded my expectations. All my friends LOVED their food. Ambiance is very relaxed and all the staff is very friendly. I am visiting from Santa Barbara but when I come back this place is going to be a must. Love that they vegan options.
I tried the turkey club panini and a hot white mocha, both were delicious. They were polite and the food did not take long to come out.

My favorite place in my neighborhood. I go to this place every week, and I order breakfast panini and coffee. I tried some bagels as well, those were good but breakfast panini is awesome. People are so cool and cozy. I love this place.

I always feel so welcome in this cafe! Everyone on staff always greets me the moment I walk up to the counter. The drinks are awesome, I usually go for an almond cortado and the male barista (why haven't I asked for his name yet?!) makes it to perfection every time; perfect amount, perfect temperature, perfect foam with a heart in it, and with a smile. This is definitely my go to coffee shop in the Parkside!

This place is the best cafe overall in the Inner Parkside. The staff are extremely friendly but laid back and nonobtrusive. I love that they are just regular people who are hardworking and considerate. They are honest about everything and answer everyone's questions about anything. They are always interested in what customers think. They provide free wifi and they will let people relax on their phones or sit and study. The food and drinks are very tasty and the prices are moderate/reasonable. I personally find their paninis, wraps and sandwiches much better (and they are lower priced) than the place next door. The pastries are all excellent. Coffee drinks are perfect (without the bitterness of some other coffee shops nearby). People should really check this place out! They deserve the 5 star reviews.

We discovered this cafe a couple of months ago and have been here 3x now.  The food and coffee are good.  Love this place for a quick brunch.  The service is also very friendly.  I enjoy the low key atmosphere.

A friend of mine recommended this new cafe in the neighborhood and I haven't been able to resist working from this cafe on my work from home days.  The service is really good here!  I'm not a super fan of their chai but I'm a very picky chai drinker.  I do however really like their breakfast.  Any of the food items you order are great picks.  My faves are the breakfast croissant, egg/cheddar and bacon on bagel and their almond croissant.  I also can't get mad at their music they play!

This place definitely deserves more recognition! Came here on the early morning of Thanksgiving and was pleasantly surprised that it was open as I was looking for some quick breakfast. Ordered a breakfast sandwich and a strawberry and banana smoothie. The food was fairly priced and had a quality taste. As for the ambiance it is clean and quaint. The staff were really friendly as well. I'll definitely be making this place one of my new go-to's in the area!

The first thing I noticed about El Cafe when I came in is how light and bright it is! The atmosphere is cozy and the windows are huge. I asked one of the owners to recommend an iced drink on an unseasonably warm day in the city. He set me up with a mocha frappe that had just the right amount of sweetness. My guy got a tropical smoothie with almond milk and a vegan panini. Bonus points for accommodating pretty strict dietary need.  I plan to make this my study spot, especially since this cafe has a good amount of plugs and plenty of food and drink options. Highly recommend!
Homey spot with panini and pastries to go with Nomadic Coffee. We had a nice breakfast wrap pressed on the panini grill. Be sure to ask for your beverage in a ceramic mug! They are quite pretty.

I live in the neighborhood and find this to be an exceptional place for bagels and paninis filled with excellent choices both meat and veggie. My two favorites are the Lotta Lox Bagel on a toasted bagel of your choice with cream cheese, capers, onion, tomato and a LOT of lox. It tastes delicious and is a regular of mine. Another is the Breakfast Panini with scrambled eggs, roasted red pepper, fresh spinach, and mayo and you can add avocado, bacon, or another protein (ask for it as an addition). Best of all:  FANTASTIC PRICES! $5.50 - $7 depending on your choices and very warm human service.

Love this addition to the neighborhood. I usually stop for coffee but just recently tried their breakfast panini - and plan to make it a regular routine.It appears to be be family owned and service is very friendly.
Amazing location by the park and muni train access.  Very friendly staff.  Beautiful corner views and a wonderful mural inside! A must see!

I love this place! Delicious food, great drinks, wonderful service and good prices. Such a relief to enter a coffee shop and actually be acknowledged (; the staff is extremely friendly and attentive. My new favorite neighborhood spot.
The curry chicken panini is very special, I loved it. Very good coffee, lovely quiet spot.
$1 pastries! I forget after what hour of day, I think 3:00pm.

4.25/5Came by on a Friday morning around 10am for a quick breakfast. Luckily there was no line and I was in and out in 5 minutes. The shop is small though they have 3 large benches outside for seating along with their extras setup (water, cream, sugar, napkins, etc.). Unfortunately no shade or outdoor heaters available. Parking in the area is mostly street and can be difficult. Easy to access by MUNI though. Service is really friendly. They have a small menu but if you're coming for baked goods you just have to look on the rack to see what they have.I got the following items:1) Everything Croissant: The only item I semi regret. It's still pretty good but it can't compare to the other two items. The top layer is very flaky but most of the flavor is there so once it flakes off the remainder is pretty flavorless. It's not an overly buttery croissant so the inside is airy but otherwise a sticky doughy texture. There's a bit of filling consisting of cream cheese and green onions but it's not enough to carry through the whole croissant (though personally I also use a ton of cream cheese on my bagel). I'm also not a huge fan of the grainy texture cream cheese takes on when it's baked. (3.5/5)2) Sauerkraut Smoked Cheddar Peppadew Tart: I wasn't sure how this would work out in pastry but I absolutely loved it (given I am a fermented food nut). In terms of texture it's similar to the croissant. Not buttery but fluffy with a flaky (though less than the croissant) top coat. I wish the filling as a bit more dispersed but overall I loved it. It's almost like an elevated version of nacho cheese and kimchi. The sauerkraut peppadew combo is very kimchi-like though a touch sweeter. This with the smoked cheddar made for a perfect balance. The bread itself is quite sweet compared to the salty spicy filling so the extra doughy-ness works a bit more favorably here (4.25/5)3) Twice Baked Pistachio and Blackberry Croissant: Like a cross of Seattle's Bakery Nouveau twice baked chocolate almond croissant and Arsicault's almond chocolate croissant but with fruit. The texture if just like Bakery Nouveau's a sort of heftier crust with crunchy ridges. The filling has that more grainy sweet paste texture like Arsicault's but it offsets the sweetness with the nutty toasty pistachios and the tart blackberries. In principle I am still a chocolate over fruit girl but damn this was good (4.75/5)Overall I really enjoyed my visit here. While I've had better croissants elsewhere I loved the unique flavor combinations they offered here. I definitely want to come back to try some of their hot food options or their kimchi toast (they serve this at room temp but you can get it heated up).---The Re-return: Twice Baked Pistachio and Blackberry Croissant if you are a fruit person; otherwise go for Arsicault's chocolate croissants---

What can I say except queue up early! Check hours but we arrived 10 minutes before opening and there was already a line! Not a bad review on any of the bakeries we tried. To offset the sugary- ness we got the savory porridge. AKA "jook" Ours did not look like the display at the counter. Instead it was a condensed version in a paper soup cup. Otherwise, solid bakeries all around, go early!!!

I had the shio koji porridge. It was incredibly warm and nourishing to the soul. The right amount of spicy umami and savory. I would eat this every day if I could. I wish this place had wifi, I would never leave but I guess that's why they don't. I love this place!

MUSHROOM TART is da bomb. The kimchee toast was good - not amazing. Passion fruit doughp - good if you want something sweet. Coffee has a nice design but was just ok. The line is long and intimidating, but it does move pretty fast!
Dude the bake goods are legit. I see why people line up and get up early. Walking there or getting dropped off by lyft is ideal there really isn't many spots to park.

Was kinda skeptic going to a ppace with almost 5 stars but damn its earned.staff was incredibly polite and helpful with recommendations, theres a restroom if you need it(its sf, thats a luxury), and a nice ambiance.

Oh my goodness- the ginger gooey bread is delicious, and so are the pistachio blackberry... and the savory breads... and basically every other delightful item that comes out of their ovens.  I am thrilled to have such an amazing bakery in Dogpatch.   Get there early, as the lines can be long, but are worth the wait!

The best croissant we have had in California!  Only one second best was at the farmers market in LA.  Staff was extremely friendly and nice.  The other pastries we had were good too and the food looked good.  We will have to try some other things next time.  As others have said, no seating inside and parking is barely there.  Great little spot for sure!

Easily the best sourdough load in the city is their olive loaf. But with exceptional pastries, such a nice staff - there's even more to love even if they do run out of bread. Pro tip: bread often runs out early (before noon) and lines can be 15+ mins. Plan accordingly
As far as pastries go, you'll find nothing on the planet that tastes as exquisite as the cinnamon walnut bostock. Everything else pales in comparison.

This bakery is part of our Saturday morning routine. It's delicious, rain or shine they always have a line, honestly it's worth the wait. Everything is freshly baked, most of the time it's still warm when we get it. The staff is so friendly, and efficient.It's a very small place, limited out outdoor siting.

Good but not as outstanding as I expected. The very hyped pistachio blackberry twice-baked croissant is good but not worth a special trip, and I would only come back if in the area.There's no seating inside the bakery but there are many tables outside. However, in the morning (which is the best time for visiting bakeries) the seating area is covered in shade, so it might not be the most pleasant environment for enjoying pastries.From most to least liked, I tried:Recommended:-Pistachio blackberry twice-baked ($4.85)- tastes good because the filling is good - it's moist, sweet, and slightly tart, and the flavors of the pistachio and blackberry go well together. I did think it was a little too sweet, especially with the powdered sugar on top, The croissant itself is slightly dry by itself but is good together with the filling. It is a bit overhyped though - I've had better twice-baked croissants elsewhere (e.g. Baker Doe's).Better than OK:-Butter croissant ($3.50) - very crispy and light. While it does taste of butter, the flavor isn't /super/ buttery and it's a bit on the sweet side. It's good but not as good as I expected, and I think Arsicault Bakery and some bakeries in New York make better versions.-Ginger pull-apart ($4.25) - reminds me of a denser, slightly bread-like kouign amann. The base is coated in sugar, and the bottom half is more syrupy, sticky, and gingery. The ginger flavor overall was not strong.Not recommended:-Mushroom tart ($4.50) - flavorful filling, very cheesy and with a decent amount of mushrooms and onions. The pastry portion was crunchy and kind of flaky. But it was served completely cold (on a warm plate), so the cream-based filling was completely hard and not at all pleasant to eat.

So good! Every bite is delectable of whatever you get. Team is friendly and efficient, watching them work on the pastries and bread in their open space is a treat as well, I can feel the love they put into their food. Quality ingredients and great flavor combos! Only downside is parking.

I needed amazing pastries for a very picky crowd...lots of wheat free eaters (it seems to be a trend) so I pre-orders two dozen of the buckwheat financier as a SF local who is wheat free told me these would be a hit. I also ordered the jammy oat bars AND the pistachio blackberry croissants. I OVER ordered based on the amount of people at the breakfast meeting hoping there would be leftovers. Nope. These are the as good as they look and I worth the drive past five other bakeries to get here. I would eat the oat bar every day if I lived close!

First yelp review :) After my coworker brought some pastries to work, I decided to visit in person. Ordered 6 pastries/items - would recommend the twice baked croissants and the mushroom tart. Overall, I would give the pastries a solid 4/5, but the poor service reduces my overall rating to a 3. I understand that there is a long line of customers, but I felt super rushed and disrespected. I felt a bit discriminated (?), because they were super nice to certain people. Anyways, would give it a try if you love pastries.

OMG!!!!! Super duper excellent pastries! We heard about the James Beard finalists and found Neighbor Bakehouse was on the list. Finally was near enough to try their deliciousness first hand. Ginger pull apart, pistachio blackberry croissant, German coffee cake and sauerkraut cheddar cheese croissant. We were just going to take a bite of each but surprisingly enough, we devoured all of the goodies. Service is excellent!!! Caring staff because, I have a nut allergy. Definitely sharing our find with friends and hotel concierges.

Came here following the James Beard nomination and have to say it lives up to its hype!I ordered 7 items and only one (the coffee cake) ended up a little disappointing.  Here's the rundown:1. pistachio blackberry twice-baked: 5/5.  This is my favorite.  The amount of filings was just enough so that they pair nicely with the crust but is not overflowing.  And both the crust and the filings were absolutely delicious.  My only regret was not ordering the raspberry violet twice-baked.2. ginger pull-apart: 4.5/5.  This simple-looking pastry tastes nothing but simple.  The crunchy outside crust was perfect with the soft inside bread.  The hint of the ginger flavor was refreshing yet not overpowering.  Definitely one of my favorites.3. cinnamon almond bostock: 4/5.  I didn't know what a bostock was but after having it here I am a fan!  I tasted the almond but not the cinnamon here but the texture of the bostock was so good!4. passion fruit coconut macaroon: 3.5/5.  I can't taste the passion fruit in it but it was still a supremely delicious (and big!) macaroon.5. guava & cream cheese pastelito: 3.5/5.  Pretty tasty!  I sort of wish there were more cream cheese inside but the crust was pretty flavorful on its own.6. chocolate pudding doughp bun: 2.5/5.  This was the last pasty I tasted so maybe my taste buds have been accustomed to the amazing flavors produced by Neighbor by then - but the filing was all on one side so I had to use my finger to spread it (I have cut each pasty in half to share with my family.)7. coffee cake: 1/5.  The filing inside was pretty tasty, and the cream cheese topping was a nice addition.  But I ended up throwing away the outside crust because there simply isn't enough flavor there.

Best bakery/viennoiserie in San Francisco. (Yes, even better than TARTINE... in my very humble opinion) Top picks: Butter croissant, ginger pull apart, twice baked pistachio blackberry croissant. But really everything is delicious. Can't go wrong.

Delicious pastries! We got one of the savory breakfast pastries and the gingerbread pull appart, both were perfectly baked, crispy and well seasoned. They carry oat milk to pour in the coffee, which is also good, and a vanilla simple syrup. The wait wasn't too bad on a rainy Friday morning. Can't wait to be back!

I would recommend the pistachio blackberry croissant. I like the pistachio filling but I feel like it's not sour enough. I like sweet and sour together. I'd say skip the curry potato turnover. I wish we can try the everything croissant but they were out when we were there. Long line outside but not too bad

OMG amazing! This is hands down my favorite tea shop in SF! The staff is so so friendly and welcoming and they LOVE what they do! Not to mention the high quality, delicious drinks!You've probably seen the white rabbit candy trend...well here you can get WHITE RABBIT MILK TEA! They sweeten the drink with melted white rabbit candy instead of sugar! I'd never tasted the candy before, so I tried it before tasting the drink, and the drink tasted pretty close to it! They have honey boba and it is DELISH, hot, and fresh!Also, get the GREEN QUEEN HEMP! It contains matcha, mint, honey, lemon, cream top, and hemp drops (cbd oil). My friend and I drank this SO FAST! It was so yummy and had the perfect amount of sweetness. Usually I don't drink my entire boba/tea drink because it's too much sugar, but this one was actually really refreshing! The stencil on top is a marijuana leaf.Thank you for having milk substitutes! There's not much seating here, so it's not very conducive to hanging out.I can't wait to see what other creative drinks they make! I'll be back!
Such a fun tea shop to duck into to escape the hustle and bustle of Chinatown. They make delicious and creative teas (including hemp shots) and always have great music. Highly suggested!

Drinks are nicely sweetened (not too sweet with the regular amount of sugar) and the staff is friendly! Their boba is not honeyed but is cooked perfectly. This is a nice spot to stop over if you're walking through Chinatown.

I got the Green Queen which is basically a matcha lemonade and it was surprisingly refreshing.I got mine without honey since I don't really have a sweet tooth, but it wasn't overpowering sour!It's a small hole in the wall and looked pretty empty but it's a nice little gem in Chinatown!Also if you need a quick place to grab a drink, some free WiFi, and a bathroom it's not a bad place to stop by!

This place is a hidden gem in sf, not much people talk about it surprisingly?? I don't understand why, its easily the best boba shop I've ever been to. The drinks are so light and refreshing and the quality of the boba is good too. I got the moroccan mint tea a handful of times and it never disappoints, its so good that I don't wanna try anything else on the menu even though I'm dying to try everything!! The flavor combos are honestly also amazing, its so unique yet all the flavors make sense, whoever created this shop you're kinda a genius in my book, and yes I take boba pretty seriously to say that lol
I spend a lot of time in Chinatown and this place is my favorite for boba. I especially love that there is a "super sweet" option!

I'm no boba connoisseur, I'm just in the shape of one. Nevertheless, I was in the area with someone who suggested we hit this place up because of its yelp reviews. My eyes immediately gravitated to the dirty chai because, in the same intonation as Joey from Friends, I like chai and I like espresso. It was a no brainer.  The boba had the right consistency and sweetness. If I am in the area, this would be my go to for boba.

Loved this place. Excellent staff that were extremely informative and helpful. I love how they start all Tea out with a default of 50% sweetness. I've been to some bubble tea places that were so insanely sweet that I could barely enjoy my beverage. They also seem to use quality products in their drinks. I ordered a mint tea and it actually had fresh meant inside of it. It really blew me away. And it tasted fabulous. Will be back the next time I'm in the area. My new go too spot in SF for now.

After filling myself up with a sick amount of coffee from my breakfast at the st Regis, we ventured around the city, where my hankering for good boba led us here, thanks to yelp. I like chai and espresso so it was no surprise that my eyes naturally gravitated to this catchy little number that did not disappoint. My sweet tooth, superbly satiated, had me bouncing off the walls enough to finish our trek around the city, as I gleefully ambled with good company to finish our stay in the city over the weekend. Would def come back. Great boba with the chewy consistency and flavor that has me wanting more.

We were dropped off in Chinatown with a big group. A few of the boys and I had know idea what we where going to do for 90 minutes. So I looked on yelp for a good place to get a glass of tea. I thought what better place to get a few boys a chance to experience tea? Well Steap was recommended so off we went. What a hit the place was clean, the help was awesome (sorry I can't remember his name) and with his recommendation I was able to make everyone happy and turned out stop into quite a pleasant experience. Our "bar tender" even turned us on to White Rabbit candy that was a big hit with everyone on the trip.

After enjoying some egg tarts from Golden Gate Bakery, we decided to walk .2 miles to Steap Tea for some refreshments. I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba and the sweetness level was exactly as I ordered. I ordered the sweetness level as regular which is 50% sweetness based on their scale. It wasn't as sweet as I wanted but I actually got what I ordered. I would like to actually get 75% sweetness next time. Fabian got the Black Tea Lemonade with lychee jelly. His was at 75% sweetness level and he likes his on the sweeter side so he would want to get 100% on his next visit as well. I was hoping for a more tea flavor. I think that was kind of absent in my drink. It had more of a milky flavor. All in all, it was a good experience and I hope to come back and change it up a bit!

All my stars for the spacious bathroom and 3 for my drink. I had to give this place a shot due to the good reviews but I judge a bubble tea place first by their basic drinks (Almond Milk Pearl) and not the trendy gimmicks. Maybe I'm spoiled by my NY options but I wasn't a fan. I'd be down to try a colorful drink if I'm ever in the area though.I didn't like the girl making the drink because she was visibly annoyed for having to shout our name twice over the loud music and then laughing to her visiting friend about it. No need for attitude when it's only 2PM.

After walking up a hill in Chinatown, my friends and I decided it was time for tea. Came on a Saturday afternoon and there was a few people lined up. It is a small area with a few tables in front and a bar area against the wall with seats. It was a dark and loud area for a sunny afternoon. It was super heated in there. I saw a fan that I'm not sure if it was broken or they chose not to turn it on??? My friends and I were looking for a sit down place to chat but it was so uncontrollably stuffy that we had to head out. It seemed like other parties decided to do the same after receiving their drinks.I ordered the Purple Rain (butterfly pea tea with lemon). Not many places serve butterfly pea tea so I was excited to order it! It tasted decent enough for me to order again. However, my friends thought it tasted too sour so I guess it's a preference. My friend ordered an almond milk tea which tasted like regular jasmine milk tea.Wouldn't go out of my way to go again, but am willing to give it another try if in the area
So good and so refreshing! I recommend Purple Rain with Lychee jelly. The Steap Bar is a great place to get work done. They have WiFi and outlets at every bar seat.

I love this place! It's one of my favorite boba places in the North Bay. The people that work there are always really kind. I hate that they are a little further away from the main strip of downtown but it's always worth the walk to have their drinks. I hope they open another location soon! I love the Almond milk boba tea with green tea, absolutely delicious

Absolutely my favorite boba shop in SF. They have a really cool menu, with a lot of seasonal and interesting items. My favorites are the pink kitty and the butterfly pea lemonade. I try to stay away from caffeine, so I appreciate that they have rooibos as an option as well. My only complaints are: I wish it were closer to BART/Muni (please put one on my corner!), and I wish they had almond jelly / pudding.

First off, shout out to the employees! A big group of young kids on a field trip came in right before us and they handled them in a timely manner and were helping out the chaperone who was trying to navigate the group around town. My friend got the coco cereal drink (they should probably change it to **cocoa, I kept thinking it was coconut) - cocoa krispies and boba in chocolate milk tea for $5 and I got the famous green queen hemp drink for $9. I actually thought the prices were super reasonable (at least compared to other boba places) and I loved the drinks!

I was pretty disappointed with this place especially given the high reviews. I ordered the matcha drink with boba and quite honestly it was probably one of the least enjoyable matcha drinks I've ever had. The drink tasted diluted and the matcha flavor was almost non-existent. The pearls were the redeeming factor as they were pretty chewy. We also ordered the thai iced tea which we did not finish because it had really weird flavor. I did appreciate that there were numerous outlets on the wall so you could charge your laptop/phone easily.Overall, I probably would not come again as there are much better boba places nearby.

There are two prominent things in sf: boba and cannabis. In a city where every other billboard (and street corner) is promoting weed delivery and where malls hand out samples of cannabis face oils, it was only a matter of time before someone mixed boba and cbd. Not gonna lie, it was only the Green Queen CBD that drew me into Steap -  so, half an hour before it closed, I dragged my boyfriend from Inner Sunset to Chinatown to try it out.The drink itself has a matcha base with lemon, mint, and sugar, topped off with a sea salt crema similar to Happy Lemon's. I recommend asking the barista to seal the drink after you take your pictures and mixing properly before drinking the rest - I only shook it once and ended up with some sips that tasted like the normal Green Queen drink and others that hit me with a full taste of that CBD. It tasted much better after mixing and surprisingly, the flavors meshed very well together. But at $9 for a medium and $10 for a large, prices can be a little...steep (lol I couldn't resist). Other drinks ranged from $4-5. We also got the Mint Julip - very refreshingBaristas were very friendly; seating area and bathroom were both clean. The majority of their ingredients seemed to be organic, so there's a reason why their prices are a bit higher. There's also a photo booth so feel free to take all the pictures you want promoting this instagrammable drink.tl;dr - if you're in the area I recommend coming here instead of Boba Guys. Unique drinks, friendly service, much less crowded and basic. I'm coming back!

Had to do a update review, simple and yet refreshing comes to mind lately.. custom drinks  and a cool place to relax on a lunch break and for a quick drink..as always you can just show them my pictures and try some of the off menu drinks

Favorite coffee shop in this city. Cozy, weird, clean, fun for people watching, right in the middle of a great neighborhood and good shopping. It's not cheap, but it's very good. Get the iced Golden Gate with soy milk -- shit changed my life. I love this place and always stop in.

Guy making my bagel sneeze into his hands, then kept working. Gross.The bagel was supposed to have hummus on it, but the hummus was so thin, basically a super-thin layer like you'd make with butter.  Can't even taste it, just the bagel.He tried to upsell me on "hummus bagel with veggies" for more money, but I figured hummus is a thing you eat for nutrition, right? Not at Coffee To The People.It's an otherwise nice place for the couches and the wifi, but ... gross, they don't know basic food handling procedures, and the food is totally substandard.

During my first trip to San Francisco two weeks ago, my husband brought me to Haight & Ashbury, where he used to hang out when he lived near the area, 16ish years ago.We stopped in at Coffee to the People as soon as we arrived at Haight street before walking and browsing.  I saw the shop, loved the name, and we hadn't had our coffee yet, so it was really a no brainer.Its a large shop, and wasn't busy.  It's dog friendly, as there were a few pups curled up on the floor while their owners drank coffee and read books.  I also go to meet a super cute dog named Mr. Bear while waiting for our order.We had: Chocolate to the People: Chocolatey and deliciousMatcha Mint Mocha:  Best. Drink.  Ever.  I think I drank more than half of this, and it was supposed to be my husband's drink. Service was quick and polite, and drinks were inexpensive.  The next time we are in town, there is no way I'm missing a stop in to Coffee to the People.
Chill place to get a hot coffee. They have a lovely library of books to choose from while you sip on your beverage. Warm and friendly staff.
Omg how I miss this place, I lived around the corner for a while and had to move home to Alabama and I'm super sad

The people working here were really nice. They offer a lot of eclectic drinks, which look a lot better than they taste. The first time I came, I ordered the Matcha Mint Mocha and it looked and tasted like sludge, but I wanted to give another drink a try to see the best the cafe had to offer, and their White Mocha was great. It was so good that I drank it down before taking a picture.The food was OK-- I had the carrot bread and it was pretty dry and a little bland, but it wasn't bad. I think, moreso than the food and drinks, the interior is my favorite part of this cafe. It has a great vibe, comfortable couches, and--coolest of all--books that you can just pick up and read. Loved that.

I love this place so much, its infinitely cozy and not a billion dollars for a cup of coffee. Lots of sofas and tables to chill at, natural light, and a CHOICE between being on the street front or back in a more private corner. Recommend!!

nice coffee shop with plenty of seats/couches to study or read or just catch up with friends! just got a regular small coffee (~$2.35) and an everything bagel with cream cheese ($3.45). The coffee was solid but the bagel is kinda expensive for the quality. The staff was really nice, and after sitting near the cashier for an hour, i could tell they definitely try their best to remember their frequent customer's orders!

While visiting my favorite area in San Fran, it was raining and we were wanting to dry off. We stopped for some coffee and pastries. We got the lemon bread (forgot the exact name) but it was delicious. The vibe here is cool. People here were chill as well as the tweaker on the couch (lol). Cool place to do work on your laptop or just come to chill. Service was whatevs but overall it was a nice coffee joint.

The reason this place gets 5 stars and no less is because I used to be a real hard lefty and the name shone to me. I used to charge my phone here a lot back when I was a young musician looking for work. Sometimes I would sneak in without paying just to take a dump or a leak. I used to get high back then. So another hot spot... I ain't that hip. Just a lone native man on the loose. Iced coffee would do it for me. Asians run the place.
BEST BREAKFAST BURRITO!!!! I ordered the breakfast burrito with ham and avocado, and the scrambled eggs are filled with flavor!! Definitely a pleasant surprise!

These people are always so nice! The breakfast sandwiches are great and the coffee and specialty drinks are yummy! I took my family here while they were visiting and they loved it. Local no-fuss stop for anyone in the hood. They never disappoint and are reliable

The best place in the neighborhood for a relaxing cup of good ass coffee (and tasty foods). These folks truly make one of the best lattes in the Haight and the rest of their offerings are just as good. Love stopping in here for breaky before heading to the office or hanging out and working from here for a few hours. The owners run the shop themselves and are awesome as hell humans!!
Got the turmeric latte! They serve decaf, and have milk alternatives.Overall a great and interesting coffee and I loved the creativity of this latte! Will get this next time!

A good, reliable coffee shop that also serves delicious breakfast sandwiches! Fresh, toasted croissants and other breads are done just right. The sizes of the coffee drinks are LARGE! I got a medium and cant imagine how big the large ones are! The owner is very nice and accommodating. A great place to visit and watch the world go by here in the Haight.

One of the things I miss most about living in the Haight - THIS COFFEE SHOP. Call my order in and BOOM - breakfast and coffee in less than 10 minutes, ready for pickup. At a good price too! Their made-to-order steamy hot bacon egg bagel sandwich and espresso has saved me from countless hangovers.I will never find another coffee shop as perfect as you!

It's a nice, spacious cafe. Saw some board games so it'd be fun to go with friends. The cappuccino wasn't that great... I couldn't taste the coffee at all. My friend had ordered a coffee and said it wasn't bad but nothing special.

I gotta ask you comrades and brothersHow do you treat your own woman back home?She got to be herselfSo she can free herselfSinging coffee to the people Coffee to the peopleCoffee to the people Coffee to the people, right onNow, now, now, now...This Haight-Ashbury makes me want to wear my love beads and smoke a doobie in honor of Jerry Garcia, and this casual coffeehouse fits right into the purple haze of this 'hood which has been overtaken by busloads of tourists. For some reason, they don't seem to make it in here, which is fine by me. I'm not into getting bad vibes from out-of-towners, man. I just like chillin' on one of the four fake-leather couches with my $2.40 Medium Coffee (photo: bit.ly/2P6rYJc) and chantin' my Buddhist meditation. Nam Myoho Renge Kyo. Peace out.A million workers workin' for nuthin'You better give 'em what they really ownWe gotta put you downWhen we come into townSinging coffee to the people Coffee to the people Coffee to the people Coffee to the people, right onCOFFEE - 4 stars...smooth and groovyAMBIANCE - 4 stars...just give me a couch and my peace medallion SERVICE - 3 stars...in their headspace, manTOTAL - 4 stars...make coffee, not warRELATED - Hanging out in the Haight? Here are the places I've tried and reviewed: bit.ly/2P8idKw
Great affordable coffee in the Haight Ashbury District.  Love this place.  Quiet and clean with friendly staff.
Iced coffee tasted burnt and old. Had to add a lot of soy milk to make it good. Nice vibe and baristas though.

This little shop was perfect. I loved how cozy it was inside and the young girl who served us was very patient.I went with the lox bagel, and my lox bagel was LOADED with salmon and cream cheese, which was perfect.Ham, egg and cheese bagel was loaded, I liked how you can choose the option of your bagel.Coffee was spot on. Would definitely be back here next time I'm up in San Fran.

Great drinks, great bagels. This place is honestly such a good place when it comes to taste and price. Whats even better is that the owner is SUPER sweet! I love her so much and she puts a smile on everyones face which makes this place a thousand times better. It's sad to hear this place is forced to shut down soon, which makes me regret not coming here as often as I used to.
great place, even better owners. i heard this place is being forced to shut down soon so i'm trying to go as often as possible. there's just no other place like this.

The best BLT I've ever had, seriously. A large Thai Iced Tea and (extremely full and delicious) BLT on a cheese bagel for $7.70. They don't skimp on portions and the women who run this spot are always extremely friendly and welcoming! Comfy couches and three tables so laptop/homework friendly. (Free WiFi)

The staff here is so incredibly friendly, it brightened my day. I was having an off morning when i stopped by here for some ice tea, and was not disappointed! If i could give this place 6 stars i would. Definitely coming backTry their mango peach ice tea! The nice lady that works there recommended it to me and it was 10/10

Every time I try to visit for coffee, the bathroom is out of order (Out of Order sign). I'm not about to have breakfast and large coffee and take the chance that my bladder can hold out until I make it to work downtown. Bathroom busted for over a year. Too bad. Too f--g cheap to fix toilet?!? Could be my daily breakfast spot.You've been warned.Avoid.
I love this place I got here all the time and when I order they already know what I want and they are extremely nice

This is a wonderful coffee/ food Bistro in the outer Richmond. The staff is so friendly, the coffee is so tasty and won't cost you the price of a lunch. Fresh pastries, and sandwiches are available. Not much seating.
Delicious friendly little deli near Lincoln park entrance. Great tasting croissant sandwiches. Refreshing peach italian sodas   Staff is friendly. Look forward to next trip.

This is a very cute neighborhood coffee shop. The are cash only which is why it only gets four stars. That said, the coffee is delicious and affordable. Med cup with an extra shot of espresso is about $3. The ladies who run the shop are wonderful. In addition to owning the coffee shop, these ladies also own the dry cleaner/wash and fold across the street. They will let you drop off your laundry and pay your bill at the coffee shop when the dry cleaner is closed. Again they can only accept cash. However the dry cleaner does take cc.
Cute little place with great prices and quality service. Don't forget to try the Thai tea!
My favorite neighborhood cafe. I come here frequently and the everything is always awesome. Great service, great tea, great coffee, great bagels :) what more can you ask for!

My girlfriend used to frequent this spot often, so she took me here with the promise that I'd be trying the BEST Thai iced tea I've ever had. As a lifetime Thai tea lover, I can safely say that she is 10000% correct! Not only was the Thai tea SUPER BOMB, but service was extremely good! Highly recommended, and will be coming back in the future!

My favorite place for Iced chai latte! HIGHLY recommend. Their bagels are also served hot and fresh. My go to bagel is the plain bagel with egg, bacon, mayo, and their special hot sauce. You can customize choice of bagel and the ingredients. They have a lot of options. Super yummy, affordable, aesthetically pleasing. Just make sure to bring cash bc it's cash only!

Stopped here for a quick bite to eat while exploring the neighborhood. Being from out of town we went off yelp ratings. This place should have a 5 star rating. The women working were fantastic! I had the turkey egg and cheese sandwich on the focaccia bread with avocado. AMAZING! My husband got the sausage melt on the bagel that was on their special board for the day. He loved it! Sandwiches are huge! Totally worth it! The caramel blended drink I got was pretty darn good too! Probably won't be back since I live nowhere near here but I wanted people to know how awesome this place is!

Wanna learn how to run a corner cafe? Check out Art Bistro. They do it right. Everyone who works there are so super friendly. I feel so welcome every morning. Their coffee is always fresh and their breakfast sandwiches and bagels are just delicious. Almost addictive. I feel blessed having them a block from where I live.

In love with this place! It's a fun, eclectic, corner bistro. We met Tai as we entered and she was just delightful! Great recommendations and phenomenal customer service! Great spot to people watch and as we waited, we  watched Tai as she greeted everyone with a smile! And she knew quite a few people that came in, on a first name basis! Her regulars clearly adore her as well! We will definitely come back by the next time we visit from Texas!!
The most delicious sausage, egg, cheese and avocado breakfast croissant sandwich in SF, IMHO.

Me and my friends had stopped by after a nearby museum. We were hungry and we came across this place seemed small decent and by the pictures looked great. So we drove there, as soon we got there I believe the owner had welcomed us so kindly and made an adjustment to us because some of didn't have cash. She went out her way to keep our service. Must say the bagels were great just like our local one back home. The lady was above greatness!! We loved it! Definitely will go back when we're in San Francisco!Thank you!
I would  recommend a turkey sandwich the staff were very friendly. I would definitely come back.

I've been coming to this location to do all sorts of studying and miscellaneous work for years. Sometimes you want a little more buzz than a quiet, stuffy library and sometimes you want a bit more of a controlled environment surrounded by other individuals deep in their work than a regular coffee shop -- cue Workshop Cafe, where it's a perfect medium of the two. I absolutely love the concept of this place, and I think the seating pricing per hour is reasonable. Checking in, selecting rooms and seats, and even texting the cafe to order and get your food and drinks brought to you is seamless. There's an abundance of outlets (even some that hang from the ceiling for the seats that are just lounge chairs!) and Wi-Fi is super quick. The employees here are also friendly, and it's overall such a well-run operation. If you're looking for a new workspace to crunch out some productivity, definitely hit up Workshop Cafe; who knows, maybe you'll be coming back here for years like me. :)

tl;dr Sudden, don't care about the customer, changes that are all about their profits, or lack thereof. Retail staff is the only good thing about the cafe. I will rarely go there in the future.Workshop Cafe had not made changes fast enough. In September 2018 they suddenly offered three free hours instead of the 10 free hours which they have had since their start in 2013. They also started making changes to their packages and pricing for the conference rooms. They also added PRO packages and blocked off certain seats. In my opinion they should have reduced the number of free hours a few years ago.In February 2019 they suddenly stopped making their own food (which I liked) and started offering food from SOMA Eats and later another cafe/restaurant. Personally, I do not like the taste food they changed to, especially the breakfast food. Also, lamb at a cafe like this, sorry, no. I've made a greater effort to not eat at Workshop Cafe. They had a survey about the food, but the only thing I think they did was to add a couple of dishes.In addition, they also suddenly stopped allowing you to work in the conference rooms unless you have a reservation; this makes sense on the weekdays, but they are almost always not reserved on the weekends. The main reason I (and my friend(s) who joined me) used the rooms was to get away from the music that's blasted. I also used the whiteboards; thankfully this location has a couple of other non-movable ones.At the end of the day I understand the higher prices, but the food and conference room changes were done without true consideration for the customer.

Usually I don't trust coffee shops with chai tea lattes .I still took a leap of faith and ordered chai tea latte just to give it another shot.I'm glad I took that decision as it was really good and close to the Indian style milk tea (chai) .The best part was the controlled sugar unlike other places where the sweet is usually blown out of proportions.This place has Great ambience and its environment is conducive to both people working on laptops as well as those ,who just want a coffee break.

I was visiting San Francisco a couple months ago for a few days and learned about this coworking space from a quick Internet search. I've been to many different coworking spaces and this one was pretty unique one.Location-wise, I liked that it's located in the center of the financial district and very close to the Blue Bottle cafe--only a couple minutes walk.Inside the space, I could see the space was pretty automated. I didn't see any receptionist who could give me a short tour. Nonetheless customer service was there and it was quick and very helpful. I just had to text them. One thing that irritated me a bit and something that could be improved is a reminder. I didn't know I was running out of time for my allotted time for using the space. I wish there had been a 15-minute reminder either by text or email, so I could decide either wrap up to leave or add more time.If you're ever visiting SF and got some work to do, I'd definitely recommend this place to try out.
Workers gave me a little extra tea and honey when I was clearly recovering  from a gnarly cough. Very sweet. Thank you from the bottom of my throat

Review on the BLT & Za'atar Egg Sandwich:The day I decided to buy a sandwich instead of a salad, I get one of the worst sandwiches I've ever had. First off, this is FiDi so the bread better be from some bougie bakery or made in-house. Instead, I got two slices of sourdough bread that looked like it came from Safeway. What made it worst was the aioli slapped on both pieces of bread making the sandwich super soggy. In combination with the tomatoes and avocado, it was just a mess.Skip the sandwich-- it was so bad I don't even want to go back to try their coffee.

Don't come here for the Avo-Egg Scramble anymore. It's $7.50 for one scrambled egg and 3 slices of avo and a sprinkle of arugula. How is this okay? Plus sometimes the workers there are rude... not all tho..

They changed their menu and removed the avocado toasts, the bagels and pretty much everything that was vegan-friendly. I asked what was vegan on the new menu and they said nothing but a banana.Forget about eating there if you're vegan, if you're working at Workspace and need some food, there is a Chipotle two blocks away. I'm so sad that they would do such change without considering vegans.

While the space was convenient and good for work the food can only be resembled to airplane food. So low quality airplane food that was not filling and overpriced for the benefit of hard to connect to wifi and an outlet. Also sticky tables and a fruit fly that won't leave me alone.

Menu has changed! No more avocado toast!!Boooo!Why?? It was the best!! No more bagels with charred green onion schmear either!! And I loved their bagel with the works!! Seriously, why??? BTW: The three stars is for the menu change. I love that I've been able to focus on studying for my re-cert exam here. I definitely wouldn't be able to do it at Pete's or Starbucks! Bring back avocado toast and I'll add more stars!!

Great place to work. Wonderful staff. Lots of places to sit and work. Large conference room that is bigger than WeWork. A few smaller private conference rooms. Unfortunately, not a lot of conference rooms and they go fast. Cafe with nice food selection right there. Bathrooms are clean. Staff friendly and wonderful. Cost reasonable. No membership needed
Great place to get some work done or just chill. Integrated technology for check in and order. Additionally it is open on Sunday so very convenient

A pretty solid coffee shop to go to when in the financial district. The place itself is rather large and there is a lot of inside and outside seating. They have some snack options aside from the coffee.I ordered the iced latte which was pretty good, as well as their chocolate chip cookie which was good.

I am absolutely infatuation with this cafe. You honestly don't find a lot of cafes with a similar concept, especially in that area of the city. If you're looking for a place to study or utilize the online web, this is the place to go. When you walk in, there are seats where you could hang out with friends or order and enjoy your food. If you would like to go into the laptop-use area, you simply put in your phone number and a message would guide through the steps! Perks: first 3 hours of your first visit are free, so you could enjoy without any repercussions (even if you don't enjoy it as much). After 3 hours, there is a rate you would have to pay in order to stay. Though I love the concept, I wouldn't say I'm the biggest fan of the dishes my partner and I got. I got the Gochujang Noodle Bowl which had ramen, roasted chicken, a variety of vegetables, and the special gochujang sauce. I personally wasn't a huge fan because the flavors didn't leave me wanting more. My partner ordered the Super BLT Sandwich which came on a challah roll and some chips. Watching him eat looked painful mainly because of the amount of grease and saltiness the sandwich and chips were composed of. Despite the food we selected, I still had an overall pleasant experience. I would probably try out their other food the next time rather than the two dishes I've now tried.

Great spot if you're looking for a cafe environment to do work. Free WiFi and you get the first 3 hours free! You can also make a reservation beforehand so if you have a preferred spot you can just reserve it online. I came and reserved a 2 person meeting room for an interview, and it worked out great!
Good coffee and amazing service! The Wifi is a bit slow ( maybe cuz the day i went was extremely crowded)
I was in SF for a meeting and needed a quiet spot to do  some work. This place was perfect and the first 3hrs were free! Definitely will be my go-to when I'm in the area.

Life saver! My internet has been on the fritz and I had a video project emergency. Looked into best WiFi cafes and this became the best candidate. First time there, so actually got my whole time (three hours) for free! But after looking at the rates they are insanely reasonable. Food is great, coffee is great, ambience is great. It is the week of Thanksgiving and with all the fires I do think I lucked out on how easy it was to get a seat, but hoping that I can do so in the future as I work from home on Thursdays and would love to come here regularly!

This place has excellent seating for doing work (solo & collaborative). My only thing with this place is the price, slightly over the top. But you must factor in the crowd they are serving to and how it is slightly bougie. Food & drinks are great here with lots of options. Most of the time, the ​staff is friendly and helpful with food/drink selection. There is online & mobile ordering available as well as at the counter pick-up. Definitely worth checking out, considering that they give you your first couple hours (12) free of charge and after that,​ you pay by the hour of sitting.

Sure, I'll buy your overpriced, bougie-a** breakfast burrito. But it *has to actually* be good. If you're gonna claim there's bacon in there, then i should be able to see at least an entire strip of bacon in there. Bacon bits or bacon crumbs *do not* count! Also, your expensive SFbreakfast burrito shouldn't be premade and reheated at the prices you're charging. Make that sh*t fresh, you feel me?! You can't charge me $8 for a snack size, made the night before, bacon bits, more tortilla than egg- burrito! That breaks ALL the burrito codes!And finally- i just gotta ask- mayo? Really? Oh wait, it's *chipotle* mayo. No. No no no no. You don't dip a breakfast burrito in mayo. It's salsa you're looking for- or add even kimchi- but not mayo! Why?!You do have good coffee, nice baristas and a chill place to grade papers- even if im the *only* one grading actual papers. But fix that burrito!
+ Decent sandwiches- Pretty noisy place if you sit in the front by the cash registers

This is an update to a previous review .For some reason . This fabulous cafe has become a public dwelling for non customers.I noted this & now I am reading reviews from righteous people that think it's ok , to take up space , saying things like , no one else has any food or beverages , and I was going to order something , 45 min after I sat down w my laptop .I won't speak to , the yelps claiming the owner is rude & offensive . I have never witnessed that & Of course that would not be cool .But I will never side w people acting indignant about having to spend money , in a restaurant .Like , of course u must .Small businesses struggle How else do they make $$$Rents are high & so are the essentials one needs to operate .I sayRight on to the staff requiring a purchase to plant oneself .It's off putting to see 1/2 the place , non customers .This is actually mind boggling ??I am scratching my head .So little self awareness .Wow .Anyway .This place is great .Many dogs are parked outside , and that can be slightly intimidating, but they are always tails wagging and friendly pups .I love the hummus plate , comes w a nice salad & warm pita bread .Beverages are hit or miss , not going to lie bout that .But the patio is sweet .And the vibe , well it's not like it used to be .But I am keeping the faith , that sensible people will support this small cafe & actually spend some money !!Not a unique concept .Ha ha Guess I am acting righteous also, but I dislike nonsense This is that!!Ok ,nuff said !

Excellent service, been going for 5 years, staff are always friendly and treat you like a friend. Food and drink had a wide selection and good quality. It is a bit expensive for what you get but reasonable considering neighborhood and city. They also have a back lounge, and a outdoor space in the back. Great for a quick bite to eat, or lunch with a friend!
Delish little cafe! Food is made fast and fresh! Great local hangout spot!

Love progressive Grounds, love the food (croque-monsieur façon Aziz). I love the vibes in this place. Either outside on the stunning remodeled patio or inside nice and cosy you will always have a good time in PG. Very good and welcoming staff. Bernal Heights ' hidden gem!

This is a little neighborhood spot with a good variety of food and some really friendly staff who will remember you and appreciate your business. Even when I'm just passing by in the neighborhood the man who is there a lot will smile and say hello. Their food is good and they have a lot of healthier options and even some stuff you can't find many places, like croque monsieurs and Mitchell's (pro tip: skip the line at the store on 30th St and come here instead!). I'd be here every day if I could. The ambiance is friendly and relaxed. The tables in the back are a little close together in case you are hoping for a more private conversation.

I've been going to this coffee shop for a long time since my children were babies!  They have the best sandwiches in the city! Really tasty. I like going with my friends for breakfast they have variety of gourmet bagels(hummus bagel, lax bagel..) and lot of pastries. The people are super friendly! Definitely recommend progressive ground!
I have been coming here for 18 years! Always friendly inviting service, a cozy warm a atmosphere, great food!

Updating my review to 4/5 because they really have tried to do better. I was busted the next time I came in and ordered because they told me, "The tomatoes are good today!" Lol. They really do care about their business...you can't survive in SF in a small neighborhood like Bernal if you don't care. Anyway, bravo listening to feedback and making it better. Now if I can just get all employees, not just the owner, to make cappuccinos out of Almond Milk, it would be a 5/5. I don't understand why one employee refuses to make them. Obviously you can froth Almond Milk. Look at Starbucks! I could do it myself if I had the machine. It really is annoying to not be able to get your favorite drink because one person doesn't either a) know how to make them/isn't trained or b) just doesn't care/like to make them. HTH!  Edit: after reading the other posts here I'm thinking the guy is Aziz who is always doing this. I can attest, the guy is RUDE AF. He always is saying rude stuff and I just try and steer clear. The dude obviously has issues. I get the feeling he is a family member they can't get rid of or why else would you have an employee like this? Ugh. If he is one of the owners and making fun of a disabled Vet with PTSD (aka a DAILY PAYING CUSTOMER), "pretending" to assault women, and racially profiling POC...nope. I will NOT be a customer again until this is addressed. Next time I'm in I will be speaking to the nice guy who is always smiling and is the face of ownership about the situation. Totally NOT acceptable or safe behavior. This guy needs to apologize to the other people who written reviews and make amends to all he has harassed in a manner that they deem acceptable. Contributing to a Women's Shelter for battered women, Veterans programs, and Black Lives Matter would be a good start. I'm disgusted. Am I going to be harassed next?! I have to downgrade my 4/5 to 1/5 until this is resolved.

There is seriously something wrong with one of the owners, Azis (sp?). I've been an every day customer there since 2013. He has always been a little rude like slamming my coffee cup in front of me, mocking my way of speaking with an accent, but lately he has pushed it way too far. A month ago when I was getting my coffee there, Azis came behind me, put an X-acto knife to my neck and said: "Give me all your money!" When I looked at him shocked he said: "Relax my friend. It's a joke." And walked away laughing. I told him, I'm not your friend, and if you do something like this again, I'll call the cops and have you arrested. It's completely wrong to joke with customers (or anyone for that matter), like that. Today I watched him make fun of a mentally ill (but mostly independent), person R., who comes to the coffee shop every day to buy his morning coffee. I happen to know R as he lives in my neighborhood. R. is suffering from PTSD and sometimes talks to himself quietly, but is completely harmless. When I asked Azis why he was calling R. crazy and other names, he responded: R. is my friend, I can call him whatever I want. Besides, This is my business, I can do whatever I want here. R. woke out upset muttering, "I'm not your friend." Azis is very unprofessional, rude, and way too forward with customers. Will not be returning and do not recommend.

It was nice to see something other than a Starbucks or Peets but this place really isn't that Progressive in fact it's downright slow.One of the things I look for in any business is good customer service and the fact that the cashier couldn't understand my order for a small strawberry ice cream and consistently got it wrong by asking me if I wanted chocolate or mocha, then when I ask for in a cup she tried to put in a cone really bothered me in the sense that she just wasn't paying attention at all.Although this place makes you bus your own tables most people don't so it would be better if there were some towels or some sprays where people like me can bus my own table instead of just using regular napkins because each table was dirty.The orange juice that I ordered that was freshly squeezed was very bitter and not worth the price.It also seems like the cashier couldn't get anyone's order right including the person behind me who ordered a sandwich and had to clarify over and over Which sandwich they wanted because once again the cashier just wasn't paying attention.I'll give this place three stars because I believe in small businesses, and I really hope it was an off-day for that cashier, but this place really deserves two stars.
The staff is so sweet and never minds my requests for extra hot sauce. Good bagels ! Gluten free option!
Nice little place in the neighborhood. Cozy place for a brunch on Christmas Eve. We were visiting but got a nice breakfast breakfast there.

Confession: I am afraid to write this place a review because I love it so much I don't want it to get overcrowded or the prices to go obnoxiously high or anything to change!!! The space is great, the drink and food selection are excellent, and there are ample outlets for the study/work rats like me. The customer service is excellent too. I don't know his name but the main guy at the counter just had the best smile and is so pleasant and happy it's contagious. I've been here a bunch and have no suggestions at the moment to add! This place certainly is a Bernal Heights community gem.

Great space for getting work done. It has plenty of plug strips and reliable WiFi--there's also a patio in the back with great lighting and a cozy atmosphere. The music is jazzy and great for staying focused. If the music is too loud for you in the front room, there's also a room in the back without speakers, but the music from the front room still carries (it's just not as loud). The rooms also have awesome cushioned benches around the perimeter which are great for reading and comfort. The coffee itself is not that great from my experience, but you can't beat the prices and they offer plenty of other options from smoothies to bagels & other food.
This place has gluten free bagels, which is super exciting as GF treats are hard to come by on Cortland. They also recently opened their outdoor patio and it's adorable.

Maybe the most comfortable coffee shop in the Bay Area, not to mention the cutest! Loving the cushiony bench filled with pillows to get my work done as opposed to only hard wooden chairs in a stuffy noisy smelly coffee shop. Quaint cafe in a quaint area. Nice outdoor seating. Fresh roses on every table - definitely a nice touch.
I love the Croque Monsieur À La Aziz lavash wrap. I have it every time I am here and will drive across town for it. Delicious

Yay for the remodel job that is finally completed!  The entire place has been redone.  The floor has no steps from the front door through to the far side of the outdoor patio.  There are outlets for computers and phones all along both walls in the back room and the lighting is much improved.No changes to the basic menu and no price increases either.  The very friendly staff deserve this wonderful new space to serve their eager customers.  It is thought to have a menu of hot breakfast items without a full kitchen but Aziz and his team do it admirably.  This is a great place to meet others for coffee and treats and get your day rolling.

I work close by and I come here very often. The staff is very fast and attentive. They even remember my "go to" coffee sometimes! Their place is under renovation at the moment so there's not many tables but the food and drinks are still delicious. This is a great coffee shop!

Strong 4. Came for breakfast on the way to work and opted for egg/avocado sandwich and the bf ordered the ultimate sandwich. Both were delicious - I love hot breakfast foods. Other orders came out first, and I was initially confused.. but hot food takes longer. Space is super cramped - can barely maneuver - not a place to hang around to enjoy for long. Ordered the earl grey latte and this was the one thing I was NOT impressed with. It was essentially earl grey tea bag + layer of foam/creme on top, and they called it a latte. Came as a surprise. Service from the owner (?) was a big rough around the edges. Would swing by again for food, overall enjoyed it.
Simple, fresh, and delicious. The egg and avocado toast was the perfect light-but-filling way to start the day. Absolutely no complaints about my cappuccino, and the service was excellent.
Great local place that doesn't charge an arm & a leg for food. Can't wait to try the drinks.

My favorite latest find in the knob hill neighborhood in San Francisco. Very charming hole in the wall with delicious food, affordable prices, and friendly service. So happy with this place that I ate here two days in a row. Lavender Latte was excellent. Don't get the turmeric Latte though, flavors were too weird mixed with coffee. The crostini's all looked very good but my daughter and I got the cream cheese with Lox on everything bagel sandwhich and the egg and lox everything bagel sandwhich with the most sublime Dijon sauce ever. So so good. Love this place

Great coffee, excellent service.It's a tiny spot, so it's not a place for lounging necessarily, but it's great for what I need in the AM: strong, fresh coffee for around $3 with fast service. They take the standard forms of payment as well as Apple Pay.I'm pretty excited to try the food. Everything behind the glass looked delicious.

Cute spot with open faced roasts(breakfast and lunch types) bagels and breakfast Sammie's! We enjoyed everything no complaints there but depending on the line you could be waiting and might not be ideal if you're in a hurry!
I'm in love! The bagel with lox, egg, spinach, tomato, and Dijon is to die for. I thought I'd miss the cream cheese but that sweet Dijon is soooo good. Perfect every time!

This place is a gem. The staff went out of their way to make us comfortable. The lavender latte was great, croissant flaky, and tuna melt delicious! I'm not from San Francisco, but would make it a regular spot if we lived here.

I got a peanut butter latte and an avocado toast. Latte was good. I like it sweet so I added some Splenda. No complaints about the latte.The avocado toast was sad. Cheap piece of wheat bread, sliced avocado, and some sauce(maybe lemon vinaigrette?). This could be elevated so easily. Get some decent bread, mash the avocado, spread it on, some salt and pepper on top and I'd be happy. But 5$ for this was sad.
