While the sandwich was very tasty and good value for money and the store was run by a fellow friendly Brit, I found myself with food poisoning symptoms around 1-2 hrs after eating here such a shame!

On a four day business trip to SF I ate breakfast here three times, and it wasn't even on my way to my meeting site. The prosciutto crostini and salmon crostini were amazing. But the egg and avocado bagel sammy was the winner. Got that twice. The rosemary aioli makes it. Also, being from the east coast, it's refreshing to have actual ripe avocados on a sandwich. Earl gray latte also delightful! Will miss this place when I head home.

Fantastic business, delicious small bites and most importantly friendly and professional management that truly cares about customer experience. Glad I walked for a mile under heavy rain to get here and try their crostinis.

Love the food at this place and the fact that it is tucked away unassumingly on Nob Hill. It closes super early though at 5pm and there's little space for seating, which makes it not an ideal place to work. People are in and out with their drinks and it seems like a good place for coffee. My caprese sandwich was quite amazing but the wine left a lot to be desired. Definitely a good place for coffee and a snack. Their ingredients seem very fresh.

Went again.... had an amazing Roast beef sandwich and my husband tried the chicken pesto ... excellent again! Will seriously recommend this place to all of my friends! The gentleman assisting us was so sweet can't wait to come back again !thank u!
Hands down the best coffee shop in SF! European ambiance, great crowd, and clean tables. The food and coffee are beyond tastyThank you Crostini & Java!
Great Saturday morning stop in San Francisco. Excellent coffee and absolutely delicious croissant sandwich. Quality service and nice vibe. More of this sort of thing please. Well worth the visit.
The egg English muffin breakfast sandwich is amazing!! Staff is so kind + welcoming. Quaint and Small little shop
English breakfast was amazing!! House coffee was pretty legit! Five Stars for you!!!!!

This is an amazing shop. I love that they have sandwiches, crostini, and gluten-free bread. I'm a coffee and tea drinker in the day, but the availability of sangria and wine would make this a nice stop. Seating is tight. There are two or three tabletops and counter seating. The sandwich meat seems to be cut as you order. Things will be a little slow. There always seems to be one person ahead of me in line, and the sandwich takes five minutes. If you want black coffee, tell the server to fill the cup because he/she leaves a half-inch of room for cream.

Try the Lox on an everything bagel and the ultimate sandwich they are delicious.  This place is a hidden gem and anyone in San Francisco must try.  The staff is extremely friendly and two Chefs on staff serving you.

I thought I'd buy some coffee beans here since I ran out and there was a huge line at St. Frank. They sold me the stalest coffee beans I have ever purchased, which do not even smell like coffee. The kitchen area looked fairly unsanitary too, and the place had too many tables inside, there was barely room to stand and order at the counter.
Decent coffee, great honey cake with just the right level of sweetness. Terrific service!

My boyfriend and I regularly work from Royal Ground Coffee-- it is truly a local, community coffee shop and always feels warm and welcoming. Their bagels, snacks and sandwiches are always great-- as, of course, are their coffee drinks. Perfect place for working remotely, or just reading on a rainy day. Great prices and friendly service.
I really enjoyed their breakfast bagel with bacon. I had it with a latte, which was also great. The service was good and quick.

Their Viet iced coffee was pretty good. Person who took our order seemed a bit clueless as we had to repeat part of our order like three times. Place was super small and a bit cramped and super hot so we didn't stay to do work like we planned to. We also got a donut which was tasty.

Royal Grounds is awesome. Great tea selection and atmosphere. What would make this place better is if they had a parklet and a bike share station nearby so we could get to them more easily. I'd visit more often if there were a bike share station here.
What could be better than Coffee and Pastry at the Royal Ground Coffee? I live nearby and visit this place even sometimes I like to sit and work on my laptop at this place.

Honey cake!!! I am addicted to it now. I blame my addiction on two sources: my wife who introduced me to this delicacy and the chef who makes it. It's probably at the level of having an ice cream at Humphrey Slocombe's or a pastry at Holmes bakery. The foodies of San Francisco would know the magnitude of those comparisons. I am happy as well as sad when I admit this. I think my best option now is to just spread the word and hope that people can understand that it's not completely my fault that I might become a spherical existence at some point.
Awesome place in heart of SF! Very cozy like a home and very affordable place! Really love this place, sometimes really busy but I was lucky and have a seat!

I was 2 days ago in the coffee shop with my doughter. It's kids friendly cafe and atmosphere is pretty nice. We ordered Quiche and Almond latte and got free doughnut)Barista Denis brought up all our stuff to us. So we're going to visit this place regularly.
I really like this place!The coffee is amazing!They also serve delicious sandwiches and cakes.I HIGHLY recommended this cozy place to anyone who wants to enjoy the peaceful ambience!!

I was looking for a business meeting place at a coffee shop and did not want to do it at any starbucks or other chain shops. I am so glad I found the Royal Ground Coffee in San Francisco! This is such a nice place with a warm atmosphere! The place was quite busy, but the owner found a place for us and was very polite and attentive. The coffee is absolutely amazing! They also serve the most amazing Napoleon cake in the world! I will definitely come back and highly recommend this place to anyone that wants to try how real coffee tastes and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere!
Great ambiance and vibe for working. Feels locally owned and unique. Really good prices relative to other San Francisco spots. Has sandwiches as well. Lots of outlets.
Five star coffee!  With best of the best Napoleon I ever try.
I went there by my friend recommendation. Coffee was great as a sandwiches. Love this place.
Awesome place! Very cozy and cute . I totaly recommend this place and you should to try their cake such us Napoleon and Medovik ( Honey cake).
I tried Honey cake and Napoleon here - it's mind-blowing. Great place for breakfast or just a cup of coffee.

This place is amazing!! Cozy and sweet. Their HONEY CAKE is the way to go - it is just melting in your mouth, just the right sweetness!!  Barista is charming and super friendly,always make me feel like home))) I gave them preferance rather than other coffee shops in the neighborhood for sure.

This is a very cool place!Very comfortable to work there: they have wifi and friendly people who work there.The Hazelnut coffee is the best of all I've ever tried!Place is small and cozy. Royal Ground always have something new to try!I recommend this place to everyone!
The owners are very nice guys. I order espresso and breakfast bagels every single morning and love them a lot. It is very nice place for relaxing because it is really quiet place.

Absolutely my number one choice for flowers in San Francisco. Val is AMAZING. not just her arraignments, but her dedication to detail, making sure you get exactly what that special person wants in a bouquet. BTW she also makes a mean espresso, so this isn't your average flower shop. Highly recommended.

Val has created a unique space that dissolves the boundaries between a personal home and a business creating a very pleasing 'illusion' that is unique in and of itself. As such, the vibe here is inimitable and very special reminding me of a San Francisco all but vanished. I remember most memorably when Val went the extra mile to help a Chinese woman and her daughter from Jiangsu province (Shanghai area) who spoke English haltingly, or not at all. I brought Margaret Zhou and her daughter (An actual Theoretical physicist in the body of a very young teenager!) over to help her redress a nasty tenant/landlord issue where she was being grotesquely ripped off and rent gouged- living in a totally illegal- utterly delipidated unit unfit for dogs.Val proceeded to reassuringly make them both feel at ease with an exemplary generosity of spirit that was, frankly, beautiful to witness. I was so overwhelmed I just let Val 'troubleshoot' the situation as the ideas just cascaded off her like shots of warm energy. Sadly the matter was never resolved, as the women just moved to New York where the daughter continued her post-graduate work. We both never saw them again.Yo! And the coffee is great too and people I run into on the street rave about the Chai tea. Buy a pound of Harrar or Yergicheffe both blends curated by Val herself.

This is a chill little coffee spot.Came here with my mother while I still drunk from the night before, and got a Chai Tea, and it was amazing.  They ordered some stuff of their own, but I couldn't even begin to tell you what the heck it was as I was still quite inebriated from the night before.Did I say that already?  Guess the effects have yet to wear off!  Anyway, the staff is super friendly, and the place looks like it could be a home.  Who knows, maybe it is a home.  And if you play your cards right, it COULD be your home!  I mean, if you're really good at hide'n'seek, then you could potentially live in here forever, but that's neither here nor there.  Anyway, come check this place out, cuz it's awesome.And so are you :D

I've gone to Val on 3 occasions for floral arrangements - she went above and beyond each time to make sure I had something special to give to my significant other.The location has a really chill, positive vibe. Great place to grab a cup of coffee and hang for a minute before an afternoon walk in the Presidio.

Love their little gifts, shaved ice for the kids, and quick on-the-go snacks for the car. Service is friendly and fast.  We keep coming back for their shaved ice all the time. Definitely a go to place if you are in the neighborhood.

I was driving and suddenly I notice this cute coffee shop with the most adorable items to give it that taste of originality!! I highly recommend you visit ,  I believe you can do all your Xmas shopping there and have some delicious coffee!!!  What's great place!!!!!!!
Very interesting tea & coffee /gift shop. Service is very friendly and customers seem to be regulars.

I used to work at this cafe and couldn't stand working here longer than 3 weeks. The owner is rude and forgetful and disrespectful to her employees. The kitchen area and the stairs down to it are OUTRAGEOUSLY unsafe and dangerous. She also told me I was "bad at food service" when she didn't properly train me and today she came in to the restaurant I have worked at for 2.5 years now, as a valuable and excellent employee. Also way too overpriced!!!! No coffee is worth that! Boring and way too bougie!
Had a cherry and lime shaved ice, it's in a medium size cup.  The ice is shaved thin the old traditional hawaiian way.  Another great dessert place in the richmond.

I'm not one to use this particular adjective lightly, but yes, this is a "cute" place. The shop's name is described as "botanical in nature and Japanese in origin". Cute, huh. I actually thought Japonica was shorthand for a Japanese harmonica, but then I asked myself, "What's a Japanese harmonica? Maybe a group of geisha girls playing Stevie Wonder's "Fingertips Part 1"? Japonica is actually a real camellia plant which they likely sell here as well as all sorts of home & garden tchotchkes, jewelry, greeting cards, bath products like soaps and scented candles, and toys like that familiar cat with the perpetually waving arm (photo: bit.ly/2nOJkQw).Owner Valerie Nara also does floral designs, her specialty, and she serves up coffee, tea, and pastries (photo: bit.ly/2nOzP3y). I was strolling on California Street one Saturday afternoon and inadvertently exploring the random shops that pop up suddenly in the Outer Richmond. This was one of them. Maybe my inner Japanese was drawn in by the Asian-accented merchandise, but my outer Japanese wanted a warm tea on a brisk day, So I got a $2.75 tumbler of the Mighty Leaf Ginger Twist Tea (photo: bit.ly/2nXN0Ms) and sat on the big central picnic table to nurse it. The tea was quite nurturing in a shop that makes you want to get into a fetal position.TEA - 4 stars...a big glass of hot tea hit the spotAMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...when you can't think of what to buy at your next white elephant, come hereSERVICE - 4 stars...kind and quietTOTAL - 4 stars...all they need are geishas wearing Ray Bans, clapping their hands, and singing, "Clap your hands just a little bit louder...Clap your hands just a little bit louder..."
Japonica is a staple in our lives. Comfortable neighborhood coffee and tea spot. They offer a variety of pastries, great coffee and cute gifts.

This place is great. Service is friendly, lattes are tasty and made with care, pastries (from cafe Madeline) are delicious and pretty, &  gift selection is so nice (yes, can be pricey,  but special and great brands/quality/unique... Especially for babies).

Just had my fill again at Japonica. This place has a nice relaxing atmosphere, friendly owner, espresso and lattes that are for real, homemade breakfast burritos and Shave Ice. Like in Hawaii! And real authentic syrup from the islands too.

I came here not long ago looking for a gift for my friend (I know they have weird little trinkets and stuff) who lives in the hood. As I walked in there were two girls working and neither of them greeted me. I just browsed around and they continue to talk amongst themselves. I felt if I asked them a question I'd be intruding. Just odd to feel like that in a store as a consumer. Cute stuff though and they have free 20 min parking right outside their door.

What a delightful cafe in the Richmond District. Japonica is a hybrid: cafe meets gift shop, which seems like a local hot spot. I managed to grab some coffee before walking over to the bus stop. Service was friendly and relatively quick. They have a $5 minimum on credit, so bring some cash if you don't want to indulge in the extra calories or bucks. Their menu is pretty simple, all your coffee classics and a few foods to munch on. The back room seemed quite cluttered. I imagine they could utilize it for more cafe space (as working space was limited)?

Japonica is such a cute, cozy neighborhood coffee shop. We take a short stroll here often on weekend mornings to grab some coffee, tea, or pastries.I usually get their "Richmond Fog" latte - their version of a London Fog tea latte (Earl Gray with steamed milk). I usually get it with soy milk; I am unsure if the milk or the latte is lightly sweetened with vanilla, but this latte seriously gives me life. My bf usually gets a mocha and no complaints from him (he is picky about his mochas, this one is up to snuff!). We've also grabbed pastries from Japonica for a quick breakfast. The ham and cheddar croissant is savory and delicious warmed up. I will definitely keep coming back! The only reason I had to take down a star is because sometimes when it says they're open on Yelp, they are not actually open.

Comparing this coffee shop to other amazing local coffee joints definitely puts this shop at a disadvantage.The espresso in my mocha was burnt. There were no stoppers for my drink that I brought home in my car. There was also no whip team on my mocha, what coffee place doesn't put whip on a mocha? The drinks are less than average but the workers are somewhat friendly and the building is charming inside. I only went because of the convenience of location to where I live. Not going back there.

The place is very well decorated and has a home like feel/vibe to it. I ordered the richmond fog and it was delicious. Something different than your usual latte. You can pick whole pick, soy milk or almond milk. The floral / gift shop next door is really cute and has some cool gifts. Would definitely come back.

Very comfy neighborhood coffee shop/florist.  Owner Val is super nice.  While ordering she noticed that I had that Hawaii "accent." Turns out she is from Kaneohe.  Had fun reminiscing with her about old days in Hawaii.  Looking forward to stopping by on our next visit to the relatives nearby. BTW coffee was delicious!

This shop is the best kept secret in town. Want to order the most beautiful and unique floral arrangement for a special occasion? Go to Japonica....you won't find more beautiful flowers anywhere! Got a craving for some of the best coffee drinks and pastries around? Go to Japonica! the pastries and coffee are delicious. Need a fantastic gift for someone special in your life that tells them you're thinking of them? Go to Japonica! The selection of gifts are the best around. Want to feel a touch of "aloha" in your life? Go to Japonica.....they have the best shave ice you'll find in the city.

I don't write many Yelp reviews, but my anger from walking by a extremely crowded Boogaloos and into an empty Breakfast Little has given way to a desire to help bring business to this tiny place, as I wait for a delicious Breakfast Little Burrito. Do yourself a favor and skip the long lines and get some food here. I also heard from the owner that the French toast is delicious, and look forward to trying it.

The food here was very good. Service was friendly and prompt, and the restaurant was clean. For the area, the prices are very reasonable! I found the food to be well-prepared and tasty but a little bland. I had the burrito and my friend had the tater tots, which looked delicious. I would definitely be back!
Don't sleep on one of the few places in the neighborhood offering a good breakfast sando. Their agua fresca is always on point and not too sweet.

I dont get into the city too often, but my partner and I were very pleased to find this adorable little gem on an early walk.  Very cute space with a unique and delicious menu.  I loved the 'not your moms pb&j toast' and the homemade lemonade had an awesome unique flavor!  My partner got the breakfast little tots which were super duper tasty, deliciously crispy, fresh, all around great, apparently their burrito is just the breakfast little tots in a tortilla which sounds like the best breakfast burrito ever.  Warm little spot to stop for coffee and breakfast, super cute, will for sure come again if i find myself in the area again!

Everything is freaking amazing! Simple menu but everything is gourmet and to the point. All the ingredients are fresh and quality.  Simply delicious! Excellent service!Must try: - breakfast little tots- breakfast little burrito- mr. Fancy pants - OMG! Have to be opened minded but it's to die for!- banana bread OMG- agua fresca Next time I am going to try their oatmeal. Probably tomorrow. Yes, we had all this in one sitting. Everything is available vegetarian and no dish is more than $9.Five stars all the way!

A super cute little nook in the Mission serving breakfast sandwiches, tater tots, pastries, and oatmeal. They also have French toast on the weekends. I got the Breakfast Little Sandwich and it was amazing - I liked that the ingredients were wrapped up in the egg to prevent spillage. The bread was also so perfectly soft with a light crisp. My boyfriend got the almond fresh toast which was perfectly crispy and the right amount of sweetness. We also got the honey and cinnamon Tater tots which were an interesting take. I don't know if I would order again but I enjoyed them!
Hands down THE best breakfast burrito I've ever had! Aioli, hot sauce, tater tots, bacon -- so much deliciousness! Also: everyone is super friendly there. Highly recommend!
This place is pretty awesome, lattes are amazing and the ham and cheese French toast is the best I've ever had. Customer service was 5 stars as well.
Came in this morning order a pb&g oatmeal as I opened the container is half way full I paid $5.59 for this
A trick little spot in the Mission serving up a killer breakfast burrito! Must give this place a serious look. Update: I'm completely hooked on the aioli used on this burrito.

Such a cute neighborhood spot for a casual breakfast. My favorite is the breakfast little breakfast sandwich. On weekends they also offer French toast. The staff is so friendly. It's rather small but there's a communal table inside and some seating outside.

Soooo tasty!! The oatmeal with egg and bacon blended savory and sweet really well. It's also certified gluten free and so are their tatter tots! It's also super cute and charming inside and the staff are sweet.

I love Breakfast Little! I've been going to Andrew's other cafe - Piccolo Pete's in Bayview for a couple years now and was thrilled to see that they opened a cafe in the mission :) I love the coffee, breakfast burritos, fancy toast, and the namesake "breakfast little" sandwich with bacon, sriracha, and garlic aioli!
The best breakfast burrito I've ever had! And the toast is also great. Come here before it becomes too popular

I love a good tater tot action in my breakfast burrito. Breakfast Little's is really the perfect to-go breakfast IMO: 2 eggs, cheese, mushrooms, tater tots, bacon, garlic aioli spread. My husband highly recommends getting the sriracha sauce which gives it a little kick and it also complements the creaminess of the garlic aioli. Size-wise theirs is also perfect for me. It's filling enough to satisfy hunger but not overly hefty where you feel greasy and heavy and want to take a nap until you've digested it down like many other bf burritos I've encountered. It's odd, but I'd rather a smaller burrito so there's a hard stop to its completion rather than have that unsatisfactory uncertainty of when to do so. My husband always gives me a hard time when I inquire about the option of junior or kid sized burritos rather than purchasing a full sized one and to "just stop when full". Uh, it's not that easy!They have plenty of other items on their menu I'd like to try - the toasts and frescas are all sounding like they're up my alley.
Great little spot I just found. Coffee and toast are freaking delicious. Must check out

Super friendly and welcoming staff.  They offer a nice selection of breakfast items.I had the Breakfast Little sandwich and it was delicious.  There is a nice garlic spread that makes this stand out as a breakfast sandwich.  The Spicy Mocha was very tasty too.
Great coffee and people. The señorita really is the best thing ever. Good breakfasts and snacks.
Breakfast burrito is hands down a must try! Super cute space and staff are really friendly.

I was in the city for a funeral and after went exploring to take my mind off the sadness when I came across this trendy neighborhood restaurant.   It was 11:30 Am We were hungry after the funeral and asked for a table and the waitress directed us to the bistro tables outside.   We said its too small for two men to order food and she said that was all they had.  We noticed a gentleman with a laptop at a table for four and asked the waitress if she could ask if he would mind sharing a table?  She said @ I cant do that!"  and would not even try.  She was black haired, young and chubby.  We were very disappointed and left.    On monday I called and spoke with a young man who said he was there, and thought we were asking for another table.  We did ask for another table and he said " the waitress misunderstood what we were asking as did he that same day"  he explained that everyone knows its shared tables because the cafe is small!  I said no, she knew exactly ehat we asked and said she wouldn't ask the guy to share the table!"   He said, everyone knows it is shared tables.  I said if you knew we were strangers, how could you assume we would know if we had never been there before?  I said I can not believe the owner Mr. Perez eould allow new customers to be treated like that and told him I would comment on it!   Very disappointed we could not enjoy a meal after the funeral and this did not help the treatment by both this gentleman covering for the waitress as well as the waitress refusing to ask!

There's a lot to love about this place. Very reasonable prices, tasty tuna panini, and good espresso. It was great that they had half sandwich option s for us little folk. Also, there was no line at the lunch rush, a huge value in itself at this location.

Nice little family owned business, but not here for long!I usually stop here for a cup of coffee or shot of espresso. The lady who owns the business is a wonderfully friendly and super nice. The coffee is good and the espresso has a nice aroma and aftertaste. In my last visit I found out that the lease is running out and the landlord is not extending it for them. Sadly after about 18 years of serving the neighborhood, Howard Street Coffee Roastery will have to shut its doors forever in two months. Ti is sad, but that is how it is in these days. The family owned businesses are getting pushed out as the rental space becomes more and more expensive.Stop by for a coffee and wish them well if you can.
Wouldn't have guessed it but really great Thai iced tea here. It's not too sweet and they actually brew the Thai tea (it's not a powder). Other than that, great sandwiches and great service!

This little coffee shop has decent coffee though the interior is really just above a bodega. The coffee is well made, but don't expect a bevy of baked goods or pastries. IT's a fine place to get a quick cup for a pick up in the morning.

I have been here for a cup of coffee, and I have been here for lunch.  The staff is friendly, and the coffee was great.  They take their time to make the coffee and it shows.  I had the lasagna for lunch, and it was not bad, but they warm it in a microwave, and due to the thickness of the dish, the microwave does not warm it all the way through.  The sandwich selection looks inviting, so I think I will give that a try next time

Popular place in FiDi for breakfast and lunch-LOVE the cappuccino w/almond milk, the quality of pastries, variety of lunch options, and the kind, homey atmosphere!!If you try the cappuccino, they have BROWN SUGAR and cinnamon available - GO FOR IT.

I love this place. Had the best breakfast burrito made from scratch here. The eggs were soft and beautifully scrambled, the ham tasted wonderful and the potato hash was to die for. The burrito was toasted and had a lovely crispness to its outer layer. Not the soggy soft thing you usually get. They also have a great selection of tea and coffee.
nice friendly service.  Serves coffee, pastries, and donuts.  7 dollar min if using your card.  No more boba :(I come back for the service every time!
This spot is top notch. The staff is great - warm and friendly. Beverages and food fast and tasty. A morning favorite.

Donuts were average, coffee wasn't anything special.They have a minimum for using credit/debit cards. I don't often carry cash on me, so I probably won't be returning here. They got me to spend $7 to hit the card minimum this time, but they lost me as a future customer. Quality of their stuff is not worth going out of my way for.

Location Location Location...it's what makes or breaks businesses and makes houses across the street or next door worth more/less in the 10's if not hundred's of thousands of dollar. This venue is not bad/ not great a $1 or 2 more expensive than some competitors nearby but still a solid venue with a great location (which probably dictates the $ increase as with many SF establishments).  Breakfast sandwiches are pretty good , doughnuts and panninis as well.

I don't know the short cute Asian lady's name but she was very nice and helpful when the young man taking my order didn't understand what to do. I wanted this Harry Potter drink from the secret menu, so I handed him my phone and asked him if could make this for me. That's when he called over that lady and she pretty much took my order. I also left a double tip because I felt bad but my drink is made wonderful so yeah :).

As I was walking up to the temporary transbay bus terminal about 10 minutes early for my ride, I thought "man, it would be really cool if there were a coffee shop for me to dip into". And then, as I crossed the street I saw it! The pastry cabinet had plenty of donuts, scones, and a few jars of biscotti. It appeared to be not completely filled. I believe this was because I visited after the holidays when foot traffic is slow.  Is like to comeback and check out the breakfast options another time. The staff is friendly and service was quick. If you need a coffee pick-up, look no further than the northeast corner of the temporary transbay bus terminal!

I love this small corner shop in FiDi. They were during breakfast/lunch hours. And the one thing I come in for is their bubble milk tea!! It's super good. Who knew a place that doesn't specialize in boba to make the perfect tapioca. The milk tea is delicious as well! In addition, I love their panini. It's a nice quiet place to grab lunch.  The people are really friendly there too!
I tried the turkey panini. I only got half, but it was enough. It was good, but needed to be hotter. I wish cheese was more melted. I did walk in 15 mins before closing so maybe it was rushed.

Great local coffee shop, with Starbucks all around them, they hold their own and do it with a smile. Can always count on my  morning coffee there. Haven't tried lunch there, but will now after reading the reviews!
Got a cappuccino here, tasted worse than Starbucks. Don't know about food or pastries, but coffee was awful.

Consistently good foodTried the hot panini and soup combo. The vegetable soup is actually full of vegetables. I could spot more than 5 different vegetables.The veggie paninis were freshly made loaded with greens.Love this healthy little cafe near my workplace.Their coffee is also amazing!
Coffee is okay but there are few non dairy options. Also, as a word of warning, there is a $7.00 minimum purchase for credit or debit cards.

Good coffee, delicious blackberry scone.  I stumbled across this gem while walking around the city.  Very friendly staff.  Interesting note: Needed to plug my phone to recharge it and there's very limited receptacles. But they were very accommodating!

Their location was hidden.. couldn't have imagined there's coffee shop/bar with their front door's design. Their ambience was fine, service was pretty good even though I personally think they might need to separate barista and cashier.. I ordered matcha and the lady was trying to whisk the green tea (which I was just trying to pay) when her whisk fell down and she rolled her eyes. It was none of my fault though, but just give the impression that they are somewhat unhappy with their job/day/life/idk. Their matcha was kinda thin (watery and tastes mostly like foam milk) and there're still lumps of green tea powder at the bottom. Nooope.
Had the cold brew. It was good. Nothing extra. I did like the inside. Two bars. Seating. I would probably go back but maybe drinks instead of coffee.

Five stars for the environment and ambiance of the cafe. I really love bringing other people here to meet up and I think it's such a cool idea you can order coffee and then drink it at the bar area. Also the fact that they have a bar in the back shows this place knows how to turn up in the day and night!I haven't had the coffee here but I don't think it's as good as blue bottle.. also I wish they sold more pastries and baked goods rather than just donuts.Overall a great meet-up spot for the day and night!
Great spot to grab coffee early I like the sitting area. ----- adding for text requirement--------------
What a beautiful space with really gorgeous artwork. Not too loud, spacious, really relaxed vibes. Def a good place to work out of or hang out with friends :)

Really cool, unique setting. Perfect blend of art gallery and hip coffee shop without feeling like it's trying too hard. It's just a nice place to sit and chat. I can't comment on the coffee here but the almond milk matcha latte was tasty and not sweet. They have Dynamo donuts and Craftsman & Wolves pastries, but a pretty small selection.

I like coming here for coffee! Different vibe because it's also a bar (at night, with a dj) and gallery, so it's not your typical setup (some high tops, some coffee tables, benches, etc). You'll see people catching up, working, or just checking out the art.

Great place to go and get anything ranging from an afternoon coffee with a rando, to a low-key drink, to a full-on happy hour with friends. Not sure how it manages to satisfy all of those needs but somehow it does. I usually get a quad espresso (pro tip: they charge for espresso shots in doubles so getting a triple shot is not a good idea for the value-conscious!), which always comes out great. I've never struggled to find seating either in the area around the main bar or at the back and the ambiance is cool. Have nothing negative at all to say about Red Door. The only other thing worth noting is that they give away their spare pastries (yay for free donuts) after ~3/4pm and their cookies are delicious. Go for it.

Venue is great - shared with Minna Gallery - so there's art to look at if not otherwise events going on... limited seating makes this mostly a spacious place to absorb, grab and commute. Coffee service - very quick especially if you use apps to order ahead and well prepared with gourmet grounds: Verve, Four Barrel, etc. I tried a dirty chai latte (chai with a shot of espresso). Pleasantly surprised with the chai flavor not compromised by added caffeine. Well balanced, smooth, and pre-sweetened.OCD alert - some people I know complain about that if the seam of the coffee cup is aligned a certain way, coffee can drip into shirts etc. but this cup *actually* has markings for barista to align the sip hole for coffee lids... I guess there are more people who care about this than I originally thought. Personally, I am not particular as to coffee seam/sip hole issues, but I admired the ergonomics of the coffee cup lid. Guess these are the things that make coffee worth $5 :P but at least I feel it better justified with all the extras you get at Red Door versus some other $5 spots in FiDi...!

Super cool cafe which turns into a bar at night.  Highly recommend this place to catch up with a friend or just for a meeting.  The place has a art gallery, barista area and a bar.  Its great instead of stopping at starbucks or peets although it is slightly more pricey.

A solid coffee/bar spot. Came here with my co-workers during our afternoon coffee run. The place is very spacious having a bar in the back as well as an art exhibit on the side. Very friendly staff! I got the maple latte and a donut that was maple with bacon. Weird sounding, but it was great actually. The latte wasn't too sweet or too strong which is the way I prefer it. The donut was great! It had a mix of sweet and salty. Overall, solid spot and I would gladly come back to try some more things!

Our daycare backup options fell through at the last minute so I watched my son for the day and wanted to take him into the city for the morning and afternoon.  We went to Red Door Coffee, a place that I used to frequent quite often for both coffee in the morning and afternoon and drinks in the evening.  However, this last time I went there I was rudely KICKED OUT with my 2 year old son at 845am while having coffee and while my son was mid-bite in his salted caramel donut (which is terrible and sticky, btw).  I was confronted by someone claiming to be the manager that children were not allowed in the coffee shop, because the art gallery is 21 and over.  AGAIN, this was 845am in the morning and everyone was peacefully drinking their coffee or eating whatever pastry they ordered.   I asked him "are you serious? it's 845am" and also "who is telling us to leave?" he claimed it was the Owners of the place.  Everyone started looking at us, what I hope was in shock, that an asshole was kicking out a father and toddler from having coffee and a donut in the morning.  I am hoping that this was just a lapse in this inexperienced manager's judgment and not something worst like being racist, which also crossed my mind.  I tried calling into the establishment a few times and no-one picked up, and only got voicemail, but I hope they see this review and re-think how they approach this next time.  I know for sure that I certainly won't be going here anymore as their COFFEE SHOP is clearly not kid welcoming.  PS - I was trying to snap a photo of my son eating his donut, but actually caught him looking at the guy instead as he wouldn't even let him finish his bite of the shitty donut before asking us to leave.

Very cool cafe! I also love the selection of pastries they have. The pastries & donuts are a bit pricier (normal hip-SF-bakery price), but they're totally worth it. My favorite is the pistachio blackberry croissant! It has the perfect balance of very different flavors: crispy, sweet, fruity, and nutty. Yum!~~~ UPDATE~~~ Seems like they no longer have the pistachio blackberry croissant, but they now have ham and cheese croissant that's also pretty good! The pastry is slightly glazed in between the flakey layers, so it gives you hint of sweetness along with the savory flavors. (It also looks pretty since it has sprinkles of dried flowers and veggies on top :P)

This is such a cute little cafe. I went to go study there, and they have two long tables (no outlets, or not that I had seen) and then more lounge space with small coffee tables. The artwork was also really cool. The space is clean, bathrooms very clean! There isn't much of a selection of different types of drinks to get but their drinks are tasty! Great space to study, and very friendly staff!

Cute coffee shop located in the 111 Minna art gallery. This place offers your standard coffee options (cappuccino, latte, cafe au lait etc) and some sweet pastries to compliment your beverage. I enjoyed a soy cafe au lait recently and really enjoyed it (it was recommended by the barista). A great spot to come to with a friend or for a work meeting when you want to get away from the office.
Great atmosphere. Awesome coffee. One of my favorite places in the city.

This place was great- recommended to me by some people at an office I was visiting, and it did not disappoint. Quality cappuccino, calm vibe, and the artwork was a nice perk. Lots of creatives sitting around with moleskine notebooks and big ideas. Seems like a good place to catch up with a friend or get work done.

I really like the concept of this place - coffee in a really cool art gallery. However, the coffee itself (despite being four barrel) is not all that great - I'm not sure why since I usually love four barrel. The real reason this place is a deal breaker though is the baristas in the mornings - they're rather standoffish and not friendly at all. They also got my order wrong on a couple of occasions which would've been fine if they'd had a better attitude about it.

I love the artsy vibes in this cafe, because it is also a gallery! I got a chai latte here, and a chocolate croissant, and the most surprising and delicious curry potato turnover, which I have still been trying to recreate since having breakfast here. The baristas were super chill, and we sorta had our own "intimate" area in broken off seating, covered by hanging dividers. There were cute little wooden stumps as tables as well. Very aesthetic. The bar opens up later in the day as well within the same building.
Really nice coffee shop within an art gallery.  Nice scene to have good conversation and we'll brewed coffee.
